Choices

by MesserMoon

Summary

People make mistakes, but they also make choices. It‚Äôs important to James, that difference. He does his best not to confuse the two.

Chapter 1

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

People make mistakes. Most of the time, James thinks, you should forgive them. If they‚Äôre sorry. If they mean it. He himself has made some questionable decisions in his life. Some missteps. Everyone is just trying their best.

People make mistakes.

But they also make choices. It‚Äôs important to him, that difference. He does his best not to confuse the two.

¬†

The night that Sirius shows up on James‚Äôs doorstep he‚Äôs barely able to stand. He has his wand. That‚Äôs all. He‚Äôs not even wearing shoes.

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt have time,‚Äù he tells James, words slightly slurred. Sirius smiles when he says it, but the expression doesn‚Äôt reach his eyes‚Äîcracking at the corners of his mouth. Before that night, James had never fully understood what it meant to want someone dead. But he could have killed them. All of them. Anyone who had ever touched Sirius.

‚ÄúBit predictable aren‚Äôt they?‚Äù he finds himself saying as he slips a gentle arm around his friend and starts leading him inside.

‚ÄúWhat, shoes you mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell yeah, everyone wears them don‚Äôt they? Where‚Äôs the fucking spontaneity? I look down and I know exactly what I‚Äôm gonna get.‚Äù

‚ÄúShoes.‚Äù

‚ÄúExactly!‚Äù

Sirius‚Äôs smile is a bit more genuine this time, though James can feel him trembling under his hands.

‚ÄúFucking fascists,‚Äù Sirius mutters, just as James‚Äôs mother comes down the stairs, wand lit, feet slippered.

‚ÄúJames, what‚Äîoh,‚Äù she stops there, halfway down the steps, and for a moment something painful flickers across her face. But then it‚Äôs gone. ‚ÄúSirius, love, it‚Äôs good to see you‚ÄîJames, the den please.‚Äù

James nods, slowly walking himself and Sirius towards the sofa. Sirius‚Äôs breath is laboured and every once and a while James feels him suppress a wince.

‚ÄúSorry about just turning up,‚Äù he says, his voice strained as James lowers him onto the sofa.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be daft,‚Äù he sits beside him, hand still on his arm, unwilling to let him go.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre always welcome, you know that,‚Äù Mrs. Potter comes into the room behind them, a cup of hot tea floating beside her. She levitates it gently onto the coffee table. ‚ÄúMilk, four sugars,‚Äù she says, making Sirius grin.

‚ÄúYou remembered.‚Äù

‚ÄúHard to forget a bloody toothache in a mug,‚Äù that earns James a pointed stare from his mother but Sirius only laughs, head resting on the back of the sofa like he hasn‚Äôt got the energy to hold it up.

‚ÄúWhat can I say, I like ‚Äòem sweet,‚Äù he winks at James, who grins in return. Sirius would flirt with a lamppost if he was bored enough. Or scared. Sirius wraps charm around himself like armour.

Euphemia kneels in front of him, her hand reaching out to gently cup his cheek. Sirius is pale, even in the dark James can see that, can see the circles under his eyes and the blooming purple bruise on the side of his jaw. If her frown is anything to go by, James would guess his mother sees it too.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to cast a diagnostic spell love,‚Äù she says softly, thumb grazing his cheek. ‚ÄúIs that alright?‚Äù There‚Äôs a pause, a slight tightening at the corners of Sirius‚Äôs eyes, never one to relish letting people in. Eventually, he nods.

Euphemia takes a deep breath before pulling her hand away and beginning to cast silently. James can feel her magic‚Äîwarm and sweet, like cinnamon. Sirius‚Äôs eyes flutter closed, arm going stiff under James‚Äôs hand so he gives it a squeeze. I‚Äôm here, he hopes it says. I‚Äôm here. I‚Äôm here. After a few seconds Sirius squeezes back.

Euphemia‚Äôs wand drops into her lap but she waits for Sirius‚Äôs eyes to open before she speaks, teeth nervously biting into her lower lip.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just going to mend your ribs and ankle, okay? There shouldn‚Äôt be any lingering soreness, but if there is you let me know.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù James‚Äôs stomach clenches. The rage, when it comes, is a wave so high he can‚Äôt see over the top of it. He drowns in it. ‚ÄúYour ribs? They broke your fucking ribs?‚Äù

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù his mother chastises. But he can‚Äôt. It‚Äôs too much. It‚Äôs too fucking much.

‚ÄúIf it makes you feel better, I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre actually broken,‚Äù Sirius shifts his position and barely holds back a groan. ‚ÄúMore like‚Ä¶slightly cracked. Isn‚Äôt that right Effie?‚Äù He offers her a smile and she huffs out a breath in return.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to need you to hold still,‚Äù is all she says, he nods again. This time, when the spells are cast, Sirius's control slips, small grunts of pain forcing themselves out of his mouth as his bones knit themselves back together. James wants to scream.

‚ÄúThere we go,‚Äù his mother says softly, pushing the fringe back off of Sirius‚Äôs forehead. ‚ÄúAll done now.‚Äù

Sirius nods, eyes closed again as he slowly sinks down onto the sofa. James moves so he can stretch out his legs.

‚ÄúSorry‚Ä¶bit tired‚Ä¶thanks though. Thought I was gonna have to go to Mungo‚Äôs. Worried they would‚Ä¶come‚Ä¶get me.‚Äù

Even in the dark James can see his mother holding back tears. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù she says weakly, ‚Äúno one‚Äôs going to get you Sirius.‚Äù

‚ÄúMmm,‚Äù is all he replies, already half asleep.

The two Potters stand frozen for a moment, silent in their darkened home, brimming with feelings that ache.

‚ÄúJames, will you‚Äî‚Äú

He cuts her off with a nod, going quickly to the cupboard in the hallway and getting the spare blankets and pillows.

‚ÄúGo to sleep mum,‚Äù he says softly, as he comes back into the room. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll stay with him.‚Äù He drapes the blankets over Sirius‚Äôs body, gently slipping a pillow under his head.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre sure?‚Äù she asks.

James turns back to her, offering what he hopes is a reassuring smile. ‚ÄúYeah, ‚Äòcourse.‚Äù It‚Äôs not as though he's going to be able to sleep now anyway, and there‚Äôs no way in hell he‚Äôs letting Sirius out of his sight.

She nods, eyes still on Sirius even as she pulls James close and kisses the top of his head.

‚ÄúHey mum?‚Äù he catches her before she leaves the room, still whispering. ‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù he says lamely, causing his mother‚Äôs brows to draw together. ‚ÄúThank you for‚Ä¶‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt know how to put it into words, how to say how grateful he is to his parents for loving Sirius, for seeing how desperately he needs them to. Deserves for them to. James gestures vaguely at the sleeping boy on the sofa. ‚ÄúJust thanks.‚Äù

‚ÄúI love you,‚Äù she says after a brief pause, voice thin and far too sad for James‚Äôs liking.

‚ÄúLove you too,‚Äù and then, almost in the same breath: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to let him go back there.‚Äù Because it needs to be said. Because he should have said it ages ago.

She nods slowly. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

But he shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo, I mean, not just right now. Not just this summer. I‚Äôm never letting him go back there. To them.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù a sad sort of smile finds its way into the corner of her mouth. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù And then her expression shifts, as though suddenly remembering something: ‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù the name comes out as a breath.

James blinks, thrown by the sudden change in subject. ‚ÄúWhat about him?‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt mean it to sound as cold as it does.

His mother runs a hand over her face, looking tired. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt leave him there‚ÄîI‚Äôll talk to Albus, see if I can‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo, mum,‚Äù James glances quickly down at Sirius to make sure he‚Äôs still asleep. ‚ÄúRegulus isn‚Äôt like Sirius. He‚Äôs‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know‚Äîhe‚Äôs one of them.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a child James.‚Äù

‚ÄúPfft,‚Äù he knocks her words aside. ‚ÄúNot hardly, we're practically the same age.‚Äù

She smiles a bit at that. ‚ÄúYes. Exactly.‚Äù James scowls.

‚ÄúHe doesn‚Äôt want to leave,‚Äù he presses on. ‚ÄúHe likes it there, likes all that pureblood garbage. I‚Äôm not having him in my house‚Äînot having him around Sirius.‚Äù

She arches her brow. ‚ÄúOh, it‚Äôs your house is it?‚Äù

James‚Äôs cheeks flush but he doesn‚Äôt backdown, arms crossing over his chest as he holds her gaze. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not having him near Sirius,‚Äù he repeats.

A few moments of tense silence pass before Euphemia rolls her eyes, letting out a long suffering sigh. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm writing Albus in the morning.‚Äú

‚ÄúMum‚Äî‚Äú

Her hand snaps up to stop him, a clear warning sign. Mrs. Potter is not a woman you want to cross and James‚Äôs protest is effectively shoved back down his throat.

‚ÄúI won‚Äôt leave a child in that household James, not if I can help it, so I don‚Äôt really care what you think of him. Am I clear?‚Äù

Grudgingly, James nods his head.

‚ÄúExcellent. Goodnight then.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt reply, sulkily sliding down onto the floor, pressing his back into the sofa.

People make mistakes. But this? His friend showing up broken and shivering in the middle of the night? This is not a mistake. As far as James is concerned the Blacks have made a choice, Regulus included. And it is unforgivable.

¬†

It‚Äôs brilliant, having Sirius stay all summer. Not worrying about running out of time, not seeing that look in his eyes as the days count down. Sure, there are still moments when he‚Ä¶drifts. To places that James can‚Äôt quite get to. But on the whole, it‚Äôs better.

He speaks about what happened in bits and pieces, like he can‚Äôt handle it all at once. First to James‚Äôs mum and dad and then, when they come, to Professor Dumbledore and Alastor Moody.

‚ÄúThey told me to take the mark,‚Äù Sirius explains, always in the same dead voice. Just once more, they keep saying, just a few more details. ‚ÄúI told them to fuck off. You can imagine how well that went over.‚Äù

James never pushes Sirius for more. He watches the adults around them take from Sirius without even realizing it, even his mum and dad, so focused on the bigger picture. The politics. The war. They never notice how their questions strip him bare. How little is holding Sirius together‚Äîprobably because he snarks his way through it, throwing out one-liners like it‚Äôs his own personal one man show. It‚Äôs only James who notices how his hands shake. Or the muffliato charm he throws over his bedroom at night.

But mostly‚Äîmostly the summer is good. Bright and warm‚Äîthey play quidditch nearly everyday, twirling around one another in the yard, diving for snitches that aren‚Äôt there just to see if the other will follow, tugging on broom ends and knocking bludgers about.

Dumbledore comes and goes and there is no more talk of Regulus. At least not that James hears. He‚Äôs glad. That‚Äôs the last thing Sirius needs.

‚ÄúYou will try to behave won‚Äôt you?‚Äù Euphemia asks, as they face her on platform 9 3/4, the train thrumming behind them.

‚ÄúTry?‚Äù Sirius says lightly, grinning as Mrs. Potter places a kiss on the top of his head. ‚ÄúCertainly we can try.‚Äù

‚ÄúLove a good try, I do,‚Äù James agrees, as he receives his own kiss.

His mother rolls her eyes, elbowing her husband as he attempts to choke back a laugh. ‚ÄúI pity Minerva,‚Äù Fleamont manages to wheeze.

James scrunches his nose. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know why, if anything you should pity me the amount of homework that woman gives out.‚Äú

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù his mother says pointedly.

‚ÄúYes Jamie, that was terribly rude. Everyone knows she goes by feline.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius!‚Äù

James chortles. ‚ÄúCat on her bad days.‚Äù

‚ÄúKitty on her very bad days.‚Äù

‚ÄúSIRIUS.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, what‚Äôs that‚ÄîI think we better go, don‚Äôt want to miss the train,‚Äù Sirius tugs on James who is bent over in a fit of laughter.

‚ÄúI mean it you two!‚Äù Euphemia calls after them, not sounding nearly as cross as she probably means to. ‚ÄúBehave‚Äîand be careful!‚Äù

James waves to his mother before being dragged onto the train by Sirius, both of them still half in hysterics.

‚ÄúKitty,‚Äù James is still muttering to himself as they push along the train in search of the others. It doesn‚Äôt take them long to find them. It never does, even without the map. James has always felt there was an almost electric pull between the four of them. Sometimes he swears he can feel them tugging at him, like strings wrapped around his ribs. He could find them anywhere.

‚ÄúHello boys!‚Äù Sirius grins as he throws open the compartment door with a bang, nearly causing Remus to fall off his seat.

‚ÄúYou can never just walk into a room can you?‚Äù he grumbles, righting himself. ‚ÄúAlways got to announce yourself like the bloody Queen.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh, but Moony,‚Äù Sirius drops into the seat next to him, invading his personal space. ‚ÄúI am the Queen.‚Äù

James watches Remus struggle to keep a straight face. ‚ÄúAre you now?‚Äù

Sirius nods gravely. ‚ÄúI can tell you don‚Äôt believe me, but answer me this‚Äîhave you ever seen us both in the same place at the same time?‚Äù

That‚Äôs enough to have James giggling again, Peter snorting so hard he nearly chokes.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a menace you know that?‚Äù Remus shoots at Sirius before returning to his book, unable to keep the fondness out of his voice.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all for you, my love.‚Äù

‚ÄúBloody genetic,‚Äù Remus mutters under his breath, the four of them staring up at their new arrival.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he says, eyes meeting Sirius‚Äôs and then instantly going blank, like a wall has come down, ‚Äúthought it was empty.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

Regulus is‚Ä¶well‚Ä¶there‚Äôs no other word for it‚Ä¶pretty. He looks like one of the cherubs in a renaissance painting, just with more scowling.

‚ÄúCan we help you with something?‚Äù James hears himself say before deciding to speak.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says again, his favourite word apparently.

‚ÄúBrilliant,‚Äù James claps his hands together. ‚ÄúGuess you‚Äôll be off then, won‚Äôt you?‚Äù

But he doesn‚Äôt move, just keeps standing there, a weird tension on his face, jaw clenching and unclenching. The awkward silence stretches on infinitely too long as far as James is concerned.

Eventually, Regulus pulls his eyes up again, looking determinedly at his brother. ‚ÄúYou alright?‚Äù

Sirius goes stiff, even from the other side of the compartment James can see it‚Äîthe flexing in his arms, the rising of his shoulders. When he‚Äôs around his family James hardly recognizes him, all the light that pours out of Sirius on a nearly constant basis seems to dry right up. They‚Äôre a bunch of bloody dementors, the Blacks are.

‚ÄúAlright?‚Äù Peter asks confused, eyes darting back and forth between the two brothers. ‚ÄúWhy wouldn‚Äôt he be alright?‚Äù

No one answers him. Remus, who must be nearly as confused, has closed the book in his lap, eyes brimming with concern as he watches Sirius like there‚Äôs no one else in the room.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Sirius says finally. ‚ÄúSure Reg, I‚Äôm fine.‚Äù

James can feel it again, the rage that welled inside him the night Sirius showed up, broken and bloody and hurting.

‚ÄúYou done now?‚Äù he snaps, when Regulus continues to just stand there.

‚ÄúThis is none of your business,‚Äù Regulus snipes back, and oh boy that about does it. James can practically feel the magic buzzing under his skin as his hands curl into fists.

‚ÄúThe hell it isn‚Äôt. You think you can just waltz in here like everything‚Äôs fine? Like you lot didn‚Äôt beat the shit out of him‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Peter squawks, but James is barely paying attention, his eyes burning holes into Regulus who gives it right back to him.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know enough.‚Äù

‚ÄúI never touched him.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut you didn‚Äôt stop it!‚Äù James is suddenly on his feet, voice too loud for the small compartment. Him and Regulus stand toe to toe, James has an inch or two of height on him, but not as much as he would have thought.

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt,‚Äù Regulus says after a moment, the words barely making it passed his clenched teeth. ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt.‚Äù

His cheeks flush, but the anger in his eyes comes back full force. ‚ÄúIf he would just stop antagonizing them‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúAntagonizing‚Äîoh you have got to be fucking kidding me,‚Äù James shouts outraged, reaching for his wand.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù his name comes out short and strong. A command. He looks down to see Remus staring pointedly at him, one of his hands gripping Sirius‚Äôs arm‚ÄîSirius looks like he‚Äôd rather be just about anywhere else. James wants to protect him. He wants to keep him safe. He just wishes he knew how. ‚ÄúEnough now, yeah?‚Äù Remus goes on, eventually. James wants to fight back, he does, but the sick look on Sirius‚Äôs face keeps him still.

‚ÄúFine,‚Äù he mutters, dropping his hand and glaring as he falls back into his seat beside a very confused Peter. Regulus looks infuriating smug for a bloke who just nearly got his balls hexed off. He opens his mouth to speak but Sirius cuts him off.

‚ÄúGo, Reg,‚Äù he sounds tired and it makes James‚Äôs chest ache. ‚ÄúJust go, yeah?‚Äù

His brother hesitates, eyes running Sirius over before he cautiously nods his head. He does not bother looking at James again before he slides the compartment door open and slips back into the corridor, like the snake that he is.

They're quiet for a moment, the noise of the train and some rowdy students outside the only thing filling the space around them. Eventually, James sighs, bringing himself to look across at Sirius.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of stillness before a smirk makes its way onto Sirius‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúShould be, very anti-climatic that,‚Äù he nods his head towards the door. ‚ÄúReally thought I was gonna get to see Reg punched in the face.‚Äù

James smiles back. ‚ÄúI wanted to, believe me. Moony‚Äôs disappointment was the only thing holding me back.‚Äù

Remus rolls his eyes, returning his attention to his book.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know why, you‚Äôve disappointed him plenty of times before.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to be a better man.‚Äù

Sirius snorts, leaning back, one leg bent up on the seat, the other stretched out, taking up an unreasonable amount of foot space. ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù he takes on a rather haughty air. ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt be trying to impress a certain prefect would you?‚Äù

James lets out a melodramatic sigh, hands clutching at his chest as he makes heart eyes at Remus. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just waiting for the day that he wakes up and realizes I‚Äôve been here all along.‚Äù

Remus snorts, eyes rising off his book. ‚ÄúOh I know where you‚Äôve been James Potter, and I‚Äôm not touching that with a ten foot pole.‚Äù

Sirius barks when he laughs, which is fitting really, the noise of it filling up the small space as the three of them dissolve into hysterics.

Remus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúYou lot are too easy, I swear.‚Äù

‚ÄúMoons we can‚Äôt help it, you‚Äôre fucking hilarious,‚Äù Sirius claps him on the back.

‚ÄúAnd don‚Äôt let anyone tell you any different,‚Äù James adds, wiping the tears of mirth from under his eyes.

‚ÄúHowever,‚Äù Sirius continues, ‚ÄúI was thinking of a slightly more ginger prefect,‚Äù he shoots James a look, wiggling his eyebrows in a gesture that is equal parts suggestive and ridiculous.

‚ÄúReally? No one‚Äôs coming to mind,‚Äù James says, suddenly intensely interested in his wand.

‚ÄúIs that so?‚Äù

He shrugs, even though he can feel the blush heating up his face. ‚ÄúSorry mate, no idea who you‚Äôre referring to.‚Äù

Sirius is barely holding it together but it‚Äôs Remus who speaks next. ‚ÄúIs this your new strategy then? Pretending she doesn‚Äôt exist? I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs a sign of you progressing or regressing?‚Äù

Sirius snorts. ‚ÄúRegressing, must be.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a strategy,‚Äù James adjusts his robes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just done chasing after her, that‚Äôs all.‚Äù

All three of the other marauders give him near identical looks of disbelief.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre having a laugh,‚Äù Sirius pokes.

But James shakes his head, cheeks still on fire. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not. It‚Äôs bloody exhausting getting shot down all the time. Even I don‚Äôt have an unlimited supply of pride.‚Äù

It‚Äôs possible he isn‚Äôt being entirely truthful. He did do some soul searching over the summer, coming to the conclusion that the badgering and big showy gestures in his attempt to court Lily Evans were getting a bit, well, tired. Predictable was not something James Potter ever intended to be. And it did actually hurt every once and a while, when she would turn him down with a particularly sharp, and usually fairly accurate, attack of his character. But was there a tiny part of him that hoped this new leaf he was turning over would succeed in endearing him to her? Yes. Definitely. ‚ÄòCourse he wasn‚Äôt about to tell anyone else that.

‚ÄúWow,‚Äù Sirius exhales, ‚Äúend of an era ‚Äòinnit?‚Äù

James just shrugs again, forcing a casualness he does not feel. ‚ÄúOther fish in the sea and all that.‚Äù

Remus blinks, looks down at his book, blinks again. ‚ÄúMy little boy‚Äôs all grown up,‚Äù he says with a quivering lip.

‚ÄúOh shut it!‚Äù

James reaches across and playfully punches his arm, Remus batting him away with his book, the lot of them laughing again.

‚ÄúWait, wait, not that I‚Äôm not fascinated by James‚Äôs love life‚Äîor lack there of‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHey!‚Äù James pipes up, but Peter ignores him, turning to Sirius and causing a rock to plummet into James‚Äôs stomach. ‚ÄúBut is someone going to explain to me what just happened with Regulus? He was acting like he hadn‚Äôt seen you in weeks.‚Äù

Sirius‚Äôs lazy posture grows forced. ‚ÄúProbably because he has‚Äôt. Spent the summer at the Potters‚Äô.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence.

‚ÄúYour mum okay with that?‚Äù

Sirius shrugs. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt think she cares one way or the other to be honest with you. Not anymore.‚Äù

Peter screws his face up, while Remus sits deathly still, eyes running Sirius over like he‚Äôs worried any sudden movement will spook him. It‚Äôs not an unfair assumption. Sirius always gets tetchy when he talks about his family.

‚ÄúWon‚Äôt you get in trouble?‚Äù Peter finally asks, in a tone that suggests he‚Äôs feeling as though he missed the punchline of the joke.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know how, seeing as I‚Äôm not going back,‚Äù he smiles, but it doesn‚Äôt look quite right, and James feels his chest squeeze at the sight of it.

‚ÄúNot going back?‚Äù Remus repeats slowly, gaze jumping from Sirius‚Äôs face to James‚Äôs.

James nods. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs taken up permanent residence at mine, fucking drifter.‚Äù

‚ÄúOoh, like that, makes me sound dead mysterious,‚Äù Sirius grins. ‚ÄúNow, which one of you suckers wants to lose at exploding snaps?‚Äù

And that was that.

¬†

It feels good, being back in the dormitory. It always feels good, the four of them together, like they belong. Admittedly, it feels less good to be back in class. It isn‚Äôt that James has an issue with school on a practical level‚Äîhe is, all things considered, rather brilliant. Which has the unintended effect of making school a bit of a chore. The first few years he‚Äôd gotten a kick out of being top of the class, but the shine has warn off. Now a days he lets Remus and Lily fight over the top spot, he has more important matters to attend to‚Äîpranks to pull, chaos to spread, etcetera etcetera. Sirius is the same. Or he had been. Things are a little‚Ä¶different, this year. If he's forced to admit it, which he sometimes is by a particularly concerned werewolf, he would say that Sirius is being more reckless this year than he has been in the past. There's a chaotic energy that seems to hover beneath his skin and threaten to explode at any moment. Pity the suckers who are around when it does.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the second week,‚Äù Remus hisses at him across the library table as James tries half-heartedly to get through his potions homework.

‚ÄúSurprisingly, I do own a calendar.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt need to look up to know that Remus is glaring at him. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been in detention practically since we got here.‚Äù

James shrugs. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not all that strange for him.‚Äù

There is another pause, no doubt to accommodate more glaring.

‚ÄúJames.‚Äù

It‚Äôs the shift in his tone that finally makes James look up‚ÄîRemus sounds‚Ä¶scared. He meets Remus‚Äôs giant, beseeching brown eyes and lets out a sigh, dropping his quill and running a hand through his mop of hair.

‚ÄúYeah alright, it‚Äôs been a bit full on.‚Äù

It‚Äôs not that Sirius has done anything particularly outlandish‚Äîtransfiguring Mrs. Norris into a duck, sticking the Slytherin cutlery to the table with a permanent sticking charm, setting a bunch of bludgers lose in the halls (that one had been a tad extreme). While he's sure Remus is concerned for all the right reasons‚Äîhe usually is‚Äîpersonally, the thing James is most peeved about is the fact that he hasn‚Äôt been consulted on a single one of these stunts.

‚ÄúThey were spur of the moment,‚Äù Sirius said, when James broached the topic. ‚ÄúJust right place right time, you know, if I‚Äôd thought about it for even a second I‚Äôd have told you.‚Äù

Shockingly, this had not remotely satisfied James‚Äôs ego.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm worried about him,‚Äù Remus whispers, bringing James back to the present.

‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs cheeks go pink as he looks down, fiddling with his quill. ‚ÄúI feel like I‚Äôm flying a little blind here,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúI know that something happened this summer. But I don‚Äôt‚ÄîI mean he didn‚Äôt just walk out of that house. And I know it‚Äôs not really my business‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúSays who?‚Äù

Remus looks up at that, sending James a grateful smile.

‚ÄúListen, Moony,‚Äù he puts his arms down on the table, leaning closer to his friend, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre a team, yeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúI swear to merlin if you‚Äôre about to make a Quidditch reference.‚Äù

James laughs. ‚ÄúNo, no I wouldn‚Äôt do that to you.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou absolutely would.‚Äù

James pushes playfully at Remus‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying‚Äîtrying to say‚Äîit‚Äôs all four of us. We‚Äôre in this together.‚Äù

Remus arches his brow. ‚ÄúIn what together?‚Äù

James gestures to the space around them. ‚ÄúThis, life, all of it. We‚Äôre in it together. You care about him, you want to help, I get it. I think he should tell you the whole story, really I do. But I can‚Äôt tell you‚Äîbecause it‚Äôs not mine to tell.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs eyes go wide. ‚ÄúNo, I wasn‚Äôt trying to‚Äî‚Äú

But James waves a lazy hand, knocking his worries away. ‚ÄúI know Moons, I know. I‚Äôm just telling you so you understand that there‚Äôs not some secret club between the two of us.‚Äù

There‚Äôs an uncomfortable pause that James was not entirely prepared for.

‚ÄúI mean,‚Äù Remus shrugs, ‚Äúthere is a bit.‚Äù

He knows they‚Äôre not supposed to, but those words sting, and James finds himself sitting back, running a frustrated hand through his hair.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine James,‚Äù Remus goes on, clearly trying to cover up how very not fine it is. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre allowed to have a best friend.‚Äù

James scowls. ‚ÄúI have three best friends.‚Äù

Remus arches a skeptical brow but James refuses to backdown. After a few minutes of staring one another down Remus breaks, shaking his head with a laugh. ‚ÄúJesus James, alright.‚Äù

James smiles. ‚ÄúI love being right.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs exactly what I said,‚Äù Remus huffs, but the little smile still in the corner of his mouth is enough to satisfy James.

‚ÄúListen, Moons,‚Äù he starts again, tone more serious, ‚Äúme and Sirius, we‚Äôre similar, at least in the obvious ways‚Äîthe ways that everyone can spot. More than you and me or me and Pete, but that doesn‚Äôt mean I love you any less, yeah?‚Äù

Remus blinks at him, a look on his face that James can‚Äôt quite read. ‚ÄúJames...‚Äù he says slowly, ‚Äúare you...proposing?‚Äù

James snorts, earning him an aggressive ‚Äúsh‚Äù from the Ravenclaw at the next table. ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù he arches his brow suggestively, ‚Äúwould you say yes?‚Äù

‚ÄúAbsolutely not.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù he clutches at his chest. ‚ÄúRemus, you wound me.‚Äù

Remus rolls his eyes, picking up his quill again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll live,‚Äù he hovers the point over his parchment but doesn‚Äôt pressed down. And then: ‚Äúthanks, for...saying all that,‚Äù his voice a little tight, ‚ÄúI‚Äîit‚Äôs appreciated.‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúCourse.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd Sirius‚Ä¶‚Äù

James sighs. ‚ÄúSirius,‚Äù he scrubs at his face with his hands before dropping them back on the table. ‚ÄúI think we just have to, you know, keep an eye on him. Be there. When he needs us.‚Äù

‚ÄúReckon we can handle that.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, me too.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence before they both turn reluctantly back to their homework. Well, James is reluctant, Remus seems perfectly happy. But then, the bastard has already finished his potions, and is very rudely refusing to let James copy.

‚ÄúHey James?‚Äù Remus says after a few moments have passed.

His eyes flick up briefly but Remus‚Äôs are still on the parchment in front of him.

‚ÄúI love you too, just so you know.‚Äù The words are quiet and fast and all squished together and it‚Äôs so very charming and so very Moony that James‚Äôs grin is almost too big for his face.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking July.‚Äù

Remus looks up. ‚ÄúJuly?‚Äù

‚ÄúFor the wedding.‚Äù

James cackles, ducking under the table as a quill is launched at his head.

¬†

The first time he sees Regulus after the train, James is sneaking down to the kitchen‚Äôs under the invisibility cloak some time around midnight. It‚Äôs the third week of school and Sirius‚Äôs stunt pulling has not in anyway diminished. James is worried it‚Äôs starting to prematurely age Remus. The problem with Sirius is you have to let him spin out a bit, not too far, of course, but it‚Äôs like his feelings are too big. Too big to speak or think, so he has to act.

James rounds a corner and nearly runs headlong into the person on the other side. Luckily, he catches himself in time, flattening out against the wall as a very purposeful looking Slytherin pushes past him. It takes a few moments for his brain to catch up, fitting the curly black hair and haughty expression into place. By the time he realizes who it is Regulus is already half-way up a flight of stairs, headed very much away from the Slytherin common room.

For a moment James is frozen. Unable to decide which is stronger: his hunger or his curiosity? He‚Äôs barely made a decision before he‚Äôs taking the stairs two at a time, trying to close the gap between him and Regulus before he loses him.

The younger boy moves nothing like Sirius‚Äîhe‚Äôs all rigid straight lines and perfect posture. It makes James want to trip him, the pretentious prick. If he hadn‚Äôt been so preoccupied with the position of Regulus‚Äôs shoulders‚Ä¶and arms‚Ä¶and‚Ä¶hips, he probably would have realized where they were headed a lot sooner. But it‚Äôs not until Regulus is throwing open the door‚Äîwith James close behind‚Äîthat he realizes they‚Äôve climbed all the way up to the astronomy tower.

James leans against the outer wall, watching as Regulus walks towards the edge of the tower. In the summer, when it doesn‚Äôt get quite so cold after the sun sets, this is where people come to snog‚Äîand maybe a bit more if they‚Äôre feeling adventurous. But somehow James can‚Äôt quite picture Regulus being the type for a quick hook-up‚Äîhe really is nothing like Sirius.

The other boy is leaning over the edge of the railing, eyes on the sky which is, admittedly, rather stunning at this time of night. All velvet black and sparkling stars. The moon is beginning to fill out, something James has learned to watch with wariness.

He keeps expecting someone to come through the door, surely this is some kind of rendezvous even if not of the sexy variety. But no. No one comes. The only thing that happens is Regulus pulls a telescope from his pocket, un-shrinking it with the wave of his wand and then peering at the sky. For a horrifying minute James wonders if he‚Äôs just gone and got himself stuck up here watching Regulus do his astrology homework.

James pushes off the wall and steps closer, watching as Regulus spins a dozen different dials, adjusting the lenses. Whatever he‚Äôs doing, it‚Äôs practiced. Nothing about his fingers is unsure. He‚Äôs always thought of Regulus as being so much younger than them, even though there‚Äôs only a year between them. But he‚Äôs grown over the summer, James noticed his height on the train but now he can see that his shoulders and chest have started to fill out‚Äîhis hair longer. Like Sirius‚Äôs, except neater.

Eventually Regulus‚Äôs hands stop moving. He stares through the telescope for a solid few minutes before sighing and straightening up, eyes still on the sky.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs gotten worse you know,‚Äù the words heavy, ‚Äúsince you left.‚Äù

James jumps at the sound of his voice, surprised, and momentarily afraid that he‚Äôs somehow let the invisibility cloak slip. But no, Regulus isn‚Äôt looking at him, his eyes still staring straight ahead.

‚ÄúDid you even think, for one second, about what would happen to me?‚Äù he laughs coldly, looking down for the first time and scuffing his shoe on the ground. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how to handle them anymore, I used to, but lately it‚Äôs‚Ä¶fuck, lately I can‚Äôt breathe.‚Äù

His voice has gotten thick and James thinks there‚Äôs a chance he might actually be crying, but when Regulus looks up again his face is dry. He scrubs at it with his hands before letting out an exhausted sigh. His eyes get caught in the moonlight and the sight makes James‚Äôs breath catch in his chest. There‚Äôs something overwhelming about them. He doesn‚Äôt think he‚Äôs ever seen Regulus look this full before. Normally he‚Äôs a stiff cut-out of a person, parroting his parents, practically two dimensional. But not here, not tonight. Tonight he feels so big.

With another piercing looking through the telescope he waves his wand and the thing shrinks to the size of a keychain. James watches him slip it into his pocket, watches him go back into the castle, the distant noise of his footsteps audible even after the door closes.

He feels off kilter. The entire time he‚Äôs known Regulus he‚Äôs been a spoiled, spineless git, who treated Sirius like he was a disappointment. An embarrassment. But whatever just happened‚Äîand he‚Äôs still not entirely clear on what just happened‚Äîit didn‚Äôt‚Ä¶fit.

He‚Äôs still stewing over it fifteen minutes later when he walks through the portrait and into the Gryffindor common room, invisibility cloak in hand.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù he looks up and sees Sirius, Peter and Remus all waiting by the fire, everyone else clearly gone to bed. Sirius raises his brows and gestures emphatically at James‚Äôs visibly empty hands. ‚ÄúWhat the hell Prongs? Where are the snacks?‚Äù

‚ÄúSnacks?‚Äù but as soon as the word is out of his mouth it dawns on him why he left in the first place. ‚ÄúRight‚Äîer‚Äîsorry, Filch was about so‚Ä¶‚Äù he shrugs, before moving towards the staircase.

‚ÄúFilch?‚Äù Sirius squawks indignantly behind him. ‚ÄúSince when has Filch ever stopped us from doing anything? You had the cloak for fuck‚Äôs sake!‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt bother replying, suddenly feeling incredibly tired as he jogs up to their dorm room. He doesn‚Äôt put on pyjamas, just strips down to his pants and crawls under the covers, closing the bed curtains around him. He wants to sleep off whatever the hell this weird feeling is that‚Äôs sitting in the pit of his stomach. But despite his best efforts his mind keeps lingering on the memory of Regulus‚Äôs face‚Äîthose stupid fucking eyes. The last thing he hears before falling asleep is Regulus‚Äôs voice in his head, whispering over and over again.

I can‚Äôt breathe.

Chapter End Notes

I have been obsessed with this pairing since Jegulus week but I haven't found any longer fics with them (if you have them pls send me those recs!!) so I thought I'd give it shot!

Comments are always appreciated :)

Chapter 2

Chapter Summary

Remus is going through it in this one - I know, shocking, a new direction for this character, his life is usually so easy.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

He never gets used to it. The full moon. It starts a week before - Remus goes to bed early, he gets headaches, backaches, loses his appetite - James hates it. Hates that there‚Äôs nothing he can do, and that everything he says just seems to make things worse. Remus can‚Äôt stand being fussed over, or when they hover around him. James gets it. Sirius gets it less‚Äîwhich is ironic considering he can be such an antisocial prick when he‚Äôs in a mood.

On the really bad moons, Remus can‚Äôt get out of bed. On the better ones he drags himself through his classes. Those days are the most stressful if James is honest, because Remus is so sensitive. He winces at the light, the noise, at being touched, which sends Sirius into overprotective mode and means that James spends the whole day trying to keep the both of them in one piece.

‚ÄúPads‚ÄîSirius! Come on mate, calm down,‚Äù James mutters, one arm wrapped around Sirius‚Äôs middle as he drags him down the hall.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll calm down when McAllen learns to WATCH WHERE THE FUCK HE‚ÄôS GOING!‚Äù Sirius shouts at the quickly retreating back of a Hufflepuff third year.

‚ÄúMerlin‚Äôs tits, you wanna try not making me go deaf at the tender age of fifteen?‚Äù James is still dragging Sirius along, Peter and Remus up ahead, having not stopped to witness the spectacle that was Black v. McAllen.

‚ÄúPrick.‚Äù

‚ÄúAt least you‚Äôre self-aware.‚Äù

Sirius scowls at him. ‚ÄúI meant McAllen.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don't see why, he was just trying to walk down the hall.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe ran straight into Moony!‚Äù

James rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúHe barely touched him, and it‚Äôs not as though it was on purpose.‚Äù

Sirius looks mutinous but when he speaks he isn‚Äôt angry. Not exactly. ‚ÄúHe winced, Prongs‚Äîhe‚Äî‚Äù but Sirius‚Äôs voice drops off, unwilling or unable to finish that thought.

James finds his eyes trailing to the sandy blond head in front of them, ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt bother pointing out that on days like today Remus winces if you breathe too hard near him. He really ought to stay in the dorm, but he never does. He has to be practically catatonic before he‚Äôll consider missing class.

‚ÄúOh good,‚Äù the boy in question says dryly, as they catch up to him and Peter outside the common room, ‚Äúhe‚Äôs stopped shouting.‚Äù

The portrait swings open and the four of them tumble inside, Sirius looking sufficiently cowed.

‚ÄúSorry Moony,‚Äù he mutters, hands in his pockets.

Remus looks over at him, a weak smile managing to pull at his mouth. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine‚Äîjust, maybe try not to fight everyone who steps near me, yeah?‚Äù

Sirius lets out a dismissive ‚Äúpfft‚Äù while simultaneously glaring at a group of second years who've dared to start walking in their direction. James is pretty sure he hears one of them actually squeal in fear. It‚Äôs a miracle they manage to make it up to their room without anyone being challenged to a duel.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm serious you know,‚Äù Remus says, making a bee-line for his bed, more out of breath than he should be and with a sickly sweat covering his skin.

Sirius‚Äôs eyes light up. ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm Siri‚Äî‚Äú

James has his wand in Sirius‚Äôs face before he can finish his sentence. ‚ÄúI swear to Merlin, if you make that joke one more time I'm going to hex your eyebrows off.‚Äù

Sirius chokes back a laugh, hands coming up in mock surrender. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know why you‚Äôre pointing that thing at me, Moony‚Äôs the one who started it,‚Äù he sends Remus a wink over James‚Äôs shoulder that earns him an unimpressed huff.

‚ÄúI like him better than you,‚Äù James says simply, dropping his wand.

‚ÄúPlease, you couldn‚Äôt live without me.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes, knocking his shoulder into Sirius‚Äôs. ‚ÄúPrick.‚Äù

‚ÄúTwat,‚Äù Sirius knocks him right back.

It feels good, joking around after the day they‚Äôve had. A break in the tension that‚Äôs been pulling at the four of them. Ready to snap. James exhales and feels his shoulders drop away from his neck.

‚ÄúSorry Moony,‚Äù Sirius goes on jovially, ‚Äúyou were saying something before Jamie so rudely interrupted us?‚Äù

But Remus has seemingly stopped paying attention, sitting on his bed with his head in his hands, his whole body rigid.

‚ÄúRemus?‚Äù there's new urgency in Sirius's voice as he steps forward, James also inching closer. Sometimes, on the day of the transformation, things can happen too soon. One bone breaking hours before the moon has risen. One organ beginning the shift when the rest of the body has yet to wake up. It's rare, but it happens, leading to frantic emergency Infirmary visits. The first time was the worst, but it never stops being scary.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù slowly, Remus pulls his hands away from his face, and James thinks he hears Sirius let out a sigh of relief, ‚Äúheadache.‚Äù

James almost laughs at how inadequate that is, even just looking at Remus you can tell the word ‚Äúheadache‚Äù doesn‚Äôt cover it. It‚Äôs another few minutes before Remus actually manages to lift his eyes off the floor, looking directly at Sirius. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need you to protect me.‚Äù

Sirius blinks. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I was trying to say‚Äîbefore. That I mean it. I‚Äôm not some‚Ä¶invalid,‚Äù the last word comes out sharp. ‚ÄúI can handle myself.‚Äù

A series of emotions flicker across Sirius‚Äôs face so quickly that James can‚Äôt catch any of them.

‚ÄúI know that,‚Äù he says finally.

‚ÄúDo you?‚Äù the words barely make it passed Remus‚Äôs teeth.

Peter, who had been lying facedown on his bed, sits up at that, sending James a worried look across the room. This is not going anywhere good.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Sirius says, starting to sound irritated now. ‚ÄúOf course I do. But just because you can handle it, doesn‚Äôt mean you should have to.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius,‚Äù Remus sounds tired, passing a hand over his face. ‚ÄúI‚Äîappreciate that. But I don‚Äôt need a bloody bodyguard.‚Äù

Sirius huffs, crossing his arms over his chest. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre being dramatic.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs really not. You go more mental around the full moon than he does,‚Äù Peter says, before ducking to avoid the pillow Sirius chucks at his head.

James is grateful for the interruption, they're all strung too tightly for this conversation. And the last thing anyone needs is Remus and Sirius going at each other. It doesn‚Äôt happen that often, but when it does it‚Äôs fucking vicious.

‚ÄúI need you to have some faith in me Sirius, alright?‚Äù Remus‚Äôs voice has softened a little, the pair of them staring at one another so intensely James feels like maybe he should leave the room.

‚ÄúMoony,‚Äù Sirius says finally. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll build you a bloody church if that‚Äôs what you want.‚Äù

James snorts, earning him a pointed stare from Remus. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt encourage him,‚Äù but he‚Äôs clearly fighting off a smile.

‚ÄúSince when does Sirius need encouragement to be an idiot?‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Sirius shouts indignantly, causing Remus to roll his eyes.

With the potential row averted James finds himself following Pete‚Äôs example and collapsing onto his bed. His whole body sighs with relief, sinking into the extraordinarily soft mattress. He‚Äôs almost certain the beds at Hogwarts have been charmed because he‚Äôs never slept on anything so comfortable. In the background he can hear the vague noises of Peter and Sirius talking‚Äîsomething about trading chocolate frog cards‚ÄîPeter is obsessed with them. He wants to be the first wizard to have a full set. It doesn‚Äôt seem to matter how many times James tries to explain that it‚Äôs not possible, they put out new cards practically daily, Peter is determined.

It‚Äôs not until he hears the rattling of curtains being pulled shut that his eyes open and he props himself up on his elbows to see that Remus has closed his bed off. Across the room Sirius and Peter have stopped their bickering, Sirius sending James a concerned look.

‚ÄúHey Moons?‚Äù James asks tentatively. ‚ÄúYou need anything? Food? Water? Pepperup?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a small pause before he answers. ‚ÄúNo. Just‚Ä¶quiet, would be good.‚Äù

James nods, even though Remus can‚Äôt see him, sliding off his mattress and back onto his feet.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon Pete, lets go,‚Äù Sirius is already at the door.

Peter looks at him with confusion. ‚ÄúGo where?‚Äù

‚ÄúOut,‚Äù James says, joining Sirius.

‚ÄúBut we just got in,‚Äù there is a slight whine to his voice.

‚ÄúYeah, but Moony wants quiet so we gotta clear out.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can be quiet,‚Äù Peter protests.

Sirius and James both make sounds of disbelief. ‚ÄúYeah, not likely, come on you twat, lets go, chop, chop.‚Äù

Still grumbling Peter follows them out of the room and as the door is closing James swears he hears the faint sound of a ‚Äúthank you‚Äù coming from Remus‚Äôs bed.

¬†

It‚Äôs a rather uneventful evening, all things considered. They spend most of it in the common room, one of them sporadically going upstairs to check on Remus. They bring him a plate from dinner knowing he probably won‚Äôt be well enough to eat any of it.

By seven o‚Äôclock they‚Äôre all lounging about by the fireplace again, Pete playing chess with one of the fourth years, Sirius chatting up Mary while she sits shamelessly on his lap and James trying very resolutely not to look‚Äîor think‚Äîabout the red head doing her charms work in the corner. In fact, he is not thinking about her so hard that he doesn‚Äôt even notice that Remus has come down until he hears his scratchy voice behind him.

‚ÄúSince when is that a thing?‚Äù

James starts, surprised to find a pale Remus hovering over his shoulder. He's sitting far enough from the others that no one else seems to have noticed his arrival either.

‚ÄúSince when is what a thing?‚Äù he asks perplexed, Remus gestures with his chin and James follows his gaze to Sirius and Mary who seem to have decided that snogging one another in the middle of the common room is perfectly acceptable behaviour.

‚ÄúUh‚Ä¶don‚Äôt know‚Ä¶been flirting with each other since last year though, haven‚Äôt they?‚Äù

‚ÄúHave they?‚Äù the tense tone of Remus‚Äôs voice brings James‚Äôs attention back to him. He looks like he‚Äôs in pain‚Äîlips pressed together, eyes tight‚Äîbut then, he is in pain, so that‚Äôs not really surprising. Still, James can't help but feel that something is wrong.

‚ÄúYou okay Moony?‚Äù

Remus blinks, eyes still across the room, it takes a few seconds before he seems able to tear them away, swallowing thickly before he speaks. ‚ÄúYeah‚Äîyeah, just the full moon, you know?‚Äù

James nods slowly, not sure why it doesn‚Äôt sound like the truth. ‚ÄúHeading to the infirmary?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Remus wraps the jumper he‚Äôs wearing more tightly around himself. ‚ÄúBetter get going actually, she‚Äôll give me hell if I‚Äôm late.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll come with,‚Äù James says, getting to his feet.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to‚Äî‚Äú but James waves his words away, already walking towards the portrait, Remus trailing slightly behind.

They walk in silence, the hallways mostly empty, people either still in the great hall or tucked away in their dorms for the night. It‚Äôs a Wednesday, which means Remus is likely stressing about whether or not he‚Äôll be well enough to make it to classes tomorrow. He won‚Äôt be, but James doesn‚Äôt point that out. Especially since he knows that Remus will end up going anyway, which means Sirius will inevitably end up trying to fight someone. James lifts his glasses and massages the bridge of his nose, already tired.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù Remus says, voice rough, ‚Äúhow‚Äôs quidditch going?‚Äù

A laugh bursts out of James before he can help it. ‚ÄúMerlin, you must be desperate for conversation if you‚Äôre willing to talk about quidditch.‚Äù

Remus smiles at him out of the corner of his mouth. ‚ÄúMostly I just know it‚Äôs a conversation I won‚Äôt be expected to contribute much to.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll never understand why you hate it.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know you won‚Äôt.‚Äù

James looks over at him, but the smile is gone now, his face tense and nervous.

‚ÄúReally Moons,‚Äù he tries to inject as much sincerity as he can into his words, ‚Äúare you okay?‚Äù

Remus lets out a dry laugh and James quickly corrects himself. ‚ÄúI know‚ÄîI know that you‚Äôre not physically okay. I‚Äôm not asking that‚Äîyou just seem a little bit more‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know, sad?‚Äù

Remus doesn‚Äôt answer right away, doesn‚Äôt answer for a long time actually, doesn‚Äôt look at James either. When they slow in front of the infirmary doors James half expects him to just walk on through without another word.

But he doesn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúI hate this,‚Äù he whispers, he looks small in a way Remus almost never does. He isn‚Äôt loud and out of control like James and Sirius, but he‚Äôs‚Ä¶strong. When Remus John Lupin puts his foot down there is no negotiating. No changing his mind. He‚Äôs like a fucking mountain‚Äîcommanding authority and respect in a way that James and Sirius never could. So seeing him like this‚Äîseeing him waver‚Äîit makes something in James‚Äôs chest ache.

‚ÄúSometimes I just wish,‚Äù Remus goes on, closing his eyes as he breathes out, ‚Äúthat I was someone else. Anyone else. Anything has to be better than this. Than me.‚Äù

James‚Äôs insides twist, wrecked by the pain in Remus‚Äôs voice. It takes him a while to get himself under control enough to speak. ‚ÄúI know this is going to make me sound like a selfish dick,‚Äù Remus laughs at that, eyes still closed. ‚ÄúBut personally, I‚Äôm so fucking glad you‚Äôre you.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a moment of stillness in which James is almost positive he‚Äôs said the wrong thing, but then Remus opens his eyes, and they‚Äôre watery but he‚Äôs smiling again, even if it‚Äôs only a little.

‚ÄúThanks.‚Äù

There‚Äôs too much in that word for either of them to fully appreciate.

‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù

Remus sighs, pressing the heels of his hands into to his eyes. ‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he says eventually. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you, I guess‚Ä¶‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúYou will.‚Äù

And with that Remus turns away, and James can‚Äôt quite make himself move even when the door closes.

¬†

There‚Äôs too much time before they have to leave for the shack and James is too twitchy to go back to the dormitory. He needs to do something. To move. Part of him feels like grabbing the cloak and going back to sit with Remus until it‚Äôs time. It‚Äôs not that he‚Äôs never heard him talk like that before‚Äîof course he has. Every few months there‚Äôs a particularly bad moon that makes Remus‚Äôs gaze hard to hold. The three of them being with him, it helps. But it doesn‚Äôt fix anything. And James hates that. Hates that the best thing he could come up with doesn‚Äôt even come close to a solution.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre pathetic you are.‚Äù

The sound of voices up ahead snaps him out of his thoughts. He stumbles to a stop, somewhere near the library‚Äîadmittedly he hadn‚Äôt really been paying attention to where he was going. There‚Äôs the sound of scuffling around the corner and then a thud‚Äîsomeone being slammed against the wall he reckons.

‚ÄúAwe look, I think he‚Äôs going to cry. Are you gonna cry wittle baby?‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin, your poor mother, stuck with two pansies for sons.‚Äù

James already has his wand out even before he hears the third, and unmistakable, voice of Severus fucking Snape: ‚ÄúStop playing with your food Mulciber, some of us have places to be.‚Äù

Without another thought James steps around the bend. There‚Äôs three of them‚Äîall Slytherins, of course‚ÄîMulciber with his hand on some kid‚Äôs throat, holding him to the wall, Avery and Snape standing beside him. Snape looking bored, Avery giddy.

‚ÄúPlaces to be? You? That can't be right. Oh wait, let me guess, you got a hot date with the Giant Squid?‚Äù James casts a wordless incarcarous at Mulciber who is instantly thrown to the ground as ropes snake around his arms and legs. James can‚Äôt help grinning‚Äîhe‚Äôs been practicing that one.

‚ÄúFucking Potter‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúExpelliarmus,‚Äù James catches Avery‚Äôs wand as it flips through the air. He barely has time to blink in Snape‚Äôs direction before he hears the beginning of a Levicorpus. He dives to the side just as the spell fires, missing him by an inch and cracking the stone wall behind him.

James laughs, straightening up with two wands in his hands, Mulciber grunting on the floor. ‚ÄúCareful there Snivellus, wouldn‚Äôt want our little prefect getting in trouble now, would we?‚Äù

The pair have their wands up and ready but neither moves. Snape‚Äôs face is pinched, his lanky hair curtaining it on either side, out of the corner of his eye James sees Avery take a step forward and quickly points his own wand at him. ‚ÄúAh, ah, ah.‚Äù

Avery growls. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not going to let you cast, it‚Äôs not loyal to you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWanna bet?‚Äù the whole time he doesn‚Äôt take his eyes off of Snape.

‚ÄúWill someone get rid of these bloody ropes!‚Äù Mulciber shouts.

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúSounds like your friend could use some help there.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou better watch your mouth Potter,‚Äù Snape hisses.

‚ÄúIs this about the squid comment? Honestly I‚Äôm happy for you, I hear she puts out.‚Äù

Snape fires off a stupefy but James blocks it easily.

‚ÄúSee, this is why you were always so crap at quidditch,‚Äù James says conversationally, enjoying himself perhaps a little too much for someone currently outnumbered three to one. ‚ÄúSo fucking predictable.‚Äù

‚ÄúI noticed you stopped making a fool of yourself in front of Lily,‚Äù Snape shoots back, a leer hanging in the corner of his mouth. ‚ÄúFinally realize she‚Äôll never look twice at a moron like you?‚Äù

Admittedly, that stings more than James would like it to, a few choice memories of his proposals to Evans sneaking unwelcome into his thoughts. ‚ÄúThat depends,‚Äù he says, shaking his head clear, happy to find his voice unaffected, ‚Äúhave you?‚Äù

Snape‚Äôs face clouds over and James is certain he‚Äôs about to get hexed again.

But he doesn‚Äôt.

Something shifts. Snape straightens up, a cocky smirk replacing his scowl.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to enjoy it you know,‚Äù his words make as little sense to James as his sudden change in mood.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to enjoy it?‚Äù James repeats slowly. ‚ÄúEnjoy what you creep, fucking the Giant Squid?‚Äù

But for the first time in their lives Snape doesn‚Äôt rise to the bait. ‚ÄúThis is all irrelevant Potter, all so insignificant compared to what‚Äôs coming. And it‚Äôs not going to be long now, I can wait. I can be so patient.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh well, don‚Äôt stop there Snivellus,‚Äù James adjusts the grip on his wand, eyes doing a quick scan of the corridor, trying to figure out what he‚Äôs missed. ‚ÄúShare with the class why don‚Äôt you.‚Äù

But Snape only smiles. ‚ÄúI just hope I‚Äôm there to see it.‚Äù

Now James is starting to get irritated. ‚ÄúSee what?‚Äù

‚ÄúSee them break you.‚Äù He slides his wand back up the sleeve of his robes like James isn‚Äôt still armed and aiming at him.

‚ÄúBreak m‚Äî‚Äú

But Snape cuts across him, speaking directly to Avery: ‚ÄúGet him up, we‚Äôre done here.‚Äù He kicks Mulciber with the toe of his shoe before turning away and skulking down the corridor.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck Snape?‚Äù James shouts after him, with half a mind to follow. The problem is, Snape put his wand away, and as much of a git as he is, James isn‚Äôt about to start firing hexes at someone who isn‚Äôt armed.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù

Avery‚Äôs nasally voice breaks through his thoughts, bringing his attention back to the two idiots still in front of him. Mulciber now teetering on his feet still bound by James‚Äôs ropes, Avery scowling. ‚ÄúMy wand Potter,‚Äù he holds out his hand expectantly.

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúNo please? Come now Avery, surely your mother taught you better than that?‚Äù

‚ÄúGive. Me. My. Wand.‚Äù His face is so red and angry James half expects it to burst open. He considers toying with them a little longer but he really should be heading back to the others.

‚ÄúYou want this?‚Äù he holds up Avery‚Äôs wand, twirling it between his fingers.

‚ÄúYou know I do, you twat.‚Äù

James nods, barely holding back a grin. ‚ÄúWell alright then,‚Äù he winds his arm back and chucks the wand down to the other end of the corridor.

‚ÄúBastard!‚Äù

‚ÄúGo on doggy,‚Äù James says with barely contained glee, ‚Äúfetch.‚Äù

Growling, Avery takes off after his wand.

‚ÄúHey!‚Äù Mulciber shouts. ‚ÄúHey wait‚Äîfucking‚ÄîMerlin‚Äôs tits, wait!‚Äù

James can‚Äôt control himself anymore, laughter bursting out of him as he watches Mulciber hop down the corridor like some kind of monstrous rabbit.

It‚Äôs not until then that he remembers the fourth member of the party. The victim‚Äîstill sitting where Mulciber dropped him, back to the wall, knees pulled up. James feels his heart stutter for a moment.

‚ÄúRegulus?‚Äù he asks incredulously.

Grey eyes meet his. Despite his current state, there isn‚Äôt a lick of embarrassment in Regulus‚Äôs stare. If anything, he looks resigned.

‚ÄúYes, sorry,‚Äù he says dryly. ‚ÄúI would have made myself known sooner only, I thought it might take away from your heroics if you realized who you were saving.‚Äù

James blinks, still adjusting to the fact of his presence. ‚ÄúYou think I would have let them carry on if I realized it was you?‚Äù Regulus just stares back at him flatly, which only manages to irritate James. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt have. Of course I wouldn‚Äôt have.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a brief pause before a snarky smile spreads across Regulus's face. ‚ÄúNo, I suppose you wouldn‚Äôt, saintly reputation to uphold and all that. Gosh, what must it be like to be so righteous?‚Äù Regulus either doesn‚Äôt expect, or desire, an answer, because he gets to his feet, picking up his fallen wand and books and turning to give a gapping James Potter another hard look.

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he says, running James over with his eyes, ‚Äúcheers.‚Äù

He turns on his heel, walking down the now empty corridor.

James could let it go, he absolutely could. He certainly has more important things to be doing right now than bothering with Regulus Black. He could let it go‚Äîexcept, of course, that he can‚Äôt at all.

‚ÄúWhat the hell was that all about then?‚Äù he asks as he falls in step with the younger boy.

Regulus sends him a look out of the corner of his eye. ‚ÄúOh joy, you‚Äôre following me.‚Äù

James pointedly ignores that comment. ‚ÄúWith Snape and them‚Äîdidn‚Äôt think Slytherin‚Äôs picked on their own?‚Äù

Regulus lets out a dry laugh. ‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt you?‚Äù

And, well, James has no idea what to do with that. ‚ÄúRegulus‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúPlease stop calling me that.‚Äù

James wrinkles his nose. ‚ÄúWell I can‚Äôt call you Black.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd why not?‚Äù they round another corner and James realizes, with some trepidation, that they‚Äôre heading towards the dungeons. He‚Äôll be outnumbered by a lot more than three down there.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, cause your brother‚Äôs my best mate?‚Äù

Regulus sends him another sidelong glance. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what that has to do with me.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt would be weird.‚Äù

‚ÄúI assure you, it wouldn‚Äôt.‚Äù

James lets out an exasperated sigh. ‚ÄúRight, okay,‚Äù he runs a hand through his hair, ‚Äúsay I call you Black, will you tell me what happened then?‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúSeverus asked me to do a favour for him,‚Äù he says coldly.

James waits for more but Regulus is frustratingly unforthcoming. ‚ÄúBased on that little melodrama, I‚Äôm guessing you told him no?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause, their steps echoing in the empty hall.

‚ÄúI told him to blow me.‚Äù

The laugh that comes out of James makes Regulus start so hard he almost drops his books.

‚ÄúChrist,‚Äù the younger boy swears as James tries to contain himself. ‚ÄúWhat the hell was that?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs called laughter, you should try it sometime.‚Äù

Regulus glares. ‚ÄúThat was not a laugh, that was a fucking banshee cry.‚Äù

But James only smiles. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm choosing to take that as a compliment.‚Äù

‚ÄúI promise you, it wasn‚Äôt one.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh well, too late now,‚Äù there‚Äôs a curl of pride in James‚Äôs stomach at the sight of a smile hiding in Regulus‚Äôs mouth. He‚Äôs never seen that before. Never seen Regulus do anything but scowl.

‚ÄúSo he didn‚Äôt take you up on your offer then?‚Äù James asks eventually.

‚ÄúFunnily enough, no.‚Äù

James smirks, shoving his hands in his pockets as they pass by a pack of Ravenclaw girls who almost immediately start whispering to each other. James is usually quite happy to be the subject of school gossip, but for some reason this attention makes him feel antsy.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm surprised you let dumb and dumber back there disarm you,‚Äù he starts talking again to distract himself.

Regulus snorts, keeping his eyes on the space ahead of him and very resolutely off of James. ‚ÄúThey didn‚Äôt disarm me,‚Äù and then, after a beat, ‚ÄúMulciber punched me. In retrospect, I really should have seen that coming.‚Äù

James looks over at him and notices the bruise on his jaw for the first time. It sends an eery shiver down his spine, images of Sirius standing so lost and hurt on his doorstep. He looks away.

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Regulus comes to a stop in the middle of the corridor, pulling James up short. The two of them stand facing one another for the first time. God, James can‚Äôt help but think, those fucking eyes. He's not sure what it is exactly, just that when he looks at them it hurts. ‚ÄúAs strange as this has all been, I really think it would be best for us to part ways now.‚Äù When James just stares blankly back at him he continues, with the air of the long suffering. ‚ÄúAs much as I appreciate your‚Ä¶assistance‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúAssistance?‚Äù James laughs, thinking it‚Äôs a funny way of saying ‚Äòthanks for saving my ass.‚Äô

Regulus ignores him. ‚ÄúBeing walked to my dorm by James Potter is hardly going to help matters.‚Äù

James splutters. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not walking you to your dorm.‚Äù

Regulus blinks at him, looks down the hall, then blinks at him again. ‚ÄúPotter, that is literally what you‚Äôre doing.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo I‚Äôm‚Äîwell, it‚Äôs just when you put it like that it sounds like‚Äîcause I‚Äôm not‚ÄîI'm just, we‚Äôre just walking, I‚Äôm not‚Ä¶‚Äù for some reason he can‚Äôt explain the heat is rising in his face, his hand going nervously to the back of his neck.

Regulus stares back at him for the longest thirty seconds of James‚Äôs life before he lets out an aggravated sigh‚Äîunnecessarily aggravated, in James‚Äôs opinion. ‚ÄúOkay then. Goodbye Potter.‚Äù

He watches Regulus walk away, almost thinks he‚Äôs going to let him. And then: ‚ÄúHey, Regulus?‚Äù

The younger boy stops, but it takes him a while before he turns around, that look of resignation back on his face. He doesn‚Äôt say anything, just watches James expectantly.

‚ÄúWhat was Snape on about?‚Äù he pushes away the nagging feeling in his stomach that insists he already knows. Because it can‚Äôt be that. It can‚Äôt. Not here. Snape is a prick but he‚Äôs not‚Äîhe can‚Äôt be.

Regulus‚Äôs eyes widen slightly, and he suddenly looks startling young. James almost wants to take it back, if it‚Äôs going to make Regulus look at him like that.

The other boy opens and closes his mouth several times but nothing comes out. Eventually, he sighs, grey eyes full of something like pity. ‚ÄúYou really should get out of here James,‚Äù and that‚Äôs it. He turns around again and doesn‚Äôt stop.

James might have protested, might have gone after him and demanded an actual answer, except that his ears are ringing with that last word. James. James. James. His name sounds different, spoken in Regulus's haughty drawl, and it's making something warm bloom inside him.

¬†

‚ÄúWhere the hell have you been?‚Äù Sirius demands, ten minutes later when he makes it back up to their dorm room. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre almost late.‚Äù He whips the invisibility cloak at James who fumbles it.

‚ÄúSorry, ran into Snape and his lot,‚Äù James mutters as the three of them climb under the cloak, Peter already a rat riding on Sirius‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúThey ambush you?‚Äù Sirius asks, tone suddenly much more understanding.

‚ÄúNah, other way around. Found them picking on some kid,‚Äù the guilt is instant. He doesn‚Äôt lie to Sirius, not really. And he has no idea why he‚Äôs doing it now.

‚ÄúWankers, we‚Äôll have to organize a little payback huh? Take them down a few pegs.‚Äù

James nods as they slip out of the common room and into the hall. ‚ÄúDefinitely.‚Äù

Peter Squeaks in agreement.

It‚Äôs a seamless walk to the shack, they‚Äôve done it so many times by now they‚Äôre old hats‚Äîknow which stairs to take, what halls to avoid, what time Pomfrey leaves‚Äîwhich is never soon enough in James‚Äôs opinion. Once they nearly ran into her in the tunnel and it was a fucking disaster.

‚ÄúHey Moons,‚Äù Sirius says, as they whip off the cloak in the shack‚Äôs upstairs bedroom.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Remus croaks, he‚Äôs sitting on the dirty mattress on the floor, head between his knees, breathing too fast. He doesn‚Äôt look at them.

Sirius kneels next to him, carefully rubbing his back, while Peter scurries onto his lap. Remus makes a sound somewhere between a laugh and a sob. ‚ÄúYou lot are ridiculous, you know that?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been told,‚Äù James says, stashing the cloak before he joins his friends, sitting on the floor in front of them.

Remus lets out another choked noise. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs bad tonight. I don‚Äôt know why it‚Äôs so bad tonight. F-fuck.‚Äù

Sirius looks at James, his eyes tight. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre here Moony,‚Äù he says softly. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll be here the whole time.‚Äù

Remus nods in a jerky movement, visibly shaking now. ‚ÄúYou should change.‚Äù

James gets to his feet, Peter scurrying off of Remus to come stand by his feet. But Sirius is reluctant to move, continuing to rub comforting circles on Remus‚Äôs back until the screaming starts. That‚Äôs always the hardest part for James. Remus‚Äôs voice tries to tear itself apart as he convulses on the bed, skin beginning to split open.

¬†

His thoughts change slightly when he‚Äôs a stag. They become more simple‚Äîhe sees and hears and tastes the world differently, new senses filtering into his brain in a way that is distinctly not human.

The first thing his stag brain thinks when Remus has fully transformed, is wrong.

Wrong.

Something is wrong.

He doesn‚Äôt know what it is, the wolf is on edge, tense and twitchy. It doesn‚Äôt follow them as willingly out of the shack as it usually does, a low growling emanating from its chest the whole time. It makes James nervous, his pulse beating in time with his thoughts.

Wrong.

Wrong.

Wrong.

They‚Äôre barely past the tree line when he lunges. Claws out, teeth barred. Padfoot only just doges him, scrambling away in surprise. They play with the wolf all the time‚Äîtackling one another, sometimes nipping each other on the shoulder or ear. But this is different.

Wrong.

Wrong.

Wrong.

The wolf makes another attempt but this time James is there, stepping between the pair and pushing the wolf back, pounding his hooves into the dirt. The wolf glares at him so James tilts his head down, threatening his antlers. He‚Äôs not going to use them, but the wolf doesn‚Äôt need to know that.

After a few more seconds of glaring at one another Moony skulks off, running deeper into the forest.

He‚Äôs angry.

Why is he angry?

Padfoot comes up beside him, Peter making figure-eights as he runs around their legs, letting out little nervous squeaks. After a few minutes he swears he hears Padfoot huff and then he starts off after Moony. James follows, making sure to keep close to him.

They find the wolf by a small stream about half a mile in. Drinking. Padfoot goes bounding into the water, face spreading into a grin, tongue hanging out. James joins him. Moony lays down sulkily on the beach but at least he seems calmer.

It‚Äôs a nice night, warm, the moon and stars so bright they‚Äôre almost blinding. Moony, apparently bored, gets back on his feet and takes off again, into the forest. The rest of them are quick to follow, Padfoot shaking his fur dry in a move that is very reminiscent of his human form. They know the forest pretty well by now but James still feels himself getting disoriented. Moony is going deep. Too deep. Padfoot barks, trying to call him back. James can‚Äôt see him anymore, it‚Äôs too dark, the trees here too crowded. The three of them slow. Turning around themselves. James tries to hear, to smell, but there‚Äôs nothing.

Wrong.

Wrong.

Wrong.

It happens so fast. One minute they‚Äôre lost and the next Moony is coming through the trees. James has never felt afraid of him, not really, but this time‚Ä¶he goes right for Padfoot. The pair tumble to the ground a few feet away and the noise‚ÄîSirius whines in a way that James has never heard before and his heart stops.

He‚Äôs barely thinking as he charges after them, Peter squealing behind him. One well aimed kick gets Moony off of Sirius‚Äîit‚Äôs too hard, he knows it is, but he‚Äôs panicking. And Sirius doesn‚Äôt get up. The wolf comes at them again‚Äîexcept he isn‚Äôt coming for them. He‚Äôs coming for Padfoot. This time James rises up onto his hind legs and throws his front feet heavily into the wolf‚Äôs chest, knocking him backwards and into one of the trees behind him.

Fuck.

Fuck, Remus. Fuck.

James turns back to Sirius. He doesn‚Äôt know what to do. He can‚Äôt transform, not yet, not with Moony right behind him, but he‚Äôs fucking useless as a stag. He moves forward, and sees the slow rise and fall of the dog‚Äôs chest, blood catching in the moonlight. He nudges him as gently as he can, Peter running mad laps around the both of them. Padfoot groans, and then, slowly, pulls himself up.

James almost cries‚Äîthough he‚Äôs not sure what that would look like as a stag. He needs to know if Sirius is okay but there‚Äôs no fucking way to ask and then, as if he‚Äôs heard James‚Äôs thoughts, Sirius comes forward and gives him a lick. James laughs and it comes out as a heavy breath through his nose.

They turn back towards Moony, sitting still where he hit the ground, curled in on himself, licking his wounds. He growls when he notices them watching. There‚Äôs a small tug at James‚Äôs leg and he looks back down at Padfoot. The dog holds his gaze for a moment before nodding his head in the direction of the shack.

He wants to go back.

He‚Äôs been hurt, and clearly Moony is riled up for some reason. It makes sense, but James‚Äôs chest still aches a little at the thought. They‚Äôve never split up on a full moon before. He dips his head slowly so Padfoot knows he understands, and without pausing the black dog slinks off into the woods, limping more than James is comfortable with. Part of him wants to follow, but it‚Äôs too early and he can‚Äôt leave Moony alone.

So he tears his eyes away from the spot where Padfoot disappeared and takes his place beside the wolf.

¬†

‚ÄúShit Sirius,‚Äù James slips out from under Remus‚Äôs arm as they enter the bedroom in the shrieking shack. Sirius is sitting against the wall, the side of his shirt drenched in blood.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not as bad as it looks,‚Äù he says, voice rough around the edges.

James picks up his wand and kneels beside him while Peter takes Remus‚Äôs unconscious body the rest of the way to the mattress.

‚ÄúHow is he?‚Äù Sirius asks, while James lifts up his shirt to get a better look at his injuries.

James grimaces. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs had easier nights. At least he‚Äôs bleeding less than you.‚Äù He holds his wand over Sirius but pauses before he casts, catching his friend‚Äôs eye. ‚ÄúI only know episkey,‚Äù he says apologetically.

Sirius half-coughs, half-laughs. ‚ÄúWell, go on then, see what it does.‚Äù

James flicks his wand and watches as the three deep gashes across Sirius‚Äôs side grow slightly smaller. ‚ÄúShit,‚Äù he hisses under his breath, trying the spell again only to accomplish even less.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs all I‚Äôve got.‚Äù

‚ÄúHere,‚Äù Peter comes up behind them, sweating from having carried Remus back to the shack‚Äîthey hadn‚Äôt been sure it was a good idea to bring the wolf around Sirius again. Just incase.

Peter nudges James out of the way before taking his place.

Sirius raises his brow. ‚ÄúYou know what you‚Äôre doing Pete?‚Äù

He rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúI know at least as much as James.‚Äù

Sirius smiles. ‚ÄúFair enough.‚Äù

Peter‚Äôs face screws up in concentration as he raises his wand, ‚ÄúFerula.‚Äù Bandages shoot out of his wand and wrap around Sirius‚Äôs side‚Äîfrom his under arm to his hip.

‚ÄúNice one,‚Äù James slaps Peter on the back. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôd you learn that?‚Äù

‚ÄúRemus, ‚Äòcourse,‚Äù he says, clearly trying to hide how pleased he is to get James‚Äôs praise. ‚ÄúWhere do I learn anything?‚Äù

As if on cue, Remus groans, drawing all their attention back to him.

‚ÄúHow long do you reckon we have until Pomfrey gets here?‚Äù Sirius asks, as he pulls his bloody shirt back down. James is already across the room, Pete‚Äôs thrown an old blanket across Remus‚Äôs body but James pulls it back to get a look at his chest and hisses. It‚Äôs already turning blue, bruised all down the front.

‚ÄúHey Peter,‚Äù he whispers, instead of answering Sirius‚Äôs question. ‚ÄúRemus teach you anymore of those nifty healing spells?‚Äù

Peter comes to hover over his shoulder, staring down bleakly at their friend before shaking his head. James sighs, dropping the blanket just as Remus‚Äôs eyes start to flutter open. He gasps like he‚Äôs coming up for air, struggling at first, and James places a steady hand on his shoulder to keep him from falling onto the floor.

‚ÄúEasy, easy,‚Äù he murmurs. Remus‚Äôs breathing starts to even out but his eyes stay wide and frantic. There‚Äôs a moment of calm when he finds James, but it only lasts a second before his eyes are traveling down to the blood on James's hands. Fuck, he should have wiped that off.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äî‚Äú but he winces when he tries to speak, his chest hitching, causing a new wave of guilt to wash over James.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù James says. ‚ÄúI‚Äîyou were a little‚Ä¶.‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt know how to explain in a way that won‚Äôt make Remus feel worse.

‚ÄúAngry,‚Äù Peter supplies from behind him, which is as good a description as any James supposes.

Somehow Remus‚Äôs eyes grow wider. ‚ÄúD-did I hurt you?‚Äù and then, panicked: ‚ÄúSirius? Where's-‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here,‚Äù Sirius pops up, without giving any hint that his entire left side has been mauled. James almost laughs when he sees that Sirius has wrapped the invisibility cloak around his shoulders, hiding his bloody torso. Thank Merlin.

Remus's eyes are bright with tears. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre okay?‚Äù

And James doesn‚Äôt know if the question is directed at all of them or just Sirius, doesn‚Äôt know if Remus remembers any of what happened‚Äîhe doesn‚Äôt usually. Either way, Sirius smiles, bless him.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre okay, Moony.‚Äù

Before anymore can pass between them there is the distinct noise of a door opening.

‚ÄúShit,‚Äù James gets to his feet as Peter quickly shrinks himself back into a rat. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see you soon, alright Remus?‚Äù he says, as Sirius lets him under the cloak. It doesn‚Äôt escape his notice that Remus‚Äôs eyes are trained on his bloody hands until the moment they disappear.

¬†

They‚Äôre quiet when they get back to the dorm room, the dim blue light of the early morning filling up the space. James chucks the invisibility cloak into the corner and heads straight for the bathroom, he tries not to think about about what he‚Äôs washing away as the pink water swirls down the drain.

When he walks back into the room Sirius is inspecting his wounds in front of the mirror, Peter face down on his bed. James pauses, breath hitching again at the sight of Sirius‚Äôs bloody side, at the knowledge that it could have been so much worse. Sirius‚Äôs eyes meet his and James tries to keep his expression blank. Sometimes he wonders what Sirius's body would look like, if he couldn't magic away all his scars. ‚ÄúYou gonna be able to get those bandages back on?‚Äù he asks eventually, unable to say any of what he wants to.

‚ÄúPeter will do me again, won‚Äôt you Pete?‚Äù

An indistinct noise comes from Peter as he speaks into his bedding. James huffs out a laugh, sitting on the end of his own bed. He considers lying down but he knows if he does he won‚Äôt be able to get back up again.

‚ÄúHow long do we have until breakfast?‚Äù he asks, too lazy to check himself.

‚ÄúNot long‚Äîfifteen minutes tops,‚Äù Sirius answers as he starts looking around for a new shirt. Much to Remus‚Äôs dismay, Sirius has never learned how to use a wardrobe. James‚Äôs eyes find his bloodied clothes thrown over his headboard.

‚ÄúOi, get rid of those before Moony comes back,‚Äù he says, earning him an indignant grumble as Sirius finishes pulling a clean jumper over his head. Well, relatively clean.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not an idiot you know,‚Äù he says as walks towards his bed, tying his hair back.

James is too tired to snap back, dropping his head into his hands and wondering how many points McGonagall will dock him if he skives off transfigurations this morning.

‚ÄúHe was so angry.‚Äù

It‚Äôs the tone that makes James look up‚ÄîSirius has suddenly gone quiet, standing at the head of his bed with the bloody shirt between his hands.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what I did.‚Äù

James's throat feels tight. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt‚Ä¶it could have been random.‚Äù But for some reason, he can‚Äôt quite make himself believe it.

‚ÄúDunno,‚Äù Pete chimes is, having flipped himself onto his back, ‚Äúfelt pretty Padfoot focused, didn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

James glares at him. ‚ÄúYes. Thanks Pete. Real helpful.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs right though,‚Äù Sirius says, before the two of them can start bickering. He‚Äôs still looking down at the shirt in his hands. ‚ÄúFuck, I really don‚Äôt know what I did.‚Äù

None of them speak for a while. James watches Sirius nervously, foot tapping against the ground. He really needs to fucking fly‚Äîjust to get rid of the adrenaline still coursing through his veins. He keeps hearing it‚ÄîSirius‚Äôs whine. Keeps feeling the way his breath stuttered. He‚Äôd thought‚Äîfor a second there he‚Äôd really thought‚Ä¶

‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù he forces himself to say, pushing to his feet. His whole body protests, begging him to lie down. ‚ÄúLets go before the great hall gets too crowded.‚Äù

Peter groans as he slides reluctantly off his bed and makes for the door, but Sirius doesn‚Äôt move.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James says softly, stepping closer and squeezing Sirius‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry about it too much, yeah? Remus loves you.‚Äù

He sees the muscles in Sirius‚Äôs jaw tense before he breathes out, nodding his head. ‚ÄúYeah.‚Äù

He incendio‚Äôs the shirt in his hands so quickly that by the time James realizes what‚Äôs happened Sirius is already out the door.

¬†

The marauders have been sneaking breakfast up to the infirmary every morning after the full moon since about half-way through first year‚Äîbefore they even fully understood what was going on.

At first they would come in under the invisibility cloak, but they gave up on that pretty quick. They never could keep quiet once they were all together, and it was a while before any of them could cast a muffliato strong enough to make a difference. Pomfrey‚Äôs just accepted it at this point. Secretly, James thinks she‚Äôs glad. Glad that Remus isn‚Äôt alone. She‚Äôs not nearly as scary as she pretends to be.

‚ÄúMorning Poppy,‚Äù Sirius says cheerily, two levitating plates stacked high with breakfast carnage following him into the infirmary.

‚ÄúMr. Black,‚Äù she says wearily, the large room is empty except for one bed with the curtains drawn around it. ‚ÄúQuiet if you please, he hasn‚Äôt gotten up yet.‚Äù

Sirius sends James a nervous look over his shoulder. That‚Äôs unusual. Remus is usually itching to get to class by now.

‚ÄúHow is he?‚Äù James finds himself asking. What‚Äôs wrong with Remus is another thing that has become quietly accepted between them. Technically, she doesn‚Äôt know that they know but‚Ä¶well, she‚Äôs not an idiot.

Her face is grim. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs in bad shape, the worst it's been in a while‚Äîfew fractured ribs, cracked clavicle, bad bruising.‚Äù
