‚ÄúNot really,‚Äù he sinks lower in his chair, tilting his head back to look up at the ceiling. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt we just do what we did last year?‚Äù

Sirius gasps, scandalized. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt we just‚Äîare you‚ÄîRemus are you hearing this?‚Äù

James is only vaguely paying attention. He knows that someone says something else, and then he hears the muffled noises of shuffling feet and closing books. Sirius doesn‚Äôt start shouting again though, so he considers it a win.

Remus‚Äôs face appears above him.

‚ÄúHey Moons,‚Äù he says wearily.

Remus worries his bottom lip between his teeth, eyes running James over like he‚Äôs a potion that‚Äôs not boiling right. ‚ÄúLets go shall we?‚Äù he says eventually.

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúSorry, I can‚Äôt go anywhere right now. I‚Äôm in the middle of some very important work.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh yeah?‚Äù

James nods, expression serious. ‚ÄúMhm, someone‚Äôs got to count all the cracks in the ceiling.‚Äù

Remus smiles, reaching down and grabbing hold of James‚Äôs wrist, ‚ÄúCome on you lump, lets go.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre going to kidnap me at least have the decency to tell me where we‚Äôre going,‚Äù James notices that Sirius has retreated to the other side of the common room with Mary, Pete nowhere to be seen. Remus clearly dismissed them.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure kidnappers are known for being particularly decent.‚Äù

‚ÄúSemantics,‚Äù James mutters, allowing himself to be dragged though the portrait hole and into the hall on the other side.

They walk in silence at first, James shoving his newly freed hands into his pockets and making a concerted effort not to look at anyone. The problem with being a generally sociable person is there‚Äôs no efficient way to communicate to people to stay the fuck away from you when you‚Äôre having a bad day.

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt bring the cloak,‚Äù James finds himself saying, eventually.

‚ÄúI did not. Very astute of you to notice.‚Äù

James huffs. ‚ÄúYou going to be okay when we get detention for walking around after curfew?‚Äù

Remus taps the Prefect badge on his chest, sending James a sly look.

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù James says wisely. ‚ÄúThe perks of selling out.‚Äù

Remus only rolls his eyes, continuing to lead the way. The nice thing about Moony‚Äîwell, one of several‚Äîis that he‚Äôs not a bad person to not talk to. He‚Äôs not uncomfortable with silence. He can let things be, in a way that James has never been very good at. It doesn‚Äôt bother Remus that you‚Äôre sad, not because he doesn‚Äôt care, but because he understands that sometimes things can‚Äôt be fixed. They just need to be felt.

‚ÄúSnacks?‚Äù James asks, as they stroll up to the painting of the bowl of fruit, Remus tickling the pear with great dignity.

‚ÄúHot chocolate,‚Äù Moony corrects.

James follows him through the portrait hole, smiling. He should have guessed.

‚ÄúHello sirs!‚Äù

‚ÄúHow can we be of help sirs?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat be you needing young masters?‚Äù

At least a dozen house elves swarm them. James never gets used to it. The Potter‚Äôs only have one house elf ‚ÄîMimi‚Äîand she isn‚Äôt anything like the Hogwarts elves. For starters, she‚Äôs always giving James shit: ‚ÄúOh the little master has lost both his arms I see, that is why his bed is still unmade,‚Äù or ‚ÄúMaster James seems to have lost his sight at school, that is why he cannot see the mess on his bedroom floor.‚Äù

‚ÄúTwo mugs of hot chocolate would be lovely if you wouldn‚Äôt mind,‚Äù Remus says, walking towards the nearest table. ‚ÄúIs it ok if we stay for a bit?‚Äù

‚ÄúNot at all sirs!‚Äù

‚ÄúRight away sirs!‚Äù

‚ÄúWill you be wanting marshmallows sirs?‚Äù

Remus turns to James, brow raised.

‚ÄúUh‚Äîyeah, sure. Thanks,‚Äù he rubs the back of his neck uncomfortably as the little creatures scurry about.

‚ÄúSo we‚Äôre staying then?‚Äù James asks, sitting down beside Remus.

Remus nods. ‚ÄúFigured it might help.‚Äù

‚ÄúHelp?‚Äù

At that moment two giant mugs, overflowing with mountains of already melting marshmallows, appear in front of them. Remus makes a pleased humming noise as he wraps his fingers around the one closest to him. ‚ÄúGod, I love that smell,‚Äù he says happily.

James takes hold of his own mug, pressing the warm porcelain between his hands and trying to ignore the dull ache that has been sitting in his chest for the past few days.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to tell me what‚Äôs wrong,‚Äù Remus says eventually, causing James to look up. His friend is lowering his mug back down onto the table, eyes soft, but he can see the concern in them. ‚ÄúBut‚Ä¶something is wrong, isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

James stares back helplessly. ‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú but nothing else comes out, a hundred words lodged in his throat. He sighs, running a hand over his face before swallowing them all back down with great difficulty. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just tired,‚Äù is the best he can come up with.

It‚Äôs not a lie. The nightmares have made a return. Except now sometimes Regulus is the one who‚Äôs screaming. And James never makes it on time.

Remus looks at him skeptically. ‚ÄúJames, you love Halloween.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs because Halloween is amazing.‚Äù

Remus sends him a pointed look that James chooses to ignore, becoming suddenly much more interested in his hot chocolate.

‚ÄúYou were barely paying attention earlier,‚Äù Remus pushes on. ‚ÄúUsually I‚Äôd be trying to convince you and Sirius not to sneak a troll into the castle or charm the sofa cushions to growl at people.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúThose are both excellent ideas.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd you‚Äôd have come up with them if you hadn‚Äôt been so busy sulking.‚Äù

James groans, dropping his head into his hands. Part of him wants to tell Remus‚Äîis desperate to tell him. But another part of him is terrified. It was so easy, when he could keep Regulus up in that tower, away from everything and everyone else. Away from the rest of his life, so he didn‚Äôt have to think about what he was doing.

‚ÄúListen, like I said, you don‚Äôt have to tell me okay?‚Äù Remus says, reaching across the table and tapping his shoulder lightly, letting James know that he‚Äôs there. ‚ÄúBut the thing is, well, you‚Äôre usually kind of an open book, and since not one of us has any idea what‚Äôs going on with you it‚Äôs thrown us for a bit of a loop,‚Äù he pauses, ‚Äúespecially Pads.‚Äù

James scrubs at his face before sitting back and meeting Remus‚Äôs gaze. ‚ÄúHe told you to talk to me?‚Äù

Remus smirks. ‚ÄúPlease, he wanted to talk to you himself. But since he has the emotional awareness of a toddler, I figured that would be completely useless.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúProbably right.‚Äù

Remus takes another sip of his hot chocolate, waiting. Waiting for James. He‚Äôs never hidden anything from them before. He knows that they do‚ÄîSirius and Remus especially. He sees it sometimes, in the tight way they hold their mouths, or drop their eyes. He doesn‚Äôt mind, he knows that it‚Äôs harder for them. Knows that part of his job‚Äîhis role‚Äîis to be open. To be bright. To prove everything they think about the world wrong. To prove that there is good and sometimes that‚Äôs enough. Sometimes the worse thing doesn‚Äôt happen.

He sighs. ‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú he starts, voice going out on him almost immediately. He clears his throat and tries again. ‚ÄúI think I hurt someone,‚Äù he swallows with difficulty. ‚ÄúI think I hurt someone and I don‚Äôt know‚Ä¶fuck Remus, I don‚Äôt know how to fix it.‚Äù

The obvious questions‚Äîthe who and the how‚Äîdon‚Äôt come. And James is grateful.

‚ÄúWell, assuming that you didn‚Äôt kill them‚Ä¶?‚Äù he waits for James to nod in the affirmative. ‚ÄúHave you tried apologizing?‚Äù

James lets out a breath. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry is usually a good start.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James picks at the table. ‚ÄúYeah, it‚Äôs just‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know, it‚Äîit‚Äôs complicated.‚Äù

When a few minutes pass without Remus saying anything James forces himself to look up. His friend is watching him thoughtfully, that little crease between his eyes he gets when he‚Äôs thinking too hard. James braces himself for an onslaught of questions that he can‚Äôt answer. Not right now. Maybe not ever. But he should have known better. This is Moony after all.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù the other boy says eventually. ‚ÄúSo just talk to them.‚Äù

James looks at him flatly and Remus laughs. ‚ÄúLook, despite what Sirius Black would have you believe, torturing yourself doesn‚Äôt solve anything. It sure as hell doesn‚Äôt do anything for the person you hurt.‚Äù

His chest aches, thinking about Regulus‚Äôs face, standing there after he'd kissed him, so fucking scared.

‚ÄúMaybe I‚Äôm just a coward.‚Äù

Remus makes a disbelieving noise. ‚ÄúJames, you are, without a doubt, one of the bravest people I have ever met.‚Äù

He rolls his eyes, but Remus isn‚Äôt done. ‚ÄúI swear the first years think you actually are Godric Gryffindor.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey do not,‚Äù James can‚Äôt quite keep a straight face.

‚ÄúPlease, their eyes get so wide when you walk by I worry they‚Äôre going to fall out. But,‚Äù he shrugs, a smile in the corner of his mouth, ‚Äúif they‚Äôre gonna idolize someone, there are worse people they could choose.‚Äù

That gets a proper laugh out of James, and Remus sips smugly at his hot chocolate before reaching across the table to squeeze his shoulder.

‚ÄúTalk to them, okay?‚Äù

James nods slowly, playing with his mug for a minute before speaking again. ‚ÄúListen, speaking of apologies, I‚Äôve been meaning to‚Ä¶you know,‚Äù his hand goes to the back of his neck, nervously. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt mean to make you feel uncomfortable the other day, in the library.‚Äù

He sees Remus‚Äôs posture tense as he carefully raises his mug to his lips, taking his time. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

It‚Äôs late, the candles burning low as one or two of the house elves move around them, preparing for tomorrow.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he says, when Remus continues to sit there silently.

His friend lets out a breath. ‚ÄúI got that I‚Äîyou don‚Äôt need to be sorry,‚Äù he says awkwardly, like his words are climbing over hurtles just to make it out of his mouth. ‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt do anything wrong, I just...didn‚Äôt want anyone to know,‚Äù those last words are almost a whisper.

James nods. ‚ÄúI know, and they won‚Äôt.‚Äù He doesn‚Äôt try to convince him not to worry, not to take it so seriously. Not after the way that went last time.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù Remus clears his throat and speaks more forcibly. ‚ÄúThank you for being so‚Ä¶so okay. With it. With me.‚Äù

And for the first time, James has the smallest inkling that they may not be talking about the same thing.

‚ÄúSure,‚Äù he says anyway, ‚Äúof course.‚Äù

They finish their hot chocolates in silence.

¬†

He has every intention of following Moony‚Äôs advice. Really, he does. Except it turns out Regulus is almost constantly with people. Between classes. Between meals. At meals. He seems to specifically spend his time with Crouch and Rosier who, personally, James thinks are a particularly gross pair of companions to attach yourself to. But that‚Äôs none of his business.

He spends a lot of his time trying to figure out how to get Regulus on his own and comparably little time thinking about what he‚Äôs actually going to say. What he wants. Those questions are hard and twist his stomach up and if he thinks about them too long he loses his nerve. So he doesn‚Äôt. He ignores them. A time tested method that has served him well in the past.

In the meantime, he is back to being fully invested in party planning.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll get the booze from Rosmerta this weekend when we go into Hogsmeade,‚Äù he says, running down the todo list in front of him.

‚ÄúYou mean Padfoot will get the booze,‚Äù Peter doesn't quite manage to hide his bitterness.

Sirius, who had been lying on his back, turns over at that, propping his head up on his hand and grinning. ‚ÄúJealous Wormy?‚Äù

Peter blushes. ‚ÄúI told you, I don‚Äôt fancy her.‚Äù

James tries and fails to smother a snort, earning him a sharp glare from Peter. ‚ÄúWhat? I‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he holds his hands up in surrender, ‚Äúbut you do turn into a tomato every time her name is mentioned.‚Äù

‚ÄúListen, Pete, I can get you in there, she‚Äôs not a complicated woman.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius, really?‚Äù Remus asks flatly. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be a creep.‚Äù

James sees something flicker across Sirius‚Äôs face‚Äîlike hurt‚Äîbefore he‚Äôs able to mask it with a grin. ‚ÄúOnly trying to help.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight, okay,‚Äù James presses forward. ‚ÄúSo booze is accounted for, Hagrid is supplying us with a shit-ton of pumpkins, and I‚Äôm pretty sure I‚Äôve figured out how to charm the ceiling to flash with lightning and not drench us all in a torrential downpour.‚Äù

‚ÄúIs that why the sofas were so soggy the other day?‚Äù Peter asks.

‚ÄúNo comment. Moony, you‚Äôve got music covered?‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù

‚ÄúHey, uh,‚Äù Sirius sits up, running a hand nervously through his hair. Remus turns to him. ‚ÄúI have these‚Äîmy uncle, he sent me these records, I don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôd wanna take a look at them or‚Ä¶‚Äù he trails off, shrugging in a way that is oddly self-conscious. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôre really any good. I just thought, if you were looking for something new‚Ä¶‚Äù

Remus blinks, holding Sirius‚Äôs gaze. ‚ÄúYeah, I‚Äôd like that. Maybe you can show me latter?‚Äù

Sirius nods, a little overeager. ‚ÄúYeah cool, ‚Äòcourse.‚Äù

James‚Äôs eyes bounce between his two friends before going back to the list in front of him. ‚ÄúPete, you‚Äôre on snack duty.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna clean Honeydukes the-fuck-out.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat a boy,‚Äù James leans forward to punch him playfully in the arm. ‚ÄúThat just leaves‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOi, James?‚Äù

Marlene appears, leaning over the back of the sofa. ‚ÄúDo you have the plays we worked on yesterday? I was hoping to run over them,‚Äù her eyes spot the parchment in James‚Äôs hands and the three other boys around him. ‚ÄúOh, sorry. Am I interrupting a plotting session?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt plot,‚Äù Remus says indignantly.

‚ÄúWell, I mean,‚Äù Peter's head wobbles from side-to-side, ‚Äúwe do plot a little.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes, tossing the parchment in his hands to the side. ‚ÄúYeah Mar, just give me a sec, it‚Äôs upstairs.‚Äù

‚ÄúTrying to get on Frank‚Äôs good side?‚Äù he hears Sirius ask her as he heads for the stairs.

‚ÄúMore like I‚Äôm trying to make sure I don‚Äôt get shown up by your little brother.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a blessing really, that he‚Äôs already around the corner at that point, because he isn‚Äôt sure he manages to keep the grimace off his face.

So really, it‚Äôs Marlene‚Äôs fault that the first thing he does when he gets up to his room is grab the map, tapping it open on his bed and scanning for the familiar name. He‚Äôs expecting Regulus to be in his room by now, it‚Äôs‚Äîhalf past ten? Eleven? Maybe in the common room, with Crouch and Rosier.

Except he isn‚Äôt. Not in either of those places.

James feels his breath hitch slightly, eyes going to the astronomy tower, but he isn‚Äôt there either. Frank and Alice are though. James snorts. Good for them. He keeps looking, not sure where else Regulus could be. He runs over every inch of the castle before he sees him.

James taps the map closed, dropping to his knees to pull the invisibility cloak out from under his bed. He‚Äôll have to come up with some excuse to explain his disappearance to the others later, he has no idea what it‚Äôll be but he doesn‚Äôt bother trying to figure it out now.

Marlene is still talking to Sirius when he gets back downstairs, Remus reading while Pete goes over the party list. James slips out the portrait hole as a fifth year girl slips in.

It‚Äôs cold out, James didn‚Äôt think to grab a jumper. He stashes the cloak in a spot he knows by the whomping willow before jogging down to the quidditch pitch. He sees the snitch first. Tiny and gold, blinking in the moonlight and then‚Äîout of the dark‚ÄîRegulus. James walks onto the field, watching Regulus let the ball go again, watching him wait for it to speed away before he starts doing laps around the pitch. The absolute lunatic. James considers calling up but decides against it, instead he sits down on the grass and waits.

It‚Äôs incredible really, watching Regulus find his target even in the near pitch black. James only catches glimpses of him here and there, the rest of the time he blends in with the sky. Disappearing into the stars. Fitting, James thinks.

His stomach lurches a little when Regulus finally starts to come down, the calm that had washed over him while he‚Äôd been watching quickly falling away.

Regulus doesn‚Äôt see him at first, landing gracefully and pausing for a moment, looking at the snitch in his hands. James waits, wondering what it is that‚Äôs caught Regulus‚Äôs attention and then, watching as the other boy carefully slips the ball into his pocket.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe you‚Äôre stealing a snitch,‚Äù James says, stepping forward.

Regulus jerks around, hand going right for his wand like it had the night James surprised him in the tower. Always ready for an attack.

Even in the dim light James can see the surprise on Regulus‚Äôs face before he quickly locks it down. Expression becoming flat, unreadable. And he knows he should say something, now that they‚Äôre here, knows that that was the whole point of coming. But for a minute all he can do is stare‚ÄîRegulus is windswept, still breathing heavy from flying, his grey eyes filling with the moon.

Regulus drops his broom, arms crossing over his chest, same blank expression on his face. ‚ÄúLovely night for some queer bashing, huh?‚Äù

James physically rears back at that‚Äîat the spite that manages to bleed into Regulus‚Äôs voice despite his attempts to keep it level.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt take too long yeah? I have things to do. Oh, and if you could try not to get blood on my jumper I‚Äôd appreciate it. I‚Äôm quite fond of this one.‚Äù

James is still reeling. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äîdo you really think I would‚Äî‚Äú but then, then something else hits him. ‚ÄúHas someone done that to you?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs mask slips ever so slightly, and even though he pulls it back James still sees. Still knows what it means. His hands curling into fists.

‚ÄúWho?‚Äù the word is practically a snarl. Regulus doesn‚Äôt say anything, doesn‚Äôt move. ‚ÄúWho was it Reg,‚Äù he takes a step forward and that seems to wake Regulus up.

‚ÄúOh, leave off it,‚Äù he sounds irritated. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need you to defend my fucking honour Potter.‚Äù

Which isn‚Äôt nearly good enough. Because the idea that someone would‚Äîthat they had done that, to Regulus‚Äî

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù Regulus‚Äôs eyes run him up and down, sneering in a way that James hasn‚Äôt seen in a while. ‚ÄúNot here to mess me up then, just here to‚Ä¶what? Talk?‚Äù he says the last word with a great deal of contempt. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather the beating if I‚Äôm being honest.‚Äù James is still too busy trying to get his anger under control to come up with any kind of response to that. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll save you the trouble,‚Äù Regulus goes on, holding his hand out over his broom and summoning it into his palm without uttering a word. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not gay, you didn‚Äôt even touch me. You‚Äôre welcome. Now, if you don‚Äôt mind, I‚Äôm tired and I want to go to bed.‚Äù

The problem is, well, one of many James thinks, is that he‚Äôs not much of a planner. Sure, pranks and parties he does alright with. Though if he‚Äôs honest, that‚Äôs really Remus‚Äôs influence. James has always been more of a gut feeling kind of person. Act now, think later.

So you see, he isn‚Äôt thinking when he reaches out, frustrated with Regulus for walking away. Walking away again. For not giving him a second to breathe. Or think. Mostly he just wants him to wait. But he doesn‚Äôt have a plan. He isn‚Äôt thinking. He‚Äôs following his gut. So when Regulus stumbles back towards him he doesn‚Äôt know how his hands find their way to the other boy‚Äôs face, doesn‚Äôt remember deciding to move forward, to press into him. Lips crashing together.

This kiss is different. This time James feels all of it. Every inch of his body humming as Regulus opens his mouth and lets him inside. All James can think is yes.

Yes this.

Right here.

Stay right here.

Where I can keep you safe.

Regulus‚Äôs nose is cold but the rest of him is still so warm and James can feel it pouring into him, filling his chest. There are universes in this kiss. It is big. Gigantic. His hands slide into Regulus‚Äôs hair. He smells like fall. Like quidditch.

James barely registers it at first, the hand on his chest, flat and pushing, not hard but persistent. Stubborn. Eventually forcing a space between them that James doesn‚Äôt want. Their breathing fills the quiet, their heads bowed close but no longer touching. Regulus‚Äôs hand flat on his chest.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Regulus says, finally.

‚ÄúNo?‚Äù James instantly steps back.

Regulus shakes his head, reaching down and picking up his broom by hand this time. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not doing this.‚Äù He turns around and starts walking back towards the castle.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù James demands, following after. ‚ÄúYou started this!‚Äù

Regulus lets out a huff. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt, actually. You did. Forcing yourself uninvited and unwanted into my life. At least I was drunk, what the fuck is your excuse?‚Äù

James ignores that last question. ‚ÄúIf you didn‚Äôt want me there you would have gotten rid of me and you know it,‚Äù still to Regulus‚Äôs back.

‚ÄúI tried.‚Äù

‚ÄúBullocks.‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin, keep your voice down would you? I‚Äôd rather not have to deal with Filch catching us.‚Äù

Which, really, Regulus should have known was a mistake.

‚ÄúOh no, wouldn‚Äôt want to get in trouble, spoil that spotless record,‚Äù James purposefully raises his voice to a near shout. ‚ÄúIt would be terrible if someone were to look out here and see two STUDENTS OUT OF BED.‚Äù

‚ÄúShut up!‚Äù Regulus whips around, pulling James up short. ‚ÄúSalazar, what is it you want Potter?‚Äù

Which is an annoying and unfair question James thinks, because quite clearly he has no idea.

‚ÄúI want to talk.‚Äù

‚ÄúAbout?‚Äù Regulus demands, thoroughly exasperated.

James returns his tone. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know Reg, this, us, this‚Äîwhat happened in the tower. Listen, I‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Regulus says forcibly. ‚ÄúNo, see this, is exactly what I meant when I said I don‚Äôt want to do this.‚Äù

James falters for a moment. That Regulus hadn‚Äôt meant it‚Äîhadn‚Äôt meant to kiss him‚Äîhadn‚Äôt crossed James‚Äôs mind before now. Which he suddenly realizes is maybe a little self absorbed, because Regulus had been drunk. Except the look on his face afterwards had made James so sure...and then just now, the kiss just now. That kiss had been meant. On both sides. He's certain. Almost. Mostly. Maybe...

‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú he drags a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt want‚Äîsorry, I should have asked before I just‚Äî‚Äù his heart is doing this weird thing where it stops every time he tries to get a word out.

And for a second Regulus seems to soften. ‚ÄúOh honestly, bloody Gryffindors. I‚Äôm not‚Äîthat‚Äôs not what I‚Äôm saying.‚Äù James just looks at him, not trusting himself to speak. ‚ÄúReally James, what do you want? What were you hoping to accomplish here?‚Äù

James sighs. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know.‚Äù

‚ÄúBrilliant.‚Äù

‚ÄúListen, you ask a lot of questions for someone who doesn‚Äôt give a lot of answers Reg.‚Äù

Surprisingly, the younger boy seems to accept that. Grey eyes intent on James. ‚ÄúHow do you think this goes Potter? You think we‚Äôre‚Äîwhat? Gonna walk down the corridor holding hands? Snog in the library?‚Äù

James‚Äôs chest aches. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, sure, if that‚Äôs what you want.‚Äù

Regulus stares back at him, blinking before a cold laugh bursts out of him. ‚ÄúJesus Christ,‚Äù he turns away from James but doesn‚Äôt start walking again, broom forgotten on the ground as he brings his hands up to his face. They stand there for a minute, just like that, James entirely unsure of what to do with that reaction. ‚ÄúYou know what your problem is?‚Äù Regulus says finally, turning back around. ‚ÄúNobody has really fucked you up yet, and they‚Äôre going to, one day, but it‚Äôs not going to be me. I don‚Äôt want that job, give it to someone else.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú but he‚Äôs on a roll now.

‚ÄúHave you even considered how people would react‚Äîhow absolutely absurd everything I just suggested is? Have you thought about - fuck, I don‚Äôt know - your parents?‚Äù

Which takes James by surprise because no, he hasn‚Äôt. Not at all.

‚ÄúI know, I know, they‚Äôre perfect and lovely and selfless, but they‚Äôre still purebloods, still from old families, and you are their only son. You really think they‚Äôll be okay with you being a poof? Or,‚Äù he laughs again, all twisted and sharp, ‚Äúor my brother, who may have disagreed with our parents on many things but not this.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú James tries again, stepping closer, not entirely sure that Regulus is taking full breaths between his words.

‚ÄúWhich is to say nothing of the fact that the boy you have chosen to fuck everyone off over is me.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs wrong with you?‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt think about it, of course he doesn‚Äôt, the words just coming out him. Because he means them. But for some reason those are the words that break through, the words that get Regulus to slow down for one bloody second. Not that they do anything to soften the hard look in his eyes.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt act dumb James,‚Äù he says finally, sounding tired. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs beneath you.‚Äù

James shakes his head, taking in a shaky breath. ‚ÄúLook, you‚Äôre right, I haven‚Äôt thought about‚Ä¶any of that.‚Äù

Regulus exhales, looking about ready to bolt again so James talks fast.

‚ÄúI just thought‚Äîlisten, you want to know what I want? I want to talk to you, not just right now, but all the time. I‚ÄîI miss you. I miss talking to you. I haven‚Äôt been sleeping,‚Äù James admits, and when Regulus looks at him questioningly he explains: ‚ÄúI have these‚Ä¶nightmares. But you, I don‚Äôt know, being around you, it made me feel okay again, it made me feel‚Äîfuck, safe? And you‚Äôre right, my life has been easy, I know that. But I‚Äôve seen enough to understand that good things are rare. And you‚Äôre,‚Äù he looks at him, trying to lay all the thoughts he can‚Äôt articulate bare in the space between them. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre good Reg.‚Äù

The other boy just stares back at him, eyes wide, and James feels like his chest is going to burst open, his ribs aching in his skin.

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThink about it, okay?‚Äù James cuts him off, too afraid of how sad he sounds. ‚ÄúCome to the astronomy tower tomorrow night.‚Äù

Regulus is impossibly still, a deer in the headlights, looking at James like he‚Äôs never seen him before. James swallows with difficulty. He‚Äôs too much, he knows he is, always has been.

Slowly, Regulus nods.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù James exhales, mostly speaking to himself. ‚ÄúOkay, good.‚Äù

This time, when Regulus starts walking away, James doesn‚Äôt try to stop him.

The wind feels colder now, James shivering as he wraps his arms across his chest. He wonders if everything will feel colder now. After Regulus.

¬†

The next day is a bit of a blur. James doesn‚Äôt get much sleep but thats par for the course at this point. He looks for Regulus at breakfast but doesn‚Äôt see him. Marlene gives him shit about not coming back with the plays, and Sirius demands a full explanation.

‚ÄúJust needed some fresh air.‚Äù

‚ÄúFresh air? Is that some kind of euphemism I‚Äôm not aware of?‚Äù

James just shrugs, doing his best not to meet Remus‚Äôs knowing stare.

‚ÄúProngs‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHey, Sirius, don‚Äôt you have to show me those records your uncle sent you?‚Äù

James sends out a silent thanks to the universe for Remus bloody Lupin.

He drags himself from class to class all day, retreating to his room when it‚Äôs over and doing his best not to absolutely lose it.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù Peter comes up at one point, James is lying on his bed, tossing his snitch up and down, curtains drawn. ‚ÄúYou‚Äîuh‚Äîyou okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúFine. Not feeling well.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh‚Äîokay, do want something or‚Ä¶?‚Äù

‚ÄúI just want to sleep.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight, right, yeah okay.‚Äù

He listens as the door closes, then grabs the invisibility cloak and heads for the tower.

¬†

He waits facing the door, elbows on his knees, hands clasped. He should have brought something to do‚Äîto distract him. Not that anything could have. Still.

It‚Äôll be okay, if Regulus doesn‚Äôt come. It will. Better actually, probably. So. His knees bob up and down impatiently as he runs over every stupid thing he said the night before and every stupid thing he didn‚Äôt say but absolutely should have. He doesn‚Äôt know how he‚Äôs got himself here or how something he didn‚Äôt even know he wanted a week ago now feels so‚Äîso important.

He sighs, dropping his head into his hands and pulling at his hair. Fuck, he thinks, fuck, he‚Äôs not coming is he? But that‚Äôs okay, he reminds himself. Better even.

It‚Äôs pathetic, how quickly his head snaps up when he finally hears the door open, how instantly he fills with warmth at the sight of Regulus - stiff and uncomfortable, but here. So very here. James feels himself still for the first time all day. Because at least if he‚Äôs here they can‚Äîthey can deal with this. At least if he‚Äôs here then James isn‚Äôt in this on his own.

It‚Äôs several moments before Regulus clears his throat, still standing at the door, eyeing James warily. ‚ÄúNo one can know.‚Äù

James blinks, trying to catch up. ‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he says slowly.

‚ÄúI mean it,‚Äù Regulus pushes on. ‚ÄúNot my brother, not Lupin, not Pettigrew. We - whatever we do here, whatever this is - nobody knows.‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúOkay. Nobody knows.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt say anything else, just keeps standing across the tower, looking like he‚Äôs ready to run.

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù James says eventually, voice soft, a smile pulling at the corner of his mouth. ‚ÄúC‚Äômere.‚Äù

It takes him a minute, so much going on behind those eyes, but eventually, eventually he moves forward. Stiff and overly studied, like he was when he was drunk. Thinking too much. Trying too hard.

He stops in front of James, grey eyes even more intense up close. And James honestly doesn‚Äôt know where he gets the gaul, but he reaches up and hooks his fingers through Regulus‚Äôs belt loops, tugging him forward. He doesn‚Äôt really think Regulus will do it, doesn‚Äôt think he‚Äôll follow. But he does. Sliding onto James‚Äôs lap, and‚Äîoh, oh James likes that. Aloof, proper Regulus in his lap. He runs his hands up his back, coming to hold his face, thumbs brushing his cheeks. And he sees it then, this close, sees the fear and uncertainty and softness that Regulus is always trying so hard to hide.

‚ÄúThere you are,‚Äù he says, almost a whisper, before pulling lightly on Regulus‚Äôs hair, exposing his neck. He leans in and presses his mouth to the delicate skin, feeling Regulus‚Äôs pulse race as a breath punches out of him.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to be insufferable aren‚Äôt you?‚Äù Regulus says. James feels the words vibrate against his mouth.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù he says between kisses. ‚ÄúGod yes.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Now if only Remus and Sirius could get it together, amiright?

As always thanks so much for your comments! Always interested to know what you guys think!

Chapter 6

Chapter Summary

It is a well known fact that high school parties are always very chill and drama free.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

‚ÄúHoly shit James,‚Äù Abbott practically crashes into him when they land back on the ground, slapping his back as Alice comes from behind and messes up his hair. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen anyone fly like that!‚Äù Abbott gushes. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to destroy Ravenclaw!‚Äù

‚ÄúYou did good kiddo,‚Äù Alice smiles, the rest of the team landing around them.

James just grins, big and toothy, a little breathless from the fly. Sirius rolls up beside him, knocking their shoulders together. ‚ÄúI give you a six out of ten, not enough showmanship for my taste.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre enough of a showman for the rest of us Black,‚Äù Frank says, pushing his goggles to the top of his head. ‚ÄúOkay team, I‚Äôm feeling good about that practice‚ÄîMacdonald, tighten up your passes, Abbott, you still need to work on not projecting your blocks, and Potter?‚Äù

‚ÄúYessir?‚Äù James says, bringing his hand up to his forehead in a mock salute. The older boy rolls his eyes.

‚ÄúFly like that on Saturday and I‚Äôll take back everything bad I‚Äôve ever said about you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWait, what have you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHit the showers everybody. I expect you back on this pitch at six tomorrow morning.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut what have you said‚Äî‚Äú the team disperses, Frank walking away like James isn‚Äôt very clearly speaking to him. ‚ÄúAlice?‚Äù he turns to the older girl pleadingly, but she only smiles, clicking her tongue.

‚ÄúSorry James, my lips are sealed.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh really, cause that‚Äôs not what I‚Äîow,‚Äù Sirius cuts off as she smacks the back of his head on her way to the locker room.

‚ÄúMerlin,‚Äù Sirius stares after her. ‚ÄúI love that woman.‚Äù

James makes a juvenile snort, patting his friend on the back. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs out of your league mate.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt I know it.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi, Black!‚Äù

They both turn towards Mary, who is currently leaning against the entrance to the field, crooking her finger in a come-hither motion.

‚ÄúThink she means me?‚Äù James asks, earning him an elbow to the side.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll catch you later, yeah?‚Äù Sirius jogs backwards towards her, still facing James.

‚ÄúYou better not be late you prat, we have a party to prepare for!‚Äù

‚ÄúYes mum,‚Äù he says with a cheeky grin.

James rolls his eyes, smiling despite himself. ‚ÄúWanker,‚Äù he whispers under his breath, as he heads towards the locker room.

‚ÄúYou seem in high spirits.‚Äù

James looks over, surprised to find Marlene falling into step with him.

‚ÄúIt was a good practice,‚Äù he shrugs.

‚ÄúUh-huh.‚Äù

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúWhy do you look like you‚Äôre plotting my death McKinnon?‚Äù

‚ÄúI just feel like you‚Äôve been awfully chipper the last few days. ‚Äú

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a very upbeat person, it‚Äôs one of my many excellent qualities.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne might even say you‚Äôre glowing.‚Äù

‚ÄúI do have great skin.‚Äù

Marlene laughs, punching him in the arm. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to figure it out, you know.‚Äù

‚ÄúFigure it out?‚Äù James asks. ‚ÄúYou mean the secret to my great skin? Sorry, but that‚Äôs all genetics baby.‚Äù

But Marlene will not be deterred, eyes wide and bright the way they get when she spots the snitch. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not in Gryffindor, I know that much.‚Äù

James lets out something between a sigh and a laugh, running a hand through his sweaty hair. ‚ÄúMarlene, I told you, there‚Äôs no girl.‚Äù

‚ÄúSure there isn‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúMarlene.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames.‚Äù

He shakes his head. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a menace, you know that?‚Äù

‚ÄúPretty sure that's a compliment coming from you.‚Äù

He can‚Äôt help but grin, ‚ÄúIt is.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know,‚Äù Marlene leans into him, a strand of hair slipping out from behind her ear. ‚ÄúYou could also just tell me, seeing as we‚Äôre mates.‚Äù

For some reason that hits too close to home, his eyes going briefly back to the spot where his best friend is still talking to his girlfriend. He does want to tell them - his mates. It would help, he thinks, help it feel real. He still isn‚Äôt entirely sure that he didn‚Äôt make it all up. Because it‚Äôs mad, him and Regulus. Brilliant, but mad.

James swallows with difficulty. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs nothing to tell Mar.‚Äù

She runs him over in a way that makes him feel exposed. ‚ÄúIf you say so.‚Äù

¬†

James loves parties. He knows for some people they‚Äôre too much‚Äîthe crowds, the noise‚Äîbut he loves it. Every part of it. He loves the start, when everything is set up and he can‚Äôt sit still, thrumming with adrenaline and the beginning of a buzz, wondering what kind of night it‚Äôs going to be. He loves it when the first people arrive and everything is chill and quiet. He loves it in the middle, when you can barely move and you‚Äôre a bit too drunk and everything is so sweaty that‚Äôs it‚Äôs blurring together, like the world is painted in water colours. He loves the end, when you can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs the exhaustion or the alcohol that‚Äôs making you fuzzy, the sky slowly growing brighter.

‚ÄúOi! Pete, turn it up!‚Äù Sirius shouts from where he‚Äôs squashed himself between James and Remus.

It‚Äôs just starting to transition into that middle period‚Äîthe room packed and everyone tipsy. James tilts his condensation covered bottle back into his mouth, feeling the satisfying burn as it runs down his throat.

‚ÄúOh, don‚Äôt tell him to touch my record player,‚Äù Remus says, straining his neck in an attempt to see between the crowd that separates him from his music.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be fine,‚Äù Sirius waves his hand dismissively.

‚ÄúOh will it,‚Äù Remus asks bitterly. ‚ÄúDo you not remember what happened last time?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause before Sirius lets out a short bark of a laughter. ‚ÄúOh God‚Äîdidn‚Äôt he set it on fire?‚Äù

James snorts beer out of his nose. ‚ÄúI forgot about that!‚Äù

Remus doesn‚Äôt look particularly happy with either of them. ‚ÄúThank God Lily was there to put the bloody thing out.‚Äù

James still feels his heart hitch a little at the mention of her name, but it‚Äôs not like it used to be.

‚ÄúAh yes,‚Äù Sirius says, taking a fairly substantial gulp of his drink. His eyes have started to go a bit hazy. ‚ÄúWhere is the fair lady of Gryffindor?‚Äù

James shrugs. ‚ÄúDunno, haven‚Äôt seen her in ages.‚Äù

He feels, as much as he sees, his two friends turn towards him. He stares back blankly.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

There‚Äôs another beat of silence before Remus seems to shake himself awake. ‚ÄúNothing, just‚Ä¶well‚Ä¶usually you know.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know?‚Äù

James rolls eyes. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre being dramatic.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶‚Äù Remus starts.

‚ÄúOh okay, the both of you can fuck right off then.‚Äù

Something heavy fills the pit of James‚Äôs stomach, ‚ÄúMmm,‚Äù he mutters noncommittally, trying not to think about Regulus‚Äôs eyes, or his hands, or‚Äîmerlin‚Äîhis mouth.

‚ÄúOh!‚Äù Sirius snaps his fingers suddenly, which James can only assume is a bad sign. ‚ÄúWhat about Marlene? She‚Äôs been flirting with you loads recently.‚Äù

James tries not to laugh. ‚ÄúMarlene is a mate, and no she hasn‚Äôt.‚Äù

If James had thought Remus looked panicked before it was nothing compared to now. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre in the right frame of mind to handle this.‚Äù

Remus and James exchange another look before James sits down.

This clears absolutely nothing up for James. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he pinches the bridge of his nose. ‚ÄúSo you two‚Ä¶broke up?‚Äù

Sirius shrugs. ‚ÄúSure, I suppose. I mean, it was just convenience really, the two us.‚Äù

‚ÄúConvenience?‚Äù Remus asks, looking just as confused as James feels.

Sirius nods. ‚ÄúShe was around, I was around, so we just decided to‚Ä¶be around together? It was fun, casual, no big feelings or anything. You know how it is.‚Äù

James thinks about Regulus‚Äîon the quidditch pitch, in the tower‚Äîthinks about the way that he laughs when he can‚Äôt hold it back any longer, or the way his eyes get bright when he‚Äôs excited, or the way he tastes.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt know how it is. He says it without thinking, which would have been embarrassing if Remus hadn‚Äôt said it at nearly the exact same time.

Sirius‚Äôs brow raises as he looks between the two of them, before smiling and shaking his head. ‚ÄúBloody pair of poofs you two are.‚Äù

It‚Äôs work to keep his face neutral, breath catching in his chest. Which is stupid, because he‚Äôs heard it hundreds of times before. It‚Äôs not like it matters. Still, he finds it suddenly hard to meet his friend‚Äôs gaze.

‚ÄúNice one Black,‚Äù Remus says coldly, getting to his feet and pushing into the crowd.

‚ÄúOi‚Äîwait, Remus! C‚Äômon, I was kidding around!‚Äù

It‚Äôs too late though, the room is full and loud and Remus is lost in seconds. Sirius sighs, sinking a little ways down the wall.

‚ÄúWhy does it feel like everything I say just pisses him off?‚Äù Sirius rolls his head to look at James who prays his voice doesn‚Äôt come out as strained as it feels.

‚ÄúProbably because it does.‚Äù

Sirius huffs before finishing his drink.

They sit without talking, the noise of the party swallowing them whole. It‚Äôs hard to get the voice in James‚Äôs head to shut up, the one that says that Sirius will never forgive him. And that maybe that‚Äôs not just because it‚Äôs Regulus he‚Äôs been sneaking around with, maybe it‚Äôs because‚Äî

He shakes his head.

No.

He knows his best friend.

Whatever Regulus says. James knows Sirius.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna get some more to drink,‚Äù he announces suddenly, and when he doesn‚Äôt get a response he looks over to see that Sirius is currently preoccupied, glaring at Moony whose across the room now, talking to Dorcas.

‚ÄúDo you think he fancies her?‚Äù Sirius asks, words brittle.

James blinks, looking from Sirius to Remus and back again, feeling as though he‚Äôs missed something.

‚ÄúEr‚Ä¶dunno? Might I guess.‚Äù

Sirius doesn‚Äôt respond, but the glaring intensifies.

Sirius turns to him, blinking through the haze of alcohol. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

James nods towards Remus. ‚ÄúYou could just talk to him.‚Äù

Sirius plays with the cup in his hand, biting at his lower lip. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says eventually, ‚Äúyeah maybe.‚Äù

James claps him on the shoulder. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be back.‚Äù

But he doesn‚Äôt head over to the wide selection of drinks curtesy of his allowance money and Sirius‚Äôs flirting abilities. Instead he takes the stairs two at a time‚Äîa risk in his current condition‚Äîstumbling his way to the bedroom.

As soon as the door closes behind him the world feels too quiet, a buzzing in James‚Äôs ears he hadn‚Äôt noticed before. He can feel the sweat on his skin more now that he‚Äôs not surrounded by people‚Äîpulling his glasses off and wiping away the condensation. Not that the world isn‚Äôt still blurry when he puts them back on.

He trips over Sirius trainers on his way to the bedside table, grabbing the map and then promptly collapsing onto his bed.

There‚Äôs no reason for Regulus to be anywhere but in his own bedroom. Anywhere that James can reach him. But he checks anyway, suddenly feeling restless with the need to see him. To touch him. Because he can do that now, which is a bit mind blowing if James is being honest. And terrifying.

He bites back a smile at the sight of Regulus‚Äôs name in the astronomy tower.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù he says softly, and then laughs because jeez, he must be pissed if he‚Äôs talking to the bloody map. He lingers on the letters for too long before shaking himself awake again.

He doesn‚Äôt bother with the invisibility cloak, no one will notice him slipping out at this point in the night. He throws the map back into its drawer and tears out the door so fast he nearly tramples the person sitting on the stairs.

‚ÄúOh shit,‚Äù he stumbles, grabbing hold of the wall‚Äîhis balance not at its best.

‚ÄúSorry, I didn‚Äôt realize anyone was up there or I would‚Äôve moved.‚Äù

James blinks, it‚Äôs a bit dark in the stairwell, the warm light of the common room not quite reaching them. Of course, even in the shadows that red hair is unmistakable.

‚ÄúLily?‚Äù James asks, which is stupid because it‚Äôs clearly Lily.

‚ÄúThat is my name,‚Äù her voice is scratchy, like it‚Äôs been warn out. Normally he would assume it was from the booze but then he sees her wipe at her face with the sleeve of her shirt.

‚ÄúHey?‚Äù James sinks onto the step beside her.

She laughs dryly. ‚ÄúWhat a clich√© right? Crying in the middle of a party over‚Äîwell, anyway.‚Äù

James feels significantly out of his element, the bass of the music below them rumbling in his chest.

‚ÄúYou okay?‚Äù he finds himself asking, another stupid question, with another stupidly clear answer.

‚ÄúGood. Besides, if they‚Äôre boning anywhere it‚Äôs in the prefects washroom, honestly Potter.‚Äù

‚ÄúLay it on me.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Severus.‚Äù

And though James personally finds Snape very easy to hate, he can understand what she‚Äôs saying, at least in theory

‚ÄúHe said what about Remus?‚Äù James‚Äôs voice is suddenly hard.

Lily rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúOh leave it, I went off on him already, put him in his bloody place and he apologized but‚Äîbut the fact that he said it at all‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat did he say Evans?‚Äù

She narrows her eyes at his tone. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not telling you Potter, in case I didn‚Äôt already make that abundantly clear.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs my mate,‚Äù James practically growls.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs my mate too, actually.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot the same way,‚Äù because honestly, the fact that Lily thinks they can even compare their relationships is laughable to James. ‚ÄúBesides, if you were really his mate you‚Äôd stop hanging out with Severus fucking Snape.‚Äù

At that her expression hardens, and if he hadn‚Äôt been angry‚Äîand drunk‚ÄîJames probably would have regretted it. But he doesn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like you haven‚Äôt listened to anything I‚Äôve said.‚Äù

‚ÄúI listened,‚Äù James says shortly. ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the thing Lily, your mate is awful. He‚Äôs awful to pretty well everyone except for you. He‚Äôs not just rude or‚Äîwhat is it you said? Oh yeah‚Äîpetty. He‚Äôs a bloody bigot. And what I heard you say just now is that you know that. So Gryffindor the fuck up and walk away from him already. Because him apologizing to you isn‚Äôt good enough anymore‚Äîit isn‚Äôt fair. Not to Remus, or to any of your other friends he‚Äôs been attacking. I mean, fuck Lily, it‚Äôs not even fair to you.‚Äù

Lily‚Äôs eyes are wide, the colour unreal as she stares at him speechless, and suddenly James feels exhausted. Exhausted by this conversation and by Snape and all the things that they aren‚Äôt saying. Petty wasn‚Äôt the right word for what Snape is, but neither was bigot. They have a name now.

James sighs, running a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he says, though he‚Äôs not entirely sure what he‚Äôs apologizing for, he‚Äôs just desperate to get away‚Äîfrom the noise and the heat and her. Her more than the rest of it. ‚ÄúI gotta go.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

There was a time when Lily calling out to him‚Äîsaying his first name‚Äîwould have stopped him in his tracks. But it‚Äôs not now. He‚Äôs already down the stairs and he doesn‚Äôt turn back.

¬†

Reg is reading when James finally gets to him, he pauses at the door, just watching for a moment, feeling the fingers of Regulus‚Äôs warming charm drifting over him. Some of the anger from his conversation with Lily starts to fade and when Regulus looks up, his grey eyes instantly finding James, he forgets about it all together.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you have a party to be hosting?‚Äù the younger boy asks, marking his page as he slides the book off his lap.

‚ÄúMm,‚Äù James says noncommittally, ‚Äúthey‚Äôll survive without me. Besides, I couldn‚Äôt leave you up here waiting for me all night.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt waiting for you.‚Äù

‚ÄúSure you weren‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf that‚Äôs what you need to tell yourself,‚Äù James pushes off the wall, the world around him a little fuzzy. Regulus is wearing a dark blue jumper, which is a weird thing to notice except that usually he‚Äôs in black‚Äîor green‚Äîbut this feels so much more natural somehow.

When James reaches him he runs his fingers along the collar, feeling the soft cotton between his fingers.

Regulus arches his brow.

‚ÄúColour looks good on you,‚Äù James says.

‚ÄúColour? Not very specific,‚Äù Regulus is unable to keep the amusement out of his voice.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James agrees, ‚Äústill true though. I‚Äôve only seen blue and green but both have been aces so, I‚Äôm sure the rest look just as good.‚Äù

Regulus snorts. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre drunk.‚Äù

‚ÄúVery much, yes.‚Äù

His hand moves from the collar of Regulus‚Äôs shirt up his neck to his jaw, James‚Äôs thumb running along Regulus‚Äôs lower lip.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he says, voice a little huskier, sending a chill along James's spine, his eyes intently on Regulus‚Äôs mouth, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre drunk.‚Äù

‚ÄúMmm,‚Äù James hums again. He‚Äôs learned a lot about Regulus recently, specifically about how he likes to be touched‚Äîwhich is slowly. He wants to see you, to know where you are. To know when you‚Äôre coming. So James makes an effort to broadcast his movements at all times. He doesn‚Äôt mind, even likes it‚Äîhow intentional it all is.

Slowly, he lowers himself to his knees, Regulus opening his thighs for him almost automatically so that James can press forward, hand still on Reg‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he says again, but whatever else was going to come out of his mouth is swallowed by James‚Äôs lips.

He is a tad sloppier than usual, his whole body aching at the contact.

‚ÄúThis is all we‚Äôre doing,‚Äù Regulus says against him.

James makes a noise of protest and quickly finds Regulus‚Äôs hands on his shoulders, pushing him back.

‚ÄúI mean it James, this is it.‚Äù

James huffs. ‚ÄúYeah, okay, okay. I‚Äôm not even that drunk,‚Äù he mutters feeling Regulus‚Äôs smile as they come together again.

‚ÄúIt took you ten minutes to figure out how to open the door.‚Äù

James laughs into his mouth, pulling back slightly. ‚ÄúBold of you to assume I can open a door sober.‚Äù

It‚Äôs Regulus‚Äôs turn to laugh and James eats it up, tongue lapping into his mouth, hungry for every piece.

For all his whining he‚Äôs more than happy with this‚Äîwith the warmth of Regulus‚Äôs hands as they skate over his back, his chest, pulling at the hem of his shirt in search of skin. Regulus tastes like something sweet, his legs tightening around James, like he‚Äôs afraid he‚Äôs going to move. As if he would.

Regulus‚Äôs pulls back from James‚Äôs mouth and kisses along his jaw, down to his neck, meeting his collarbone. It all makes James groan.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre gorgeous, you know that?‚Äù he says when Regulus‚Äôs face is once again level with his. For a second their foreheads rest against one another.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre drunk.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James‚Äôs hand moves to the back of Regulus‚Äôs neck, holding it carefully, ‚Äúbut it‚Äôd still be true if I was sober.‚Äù

This time, when Regulus kisses him, he sinks his teeth in, ripping a sound out of James he‚Äôs never heard himself make before.

‚ÄúGod Reg‚Äî‚Äú he wants to be closer. Somehow. Impossibly. He wants to feel every inch of him. Wants to‚Äî

‚ÄúI knew it!‚Äù

It takes a second for James‚Äôs intoxicated, and very preoccupied brain, to fully comprehend that that voice belongs to neither himself nor Regulus. It takes Regulus significantly less time, his mouth ripping away from James, his whole body going still in a way that is incredibly disconcerting.

‚ÄúOh‚Äîoh fuck,‚Äù the voice says again.

‚ÄúMarlene?‚Äù

James, who is still on his knees between Regulus‚Äôs legs, turns towards the door to find a white faced Marlene standing there, hands clasped to her mouth, head shaking back and forth.

Oh. James thinks. Oh this is‚Ä¶not‚Ä¶ideal.

Regulus, apparently no longer frozen, is suddenly on his feet, stepping around James with his wand raised and pointed at Marlene‚Äôs chest.

‚ÄúIf you breathe a fucking word of this I will‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú James scrambles to his feet attempting to get between them.

‚Äú‚Äîhurt you in ways you cannot possibly imagine. Do you understand?‚Äù

‚ÄúOi! Jesus,‚Äù James steps in front of Marlene hands raised as he meets Regulus‚Äôs stone cold stare. Gone is the soft boy he‚Äôd been wrapped up in only seconds earlier‚Äîhis mouth still red from James‚Äôs lips, hair still mussed from his hand‚Äîthe person in front of him is all sharp edges.

‚ÄúReg, put that away,‚Äù James swats at his wand but Regulus quickly steps out of his reach. There is something feral about Regulus, like a wild animal who's just been backed into a corner. ‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù James repeats louder, ‚Äúput the wand down. Now.‚Äù

For a second he thinks Regulus might actually curse him, which‚Äîwell, James doesn‚Äôt know what he‚Äôd do with that‚Äîbut after a few more intense moments of staring Regulus lowers his wand.

James exhales, turning to Marlene who still looks thoroughly freaked out. ‚ÄúMar,‚Äù James nods towards the door, ‚Äúlets talk, yeah?‚Äù

She nods, understanding immediately and moving towards the door.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll be back,‚Äù James says to Regulus and when he doesn‚Äôt get a response he pauses, halfway through the door. ‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he waits until grey eyes meet his. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm coming back okay? Just‚Äîwait here yeah? Please?‚Äù

It‚Äôs small and stiff, but eventual Regulus nods, James‚Äôs chest aching at the blank look on his face.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he‚Äôs barely taken two steps into the stairwell before Marlene is on him, hands grabbing hold of both of his arms. ‚ÄúJames I‚Äôm so sorry, that was so stupid of me I don‚Äôt know what I was thinking‚ÄîI‚Äôve been drinking and then I saw you sneak off and I just‚Äîmy stupid brain thought it would be funny. I didn‚Äôt think‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt think‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúWoah, okay, I‚Äôm going to need you to breathe, alright?‚Äù he ducks his head so he can meet her eyes.

She nods, taking in a deep breath and letting it go shakily. ‚ÄúShit, shit,‚Äù she looks at James again. ‚ÄúJames, that was Regulus Black.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James‚Äôs chest gives a small squeeze at the look on her face, her eyes the size of dinner plates.

‚ÄúDoes Sirius know?‚Äù

The ache grows. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúShit,‚Äù she shakes her head again. ‚ÄúShit James, he pulled his wand on me.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, I know, he does that.‚Äù

She lets out an outraged noise. ‚ÄúHe threatens you!?‚Äù

James feels a small swelling of warmth at the sudden protectiveness in her eyes.

‚ÄúNo, no that‚Äôs not what I meant. He‚Äôs just‚Äîhe‚Äôs jumpy.‚Äù

Marlene looks like she doesn‚Äôt quite believe him. ‚ÄúThis‚ÄîGod James, I did not see this coming when I guessed you were wooing someone.‚Äù

James wrinkles his nose, ‚ÄúStill not a fan of the term wooing‚Äîand believe me, the feeling is mutual. It just sort of‚Ä¶happened.‚Äù

She lets out a low whistle.

‚ÄúYeah, listen, Mar? You can‚Äôt‚Äîyou can‚Äôt tell anyone about this, okay?‚Äù

Though James wouldn‚Äôt have thought it possible, her eyes get bigger. ‚ÄúNo‚Äîno I won‚Äôt, of course I won‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúThanks I‚ÄîI appreciate it,‚Äù he offers her a weak smile before nodding over his shoulder. ‚ÄúI should‚Äîer‚Äîgo make sure he‚Äôs okay.‚Äù

She nods slowly, reluctantly letting go of him. ‚ÄúRight, yeah, of course.‚Äù She takes a few steps down the stairs before stopping. ‚ÄúI really am sorry James.‚Äù

But he waves her apology away. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine‚ÄîI‚Äôve done stupider things.‚Äù

He waits until she‚Äôs out of sight before he opens the door again.

Regulus is standing at the ledge, back to the door, arms stiff at his sides. The sight makes something in James‚Äôs stomach twist. They stay like that for too long, James not knowing what to say.

‚ÄúWell?‚Äù Regulus asks coldly, without turning around.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not going to tell anyone.‚Äù

Regulus scoffs. ‚ÄúAnd you know that how?‚Äù

‚ÄúShe said so.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat doesn‚Äôt mean anything James,‚Äù it sounds like he‚Äôs forcing the words between his teeth.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs my friend.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat doesn‚Äôt mean anything either.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt does to me,‚Äù James says simply. ‚ÄúIt does to her too‚ÄîReg, look me?‚Äù

He steps closer but not too close. He wants to reach out but he doesn‚Äôt.

It takes a while, but eventually Regulus faces him. It‚Äôs hard, to see the mask so firmly back in place. The walls so thick and high around him that James doesn‚Äôt know how he‚Äôs going to get back over them.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to let anything happen to you okay?‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt know where the words come from exactly, only that he wants to take some of the fear out of Regulus's eyes.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt make promises you can‚Äôt keep James.‚Äù

‚ÄúI won‚Äôt.‚Äù

Another moment passes before Regulus sighs, his shoulders sagging as he brings his hands up to scrub his face. ‚ÄúYou really believe that don‚Äôt you? Just like you believe you can trust McKinnon?‚Äù

‚ÄúI do and I can,‚Äù James says simply. Hoping, somehow, he‚Äôll be able to get Regulus to see‚Äîsee that he isn‚Äôt alone. That everyone isn‚Äôt trying to punish him.

Regulus drops his hands away from his face. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired,‚Äù is all he says.

James nods. ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù

Regulus grabs his book from the ledge, very determinedly not looking at James as he walks towards the door.

‚ÄúRegulus?‚Äù James calls to him before he can disappear, relieved when the younger boy actually stops. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you tomorrow yeah?‚Äù trying to keep the fear out of his voice.

Eventually Regulus‚Äôs eyes seem to find their way back to him. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he sounds worn through, ‚Äúyou‚Äôll see me tomorrow.‚Äù

And somehow that manages to take the edge off the sound of the door slamming closed.

Chapter End Notes

Hello lovelies,

This chapter is one of those where when I wrote it I was like "Wow, amazing **chef's kiss**" and then every time I've read it since I've liked it less and less, so hopefully it still turned out okay!

Thank you for the comments they make my day!

Chapter 7

Chapter Notes

TW injury

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Regulus is complicated. It isn‚Äôt that James is completely lost, he has been friends with Sirius since he was eleven. But it‚Äôs‚Ä¶different. Regulus does come back, the night after Halloween, but he brings the telescope and holds himself apart from James. They talk, it‚Äôs nice, but it‚Äôs‚Ä¶stilted. Regulus never lets either of them get too close, doesn‚Äôt laugh too loud, doesn‚Äôt say anything important.

James wants to talk about it‚Äîabout Marlene, about Regulus‚Äôs reaction, about how they can be more careful in the future. But he‚Äôs met with silence. With an unreadable expression. With empty eyes.

They don‚Äôt touch. Which is okay, except James doesn‚Äôt know what‚Äôs allowed here‚Äîwhat Regulus wants. Where the boundaries are. Regulus keeps coming back, just like always, he smiles at James and it feels like he means it. But he keeps the walls up and the mask on, and sometimes James feels like maybe they‚Äôre just good friends. Hell, maybe they‚Äôre just acquaintances. And that‚Äîthat hurts more than he would have expected.

It‚Äôs just‚Ä¶it had felt big. Whatever was happening between them. It had felt like standing on the precipice of something and now‚Ä¶now James is just‚Ä¶waiting.

¬†

‚ÄúAw, brilliant,‚Äù Sirius says as he tears into another package from his uncle. James doesn‚Äôt miss the way he carefully folds the accompanying letter and slips it into his pocket. He knows how much this means to Sirius, having someone that‚Äôs his. Knows that there‚Äôs part of him that wants to keep it that way, sharing some of it with the three of them but keeping the rest for himself.

‚ÄúMoony, verdict?‚Äù

Sirius turns the muggle record around so that Remus can see it on the other side of the table.

Remus looks up from his breakfast, smiling as much at Sirius‚Äôs excitement as he is at the record.

‚ÄúNo way‚ÄîI‚Äôve been looking for that Fleetwood album for ages!‚Äù

Sirius preens and James quickly ducks his head, trying to hide his own smile. He was worried at first, but so far it's been really good, this thing with his uncle. The impromptu pranking has certainly been on the decline. Which James is a fan of, if for no other reason than he hates being left out.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got a free period in the afternoon yeah? We can listen to it if you want?‚Äù

Remus blinks, forkful of egg missing his mouth, ‚ÄúAh‚Äîyeah, sure, yeah. We can do that.‚Äù

‚ÄúCool,‚Äù Sirius nods, eyes already back on the track list.

Without meaning to‚Äîor maybe completely meaning to‚ÄîJames finds himself searching the Slytherin table. Gaze stopping at the sight of dark curls and grey eyes. Regulus is sitting with Crouch and Rossier, smirking at something one of them said, looking every inch the Black prince he‚Äôs supposed to be. It‚Äôs hard sometimes, making the two versions of him fit together in James‚Äôs head. He‚Äôll see Regulus in the halls and he won‚Äôt even recognize him. It‚Äôs a bit frightening if he‚Äôs being honest.

‚ÄúMorning,‚Äù Lily slides into the seat beside James, jolting him out of his thoughts and nearly making him choke on his breakfast in the process.

All four Marauders turn to stare at her in mild shock as she starts filling up her plate.

Peter leans over towards Remus and very loudly whispers; ‚Äúhas James finally imperiused her?‚Äù

James scowls at him while Sirius barely keeps it together beside him.

‚ÄúProblem?‚Äù Lily asks, taking a bite of her toast like this is the most natural thing in the world.

While James knows for a fact that he hasn‚Äôt imperiused Lily, he is not at all certain that somebody else hasn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúOf course not,‚Äù Remus jumps in when the rest of them continue to stare at her like she‚Äôs the Giant Squid and not a girl they‚Äôve had classes with for the past five years. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôre you doing with the potions revising by the way?‚Äù Remus presses on as he starts cutting up his bacon again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been meaning to ask if you‚Äôre free for a study session this week?‚Äù

Lily nods, chewing thoughtfully. ‚ÄúI can probably do Thursday at lunch?‚Äù

‚ÄúBrilliant.‚Äù

The rest of them slowly go back to their breakfasts as well, except for Peter, whose eyes have grown to about twice their normal size as they bounce between James and Lily.

‚ÄúAlright Potter?‚Äù Lily asks after a few minutes of awkward silence.

James almost laughs. ‚ÄúYeah, I‚Äôm alright. What about you, hit your head recently? Drink any funny tasting pumpkin juice?‚Äù

Lily rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need to sustain a brain injury to want to sit with you at breakfast.‚Äù

Now James really does laugh. ‚ÄúI think that might be the nicest thing you‚Äôve ever said to me.‚Äù

A crease forms between her eyes and she frowns. ‚ÄúIs that really the nicest thing I‚Äôve ever said to you?‚Äù

‚ÄúLily, I‚Äôm joking.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre you?‚Äù

James sighs, running a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúWell, to be fair to you, I haven‚Äôt really given you a lot of opportunities to be nice have I?‚Äù

Lily continues to frown, poking at the food on her plate before speaking again; ‚ÄúI think I got so used to you being‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúAn arrogant toerag?‚Äù Sirius supplies from James‚Äôs other side. James elbows him in the ribs.

‚ÄúOof,‚Äù Sirius grins through the pain.

‚ÄúSure,‚Äù Lily smiles despite herself. ‚ÄúI was so used to you being an arrogant toerag that I didn‚Äôt realize when you stopped.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs stopped? James, you should have told us! I had business cards made up and everything.‚Äù

James turns to glare at Sirius. ‚ÄúYou can leave you know?‚Äù

‚ÄúCould yeah, probably won‚Äôt though.‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù James returns his attention to Lily. ‚ÄúYou were just singing my praises.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot sure that‚Äôs what she was doing,‚Äù Remus says, looking entirely too amused by the whole situation.

‚ÄúI mean,‚Äù Pete scratches the back of his head, ‚Äúpretty close though, for them at least.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just trying to say,‚Äù Lily is clearly enjoying herself. ‚ÄúThat what you said the other night, it was pretty spot on.‚Äù

James smiles, though he has to admit that this was not exactly how he was expecting Lily to react to him telling her off. ‚ÄúTold you I could do complicated,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúYou did. So I thought, maybe,‚Äù she trails off, shrugging. ‚ÄúWell, Marlene is really rather fond of you, and so‚Äôs Mary and Remus‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still on the fence about him personally,‚Äù Sirius pipes up.

‚ÄúLiterally no one asked you.‚Äù

‚ÄúI thought,‚Äù Lily continues, ignoring them, ‚Äúwe could try to be, y‚Äôknow, mates?‚Äù

James can feel the shock on his own face. ‚ÄúI‚Äîyeah, yeah okay. Mates sounds good.‚Äù

Lily nods. ‚ÄúGood.‚Äù

None of them seem to know what to do then, all sitting awkwardly staring at one another.

‚ÄúShould we shake on it?‚Äù James asks with a grin, attempting to fill the silence.

Lily laughs, which he has to admit, is rather satisfying.

‚ÄúDo you start all your friendships like business deals?‚Äù

He shrugs. ‚ÄúJust feels more official that way.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, in that case, you‚Äôve convinced me,‚Äù Lily holds out her hand and James takes it, feeling a small part of him shiver at the contact.

‚ÄúWow,‚Äù Peter says from across the table. ‚ÄúI really, honestly, never saw this coming.‚Äù

Remus, however, is looking very smug, turning his gaze on Sirius. ‚ÄúYou owe me ten galleons Black.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou bet on this?‚Äù James asks indignantly, at the same time that Lily says; ‚ÄúOnly ten Galleons Remus? Really?‚Äù

He shrugs, holding out his hand as a very grumbly Sirius starts digging through his pockets. ‚ÄúYou were very adamant about your desire to drown him at the bottom of the lake, made it hard to feel confident.‚Äù

James turns slowly to look at Lily, arching his brow. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, you wanted to what?‚Äù

Lily rolls her eyes, waving around a fork full of pancake. ‚ÄúI was joking, obviously.‚Äù

‚ÄúObviously,‚Äù James repeats, trying to hide his amusement.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre two short Padfoot,‚Äù Remus says, hand still held out expectantly.

Sirius lets out a melodramatic sigh. ‚ÄúWell I‚Äôm not an heiress anymore, I don‚Äôt just have galleons to throw away.‚Äù

‚ÄúAn heiress is a girl,‚Äù Peter corrects, mouthful of food. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just an heir‚Äîor, er‚Äîyou were just an heir.‚Äù

Sirius rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no flair to ‚Äúheir‚Äù it‚Äôs so dull, so short. Nothing exciting happening.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have to agree with Sirius,‚Äù Lily says. ‚ÄúHeiress is way more fun.‚Äù

‚ÄúThank you Evans.‚Äù

James looks between the two of them before taking off his classes and rubbing his eyes, not entirely certain he isn‚Äôt dreaming. Not only has Lily Evans elected to have breakfast with them, she‚Äôs getting along with‚Ä¶Sirius?

‚ÄúPads,‚Äù Remus says, bringing the conversation back. ‚ÄúI know for a fact you have two more galleons, pay up.‚Äù

‚ÄúListen Moony, Moons, my love, my darling, my one and only‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI am not accepting flattery,‚Äù though his cheeks have gone a very dark colour of crimson.

They stare at one another for a moment before Sirius eventually breaks, turning to James.

‚ÄúProngs, can I borrow‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI am not giving you money to pay off a bet you made against me you traitor.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt against you per se.‚Äù

Remus snorts, earning him a pointed look from Sirius. ‚ÄúJamessssssssssss, come on, do me a solid.‚Äù

But James shakes his head, struggling not to laugh. ‚ÄúNo fucking way.‚Äù

Sirius sighs. ‚ÄúAlright,‚Äù turning back to Remus. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll see if I can scrounge the rest up when we get back to the room you tyrant.‚Äù

Remus snorts, shoving his galleons into his pocket.

It‚Äôs a bit mad really, James thinks, sitting there between Lily and Sirius. Mad that this is happening. That it works. Though James would never admit it, he would have bet against it too.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù Lily asks, reaching across the table for the orange juice, ‚Äúare we going to beat the shit out of Ravenclaw this Saturday or what?‚Äù

It‚Äôs Sirius who responds first, his barking laughter ringing out so loudly James is almost certain he‚Äôs going to lose hearing in his left ear.

‚ÄúOh I knew I liked you.‚Äù

¬†

Usually James waits for Regulus, periodically checking the map to see when he goes up to the tower, but for whatever reason he‚Äôs too impatient tonight. He walks around the halls instead, avoiding Filch, stopping to talk to Frank.

‚ÄúTechnically I should be docking you points for wandering the halls,‚Äù he says, half-way through a discussion on Ravenclaws‚Äôs weaknesses.

James just grins. ‚ÄúYou wouldn‚Äôt do that to your favourite chaser would you?‚Äù

Frank gives him a flat look. ‚ÄúJust don‚Äôt cause any major catastrophes.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll do my best.‚Äù

By the time he makes it up to the astronomy tower Regulus is there, standing in front of his telescope, expert fingers toying with the dials. He explained to James one night, what they all do. James had liked listening to him, had liked watching Regulus wave his arms around, his face bright, passionate. James hadn‚Äôt understood a word of what he was saying mind you, but‚Ä¶that had been a good night.

‚ÄúFancy meeting you here,‚Äù he says as the door closes behind him.

Regulus doesn‚Äôt respond, or react at all really, which seems cold even for him. James waits for a second but when nothing is forthcoming he makes his way over to the ledge, sitting down facing Regulus. It‚Äôs not that Regulus hasn‚Äôt been quieter recently, since Halloween, but something about this feels different. The air between them tight, like a string pulled to its breaking point.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù

‚ÄúJames.‚Äù

The cold tone makes him flinch. He still can‚Äôt really see Regulus‚Äôs face, half hidden behind the telescope, looking up at a family that doesn‚Äôt exist anymore. James‚Äôs leg starts to bounce nervously.

‚ÄúHas‚Äîare you okay?‚Äù he asks.

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

James again waits for more and again gets nothing.

‚ÄúAre you sure? Because I‚Äôm getting some very distinctly not-okay-vibes over here.‚Äù

James wishes that he could go back to listening to Regulus talk endlessly about his telescope, or his favourite quidditch team or the best flavours of ice cream at Florean‚Äôs. He wishes that he didn‚Äôt feel like he was standing on thin ice, praying it didn‚Äôt crack.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine,‚Äù Regulus answers shortly. James hates being so close to Regulus and at the same time feeling like he has no idea where he is, or how to reach him.

But then Regulus speaks again, unprompted for the first time all night.

‚ÄúYou and Evans seemed to be getting along well at breakfast.‚Äù

James blinks, thrown. ‚ÄúI‚Äîyeah, yeah she wants to be mates so‚Ä¶that‚Äôs‚Ä¶nice?‚Äù

‚ÄúMates,‚Äù Regulus repeats mockingly, pulling away from the telescope for the first time.

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúIs that a problem?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, the opposite really,‚Äù except that his voice is full of so many sharp edges that James is having a hard time believing that. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure there‚Äôll be a parade or something. The Minister will probably make it a national holiday.‚Äù

James is well and truly lost now. ‚ÄúWhat are you‚Äî‚Äú and then it hits him. ‚ÄúWait, are you jealous?‚Äù

Regulus stiffens. ‚ÄúNo. What would be the point? This was bound to happen eventually, she was always going to come around.‚Äù

‚ÄúCome around,‚Äù James repeats, feeling a little dumbfounded. ‚ÄúReg, she wants to be mates, not bloody boyfriend-girlfriend.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight now,‚Äù and there, just on the ends, his voice splinters and the pain slips through. ‚ÄúBut really it always made sense you two. So, you know, you have my blessing to‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know‚Äîride off into the sunset or whatever it is normal people do.‚Äù

‚ÄúNormal people?‚Äù James is starting to feel a bit like a parrot at this point. ‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú he gets to his feet and instantly Regulus steps back, causing James to freeze. They stay like that for a minute, neither one of them moving.

Eventually James lets out a sigh, hands running over his face as he tries to settle the knot that's been tying itself in his stomach. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happening right now?‚Äù

He can see Regulus struggling to swallow. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù and he sounds so fucking sad that James almost believes him.

‚ÄúShe just wants to be friends Regulus,‚Äù James says with as much authority as he can muster. ‚ÄúAnd even if she didn‚Äôt, that‚Äôs all I want from her now, okay? I‚Äôm not‚Äînot riding off into the sunset with anyone‚ÄîJesus.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt would be easier,‚Äù Regulus says finally.

James gives him a flat look. ‚ÄúFirstly, I highly doubt it. Secondly, what about me makes you think I‚Äôm interested in easy?‚Äù

Regulus breaks eye contact, shaking his head and looking off to the side‚Äîinto the empty night. From here it‚Äôs all sky.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand what you‚Äôre still doing here,‚Äù he says finally, the words sounding like they‚Äôve fought their way out of his mouth. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been‚Ä¶horrible to you.‚Äù

That surprises James. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve been scared, it‚Äôs not the same thing.‚Äù

Regulus lets out a breath that‚Äôs almost a laugh. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

And James doesn‚Äôt know what to say to that so they just sit with it.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt‚ÄîI can‚Äôt do things, sometimes.‚Äù He still isn‚Äôt looking at James, still staring into space.

‚ÄúThings?‚Äù

Regulus closes his eyes, a look of frustration crossing his face, though not directed at James, he doesn‚Äôt think. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt always be‚Ä¶here‚Ä¶be‚Ä¶touched. Sometimes I have to just‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know‚Äîlock some parts of me away or it gets too much,‚Äù he lets out a laboured breath and James feels his chest ache.

‚ÄúAnd then I saw you two this morning and I just thought‚Äîyou just looked so perfect and I thought, I bet she doesn‚Äôt ever have to disappear. I bet she‚Äôs normal and well adjusted. I bet she‚Äôs nice.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù James says softly, slowly taking a step forward but not touching him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre nice.‚Äù

He scoffs. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not though, I know I‚Äôm not and I hate it. It‚Äôs just‚Ä¶this,‚Äù he motions between them, ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt come‚Ä¶naturally to me. And I want to not care, not about you or any of it. God I want to not care so badly it hurts. But I do‚ÄîI do care,‚Äù he looks at James for the first time. ‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôm‚Äî‚Äù but he cuts himself off, shaking his head.

It takes James a minute to work out which words are worth saying, because he has so many of them. He always has so many of them for Reg.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to pretend to understand everything about you,‚Äù he says, which is admittedly maybe not the strongest start. ‚ÄúWhen you want to tell me‚Äîif you want to tell me‚ÄîI‚Äôm here. But until then I‚ÄîI just want you to let me be around you, however you can. Just don‚Äôt, don‚Äôt shut me out completely okay? Because this week was‚Ä¶hard.‚Äù He sighs, running a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúI feel like I‚Äôve been out here on my own.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause before Regulus nods. ‚ÄúYeah‚Äîyes‚ÄîI can‚Ä¶do that.‚Äù His shoulders sag as he presses into the wall behind him, face flickering between controlled and terrified.

‚ÄúReg, can I touch you?‚Äù

The younger boy sighs, sounding exhausted. ‚ÄúI hate that you have to ask that.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt,‚Äù and he means it.

Regulus eyes him for a moment, before reaching forward and tugging him close, forehead resting against James‚Äôs chest. And oh that feels good‚Äîto have him again. To hold him.

‚ÄúI just want you Reg,‚Äù he says softly, kissing the top of his head. ‚ÄúJust you. However you are.‚Äù

Reg snorts, the noise muffled by James‚Äôs torso. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a ridiculous thing to want.‚Äù

James runs his hands slowly up and down Regulus‚Äôs back, feeling the heat through the fabric of his jumper. ‚ÄúNah,‚Äù he says confidently, ‚Äúit‚Äôs brilliant really.‚Äù

¬†

The crowd irrupts as James scores his sixth goal in the game against Ravenclaw. With Mary‚Äôs other four they‚Äôre starting off with a steady lead.

James feels good, I mean, he always feels good playing but, this game is different.

‚ÄúNow that,‚Äù Sirius says as he pulls his broom up beside him, ‚Äúis the showmanship I‚Äôm looking for.‚Äù

James laughs. ‚ÄúI live to please you.‚Äù

‚ÄúDamn straight.‚Äù

The Ravenclaw keeper does a good job of getting the Quaffle out of his zone, launching it nearly halfway across the field.

‚ÄúMerlin, the arm on that kid,‚Äù he hears Sirius mutter, but James is already chasing the ball down the pitch.

The wind whips against his face as he presses himself closer to his broom, eyes zeroing in on the Quaffle. One of the Ravenclaw players tries to get in his way‚Äîa mistake‚ÄîJames dips under him with ease, letting his broom spiral the way he knows the crowd likes.

The Ravenclaw strategy seems to be simple enough‚Äîthey have a pair of Chasers who work exceptionally well together, so they send them down the field passing the Quaffle back and forth and turning the match into a giant game of monkey in the middle.

But James doesn‚Äôt want to play.

He keeps low and fast, getting himself underneath them as they move down the pitch. Frank is probably the best Keeper at Hogwarts so James isn‚Äôt particularly worried about them scoring, but that doesn‚Äôt mean he doesn‚Äôt want to steal the goal.

They‚Äôre nearly at the Gryffindor net but James smiles. Because he‚Äôs figured out the pattern, which means he knows who‚Äôs going to try and make the shot. And if he knows who‚Äôs going to shoot that means‚Äî

‚ÄúMerlin‚Äôs balls‚Äîsorry Professor‚Äîbut James Potter has just stolen the Quaffle!‚Äù

They weren‚Äôt expecting him, so the defence he runs into on his way back across the pitch is pretty sloppy. James feints to the left, avoiding one of the Ravenclaw Chasers as he rolls up on their goal. Their Keeper really isn‚Äôt bad but he‚Äôs shaken‚ÄîJames can tell. He grins, aiming the Quaffle through the top of the centre ring.

‚ÄúAnother goal for Gryffindor!‚Äù

The crowd cheers again, the noise filling James up. He flies over to the stands, gliding along and high-hiving his classmates‚Äîwhich is technically not allowed but that‚Äôs never stopped him before.

‚ÄúMr. Potter,‚Äù Professor McGonagall‚Äôs voice comes over the speakers. ‚ÄúStop showboating and take your position on the field immediately.‚Äù

James looks over to the commentator‚Äôs booth and finds the rather austere older witch staring pointedly at him, arms crossed over her chest.

James‚Äôs smile widens, ‚ÄúYes m‚Äôam,‚Äù he calls out, saluting her rather theatrically before flying back into the game.

The Quaffle is back in play, this time Mary takes the lead, battling it out with the Ravenclaw Chaser until she sees her opening and takes it.

‚ÄúYes!‚Äù James hisses out of breath, following alongside her incase she needs support. Not that she‚Äôs likely to, she‚Äôs dodging Ravens like a motherfucker.

‚ÄúAnd Gryffindor is in possession again!‚Äù comes the ecstatic voice over the speakers. ‚ÄúPotter and Macdonald are making a joke of Ravenclaws defences this game. And it looks like‚Äî‚Äú

James has never cracked his skull open before. But he imagines it probably feels like this. At first it‚Äôs just the pressure‚Äîsomething heavy colliding with his head. The world blinks. His broom no longer underneath him. An incredible weight pulling his head down, down, down. At first it‚Äôs just the pressure. And then it‚Äôs all pain.

¬†

He doesn‚Äôt know where in the forest he is, which is odd, usually he‚Äôs better at not getting lost. It‚Äôs dark‚Äîalmost pitch black, the moon coming down through the trees in droplets. James steps forward, realizing that he has two feet and two hands and no hooves.

Somewhere in the distance he hears a howl, head shooting up. He looks for his wand but he can‚Äôt find it.

‚ÄúSirius?‚Äù James half shouts. ‚ÄúPeter?‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt know how he ended up here like this, but he he knows he needs to find them.

It‚Äôs hard to walk, it feels like the air is too thick, like he‚Äôs wading through water. He looks for the usually landmarks but everything is blurring together. Distorted. Identical.

‚ÄúSirius? Peter?‚Äù he calls out again.

Something rustles behind him and James whips around, but all he sees are trees and the empty dark spaces between them. The unease crawling over his skin.

He has to find the others.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù

He turns around again and this time Reg is standing there, the moonlight that is dim everywhere else is bright on his face. He looks blurry around the edges.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James says, smiling automatically as he steps closer. ‚ÄúWhat are you doing here?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou said I needed to see it,‚Äù he shrugs, smirk tugging at his mouth. ‚ÄúWell, here I am.‚Äù

James laughs. ‚ÄúAnd what do you think?‚Äù

‚ÄúLots of trees.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat tends to happen in forests.‚Äù

‚ÄúHonestly, I don‚Äôt feel that it lives up to the hype.‚Äù
