‚ÄúAnd like, obviously I‚Äôm all for the Greeks, but, I‚Äôve got to be honest, I kinda like Hector.‚Äù

Now Regulus actually does laugh, wet and rough as it is. His eyes open and the world is blurry. So he is crying then.

‚ÄúOf course you like Hector.‚Äù

And oh how James smiles at that. Slow and soft. ‚ÄúThere you are,‚Äù he almost whispers.

Regulus realizes that it‚Äôs true. He‚Äôs shaking and crying and not at all confident that he can stand up but he‚Äôs breathing again. Thank Merlin he‚Äôs breathing again.

‚ÄúMr. Potter?‚Äù

The voice makes Regulus look up, a wave of nausea washing over him as he sees Filch and Snape standing there. Snape‚Äôs nose bleeding, his shirt collar torn.

‚ÄúTake Mr. Black to the infirmary and then get back to your dorm,‚Äù Filch continues. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be telling Mcgonagall and Slughorn all about this, no doubt I‚Äôll see you in detention tomorrow evening.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes Sir,‚ÄùJames says without hesitating, still crouched on the floor.

‚ÄúCome on you,‚Äù Filch nudges Snape down the hall, Snape whose eyes have not stopped bouncing between James and Regulus. ‚ÄúGo on get!‚Äù Filch gives him another push and Snape reluctantly tears his eyes away from them, allowing himself to be nearly dragged in the direction of the Slytherin dorms.

They‚Äôre silent at first, listening as the footsteps grow distant down the hall.

‚ÄúRegulus‚Äî‚Äú

But he cuts himself off when Regulus reaches forward, tugging on his shirt, pulling him close.

‚ÄúWoah‚Äîhey,‚Äù there‚Äôs some shuffling, James moving so that his back is against the wall, pulling Regulus into his lap, like a little kid, but he doesn‚Äôt care, pressing his face into James‚Äôs chest.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he mutters, voice still rough. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

‚ÄúShh, hey, no, it‚Äôs okay Reg, you‚Äôre okay.‚Äù

And none of that is true but he doesn‚Äôt bother trying to correct him. James runs his hand soothingly up and down Regulus‚Äôs back, kissing the top of his head. ‚ÄúThis okay?‚Äù he asks.

And Regulus nods. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in the hallway,‚Äù he says stupidly, but James seems to understand. Regulus feels him shuffling underneath him‚Äîpulling out his wand he thinks. A few seconds later something is draped over their heads. Regulus blinks, looking up.

‚ÄúDid you just cover us with a cloak?‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúInvisibility cloak.‚Äù

Regulus stares at him. ‚ÄúYou have an invisibility cloak?‚Äù

‚ÄúSurprise?‚Äù

Regulus shakes his head, pressing his face back into James‚Äôs shirt. ‚ÄúMagic map, invisibility cloak‚Äîyou‚Äôre ridiculous.‚Äù

James laughs softly. ‚ÄúSo I‚Äôve been told.‚Äù

It‚Äôs warm in James‚Äôs arms, so they stay like that, Regulus unwilling to move, James probably afraid to.

Eventually, Regulus hears himself whisper; ‚Äúshe cut my hair,‚Äù he thinks he might be crying again. He doesn‚Äôt know why.

James nods. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll grow back,‚Äù he presses another kiss to the top of Regulus‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúBesides, I told you, I like it. Very badass.‚Äù

Regulus half-sniffles half-laughs. ‚ÄúRidiculous.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

¬†

Chapter End Notes

I love this chapter but I'm also nervous about it so hopefully it wasn't too much

I just can't imagine living in that house to be anything but traumatizing honestly, plus I feel like it makes Regulus make more sense as a character

ALSO: I hear you guys with the happy ending, I do, really, buuuuuut, I can't promise you that. This fic is gonna be pretty canon compliant. That being said, I can promise you that they definitely don't hate each other at the end of this and they like, know that, if that makes sense?

Always thank you for comments!

Chapter 11

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

James knows he‚Äôs overprotective. Really, he does. He‚Äôs not sure why. Not sure where it comes from. He‚Äôs never lost anyone, never had anyone walk away from him, he hasn‚Äôt lived through what Sirius has. What Remus has. There‚Äôs no reason for him to have this deep need to protect when nothing has ever been taken from him. But he does. If you wanted to be cute, and sometimes his mother does, you could call it the Gryffindor in him. But it‚Äôs more than that. It scares him sometimes, if he‚Äôs honest. It‚Äôs too‚Ä¶intense. He feels it about Sirius, about Remus, about Peter. This need to be at their sides. To make sure they‚Äôre okay. To destroy anything and anyone who tries to touch them. Because they‚Äôre his. His to protect. His to keep. His to love. It‚Äôs too much. He knows it is.

It‚Äôs worse with Regulus.

He doesn‚Äôt like Snape. Whatever Lily says, he doesn‚Äôt see much that‚Äôs redeemable about the kid. But he‚Äôs glad that Filch showed up when he did, glad that he pulled them apart. Because, for a minute, when he came around that corner, when he saw Snape with Regulus pressed against the wall‚Ä¶he doesn‚Äôt actually think he was going to kill him. He hopes he wasn‚Äôt. But merlin he wanted to. He felt the need burn under his skin. He wouldn‚Äôt have needed magic. Wouldn‚Äôt have needed a wand. He‚Äôd have done it with his bare hands. And that scares him.

Scares him almost as much as the way Regulus shakes in his arms. The way he cries silently into his chest. James has never felt his age quite so much as when he was crouched on the floor, trying to get Regulus to breathe. All he could think was; ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm doing. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm doing. Someone help. Someone get my mum.‚Äù

It hurts. People hurt. Even when they don‚Äôt mean to. Even when it isn‚Äôt their fault. It hurts to see Remus the morning after a full moon, which is a selfish thing to feel, or to think, but it‚Äôs true. It hurts to see him broken and battered and filled with loneliness. Just like it hurt to watch Regulus fall apart. He knows it isn‚Äôt about him. None of it is. But it hurts like it‚Äôs his. And he‚Äôs sorry. And he wishes he was stronger. Wishes he was more. Wishes he wasn‚Äôt the only person he knew who wasn‚Äôt covered in scars.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to have to move,‚Äù Regulus says eventually, still pressed against him, invisibility cloak over their heads. James‚Äôs arms instinctively tighten around him.

‚ÄúLets go back to the room. Can we do that?‚Äù he realizes he shouldn‚Äôt be making demands right now. But the idea of letting Regulus go back to that dorm‚Äîthe idea that Snape might be waiting for him‚Ä¶

‚ÄúFilch might check‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThe room?‚Äù

‚ÄúIf you went back to your dorm.‚Äù

James shakes his head. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve already got one detention, another won‚Äôt make much of a difference.‚Äù

Regulus is quiet.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm asking Reg,‚Äù James says gently, ‚Äúit‚Äôs a question, you can say no. You can always say no.‚Äù He knows he handled things wrong, before. Knows he looked disappointed when Regulus turned him away. He‚Äôs never been good at guarding his emotions. He hates that he did that. That he made him think‚Äîfor even a minute‚Äîthat he had to do anything he didn‚Äôt want to.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Regulus whispers back, before burrowing further into James‚Äôs chest.

His hand goes to the back of his head, holds him there.

I love you.

I love you.

I‚Äôm so sorry that I wasn‚Äôt there.

I‚Äôm so sorry that someone hurt you and I couldn‚Äôt stop it.

I‚Äôm so sorry that I don‚Äôt know what to do.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù Regulus says finally. ‚ÄúOkay, lets go.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù James tries to keep the relief out of his voice.

‚ÄúYeah. Yes. Yes James.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a slow process, getting Regulus back on his feet. James suggests carrying him but Regulus sends him a look so sharp James can‚Äôt believe he isn‚Äôt bleeding from it. He keeps one hand around Regulus‚Äôs waist and the other holding up the invisibility cloak, even though it doesn‚Äôt quite cover their feet. He figures some coverage is better than none, and he‚Äôs not at all certain that Filch isn‚Äôt coming back.

By the time they make it to the room he thinks they‚Äôre both exhausted. He tosses the cloak over a nearby chair, Regulus collapsing onto the bed leaving James standing awkwardly by the door. He wants desperately to be closer but knows better than to move. He may not understand where it comes from, Regulus‚Äôs fear of hands, and bodies, and touch. But he knows that Regulus hates it, that he‚Äôs almost‚Äîashamed of it. And that he‚Äôll let James cross boundaries if he pushes. Clearly it‚Äôs something Regulus has grown used to. So James is so, so careful not to push.

‚ÄúDo you have practice tomorrow morning?‚Äù he asks finally.

Regulus shakes his head, still lying on his back. ‚ÄúNo. You?‚Äù

‚ÄúCourse, Frank‚Äôs a complete tyrant.‚Äù

‚ÄúPlease, you love it.‚Äù

‚ÄúMaybe,‚Äù James admits, feeling shaky even as they fall into familiar patterns, ‚Äúbut I don‚Äôt want him to know that.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, I suppose not.‚Äù

There‚Äôs another pause, the fire burning low, somehow anticipating their level of exhaustion.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll sleep on the sofa yeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

He knows that tone. Hears the pain in it. The fear. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs alright Reg. I don‚Äôt mind. Really.‚Äù

Regulus sighs. ‚ÄúHas it ever occurred to you that you should mind? That you should want more? More than‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James cuts him off, voice steady. ‚ÄúIt hasn‚Äôt.‚Äù

Regulus lets out another sigh, kicking his shoes off before wiggling so that‚Äôs he‚Äôs sitting up against the headboard. He looks exhausted, like he hasn‚Äôt slept the whole time he‚Äôs been gone. There are craters hanging under his eyes, his skin pale, his hands unable to stay still. Constantly fidgeting in his lap or with his sleeve.

‚ÄúOkay, the sofa, but can you come here first?‚Äù he looks nervous when he says it.

When James had walked in here the first time, it had been hard not to react to the boy in front of him. Regulus had been swaying against the back wall, eyes barely able to focus, body held so tightly James was afraid he was going to snap. At least now he‚Äôs present. But it‚Äôs‚Äîit‚Äôs all laced with a new kind of fear. One that‚Äôs closer to the surface.

‚ÄúSure Reg,‚Äù he sits on the side of the bed, leaving space between them. After a few moments Regulus reaches out, playing with James‚Äôs fingers, slowly, carefully. James doesn‚Äôt move.

‚ÄúWhat happened,‚Äù Regulus says finally, not looking up from their hands, ‚Äúwith Snape? I wasn‚Äôt really‚Ä¶I didn‚Äôt really see.‚Äù

James blinks, surprised by the question, really feeling that he ought to be the one asking. ‚ÄúI heard you two arguing‚Äîor, well, I heard Snape anyway, he wasn‚Äôt exactly keeping his voice down. So I followed the noise and when I found you he‚Äîhe had you pinned against the wall,‚Äù Regulus‚Äôs hand stills, and James feels the anger fresh again, the desire to rip Snape to shreds.

‚ÄúSo I pulled him off you and he took a swing at me,‚Äù Regulus looks up at that, squinting.

‚ÄúHe hit you?‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúNot very well, Snivellus has never excelled at physical altercations.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou would know I guess.‚Äù

‚ÄúMm,‚Äù James nods noncommittally. ‚ÄúAnyway, I hit him back, somewhat more effectively.‚Äù

‚ÄúI noticed,‚Äù and James thinks he catches the hint of a smile in Regulus‚Äôs mouth.

‚ÄúMostly we just shoved each other around a bit, he shot off a spell at some point but it missed by a mile.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt respond right away, still playing with James‚Äôs fingers. ‚ÄúI think he knows,‚Äù he says eventually.

James raises his eyebrow. ‚ÄúKnows?‚Äù

‚ÄúAbout‚Ä¶us.‚Äù

‚ÄúIs that why you two got into it?‚Äù

Regulus forces a breath out of his nose. ‚ÄúNo. No, that was‚Ä¶well, anyway. The way he was looking at us, when Filch dragged him off, I think he knows.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs not like we were snogging or anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe weren‚Äôt behaving‚Ä¶platonically.‚Äù

James makes a scoffing noise. ‚ÄúI mean, we could have been, I‚Äôd have helped any of my friends out the same.‚Äù

Grey eyes look up, tired. ‚ÄúBut we‚Äôre not friends.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt have an answer for that. Doesn‚Äôt even know where to start.

Eventually Regulus sighs, pulling his hand back into his own lap. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just warning you, because if I were Snape, the first person I would go to would be Sirius.‚Äù James doesn‚Äôt miss the way his voice frays on his brother‚Äôs name.

He still doesn‚Äôt know what the right thing to say here is. What it is that Regulus wants to hear. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be his word against ours, he hasn‚Äôt got any way to prove it.‚Äù

Regulus leans back against the headboard, breathing in and out in that way he does sometimes, like he has to think about it. ‚ÄúSince when do you need proof to spread a rumour at this school?‚Äù and before James can answer he goes on; ‚ÄúBesides, that‚Äôs why he‚Äôll go to Sirius. He won‚Äôt need to prove it, he‚Äôll just need to make Sirius doubt you. Which he will.‚Äù

James hates this conversation. ‚ÄúWill he?‚Äù a bit defiantly.

Regulus rolls his head sleepily towards him, eyes opening again. ‚ÄúYes, it‚Äôs what we do. Doubt and doubt and doubt. Everything gets all twisted in that house, love and hate and all the rest. You can‚Äôt trust anyone. Can‚Äôt even trust yourself.‚Äù

James aches for the both of them. He wishes that he could fix it, that he could stop them from ever being hurt at all. ‚ÄúHe trusts me,‚Äù James says finally, voice weak.

Regulus nods. ‚ÄúAnd you‚Äôre lying to him.‚Äù

James feels the air escape from his lungs, like he‚Äôs just been hit. He‚Äôs not entirely sure he hasn‚Äôt been. He makes to stand up but Regulus‚Äôs hand shoots out, wrapping around his wrist. Sleepy eyes suddenly wide.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôm sorry, I don‚Äôt know why I said that. I‚Äôm not‚Äî‚Äú he fumbles with his words. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not very good right now, I‚Äôm all‚Äîall the worst parts of me. I‚Äôm sorry. I‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

James breathes in, trying to put out the fires those words started in his chest. Because he hadn‚Äôt thought about it like that. Not really, not fully. He knows that he is one of the few people that Sirius trusts‚Äîthat he‚Äôs ever trusted. But it never occurred to him before that he wasn‚Äôt worthy of it.

Regulus is still staring at him with frightened eyes.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay Reg.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt was just the truth.‚Äù

But the younger boy shakes his head. ‚ÄúI was being cruel. I told you I‚Äôm‚ÄîI‚Äôm not very nice. I try to be‚Äîfor you,‚Äù he grimaces at the confession. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the one who made you promise not to tell anyone, it isn‚Äôt fair for me to throw it back in your face.‚Äù

‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù he says softly, holding the other boy‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to be nice all the time you know, nobody is.‚Äù

Regulus looks at him skeptically. ‚ÄúSays you.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll have you know there are plenty of people who think I‚Äôm an asshole.‚Äù

This doesn‚Äôt seem to sway Regulus. ‚ÄúThey think you‚Äôre an idiot. There‚Äôs a difference.‚Äù

James laughs, probably too loud, but it melts some of the ice in Regulus‚Äôs eyes so he doesn‚Äôt feel too bad about it. ‚ÄúYou might be right.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am,‚Äù Regulus looks down at where he‚Äôs still holding on to James‚Äôs wrist, and then, slowly, and almost painfully sweet, he brings James‚Äôs knuckles to his mouth and kisses them. It‚Äôs soft and quick, like something he wanted so badly he couldn‚Äôt help it. His cheeks are slightly pink when he puts James‚Äôs hand back down again. James wonders how it is that Regulus can be so forward about so much else and so unsure of the littler things like this?

‚ÄúI should let you sleep,‚Äù he says eventually, breathless, heart trying to slip between his ribs.

There are so many words crowding behind Regulus‚Äôs lips, he can see them, see Regulus swallow them down. He wishes, that just once, he wouldn‚Äôt. That just once he would tell James all the things he thinks are too terrible to utter. The parts of him too ugly to show. I can take it, James wants to say, trust me.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù Regulus says finally, voice quiet.

‚ÄúFor what?‚Äù

The younger boy shakes his head. ‚ÄúAll of it. Everything.‚Äù

They watch one another for too long before James eventually gets to his feet. He reaches his hand out, slowly, pausing before they touch, ‚ÄúCan I?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a moment of hesitation before Regulus nods; ‚Äúyes,‚Äù he says softly.

James holds his face, thumbs brushing over his cheeks as Regulus closes his eyes, leaning into the touch. James bends forward and presses a kiss to the top of his head before pulling away.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going anywhere Regulus.‚Äù

The younger boy blinks his eyes open, so serious and stoic. ‚ÄúI know,‚Äù he says, though the pause gives him away.

‚ÄúI mean it.‚Äù

Regulus looks almost sad for a minute, before he‚Äôs able to wipe his expression clean, neutral. ‚ÄúI know you do.‚Äù

He considers pushing the matter but decides against it, not tonight. ‚ÄúGoodnight Reg.‚Äù

‚ÄúGoodnight James.‚Äù

¬†

James is slightly better at sneaking back into his dorm, using the invisibility cloak to make sure he gets upstairs unseen. Unfortunately, Sirius is already awake for quidditch, and there isn‚Äôt really a subtle way for James to just‚Ä¶appear.

Sirius doesn‚Äôt seem surprised when James takes off the invisibility cloak, he just gives him a cold once over from where he‚Äôs sitting on his bed.

‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äù James tries to explain.

‚ÄúBetter hurry up,‚Äù Sirius gets to his feet, grabbing his broom, ‚Äúdon‚Äôt want to keep Frank waiting.‚Äù

With that he brushes passed him and out of the room, shutting the door a bit too forcefully considering their other two roommates are still sleeping.

Sirius gives James the silent treatment for the rest of the morning, which James thinks is a little unfair but he tries to ignore it. All he gets is glowering and grumbling and sarcastic huffs every time he opens his mouth. By the end of breakfast he‚Äôs about ready to throttle Sirius. Luckily Remus, being the perceptive lad he is, makes sure to sit between them in charms and then again in potions. By lunch things are actually starting to feel a little more relaxed. That is, until James hears the unmistakable sound of McGonagall clearing her throat.

‚ÄúProfessor,‚Äù he says, resigned. Putting down his sandwich and turning towards her.

‚ÄúReally Potter, fighting in the corridor in the middle of the night?‚Äù

James can feel the eyes of each of his friends boring into him, Sirius‚Äôs especially.

‚ÄúWhat on earth possessed you to act so foolishly?‚Äù After an extended silence James realizes that she actually expects an answer from him.

‚ÄúOh‚Äîer‚ÄîI was sleep walking?‚Äù

She arches a formidable eyebrow. ‚ÄúReally? And you just happened to sleepwalk right into Mr. Snape?‚Äù

James rubs the back of his neck. ‚ÄúYeah, mad coincidence that.‚Äù

‚ÄúMmhm,‚Äù she says, eyes running him up and down, clearly unimpressed. ‚ÄúA weeks detentions‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOh come on‚Äî‚Äú

‚Äú‚Äîand ten points from Gryffindor.‚Äù

‚ÄúProfessor, you know Slughorn‚Äôs not going to take anything from Slytherin for this!‚Äù

She sniffs. ‚ÄúHow my fellow professors deal with their houses is none of my business, you, Mr. Potter, ought to know better. You‚Äôre in fifth year for goodness sakes.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt understand how that‚Äôs relevant to anything but he can‚Äôt see the point in trying to fight with her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre detention starts tonight, after supper, six-thirty. Filch will be waiting for you in the trophy room, you are to be punctual and contrite, have I made myself clear?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, Professor,‚Äù he grumbles, turning back to his sandwich.

‚ÄúOh, and Mr. Potter?‚Äù

He looks up as she calls to him over her shoulder.

‚ÄúIf this happens again I promise you the consequences will be far more severe.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes‚Äîthough only once he‚Äôs certain she‚Äôs no longer looking. ‚ÄúBrilliant.‚Äù

It takes him a minute to realize that the other three marauders are all still staring at him and he tries to figure out if there‚Äôs anyway he can avoid having the conversation that is clearly coming.

‚ÄúYou got into a fight with Snape?‚Äù Remus hisses.

Apparently not.

James looks guiltily up at the confused faces of his friends‚Äîwell, Remus and Peter look confused. Sirius looks angry.

‚ÄúSort of,‚Äù he answers eventually. ‚ÄúYeah.‚Äù

‚ÄúSort of?‚Äù Peter repeats.

James shrugs. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know why you‚Äôre acting like this is some big deal, we get into scrapes with Snivellus all the time.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot usually in the middle of the night,‚Äù Remus says, not unfairly.

‚ÄúYeah well, what can I say, the bloke‚Äôs a tool 24/7, no rest for the wicked eh?‚Äù he tries to smile but doesn‚Äôt appear to appease a single one of his friends.

‚ÄúWhat the hell were you even doing out of bed?‚Äù Peter asks, looking the most genuinely confused out of the bunch.

James shrugs again, looking down at his plate. ‚ÄúWalking.‚Äù

That earns him a cold laugh from Sirius, who pushes away from the table muttering something that sounds a lot like ‚Äúunbelievable‚Äù under his breath.

‚ÄúPads?‚Äù Remus calls after him, but Sirius is already walking away, without a backwards glance. James watches him.

‚ÄúHe must have forgotten something in the room,‚Äù Remus says, eyeing James nervously.

James stares for a moment longer before dropping his eyes. ‚ÄúYeah. Must have.‚Äù

¬†

Sirius‚Äôs mood continues for the rest of the day and it‚Äôs for that reason that instead of going back to the dorms after class James decides to go to the library. Maybe giving him some space will help. Besides, if he has to listen to Sirius sigh one more time he‚Äôs going to lose it.

Marlene and Lily are already there, Remus having promised to be along later after grabbing some books from upstairs. James stews over his coursework. Not really paying attention to anything he‚Äôs reading, mind preoccupied with the Black brothers.

He wonders how Regulus is getting on‚Äîhe didn‚Äôt see him at breakfast and Regulus was still asleep when James left this morning. He wasn‚Äôt sure if he should wake him up or not but decided against it‚Äîif anyone needs an extra hour or two of shut-eye it‚Äôs Reg.

Sirius is a whole other problem. It‚Äôs clear that James can‚Äôt keep shutting him out like this. Sirius won‚Äôt stand for it and even though he‚Äôs being a complete wanker at the moment James knows it‚Äôs fair. Knows he‚Äôd probably be just as bad. But what other option does he have?

‚ÄúOi! Earth to Potter?‚Äù Lily snaps her fingers in front of his face, pulling him out of his thoughts.

‚ÄúDamn Evans, we‚Äôre in a library, tone it down a bit.‚Äù

She blinks back at him, then elbows Marlene beside her. ‚ÄúMar, did you hear that?‚Äù

Marlene, who is still scribbling out her potions essay, nods. ‚ÄúSure did.‚Äù

Lily turns back to him, biting her lips to hold in a smile.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand what‚Äôs so funny here,‚Äù he looks between the two girls, not at all in the mood for mind games.

‚ÄúYou just told me to tone it down,‚Äù Lily says, as though that ought to make everything clear.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîyeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou,‚Äù she repeats, openly smiling now. ‚ÄúYou James Potter, king of the loud-over-the-top-wankers‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOi, okay, I‚Äôm not that bad.‚Äù

‚Äú‚Äîyou just told ME to tone it down.‚Äù

He gives her a flat look. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre enjoying this way too much Evans.‚Äù

‚ÄúPretty sure I‚Äôm enjoying it the exact right amount.‚Äù

He snorts, shaking his head as he looks back down at his textbook.

‚ÄúThat must be some page there,‚Äù Lily goes on, still smiling. He‚Äôd be more annoyed if it wasn‚Äôt so fucking charming.

‚ÄúWhat are you on about now?‚Äù

She nods down at the page in front of him. ‚ÄúJust that you‚Äôve been reading that same section for the past thirty minutes.‚Äù

He blinks, looks down at the page, and then back up again. ‚ÄúMaybe I‚Äôm just a very slow reader, ever consider that?‚Äù

‚ÄúPlease, I‚Äôve seen you read a dozen times James.‚Äù

He grins out of the corner of his mouth. ‚ÄúYou been watching me Evans?‚Äù

She rolls her eyes, but he‚Äôs pleased to see pink stains on the tops of her cheeks. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been in school together for five years, I‚Äôve seen you read.‚Äù

‚ÄúA likely story.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù she goes on, ignoring him, ‚Äúwhat is it that‚Äôs got you so preoccupied you can‚Äôt get through a single paragraph?‚Äù

He meets her green eyes across the table and thinks, not for the first time, that this lying business is really rather exhausting and he has no idea how the Slytherins manage it.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù he sighs, running a hand through his hair.

She sends him a pointed look that makes clear that that will not be enough for her, so he decides to give-in a little: ‚ÄúSirius is upset with me.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh no, trouble in paradise?‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt particularly appreciate her joking tone. ‚ÄúYeah, a bit.‚Äù

She leans forward across the table, expression becoming slightly more sincere. ‚ÄúDid you have a fight?‚Äù

And how does he even answer that? ‚ÄúMerlin, maybe, I can‚Äôt tell.‚Äù

She arches her brow. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, you can‚Äôt tell?‚Äù

Marlene snorts beside her. ‚ÄúBoys,‚Äù she says disparagingly.

‚ÄúHey, it‚Äôs complicated, okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúSomehow I doubt that,‚Äù Marlene doesn‚Äôt even bother to look up from her coursework.

‚ÄúMar, stop antagonizing him,‚Äù Lily elbows her again, holding back a smirk. ‚ÄúGo on Potter, you don‚Äôt know if you and your best mate have had a fight?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, we did have a fight,‚Äù he tries to explain, not at all sure why he‚Äôs bothering. ‚ÄúBut we were fine afterwards.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou made up?‚Äù she asks.

‚ÄúWhat? No. We just pretended it never happened.‚Äù

She blinks slowly. ‚ÄúAh, I see, you were,‚Äù she makes air quotes with her fingers, ‚Äúfine.‚Äù

‚ÄúHonestly, you lot are way less sympathetic than I thought you would be.‚Äù James crosses his arms over his chest and slouches in his seat.

‚ÄúSorry, sorry,‚Äù she shakes out her shoulders. ‚ÄúSympathetic Lily, in the house. So, you ignored all your feelings, dealt with nothing, and now it‚Äôs coming back to bite you in the ass?‚Äù

James glares at her across the table. ‚ÄúThat didn‚Äôt sound very sympathetic.‚Äù

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt it?‚Äù she asks innocently, and when he continues to pout she sighs; ‚ÄúListen, here‚Äôs what it comes down to, did you do something wrong?‚Äù

James‚Äôs stomach squirms. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says reluctantly.

‚ÄúSo apologize.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh brilliant advice that.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù she looks at him expectantly, ‚Äúhave you tried it?‚Äù

James grinds his teeth. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he forces out eventually.

‚ÄúYou might want to.‚Äù

He sighs, running a hand over his face. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not that simple‚Äîhe doesn‚Äôt want an apology, he wants me to‚Äîto fix it,‚Äù which is as close to the truth as James is going to get.

Lily looks at him, eyes searching his face for a moment before she speaks again. ‚ÄúAnd you‚Ä¶can‚Äôt? Don‚Äôt want to?‚Äù

James lets out a breath. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm scared more like.‚Äù Okay, THAT‚Äôs as close to the truth as James is going to get.

She nods slowly. ‚ÄúWell, have you tried telling him that?‚Äù

He opens his mouth, finds he has nothing to say, and closes it again. That hadn‚Äôt actually occurred to him. After a few moments of watching him flounder Lily leans forward again, placing her hand on his arm which feels‚Ä¶weird. Nice but‚Ä¶weird.

‚ÄúListen, I‚Äôm not saying I‚Äôm an expert or anything, but I‚Äôm pretty sure even the giant squid knows how much Sirius Black loves you. So, whatever you did, I bet you anything that he wants to forgive you more than he wants to be angry with you. Besides,‚Äù she pulls back, ‚Äúit‚Äôs a bit sad, one of you without the other, you‚Äôre really better as a pair.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to try not to take that as an insult.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood, it wasn‚Äôt meant as one.‚Äù

He nods, scrubbing at his face before meeting her gaze again. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right. I know you are. I‚Äôm bloody miserable without the wanker.‚Äù

She smiles, a little more softly than he would have expected.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúNothing,‚Äù she shakes her head, still smiling, ‚Äújust, it‚Äôs sweet is all.‚Äù

James pulls a face that makes her laugh.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying, however annoying you lot are‚Äîminus Remus of course.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù James agrees. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always said Remus is my best quality.‚Äù

She smirks. ‚ÄúHowever annoying,‚Äù she continues, ‚Äúthe way you look after each other, it‚Äôs always been‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know, the most human thing about you.‚Äù

‚ÄúHuman?‚Äù James asks. ‚ÄúYou thought I was inhuman?‚Äù

‚ÄúSometimes, there were a few years there where you felt more like a cartoon character than a person, all those bloody proposals.‚Äù

James grimaces. ‚ÄúOh yeah, those.‚Äù

‚ÄúMm, those.‚Äù

He rubs the back of his neck, fidgeting uncomfortably. ‚ÄúSuppose I owe you an apology for some of them.‚Äù

She arches her brow, ‚Äúare you sure you don‚Äôt want to just act like they never happened?‚Äù her voice is dripping in sarcasm.

Marlene snorts. ‚ÄúAs if any of us could ever forget.‚Äù

James glares at her even though she‚Äôs not looking up to see it. ‚ÄúThanks Mar, big help you are.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnytime Potter.‚Äù

James exhales, turning back to Lily who watches him expectantly.

He coughs, clearing his throat. ‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶for what it‚Äôs worth, I am sorry. About most of them.‚Äù

‚ÄúMost?‚Äù she repeats.

‚ÄúWell, not the first one.‚Äù

She arches her brow. ‚ÄúBut the rest of them?‚Äù

He shrugs. ‚ÄúIt kinda became expected didn‚Äôt it? Couldn‚Äôt let my audience down.‚Äù

He sees the familiar expression of anger pinching her face and when she speaks again her voice is brittle. ‚ÄúAnd what about me then?‚Äù

James ducks his head sheepishly. ‚ÄúYeah, I know, it wasn‚Äôt‚Äîwasn‚Äôt fair. You got lost a bit, ironically, in the‚Ä¶show of it. It just, it took me a while to figure that out. That I‚Äôd stopped doing it for you. Stopped thinking about you at all really.‚Äù

He expects her to get angry but she doesn‚Äôt. Just watches him. He feels uncomfortable but he does his best to bear it, to let her get out whatever it is that she needs to. If not yelling, he at least expects a dressing down, Lily is rather famously good at those. But the next words out of her mouth are not what he expects.

‚ÄúBut the first one,‚Äù she says slowly, ‚Äúyou thought about me then?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù and he doesn‚Äôt know why that feels important but it does. ‚ÄúYou were all I thought about really.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a moment of silence then, both of them looking at each other, for the first time with the past laid out in front of them. Eventually James can‚Äôt take it anymore.

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he says, suddenly feeling antsy, ‚Äúbetter get back to‚Ä¶‚Äù he gestures to the book in front him.

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù Lily seems to shake herself awake. ‚ÄúRight, yeah.‚Äù

He tries to concentrate. Really. But he never does get passed that page.

¬†

James is not new to detention. In fact, he‚Äôs rather old hat at it. Usually it involves cleaning, on occasion, when McGonagall is feeling particularly spiteful, it also includes essay writing. Something about making him think about his actions and consider the consequences blah blah blah. Honestly, all things considered, dusting and polishing old trophies is one of the better options. So James is feeling in relatively good spirits as he strolls up to the dusty room in the east wing of the dungeons. That is, until he remembers who he‚Äôs gotten himself in trouble with.

‚ÄúOh fuck,‚Äù he mutters under his breath as Snape skulks down the corridor towards them. James turns to the caretaker.

‚ÄúI would rather you hang me from the ceiling by my toes than spend the next three hours with that tosser.‚Äù

Filch seems almost wistful. ‚ÄúIf only my boy, if only.‚Äù He pulls out a set of jangly keys from his pocket and unlocks the door, whispering something about ministry guidelines and ‚Äúa little bit of torture never hurt anyone‚Äù which, James doesn‚Äôt think is strictly true. He follows Filch into the room very pointedly not looking at Snape who has come up behind him.

The door has barely closed before James has a rag and spray bottle thrown in his face. He decides to let it go however, because Filch does the same thing to Snape who makes an affronted squeaky noise that James wishes he had recorded.

‚ÄúYou,‚Äù Filch points at James, ‚Äústart at that end, and you,‚Äù he turns to Snape, ‚Äúthat one,‚Äù he gestures to the opposite end of the long, slender room, which is made up almost entirely of shelves. What all these trophies are for James hasn‚Äôt the foggiest. He‚Äôs done this once or twice before, a lot of them are quidditch, some are for academics or sports that James has never heard of and clearly went out of fashion centuries ago. Some are inscribed in latin so honestly it‚Äôs anyone‚Äôs guess.

‚ÄúWands,‚Äù Filch holds out his hand.

‚ÄúWands!‚Äù Snape demands indignantly.

James just rolls his eyes, pulling his out of his pocket and handing it over.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no magic allowed in detention,‚Äù Filch says with a leer, motioning to Snape with his fingers. ‚ÄúNow, hand it over.‚Äù

Snape scowls back at the man, seemingly trying to decide whether or not he actually has to listen to him. James sighs, leaning against the shelves behind him. It‚Äôs a rookie move honestly, getting Filch riled up.

‚ÄúDo you want want me to be fetching McGonagall, telling her you aren‚Äôt complying huh?‚Äù

If anything, Snape‚Äôs scowl seems to deepen. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not my head of house.‚Äù

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt say she was.‚Äù

James snorts and then quickly tries to cover it with a cough as Filch looks over at him suspiciously. There‚Äôs no getting on the caretakers good side, there‚Äôs only staying off of his bad side, and James has always managed that balancing act rather well.

Eventually, with a dramatic sigh, Snape hands over his wand.

‚ÄúAlright then, you lot get to work, I‚Äôll be back in an hour to check on your progress.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just going to leave us?‚Äù Snape demands outraged.

Filch smiles. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, you needn‚Äôt be afraid, Mrs. Norris will be here to watch you, won‚Äôt you sweetheart?‚Äù

There‚Äôs the sound of purring before the feline emerges from between a stack of trophies on the floor, winding her way around the caretakers legs. James does his best to repress a shiver. He‚Äôs always hated that cat.

‚ÄúNow, if you wanna get out of here before midnight I‚Äôd suggest you start polishing.‚Äù

James kicks himself upright, happy to put some distance between himself and Snape as he walks down to the other end of the room. He polishes a few trophies the muggle way, keeping an eye on Mrs. Norris and the back of Snape‚Äôs head. But once he‚Äôs certain that neither of them can see him, he slides Peter‚Äôs wand out of his sleeve. This isn‚Äôt James‚Äôs first rodeo, and he absolutely refuses to be stuck in this miserable room all night.

With the quick flick of the wand the trophies closest to him start to sparkle, and James smiles.

¬†

‚ÄúMy, my Potter, aren‚Äôt you quick,‚Äù Filch mutters an hour latter when James has nearly half the room done without breaking a sweat.

‚ÄúLots of practice sir,‚Äù he smiles. Filch does not smile back, his sneering gaze moving over to Snape, whose normally grey face is flushed and sweaty and made even uglier by the intense anger James can see bubbling beneath it.

‚ÄúYou on the other hand,‚Äù Filch looks at Snape‚Äôs pitiful pile of polished trophies. James reckons he could do twice that many even if he wasn‚Äôt cheating. ‚ÄúPick up the pace boy. I‚Äôll be back again in an hour and I expect you to have more done than that,‚Äù he all but spits on the floor next to him. There is little that bothers Filch quite as much as poor housekeeping.

He gives Mrs. Norris a scratch on the head before trudging out of the room.

James turns back to the shelves behind him. Unfortunately, now that he‚Äôs no longer hidden away in his corner he‚Äôll have to start doing them by hand. Still, he‚Äôs managed to make an impressive dent if he does say so himself.

‚ÄúHow the hell did you get through those so fast?‚Äù demands an irate Snape from beside him

James lets out a long suffering sigh. He is also now, unfortunately, much closer to his detention partner.

‚ÄúListen Snivellus,‚Äù he looks over at Snape, whose rag is curled in his fist as though it has personally offended him, ‚Äúit‚Äôs not my fault that you‚Äôre crap at everything.‚Äù

Snape lets out an indignant noise, like a tea kettle that‚Äôs just come to boil, and James can‚Äôt help but laugh, bending down to pick up his next trophy. ‚ÄòPrefect of the Year‚Äô is scrawled across it and James has half a mind to nick it for Remus.

‚ÄúNever would have pegged you for a queer Potter,‚Äù he hears the words come out of Snape‚Äôs mouth in a hiss and feels himself pause.

It‚Äôs the first time anyone‚Äôs ever called him that and he expected to feel‚Ä¶more. More about the disgust in Snape‚Äôs tone. But maybe it‚Äôs because it‚Äôs Snape‚Äîpathetic and grasping as he is‚Äîthat makes it almost laughable instead.

He looks over at the other boy, expression flat. ‚ÄúSorry? Did you say something? You‚Äôll have to speak up, I‚Äôm not fluent in asshole.‚Äù

Snape‚Äôs eyes narrow. ‚ÄúTell me Potter, does your friend know you‚Äôre fucking his brother?‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you know that I‚Äôm fucking his brother?‚Äù James asks, feeling the weight of Peter‚Äôs wand up his sleeve and struggling to find the willpower not to use it. ‚ÄúBecause I don‚Äôt actually think you do, that‚Äôs just the baseless conclusion that you‚Äôve drawn in that tiny little brain of yours. So, if you don‚Äôt mind, I‚Äôd like to get back to polishing so that I can get the hell out of here.‚Äù

Snape opens his mouth to speak but James cuts him off.

‚ÄúGreat. Glad we‚Äôre on the same page.‚Äù

He very purposefully turns away from him, scrubbing rather unfairly at the trophy in his hands. A few moments of silence pass and James starts to think that he might actually be able to get through the rest of this night without having to speak to Snape again. Of course, Snape has other plans.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the second time you‚Äôve come to his rescue,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúGood to know you can count,‚Äù James does not look up from his cleaning.

‚ÄúBit hypocritical of you, don‚Äôt you think?‚Äù

James hates that he can feel himself taking the bait, responding to the infuriatingly smug tone Snape‚Äôs voice has taken on.

‚ÄúWhat ever are you talking about Severus?‚Äù he asks, forcing a brevity into his words that he does not feel.

‚ÄúJames Potter, defender of half bloods and muggle borns, protecting Regulus Black? Hardly adds up does it?‚Äù

James grits his teeth. ‚ÄúShockingly, I don‚Äôt really care what you think adds up.‚Äù

‚ÄúI bet I‚Äôm not the only one who would have a problem with it, even if you aren‚Äôt fucking him.‚Äù

James very determinedly picks up another trophy, hoping Snape doesn‚Äôt notice the way his hands shake with the barely refrained desire to punch him in his stupid mouth.

‚ÄúPeople like Lily, for example.‚Äù

As someone who quite enjoys antagonizing people, James can recognize a trap when he sees one. And this one is oh so transparent. Unfortunately, that doesn‚Äôt stop him from walking right into it. You just can‚Äôt help yourself can you? says the voice in his head that sounds strangely like his mother.

‚ÄúOh because you know Lily so well.‚Äù

‚ÄúI do.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúReally, cause from what I hear, you two aren‚Äôt so close anymore. And I don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôve noticed, Snivellus, but now at meals, she seats with me.‚Äù

Snape‚Äôs mouth forms a firm line and James is about to confidently turn back to his cleaning when:

‚ÄúDid he tell you, why we were fighting?‚Äù

That makes James pause, because, of course, he didn‚Äôt. Which isn‚Äôt unusual for Regulus. For every word he says James knows there are a dozen he doesn‚Äôt. Still, he can‚Äôt quite bring himself to admit that to Snape, who seems to understand it anyway, smiling again.

‚ÄúHe called her a mudblood.‚Äù

He says it so casually, that at first James doesn‚Äôt quite understand it. Can‚Äôt take it in.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù he asks unwillingly. He doesn‚Äôt want to play this game anymore.

‚ÄúSee?‚Äù Snape sneers. ‚ÄúHypocrite.‚Äù

James throws the trophy in his hand to the side, causing it to crash into the pile behind him. ‚ÄúLet me get this straight,‚Äù he says, the anger now clearly humming under his words. ‚ÄúHe just walked up to you in the middle of the night and went ‚Äòoh, hey Severus, you know that Lily Evans? She‚Äôs a‚Äî‚Äú his voice cuts out, unable to finish that sentence. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm supposed to believe that?‚Äù

Snape is clearly enjoying this.

‚ÄúNo. There was a bit more to it than that, though I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôd have liked any of the rest of it much better. A lot of boasting about his family and blood status. If memory serves, you‚Äôve done worse than shove people into walls for that kind of thing.‚Äù

James has a rotting feeling growing in the pit of his stomach. Because Snape is right. And God does he hate it.

‚ÄúAnd you were? What? Standing up for muggle-wizard equality?‚Äù James asks coldly, doing his best to hide the tremor in his voice.

Snape runs him up and down with his beady little eyes. ‚ÄúWell, you certainly weren‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúFuck you.‚Äù He wants to be able to say that he can‚Äôt picture it. But the terrible truth, is he thinks that Reg might‚Äîmight say those things‚Äîif he was pushed, if he was angry. The rotting feeling grows.

‚ÄúSo which is it Potter?‚Äù Snape asks with a sneer. ‚ÄúWhich side are you on?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell I‚Äôm sure as fuck not on your‚Äôs.‚Äù

Snape‚Äôs black eyes glint viciously in the candlelight. ‚ÄúAre you sure about that? Because I can promise you that Regulus certainly is.‚Äù

¬†

James is already in the Come and Go Room when Regulus gets there. He came right from detention. He sits at the end of the bed, elbows on his knees, hands clasped between them. He doesn‚Äôt look up when Regulus comes in. Doesn‚Äôt quite know how to handle himself.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù he hears Regulus stop. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre ‚Ä¶ early?‚Äù

‚ÄúYup.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt want to be angry with Regulus. He doesn‚Äôt want to believe Snape. He decides that if Regulus denies it he‚Äôll let it go. He‚Äôll trust him. Because he does, doesn‚Äôt he? Trust him?

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù Regulus asks cautiously, still standing by the door. And James knows he‚Äôs let the silence stretch on too long.

With a sigh he lifts his head, looking at Regulus and feeling the breath catch in his chest.

I love you.

I love you.

I love you.

He swallows with difficulty.

‚ÄúDid you call Lily a mudblood?‚Äù he usually avoids the word, but he doesn‚Äôt want there to be any ambiguity here.

Regulus blinks, surprised and then‚Äînothing. A mask. Empty eyes stare back at him. He hates it.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù there‚Äôs no inflection in his voice and James feels something icy drip down his spine.

‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù he practically whispers.

Regulus looks back at him like he doesn‚Äôt understand the question. ‚ÄúBecause she is one,‚Äù he says simply.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúUnless I‚Äôm mistaken she‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs muggleborn,‚Äù James interrupts, maybe more sharply than he means to, or maybe just as sharply as he means to, he can‚Äôt decide.

Regulus stares at him silently for a beat too long. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I don‚Äôt see the difference.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äî‚Äú James‚Äôs voice fails and all he can do is gape at the boy in front of him. It‚Äôs several moments before he seems to find himself again. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt see the difference?‚Äù he repeats, and when he gets no response he runs a hand over his face.

‚ÄúReg, are you kidding me?‚Äù

‚ÄúThey both mean the same thing‚Äî-‚Äú

‚ÄúBullshit,‚Äù he‚Äôs never raised his voice with Regulus before, and he sees the impact instantly. Sees Regulus‚Äôs walls go up. See his eyes grow hard. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs bullshit Regulus and you know it.‚Äù

Once again Regulus doesn‚Äôt respond, standing there stiffly in the middle of the room.

‚ÄúOne of them is describing someone whose family doesn‚Äôt have magic,‚Äù James tries again, a little desperate now. ‚ÄúThe other is attacking them. Those two things are not the same.‚Äù

Still nothing.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he gets to his feet but doesn‚Äôt move, just‚Äîjust trying to get some sort of response. ‚ÄúIs any of this getting through to you?‚Äù

He sees Regulus‚Äôs jaw clench, sees the struggle going on in his grey eyes. He just wishes he knew what it was about.

‚ÄúI understand your words,‚Äù he says carefully. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the sentiment I‚Äôm struggling with.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe sentiment?‚Äù James repeats, uneasily.

He can see Regulus‚Äôs frustration before he hears it, though whether it‚Äôs directed at James or himself James can‚Äôt tell. ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt‚Ä¶have‚Ä¶magic. They will never be us, be what we can be.‚Äù

James opens and closes his mouth several times before he manages to get something out. ‚ÄúSo what?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes narrow. ‚ÄúSo what?‚Äù he repeats almost mockingly.

‚ÄúWhat makes you think that we‚Äôre the only thing worth being? Or even the best thing? Look at‚Äîlook at this Reg!‚Äù he points up at the ceiling. ‚ÄúYou love this, this painting, this story, a wizard didn‚Äôt come up with any of that. But when this room tried to give you the things you needed most that‚Äôs what it chose‚Äîsomething muggle.‚Äù

Regulus has his eyes on the painting, it looks like he‚Äôs concentrating, trying to puzzle something out. James knows that this is what he‚Äôs like, that he goes quiet, that he needs to take his time with things. James has to be patient. But right now it feels as though his anxiety is going to break through his skin. He‚Äôd never thought‚Äîreally thought‚Äîthat Reg believed any of this. He was trapped in that house, trapped in Slytherin but he wasn‚Äôt‚Äîhe wasn‚Äôt one of them. Not really. Not his Reg. And right now James just needs him to prove it. Needs it desperately. Because he can already feel the cracks in his heart and he isn‚Äôt sure he can handle more.

‚ÄúI never really thought of it like that,‚Äù Regulus says finally, slowly, ‚Äúit‚Äôs just always seemed magical to me,‚Äù he shakes his head, eyes dropping back down. ‚ÄúThat sounds stupid I‚Äôm sure.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James thinks of that awe and wonder that has nothing to do with spells. ‚ÄúWho says wizards are the only ones with magic?‚Äù

Regulus looks away from James and then back again, like he can‚Äôt quite hold his gaze. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how to see the world the way you do. It‚Äôs‚Äîno one‚Äôs ever said anything like that to me. Or around me. If they had my mother probably would have dismembered them.‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure how much of that is a joke.

‚ÄúBut you still snuck out to those muggle museums,‚Äù he prods gently.

Regulus nods ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt really think about it at the time, I just‚Ä¶wanted to.‚Äù

That‚Äôs enough, James thinks, we can work with that.

‚ÄúReg, I get it, I do, but you need to‚Äîyou can‚Äôt‚Äîyou can‚Äôt go using that word, okay? You can‚Äôt go around calling people‚Äîbecause if you do then‚Äî‚Äú another sentence he can‚Äôt finish. ‚ÄúI just need you to promise okay?‚Äù James is losing the threads of his thoughts, all the things he knows need to be said but that he doesn‚Äôt know how to say.

Regulus nods again, warily. ‚ÄúOkay, if that‚Äôs what you want.‚Äù

Which isn‚Äôt exactly the enthusiastic response James was looking for but he‚Äôll take it. For now.

‚ÄúPromise?‚Äù

‚ÄúI promise James,‚Äù grey eyes unwavering. And James trusts him.

He trusts him.

He trusts him.

Doesn‚Äôt he?

He exhales a breath he wasn‚Äôt aware he was holding, before extending his hand‚Äîa question.

Regulus looks at it for a minute before walking forward, slotting his fingers between James‚Äôs and allowing himself to pulled in.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù James murmurs, resting his chin on Regulus‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù

The boy is warm and soft in his arms and it makes James‚Äôs bones ache. It frightens him, how much he feels about Regulus. And he finds himself wondering, for the first time, if maybe it‚Äôs wrong.

Chapter End Notes

Two things:

1) Okay, I don't want anyone selling organs - or babies - so I have come up with an epilogue that I actually really like and will end this story on a relatively nice-ish sweet-ish but still canon compliant-ish note. How, you may ask? I guess you'll have to find out.

2) I also want to make clear that like when I say "canon compliant" I don't mean that I'm all the sudden gonna turn this into a Jily fic, like Jily is going to happen, but the focus is always going to be on James and Regulus

I don't know if this chapter actually feels slow or if that's just me, but I promise that it was necessary set up and the next two chapters there's a lot more action/drama

It's really super fun and nice that you guys are so invested in these characters and what happens to them and I love reading your opinions so forever thank you!

Chapter 12

Chapter Notes

French translations will be in the end notes!

TW Referenced mass acts of violence (I'm so sorry idk how to tw this)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Dear James,

I will try to refrain from nagging you too much about your horrendously sparse letters lately, but let me just remind you that I literally birthed you from my body, so you could perhaps put in a bit more effort darling.

I enclosed the jumper you asked for (it was curled in a heap under your bed of course), tell me, does Remus let you boys get away with such poor cleanliness in his room? Should I write him for tips?

In any case, your father and I were both thrilled to hear about your win against Hufflepuff, he‚Äôs thinking about coming down for your next match so you‚Äôll have to let me know if that‚Äôs an idea you‚Äôd like me to get out of his head. I know how very uncool having your parents doting on you can be (I should let you know, he has gotten his old school scarf and Gryffindor jumper‚Äîyes, the one with the roaring lion on the front‚Äîready to go just for the occasion). He‚Äôs working quite a lot these days, I think he just wants something to look forward to. Not that I‚Äôm trying to guilt you into letting us come or anything (I too may have pulled my Gryffindor apparel from the basement, but that is purely a coincidence).

Your cousin Daphne is having a baby, I can tell you‚Äôre already pretending you don‚Äôt know who she is but I promise you you‚Äôve been introduced to her on several occasions. I‚Äôll be heading to Diagon Alley to pick out a present and I was thinking I‚Äôd get some new trainers for you and Sirius, you two were both looking ratty over Christmas. So you can be expecting those in the near future.

You see James Potter, this is a letter, look at all those words. Don‚Äôt you feel so much better informed now? I can feel our mother-son relationship strengthening with each sentence (be warned, if you reply to me with four sentences or less your father and I will be showing up to your quidditch game in matching lion jumpers whether you want us to or not).

Give my love to Sirius and the boys!

Sincerely,
your gracious, youthful, incredible mother

¬†

Mum,

Please. I‚Äôm begging you. Anything but the lion jumper. ANYTHING. You can come, sure, but be a little more chill about it okay? Like maybe wear a trench coat, some hats, sunglasses‚ÄîI‚Äôm just throwing out ideas here!

Listen, it‚Äôs not my fault my life is dull. I‚Äôm doing alright in classes, Frank has us practicing twice a day at this point, the tyrant, but that‚Äôs hardly new. Mostly everything is the same as it always is.Also, my room in not that messy. Me and Sirius are incredibly well kept young gentlemen I‚Äôll have you know. Well, I am anyway. And Remus is not the boss of us!!! (but please don‚Äôt tell him I said that)

Have they got dad working on the dark mark case? Is that why he‚Äôs so busy? Bloody mad that was, how it just appeared like that in the middle of London. Do you know anymore about what happened? Have they caught who did it?

See look, loads of words!

Sincerely,

the best son ever, James

¬†

A month after they get back from Christmas holidays the image of a skull eating a snake is projected into the sky over downtown London. Clearly magical. Clearly in violation of just about every line of the Statute of Secrecy. The Aurors have to oblivate a ton of muggles and spread a fake news story about how it was promotion for some film or something. No one knows where it came from or what it means, and the Ministry has been infuriatingly tightlipped. Of course, there are rumours that it‚Äôs connected to the Death Eaters, but they‚Äôve never done anything like this before. Anything this big.

‚ÄúBullshit,‚Äù Sirius mutters, crumpling up the Daily Prophet in his hands before incendio-ing it.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Peter tries to lean away, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre getting ash in my eggs,‚Äù he says, mouth full.

‚ÄúNothing again?‚Äù James asks, not bothering to look up.

‚ÄúWhat the hell are they playing at?‚Äù Sirius demands indignantly, fist slamming down on the table so hard the cutlery rattles. ‚ÄúHow can they say nothing? How can they KNOW nothing? It‚Äôs been months at this point. I mean, don‚Äôt we deserve some kind of, I don‚Äôt know, fucking explanation?‚Äù

It‚Äôs strange for James, to see the differences between Sirius and Regulus. When they first heard about the mark Sirius got loud and angry and reckless‚Äîthere have been a lot of scuffles in the corridors. Not that James is in any position to criticize, he‚Äôs been getting into a fair few fights of his own recently. But Reg? Reg got quiet. There were a few nights where they just lay next to each other, not touching, not talking. It should have been boring, frustrating, but it wasn‚Äôt. It was nice to have him there, at James‚Äôs side, even if he couldn‚Äôt explain to James what he was feeling, even if he needed to disappear for a bit. Things are better now, but the same way that Sirius‚Äôs anger lingers just under his skin, so does Reg‚Äôs silence.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre hiding something,‚Äù Remus speaks up, drawing James‚Äôs attention across the table.

‚ÄúYou think someone in the Ministry had something to do with it?‚Äù James asks, feeling a bit uneasy about that, seeing as his dad is part of the Ministry.

Remus just shrugs. ‚ÄúI think they fucked up, and now they‚Äôre trying to fix it before they have to admit to it.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell they‚Äôre doing a shit job,‚Äù Sirius growls. ‚ÄúHow hard can it be to find them? I mean they were casting in the middle of London, someone had to have seen them!‚Äù

‚ÄúMaybe they have found them and they just don‚Äôt want to release their names to the public,‚Äù Remus says, pushing the food around on his plate.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James says sternly, ‚Äúthey wouldn‚Äôt do that, no way.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying, the Death Eaters have a lot of sympathizers within the Ministry.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat are you talking about?‚Äù James doesn‚Äôt know why this feels like a personal attack but for some reason it does. ‚ÄúThe Minister of Magic has come out a dozen times renouncing them, he put more dementors on Azakaban to make sure the prisoners were secure‚Äîthe Ministry does not support these assholes.‚Äù

Remus sighs, looking up from his plate. ‚ÄúYou know I‚Äôm not talking about your dad, right?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell I don‚Äôt know how you could not be,‚Äù James says defensively.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying,‚Äù he goes on, sounding a bit exasperated, ‚Äúthat I don‚Äôt think we can trust everything the Ministry tells us.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm with Moony,‚Äù Sirius pipes up, and James turns to him with a look of betrayal on his face.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not talking about Fleamont, obviously,‚Äù Sirius goes on. ‚ÄúBut my dad worked for the Ministry too, and my cousins‚Äô awful husbands are working there now. The way I reckon it, the good guys are outnumbered.‚Äù

James officially hates this conversation.

His eyes skate over to the Slytherin table. They stand out starkly from the rest of the hall. He‚Äôs not saying it‚Äôs all of them, not saying that there aren‚Äôt some Slytherins‚Äô with tense faces and slouched shoulders. He‚Äôs just saying it‚Äôs a lot less than the rest of the school.

James sighs, pushing his plate away and getting to his feet.

‚ÄúWhere are you going?‚Äù Sirius asks. ‚ÄúClass doesn‚Äôt start for another half-hour.‚Äù

James holds up the folded parchment in his hand. ‚ÄúGotta post a letter to my mum, I‚Äôll see you in charms?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, alright.‚Äù

James pats him on the shoulder, giving Peter and Remus a nod before heading out of the hall and towards the owlery.

Things are‚Ä¶okay‚Ä¶between him and Sirius. He‚Äôs at least talking to James again, which is something. But there‚Äôs an undeniable stiffness to their conversations. It makes James's skin crawl. He keeps telling himself to follow Lily‚Äôs advice and apologize. Or admit that he‚Äôs scared. Say something. Anything. But months have passed and he still hasn‚Äôt. Tomorrow, he keeps telling himself, I‚Äôll do it tomorrow.

The one upside to this, if there is any, is that it seems to have forced Sirius and Remus to come to some sort of agreement. James isn‚Äôt exactly sure what it is, he just knows that the weirder things get between him and Sirius the easier they get with Sirius and Remus. He tries to think of it as a good thing. Tries not to be jealous. Not to hate Remus for it.

So things are tense. Tense at school. Tense outside of school. You can feel it when you walk down the halls, feel it in the whispered insults and rumours. Who cast the mark? Where are they? Why haven‚Äôt they been caught? In the white faces of the first years you see the other fear: are they coming for us?

Honestly, James is sick of it. So maybe that‚Äôs why, on his way back down from the owlery, when he spots a head of short, black curls disappearing around the corner in front of him, he decides that charms is not at all what he wants to do be doing with his morning.

Luckily, the corridor Regulus turns down is empty and James settles himself against the wall, watching the back in front of him for a minute before letting out a whistle.

Regulus looks over his shoulder, sees James, does a double take, then slows to a stop and turns around. He stands there for a few minutes, seemingly unable to decide whether to be surprised or annoyed.

‚ÄúCan I help you Potter?‚Äù he asks eventually.

James smirks. ‚ÄúI bet you can,‚Äù he nods towards the door beside him, and sees Regulus recognize it for what it is.

‚ÄúA broom cupboard Potter? Really? How gauche of you.‚Äù But he steps forward anyway, eyes darting around the hallway, checking that they‚Äôre still alone.

‚ÄúBroom cupboards are highly undervalued spaces you know.‚Äù

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúAre they?‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúEveryone always goes on and on about the towers and the great hall and the moving staircases. But when do they ever talk about the real backbone of this castle?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe broom cupboards?‚Äù he can see Regulus fighting off a smile and it makes something warm pool in James‚Äôs stomach.

He opens the door, gesturing with a dramatic bow for Regulus to enter. ‚ÄúThe broom cupboards.‚Äù

As soon as the door closes behind them Regulus rounds on James, sending him a pointed look. ‚ÄúYou going to tell me what the hell this is about?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs hair is still short, but it‚Äôs grown enough that little curls have started to wisp around his ears and the back of his neck. James is a little obsessed with it, if he‚Äôs being honest.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù Regulus asks, and James realizes he‚Äôs been staring.

‚ÄúSorry, you‚Äôre very distracting‚Äù he grins out of the corner of his mouth and watches Regulus blush even as he rolls his eyes.

‚ÄúYeah, yeah‚Äîwhat do you want?‚Äù

‚ÄúI just realized what day it is, that‚Äôs all,‚Äù James says, still grinning as he leans back against the door.

Regulus looks at him flatly. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Wednesday.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes. It‚Äôs the Wednesday I take you into the forest.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence.

‚ÄúHave you lost your mind?‚Äù

‚ÄúJury‚Äôs out on whether or not I had it to begin with,‚Äù James quips, and then, more sincerely; ‚ÄúC‚Äômon Reg, it‚Äôll be fun. Besides, I have something I want to show you.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh well, in that case,‚Äù he says sarcastically. ‚ÄúJames, I have transfiguration in fifteen minutes.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh, but what if you didn‚Äôt though?‚Äù

Regulus is apparently so outraged by this statement that all he can manage in response is a series of indignant noises that James has to try very hard not to laugh at.

After enduring a few seconds of silent glaring James holds out his hand and, reluctantly, Regulus allows himself to be pulled forward, pressing into James who bends down, nosing at the spot just behind Regulus‚Äôs ear. James‚Äôs lips brush his skin and he feels Regulus shiver.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon on Reg,‚Äù he hums, ‚Äúbreak the rules for me.‚Äù

Regulus scoffs but it lacks conviction. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm already breaking the rules.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo break them a little more,‚Äù he kisses him gently just under his jaw.

‚ÄúYou‚Äîare ridiculous.‚Äù

‚ÄúMhm,‚Äù James continues his light kisses, innocent, purposeless, trailing all along his neck.

‚ÄúMerlin‚Äîfine‚ÄîFINE,‚Äù he‚Äôs breathing heavy when he steps back, face fully red now, and James can‚Äôt help but look smug.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to kill me one of these days,‚Äù Regulus murmurs, running a hand over his short hair, trying to straighten himself out.

‚ÄúNah, never. What would I do without you?‚Äù he sends him a smile that makes something flicker in Regulus‚Äôs eyes.

He has half a mind to ask him about it but doesn‚Äôt want to push his luck. ‚ÄúYou wait here‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúWait here? In the broom cupboard?‚Äù

‚Äú‚ÄîI‚Äôll go grab the invisibility cloak,‚Äù ignoring him as his hand reaches for the doorknob. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll take me five minutes.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames Potter, I am not going to wait for you in a broom cupboard!‚Äù

¬†

Regulus does wait for him in a broom cupboard‚Äîeven if he makes several angry comments about it under his breath after James gets back. With the cloak it‚Äôs incredibly easy to get out of the castle and passed the Care for Magical Creatures class on the lawn outside. Spring is only just blooming, the weather still cold enough that you need a jacket or sweater. But the snow is gone, and today the sun is out, making it feel warmer than it is. James waits until they‚Äôre sufficiently past the tree line before he takes the cloak off.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe I let you convince me to do this,‚Äù Regulus mumbles, wand held in his hand like he‚Äôs expecting to be attacked at any moment. Which is fair enough, there are a bunch of nasties in these trees, luckily James knows this place pretty well by now. Knows where to go and what not to step on.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve never skived off class before.‚Äù

James smiles down at him, stepping over a fallen trunk. ‚ÄúWhat? No! I‚Äôm shocked.‚Äù

Regulus shoves him into a nearby tree and James lets out a laugh that is, admittedly, quite loud.

‚ÄúMerlin, keep your voice down before everything in here knows where we are.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes, pushing some bushes out of the way as he leads them on. ‚ÄúEverything worth being afraid of already knows we‚Äôre here.‚Äù

The branches are thick over their heads causing the sunlight to drip down, lighting the way in tiny puddles.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry what?‚Äù Regulus turns to him, indignant.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, they won‚Äôt bother us as long as we don‚Äôt bother them. Just stay out of their space.‚Äù

‚ÄúTheir space,‚Äù Regulus repeats slowly, like it‚Äôs the stupidest thing he‚Äôs ever heard. ‚ÄúHow do you know what their space is, exactly?‚Äù

James shoots him a smile. ‚ÄúYou follow me.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, because you‚Äôre the beast whisperer are you?‚Äù

‚ÄúI just happen to have excellent intuition,‚Äù he looks at Regulus out of the corner of his eye. ‚ÄúAlso, maybe don‚Äôt call them beasts.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

James shrugs. ‚ÄúJust not very polite, is it?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat or two of silence before Regulus laughs, his laugh is softer than James‚Äôs, quieter. It‚Äôs something James always wishes he could hold in his hand or slip in his back pocket and keep for later.

‚ÄúYou are an enigma you know that?‚Äù

‚ÄúMe?‚Äù James demands, slightly outraged. ‚ÄúYou, Regulus Black, want to call ME an enigma?‚Äù

‚ÄúHalf the time you‚Äôre this obnoxious Quidditch lad‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI am not a lad. How am I a lad? I don‚Äôt have "lad" energy at all!‚Äù

‚ÄúOh yes, you do,‚Äù Regulus goes on, clearly enjoying this a little too much. ‚ÄúWalking through the halls like you own the place, like some bloody jock teen heartthrob‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOi! You‚Äôre also a jock.‚Äù

But Regulus shakes his head. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm on the Quidditch team,‚Äù he says, ducking below a low hanging branch, ‚Äúbut I‚Äôm not a jock.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat makes no sense at all.‚Äù

Regulus only waves him off. ‚ÄúYou really should be such an airhead and then‚Äîthen‚Äîit‚Äôs like you think about everyone all the time. You care more than anyone I‚Äôve ever met it‚Äôs‚Äî‚Äú he shakes his head, lost for words. And then; ‚ÄúI get it though, why Sirius was drawn to you. Why he became so obsessed.‚Äù

James scoffs, unable to tell if Regulus is being sincere or just having a laugh. ‚ÄúSirius has never been obsessed with me.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, he has. He is. I used to hate it.‚Äù

And doesn‚Äôt that just peak James‚Äôs interest. ‚ÄúWere you jealous?‚Äù

Regulus huffs out a laugh. ‚ÄúOf course I was jealous. You were cooler than me, and older than me, and I knew exactly what was going to happen.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd what‚Äôs that?‚Äù

Regulus is quiet for a moment, the noise of twigs snapping under their feet the only thing filling the space between them.

‚ÄúI knew you were going to take him away,‚Äù he says it like he doesn‚Äôt want to. Like it has to fight its way out of his mouth.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I took him away as much as you lot forced him out‚Äî‚Äú and then, of course, his brain catches up with his mouth and he realizes what he‚Äôs just said. ‚ÄúOr‚Äînot you, but‚Äî‚Äú

Luckily, he‚Äôs saved from having to explain himself as they break through the foliage and into the clearing on the other side. Regulus lets out a gasp that James is pretty sure he‚Äôs going to be replaying in his head for the next week.

‚ÄúSweet, huh?‚Äù James says smugly, looking out at the small waterfall in front of them. The water slips down the rocks and pools in a decent sized pond at the bottom, the green vines snaking along the stones only just starting to bud with little pink flowers. He found it last year during one of the full moons, and he‚Äôs been back with Sirius a few times since.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs beautiful,‚Äù Regulus says, without the trees over their heads the sun pours down uninterrupted, making the water sparkle.

James nods, knocking his shoulder against Regulus‚Äôs before stepping forward and starting to unbutton his shirt.

‚ÄúUm‚Äîexcuse me? What are you doing?‚Äù

‚ÄúGoing swimming, obviously,‚Äù he shoots Regulus a grin as he slides the shirt off his shoulders.

‚ÄúSwimming?‚Äù Regulus repeats indignantly. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt go swimming in there James, are you completely insane?‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd why not?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, for starters, it‚Äôs going to be freezing.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh, good point,‚Äù James pulls out his wand, casting a warming charm over the water before bending down to check the temperature with fingers. ‚ÄúPerfect,‚Äù he winks at Regulus over his shoulder, the younger boy looking scandalized.

‚ÄúDid you just‚Äîdid you just warm the whole pond?‚Äù he asks

‚ÄúMmhm,‚Äù James straightens up, dropping his wand onto the pile with his shirt and glasses.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs‚Äîthat‚Äôs a complicated variation on that spell,‚Äù he says, somewhere between impressed and annoyed.

‚ÄúIs it?‚Äù James asks innocently, slipping out of his trousers and standing in front of Regulus in his pants. ‚ÄúWell, c‚Äômon?‚Äù

‚ÄúWait‚ÄîJames‚ÄîJesus, you absolute mad man, you can‚Äôt just go jumping into a random body of water in this forest of all places!‚Äù he sounds nearly hysterical and James has to bite down on his lower lip to keep from laughing. ‚ÄúYou have no idea what could be in there.‚Äù

He does actually, having been in several times. First as a stag, of course, always safer that way.

‚ÄúReckon we might run into some mermaids?‚Äù he asks cheekily.

Regulus gives him a flat look. ‚ÄúThat would not be nearly as fun as you seem to think it would be.‚Äù

James shrugs. ‚ÄúWell, only one way to find out.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, there is definitely more than one way to find out.‚Äù

‚ÄúC‚Äômon Reg,‚Äù he stands at the edge of the shore, back to the water, ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs life without a little risk?‚Äù

‚ÄúSafe.‚Äù

James only laughs as he falls back into the water. It‚Äôs deceptively deep, and he flips himself around so he can dive further down before coming back up for air.

‚ÄúJames Potter I swear to merlin if whatever is in that water doesn‚Äôt kill you I will,‚Äù he hears as he breaks the surface. Reg is on his hands and knees at the water‚Äôs edge, a stern look on his face.

James shakes out his hair, swimming back over. ‚ÄúSeems a bit contradictory, don‚Äôt you think?‚Äù

Regulus makes a growling noise that James secretly loves.

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù he says softly, sincere as he can manage. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs safe, I promise.‚Äù

Regulus searches his face for a moment. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve done this before?‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúAbout a dozen times.‚Äù

Regulus looks no less exasperated. ‚ÄúWhat kind of person wanders into a deadly forest just to have an afternoon swim?‚Äù

James only rolls his eyes, diving back below the surface. The water is so clear that he‚Äôs almost certain this whole place has been magicked, by the founders or someone who came after. Everything about it is so idyllic‚Äîso juxtaposed to the rest of the dark, overgrown forest.

He comes back to the surface and finds Regulus on his feet again, shoes and socks off, shirt halfway undone.

‚ÄúThere we go,‚Äù James smiles, spitting water out of his mouth.

Regulus sends him a dry look. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm doing this.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can, it‚Äôs brilliant.‚Äù

The younger boy shimmies out of his shirt and James feels something tug hard on his gut. He‚Äôd forgotten that he‚Äôd never seen Regulus anything but fully dressed before and he hadn‚Äôt quite prepared himself for what it would feel like. Which apparently is overwhelming. Shirtless Regulus, James realizes, is a special kind of weakness for him.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre sure there‚Äôs nothing in here that‚Äôs going to eat me?‚Äù Regulus does away with his trousers and comes to stand at the edge of the water. ‚ÄúJames?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat? Sorry?‚Äù James shakes himself, trying to focus.

‚ÄúNo sea monsters, oui?‚Äù

James blinks. ‚ÄúWas that French? Did you just speak French to me?‚Äù He‚Äôs not sure his heart can handle this.

Regulus blushes. ‚ÄúSorry, it just slipped out.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo NOT apologize. Say something else.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúIn French, say something else,‚Äù James is treading water, shoulders bobbing in and out of the pond, and he‚Äôs glad to have an excuse for the breathless sound of his voice.

For a moment he doesn‚Äôt think Reg is going to do it, he just stands there watching him. And then; ‚ÄúJ'ai peur de te blesser,‚Äù his voice is soft, changed by the different accent, the syllables gooey in a way they aren‚Äôt in English, ‚Äúparce que je t'aime. Je pense que je le ferai toujours.‚Äù

James makes a pleased humming noise. ‚ÄúWhat did you say?‚Äù

Regulus blinks before looking away. ‚ÄúI said your hair looks ridiculous.‚Äù

James scowls. ‚ÄúDid not.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre you suddenly fluent in French Potter?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, please,‚Äù he rolls his eyes, ‚Äúdon‚Äôt start with ‚ÄòPotter‚Äô again. Makes me feel like I‚Äôm in detention or something.‚Äù

Regulus snorts. ‚ÄúA familiar feeling for you, I‚Äôm sure.‚Äù

‚ÄúHar, har, har, now get in here before I drag you in.‚Äù

‚ÄúPfft,‚Äù Regulus scoffs. ‚ÄúYou woul‚Äî‚Äú

But before he can finish he gets a face full of water as James splashes, what seems like, nearly half the pond on him.

‚ÄúYou. Are. Five.‚Äù Regulus bites out, wiping the water from his face.

James only laughs. ‚ÄúBig words from the man still standing on the shore,‚Äù he starts to swim further out, but stays on his back so that he doesn‚Äôt break eyes contact with Regulus. ‚ÄúCome on Black, come and get me.‚Äù

He sees the light flash in Regulus‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre mine Potter.‚Äù

James laughs again, turning to swim away properly as he hears Regulus hit the water.

Yes, he thinks, cutting across the pond. Yes I am.

¬†

A while later they‚Äôre lying on their backs in the sun, Regulus dressed again, James still in just his pants, both with their eyes closed, enjoying the warmth.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll have to go back eventually, I can‚Äôt skip out on the whole day,‚Äù Regulus says, causing James to make a childish grumbling noise.

‚ÄúUgh why? School is so miserable. Here is so nice.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, nice until something eats us.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúNothing is going to eat us.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf you say so.‚Äù

James cracks his eyes open, turning his head to look at Regulus. It really is a bit ridiculous, how much he enjoys it, just watching him. How he could do it all day. His skin is flushed from the sun, curls slightly tighter after the water. James wants to run his hands through them but he‚Äôs pretty sure Reg doesn‚Äôt want to be touched right now. He‚Äôs gotten good at picking up on his moods, on the way they shift. There are good days and bad days, sure, but there are also good moments and bad moments. It changes, even within the time they spend together. James understands that, even if he doesn‚Äôt know why.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre staring,‚Äù Regulus says without opening his eyes.

James smiles. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre beautiful.‚Äù

Regulus makes an indignant noise. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why you say that.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why you don‚Äôt believe it.‚Äù

He sees Regulus tense and then force himself to relax. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never heard it before.‚Äù

Which James thinks is a travesty. ‚ÄúWell, you are.‚Äù

Silence drifts back around them, filled by the noise of the breeze in the trees and the humming of the water beside them.

‚ÄúHey Reg?‚Äù James finds himself asking.

‚ÄúMm?‚Äù

‚ÄúHave you‚Äîhave you done this," he motions between the two of them ‚Äú‚Ä¶before?‚Äù

He feels the stillness as much as he sees it, watching Regulus‚Äôs adam‚Äôs apple bob up and down as he swallows.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù he says carefully.

James thinks that, deep down, he already knew that, but still he finds himself surprised by it. ‚ÄúWas it serious?‚Äù

He watches lines appear on Regulus‚Äôs face as he squeezes his eyes more tightly closed.

‚ÄúI guess that would depend on your idea of serious.‚Äù

James accepts this, resisting the urge to reach out and smooth the wrinkles from his face. ‚ÄúThey never told you you were beautiful?‚Äù

He hears Regulus's breathing hitch.

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he interrupts quickly. ‚ÄúI‚Äîthey didn‚Äôt see me that way. Most people don‚Äôt see me the way you see me. Je ne le m√©rite pas.‚Äù

James feels his chest grow tight at the tone of Regulus's voice, rolling towards him and onto his side. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not the way I see you. It‚Äôs just the way you are.‚Äù

Regulus brings his hands up to cover his face. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt‚Äîsay things like that‚Äîto me.‚Äù His words are choked, like he doesn‚Äôt have the air to force them out.

‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause they hurt.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey aren‚Äôt supposed to.‚Äù

Regulus nods, dropping his hands to look at James again. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

And oh that look. That look breaks his heart.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù James whispers, but Regulus just shakes his head.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be,‚Äù he reaches out and runs his hand through James‚Äôs wet hair, James closes his eyes falling into the touch. ‚ÄúI just wish I‚ÄîI just wish this was easier.‚Äù

There‚Äôs is a delicacy to this confession. A vulnerability that James knows Regulus hates. His hand pauses, thumb rubbing gentle circles into James‚Äôs temple.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think important things are supposed to be easy,‚Äù he says, voice soft. He opens his eyes to find that Regulus has rolled onto his side as well. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre important Reg, you‚Äôre so fucking important. Especially to me.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes widen, thumb stilling. ‚ÄúJe ne te m√©rite pas,‚Äù he mumbles again.

‚ÄúWhat does that mean?‚Äù James asks, practically whispering, anything else would feel too loud in the fragile space that‚Äôs built up around them.

Regulus looks back at him, grey eyes full of so much feeling they nearly swallow James whole. Eventually he exhales, propping himself up on his elbow and leaning down to press a chaste kiss to James‚Äôs mouth. He can taste the water. The sunlight. The sadness.

Regulus pulls back, still leaning over him. ‚ÄúI said your hair looks ridiculous.‚Äù

A choked laugh finds its way up James‚Äôs throat. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe you,‚Äù he turns his head, kissing the palm of the hand that‚Äôs still holding him.

Regulus smiles sadly. ‚ÄúGood.‚Äù

¬†

They head back to the castle for lunch. James makes several attempts to dry his hair with little success. Domestic spells have never been his strong suit but even Regulus can‚Äôt seem to get it to work.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs just so much of it,‚Äù he says, exasperated.

‚ÄúWhatever, if anyone asks I‚Äôll just tell them I took a shower or something.‚Äù

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúDo people often ask you about your hair?‚Äù

‚ÄúObviously,‚Äù he makes a show of primping it, ‚Äúit‚Äôs got quite the fan club.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure it does.‚Äù

They part in an empty corridor, James whipping off the cloak and Regulus instantly pulling away.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you later, yeah?‚Äù

The younger boy nods, ‚Äúyeah.‚Äù

James makes a run back to Gryffindor tower to drop off the cloak and grab his books. He tries to do something with his hair again but it‚Äôs no use.

‚ÄúYou are bloody ridiculous,‚Äù he mutters at it before giving up and heading for the Great Hall. He‚Äôs about two corridors away when he spots his friends, chatting against the wall outside of class. He‚Äôs in such a good mood that he forgets that he ditched them without any warning this morning. That he went to the owlery and never came back. Forgets that they will almost certainly demand an explanation. He blames the sun. Blames Regulus‚Äôs mouth. They‚Äôve made his brain go fuzzy.

‚ÄúJames!‚Äù Peter is the first one to see him, causing the other two to swivel towards him.

James smiles until he sees the expression on Sirius‚Äôs face.

Oh, he thinks.

Oh shit.

‚ÄúThat was some trip to the owlery,‚Äù his friend says coldly.

‚ÄúEr‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúIs your hair wet?‚Äù Remus asks, squinting at him.

Fuck.

‚ÄúYeah, I took a shower.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhere?‚Äù Sirius demands, voice almost as sharp as the look in his eyes.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhere did you take a shower? Because it wasn‚Äôt in our room, we checked.‚Äù

James opens and closes his mouth several times but can‚Äôt quite make any words come out.

‚ÄúWhat? Nothing?‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius,‚Äù Remus cautions, James appreciates the effort, but they both know it‚Äôs a lost cause.

‚ÄúYou taking your ‚Äòwalks‚Äô in the middle of the day now? Damn Jamie, it‚Äôs a miracle you can stand with all the bloody walking you do.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo, fuck you,‚Äù Sirius cuts him off, clearly fuming. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so tired of your bullshit. I mean, you can‚Äôt even be bothered to come up with a decent lie for fucks sake. You couldn‚Äôt care less about us if you tried.‚Äù

‚ÄúOKAY,‚Äù James cuts across him, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs not fair.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah whatever, I‚Äôm done with this,‚Äù Sirius makes to walk away but James grabs his arm and then, in a split second decision, starts dragging him towards the empty classroom next to them.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Sirius says indignantly, but he doesn‚Äôt really put up much of a fight.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù Remus steps forward, eyes travelling nervously between the pair of them, clearly unsure of whether or not he should step in.

‚ÄúMe and Pads need to have a talk, we‚Äôll meet you guys in the great hall, yeah?‚Äù

Remus still hesitates, hovering in the doorway as James shoves Sirius inside.

‚ÄúMoony, I‚Äôm not going to fight him, I promise. I just want to talk.‚Äù
