James looks up to see Alice beckoning them over to the corner where, her, Peter and Frank are currently huddling, crumb filled paper plates in their hands.

‚ÄúNow where have you two been?‚Äù Alice raises her eyebrows as her gaze bounces between the pair of them in an insinuating manner.

‚ÄúMerlin Alice, we‚Äôre at a funeral,‚Äù Lily mutters.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not quite a denial.‚Äù

‚ÄúHave you seen Remus?‚Äù James asks, before the conversation can truly go off the rails.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs over there,‚Äù Frank answers, gesturing with his chin at the front of the room where Sirius and Remus are standing side by side at his mum‚Äôs coffin.

‚ÄúAh.‚Äù

Lily shakes her head. ‚ÄúTold you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll wait.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúLily.‚Äù

‚ÄúWait for what?‚Äù Alice butts in, pulling their attention back to her.

Lily lets out a heavy sigh. ‚ÄúMary has gotten it into her head that Remus needs rescuing.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not wrong.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlice!‚Äù

Alice holds her hands up in surrender. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying, he looks more and more defeated with every passing second and he wasn‚Äôt exactly in great shape to start with.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell can you blame him?‚Äù Peter asks. ‚ÄúThis place gives me the creeps, especially that thing,‚Äù he gestures at the coffin with his half-eaten ham sandwich. For a moment, everyone goes silent and James feels his hackles raise.

He turns to face Peter properly. ‚ÄúThat thing?‚Äù he repeats, making Peter‚Äôs eyes go wide.

‚ÄúShit, sorry I didn‚Äôt‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt mean it like that.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat ‚Äúthing‚Äù is Remus‚Äôs mum and if I ever hear you speak about her like that again I swear Peter‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúJames I know, I‚Äôm sorry, it slipped out.‚Äù

The problem is, James can‚Äôt quite see how something like that just slips out. And God, what if Remus had been here? What if he had heard?

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù Frank nudges him and James tears his eyes away from Peter to watch Sirius and Remus walking away from the coffin.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he says, not taking his eyes off his two best mates. ‚ÄúYou lot go wait by the car yeah? It‚Äôs just in the back lot.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù Lily hisses, moving to his side. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know if this is what he wants.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have a pretty good idea,‚Äù he starts moving, and a second later he feels Lily matching his strides, muttering curses at him under her breath.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James says softly as they meet Sirius and Remus by the wall. Remus is pale faced, blue bruises under his eyes, blond hair almost as much of a mess as James‚Äôs.

‚ÄúProngs,‚Äù Sirius says casually, though James can see the tension in him. It‚Äôs hard, watching other people hurting and not being able to stop it.

‚ÄúSo‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúListen, Remus,‚Äù Lily interrupts him, and it‚Äôs work for James not to roll his eyes. Sirius raises his brow but doesn‚Äôt say anything. ‚ÄúI just want you to know that this is all up to you, and all any of us want is to make sure that you‚Äôre okay‚Äîor as okay as you can be.‚Äù

Remus looks from her to James and back again. ‚ÄúEr‚Äîthanks? Why do I feel like I‚Äôm about to get kidnapped?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, funny you should say that‚Äîow!‚Äù James winces as Lily elbows his side.

‚ÄúBasically, our friends are ridiculous,‚Äù Lily goes on, pulling a smile out of Remus, even if it‚Äôs only a ghost of what it normally is.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve noticed that, yeah.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd they seem to be under the impression,‚Äù she goes on grudgingly, ‚Äúthat you need to be rescued.‚Äù

Remus gets that wrinkle between his eyebrows that he always does when he‚Äôs confused and Sirius turns to James mouthing: Rescued?

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand,‚Äù Remus says slowly.

‚ÄúWell that‚Äôs probably because you aren‚Äôt insane.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúListen,‚Äù he steps in, ‚ÄúMary‚Äôs gone and nicked her dad‚Äôs car and is waiting outside in the parking lot in case you wanna make a speedy escape‚ÄîOW!‚Äù he rounds on Lily. ‚ÄúWas that necessary? I was literally just relaying the situation?‚Äù he rubs irritably at his side.

‚ÄúIt was necessary,‚Äù she says, head held high. ‚ÄúIt made me feel better.‚Äù

Gritting his teeth he turns back to Remus.‚ÄúWhat do you say mate? It‚Äôs up to you.‚Äù

Remus hesitates, looking over his shoulder at the coffin. At his mum. After a few seconds he sighs.

‚ÄúFuck it. Lets get out of here.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou sure?‚Äù Sirius asks, pulling lightly on Remus‚Äôs sleeve, bringing his eyes back to him.

Remus nods. ‚ÄúYeah, I‚Äôve said my goodbyes. Besides, I can‚Äôt breathe in this place.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell alright then,‚Äù James looks very pointedly at Lily. ‚ÄúHappy now?‚Äù

She rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon, everyone else is already outside, Remus do you need to say goodbye or‚Ä¶?‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs eyes trail over to the people he‚Äôd been sitting with during the ceremony. James doesn‚Äôt recognize any of them, can‚Äôt remember seeing pictures of them in Remus‚Äôs house or ever hearing him talk about any family other than his parents.

Eventually Remus shakes his head, ‚ÄúNah,‚Äù he looks away. ‚ÄúLets just get out of here, okay?‚Äù

Lily nods. ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù

The beauty of Lily Evans, James is coming to realize‚Äîwell, one of many‚Äîis that she always knows when to push and when to let things go.

¬†

‚ÄúFINALLY!‚Äù Mary shouts at them as they walk up to the still idling car.

‚ÄúAre we all supposed to fit in there?‚Äù Remus asks.

Now looking at the car properly James can understand the confusion, it can‚Äôt be more than a five seater tops.

Mary rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúOne day with a bunch of Muggles and you forget that magic exists. Alice cast an extension charm on it, now get in. If we stand here any longer I‚Äôm going to be personally responsible for creating a new hole in the ozone layer.‚Äù

They slide into the back of the car which has, indeed, been stretched out like a limousine.

‚ÄúAlright captain,‚Äù Alice calls out as James slams the door closed behind them. ‚ÄúWhere to now?‚Äù

‚ÄúSeaside, obviously,‚Äù Mary says as she starts pulling out into the road.

James turns to Lily for an explanation. ‚ÄúSeaside?‚Äù

‚ÄúDoes what it says on the tin Potter,‚Äù she leans forward between the front two seats. ‚ÄúMary, that‚Äôs an hour drive.‚Äù

‚ÄúHa!‚Äù Mary scoffs. ‚ÄúNot the way I drive.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy does that sound like a threat?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause it is,‚Äù Marlene says dryly.

‚ÄúI can help too,‚Äù Alice pipes up, causing everyone to turn to her.

‚ÄúYou know how to drive?‚Äù Lily asks.

Alice laughs. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not,‚Äù then slides her wand out of her sleeve. ‚ÄúBut I know how to make things move faster.‚Äù

Beside her Frank is shaking his head. ‚ÄúMoody is gonna kill us.‚Äù

‚ÄúPlease, Moody loves me.‚Äù

‚ÄúGod, I‚Äôve missed you Alice,‚Äù Mary sings from the front seat.

Lily sits back beside James, rolling down her window and letting the crisp fall wind whip through the car. The clouds are almost gone now, just in time to watch the sky start to warm up as the sun dips towards the horizon, pinks and oranges mixing over their heads.

‚ÄúHow long until the last Portkey?‚Äù James asks no one in particular.

‚ÄúEleven thirty,‚Äù Lily answers, and at James‚Äôs raised brow; ‚ÄúI think McGonagall wanted to make sure Remus didn‚Äôt feel rushed.‚Äù

James nods, eyes trailing over to the boy in question who has pulled his tie loose around his neck, undoing the first few buttons of his shirt and dropping his head back against the seats.

Sirius looks up then, eyes meeting James‚Äôs. He can read the concern in his friend‚Äôs stare, knows that feeling intimately. He‚Äôs felt it every time Regulus has come back from Grimmauld, torn apart in ways that James can‚Äôt even imagine. And all he‚Äôs been able to do is stand there.

Don‚Äôt worry, he wants to tell Sirius. We‚Äôll take care of him. Even if we don‚Äôt know how‚Äîhow to put someone back together. We‚Äôll figure it out. We always do.

Marlene flips on the radio and her and Mary start arguing over stations. Alice rests her head on Frank‚Äôs shoulder though every once and a while James sees her flick her wand. She catches him staring and winks. Not twenty minutes into the drive Peter is passed out, snoring and leaning dangerously close to Sirius who looks about ready to hex him. Next to James Lily has her head out the window, hair whipping back from her face, sunset glowing in her green eyes. James very purposefully doesn‚Äôt look too closely, or think about the way she smells of apples and clean laundry. Eventually he feels his own eyes drifting closed.

¬†

‚ÄúMerlin, he sleeps like a corpse.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs cause he gets up at five in the bleeding morning.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt get him‚ÄîSirius can you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúStand aside, let the master work,‚Äù There‚Äôs rustling. And then: ‚ÄúPRONGS GET THE FUCK UP!‚Äù

James startles, clutching at his ears as he sits up, banging his head against the car door as he goes.

‚ÄúGodric‚Äôs balls,‚Äù James curses, glaring up at a very smug looking Sirius. Lily is standing beside him, trying and failing not to laugh.

It takes James a minute to realize it‚Äôs gotten dark, the car around him empty.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve arrived then?‚Äù

Sirius nods, reaching into the car and and clapping James‚Äôs shoulder, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve arrived,‚Äù and then, as he pulls away; ‚ÄúMight wanna take off your shoes‚Äîsand.‚Äù

James rubs at the back of his head bitterly.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù Lily starts walking after Sirius. ‚ÄúI tried to do it gently, but you weren‚Äôt budging.‚Äù

‚Äús‚Äôfine,‚Äù he mutters, swinging his legs out of the car and starting to unlace his shoes. Down the beach he can see a fire growing, the blurry outlines of his friends sitting on the ground around it. As far as he can tell they‚Äôre the only ones here‚Äîwherever here is.

Leaving his shoes and socks behind James walks across the gravelly beach towards his friends, their voices echoing through the night as the dark waves in front of them stretch on endlessly.

‚ÄúJames!‚Äù Alice cries out as he gets close. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre awake!‚Äù

He smiles, dropping down next to Remus, ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

Remus smiles a little, before looking down at his hands. He‚Äôs gotten rid of his shoes and socks too, along with his suit jacket, despite the chill. Remus always runs hot, James thinks it‚Äôs a werewolf thing but he never wants to ask.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs that look for?‚Äù he asks, knocking his shoulder against the other boy.

Remus shakes his head. ‚ÄúNothing, just‚Ä¶you and Sirius, all day, every chance you get you‚Äôve been‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know, at my side. One of you on each. Like I‚Äôm the Queen or something.‚Äù

‚ÄúPretty sure Sirius is the Queen,‚Äù James says, causing Remus to laugh. It feels good, hearing that sound come out of him. The past few days he‚Äôs been more or less catatonic.

After a few seconds James nudges him again. ‚ÄúIs it too much? D‚Äôyou need me to back off?‚Äù

There‚Äôs that smile again, not quite amused, more‚Ä¶fond. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúNo it‚Äôs‚Ä¶nice.‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúGood.‚Äù

‚Äú‚ÄîMacdonald you‚Äôve lost the plot,‚Äù Sirius is shouting across the circle, the moon now bright in the sky.

‚ÄúOh what do you know, you‚Äôre not even on the team anymore. Listen, I‚Äôm telling you, Slytherin is still our biggest competition.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will not lose to those jackasses again,‚Äù Marlene adds bitterly. ‚ÄúOnce was enough.‚Äù

‚ÄúAmen,‚Äù Frank nods. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôre you doing so far?‚Äù he turns to James now. ‚ÄúSorry I haven‚Äôt been able to make it out to the games, I‚Äôve been trying but‚Ä¶‚Äù

James waves him off. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine Frank, really, you‚Äôre off saving the world.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe won our first game,‚Äù Marlene puts in.

‚ÄúWe killed our first game,‚Äù Mary corrects. ‚ÄúFucking slaughtered Hufflepuff.‚Äù

Frank smiles. ‚ÄúOh yeah?‚Äù

James nods. It had been a good game, his first as captain, he was proud of it. ‚ÄúSlytherin won their match too though.‚Äù That had also been a good game. Regulus in his quidditch kit never got old. James had barely been able to focus.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I‚Äôm saying,‚Äù Mary goes on.

‚ÄúSlytherin is all flash,‚Äù Sirius insists.

‚ÄúAll your brother more like,‚Äù Marlene shakes her head. ‚ÄúThat kid is crazy.‚Äù

James sees Sirius‚Äôs jaw clench in the dim light. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs one word for it.‚Äù And for a moment he wants to reach over and shake him. Wants to ask him if he knows‚Äîknows what they‚Äôve done to Regulus. Knows about Lucius. But he can‚Äôt know. Can he? He wouldn‚Äôt talk like that if he did.

‚ÄúRegulus is no better than Marlene,‚Äù Sirius goes on. ‚ÄúHe just has mommy‚Äôs expensive broom. That‚Äôs my whole point. There‚Äôs no substance on that team.‚Äù

James‚Äôs fists clench. ‚ÄúFire‚Äôs getting a bit low,‚Äù he hears himself say as he gets to his feet, dusting the sand off his pants. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna go find us some more wood.‚Äù

‚ÄúOoh, I‚Äôll come!‚Äù Alice says as she gets to her feet too. ‚ÄúLove a good late night beach stroll.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt miss the concerned look Remus sends him and he feels guilt fill the pit of his stomach for making him worry, today of all days. But if he stays he‚Äôll end up saying something he isn‚Äôt supposed to. So he starts walking.

‚ÄúMerlin,‚Äù James winces as Alice falls into step beside him, the voices of their friends growing dim. ‚ÄúIs this beach made of sand or rocks?‚Äù

Alice snorts. ‚ÄúThis close to London? You‚Äôre lucky if it‚Äôs just rocks.‚Äù

James makes a face, looking down at his feet and doing his best to avoid the rubbish. After a few moments of silence Alice bumps his shoulder with her‚Äôs. ‚ÄúHey, you alright?‚Äù

‚ÄúMe?‚Äù James asks, looking over at her, ‚ÄúYeah, ‚Äòcourse. Why wouldn‚Äôt I be?‚Äù

She shrugs, Alice has always had the infuriating ability to make everything seem easy. ‚ÄúThat was a pretty quick exit back there.‚Äù

He grimaces, looking out at the water beside them, hoping she doesn‚Äôt notice. ‚ÄúWas it?‚Äù

‚ÄúWorried about Quidditch?‚Äù

James huffs out a laugh, ‚Äúa bit yeah,‚Äù and then, ‚ÄúIt must seem so stupid to you.‚Äù

She looks up at him. ‚ÄúWhat must?‚Äù

He shrugs, hands sliding into his pockets. ‚ÄúQuidditch, Hogwarts, all of it. Now that you‚Äôre, you know, out there in the real world. Doing important things. Things that matter.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù there‚Äôs another pause, the silence filled by the sound of the waves rocking into the shore. ‚ÄúI saw my first dead body.‚Äù

James comes to an abrupt stop, Alice continuing on for a few seconds before she realizes, turning back to him. Somehow even this she makes seem easy.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry?‚Äù James finally splutters.

‚ÄúMoody really does love me,‚Äù she goes on, then wrinkles her nose. ‚ÄúWell, not in like a weird way but‚ÄîI‚Äôm good at this. The Auror thing, I know no one thought I would be‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúWho didn‚Äôt think you would be?‚Äù James asks, momentarily distracted.

Alice arches her brow. ‚ÄúOh come on James, none of you were exactly like ‚Äòwow Alice, Auror, I can totally see that for you.‚Äô‚Äù

‚ÄúJust because I didn‚Äôt see it coming doesn‚Äôt mean I didn‚Äôt think you would be good at it,‚Äù James says defensively. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre brilliant.‚Äù

She smiles at that, moonlight glittering off the chain around her neck. ‚ÄúAw shucks, I forgot how sweet you can be.‚Äù

He frowns, not entirely sure he wants to be ‚Äúsweet.‚Äù

‚ÄúI think you were going somewhere before this?‚Äù

She nods. ‚ÄúYeah, I was. I‚Äôm good at my job, Moody likes that, so when he needs extra hands he takes me. Frank sometimes too, but, not this time.‚Äù

There‚Äôs something eerie about having this conversation in the dark, alone on some random beach.

‚ÄúIt was a woman, forty-years old, she has two kids. Well, had, anyway,‚Äù there‚Äôs a pause and though Alice shows no outward signs of distress James can tell that something isn‚Äôt quite right, that she‚Äôs holding herself too still, her expression mild, which is rarely something you can call Alice.

‚ÄúThey tortured her, Crucio, for hours Moody thinks, before they killed her.‚Äù

James feels a chill run down his spine. ‚ÄúDeath Eaters?‚Äù

She nods.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt read anything‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo, well, you wouldn‚Äôt have. She was a Muggle.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh.‚Äù And then; ‚ÄúWhy her?‚Äù

Alice shrugs. ‚ÄúNo idea. Because she was there? Because they could?‚Äù she pauses, turning to face the water. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the thing that gets me, that they could. No one has any idea who they are, or if they do they‚Äôre not telling us. Hell, they might even be Ministry employees.‚Äù

James feels his chest grow tight. ‚ÄúDo you know that for certain‚Äîthat there are Death Eaters in the Ministry?‚Äù

Alice nods slowly. ‚ÄúMoody is pretty convinced, he has names but he won‚Äôt tell me who.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell is he telling someone?‚Äù James can hear the anger mounting in his voice.

She looks over at him, something like pity in her eyes. ‚ÄúTell who James?‚Äù which feels like a punch to the gut.

‚ÄúThe Minister?‚Äù

‚ÄúJury‚Äôs still out on whether he‚Äôs one of them or just being manipulated. But he‚Äôs awfully close to Malfoy and Lestrange.‚Äù

Malfoy.

James feels his fists curl tight, nails digging into his palms.

‚ÄúWell what are those assholes doing there anyway, I mean they practically scream Death Eater.‚Äù

‚ÄúLike I said, the Minister‚Äôs close to them. They‚Äôre close to most people,‚Äù she lets out a sigh and it‚Äôs the closest to defeated he‚Äôs ever seen Alice. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre pretty alone in there. The Auror department is the last safe haven and that‚Äôs only because of Moody, and now Lestrange is trying to petition the Minister for the right to add to the force.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat? That can‚Äôt happen.‚Äù

Alice shrugs. ‚ÄúShouldn‚Äôt happen. But it might. They might replace Moody all together and then‚Ä¶well, I don‚Äôt know. We‚Äôll have to go underground.‚Äù

James just stares at her, feeling like he‚Äôs had the rug pulled out from under him. He knew things were bad, he did, with the attacks in Diagon, outside the Ministry, now apparently on innocent Muggles, but he hadn‚Äôt realized‚Äî

‚ÄúSo what do we do?‚Äù he finds himself asking‚Äîbegging really. Why hadn‚Äôt his dad said anything? Why hadn‚Äôt he said more?

Alice reaches out, talking hold of his arm and squeezing. After a few more moments of silence she turns to look at him, smiling a little again. ‚ÄúYou wanna know a secret? A good one this time?‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure he can handle the emotional whiplash but he nods anyway.

With her free hand she reaches into her shirt and pulls out the necklace James had noticed earlier. Hanging on the end he sees a ring, the gold band wrapping around blue stones, one large one right in the centre.

‚ÄúEr‚Ä¶‚Äù he looks from the piece of jewellery to Alice and back again. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nice?‚Äù

‚ÄúFrank gave it to me.‚Äù

‚ÄúCool.‚Äù

He watches her bite down on her lip, like she‚Äôs holding back a laugh. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs his mother‚Äôs.‚Äù

James continues to stare at her. ‚ÄúWhy are you wearing it on a chain?‚Äù

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt seem like the right time today, to tell everyone.‚Äù

James still feels like he‚Äôs missing something here. ‚ÄúTo tell everyone‚Ä¶that Frank gave you a ring?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

And then.

Then.

Oh.

‚ÄúOh my God!‚Äù James says suddenly and now Alice really does laugh.

‚ÄúLadies and gentleman I think he‚Äôs got it.‚Äù

‚ÄúHoly shit Alice, holy shit, are you and Frank getting married?‚Äù

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù she tugs on his arm, still laughing. ‚ÄúQuiet, I haven‚Äôt been able to tell the girls yet and I don‚Äôt want them to find out by you bellowing into the night.‚Äù

James shakes his head, raking a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs‚Äîthat‚Äôs‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúMad?‚Äù she offers, slipping the chain back inside her shirt.

‚ÄúYes, definitely, but also‚ÄîMerlin, congratulations,‚Äù he pulls her in for a hug, squeezing her tight, Alice giving about as good as she gets.

‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù she says, when they pull back from one another. ‚ÄúTook me by surprise too honestly.‚Äù

‚ÄúFucking Frank,‚Äù James laughs, swiping a hand across his face.

‚ÄúYeah, always so reasonable and then one day he just‚Ä¶got down on one knee.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd you said yes like the nutter you are.‚Äù

She laughs, ‚ÄúYes, exactly.‚Äù

James smiles back at her, ‚ÄúReally Alice,‚Äù he says, feeling a little less wild. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so happy for you.‚Äù

Something more subdued comes over her, dimming the light in her eyes ever so slightly. ‚ÄúBut do you see?‚Äù

James blinks. ‚ÄúSee what?‚Äù

Her hand goes to her neck, grabbing hold of the chain. ‚ÄúThis is what we do.‚Äù

It takes a minute for James to catch on, to realize that she‚Äôs answering his question. He arches his brow.

‚ÄúWe get married?‚Äù

Alice smiles ruefully. ‚ÄúSure, or we worry about Quidditch, or think about the fact that Lily Evans hasn‚Äôt stopped staring at us all day,‚Äù James rolls his eyes but Alice continues. ‚ÄúPeople make the mistake I think, when things get hard, of thinking that what they love doesn‚Äôt matter, that it‚Äôs‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know, a luxury, or frivolous‚Äîbut I saw my first dead body. My first, not my last. And I can tell you that the only thing that matters right now, is what you love.‚Äù She squeezes James‚Äôs arm again. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt give them up, the things that make you happy James, just because you think it‚Äôs the right thing to do, the heroic thing, because it isn‚Äôt. Take what brings you joy and fucking savour every last piece of it.‚Äù

It‚Äôs terrifying, hearing Alice talk like this‚Äîlight hearted, good-time, Alice. James is pretty sure he‚Äôs never even seen her in a bad mood, yet here she is talking like the world is ending.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he finds himself saying. ‚ÄúYeah, okay Alice.‚Äù

She nods, before pulling him in for another hug.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù he says, chin resting on the top of her head. ‚ÄúSince I‚Äôm the first person you told does that mean I get to be in the wedding?‚Äù

She smiles against his chest. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not how anything works but sure. We needed a flower girl anyway.‚Äù

It feels good to laugh. Even if it doesn‚Äôt last.

¬†

He told Regulus he probably wouldn‚Äôt make it tonight. That they‚Äôd be back late. That Remus would need him. So he doesn‚Äôt know why the first thing he does when they get back to the castle is head in the direction of the Come and Go Room. Muggle suit jacket in hand, shoes full of sand.

He mumbles something to the boys but none of them question it‚Äîused to it by now. Besides, they‚Äôre all knackered. They barely made it back for the last Portkey and it‚Äôs past midnight now. James doesn‚Äôt have the map, doesn‚Äôt have the invisibility cloak, all in all this is a sloppy and pointless mission. But after his chat with Alice‚Äîafter the whole day really‚Äîhe just needs to see him.

He steps through the door almost the minute it appears, walking into a dimmer room than usual. Most of the lights are out, but the fire is lit, burning low in the hearth. It takes James‚Äôs eyes a minute to adjust, a minute to find Regulus curled up on the bed, asleep. Reasonably he shouldn‚Äôt be here‚Äîshouldn‚Äôt have bothered, and that makes all sorts of feelings bubble up inside of James.

He throws his jacket over a nearby chair, slipping off his socks and shoes as he walks towards the bed. Regulus always looks so young when he‚Äôs asleep, curled up on his side, hair hiding his face. James goes as far as to crawl on top the mattress but then he stops.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he says gently, wanting to wake him but not wanting to touch him. ‚ÄúReg? Regulus?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes fly open, his hand shooting out in James‚Äôs direction trying to grab him or push him away, James can‚Äôt tell which.

‚ÄúHey, hey,‚Äù he says, letting Regulus keep his hand on his chest, holding them apart. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, it‚Äôs me, it‚Äôs just me.‚Äù

Regulus blinks, his breathing evening out as he pulls himself up to sitting. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt mean to fall asleep,‚Äù he says groggily, letting his hand drop so he can scrub at his eyes.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm surprised you‚Äôre here at all,‚Äù James says, watching Regulus come awake, the sharpness returning to his eyes, offset by his mussed hair and wrinkled clothes.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt mean to do that either.‚Äù

James nods, understanding. ‚ÄúCan I touch you?‚Äù

Regulus pauses, his whole body going tense, ‚ÄúGive me a minute?‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù James pushes himself up the bed, adjusting so that he can lean back against the headboard. Regulus watches him the whole time, eyes running him up and down, and James lets him. The truth is, Regulus looks the way most people touch. You can feel his eyes as much as any pair of hands.

‚ÄúWhat are you wearing?‚Äù he asks eventually, and James can‚Äôt help but smile.

‚ÄúMuggle suit, you like it?‚Äù

Regulus just keeps looking at him and then, eventually, he reaches out his hand, James holding himself perfectly still, letting Regulus do what he wants. He rubs James‚Äôs collar between his fingers, slowly moving along his shoulder, down his arm, over his rolled up sleeve, pausing when he reaches his wrist. He hovers over the crossroad of veins there, over James‚Äôs quickly increasing pulse.

And then his touch is gone. Taken back like a misspoken word. When Regulus raises his eyes to meet James‚Äôs his gaze is bright, wide awake now.

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

James blinks, like waking from a trance. ‚ÄúSorry?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs lips quirk up. ‚ÄúYes. I like it.‚Äù James feels his stomach flip.

‚ÄúYou wear yours I‚Äôll wear mine baby.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúThat is not a thing.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs not a thing?‚Äù

‚Äú'Baby', it‚Äôs not going to be a thing.‚Äù

James bites the inside of his cheeks, trying to keep a straight face. ‚ÄúI think there are a lot of people who would argue that it already is a thing.‚Äù

Regulus gives him a flat look. ‚ÄúYes, well, it‚Äôs not going to be a thing between us.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what you said about Reg.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot the same.‚Äù

James shrugs, ‚ÄúSort of the same,‚Äù and then, because he can‚Äôt resist; ‚Äúbaby.‚Äù

Regulus makes a disgusted face before pouncing on James, pushing him down onto the bed. It‚Äôs usually better like this, letting Regulus be the one to take charge, to decide when and how they touch. James doesn‚Äôt mind really.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm too nice to you, that‚Äôs the problem,‚Äù Regulus says as he pins James‚Äôs arms to the bed.

‚ÄúOh is that the problem?‚Äù James laughs.

‚ÄúOne of many.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you have a list?‚Äù James is joking but when Regulus doesn‚Äôt answer his eyes grow wide. ‚ÄúOh my God, you do have a list?‚Äù

‚ÄúI have lots of lists,‚Äù he responds noncommittally.

‚ÄúLists about me?‚Äù James asks, already grinning.

Regulus scowls down at him. ‚ÄúI have lots of lists,‚Äù he repeats.

‚ÄúMerlin, you‚Äôre a nerd about everything aren‚Äôt you?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs scowl deepens. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure which is worse ‚Äúnerd‚Äù or ‚Äúbaby.‚Äù

‚ÄúDepends on what you‚Äôre into I imagine.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes, pulling himself off of James and collapsing down next to him on the mattress. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre impossible.‚Äù

‚ÄúI thought I was ridiculous?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat too.‚Äù

James smiles, turning his head to look at the other boy who at that moment lets out an enormous yawn.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs late, we should sleep. Can you stay here tonight?‚Äù he asks, eyes greedy for Regulus‚Äôs face. The other boy nods, looking back at him.

‚ÄúCan you?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat about Lupin?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe has‚Äî‚Äú but James stops himself, not that saying that Remus has Sirius would be all that revealing, still, it makes something in his stomach squirm. Regulus is Sirius‚Äôs brother and this isn‚Äôt his secret to tell. ‚Äú‚Äîhe has the others,‚Äù he finishes after a brief pause.

Regulus nods, though James can tell his hiccup didn‚Äôt go unnoticed. ‚ÄúHow was it then, the funeral?‚Äù

James exhales, ‚ÄúFine and also kind of horrible. Lyall didn‚Äôt show.‚Äù

‚ÄúBastard.‚Äù

James can‚Äôt help but laugh at that‚ÄîRegulus repeating his brother‚Äôs words exactly.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù the younger boy demands.

James just shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo, nothing I just‚Äîdidn‚Äôt think you cared that much for Remus.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy, cause he hexed me?‚Äù Regulus asks, like it‚Äôs a ridiculous assumption to make.

‚ÄúSure. That and other things.‚Äù

Regulus holds his gaze for a second longer before looking back up at the ceiling. ‚ÄúHe thought he was protecting you,‚Äù Regulus shrugs. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been hexed for worse reasons.‚Äù That makes something in James‚Äôs chest ache. ‚ÄúBesides, me liking or disliking Lupin doesn‚Äôt change the fact that his father is a bastard.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúFair enough.‚Äù

He wants to kiss him but he doesn‚Äôt ask, he tries not to, not after Regulus has already said no. Feels too pushy. But fuck does he want to.

Regulus yawns again.

‚ÄúOkay, come on, lets go, bed,‚Äù James rolls off the mattress, undoing his shirt and trousers until he‚Äôs standing in just his pants. He can feel Regulus‚Äôs eyes on him again but he tries to ignore it, pulling back the comforter and waiting for Regulus to move. He doesn‚Äôt. Still sitting at the end of the bed, looking.

‚ÄúSorry, d‚Äôyou want me on the sofa tonight?‚Äù James asks, taking a step back.

But Regulus shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo‚Äîno sorry‚ÄîI was just‚Ä¶‚Äù he shakes his head again, sliding off the bed and kicking off his shoes and trousers but keeping his shirt on. When he looks up again James arches his brow.

‚ÄúYou were just what?‚Äù James asks.

‚ÄúGet in the bed James,‚Äù Regulus says instead of answering, sliding under the covers himself.

But James shakes his head. ‚ÄúYou were what Reg?‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, nothing, will you just‚Äî‚Äù he waves impatiently at the space beside him. But James takes another step back.

‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt want me in the bed tonight that‚Äôs okay, you know that right? Don‚Äôt say it is just because you think it‚Äôs what I want.‚Äù

Regulus glares at him for a good long minute before eventually throwing his arms up in surrender. ‚ÄúYou just‚Äîyou look like that.‚Äù

James blinks, looking down at himself and then back up at Regulus. ‚ÄúLook like what?‚Äù

Regulus gestures unhelpfully at James‚Äôs torso. ‚ÄúLike THAT. And I got‚Ä¶distracted. Can you please just get in here already? I have potions first period tomorrow and I‚Äôd really rather not fall asleep in my cauldron.‚Äù

But there is no way James is letting this go that easy. ‚ÄúRegulus, you‚Äôve seen me like this before.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, I know, and it‚Äôs always‚Ä¶but this time you were wearing those stupid Muggle clothes, which was bad enough, but then you were taking them OFF and it was‚Ä¶it was all a lot honestly.‚Äù

Despite his persistent glaring, the tops of Regulus‚Äôs cheeks have started to go pink and James can‚Äôt hold it in anymore, he laughs. Laughs so hard he has to grab his knees for support.

‚ÄúOkay, really? You‚Äôre being a little much now don‚Äôt you think?‚Äù Regulus says as James wipes tears of mirth from his eyes.

‚ÄúMerlin, you‚Äôre adorable.‚Äù

‚ÄúCareful,‚Äù Regulus says in a cold voice. ‚ÄúI will hex you James Potter and I promise you it‚Äôll be a lot worse than a Jelly-leg jinx.‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry, it‚Äôs hard to be scared of you when your cheeks are all pink like that.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay, that‚Äôs it,‚Äù Regulus starts reaching for the wand on his bedside table.

‚ÄúAlright, alright, I‚Äôm done, I‚Äôm done. I promise,‚Äù he swallows down the rest of his laughter as he crawls into bed, the room somehow knowing to bring the lights down with him.

‚ÄúYou really are impossible.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd ridiculous.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat too.‚Äù

James tries to catch his breath, settling into the comfortable bed. One of the many perks of being James Potter is that he has never had to suffer through a bad mattress but this one‚Äîthis one really is a cut above the rest.

‚ÄúYou can‚Ä¶touch me, if you want,‚Äù Regulus says eventually, voice quiet in the dark.

James turns to look at him. ‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

James shuffles over, wrapping one arm around Regulus‚Äôs middle and pulling him in, the pair curving around one another, James resting his chin on the top of Regulus‚Äôs head. He lets himself relish in the warmth of him. Listening as Regulus‚Äôs breathing slowly evens out, becoming calm and then almost sluggish as he drifts closer to sleep.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he hears himself say into the dark.

‚ÄúMmm?‚Äù

James tightens his arms around him. ‚ÄúYou make me happy.‚Äù

There‚Äôs no response, and James is fairly certain that Regulus has fallen asleep until a groggy voice spills into the night:

‚ÄúYou are my happy.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Hi! Hello! Hey!

I am sorry for the delay with this chapter, I had to move apartments and provinces and then also write a thirty page paper but it's fine, we're FINE, we're alive.

I realize the double perspective was a little weird but hopefully it worked?

Thank you all for the comments and the kudos it's all so nice!

Also, I'm little-shit-soph on tumblr if you ever wanna chat fic or hp or whatever (shout-out to the people who have already found me on there y'all are lovely)

Chapter 25

Chapter Summary

Everything is stressful from here on out.

Chapter Notes

tw: Homophobic language
tw: Violence (blood - I don't think it's too graphic but it's graphic-ish)
tw: Implied/Attempted sexual assault (via Imperius Curse - again nothing is graphic)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

You are my happy.

He hadn‚Äôt meant to say it. He‚Äôd been half-asleep. Unfair of James really, being all sentimental around him in that state.

You are my happy.

He hadn‚Äôt meant to say it. He had meant it though. In retrospect, that was the real problem. He needed to end this. He knew that. The Mark on his arm a ticking clock. He just couldn‚Äôt quite make himself let go. He‚Äôd never had something like this before‚Äîsomething that was good. Something that was his. So he just kept digging a hole he wasn‚Äôt sure he was ever going to be able to get himself out of.

‚ÄúOi! Earth to Black?‚Äù

Regulus blinks as Evan shoves his hand in his face, flapping it around as he tries to get his attention.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre intolerable,‚Äù Regulus slaps the hand away, earning him a grin.

‚ÄúI love it when you talk dirty to me.‚Äù

‚ÄúGross,‚Äù Barty is leaning against the wall, his arms and ankles crossed in a way that Regulus knows he thinks is intimidating but is very much the opposite.

‚ÄúAw, don‚Äôt be jealous Barty,‚Äù Evan leans close to him making kissing noises, causing a look of utter revulsion to contort Barty‚Äôs face. He shoves Evan away.

‚ÄúMerlin, cut that out. People are going to think you‚Äôre a fucking queer.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt react. He never does. Staring dully out at the hallway as kids mill about on their lunch break.

Evan rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúI doubt it. Besides, if I WAS queer I‚Äôd aim a little higher than you. I do have standards you know.‚Äù

‚ÄúSince when?‚Äù Regulus asks dryly.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Evan tries to kick him but Regulus smoothly steps out of the way, the corners of his mouth flicking up.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm serious,‚Äù Barty goes on, straight faced. He‚Äôs been more of a buzzkill recently. Regulus reckons it‚Äôs because his dad got another promotion. ‚ÄúYou think the Dark L‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúJesus Barty,‚Äù Regulus cuts him off, eyes bouncing up and down the corridor, making sure no one is paying attention. ‚ÄúA little subtlety please?‚Äù

Barty‚Äôs cheeks flush, his scowl growing. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not going to want a bunch of poofs in his order is he?‚Äù

Well, Reg thinks flatly, bit late for that.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm pretty sure he has more important things to worry about than who you‚Äôre shagging,‚Äù Evan claps Barty on the back. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs cute that you think he cares.‚Äù

Barty shrugs him off. ‚ÄúYou haven‚Äôt heard anything have you?‚Äù he says to Regulus.

‚ÄúHeard anything?‚Äù

‚ÄúY‚Äôknow, from him, from the others. Anything they want us to do?‚Äù Sometimes, the thing on Regulus‚Äôs forearm squirms, wriggling under his skin like a real snake. Other times it burns. That‚Äôs about the extent to which he‚Äôs ‚Äúheard‚Äù from Voldemort.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says flatly. ‚ÄúWhy would I have?‚Äù

Barty lets out a frustrated sigh, turning so that his back presses into the wall. ‚ÄúFuck, I don‚Äôt know. We‚Äôre here, we could be useful, get information or something,‚Äù he kicks at the ground. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just so bored.‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin me too,‚Äù Evan runs a hand down his face. ‚ÄúWho the fuck cares about Ruins when there‚Äôs a war that‚Äôs about to kick off.‚Äù

‚ÄúI swear if we‚Äôre stuck here when it does,‚Äù Barty goes on, looking murderous.

Regulus isn‚Äôt sure he‚Äôd mind honestly. Easier that way. No hard decisions to make, no danger, just; ‚ÄúOh there was a Wizarding war? I must have missed it, I was in Arithmancy.‚Äù Somehow he can‚Äôt quite believe it‚Äôll happen like that.

‚ÄúWe need to do something,‚Äù Barty goes on, which sounds like a threat as far as Regulus is concerned.

‚ÄúAnd what exactly do you suggest?‚Äù he asks carefully.

Barty kisses his teeth, looking agitated as his eyes bounce around the corridor. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, just something. Something to get their attention.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm intrigued Barty boy, go on,‚Äù Evan says and Regulus could smack him for encouraging this.

‚ÄúPreferably not something that will get us arrested.‚Äù

Evan rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúHonestly Reg, you have to get over that whole ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt wanna get arrested‚Äù thing, it‚Äôs really holding us back.‚Äù

Regulus looks over at him, brow arched. It‚Äôs hard to tell with Evan, when he‚Äôs joking and when he‚Äôs serious.

‚ÄúBesides, like I said, even if they did lock us up it wouldn‚Äôt be for long.‚Äù He gives Regulus a playful shove and Regulus shoves him back, not feeling nearly as confident that anyone would come get them out of Azkaban. Their side might have control of the prison but that didn‚Äôt mean they‚Äôd risk it becoming public knowledge for the sake of three teenage morons.

‚ÄúHey, what do you reckon Dementors‚Äô sound like?‚Äù

Regulus blinks, trying to catch up to the change in topic. ‚ÄúWhat do they sound like?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, like are their voices deep,‚Äù Evan provides him with a demonstration. ‚ÄúOr high and squeaky?‚Äù

Despite himself, Regulus laughs. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm pretty sure they don‚Äôt have voices at all.‚Äù

Evan looks at him skeptically. ‚ÄúNah, come on, they must‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúFlipendo,‚Äù Barty snaps. Regulus looks over just in time to watch a third year Hufflepuff get knocked off her feet.

There‚Äôs a moment of stillness in which everyone in the hallway seems to be in shock, staring at the girl open mouthed. Then she makes a pathetic whimpering noise and her friends go rushing to her side, others looking around to see who hexed her.

‚ÄúTake that you filthy Mudblood,‚Äù Barty smirks as he slides his wand back up his sleeve.

‚ÄúMerlin Barty, warn bloke next time, will you?‚Äù Evan says, dramatically clutching his heart.

To be honest, Regulus doesn‚Äôt care one way or the other about the Hufflepuff girl. It‚Äôs the stupidity that bothers him.

‚ÄúCongratulations Barty,‚Äù he says dryly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure the Dark Lord will be well impressed that you managed to jinx an unsuspecting thirteen year old. Definitely get his attention that. Heck, I‚Äôll be surprised if he doesn‚Äôt show up any minute and give you the Mark right here. I mean, who needs to be clever about these things right? Might as well just start doing whatever the hell we want, wherever the hell we want, regardless of who‚Äôs around.‚Äù He watches the mirth drain from his friend‚Äôs face, replaced by bitterness, but he doesn‚Äôt care. Their positions are too precarious for idiotic stunts like that.

‚ÄúWell put Black,‚Äù comes a new voice from behind him.

Regulus closes his eyes for a brief moment and groans internally.

‚ÄúLook who it is Reg, your new best friend,‚Äù Evan is grinning a little manically as he comes to Regulus‚Äôs side, Regulus turning to find Remus Lupin at his back. The Prefect is not looking especially good at the moment‚Äîface pale, heavy bags under his eyes‚Äîit‚Äôs clear he isn‚Äôt sleeping.

Lupin‚Äôs gaze remains on Regulus for a second longer before it flicks behind him to Barty. ‚ÄúCrouch, detention and fifty points from Slytherin.‚Äù

‚ÄúFor?‚Äù Barty asks in the most bratty tone Regulus thinks he‚Äôs ever heard. He‚Äôs honestly impressed.

The older boy rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúI saw you cast it, not particularly subtle about it, were you?‚Äù

Barty‚Äôs eyes narrow. ‚ÄúYour word against mine.‚Äù

Remus lets out a dry laugh, shaking his head. ‚ÄúI hear that Dumbledore has a pensieve, I will gladly hand over my memory of the event.‚Äù

With no defence left Barty resorts to glaring, as though he can frighten Lupin out of punishing him. Regulus thinks that‚Äôs unlikely.

‚ÄúGlad to see that won‚Äôt be necessary. I‚Äôll let Slughorn know about the detentions,‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt look at Regulus as he pushes past them.

‚ÄúHey Lupin?‚Äù Barty calls out, stopping the Prefect on the his way down the hall.

‚ÄúOh, ho, ho,‚Äù Evan whispers, elbowing Regulus in the side. ‚ÄúThis ought to be good.‚Äù

Regulus grimaces.

‚ÄúI hear that dirty Muggle mum of yours has gone and died,‚Äù he smiles cruelly, showing off all his teeth. ‚ÄúSee, if I were you, I would have killed her myself years ago. You‚Äôd still be a filthy half-blood but at least then you‚Äôd have some dignity, you know?‚Äù

To his credit, Lupin doesn‚Äôt even flinch. Just stares back at Barty stone faced for long enough that the Slytherin starts to fidget. Then he turns around and continues down the corridor.

Evan lets out a low whistle. ‚ÄúHoly shit my dude,‚Äù he grabs Barty by the shoulders and gives him a shake. ‚ÄúThat was fucked up.‚Äù

Barty‚Äôs eyes have gone dark, following Lupin‚Äôs back as he disappears around the nearest bend. ‚ÄúI meant it.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt have a shred of doubt that that‚Äôs true.

‚ÄúUh-huh,‚Äù Evan slings his arm around him, laughing a little. ‚ÄúLets go get some food you little psychopath,‚Äù he looks over his shoulder; ‚ÄúReg?‚Äù

Regulus nods slowly, eyes on Barty. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says finally, ‚Äúyeah lets go.‚Äù

¬†

Barty is in a shit mood for the rest of the day. Shoving and pushing his way through the corridors, cursing at just about everyone in sight. Evan finds it funny‚Äîthough Evan finds most things funny‚ÄîRegulus, on the other hand, finds it grating. Which is why he tells them he‚Äôs going to the library after last period, speeding off down the hallway before either of them can say anything about it.

He might actually go to the library, he hasn‚Äôt decided. The problem is that he‚Äôll likely run into to Lupin again if he does and he‚Äôs not sure he has the patience for that right now. So instead he wanders, keeping to the quieter areas of the castle, away from the common rooms and the Great Hall. Between the end of the school day and dinner the halls are generally pretty empty anyway.

‚ÄúWell look who it is.‚Äù

He stops at the end of the hall, turning around to find a smiling James Potter making his way towards him. His hair is a mess, glasses smudged, robes wrinkled and yet somehow he still manages to be the most attractive person Regulus has ever seen. It‚Äôs infuriating.

James quirks his brow as he comes to a stop in front of him. ‚ÄúReg?‚Äù

Right. He‚Äôs meant to speak. ‚ÄúHi.‚Äù He wonders if James has talked to Lupin yet, he must have, yet he seems a little too happy to have heard exactly what happened with Barty.

‚ÄúYou okay?‚Äù James asks, leaning a bit closer. He doesn‚Äôt reach out, doesn‚Äôt touch Regulus, he never does unless Regulus says he can. But still. It‚Äôs too close for the hallway, so Regulus steps back.

‚ÄúFine. What are you doing wandering the halls without your fan club?‚Äù

He sees the flash of hurt in James‚Äôs eyes at the distance between them but he doesn‚Äôt say anything.

‚ÄúI‚Äîuh‚Äîwas following you actually,‚Äù he says, rubbing the back of his neck, and it‚Äôs then that Regulus realizes that James hasn‚Äôt got any of his school stuff with him.

It only takes him a second to understand; ‚ÄúYou saw me on your map?‚Äù

James smiles sheepishly. ‚ÄúI saw you on my map,‚Äù he confirms.

Regulus isn‚Äôt exactly sure what to do with that information. On the one hand, his stomach does several somersaults at the thought of James looking for him, coming to find him. On the other hand, he wonders if he‚Äôs the only one at this school with any fucking sense.

‚ÄúWe really shouldn‚Äôt be‚Ä¶talking‚Ä¶here,‚Äù he says stiffly, eyes doing a quick circuit of the hallway, making sure they‚Äôre still alone.

That sucks some of the light out of James‚Äôs eyes. Regulus feels guilty, he does, but he also doesn‚Äôt step any closer.

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù James says quietly, ‚Äúwe‚Äôve been together for a year.‚Äù

Which seems like a random and irrelevant piece of information to Regulus but he at least knows enough not to point that out. ‚ÄúWe have,‚Äù he says slowly, wondering where the hell James is going with this and why he feels the need to do it in the middle of the corridor.

‚ÄúSo‚Ä¶I just‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt want to do this forever.‚Äù

That makes something in Regulus‚Äôs chest stammer. It shouldn‚Äôt‚Äîafter all, he‚Äôs been telling himself to end things with James for months. If James has decided to do it himself all the better for Regulus. He just‚Ä¶hadn‚Äôt seen it coming.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt want to do this?‚Äù Regulus repeats, hating how tight his voice sounds.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to hide.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù the relief he feels is enough to stop him from fully taking in what James is saying.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James goes on, gaze bouncing between Regulus and the floor, like he‚Äôs not quite brave enough to hold his gaze. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been thinking and, obviously, y‚Äôknow, coming out to the whole school would be‚Ä¶a lot,‚Äù Regulus‚Äôs eyes instantly go back to the end of the hallway, and then over his own shoulder. He really‚Äîreally‚Äîdoes not want to be having this conversation here.

‚ÄúBut maybe we could just start smaller‚Äîtelling our friends?‚Äù

Whatever relief he had felt about James not wanting to finish with him immediately evaporates.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says harshly, and then, perhaps TOO harshly; ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, but haven‚Äôt we already had this conversation?‚Äù

He sees James straighten up and he knows this is going nowhere good. Knows he has to rein in his frustration. But that‚Äôs never been his strong suit.

‚ÄúYeah, we have, and I‚Äôve told you I don‚Äôt think you need to be so afraid.‚Äù

Regulus grits his teeth. ‚ÄúThe answer is no. It‚Äôs always going to be no,‚Äù he thinks of Lucius back in Scotland, thinks of the hungry look in his eyes.

I‚Äôd be careful if I were you,

His voice bounces around Regulus‚Äôs head.

Wouldn‚Äôt want Bellatrix to find out about your little boy-toy.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre too‚Ä¶‚Äù James presses on through the silence. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre too big for hiding Reg. You and me,‚Äù he smiles a little. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt you see it?‚Äù

If she finds out what you‚Äôve been doing and, God forbid, with whom, that poor boy is going to find himself dismembered.

‚ÄúNo. I don‚Äôt see it,‚Äù this time it‚Äôs James who steps back, like he‚Äôs just been hit. ‚ÄúSurely you have to know that there‚Äôs no other way‚Äînot with me?‚Äù

But James looks back at him defiantly. ‚ÄúPeople will surprise you.‚Äù

He thinks of his mother. Of Bellatrix.

‚ÄúNo, they won‚Äôt.‚Äù

James lets out a frustrated groan. ‚ÄúJust my friends then, that‚Äôs it, that‚Äôs all I‚Äôm asking.‚Äù

Regulus laughs coldly. ‚ÄúYour friends, meaning my brother?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin, have you lost your mind? No. No James.‚Äù He keeps checking over his shoulder, over James‚Äôs. God he hates this.

‚ÄúI think I can talk to him,‚Äù James keeps pushing for reasons that Regulus can‚Äôt fathom. ‚ÄúI think I can make him understand‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúTake it from someone who has been trying to make Sirius understand for the last fifteen years‚Äîyou can‚Äôt. He won‚Äôt.‚Äù And if he makes a scene, if other people find out, if it gets back to their family‚Ä¶God this is so stupid‚Ä¶he‚Äôs been so stupid.

‚ÄúLook,‚Äù James lifts his glasses, pinching the bridge of his nose. ‚ÄúI know you‚Äôre worried about how he‚Äôll react.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou have no fucking idea what I‚Äôm worried about.‚Äù

He watches James tense at that, clenching his teeth as he lowers his hand. ‚ÄúThen tell me,‚Äù he growls. ‚ÄúTell me what has you so stuck Reg?‚Äù

And for a moment he almost does.

They‚Äôll kill you. They‚Äôll kill me. Hell, they‚Äôll probably take out your parents just for the fun of it. I have no choice. I have nowhere to go. I‚Äôm putting you in danger everyday and I don‚Äôt know how to stop. I let them carve him into my skin and sometimes I swear I feel his heart beating overtop of mine.

But he doesn‚Äôt say any of that.

Instead he takes another step back. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not having this conversation here.‚Äù

James‚Äôs face clouds over. ‚ÄúSure. Fine. Whatever.‚Äù He turns sharply on his heel, hands shoved in his pockets as he starts heading back in the direction he came from.

Regulus feels a lump in the back of his throat.

Fuck.

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúCareful Black,‚Äù James throws over his shoulder. ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt want anyone hearing you use my first name, they might get the wrong idea.‚Äù

He delivers the blow seamlessly, doesn‚Äôt even slow down to do it. It‚Äôs work for Regulus not to flinch as he watches James round the next corner, disappearing from sight.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he says, out loud this time.

For half a heartbeat he actually considers going after him. But he can‚Äôt. Can‚Äôt risk causing a scene, can‚Äôt risk being overheard, this whole conversation was already dangerous enough. He sighs, scrubbing at his face with his hands. He really can‚Äôt wait for this day to be over.

¬†

Safe to say, when he turns up for Prefect duty that evening he is not in the best of moods. He isn‚Äôt seeing James again until tomorrow night, and that means that he‚Äôs stuck just sitting with this‚Äîthis fight? Was it a fight? Are they fighting? His skin feels itchy, a pit growing in his stomach that he can‚Äôt seem to get rid of.

It‚Äôs all stupid. This thing with James was never going to last, he should be happy that it‚Äôs coming to an end in such a mundane way. Maybe it‚Äôll hurt them both less. No need for wars or monsters. Regulus can ruin this all on his own thank you very much.

‚ÄúHey!‚Äù

He turns to see Cerci walking towards him, smiling enthusiastically‚Äînot that she ever smiles any other way.

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôre you doing here?‚Äù

‚ÄúWow, what kind of greeting is that?‚Äù though she doesn‚Äôt sound remotely put off.

Regulus tries to adjust himself, shaking out his shoulders, dragging up some amount of good will. ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he manages, ‚Äúbad day.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell it just got better,‚Äù she places her hands on her hips, pigtails bouncing on either side of her head. Regulus has never known anyone in real who wears their hair in pigtails before. He always assumed it was a style reserved for cartoon characters.

‚ÄúHas it?‚Äù he asks tentatively.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm on Prefect duty with you tonight! Sarah got sick or something and asked me if I could cover and I was like ‚Äúheck yeah, I‚Äôll take your shift with my partner‚Äù so here I am.‚Äù

‚ÄúHere you are,‚Äù Regulus is never entirely sure whether he‚Äôs exhausted or amused by Cerci. ‚ÄúYou really have to stop telling people I‚Äôm your partner.‚Äù

She looks at him curiously as they start walking down the hall, away from the Prefect office. ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause people assume you mean something else.‚Äù When she still looks confused he tries again; ‚ÄúIt makes them think we‚Äôre‚Ä¶involved.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence before Cerci starts laughing‚Äîalmost insultingly loud, in Regulus‚Äôs opinion.

‚ÄúUs?‚Äù she chokes, grabbing her stomach. ‚ÄúOh my God I‚Äôm getting a cramp, that‚Äôs the funniest thing I have ever heard‚Äîyou and me? A couple?‚Äù she starts cackling again.

Regulus would like to be annoyed but for some reason he finds himself smiling instead. ‚ÄúStranger things have happened.‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin, have they?‚Äù she wipes at the corners of her eyes. ‚ÄúBesides, I could never allow it.‚Äù

He arches his brow. ‚ÄúOh?‚Äù

Cerci shakes her head, pigtails bouncing ridiculously. ‚ÄúIt would make my mother far too happy.‚Äù

That almost gets a laugh out of Regulus. ‚ÄúYeah, mine too.‚Äù

Cerci meets his eye, something mischievous in her gaze. ‚ÄúWell that settles it then, we can‚Äôt ever date.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, I suppose not.‚Äù

She holds out her hand and it takes Regulus a second to realize she wants to shake on it, like it‚Äôs some sort of business deal. He indulges her.

‚ÄúTo never making our mothers happy.‚Äù

That actually does get a laugh out of him, surprising given how miserable he‚Äôd been not five minutes earlier. ‚ÄúTo never making our mothers happy,‚Äù he agrees, their hands fall away only for Cerci to link their arms.

‚ÄúNow,‚Äù she says as they start walking again. ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you tell me about this terrible day of yours?‚Äù

¬†

It‚Äôs not that she isn‚Äôt a menace, because she is. But strangely, Regulus has found over the past few weeks that he rather likes talking to Cerci Greengrass‚Äîas ridiculous as she is. There is something mildly awe inspiring about someone who says absolutely everything they‚Äôre thinking or feeling without a moments hesitation. Regulus has never met anyone quite like her.

So he tells her about this morning, with Barty, and about James too‚Äîjust leaving out his name and‚Ä¶other details. A fight, he tells her, with a friend. It might be his fault.

‚ÄúSo apologize,‚Äù she shrugs, causing Regulus to roll his eyes.

‚ÄúYes, of course, why didn‚Äôt I think of that,‚Äù he says dryly. But when she looks over at him she is completely earnest.

‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause it‚Äôs complicated.‚Äù

‚ÄúComplicated how?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt just‚Ä¶he was being an idiot.‚Äù

Cerci smirks. ‚ÄúIt sounds like you just don‚Äôt want to have to admit you were in the wrong.‚Äù

‚ÄúI just admitted it to you didn‚Äôt I? Besides, like I said, he was being an idiot, so I was only partially in the wrong‚Äîfifty percent in the wrong at most.‚Äù

She sends him a pointed look. ‚ÄúUh-huh.‚Äù

Regulus lets out a heavy sigh, rubbing at his face. ‚ÄúApologizing doesn‚Äôt‚Ä¶come‚Ä¶easy to me,‚Äù he says stiffly.

‚ÄúI never would have guessed that about you,‚Äù she says with a smile, and as if that wasn‚Äôt annoying enough she continues; ‚ÄúDo you always just give up on things that don‚Äôt come easy to you?‚Äù

Regulus scowls. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell then, apologize.‚Äù

Regulus grumbles. He could, he supposes, apologize. Though he‚Äôs not entirely sure he should have to. I mean, yes, he was a bit of an ass. But how many times is he going to have to explain to James that they can‚Äôt be ‚Äúa couple‚Äù? Can‚Äôt be out? Not just for now, not just temporarily. But ever.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù Cerci stumbles to a stop, pulling Regulus up short beside her.

‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù he asks, looking around at the empty corridor.

‚ÄúI think we may have found students breaking curfew,‚Äù she says, her cheeks pinking as she holds back a smirk.

Regulus opens his mouth to ask her what she‚Äôs on about when he hears it‚Äîa stifled moan. He turns to stare at the broom cupboard next to them in horror.

‚ÄúThey couldn‚Äôt have used a bloody silencing charm?‚Äù he grumbles under his breath.

Cerci chokes back a laugh. ‚ÄúWhat do we do?‚Äù she whispers.

‚ÄúWe could keep walking?‚Äù

‚ÄúPretty sure our whole job is to deal with stuff like this.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúWhat are we even getting them for? Breaking curfew?‚Äù

‚ÄúInappropriate behaviour?‚Äù

‚ÄúIndecent exposure?‚Äù

Cerci snorts. ‚ÄúTechnically, you don‚Äôt know that they‚Äôre indecent.‚Äù

At that moment another noise slips under the door‚Äîthis one closer to a growl.

He sends Cerci a pointed look. ‚ÄúSounds pretty bloody indecent.‚Äù

‚ÄúFair enough. I can do it if you want?‚Äù

He waves her off, pulling out his wand and staring at the door, already feeling exhausted. He‚Äôs beginning to think that Dumbledore gave him this Prefect pin as some sick punishment.

‚ÄúAlohomora,‚Äù he flicks his wrist, perhaps with a bit too much force because the door not only unlocks but bursts open, banging into the wall. Regulus looks very pointedly away, not wanting to see any half-undressed strangers.

He‚Äôs about to speak when one of the occupants beats him to it; ‚ÄúHoly fuck.‚Äù

Something cold drips down his spine.

Of course.

Of course it‚Äôs him.

Regulus looks up, entirely ready to give his brother a snarky lecture about being a slag but all words die in his mouth when he sees Sirius with his shirt half open, hair a mess, leaning against the wall with one hand by Remus Lupin‚Äôs head. He blinks, trying to make the image reform in his mind‚Äôs eye, trying to figure out how he‚Äôs seeing what he‚Äôs seeing.

‚ÄúYou know what?‚Äù Cerci says, after a moment of stillness in which no one seems willing to move‚Äîto address the situation. ‚ÄúI think they get the idea. We can just go now, you guys get back to your dorm, have a good night.‚Äù

She reaches out, tugging on Regulus‚Äôs sleeve, trying to pull him away, but he doesn‚Äôt move.

He knows he should probably feel happy‚Äîor, if not happy, relieved. All those years spent worrying about how Sirius would react to finding out about him and he was the same way all along.

But that isn‚Äôt how he feels.

He feels angry.

This, he realizes, is why James thinks he can talk to Sirius. This is why he thinks that they can be out in the open, at least to some people. No doubt Sirius and Lupin are. James looks at them and sees a future. A future he and Regulus can never have. The injustice of it‚Äîthat after everything, Sirius gets this too. The only thing Regulus has ever wanted.

It makes him want to break something.

‚ÄúRegulus‚Äî‚Äú Cerci tries again.

‚ÄúThis is priceless this is,‚Äù Regulus says coldly, his voice waking the couple up. Sirius quickly pulls away from Lupin, doing-up his shirt, eyes wide with panic. Good, Regulus thinks. ‚ÄúReally, never would have guessed it, Sirius Black, teen heartthrob, gay.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not gay,‚Äù Sirius snaps back, and Regulus doesn‚Äôt miss the way that Lupin flinches.

‚ÄúReally? And what exactly is your heterosexual explanation for being locked in a cupboard, half dressed, with another bloke?‚Äù

The fire is still bright in Sirius‚Äôs eyes but his cheeks are pinking.

Regulus laughs coldly. ‚ÄúAnd after all the shit you‚Äôve talked over the years,‚Äù when he speaks next he‚Äôs doing a mocking impression of Sirius‚Äôs voice. ‚ÄúOh come on Reg, don‚Äôt be such a fairy, don‚Äôt be so fucking queer, only bent boys cry,‚Äù he drops the voice, expression flat, staring pointedly at his brother who looks about ready to crawl out of his skin.

‚ÄúI was a kid,‚Äù Sirius says through clenched teeth.

‚ÄúOh well, in that case I guess you‚Äôre only sort of a hypocrite.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù Lupin finally steps forward, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre going now.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Cerci jumps in, ‚Äúwe have to finish rounds so‚Ä¶‚Äù

Both Cerci and Remus start tugging on their respective Black brothers, Remus somewhat more effectively, guiding Sirius down the hall towards Gryffindor Tower. But Regulus isn‚Äôt ready to let this go yet.

‚ÄúDetention,‚Äù he says, bringing the other pair to a stop only a few paces away. ‚ÄúFor inappropriate behaviour.‚Äù

Sirius looks back at him, face pale. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt do that. People will talk.‚Äù

‚ÄúAbout what Sirius Black and Remus Lupin were doing alone in a cupboard together after curfew? I should certainly hope so. You know how gossip travels at this school. And I‚Äôll be happy to supply any details people might be after.‚Äù

Sirius looks like he can‚Äôt decide between anger and horror. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt do that Reg.‚Äù

He smiles coldly. ‚ÄúWatch me.‚Äù

Sirius makes a move, like he‚Äôs trying to lunge at him, but Lupin pulls him back, stepping between the pair of them. He meets Regulus‚Äôs gaze head on.

‚ÄúWe both know you‚Äôre not going to do that,‚Äù he says calmly.

But Regulus doesn‚Äôt back down.

‚ÄúYour confidence is unfounded.‚Äù

‚ÄúIs it?‚Äù And when Regulus doesn‚Äôt flinch he pushes; ‚ÄúWe all have things we‚Äôd rather not get out.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt need a mirror to know that the leer cutting its way across his face isn‚Äôt pleasant.

‚ÄúWhat are you talking about Moony?‚Äù Sirius asks.

‚ÄúYes Lupin, do go on. Tell him. What are you talking about?‚Äù

The two of them stare at one another, unblinking, a face off. A duel without wands. Waiting to see whose nerve cracks first. Lupin may not care about outing Regulus, but he won‚Äôt do that to James. Regulus would bet his life on it.

Eventually Lupin breaks, shaking his head as he turns back to Sirius. ‚ÄúCome on, lets go.‚Äù

But Sirius isn‚Äôt going anywhere, not while this still hangs in the air.

‚ÄúReg, I need you to do this for me okay? I need you not to tell anyone.‚Äù

Those words are like broken glass, shredding Regulus on the inside. When was the last time you gave a shit about me? He wants to say. About what I need? When was the last time you did anything but look down your nose at me?

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

He sees the fear explode across Sirius's face. ‚ÄúRegulus please. Fuck‚Äîplease, I‚Äôm begging you here. As your brother.‚Äù

Regulus laughs. ‚ÄúAs my brother? You haven‚Äôt been my brother in six fucking years Sirius, so do us all a favour and spare us your grovelling. It‚Äôs pathetic, even for you.‚Äù

Sirius opens and closes his mouth like a fish, no words making it out. Remus reaches out again, trying to pull Sirius away. ‚ÄúHe won‚Äôt do it, he‚Äôs bluffing, c‚Äômon.‚Äù

But Sirius is staring right into Regulus‚Äôs eyes, into his steadfast gaze.

‚ÄúWhat do you want Reg?‚Äù he asks finally.

And oh.

There are so many things.

But the answer comes quickly enough, as though he‚Äôd had it planned.

‚ÄúCome home for Christmas.‚Äù

Sirius goes so still it‚Äôs startling, the blood draining from his face.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù this is Remus now, stepping forward again. ‚ÄúThere is no fucking way.‚Äù

Regulus shrugs. ‚ÄúFine, then I suppose congratulations are in order. Hogwarts first openly gay couple. What an honour.‚Äù

Something strangled comes out of Sirius‚Äôs throat. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôll kill me Reg, you realize that? They‚Äôll kill me if I go back?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, they won‚Äôt,‚Äù and they won‚Äôt. They just won‚Äôt let him go. But why should he get to? To walk away? Let him see how it feels to be stuck in a house with no air. Let him see how much harsher they‚Äôve become. How much tighter their hands squeeze.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll give you time to think about it,‚Äù he says, when the boys in front of him continue to stand in horrified silence. ‚ÄúThough if I were you I wouldn‚Äôt keep me waiting too long,‚Äù he looks over his shoulder at Cerci. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon, lets go.‚Äù

He starts walking towards her but Lupin reaches out and grabs his wrist. Regulus isn‚Äôt sure he‚Äôs ever seen so much rage contained in one person before. It‚Äôs impressive, really.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôll never forgive you for this, you know that?‚Äù he‚Äôs dropped his voice low, and there is no doubt who the ‚Äúhe‚Äù in question is.

Regulus feels his chest squeeze but ignores it. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt that what you want?‚Äù he asks, before ripping his arm out of Lupin‚Äôs grasp and pushing down the hallway.

¬†

Regulus doesn‚Äôt sleep well, bouncing between regret and satisfaction. For once maybe Sirius will understand how it feels‚Äîhow it really feels‚Äîto be in Regulus‚Äôs position. To have someone else holding your life in their hands and not being able to fight your way out. Or to run away, which has always worked so well for Sirius in the past. What was it Sirius had said to him? Better to be dead than to let them have you? Well, they‚Äôd see how much of that Gryffindor valour he really had, the smug bastard.

‚ÄúYou alright there Reg?‚Äù

Regulus blinks, swerving just in time to avoid running into the open door in front of him.

‚ÄúYou seem a little‚Ä¶distracted,‚Äù Evan goes on, clearly trying to hold back a laugh.

‚ÄúM‚Äôfine,‚Äù he mutters, adjusting his transfiguration books as they head in the direction of their next class.

He‚Äôs not really paying attention when he hears Barty mutter ‚ÄúMudblood‚Äù at someone they pass in the hall. It‚Äôs not an uncommon occurrence, the people around them barely batting an eye. That is, until a strong voice cuts through the buzzing chatter.

‚ÄúSorry, I didn‚Äôt catch that. What did you just say to me?‚Äù

Regulus blinks, looking from Evan to Barty as they all come to a stop, Mary Macdonald standing in the centre of the hallway with her hands on her hips and a storm in her eyes.

Barty shifts uncomfortably. No one‚Äôs ever called him out before.

‚ÄúYou heard what I said,‚Äù he mutters, checking nervously about for teachers.

She smiles at him. ‚ÄúReally? Because I heard ‚ÄúI have a small dick‚Äù which, I have to admit, is a weird thing to whisper in a girl‚Äôs ear, but hey, whatever gets you off I suppose.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a ripple of snickering in the crowd around them that causes Barty‚Äôs face to go beet red.

‚ÄúWatch yourself Macdonald,‚Äù he growls, and Regulus finds himself inching closer incase he has to stop Barty from doing something stupid like cursing Mary Macdonald in the middle of a busy hallway.

She laughs, stepping forward until the two of them stand toe to toe, it feels like she looms over him even though he‚Äôs a good two to three inches taller than her. ‚ÄúDoes it make you feel strong, spewing rubbish like that?‚Äù she asks, her words cutting. ‚ÄúBecause personally, I think it‚Äôs pathetic,‚Äù Barty opens his mouth to retaliate but she doesn‚Äôt let him. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you ever threaten me again Barty Crouch, you haven‚Äôt even a quarter of the power that I have.‚Äù

With that she turns on her heel, Regulus spotting a concerned looking McKinnon waiting for her at the other end of the corridor. Despite Regulus‚Äôs fears Barty doesn‚Äôt move‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt reach for his wand or lunge after her. In fact, he stands frighteningly still, the hallway traffic slowly starting to make its way around him again, most people giving him a wide birth, afraid of getting hit with whatever temper tantrum is coming.

‚ÄúI mean,‚Äù Evan says after a few moments of silence, Macdonald now well out of sight, ‚Äúthat was kind of hot.‚Äù

Regulus turns to look at him, brow arched and Evan instantly throws his hands up.

‚ÄúListen, she‚Äôs a grade-A bitch, I‚Äôm not saying she isn‚Äôt, but, you know, a hot one.‚Äù

Regulus just shakes his head, not wanting to touch that, happy that Barty still doesn‚Äôt appear to be paying them much attention, his dark eyes burning a whole into the floor where Macdonald had been standing.

‚ÄúDisgraceful isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

Comes a snide voice from behind them.

They turn to find Snape leaning against the wall, Mulciber looming like a bodyguard beside him.

‚ÄúOh piss off Severus,‚Äù Evan says with the wave of his hand.

‚ÄúNo I mean it,‚Äù he goes on, eyeing Barty‚Äôs still turned back. ‚ÄúThe way they‚Äôre allowed to just strut about, to treat us.‚Äù

‚ÄúListen, Sevy, I know the girls are none to keen on you, but you really shouldn‚Äôt go making generalizations. Some of us do quite well with the ladies,‚Äù Evan gives him a wink that has Snape rolling his eyes.

‚ÄúHe means Mudbloods idiot,‚Äù Mulciber grumbles in his baritone voice.

Evan looks over at him and frowns. ‚ÄúPot, kettle, no?‚Äù

‚ÄúDid he just call me an idiot?!‚Äù

Evan gives Regulus a little nudge. ‚ÄúI love it when people prove my points for me.‚Äù

‚ÄúListen you little‚Äî‚Äú Mulciber steps forward but Snape holds out his arm, blocking his path before he can get too close.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no point fighting amongst ourselves,‚Äù Snape says, causing Regulus to arch his brow.

‚ÄúYou say that like we‚Äôre on the same side.‚Äù

Severus gives him something that is maybe meant to be a smile but doesn‚Äôt seem to have much good will in it. ‚ÄúAren‚Äôt we?‚Äù And then; ‚ÄúWe need to do something, need to put them in their places.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I‚Äôve been saying,‚Äù Barty speaks for the first time, finally turning to look at them.

Snape‚Äôs eyes go bright, like a predator who‚Äôs just caught his prey. ‚ÄúExcellent,‚Äù Snape licks his lips. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been thinking‚Äî‚Äú

But Regulus doesn‚Äôt hear what Snape has been thinking. Partially because he hates the kid and therefore tunes him out whenever possible. But also because, at that moment, he spots James across the hall, gaze intent on him. It‚Äôs hard to hold, all the anger in that look. The betrayal. Hard not to sink under it. James hasn‚Äôt looked at him like that in a long time. Maybe not ever. For a second Regulus wonders if James is going to confront him here and now. It would be so like him. But after a few seconds he turns away, called by someone else. He doesn‚Äôt look back again.

‚ÄúOi, Reg,‚Äù he feels someone nock his shoulder and looks up to find Evan staring down at him. ‚ÄúWe gotta go, Transfiguration remember?‚Äù

Regulus blinks, Snape and Mulciber are already walking down the hall, Barty at their side. An unholy alliance if Regulus has ever seen one.

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù he says eventually, ‚Äúyeah, lets go.‚Äù

Evan gives him a curious look. ‚ÄúYou sure you‚Äôre alright?‚Äù

Regulus swallows with difficulty, looking at the spot where James had been.

‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù

¬†

As he walks through the door to the Come and Go Room the fire comes to life, candles lighting around the room, filling the space with a warmth that feels strange after coming from the green of the Slytherin dorms. This space is so familiar to him now. It feels like home.

The room is empty of course, he‚Äôs always the first one, James coming after he spies him on his map. Which means that Regulus now has nothing to do but wait. Normally he doesn‚Äôt mind, but tonight his nerves are fried.

He perches himself on the end of the bed, hands on his knees, trying to prepare himself. He focuses on his breath, on keeping it even, on staying calm. He can do this. He can. He can. He can.

James doesn‚Äôt keep him waiting long. It can‚Äôt be more than fifteen minutes before the door is opening again and James is walking in. The minute he sees Regulus he stops, eyes hard in a way Regulus has never seen before.

Regulus clears his throat. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve heard then?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

He nods, waiting for James to go on but he doesn‚Äôt. Regulus knows, of course, what he ought to do. Apologize, just like Cerci said. More than that, beg for forgiveness. Explain how infuriating it had been to realize that Sirius was once again getting everything he wanted.

But, of course, he doesn‚Äôt do any of that.

‚ÄúI suppose it must have felt nostalgic, the four of you sitting around bashing me. Any new insults I should know about?‚Äù he says flippantly, looking up to find James with his hands in fists. Most people express themselves with their faces or their words, but James, James is all hands. The way they move and reach and hold. You can learn everything you need to know about him just by watching his hands.

‚ÄúI defended you actually,‚Äù his voice is so cold that it takes Regulus a moment to realize what he‚Äôs actually said, and even then he still needs to run the sentence over a few more times before it sinks in.

‚ÄúDefended me?‚Äù he repeats, feeling suddenly wrong footed. He wasn‚Äôt expecting that.

James nods stiffly. ‚ÄúI told Remus I thought you were afraid of going back to Grimmauld alone,‚Äù Regulus struggles between feeling insulted and at the same time feeling terribly, tragically seen. But James doesn‚Äôt give him the chance to interrupt. ‚ÄúI said I doubted Sirius had just been an innocent bystander, that I was sure he‚Äôd goaded you into it,‚Äù Regulus feels his chest grow tight at the idea of James standing up for him. ‚ÄúRemus hasn‚Äôt spoken to me all day so that‚Äôs been lovely. Tell me, Reg, what the fuck is wrong with you?‚Äù

He‚Äôs not fast enough to stop himself from grimacing. ‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he says slowly, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs a bit of a loaded question.‚Äù

James stares back at him, blank faced. ‚ÄúYeah, I‚Äôm not joking right now.‚Äù

No.

He certainly isn‚Äôt.

Regulus can‚Äôt think of anything to say, so they end up just standing there staring at one another. Eventually James speaks again.

‚ÄúRemus says you won‚Äôt tell anyone, because you know I won‚Äôt forgive you if you do. But it won‚Äôt matter because Sirius doesn‚Äôt know that, so he‚Äôll still do what you want. That you‚Äôre playing us both,‚Äù James‚Äôs fists are still clenched at his sides. ‚ÄúI told him that you aren‚Äôt that manipulative,‚Äù he lets out a shaking exhale. ‚ÄúWas I wrong?‚Äù

Regulus blinks. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúWas. I. Wrong?‚Äù

He isn‚Äôt sure how to answer that question. He drops his eyes, thinking about it, trying to pick the truth out of his mess of intentions.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt intend to tell anyone,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúToo much drama for too little reward. But I was counting on Sirius not knowing that. You I‚Äîyou I just tried not to think about.‚Äù

James stares at him for a moment longer before shaking his head, turning around so that his back is to Regulus, hands at the base of his neck.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fucked up Reg, you do realize that?‚Äù

And for some reason that sparks something in him. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all fucked up.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a copout Regulus.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says stubbornly. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the truth. It‚Äôs all fucked up. It‚Äôs fucked up that Sirius gets to do whatever he wants and get away with it.‚Äù

James laughs without humour. ‚ÄúWhat are you even talking about?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs nails are digging into his knees, the anger like a fuse, already lit and headed towards detonation. ‚ÄúWhat did he do last year James?‚Äù

That gets James to turn around again. ‚ÄúWhat has that got to do with‚Äî‚Äú

‚Äú‚Äîbecause he‚Äôll do it again. Whatever the fuck it is that he did to hurt Lupin so badly? He‚Äôll do it again. And you‚Äôll all forgive him. You‚Äôll let it slide‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt let anything slide!‚Äù

‚ÄúBullshit!‚Äù Regulus is standing now, facing James. ‚ÄúYou and Lupin and everyone else, you let him get away with using you. With taking what he wants and giving nothing back and I‚Äôm sick of it. I‚Äôm sick of him getting everything.‚Äù

James‚Äôs mouth forms a firm line, eyes unmoved. ‚ÄúSo what? You‚Äôre the one who‚Äôs gonna punish him then, is that it? The one who‚Äôs gonna put him in his place?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell no one else is going to do it, clearly.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre acting like a fucking baby, you know that?‚Äù

Which is completely unfair in Regulus‚Äôs opinion. ‚ÄúOh fuck you James.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not going back to Grimmald Place,‚Äù James says harshly. Regulus usually isn‚Äôt that aware of the height difference between them. But just then he feels it, feels those extra inches James has weighing on him, pushing him down into the ground.

‚ÄúWell I guess we‚Äôll see, won‚Äôt we?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James says harshly. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not going and you‚Äôre not saying shit, understood?‚Äù

Regulus glares at him. ‚ÄúBut why? I thought people would surprise me James? I thought there was no need to be so scared? If that‚Äôs all true then why the fuck does it matter?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause he doesn‚Äôt want it!‚Äù

Regulus laughs cruelly. ‚ÄúOh, and whatever Sirius wants Sirius gets, right? You make damn sure of that don‚Äôt you? Running around, cleaning up his messes.‚Äù

‚ÄúShut-up Reg.‚Äù

‚ÄúTell me, does it ever get tiring, being so far up his ass?‚Äù

‚ÄúI said shut-up.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne of these days he‚Äôs gonna really fucking hurt someone. I mean really bad. And I can‚Äôt wait to hear what you say then‚Äîhow you defend him‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúStop making it sound like Sirius is in the wrong,‚Äù James cuts in. ‚ÄúHe hasn‚Äôt done anything to you.‚Äù

‚ÄúHE‚ÄôS DONE EVERYTHING TO ME.‚Äù

Regulus is breathing heavy, his chest heaving up and down and for the first time James looks something other than angry.

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúGet out.‚Äù

‚ÄúRegulus‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI said get out! Get the fuck away from me!‚Äù But, of course, James doesn‚Äôt move, not an inch, just keeps standing there staring at him, with his too big eyes behind his too big glasses seeing all of him. Seeing far too much of him.

‚ÄúWhat are you even doing here?‚Äù he goes on, pushing, pushing, pushing. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you have a Mudblood to fuck?‚Äù Evans has been drooling over him for weeks, driving Regulus up the wall every time she sits next to him. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure your blood traitor parents will be so proud when they find out. The Potter line turned to filth.‚Äù

James goes stiff, staring at Regulus like he doesn‚Äôt recognize him. And then, without a word, he turns on his heel and walks out of the room. The sound of the door slamming behind him echoing in Regulus‚Äôs chest.

And that‚Äôs okay.

It‚Äôs fine.

Good, even.

James should walk away.

That‚Äôs what Regulus wants.

What he‚Äôs wanted for months.

He starts pacing, struggling to get enough air, feeling as though his lungs won‚Äôt expand. His ribcage suddenly shrunk to half the size.

But it‚Äôs fine.

Good, even.

Inhale.

Exhale.

Nothing matters.

Especially not James Potter.

Somehow he ends up on the other side of the room, gripping the fireplace mantel with both hands. This feeling will pass, he‚Äôs sure of it. He‚Äôs been through worse than this. If there is anything Regulus is an expert in it‚Äôs pain. And it always passes. Always.

Besides, this is fine.

Good, even.

Now he and James can go their separate ways. James can live his happy perfect life and Regulus can‚Ä¶can persist. And James need never know about the Mark. Probably for the best. It would only hurt him.

Regulus is still clutching at the fireplace, unable to take in a full breath, unable to quell the aching pain beneath his ribs, his lungs, his heart. He squeezes his eyes shut, trying to stop the world from spinning.

You are my happy.

He hadn‚Äôt meant to say it.

But he had meant it.

That was okay though.

Good, even.

Because happy was never something he was meant to have anyway.

He almost thinks he‚Äôs imagining it when he hears the door open. His head snapping up as he turns around and sees James Potter walking back into the room. James stutters under Regulus‚Äôs gaze, like maybe he‚Äôs going to change his mind and walk right back out. But eventually he comes forward, sitting on the arm of one of the sofas facing the fireplace. He runs a hand over his face, looking exhausted.

Regulus doesn‚Äôt know what to say.

‚ÄúThing is,‚Äù James speaks eventually, looking down at the hands in his lap. He isn‚Äôt shouting anymore, he doesn‚Äôt even sound angry, ‚Äúsometimes I need to walk away, I always have. Even when I was little. I need space. I need to think.‚Äù

Regulus stares at him. ‚ÄúTo think?‚Äù he repeats, fairly certain that any minute he‚Äôs going to blink and realize that this is all a hallucination.

James nods, ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù and then, looking up; ‚Äúbut I‚Äôm always coming back.‚Äù

Those eyes say,

I know you.

Say,

I heard you giving up even if you never opened your mouth.

James exhales, never looking away from Regulus, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll always come back to you, okay?‚Äù

Suddenly Regulus has a visceral image of the day Sirius left. Of the empty bedroom. The missing chair at the table. His mother, in one of her rages, burning his face off the family tree. And the weeks of waiting. For anything. An owl, a floo call, a Muggle letter. But nothing ever came. The next time he saw Sirius was on the Hogwarts Express. His brother had barely looked at him. Barely talked to him since.

Regulus wants to tell James that people don‚Äôt come back. They certainly don‚Äôt come back for him. And maybe there‚Äôs a good reason for that. After all, you don‚Äôt drown yourself trying to save a dead body.

Regulus sighs, leaning against the fireplace and scrubbing at his face. ‚ÄúYou shouldn‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúShouldn‚Äôt?‚Äù

‚ÄúCome back to me.‚Äù
