James shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo. No, because you told me‚Äîbecause you told me what happened, what happened to you,‚Äù his words are falling out of his mouth, tripping over one another. ‚ÄúAnd Reg would never let that happen‚Äîwould never stand by and let them‚Ä¶he just, he wouldn‚Äôt.‚Äù

Ten.

Funny, it reminds her a bit of Regulus, that night in the Quidditch stands. His vehement denial that she had been raped because he had stopped it. He had stopped them.

Nine.

Eight.

‚ÄúHe was there,‚Äù she says again. ‚ÄúHe brought me to the infirmary, he tried to erase my memories.‚Äù

Seven.

Six.

James is still shaking his head, still walking backwards, away from her. He‚Äôs halfway into the street at this point. Mary is vaguely aware that people have started counting around them‚Äîvoices echoing in the background.

Five.

‚ÄúSTOP.‚Äù

Four.

Three.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt love him James,‚Äù she says confidently. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt. Not really. You can‚Äôt, not someone like that‚Äîsomeone who would do something like that. You don‚Äôt love him like you love Lily.‚Äù

Two.

‚ÄúI DON‚ÄôT WANT LILY!‚Äù

One.

‚ÄúOh.‚Äù

Both of them swivel around as cheers and fireworks and crashing bottles irrupt around them.

Just a few paces away Lily stands by the door looking slightly shellshocked.

‚ÄúEr‚ÄîI‚Äî‚Äú she shakes her head. ‚ÄúI was supposed to find you for the countdown,‚Äù she swallows waving at the air. ‚ÄúAnyway I‚Äîum‚ÄîI‚Äôm gonna go now, yeah?‚Äù She nods to herself. ‚ÄúYeah. Okay.‚Äù And with that she stumbles back inside, both James and Mary frozen in place.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù James hisses under his breath, running a hand over his face.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Mary agrees, fairly certain that Lily won‚Äôt be forgiving her for this anytime soon. ‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt,‚Äù James growls. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt talk to me right now. Just‚Ä¶don‚Äôt.‚Äù

He starts moving towards the door, leaving Mary feeling equal parts guilty and angry. She chooses to focus on the latter, easier that way.

‚ÄúYou can be mad at me all you want,‚Äù she shouts after him. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt change what I said. Doesn‚Äôt change that it‚Äôs true.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt stop. Doesn‚Äôt look back, storming inside to do God knows what. There‚Äôll be no talking to Lily, not tonight. Maybe not ever. Mary stumbles backwards until she hits the wall behind her, sliding back down onto the ground.

She needs to get a grip‚Äîher head is buzzing with hands and faces and laughs that cut like blades. She sees Mulciber. Sees Snape. Sees Regulus. She still can‚Äôt find Barty‚Äôs face‚Äîlike her brain won‚Äôt let her get that far, won‚Äôt let he remember that much. His touch. His weight. His smell. She remembers all of that. But she never sees his face. Probably thanks to Regulus fucking Black.

He went in her fucking head. He took the truth from her‚Äîtook moments of her life. And now her word means nothing. Her truth means nothing. Fuck him. Fuck him for thinking he had the goddamn right. For thinking one violation was worse than the other. Fuck her stupid head for not being strong enough to keep him out. To keep any of them out.

Her face is in her hands, nails digging into her skull, breaths coming in short little gasps. She should stop thinking about this. She knows that. But the world around her is all noise‚Äîall shadows and voices she doesn‚Äôt recognize. Which is what it feels like in her head most of the time these days. She just keeps seeing them. Keeps feeling their hands. Hearing their laughs. They fucking enjoyed it. What they did to her. They fucking enjoyed every goddamn minute of it.

‚ÄúMary?‚Äù

She‚Äôs barely able to hear her name over the rest of it.

‚ÄúHey‚Äîhey, oh, hey, are you okay? Mary?‚Äù

Someone is sitting next to her, someone has their arm around her shoulders pulling her into their chest. Someone who smells like rooftops and home cooked meals.

Damian.

She doesn‚Äôt realize until his arms wrap around her that she‚Äôs crying‚Äîsobbing more accurately. She hasn‚Äôt cried in ages. Didn‚Äôt when she woke up in the infirmary with a splitting fucking headache and no idea where she was. Or when the nightmares started. Or when she pieced together what really happened to her. So she has absolutely no idea why she‚Äôs crying now. Why she can‚Äôt stop.

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù Damian says, rubbing soothing circles into her back. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay. It‚Äôs gonna be okay.‚Äù

For some reason that just makes her cry harder.

Once she‚Äôs able to stop long enough to speak she‚Äôll blame it on the alcohol. Damian will believe her. Or at least he‚Äôll pretend to, and soon enough she‚Äôll be back at school and she won‚Äôt have to see the pity in his eyes every time he looks at her.

‚ÄúWhat is it Mary? What‚Äôs happened? I know this isn‚Äôt about some boy, I don‚Äôt even know why I said that, I was just trying to get you to talk to me. I just want you to talk to me. Let me help. What‚Äôs wrong? What‚Äôs happened?‚Äù

And of course she can‚Äôt tell him. She can‚Äôt really tell anyone. The only person she did tell was James and it turns out he‚Äôs in love with one of the people who put her here so that shows how bloody good her judgement is. Fuck James too. God, he‚Äôs so good at acting like the nice guy but he‚Äôs just like the rest of them. Another privileged goddamn Pureblood who has no idea what it‚Äôs like. What this feels like.

‚ÄúMary,‚Äù her brother says softly, and she knows she has to speak, even though it feels impossible in that moment. Knows she has to tell him something. Knows it has to be true.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm scared,‚Äù she manages to sob into his shirt. ‚ÄúFuck, I‚Äôm so goddamn scared. All the time. I don‚Äôt‚ÄîI can‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú she sounds pathetic, she recognizes that. Definitely planning to blame it on the alcohol.

‚ÄúScared of what?‚Äù

How can she even begin to explain? How can she articulate all the things crowding her chest and crushing her lungs and keeping her up at night?

She shakes her head against his chest. ‚ÄúMagic,‚Äù for some reason that‚Äôs the word that crawls out of her mouth.

It‚Äôs the thing that's built this wall between her and her family. The thing that let a group of boys turn her body into something she can‚Äôt trust. The thing that‚Äôs painted a target on her back. The thing that at eleven years old made her feel invincible.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm scared of magic.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Hey! Hi! Hello!

Idk, was this too slow? Did you like it? I kinda think I really like it but I always go back and forth.

This chapter is fully inspired by my belief that New Years Eve is the messiest night of the year.

Thank you so much for all your lovely comments and kudos I appreciate them so muuuucchhhhh, they give me all the warm fuzzies!

Chapter 32

Chapter Notes

TW: Referenced Sexual Assault

**French translations in the end notes**

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I: REMUS

It‚Äôs always a bit awkward. Being a werewolf. Especially when you‚Äôre a guest in someone‚Äôs home and also about to transform into a monster. There‚Äôs no polite way for someone to ask if they can please lock you in their basement now. Though the Potter‚Äôs certainly try their best.

‚ÄúYou sure you don‚Äôt want anything to eat?‚Äù James‚Äôs mum asks as she places a set of folded sheets on the bed they‚Äôve brought down for him. All the other furniture has been removed, but despite that the Potter‚Äôs still have the nicest basement Remus has ever seen. Warm butter coloured walls, hardwood floors, exposed brick, a fireplace‚Äîcurrently disconnected from the Floo network and unlit‚Äîit‚Äôs nothing like his basement back home. This room was made for games and movie nights and sleepovers. It makes Remus fidget. More acutely aware of how much of an imposition he‚Äôs being. He should have gone home. Should have dealt with this himself.

‚ÄúRemus?‚Äù

He looks up, finding Euphemia still standing by the bed, concern clear in her eyes even when she smiles at him.

‚ÄúYou okay kiddo?‚Äù

He nods stiffly, not bothering to bring up the aching in his bones or his head or the nausea that hasn‚Äôt subsided since this morning. She knows all that already. Besides, it‚Äôs not really what she‚Äôs asking.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm worried about the walls,‚Äù Remus finally forces himself to say, hands shoved in the pouch at the front of his hoodie, eyes not meeting her‚Äôs.

A wrinkle appears between her eyes. ‚ÄúThe walls?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôll‚Äî‚Äú he coughs. ‚ÄúI mean I‚Äôll,‚Äù lets not shy away from it now Remus. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll scratch them up.‚Äù

She arches her brow, looking a bit bemused. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, honestly, it doesn‚Äôt matter.‚Äù

Remus swallows, throat dry, eyes trailing around the room, spotting all the places that photos and paintings have been removed. Pictures of James practically plaster the walls in this house. Remus doesn‚Äôt know if his parents ever took any family photos. If they did they certainly never hung them up.

‚ÄúThere so nice though,‚Äù he says eventually. Pathetically.

Euphemia makes a pitying noise that has Remus flinching. ‚ÄúOh love,‚Äù she‚Äôs gentle when she wraps her arm around him, when she presses a kiss to the top of his head.

‚ÄúNot as nice as you,‚Äù she says, letting him go after a moment. ‚ÄúBesides, a wave of my wand and it‚Äôll all be good as new anyway, one of the many perks of being a witch,‚Äù she gives him a wink.

Remus isn‚Äôt sure if she‚Äôs waiting for a response but he can‚Äôt quite manage one.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre sure there‚Äôs nothing else you need?‚Äù she asks eventually, standing by the bottom of the stairs.

He shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo, thank you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell alright then, we‚Äôll see you in the morning,‚Äù she smiles. ‚ÄúMimi‚Äôs making pancakes.‚Äù Remus does his best to smile back, he‚Äôs not sure how well he manages it.

After she leaves he spends a long time just staring at the bed on the other side of the room, trying to imagine what he‚Äôd be doing tonight if he was normal. He‚Äôd probably be upstairs with James, Sirius and Peter, playing exploding snaps or chess. The other night, after Peter left and James fell asleep, Sirius dragged Remus outside and convinced him to ride on the back of his broom. Remus isn‚Äôt overly fond of flying, but with Sirius‚Äôs warm body pressed to his chest and the star filled sky wrapped around them, he couldn‚Äôt help enjoying it at least a little. Afterward, they‚Äôd crawled back into bed, smelling like winter and laughter, and kissed until they‚Äôd fallen asleep.

He brings his hand to his chest like the ache there is a physical thing. After a few more seconds of sulking he sighs, walking over to the wall and sitting down on the ground, ignoring the bed. It reminds him too much of the shack. Maybe that should be comforting but it isn‚Äôt. He folds his arms over his knees and rests his forehead on top‚Ä¶waiting.

That is, until he hears the door open. He doesn‚Äôt lift his head right away, assuming it‚Äôs Euphemia, that she must have forgotten something, or brought him some food even though he told her he wasn‚Äôt hungry‚Äîmums never listen when you say you aren‚Äôt hungry. But then:

‚ÄúHey Moons,‚Äù comes a soft voice.

Remus instantly jerks upright, which hurts, a hiss escaping his mouth before he can stop it, the room spinning.

‚ÄúWoah, you okay?‚Äù Remus can hear Sirius stepping forward even though the world remains too fuzzy to see. ‚ÄúYou just got like three shades paler.‚Äù

Remus has to squeeze his eyes shut, taking in a deep breath before opening them again.

‚ÄúWhat are you doing here?‚Äù he whispers, the horror plain in his voice.

Sirius sits down in front of him, legs crossed. ‚ÄúD‚Äôyou really think we were going to leave you down here alone?‚Äù he gives him a wink.

Remus‚Äôs mouth feels too dry. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not safe,‚Äù not that it‚Äôs ever safe.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll transform when you do,‚Äù Sirius shrugs, like its no big deal. Which doesn‚Äôt sit well with Remus at all.

Mary thinks that Sirius is fucked up because of his parents. But sometimes Remus worries it‚Äôs because of him too. That Sirius can act so casually about his‚Äîabout Remus turning into a werewolf‚Äîit isn‚Äôt‚Ä¶normal.

‚ÄúThe Potters?‚Äù he finally manages to ask, eyes automatically going to the ceiling over their heads, like he can see Euphemia and Fleamont milling about above them.

‚ÄúJames is covering for me,‚Äù Sirius says. And when Remus can‚Äôt muster another reply he reaches out, softly taking Remus‚Äôs hand and squeezing. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be okay.‚Äù

He wants to believe him.

‚ÄúYou should transform,‚Äù Remus says on his next exhale, voice shaky. He should try harder to get Sirius to go but the truth is, he doesn‚Äôt want him to. Selfishly he‚Äôs glad. Glad that he‚Äôs risking his life to keep Remus company.

Merlin, he really is fucking him up isn‚Äôt he?

‚ÄúWe still have time,‚Äù Sirius says, his thumb making soothing circles against Remus‚Äôs palm. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôre you feeling?‚Äù

Remus lets out something sort of like laughter. ‚ÄúShitty.‚Äù

Sirius smiles. ‚ÄúYeah, I figured.‚Äù Then, reaching behind himself with his free hand, he pulls a chocolate bar out of his back pocket. ‚ÄúI brought you something.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs stomach simultaneously growls and lurches at the same time. ‚ÄúOh,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to eat it now obviously,‚Äù Sirius slides it across to him. ‚ÄúBut, just figured‚Ä¶‚Äù he shrugs.

Remus doesn‚Äôt know why he‚Äôs feeling choked up about a bloody chocolate bar. The Moon always makes his emotions go haywire. Though maybe it‚Äôs not the moon, maybe it‚Äôs that Sirius Black, who famously never thinks of anything or anyone but himself (and on occasion James), thought of Remus. Or maybe he‚Äôs just really happy there‚Äôs chocolate‚Äîit‚Äôs honestly hard to tell at this point.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù his words are barely audible.

Sirius smiles so brightly Remus almost has to look away. Almost. He‚Äôs going to say something else, because there‚Äôs always more to say with Sirius. He makes lists of all the things he wants to share with him‚Äîthoughts and ideas and jokes. ‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he curls forward, forehead pressed to his knees as a lancing pain shoots through his head. He feels like his skull is splitting apart.

‚ÄúWhere does it hurt?‚Äù Sirius asks softly, not sounding the least bit disturbed by the trembling mess Remus is quickly becoming. But then again, he‚Äôs seen it all before. Something like embarrassment curdles in Remus‚Äôs stomach but he pushes it down.

‚ÄúHead,‚Äù he manages to gasp. ‚ÄúEverywhere. But‚Äîmostly my head.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius.‚Äù

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù Sirius murmurs, as he slides between Remus and the wall, fitting Remus between his legs before pulling him back against his chest. Despite himself Remus feels his body relax, sighing at the contact, at the feeling of being so completely and utterly held.

‚ÄúIts not safe,‚Äù he says half-heartedly into Sirius‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúWe shouldn‚Äôt be this close.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe have time,‚Äù is all Sirius says before his fingers come up and start expertly massaging Remus‚Äôs temples.

Remus lets out a small noise of satisfaction.

‚ÄúGood?‚Äù Sirius asks.

‚ÄúYeah, Merlin, where‚Äôd you learn to do that?‚Äù

He feels Sirius shrug behind him. ‚ÄúLooked it up.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs eyes fly open‚Äîsomething he instantly regrets, immediately closing them again. Seeing is too hard right now. ‚ÄúYou‚Äîyou looked up head massages?‚Äù

Another shrug. ‚ÄúYou get headaches a lot. Thought‚Ä¶least this was something I could do.‚Äù

Remus feels his eyes start to burn. It isn‚Äôt fair really, for Sirius to do this to him on a full moon when he‚Äôs already a mess, barely able to string two thoughts together.

‚ÄúSirius Black, you‚Äôre being very sweet for Hogwarts‚Äôs resident bad boy.‚Äù

Sirius laughs, a low rumble that‚Äôs all chest, giving Remus goosebumps. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt tell anyone, wouldn‚Äôt want to shatter the illusion.‚Äù

‚ÄúYour secrets safe with me.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh I know.‚Äù

And there‚Äôs more in those words than just a little witty banter.

A few minutes of silence pass, with Remus sinking further and further into Sirius‚Äôs touch. His fingers don‚Äôt stop the pain but they definitely help. All of him helps.

‚ÄúDoes talking make it worse or better right now?‚Äù Sirius asks eventually.

It‚Äôs Remus‚Äôs turn to shrug. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine. What‚Äôs up?‚Äù his eyes are still closed and he can hear the drowsiness in his own voice.

Sirius lets out a sigh. ‚ÄúSomething‚Äôs going on between Mary and Regulus,‚Äù he says after a brief pause. That‚Äôs enough to get Remus‚Äôs eyes open again, though he doesn‚Äôt move, not even when Sirius goes on: ‚ÄúAnd I think James knows about it or‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know‚Äîis involved in it somehow.‚Äù

Well. Remus hadn‚Äôt seen this coming.

‚ÄúUm‚Ä¶why do you think there‚Äôs something going on?‚Äù he asks tentatively.

Sirius sighs again. ‚ÄúWalked in on them having some sort of secret conversation that was either Mary propositioning him or threatening his life. It was honestly hard to tell.‚Äù

Despite himself Remus laughs. ‚ÄúSounds like Mary,‚Äù Sirius makes a noncommittal noise of agreement. ‚ÄúJames wasn‚Äôt there though?‚Äù Remus clarifies.

Sirius‚Äôs nose tickles the back of his neck when he shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo, Mary just‚Ä¶just said I should ask him if I wanted to know more.‚Äù

Damnit Mary.

Remus swallows with difficulty. ‚ÄúAnd‚Äîer‚Äîhave you? Asked James I mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù another pause. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been in a shitty mood.‚Äù

Remus scrunches up his face‚Äîwhich actually hurts right now. ‚ÄúSince yesterday you mean? I noticed that too. Lily was also acting weird.‚Äù

Sirius blows out a breath that tickles Remus‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúNah, he‚Äôs been in a shit mood since we left school. Something‚Äôs going on with his boyfriend, and considering who he is‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt even know who he is,‚Äù Remus interjects, mostly just to sooth his own anxiety, needing to hear Sirius confirm it.

He grunts, fingers stilling on Remus‚Äôs head, and it takes everything in Remus not to whine in protest. ‚ÄúI know he‚Äôs a Slytherin, which is enough,‚Äù and then; ‚ÄúYou could tell me you know.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt actually.‚Äù

‚ÄúRemus‚Äî‚Äú

But he makes a protesting noise, burying his face in Sirius‚Äôs chest. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre making my headache worse.‚Äù

Sirius scoffs, sounding more fond than annoyed. ‚ÄúPulling the full moon card are you?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a card,‚Äù Remus says, voice slightly muffled by Sirius‚Äôs shirt.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Sirius agrees softly, hand travelling from his temples to his hair, which Remus can‚Äôt complain about. ‚ÄúDo you think he‚Äôll tell me if I ask?‚Äù

Remus presses further into him, hating that he‚Äôs lying to him right now. ‚ÄúIf you ask who he‚Äôs seeing?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Sirius huffs. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve tried that, his valour is too bloody strong. But if I ask about Mary and Reg?‚Äù

Remus bites his lower lip, holding back a yelp as a hot streak of pain shoots through his back. It‚Äôs a few seconds before he can speak. ‚ÄúAll you can do is ask,‚Äù is what he says, feeling like a coward.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Sirius agrees, hand still carding absentmindedly through Remus‚Äôs hair. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll ask when we get back.‚Äù

Remus nods, happy to put an end to this conversation. His whole body feels like it‚Äôs on fire even though he‚Äôs shivering. It can‚Äôt feel nice for Sirius, to be this close to him when he‚Äôs all sick and clammy, but he doesn‚Äôt pull away.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôll have to let go of me eventually,‚Äù Remus says, not knowing why, since it isn‚Äôt at all what he wants.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Sirius says, unconcerned. ‚ÄúYou tell me when and I will.‚Äù

Like it‚Äôs simple.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù he hears himself say before he can help it.

Sirius is silent and Remus is pretty sure he isn‚Äôt going to respond, but then he bends down and kisses the top of Remus‚Äôs head.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm always going to be here Remus, I promise,‚Äù he sounds like he means it. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not doing you a favour I‚Äôm just‚Ä¶this is where I want to be, okay?‚Äù

I love you.

Remus thinks without meaning to.

Almost says out loud. But then another burst of pain explodes behind his eyes and he‚Äôs forced to rip himself from Sirius‚Äôs arms, falling forward onto his hands and knees. Breathing heavy and using all his willpower not to vomit.

‚ÄúRemus?‚Äù Sirius asks gently.

‚ÄúYou should change,‚Äù he chokes, and then‚ÄîMerlin, it never gets easier, you‚Äôd think after all this time he‚Äôd have some way to mange the pain but‚Äîsuddenly it feels like hooks have been stabbed through his torso and are being yanked in all different directions, pulling him apart. He thinks he starts screaming, but he can‚Äôt be sure. Reality bends and twists around him. When he comes to again his sweaty forehead is pressed to the cold basement floor. Sirius whispering softly beside him, hand making soothing circles on his back.

‚ÄúChange,‚Äù he chokes. ‚ÄúSirius, please. Please change now.‚Äù

Sirius‚Äôs hand stills, and then; ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù

Remus looks up, meeting his eyes for the first time all night, his breath catching the way it always does.

I love you, he thinks again. Hunched over on the floor, barely able to breathe. He watches Sirius‚Äôs face disappear. Hidden behind fur. He almost says it out loud then‚Äîit‚Äôs easier when he‚Äôs a dog. Less scary. But before he can speak he‚Äôs screaming. The sound of his back breaking filling up the room.

¬†

PART II: REGULUS

He goes back to school tomorrow. All and all it‚Äôs been a rather uneventful visit. Everyone is busy. Except for Kreacher and his father, which, if Regulus is being honest, is exactly how he likes it. If it hadn‚Äôt been for his run-in with Mary Macdonald he might even have enjoyed himself. As it is, he‚Äôs been wracking his brain trying to figure out how to once again get out of doing the thing he‚Äôs been telling himself he needs to do for months.

Is there something he can say‚Äîsome way to phrase it‚Äîthat won‚Äôt send James running? That will make him understand.

Understand what?

Asks the cruel voice in his head.

That you‚Äôre every bit the coward Sirius has always said you are? That you don‚Äôt care much one way or the other, Death Eater or Mudblood, you just want to survive?

That you were trying to protect him. To keep him at arms length. But you‚Äôve changed your mind?

Regulus shakes his head, trying to push all those thoughts out. They‚Äôre pointless and unhelpful. He knows what will happen once James knows, regardless of the words he chooses or excuses he makes. He‚Äôs always known.

‚ÄúMon chou,‚Äù his father‚Äôs voice pulls him out of his thoughts. Regulus looks up from the book in his lap to find his father watching him with concern in his eyes. ‚ÄúWhat has you looking so upset, huh?‚Äù

Regulus can only hold his stare for so long before looking away. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not upset.‚Äù He grimaces at the high, tinny sound of his voice.

His father kisses his teeth, reaching over and lightly tapping under Regulus‚Äôs chin, forcing him to look up. ‚ÄúCome now, no lying to your Papa.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nothing‚Äîit‚Äôs‚Äîjust‚Äîschool and‚Äî‚Äú he waves his hand in the air unable to say the rest of it. Even in this house, the one place that the Mark on his arm is something to be proud of, they don‚Äôt really talk about it. About the people who have been coming and going and the meetings Walburga has been having. Nobody has said anything to Regulus‚Äîinvited him to sit in or asked him how he‚Äôs been forwarding their cause at Hogwarts. He‚Äôs not sure how much longer his invisibility will last but he is grateful for it.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something else,‚Äù his father pushes, voice soothing as always, like waves against the haul of a ship or a breeze through the trees. Grimmauld Place hasn‚Äôt been good for him‚Äîis it ever good for anyone?‚Äîhe‚Äôs paler and thinner than he was the last time Regulus saw him.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre afraid,‚Äù it‚Äôs not a question so Regulus doesn‚Äôt answer. ‚ÄúAfraid of me mon cher? Afraid to tell me?‚Äù

Regulus swallows with some difficulty, looking away again, out the window. It‚Äôs dark out, but then, it‚Äôs dark inside too‚Äîthe only real light coming from the fireplace. He can just make out the stars. Eyes automatically looking for Sirius.

There is a weight to his father‚Äôs attention, he can feel it even if he can‚Äôt see it. It‚Äôs something he‚Äôs always craved, though at this moment he would very gladly give it up. His father is waiting for an answer and honestly, Regulus isn‚Äôt sure why he isn‚Äôt just giving him an excuse. He has them, a dozen, a hundred‚Äîall saved up to pull out whenever anyone asks a question that cuts too close. His brain a catalogue of the different lies he needs to tell to get through the day.

‚ÄúRegulus?‚Äù

He loves his father. Probably more than anyone else in the world. He loves his father and his father is dying. That‚Äôs his excuse, for the words he lets out of his mouth. His chest. The box buried deep inside him. He loves his father. And his father is dying. And he just wants to know, before he loses the chance. He just wants to know if his father loves him back.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm gay Papa.‚Äù

He wonders if James would be proud of him‚Äîfor saying it. Admitting it. His single act of bravery.

There‚Äôs silence. Regulus doesn‚Äôt take his eyes off the window, forces himself to focus on the stars outside, trying to figure out which ones they are. Trying to find himself. Sirius. Orion. Trying not to think about the slowly growing ache in his chest or the vomit inching up the back of his throat.

We‚Äôll always be together up there,

He tells himself, trying to calm his speeding pulse the same way he had when Sirius left.

Whatever else happens we‚Äôll always have that.

Eventually his father clears his throat and Regulus barely manages to suppress a wince.

‚ÄúAnd that makes you upset?‚Äù Orion finally asks. Regulus has no idea what to do with that. He tries to dissect his father‚Äôs tone but he can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs angry or bewildered or both.

He keeps his eyes on the window, afraid to find out for certain. ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt it upset you?‚Äù

More silence. It goes on too long. Regulus should leave. He should leave. He has no idea what to expect, his mother has always been the one to punish him, he isn‚Äôt sure what his father will do. Tell her‚Äîis the obvious answer. Just the thought makes him shiver. Fuck. This was a mistake. What did he think was going to happen?

‚ÄúMon chou‚Äîregarde-moi s‚Äôil-te-pla√Æt.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs hands are trembling as he shakes his head.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù the words barely audible. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want to let you down,‚Äù it‚Äôs easier to say it without looking. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why I‚Äôm like this. Why I can‚Äôt ever seem to‚Äîdo anything the right way.‚Äù

‚ÄúNon, Regulus, enough. Look at me please?‚Äù

Feeling like he might be sick he finally manages to turn his head. Instantly his father reaches out, taking his face in both hands.

‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù he says softly, and for some reason that makes Regulus want to cry. ‚ÄúYou are my son. You are the light of my life. The joy. I am stuck in this bed withering away but I die happy knowing that I gave the world you,‚Äù his father‚Äôs hands are shaking. ‚ÄúYou are so beautiful my darling,‚Äù he wipes Regulus‚Äôs tears away with his thumbs. ‚ÄúYou could never let me down.‚Äù

All Regulus manages is a wobbly, ‚Äúoh‚Äù before his father is pulling him closer, the book falling out of his lap as he steps towards the bed, allowing himself to be hugged.

‚ÄúJe t‚Äôaime Regulus, toujours, toujours, toujours,‚Äù he whispers in his ear.

Regulus tries to steady his breathing. Settle his nerves. ‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù he says, which makes his father laugh, pulling away just enough so he can hold his face again.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm your Papa,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs my job.‚Äù

Regulus is grateful. So grateful. But he can‚Äôt help thinking of Sirius and wondering where this man was when Sirius needed him? As if hearing the thoughts in his head, his father‚Äôs expression shifts, becoming more serious.

‚ÄúBut Regulus, your maman‚Äî‚Äú

Now it‚Äôs Regulus‚Äôs turn to laugh, though perhaps a bit more bitterly. ‚ÄúNo I won‚Äôt‚ÄîI won‚Äôt tell her.‚Äù

His father nods, letting his hands fall away. And there it is, Regulus supposes, the answer to his question, the sin Sirius can never forgive. Because their father loves them. Just not enough to fight for them.

‚ÄúTell me,‚Äù his father smiles now, a mischievous look in his eyes, ‚Äúis there someone special?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs throat grows tight. He should change the subject. He should lie. ‚ÄúYes,‚Äù he says instead‚Äîdaringly‚Äîtoeing too close to the edge.

His father beams at him. ‚ÄúIs he very handsome?‚Äù

That manages to startle a laugh out of Regulus. ‚ÄúYes,‚Äù he exhales, shoulders falling away from his ears. ‚ÄúYes, very handsome.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd kind?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs chest squeezes and he wonders how his father‚Äîthe man married to Walburga‚Äîcan ask that question without choking. ‚ÄúOui‚Äîyeah, he‚Äôs‚Äîyeah. I‚Äôve never met anyone‚Äî‚Äú he can‚Äôt seem to finish that thought, hand going to the base of his throat like he can free the words that have gotten stuck there.

His father tilts his head to the side. ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

Regulus just shakes his head. ‚ÄúNothing, I‚Äôm being ridiculous.‚Äù

But his father reaches forward, squeezing his arm ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve come so far mon chou, no more lying, hmm?‚Äù

He wonders if his father realizes how ridiculous a request that is in this house. But he doesn‚Äôt argue. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt have him,‚Äù he whispers.

He sees the understanding brighten his father‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúAh,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúwell, there are ways to‚Ä¶accommodate such things.‚Äù

Regulus really does laugh now. ‚ÄúAre you suggesting he be my mistress?‚Äù the thought is so ludicrous and so addictive that Regulus can‚Äôt help imagining it, just for a moment. They could have a house, some place to meet, that was just their‚Äôs, that no one else would know about. It wouldn‚Äôt just have to be for a few hours either, they could get away for days, for weeks even, at least every once and a while. Regulus squeezes his eyes shut, mentally shaking himself.

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt,‚Äù he finally manages. ‚ÄúHe would‚Äîhe would never want that.‚Äù Regulus can‚Äôt quite believe he‚Äôs having this conversation. ‚ÄúHe doesn‚Äôt want to love in secret. It‚Äôs not who he is. He‚Äôs too‚Äîtoo honourable for that.‚Äù

His father‚Äôs eyebrows raise to his nearly nonexistent hairline before Regulus realizes his mistake. ‚ÄúLove?‚Äù

He flushes, turning away.

‚ÄúOh mon cher, tu l‚Äôaime?‚Äù

‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs enough truths for tonight.‚Äù

But when he looks back his father still wears an expression somewhere between fondness and pity. ‚ÄúL'amour est la lame la plus tranchante, n'est-ce pas? Une douleur que nous m√©prisons et d√©sirons tout √† la fois.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúEnough Papa, I misspoke, don‚Äôt go making a whole thing of it.‚Äù

His father laughs, opening his mouth to speak when a loud crack draws both their eyes towards the door.

‚ÄúKreacher?‚Äù

The house elf fidgets, eyes larger than normal as he looks imploringly from one face to the other. ‚ÄúI am being very, very sorries sirs, but Madam has sent for Master Regulus.‚Äù

Regulus blinks. ‚ÄúOh,‚Äù he gets up, Kreacher still looking unusually twitchy, ‚Äúis that all?‚Äù

Kreacher dances from one foot to the other, one of his hands coming up to tug nervously on his ears. ‚ÄúShe‚Äîshe is not alone Master Regulus sir,‚Äù he makes a nervous humming noise that causes something to twist in Regulus‚Äôs stomach.

‚ÄúWho is she with Kreacher?‚Äù he asks carefully.

Another whimper. ‚ÄúIt‚Äîhe is here. It‚Äôs him Master Regulus. He is here. In the dining room. He is‚Ä¶‚Äù the house elf shivers instead of finishing his sentence.

Regulus can relate, feeling something cold suddenly dripping down his own spine. ‚ÄúHe,‚Äù Regulus repeats numbly. ‚ÄúYou mean‚Ä¶‚Äù

Kreacher gives a jerky nod. ‚ÄúThe Dark Lord is waiting sir.‚Äù

¬†

PART III: JAMES

¬†

So yeah, he‚Äôs being a bit reckless. Or a lot. Definitely a lot. But Sirius and Remus are locked in the basement together and Peter went home and James just‚Äîhe can‚Äôt sleep. And he knows. Knows that he‚Äôll see Regulus tomorrow. Knows that he can‚Äôt see him tonight. But he just‚Ä¶because he can‚Äôt get Mary‚Äôs words out of his head. He tried reading and rearranging the furniture in his bedroom before he gave up and went outside to fly laps around the back garden. Flying usually helps clear his head‚Äîor at least exhaust him‚Äîbut this time it didn‚Äôt. His mind was just so loud and so cluttered and there was no one around to stop him or distract him and then suddenly he wasn‚Äôt flying laps around the back garden. He was flying to London.

So. Yeah. Bit reckless.

He‚Äôs never been to Grimmauld Place per se, but Sirius has talked about it enough that James knows where it is. Well, he knows what street it‚Äôs on, knows where it would be on the street if it didn‚Äôt have whatever charms it does that are currently preventing him from being able to see it. So he‚Äôs sitting in the park across the street, it‚Äôs empty and dark, one or two street lamps flickering around him, broom clutched in his hand, fingers frozen, face numb.

It feels both worse and better, knowing that Regulus is right there. James hadn‚Äôt been old enough or strong enough to save Sirius himself. To physically drag him out of this house. But he reckons he could do it now. He‚Äôs older. Well. A bit older. Enough older. He reckons he would stand a chance, if he caught them by surprise. Or if could find Regulus‚Äôs room, sneak him out the window. At this point he‚Äôd Body-Bind him and carry him out if he wouldn‚Äôt come on his own. This has gone on long enough. James has already stood by helplessly and watched Walburga destroy one person he loves, he isn‚Äôt doing it again. He isn‚Äôt waiting until the moment she hurts Regulus so badly he can‚Äôt recover from it. He‚Äôs ending this now.

Or‚Ä¶he would be‚Ä¶if he could see the bloody house.

‚ÄúParanoid bitch,‚Äù he whispers under his breath which freezes in front of his mouth. It‚Äôs bloody cold out, which is good, means there are fewer people. Fewer people to see him sitting suspiciously on a park bench all alone and fewer people to see him flying halfway across the country on a broomstick. He flinches thinking about that last one, really hoping that in the dark no one was able to spot him.

Okay Potter, he thinks, foot tapping impatiently on the ground as he continues to glare at a bunch of posh looking townhouses. What‚Äôs the plan? We‚Äôre here. We did it. So what‚Äôs next?

He fiddles with the wand that‚Äôs still half up his sleeve, turning it in between his fingers. Does he try a revealing spell? A summoning charm? What kind of magic makes a whole house disappear? And not in a ‚Äúthere‚Äôs a big empty space here‚Äù kind of way, but in a ‚Äúliterally doesn‚Äôt exist‚Äù kind of way.

‚ÄúAre you lost little boy?‚Äù

James‚Äôs foot immediately stops tapping. He knows that voice. Hasn‚Äôt heard it in a while but‚Ä¶

‚ÄúNarcissa?‚Äù his wand is now clutched more firmly in his hand as the blond haired witch walks toward him, dark cloak dragging behind her. She hadn‚Äôt been blond the last time he saw her but he‚Äôd been‚Äîwhat? Eleven? Twelve?

She stops in front of the bench he‚Äôs sitting on, cold eyes staring down at him. ‚ÄúWhat are you doing here Potter?‚Äù

He should really be doing something‚Äîlike running. Flying. Moving in any and all directions that are away from her. And yet, for some reason, he finds himself frozen.

‚ÄúD‚Äîdo you live here?‚Äù he asks dumbly.

She arches her brow. ‚ÄúNo. I‚Äôm visiting my aunt. Which brings me back to my original question: what are you doing here?‚Äù

James realizes he still doesn‚Äôt have an answer to that. ‚ÄúVisiting your aunt?‚Äù he offers up weakly, surprised when he sees Narcissa fight back a smile.

‚ÄúTouch√©.‚Äù

‚ÄúBonjour?‚Äù

‚ÄúAre you just saying random french words?‚Äù she asks.

‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt that what you‚Äôre doing?‚Äù He‚Äôs overcompensating. When he gets nervous he gets cocky.

Narcissa snorts, running him up and down with her eyes. ‚ÄúI can see why Sirius likes you so much. You‚Äôre practically the same person.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm prettier though right?‚Äù his hand tightens around his wand, pulse beating a bit too fast.

Narcissa steps forward and James fights the urge to flinch away. ‚ÄúDid somebody send you here?‚Äù she asks, voice a low purr.

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo?‚Äù

James shakes his head. ‚ÄúI swear.‚Äù

She steps closer, James considers pulling out his wand, considers aiming it at her. But then, that‚Äôs a stupid move unless he means to use it. And he‚Äôs not sure that he does. I mean, technically he can‚Äôt. And he isn‚Äôt entirely sure that the Ministry will side with him if he claims self-defence against Narcissa Black.

She tilts her head to the side. ‚ÄúDoes that mean no one knows you‚Äôre here?‚Äù

James feels his whole body go tense. Because, yes. Yes, that‚Äôs exactly what it means. Narcissa clearly notices because she smiles. She‚Äôs beautiful in the way that all the Blacks are beautiful. But she has none of warmth of Sirius or Regulus. Her eyes feel hollow. James doesn‚Äôt like it. Doesn‚Äôt think she laughs very much.

‚ÄúWell isn‚Äôt this a fabulous prize,‚Äù she takes hold of his chin, jerking his head back so she can get a better look at him, forcing him more fully into the light of the street lamps. ‚ÄúTell me, James, what do you think your father would give up to make sure you came home safe?‚Äù

James‚Äôs heart starts pounding against his ribs. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúIf I snatched you right now,‚Äù her nails dig into his chin. ‚ÄúHow far do you think he‚Äôd go to get you back, huh? Would he write a few new laws? Give up some names? Some hideouts? You‚Äôre the only one right? The only child?‚Äù something flickers in her eyes, something vulnerable that James can‚Äôt quite figure out. ‚ÄúThey tried for a long time to have you, I remember the rumours. I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôd let you go easily.‚Äù

The last thing he ever wanted was to hurt his parents. He wonders if he could convince her that they have a strained relationship, that he really isn‚Äôt worth much. He‚Äôs not sure he could pull it off, so he stays silent. Eventually she lets him go.

‚ÄúNo one sent you,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAnd my disaster of a cousin has already fled. So what, baby Potter, are you doing here? I‚Äôm honestly intrigued. What inspired this level of idiocy?‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt answer, wondering what she would do if he just jumped on his broom and took off. There would be plenty of time to hex him on the ascent‚Äîwell, at least enough time. But would she? Out here in the street? How much control do the Death Eaters really have over the Ministry? Enough to overlook kidnapping? Is she bluffing? He can‚Äôt tell. He looks at her and tries to crack open her expression but he honestly has no idea.

Fuck.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù she snaps her fingers in front of his face, causing him to start. ‚ÄúAnswers, now, or I‚Äôm getting Lucius.‚Äù

And suddenly James goes very still.

He‚Äôd forgotten.

Forgotten that she isn‚Äôt Narcissa Black. Not anymore. She‚Äôs Narcissa Malfoy.

And just like that all his nerves and fear are burnt up by near unbearable rage. The desire to break Lucius Malfoy into a hundred little pieces.

‚ÄúDo it,‚Äù he growls, standing. He‚Äôs taller than her, broader‚Äîhe has quidditch to thank for that‚Äîforcing her to instantly step back.

Her eyes narrow, running him up and down‚Äîreassessing. ‚ÄúDo you know my husband?‚Äù she asks.

James gives his head a sharp shake. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve never met.‚Äù Which seems like the safest answer but it does nothing to dim the new curiosity in her eyes.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs more.‚Äù

‚ÄúCall him here‚Äîyou bring him here.‚Äù James‚Äôs wand slides properly into his palm now, a movement that Narcissa doesn‚Äôt miss.

She watches his wand for a moment before her eyes come back up to meet his. ‚ÄúHas he done something to you? Your father?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know what he‚Äôs done.‚Äù It‚Äôs a vague statement, it could mean anything, but it makes Narcissa‚Äôs eyes narrow further.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs done many things. You‚Äôll have to be more specific.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhere is he? The Ministry? Is he in there?‚Äù he jabs a shaking hand in the direction of the street, where he knows Grimmauld Place is even if he can‚Äôt see it. ‚ÄúTell him I‚Äôm here, tell him I‚Äôm waiting. Lets see how much of a coward he really is, or if he has enough of a spine to pick up his wand.‚Äù

That startles a laugh out of her, ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not going to fight a child.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh so he‚Äôll fuck kids but he won‚Äôt fight them?‚Äù He sees the minute she understands. It‚Äôs the same minute he realizes what he‚Äôs done.

‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù she whispers, taking a step back, eyes going almost unwillingly to the houses across the street like she can‚Äôt help herself. ‚ÄúHe told you? He told YOU?‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt having this discussion. Especially not with Narcissa bloody Malfoy. ‚ÄúYou get your fucking husband here now.‚Äù

There is no mask anymore, dozens of conflicting emotions splintering across Narcissa‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúWhy? Why would he tell you? He hates you.‚Äù

James tries not to flinch. Tries not to care that that was probably true at some point. But then, you could say the same thing about him. He had hated Regulus hadn‚Äôt he?

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt get it,‚Äù Narcissa mutters, clearly irritated by that fact.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt need to get it,‚Äù James pushes into her space again. Righteous indignation is a hell of a drug.

For the second time that night he sees something click in Narcissa‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúOh shit,‚Äù she whispers under her breath. ‚ÄúOh goddamnit Regulus. It‚Äôs you, isn‚Äôt it? Lucius has been banging on about Regulus having a boy. It‚Äôs you. James fucking Potter.‚Äù

I‚Äôm so sorry Reg.

‚ÄúYou knew didn‚Äôt you?‚Äù he goes on, because he‚Äôs already so far in, and there‚Äôs no way he‚Äôs leaving this conversation without hearing her admit it.

‚ÄúKnew?‚Äù

‚ÄúAbout Lucius,‚Äù the words are ground between his teeth, anger vibrating his bones. ‚ÄúYou knew‚Äînot just after but during, didn‚Äôt you? Knew what he was doing and you did nothing. You married him.‚Äù

Narcissa at least has the decency to look ashamed. ‚ÄúWe all pay a price to be part of this family.‚Äù

It‚Äôs so horrible that the only thing James can do is laugh. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs sick that is. That‚Äôs fucking sick. How can you live with yourself? He was a kid‚Äîhe‚Äôs still a kid‚Äîhow can you get in bed with that monster.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt you moralize at me you fucking infant‚Äîlike you have any idea how the real world works,‚Äù she shoves him back. ‚ÄúHuman beings are disgusting and vile, either learn to live with it or, I don‚Äôt know, throw yourself off a cliff. Regulus hasn‚Äôt bled for this family anymore than the rest of us. He‚Äôll get his reward in the end.‚Äù

It takes every ounce of self-control he possesses not to hit her. Not to throw her on the ground. ‚ÄúHis reward?‚Äù his voice so tight it nearly snaps.

There‚Äôs a moment‚Äôs pause before she smiles at him, something vaguely sinister about it. Empty. ‚ÄúOh haven‚Äôt you heard? We are chosen,‚Äù she opens her arms wide. ‚ÄúOur blood is pure, our magic is ancient. We will rule the world and crush the rest of you into dust.‚Äù The sleeves of her robe slip down, revealing two pale, naked forearms. No Marks to be seen. Somehow that makes her speech seem a little less sincere.

‚ÄúLooking for something?‚Äù she snaps, bringing his eyes back to her‚Äôs. Her gaze a weird mix of anger and pain. Eventually‚Äîafter too long, really‚Äîshe drops her arms again. This time looking exhausted.

‚ÄúGo, Potter. Go home. Now.‚Äù

James blinks. ‚ÄúI‚Äîwhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúGet the fuck out of here,‚Äù she snaps.

James knows that he should take the out but he‚Äôs too bewildered by it to be relieved. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just going to let me go?‚Äù

She glares at him. ‚ÄúThis time. For Regulus. But if I see you sniffing around here again I promise I will lock you in the fucking basement, do you understand me?‚Äù

‚ÄúFor Regulus?‚Äù James says derisively. He knows he‚Äôs pushing his luck here but he can‚Äôt let it go. ‚ÄúAre you pretending you care about him suddenly?‚Äù

She gives him a cold look. ‚ÄúOne day,‚Äù she says slowly. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll understand that loving someone is a complicated thing,‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt appreciate the way her stare lingers on him. ‚ÄúOne day real bloody soon.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a crack, which has James stumbling back into the tree behind him. He hadn‚Äôt been expecting her to Apparate. It takes him a minute to catch his breath, to be sure that she‚Äôs really gone. His hands are shaking slightly when he grips his broom, throwing one leg over before casting a glance back at the row of houses across the street, like maybe suddenly he‚Äôll see it. He‚Äôs so hopped-up on adrenaline right now that he‚Äôs pretty sure if Grimmauld Place materialized in front of him he‚Äôd kick the door down. Consequences be damned.

Alas. There‚Äôs still no twelve. The houses jumping from eleven to thirteen, with no space between.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry Reg,‚Äù James sighs. ‚ÄúI hope you‚Äôre safe. I‚Äôll see you tomorrow, yeah?‚Äù And then he kicks off, flying back into the night.

¬†

James is asleep almost as soon as he sits down on the train, slumping into the corner with his head pressed against the glass.

‚ÄúJesus,‚Äù Sirius mutters. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôd think HE was the one who turned into a bloody werewolf last night.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt open his eyes, just gives Sirius the middle finger and burrows further into his corner, using his jacket as a pillow. If Remus had been there he probably would have hit Sirius but he‚Äôs already at the Prefect meeting. He‚Äôd looked surprisingly well for the morning after a full moon‚Äîit‚Äôs obvious that having Sirius with him had helped.

James drifts in and out of consciousness, the light casting shadows through his eyelids as the train pulls through Scottish countryside. Every once and a while Sirius and Peter‚Äôs mumbled conversations drift through the compartment but he‚Äôs never awake enough to really understand what they‚Äôre saying. He just wants to get back to school. He just wants to see Regulus. He isn‚Äôt sure if Narcissa will have told him that James showed up at Grimmauld Place‚Äîif she did he‚Äôll be in for a dressing down but he doesn‚Äôt care. Regulus can yell at him all he wants. Just as long as James can see him. Touch him.

The compartment door slams open, startling James upright and causing him to kick Peter in the process.

‚ÄúOw! What the hell Prongs,‚Äù he rubs testily at his side.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù James yawns, running a hand over his face before he looks up to find the cause of the disturbance. Remus is standing in the doorway, a grimace on his face.

‚ÄúFinally finished with your official duties?‚Äù Sirius asks, tugging lightly on Remus‚Äôs robes but Remus doesn‚Äôt look down.

‚ÄúJames can you c‚Äômere for a minute?‚Äù

‚ÄúEr‚Äî‚Äú James‚Äôs still half-asleep brain isn‚Äôt quite able to process that request.

‚ÄúYou want to talk with him‚Ä¶in the hallway?‚Äù Sirius asks, clearly as confused by this as James.

‚ÄúYeah, ah, Lily has something she wants me to tell him, so‚ÄîJames?‚Äù

Sirius lets out a low whistle. ‚ÄúShit, what‚Äôd you do Prongs?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú he‚Äôd almost forgotten about Lily. Well, no, okay, that isn‚Äôt quite right. He hadn‚Äôt forgotten as much as he‚Äôd just been completely unable to processes it. A lot had had happened all at once.

‚ÄúYou aren‚Äôt really gonna make him go in the hall are you?‚Äù Sirius goes on, seemingly not expecting an answer from James. ‚ÄúYou know he‚Äôs just going to tell me everything anyway.‚Äù

Remus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúI promised Lily I would deliver the message privately, what he does after that is his own bloody prerogative. James? Please?‚Äù

James finally manages to get to his feet, fighting with Sirius on his way out the door as the other boy tries to trip him, Sirius laughing as the compartment door slides shut behind them.

James huffs, straightening out his shirt and staring at Remus. ‚ÄúWell, what‚Äî‚Äú

But Remus shakes his head. ‚ÄúNot here,‚Äù he hisses, before he starts walking quickly along the train. James has no idea what to do other than follow him. They‚Äôre nearly at the end of the car before Remus turns into another compartment‚Äîan empty one, James realizes.

‚ÄúMoons?‚Äù he asks, stepping inside and watching Remus shut the door behind them before casting a Muffliato.

Remus sighs, bringing his hands to his face and then wincing when his fingers drag across the still fresh cuts. James waits for him to speak but he doesn‚Äôt, just stands there looking like he‚Äôd rather be anywhere else.

‚ÄúOkay, Remus? You‚Äôre starting to scare me now.‚Äù

He sighs again. ‚ÄúSorry, sorry I just don‚Äôt know how to‚Ä¶‚Äù he trails off. ‚ÄúMaybe you should sit down?‚Äù

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúIs this really about Lily?‚Äù

Remus shakes his head. ‚ÄúThough I do think you‚Äôre going to have to talk to her at some point because there was definitely something‚Ä¶off, today. You never said what happened on‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúMoons,‚Äù James interrupts. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre rambling, and as much as I would love to listen to you for hours I‚Äôm gonna need you to tell me what‚Äôs going on.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù Remus nods. ‚ÄúYeah, of course, sorry.‚Äù

They go back to standing in silence.

‚ÄúMoony?‚Äù

His eyes flutter closed for a minute, and James watches him take a deep breath before he opens them again, a new determination in his eyes. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Regulus, James.‚Äù

Which may be the most terrifying sentence James has ever heard, his stomach instantly dropping into the soles of his shoes.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Regulus? What do you mean?‚Äù fear is plain in his voice but James makes no attempt to hide it.

Remus looks at him sympathetically. ‚ÄúHe isn‚Äôt‚Äîhe didn‚Äôt come back.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

Something cold cascades down his spine, pools in his chest. He‚Äôs going to be sick. Going to pass out.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not‚Äîhow‚Äîare you sure?‚Äù

Remus nods slowly. ‚ÄúHe wasn‚Äôt at the Prefect meeting so I asked Cerci Greengrass. She said he never showed up. That she went looking for him but Barty and Rosier haven‚Äôt seen him either. Don‚Äôt seem to know where he is. Or if they do they wouldn‚Äôt tell her.‚Äù

James shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

No.

No.

No.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù

Black spots have started appearing in his vision. What if Narcissa went to Walburga? Went to Lucius? What if this is his fault?

‚ÄúJames? James breathe‚Äîfuck‚Äîbreathe.‚Äù

He feels Remus‚Äôs hands on him, feels himself being guided into one of the seats, his head pushed gently between his knees.

‚ÄúI‚Äîcan‚Äôt‚ÄîI have to go‚ÄîI have to go get him.‚Äù

He‚Äôd been right there. He‚Äôd been so close.

‚ÄúYou know you can‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo‚Äîplease, please Remus. You have to help me. I can‚Äôt‚ÄîI can‚Äôt leave him there. I can‚Äôt leave him with them. They‚Äôll hurt him. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck. This is my fault. This is my fault. I‚Äôm so sorry. I‚Äôm so sorry. I just wanted to keep him safe.‚Äù He really isn‚Äôt breathing anymore, words tripping out of his mouth tangled up in one another‚Äîall half sobs.

‚ÄúJames‚ÄîGod, James‚ÄîIt‚Äôll be okay. We‚Äôll figure something out, I promise. But right now I need you to breathe. Please, for me,‚Äù he feels Remus‚Äôs hand squeeze the back of his neck.

‚ÄúIn, out James. In, out.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt. It‚Äôs my fucking fault. He told me to stay away and I didn‚Äôt. He told me what would happen if they found out and I told him I didn‚Äôt care. I can‚Äôt. I can‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù Remus says calmly, hand still a steady weight at the back of James‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt go thinking up worse case scenarios okay? We don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs happened.‚Äù

James still feels like he‚Äôs choking on every inhale. ‚ÄúWhat if it was Sirius?‚Äù he whispers, feeling Remus stiffen next to him.

‚ÄúI promise I‚Äôll help you,‚Äù Remus says, barely louder than James. ‚ÄúI promise.‚Äù

James wants to tell him that he believes him but he can‚Äôt quite manage it. Eyes squeezing shut, head still between his knees.

I‚Äôm sorry, is all he can think. Over and over again.

I‚Äôm sorry.

I‚Äôm sorry.

I‚Äôm so sorry.

Chapter End Notes

** Mon chou = Sweetie / sweetheart

Mon cher = My dear

"Mon chou‚Äîregarde-moi s‚Äôil-te-pla√Æt" = Sweetheart - please look at me

‚ÄúJe t‚Äôaimes Regulus, toujours, toujours, toujours,‚Äù = I love you Regulus, always, always, always

‚ÄúOh mon cher, tu l‚Äôaime?‚Äù = Oh my dear, do you love him?

‚ÄúL'amour est la lame la plus tranchante, n'est-ce pas? Une douleur que nous m√©prisons et d√©sirons tout √† la fois.‚Äù = Love is the sharpest blade, isn't it? A pain that we both despise and desire. **

(Oh my god so much french I'm so sorry)

Hello beautiful people!

I really like this chapter, I don't know why, I just do. All three parts just got me feeling some type of way y'know?

Anyway, I hope you like it too!

Thank you always!!!!

Chapter 33

Chapter Summary

Extreme Where's Waldo

Chapter Notes

Listen, I think I probably mess around with HP magic lore in this chapter and also maybe how Quidditch works buuuut I like it sooooo I'm keeping it

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I: LILY

Lily isn‚Äôt sad. Really she isn‚Äôt. Not about James Potter announcing to half of London that he doesn‚Äôt want her anymore. Or about Mary going behind her back and talking to him in the first place. Those things are stupid and silly and they don‚Äôt matter. So she isn‚Äôt sad about them. Not even a little bit. Not even at all. In fact, she‚Äôs barely thought about either one of those people since New Years. So. There.

‚ÄúHave you seen my Charms textbook?‚Äù Marlene asks when Lily emerges from the bathroom after taking a shower that was both too long and too hot. But not because she‚Äôs sad.

‚ÄúUm‚Ä¶no?‚Äù she very pointedly does not make eye contact with Mary.

‚ÄúGoddamnit,‚Äù Marlene is currently on her stomach, half under her bed, throwing random items into the middle of the floor in her frantic search.

‚ÄúMar dear,‚Äù Mary says, sounding bored. She‚Äôs perched in the window, inspecting her nails. ‚ÄúYou do know you‚Äôre a witch right? Just Accio that sucker.‚Äù

The frantic searching stops as Marlene crawls back out from under her bed, sitting back on her heels, blond hair a mess. ‚ÄúOh,‚Äù she says a little breathlessly. ‚ÄúYeah, right. Good call.‚Äù

Lily finishes getting dressed as Marlene gropes around for her wand. ‚ÄúShouldn‚Äôt you two be at practice?‚Äù she asks, forcing her voice to sound casual. Because she isn‚Äôt sad. So how else would her voice sound?

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Mary says tightly.

‚ÄúJames cancelled it.‚Äù

Lily turns to face her roommates, directing her look of astonishment at Marlene specifically.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Marlene says, shoving her newly found Charms textbook into her bag.

‚ÄúIs he sick?‚Äù Lily asks, hating herself for caring.

‚ÄúMerlin I don‚Äôt know,‚Äù Marlene runs a hand through her hair. ‚ÄúRemus says he isn‚Äôt but‚Äîcancelling practice? After the break? With Mary only just able to play again?‚Äù she shakes her head. ‚ÄúSomething is definitely wrong. Has to be.‚Äù

Lily can feel Mary‚Äôs eyes on her but she refuses to meet them. She doesn't think that this has anything to do with New Years‚ÄîI mean, it can‚Äôt, right? Why would James be upset? Upset enough to cancel Quidditch? Even when he‚Äôd been fighting with Sirius he hadn‚Äôt missed Quidditch. She wonders if Mary knows but she doesn‚Äôt want to give her the satisfaction of asking. It isn‚Äôt that she hasn‚Äôt spoken to Mary at all since the break, she just hasn‚Äôt spoken to her much.

‚ÄúLily?‚Äù

She blinks, coming back to herself and finding both Marlene and Mary watching her. It‚Äôs clear that this is not the first time her name has been said.

‚ÄúAlright?‚Äù Marlene asks tentatively.

Lily instantly nods, perhaps a bit too enthusiastically. ‚ÄúYeah, yeah of course.‚Äù Neither of them look convinced but she doesn‚Äôt give them the chance to push the matter. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon, lets go before we‚Äôre late for breakfast,‚Äù she throws her bag over her shoulder, moving for the door before either of them can answer.

¬†

James isn‚Äôt at breakfast. Not that Lily is looking for him. Not that she cares where he is or what he‚Äôs doing or if he‚Äôs okay. He doesn‚Äôt want her. That‚Äôs fine. Really. She‚Äôll not want him back. Any minute now. She‚Äôll not want him back so hard.

‚ÄúWho are you looking for?‚Äù Marlene asks, causing Lily to start. She rips her eyes away from the end of the table where the other three marauders are sitting, excuse ready on the tip of her tongue. But when she looks at Marlene she realizes it‚Äôs Mary she‚Äôs talking to.

‚ÄúNo one,‚Äù Mary says casually, not looking nearly as guilty as Lily. Regardless both Lily and Marlene immediately try to follow her gaze.

‚ÄúSlytherin? Are you looking at someone in Slytherin?‚Äù Marlene sounds slightly horrified. ‚ÄúMerlin Mary, please tell me you‚Äôre not hooking up with one of them? Diggory was bad enough.‚Äù

Mary snorts, turning her attention back to her breakfast. ‚ÄúNo. I‚Äôm not hooking up with one of them.‚Äù

Lily waits for Mary to explain why then, she‚Äôs staring so intently at the Slytherin table, but she doesn‚Äôt. This is especially infuriating because Lily can‚Äôt just ask her herself because she‚Äôs not supposed to be talking to Mary right now, or at least not except when absolutely necessary. So she looks pointedly at Marlene, waiting for her to take on the burden of asking the obvious follow-up questions, but Marlene‚Äôs attention appears to have already wandered.

‚ÄúOh hey!‚Äù Marlene waves at Dorcas Meadowes, her voice about two octaves higher and more chipper than it had been only thirty seconds earlier. ‚ÄúHey, hi, good morning!‚Äù she keeps going, unnecessarily.

Mary snorts, rolling her eyes as Marlene nearly vibrates in the seat beside her.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôd you drink a whole vat of coffee this morning?‚Äù Mary asks. Marlene only elbows her as Dorcas reaches them.

‚ÄúHey guys,‚Äù Dorcas looks a bit uncertain.

‚ÄúHi!‚Äù

‚ÄúI think you‚Äôve covered the greetings Mar,‚Äù that comment earns Mary another elbow.

‚ÄúCan I er‚Äî‚Äú Dorcas blushes as she mumbles, ‚Äúis it alright if I sit here?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, of course!‚Äù Marlene is so eager Lily half expects her to pull out Dorcas‚Äôs chair for her.

‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù Dorcas smiles as she takes her seat. It‚Äôs not that Dorcas never sits with them, it‚Äôs just that she has her own group of friends. She‚Äôs more of what Lily thinks of as a walk-by-and-wave acquaintance.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs it going Dorcas?‚Äù she asks, trying to get herself together. This morning has already been a lot and it‚Äôs not even nine.

‚ÄúPretty good, you?‚Äù

Lily knows her smile is strained. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excellent.‚Äù

Mary does not bother to acknowledge that someone else has joined them. Well, at least not until Marlene kicks her under the table. Rolling her eyes at her best friend she offers Dorcas a sardonic look.

‚ÄúMeadowes.‚Äù

‚ÄúMacdonald,‚Äù Dorcas returns, looking like she‚Äôs trying not to smile. When silence falls after that Dorcas clears her throat. ‚ÄúYou guys have a good Christmas?‚Äù

‚ÄúBrilliant Christmas,‚Äù Marlene jumps in, clearly happy to have something to talk about. ‚ÄúThough to be fair I‚Äôve never not had a brilliant Christmas, it‚Äôs kinda my favourite time of year.‚Äù

Dorcas smiles fondly at her and Lily is surprised to see Marlene‚Äôs cheeks grow pink.

‚ÄúMine too,‚Äù Dorcas says.

Forgetting, momentarily, that she‚Äôs still angry at her, Lily makes eye contact with Mary across the table. It‚Äôs a sort of ‚Äúare you seeing what I‚Äôm seeing?‚Äù kind of look. Or, perhaps more accurately a ‚Äúis it just me, or does this feel like flirting?‚Äù kinda look.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your favourite part?‚Äù Marlene asks excitedly, eyes only for Dorcas. ‚ÄúMine‚Äôs the food, obviously. My mum makes the best mashed potatoes.‚Äù

‚ÄúNah-uh,‚Äù Dorcas argues playfully. ‚ÄúMy mum definitely makes the best mashed potatoes.‚Äù

Marlene grins, arching her brow. ‚ÄúIs that a challenge? You really think you could beat me in a potato off?‚Äù

Dorcas‚Äôs eyes sparkle. ‚ÄúBring it on McKinnon.‚Äù

Lily isn‚Äôt sure what‚Äôs going on between Dorcas and Marlene. On the surface there‚Äôs nothing overly intimate about their conversation, it‚Äôs just small talk. But something about their little smiles and flushed cheeks charges the air with more.With something that makes Lily feel ‚Ä¶lonely.

‚ÄúSorry, I just remembered I forgot something upstairs,‚Äù she says suddenly, pushing away from the table and causing Marlene to look up from Dorcas for the first time. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll just‚Ä¶.‚Äù she gestures towards the doors, grabbing her bag and awkwardly walking away, ‚Äúmeet you in class.‚Äù

Marlene looks confused. Mary does not.

‚ÄúOkay, see you?‚Äù she hears Marlene call after her as she speed walks towards the exit.

She still isn‚Äôt sad by the way.

That‚Äôs very important.

Or at least so she tells herself.

She isn‚Äôt sad about the way that Marlene and Dorcas were looking at one another, or the fast back and forth between them. Conversation coming so easily once it was started. She isn‚Äôt sad that the person she thought she had that same connection with doesn‚Äôt want her. And she certainly isn‚Äôt heartbroken.

Does it hurt that he doesn‚Äôt want you?

Asks the voice in her head.

Or that he used to, and you laughed in his face?

She grits her teeth.

Neither.

Neither hurts because she isn‚Äôt sad. She isn‚Äôt anything.

Lily forces herself to slow her pace, she‚Äôs walking far too fast for someone who is trying to waste time. Of course, there‚Äôs nothing she forgot upstairs and she‚Äôs too lazy to go all the way back up the tower for no reason, so she decides she‚Äôll just take the long way to class. The beauty of going to school in a massive medieval castle is that it makes dawdling exceptionally easy. Lily knows for a fact that Mary used the moving staircases as an excuse to be late to Charms for almost a year before Flitwick finally caught on.

Running a hand across her face she lets out a heavy sigh. This is okay. She‚Äôs okay. Everything is going to be fine.

‚ÄúBad morning?‚Äù

She swings around to find James bloody Potter hiding in the alcove of one of the windows. Because of course he is. Lily doesn‚Äôt know what she did to piss off the universe this much but she‚Äôs more than ready to sacrifice a goat or something and beg for forgiveness.

‚ÄúWhat the hell Potter, are you trying to give me a heart attack?‚Äù she stutters, cheeks flushing with embarrassment like she‚Äôd just been caught doing something embarrassing. Which is stupid, especially since he‚Äôs not even looking at her.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he says eventually, voice flat. It‚Äôs not a tone that suits him.

For half a heartbeat Lily pretends that she‚Äôs going to walk away. Whatever is going on with James Potter it‚Äôs none of her business. For her own health she needs to stay as far away from this boy as possible. Yet somehow she still finds herself stepping towards him. He doesn‚Äôt look up, but she can see the blank look in his eyes, hair more a mess then normal, mouth held tightly.

‚ÄúYou cancelled Quidditch?‚Äù she says nonsensically, because he isn‚Äôt speaking and she can‚Äôt stand the silence.

He nods, expression unchanged. ‚ÄúThat I did.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou never cancel practice.‚Äù

At first she thinks he isn‚Äôt going to answer her, she supposes it isn‚Äôt a statement that necessarily requires an answer. But after a few moments he speaks again.

‚ÄúTo be fair, I‚Äôve only been Captain for one term.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah but‚Ä¶‚Äù she doesn‚Äôt know why she feels the need to push this, except that it feels important somehow. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre you.‚Äù

He laughs dryly. ‚ÄúI am me.‚Äù

‚ÄúQuidditch is like‚Äîlike half your personality. The first time I met you it was all ‚ÄúGryffindor this‚Äù and ‚ÄúMy dad that‚Äù and ‚ÄúQuidditch, Quidditch, Quidditch.‚Äù That was it. The whole train ride here, all you could talk about were those three things.‚Äù

‚ÄúI sound insufferable.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell obviously.‚Äù

That manages to get a genuine laugh out of him, even if it‚Äôs only half-hearted.

‚ÄúObviously,‚Äù he repeats.

More silence. Lily should go. She knows she should. This is just‚Ä¶awkward‚Ä¶and weird. But something in her stomach, in her chest, keeps her still. Unwilling to give the moment up. The chance to talk to him. To have his attention. God, when did she become so pathetic?

‚ÄúI guess the other half of me is stronger,‚Äù James says after too long. Lily tries to catch up.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

Finally, he looks at her. ‚ÄúYou said Quidditch is half of who I am,‚Äù he shrugs. ‚ÄúI guess the other half is stronger.‚Äù

She struggles to hold his stare. It isn‚Äôt‚Ä¶right, somehow. Too‚Ä¶sad. She‚Äôs not sure she‚Äôs ever seen that before. Sure, James has been angry and confused and hurt, but this is something else.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the other half?‚Äù she finds herself asking, desperate to know.

He holds her stare for another few seconds before looking away. ‚ÄúListen,‚Äù the tone of his voice has changed, ‚Äúabout New Years Eve‚Äî‚Äú

Lily raises her hand to stop him. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs whatever James. Stupid drama. It doesn‚Äôt matter.‚Äù Lies, all of it.

‚ÄúHave you talked to Mary about it?‚Äù he asks eventually. That actually startles a laugh out of her.

‚ÄúNo. No I‚Äôm not really‚Ä¶anyway, like I said, it doesn‚Äôt matter. It‚Äôs not like I want you to‚Ä¶you know‚Ä¶anyway.‚Äù God, she can‚Äôt even finish a sentence.

He‚Äôs staring at his hands again. ‚ÄúI do know,‚Äù he says eventually, and Lily‚Äôs not sure why instead of relief she feels disappointed. Like she wanted him to see through her. To know that she is completely gone on him. All butterflies and weak knees and every other ridiculous clich√©.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still sorry though,‚Äù he goes on, ‚Äúit felt a little‚Ä¶harsh. Even if you don‚Äôt want me to‚Ä¶want you,‚Äù they both cringe, though Lily suspects for different reasons.

‚ÄúAlright, well, apology accepted then,‚Äù she says, eager to move past this. Except that it becomes immediately apparent that James has nothing else to say to her.

Go.

She shouts at herself.

You‚Äôre being weird. He clearly wants to be alone, just go!

‚ÄúAre you alright James?‚Äù she finally asks, voice soft, feet very much not moving.

He laughs without humour, picking at his fingers. ‚ÄúNah, I don‚Äôt think so,‚Äù he says it so casually that for a moment Lily is almost certain she‚Äôs misheard.

‚ÄúDo‚Äîcan I help?‚Äù she asks pathetically. ‚ÄúIs it‚Ä¶did something happen over the break? Your parents‚Äî‚Äú

James shakes his head. It takes a long time for him to speak. Too long really. Despite her best efforts Lily starts to fidget. She‚Äôs never been very patient.

‚ÄúSometimes I feel like we‚Äôre being hung out to dry here,‚Äù he says quietly, barely audible even in the empty hallway. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs this war coming‚Äîor starting‚Äîor happening‚Äîbut no one really wants to‚Ä¶to talk to us about it. Like they‚Äôre afraid we can‚Äôt handle it or that it‚Äôll scare us or some other bullshit excuse. But like‚Ä¶we‚Äôre in it too, we‚Äôre already involved. There are kids in this school choosing sides. Being forced to choose. And everyone is just‚Ä¶acting like they can‚Äôt see it. Or like it isn‚Äôt as real for us.‚Äù

Lily is frankly a little blown away to hear any of this coming out of James Potter‚Äôs mouth. Besides the fact that it is not at all the direction she saw this conversation going in, she has always felt that the Purebloods were kind of oblivious to the reality of the situation. That they didn‚Äôt see what was going on or, if they did, they couldn‚Äôt quite grasp how dangerous it was. Yet here is James Potter, king of the Purebloods, reflecting all her own outrage back at her.

‚ÄúBad things are happening,‚Äù James goes on, voice rough. ‚ÄúI can see it and I want to help‚ÄîI‚Äôm trying to help‚Äîbut this is so much bigger than anything I‚Äôve ever had to deal with and I feel like I keep failing. Keep letting everyone down. I just need someone to tell me what to do, you know? To stop hiding things from me in some pointless attempt to protect me and just explain the rules, show me how to fight. Because I will. I fucking will I just‚Äîright now it‚Äôs like all I‚Äôm doing is punching walls. All I have are bloody hands.‚Äù

She isn‚Äôt sure if it‚Äôs his words or his fidgeting or the way he keeps looking at them‚Äîhis hands‚Äîbut before she can think better of it she reaches out, wrapping her own hands gently around his, stilling his frantic fingers. She expects him to pull away but he doesn‚Äôt, just keeps staring down at the place where they‚Äôre touching, a faint expression of surprise on his face.

‚ÄúAll any of us can do is try. Honestly I‚Äôm not sure even Dumbledore is managing more than that these days.‚Äù

James shakes his head, eyes glassy even though he isn‚Äôt crying. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not enough.‚Äù

She squeezes his hands. ‚ÄúAre you kidding me? It‚Äôs everything,‚Äù she wishes that her voice didn‚Äôt sound quite so besotted but she presses on quickly before either of them can think about it. ‚ÄúYou know how many people brush me off when I talk about how bad things have gotten in this school? How many teachers?‚Äù

James looks up at her affronted. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

She nods. ‚ÄúAnd sometimes I don‚Äôt wanna push it, you know? I‚Äôm not as brave as Mary,‚Äù she gives him a self deprecating smile. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm worried that if we become too much of a nuisance we‚Äôll lose the allies we have.‚Äù

James‚Äôs eyes widen. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fucked, that so fucked Lily,‚Äù he squeezes her hands back.

She only shrugs. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs life. There are a lot of Wizards who have more to gain by keeping quiet than speaking out,‚Äù she looks at him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one of them, so is Sirius‚Äîwe all got to watch how much it cost him, standing up.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôd do it again,‚Äù James says, fiercely. ‚ÄúIn a heartbeat.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Lily smirks a little. ‚ÄúYeah I know. It‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know how to explain what it meant to me. To Mary too. Watching him walk away. Watching you help him, support him. With the exception of a few, most people aren‚Äôt awful to your face, but when push comes to shove they don‚Äôt have your back. Aren‚Äôt gonna risk anything,‚Äù she swallows, throat dry, trying to get her thoughts in order so she can stop giving him a bloody sermon.

‚ÄúWhat I‚Äôm trying to say,‚Äù she goes on eventually. ‚ÄúIs you seeing what‚Äôs going on, you caring, it‚Äôs important. It‚Äôs enough.‚Äù

He holds her eyes, searching her face. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here for you, you know that right? If something happens‚Ä¶‚Äù his voice is warm, if he‚Äôs ever spoken to her like this before she can‚Äôt remember it. All artifice and performance stripped away, he speaks with heat and care and something that makes her chest ache. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll always believe you. Always.‚Äù

Oh.

Oh fuck him.

Fuck him all the way into the centre of the sun.

What gives him the right to look at her like that?

To say that to her?

And not want her.

Because he doesn‚Äôt. And she has to remind herself of that, especially right now, in this moment, when he‚Äôs talking like she‚Äôs someone who matters to him, both of his hands curled around her‚Äôs.

If James notices the effect his words are having on Lily he doesn‚Äôt show it, instead he lets out a sigh, head falling back against the wall behind him as he closes his eyes. It takes Lily an embarrassingly long time to get herself together.

‚ÄúDid something happen James?‚Äù she asks again, because she can‚Äôt quite imagine that this has all come out of nowhere.

She sees him swallow, sees his eyes squeeze more tightly shut. ‚ÄúI need to find someone. I think they‚Äôre in trouble. It might be my fault. So I have to find them but I don‚Äôt know how.‚Äù

Lily nods, taking that in. She has no idea who it could be, since all the other marauders are accounted for, but she decides not to push. If James doesn‚Äôt want to tell her he doesn‚Äôt have to.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm assuming there‚Äôs no one who can‚Ä¶help?‚Äù

James shakes his head.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù Lily‚Äôs mind is already humming with possibilities. Looking for something, anything that she can do. Any way she can help. ‚ÄúMaybe‚Ä¶maybe there‚Äôs a spell‚Äî‚Äù

He shakes his head again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been looking. So has Remus. We asked Flitwick and McGonagall. The closest would be the tracking spell‚ÄîAppare Vestigium‚Äîbut it only shows recent magical footprints. It doesn‚Äôt reveal someone‚Äôs location.‚Äù

Lily blinks, something clinking into place. ‚ÄúOkay, okay but wait‚Äîthat‚Äôs not a bad start.‚Äù

James opens his eyes, turning to her quizzically, eyebrow raised. ‚ÄúNot a bad start?‚Äù

She nods, a dozen different possibilities whipping through her head. ‚ÄúWhat if we altered the spell‚Äîfound a way to locate a specific magical footprint or signature,‚Äù she focuses on him again. ‚ÄúDo you have something that would have their magical footprint on it? Something they cast a spell on? The more involved the magic was the better.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äîer‚Äîyeah. Yeah, actually, I do.‚Äù

Lily nods. ‚ÄúOkay, good. That‚Äôs good. If we have that than maybe‚Ä¶‚Äù she trails off. ‚ÄúI have to go to the library, there are about a dozen books I need to take out.‚Äù Without even thinking she starts walking in that direction.

‚ÄúWait,‚Äù James sits up properly, hand reaching out to her even though she‚Äôs too far to touch. ‚ÄúDo you really think, I mean, you really think we can do this? Alter the spell?‚Äù

She meets his hopeful eyes, holding them for long enough that nothing she says can be misinterpreted as flippant, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like I said before,‚Äù she shrugs, aiming for a casual confidence she doesn‚Äôt feel, ‚Äúwe can try.‚Äù

¬†

PART II JAMES

¬†

His feet have barely hit the ground before he‚Äôs walking.

‚ÄúPotter? Oi, Potter!?‚Äù

The sky above them is only just turning blue, the sunrise always weaker in the winter months. He doesn‚Äôt slow down, doesn't turn as he hears the noise of another dozen brooms landing on the field behind him.

‚ÄúJames!‚Äù

‚ÄúPractice is over!‚Äù he shouts over his shoulder. ‚ÄúBack here tomorrow, same time.‚Äù

‚ÄúOver?‚Äù Mary demands, other people are talking too but they have the curtesy to do it at a level that James can‚Äôt hear. ‚ÄúHow can it be over, it just bloody started!‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm cutting it short. You wanna keep going, by all means, we have the pitch until eight-thirty.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf I wanna keep going? You‚Äôre the bloody captain!‚Äù she yells angrily. If he thought she was going to be nicer to him after their fight on New Years Eve he was mistaken. Not that she‚Äôs wrong, mind you. A few weeks ago the idea of ending practice early would have made him choke. But things change. Priorities change. For the first time he thinks he understands Frank‚Äôs choice to give up the pros for the Aurors.

‚ÄúYeah I am,‚Äù he shouts back, nearly at the locker room now. ‚ÄúAnd I say practice is over!‚Äù

He ducks inside. No one else tries to stop him.

¬†

No more than fifteen minutes later he‚Äôs showered and dressed and practically jogging through the school towards the library. It‚Äôs early enough that the corridors are still pretty deserted‚Äîat least the ones that don‚Äôt lead to the Great Hall where the smell of bacon and syrup call out to his already grumbling stomach. But food will have to wait.

There are one or two other students in the library but few enough that he spots Lily and Remus instantly, heads bowed together, books spread out in front of them.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù he says, dropping down into the free seat next to Lily.

Both Remus and Lily jump, nearly colliding heads.

‚ÄúJesus James,‚Äù Remus says, clutching his heart, ‚Äúa little warning next time.‚Äù

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúMore warning than ‚Äòhey‚Äô ?‚Äù

‚ÄúI thought you had Quidditch?‚Äù Lily asks.

He nods. ‚ÄúI did. Ended it early. So,‚Äù he nods at the book currently open between them, ‚Äúfind anything?‚Äù

When his gaze meets Lily‚Äôs he realizes how close he‚Äôs sitting to her. He‚Äôs never noticed before‚Äîthe flecks of gold in her eyes.

‚ÄúEr‚Äî‚Äú Lily shakes herself, similarly distracted it would seem, though James doesn‚Äôt know by what.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve found the right conjugation we‚Äôre pretty sure, but something is missing from the end of the spell, something to give it strength, a far reach‚Äîgeographically speaking,‚Äù Remus gestures to the open book and James can see lists of different letter combinations and their magical properties, along with a small descriptions on the power of certain syllables.

‚ÄúCouldn‚Äôt it be a wand movement?‚Äù he asks after a minute.

Lily nods, reaching over him to tap on the large stack of books in the centre of the table. ‚ÄúThose are next,‚Äù she says with a small smile. James stares at all the work they still have to do, his foot starting to bounce anxiously under the table. He keeps waiting for Regulus to just show up at breakfast one day‚Äîhealthy and safe. It‚Äôs an unlikely scenario but it‚Äôs the only thing keeping him from losing his mind. The spell is taking too long, the three of them are doing everything they can but it‚Äôs still not enough.

Lily places a warm hand on his forearm, stilling him. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be okay. We‚Äôll find them. I promise.‚Äù

He gives her a tight smile. He knows she has no real choice but to say that. He also knows it‚Äôs not something she can actually promise.

‚ÄúLets show him the map,‚Äù Lily says finally, tearing her eyes away from James to look at Remus who is giving them a questioning stare that James can‚Äôt understand.

‚ÄúYeah, okay,‚Äù he nods after a second, pulling out his wand and spelling the books off the table and into neat little stacks on the floor. Both Remus and Lily stand so James follows suit, watching as Lily pulls out a large rolled map and begins unfurling it on the tabletop with Remus‚Äôs help. Black ink and beige canvas stares up at James, and it only takes him a minute to realize what he‚Äôs looking at.

‚ÄúBritain?‚Äù he asks, looking at his two friends for confirmation.

‚ÄúWe should be able to get the spell to stretch far enough to cover approximately this much land.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut no more?‚Äù James asks.

Remus‚Äôs grimaces. ‚ÄúMagic across borders gets tricky for a lot of reasons, not just distance. Trying to stretch the spell further would weaken it and potentially‚Äîer‚Äîalert the authorities to what we‚Äôre doing.‚Äù

James nods, feeling something like fear gnaw at his stomach. ‚ÄúMakes sense,‚Äù he says, staring back down at the map.

‚ÄúYou think they might be on the continent?‚Äù Lily asks curiously.

James just shrugs. ‚ÄúNo idea,‚Äù though he hasn‚Äôt been able to shake the feeling that Regulus might be in France. He‚Äôs never mentioned it before but Sirius has, and James knows the Black‚Äôs have connections there.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù James says finally, trying to stay calm. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the plan? How will it work?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Lily goes on. ‚ÄúI mean, it‚Äôs fairly simple really. We‚Äôll cast the spell on the object with their magical footprint and then as soon as they use magic it‚Äôll be able to show us where they are on the map.‚Äù

James‚Äôs eyes trace the lines in front of him‚Äîroads and rivers and town borders. It‚Äôs possible, of course, that the spell will tell him that Regulus is at Grimmauld Place. But if James is going to storm the place he wants to make sure.

And,

says the voice at the back of his mind.

If he‚Äôs casting spells that means he isn‚Äôt dead.

James shakes his head, instantly trying to get that thought out. Regulus isn‚Äôt dead. There‚Äôs no way, Walburga would never let anything happen to her only remaining heir.

Unless she found out that he‚Äôs queer,

the voice goes on.
