The boy‚Äôs whole body relaxes and he all but collapses into the bars. ‚ÄúOh thank Merlin. You don‚Äôt understand how scared I‚Äôve been. I told the Aurors, I told them I would never‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù Lucius cuts off the man‚Äôs ramblings and Regulus instantly goes stiff at being addressed. ‚ÄúKill him.‚Äù

Regulus turns to Lucius, his mouth open, while the boy in the cell stumbles back, away from the bars. ‚ÄúWhat? NO! Who are you? I thought‚Ä¶you said you believed me! Who are you?‚Äù

But Lucius isn‚Äôt paying him any mind. He has eyes only for Regulus who is still staring at him in horror.

‚ÄúGo on,‚Äù he says, like he‚Äôs asking him to set the dining room table.

‚ÄúW-why?‚Äù Regulus finally manages to ask, the man in question is still babbling pleas for mercy in the background.

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt matter,‚Äù Lucius sounds about as serious as Regulus has ever heard him. ‚ÄúThe Dark Lord has requested that you do it so you will do it.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut why?‚Äù Regulus repeats desperately. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs he done? What‚Äôs the purpose?‚Äù

‚ÄúI told you, it doesn‚Äôt matter.‚Äù

The screaming from early starts up again, the familiar cold that accompanies the presence of the Demnetors drifting over Regulus.

‚ÄúLucius‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúKill him,‚Äù Lucius steps forward. ‚ÄúOr I will kill him and then I will stuff you in there and leave you at the mercy of the guards.‚Äù

There is no trace of mockery, Lucius means every word, and Regulus doesn‚Äôt doubt that he has the blessing of Walburga to carry it out. She‚Äôll not want Regulus back if he fails the Dark Lord‚Äôs test.

He closes his eyes briefly, feeling the cold inching closer. He should have known this had been too easy.

Swallowing, he turns towards the cell, wand raised. The man inside, who‚Äôs already backed himself against the wall, slides to the ground.

‚ÄúNo, please, please, please,‚Äù his voice is soft, desperate. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a good man. I swear. I‚Äôm going to get married, please.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs hand is shaking and he‚Äôs almost positive he can‚Äôt do this. That he‚Äôs just going to come apart right here on the spot.

‚ÄúNow Regulus,‚Äù Lucius commands.

Regulus tries to breathe.

‚ÄúPlease, please, please.‚Äù

‚ÄúRegulus.‚Äù

You can‚Äôt save him.

‚ÄúPlease, please, please.‚Äù

You know you can‚Äôt save him.

‚ÄúIf I have to do this Regulus,‚Äù Lucius says dangerously. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll never leave this place, do you understand?‚Äù

His arm is still raised, wand still aimed.

‚ÄúI love her. I promised I‚Äôd come back. We‚Äôre going to start a family. Have mercy.‚Äù

‚ÄúRegulus‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúAvada Kedavra.‚Äù

Everything seems to go quiet after that.

Like the whole world has stopped. Regulus doesn‚Äôt drop his arm even when the man across from him slumps over. Regulus is shaking so badly he‚Äôs surprised the wand doesn‚Äôt fall from his hands. He can‚Äôt move. Can‚Äôt breathe. Can‚Äôt think

Everything is so quiet.

So still.

‚ÄúEasy now,‚Äù Regulus flinches when Lucius touches him but doesn‚Äôt pull away, doesn‚Äôt quite have that level of control over his body at the moment. Lucius‚Äôs touch is surprisingly gentle as he lowers Regulus‚Äôs arm for him, keeping one hand on his back, stabling him.

‚ÄúThat was good Reg,‚Äù he says softly. ‚ÄúYou did good.‚Äù

Regulus gives him one look before turning away and falling to his hands and knees, regurgitating what little is left in stomach.

He hears one of the bulldogs mutter something and the other laughs. He can‚Äôt make out the words but he can imagine what they are.

‚ÄúOh shut-up Crabbe,‚Äù Lucius snaps. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt act like you didn‚Äôt piss your pants the first time you killed someone.‚Äù

Killed someone.

Killed someone.

I killed someone.

Regulus quickly grabs hold of that thought and shoves it somewhere way down deep. He‚Äôll deal with it later, when he‚Äôs not on his hands and knees on the floor of Azkaban Prison.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon Reg,‚Äù Lucius slides a hand under his arm and hauls him up. ‚ÄúWe gotta go.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat did he do?‚Äù Regulus mumbles, as Lucius starts guiding him back towards the front doors.

Lucius gives him a sidelong look. ‚ÄúJust like he said. Mistaken identity.‚Äù

‚ÄúMistaken identity,‚Äù Regulus repeats.

‚ÄúThey thought he was one of ours, been questioning him for weeks, following a false lead. Think we‚Äôve been tampering with potions ingredients or something equally ridiculous. They can‚Äôt figure out what the Dark Lord‚Äôs next move will be and it‚Äôs making them reckless.‚Äù

Regulus tries to focus. It‚Äôs difficult because his brain feels foggy. Shock, he thinks dimly.

‚ÄúBut why kill him then?‚Äù he asks, desperate.

‚ÄúThey were going to use Veritaserum on him in the morning. Find out the truth.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut if he‚Äôs not one of us then he can‚Äôt have any secrets to spill,‚Äù Regulus winces at the sound of another distant scream. He really needs to get out of here.

‚ÄúNo, but then the Aurors would realize they‚Äôd been chasing a dead end, and that would be inconvenient for us. This way there will always be that little bit of doubt, they‚Äôll always wonder ‚Äòwas he a Death Eater or wasn‚Äôt he.‚Äô‚Äù

Regulus feels another wave of nausea crash over him. ‚ÄúA little bit of doubt,‚Äù he repeats. ‚ÄúThat man‚Äôs life for a little bit of doubt?‚Äù

They stop at the doors, Lucius finally releasing Regulus‚Äôs arm as he turns to him fully, a wry expression on his face. ‚ÄúOh come now Regulus, don‚Äôt look at me like that,‚Äù he reaches out and tucks a lock of hair behind Regulus‚Äôs ear.

‚ÄúAfter all, you‚Äôre the one who killed him.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

AHHH

Sirius knows! HE KNOWS. I'm dying. I've been dying since I wrote that. Like, I gotta be real with you guys, originally Sirius was never going to find out because I just felt like there was no way him and James would ever get past it. But here we are. Now he knows. So I guess we'll see.

ANYWAY I hope the timeline stuff wasn't too confusing and that you liked it etc. etc. !

Thank you always for the nice comments and also all your theories and thoughts, I love all of it!

Chapter 35

Chapter Summary

Warning: this chapter is very soft. Please handle with care.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

PART I: SIRIUS

He blinks awake, jaw cracking as he yawns. He cast a warming charm last night but it must have warn off because he can feel the chilly bite of the wind through the cracked, lifeless house. It‚Äôs fine though, his fur keeps him warm enough.

He doesn‚Äôt have proper thoughts as a dog.

Or proper feelings.

He‚Äôs still him, still in control. But he‚Äôs also‚Ä¶animal. Everything is filtered through this new body, these new senses, this new brain. He‚Äôs still Sirius. He‚Äôs just Sirius the dog not the boy. When things become too much, too hard to handle, it‚Äôs easier being like this. Things hurt‚Äîif not less‚Äîthan different.

His first real thought, as he comes awake, is Moony.

Moony, Moony, Moony.

This place smells so strongly of him, he‚Äôs in the floorboards, the mattress, filling Sirius‚Äôs nose and wrapping around his chest. He whines, burying his head more fully in the blankets piled around him.

Moony, Moony, Moony.

Even as a dog Sirius misses him. But he can‚Äôt go to him. Can‚Äôt talk to him. Can‚Äôt talk to anyone. Sirius huffs, scratching at the mattress. He just wants to be a dog. To hunt and sleep and not have to feel that ache in his chest every time he remembers that the most important people in his life have been lying to him.

It‚Äôs funny really, that it‚Äôs Regulus who has once again proven to Sirius that he can‚Äôt place his trust in other people. Maybe he planned it this way. It would be so like their mother, to try and teach him a lesson by seducing his best friends away from him.

When will you learn brother? he can hear Regulus‚Äôs snide voice so clearly that his lips actually curl back, teeth baring themselves at the very thought of him.

Everyone lets you down, the voice goes on. Everyone is out for themselves. I mean, how could you be so stupid? After everything? This is why the Dark Lord will win. Dumbledore‚Äôs supporters are nothing but a bunch of disappointments and morons.

Another whine escapes Sirius without his permission.

No.

He can‚Äôt go back.

Can‚Äôt face any of them.

So he‚Äôll stay here. For now.

Hunt and sleep and wander around the forest. Then come back and lie in blankets that smell like Remus and pretend it doesn‚Äôt feel like breaking apart.

¬†

PART II JAMES

James is a wreck.

Has been since Christmas. Maybe even before then.

He feels himself being torn in a million directions. Or maybe more accurately, in two directions, but with the force of a million hands. Sirius or Regulus. Who does he go after? Who does he fight for? Both, his thoughts insist vehemently. I love them both. I need them both. But he isn‚Äôt sure life works like that.

Last night is a blur:

‚ÄúMaybe we should go to Dumbledore?‚Äù Lily had suggested while she watched James pace the Prefect office once he could no longer bring himself to stare at the map. At the spot the Quaffle was hovering over.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù James had said. Because he really hadn‚Äôt. He knew Regulus wouldn‚Äôt want that, that he didn‚Äôt trust Dumbledore, and James wasn‚Äôt sure he was wrong not to.

‚ÄúHe might help‚Äîit can‚Äôt be‚Äî-they can‚Äôt keep kids in Azkaban can they? There‚Äôs no way that‚Äôs legal.‚Äù

James had made a noncommittal noise. As far as he knew there were no hard and fast rules about who could and couldn‚Äôt be put in Azkaban, as long as their crime was bad enough. But what could Regulus have done? Alice said the Pureblood families were almost untouchable, so why had they allowed this to happen? All he could picture was Regulus alone in a cell. Was a Dementor hovering above him sucking the life out of him.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he‚Äôd heard the door open almost at the same moment that he‚Äôd heard his name‚Äîcracked and desperate. One look at Remus was all he‚Äôd needed to know something was very very wrong.

Without thinking James had immediately stepped towards him. ‚ÄúWhat is it? What‚Äôs happened?‚Äù His voice had come out soft, Remus pale, eyes red-rimmed. Remus did not cry easily.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs‚Äîhe‚Äî‚Äú but he‚Äôd cut himself off, looking frantically at Lily.

‚ÄúEvans can you give us a minute?‚Äù James had asked, not taking his eyes off of Remus.

‚ÄúOh‚Äîyeah, of course. Just‚Äîer‚Äîlet me know if there‚Äôs anything I can do okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúI will, and thank you, again,‚Äù he‚Äôd met her eyes briefly as she passed him on her way to the door.

‚ÄúFuck James, fuck,‚Äù Remus said the minute she was gone. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt mean to. I messed it all up. I don‚Äôt know what to do.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, whatever it is it‚Äôs okay, just sit down alright?‚Äù James guided him to the couch while words continued to spill out of his mouth.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know where he is. I checked the map but I can‚Äôt find him. I should have followed him but he was so angry with me‚Äî‚Äú his voice shook and cracked and fell apart, his words unravelling.

‚ÄúRemus, breathe,‚Äù James said calmly, placing a steadying hand on his friend‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúWhat is it? What‚Äôs happened?‚Äù

Remus shook his head, tears in his eyes again, breaking James‚Äôs heart. ‚ÄúHe knows,‚Äù he‚Äôd whispered, sending something cold down James‚Äôs spine. ‚ÄúSirius knows.‚Äù

¬†

Now. Sitting in the Great Hall at Breakfast, Remus silent beside him, Peter glancing nervously between them, Sirius still missing, James has the overwhelming desire to hear his mother‚Äôs voice. To be held by her. Told what to do. He tried to handle this himself, tried to fix things, and all he‚Äôs done is make everything worse. He‚Äôd done a half-hearted search for Sirius last night but Remus was right, he wasn‚Äôt on the map, James wasn‚Äôt sure if he‚Äôd gone into town or what. He also wasn‚Äôt sure what he would do if he found him.

Apologize?

Beg for forgiveness?

Ask for his help?

Look, I know you‚Äôre angry at me, but your brother is currently in Azkaban and I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm supposed to do about it.

In the end it didn‚Äôt matter. He couldn‚Äôt find him.

Remus drops his fork onto the eggs he‚Äôd been pushing around his plate for the last fifteen minutes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna go look for him.‚Äù

‚ÄúDid you guys have a fight or something?‚Äù Peter asks from across the table.

Remus sighs. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he runs a hand over his face, voice cracking. ‚ÄúYeah, we had a fight and I need to just‚Äî‚Äú James knocks his foot against Remus‚Äôs under the table, letting him know that he‚Äôs there.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll come with you.‚Äù

Remus gives him a watery smile. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôll make it better or worse.‚Äù

‚ÄúMe either,‚Äù James says honestly. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm not sure I want you dealing with this alone.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll help too!‚Äù Peter pipes up. ‚ÄúObviously.‚Äù

James watches Remus send him a wary look. ‚ÄúListen, Pete‚Äî‚Äú But James puts a hand on his shoulder, stopping him.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, I‚Äôm done lying,‚Äù he tells him, as causally as he can manage while his heart hammers in his chest. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the point anymore?‚Äù though he still does a quick check with his eyes to make sure no one is sitting near enough to listen in.

‚ÄúLying about what?‚Äù Peter demands, starting to sound slightly exasperated.

‚ÄúAre you sure?‚Äù Remus asks.

James just nods, letting out a deep breath. ‚ÄúListen, Pete, I don‚Äôt know how to really‚Ä¶.break this news gently but‚Äîer‚ÄîI‚Äôm seeing Regulus.‚Äù

Peter looks back at him, expression blank, causing something heavy to form in the pit of James‚Äôs stomach. He opens his mouth to try and explain when Peter suddenly smiles, shutting James up immediately.

‚ÄúUm, yeah,‚Äù he says, the ‚Äúduh‚Äù clearly implied by his tone. ‚ÄúI know?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know?‚Äù James and Remus say at almost the exact same time.

Peter looks between them like he can‚Äôt figure out why they‚Äôre so confused. ‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù

James struggles to get his thoughts in order, a laugh that borders on hysterical falling from his mouth. ‚ÄúHow do you know?‚Äù

Peter shrugs, biting into his buttered toast and chewing thoughtfully. ‚ÄúWell,‚Äù he says, before swallowing, ‚Äúfor starters, you look at him like you want to eat him every time Slytherin plays Quidditch.‚Äù

If James had been drinking he would have done a spit take. As it is, he makes several spluttery-choking noises, while Remus actually has the audacity to laugh.

‚ÄúPlus there‚Äôs been a lot of references to a mysterious ‚Äúhe‚Äù who‚Äôs apparently in Slytherin since you went and broke into their bloody dorm after the party that one time,‚Äù he shrugs. ‚ÄúJust put two and two together I guess.‚Äù

James is still struggling to come up with something to say, scrubbing his face with his hands. ‚ÄúAnd you‚Äôre‚Ä¶okay with it?‚Äù he finally manages, because he can‚Äôt quite believe that Peter is willing to just shrug this off.

The other Marauder wrinkles his nose. ‚ÄúWell, I mean, I‚Äôd rather not watch you snog him. But as long as that‚Äôs off the table‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt see how it matters to me who you get with. I mean, it‚Äôs weird as all hell, but‚Ä¶‚Äù he shrugs.

James shakes his head, turning to find Remus in a similar state of shock. ‚ÄúJesus Peter,‚Äù he finally manages, smiling for the first time in what feels like days. ‚ÄúYou really are full of surprises, huh?‚Äù

‚ÄúI guess,‚Äù Peter says, sounding unconvinced as he continues to chew on his breakfast.

‚ÄúOkay, well, as wild as this revelation has been,‚Äù Remus sounds tired if not slightly amused. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna go back to the room, check the map again, see if anything‚Äôs changed.‚Äù

James nods, pushing back from the table as both him and Remus get to their feet. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm done, I‚Äôll come with you.‚Äù

‚ÄúGuys, give me like five seconds!‚Äù Peter says urgently.

‚ÄúYou know we‚Äôre just going upstairs right? You can meet us there.‚Äù

‚ÄúOr you could just wait!‚Äù Peter says indignantly, through a mouth full of beans.

James rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúOkay, but just so you know, if you choke you‚Äôre gonna have to find someone else to give you the Heimlich, because there is no way‚Äî

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù the tone of Remus‚Äôs voice grabs James‚Äôs attention immediately and when he looks over he finds him wide eyed and tense.

‚ÄúRemus? What is it?‚Äù but Remus just shakes his head, swearing softly under his breath.

‚ÄúIs he having a stroke?‚Äù Peter demands, somehow still with his mouth full.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú James starts when a noise across the room catches his attention and he looks over without thinking. Just instinct. Looks over and feels his whole body jolt like he‚Äôs just been thrown head first into a wall.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù James says weakly, his legs actually giving out under him as he promptly sits back down at the table, watching Regulus across the room, walking towards his friends. James has had this fantasy so many times over the last two weeks. Imagined this exact scenario. He‚Äôs not so sure he isn‚Äôt imagining it now.

Regulus looks thin and pale, but he‚Äôs there. He‚Äôs walking. He isn‚Äôt in Azkaban, isn‚Äôt having the soul ripped out of him. It takes everything in James not to call out his name.

‚ÄúWhat is it? What‚Äôs going on?‚Äù Peter asks looking around, but James can‚Äôt speak, can‚Äôt take his eyes off of Regulus, afraid that if he does he‚Äôll disappear again. If it weren‚Äôt for the fact that Remus could clearly see him too James would have thought he was hallucinating.

Come on, James thinks as he watches Evan Rosier get up and give Regulus a hug. Come on. Look over here. Find me. Please.

Like he‚Äôd heard him, Regulus turns his head, eyes searching the Gryffindor table for only a second before they lock with James‚Äôs. God that hurts. Makes something with claws start to scratch the inside of James‚Äôs chest.

And then it‚Äôs gone. Regulus turning away, sitting down with his friends. James feels like he‚Äôs just run a mile, breathing in deep as he does his best to catch his breath.

Remus squeezes his arm. ‚ÄúGo on, go to him.‚Äù

James just shakes his head. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt. Not here.‚Äù But God does he want to.

‚ÄúGo wherever it is you do, he‚Äôll follow, I‚Äôd bet anything,‚Äù Remus gives him a sad smile and James finds himself searching his friend‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúSirius?‚Äù he asks finally.

‚ÄúMe and Pete will find him. You won‚Äôt be any use now anyway,‚Äù he nods his head in Regulus‚Äôs direction. ‚ÄúGo on.‚Äù

Feeling oddly numb James stands back up. ‚ÄúYeah, okay, thank you.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù Remus says, and then; ‚ÄúJames? Be careful, alright?‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he looks briefly over at the Slytherin table and then back to Remus, ‚ÄúYeah I will. You too.‚Äù

Remus lets out a huff. ‚ÄúI can handle him I promise.‚Äù James knows that it‚Äôs so much more complicated than that but there‚Äôs no point arguing.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll be back‚ÄîI‚Äôll come find you okay? Don‚Äôt do anything stupid,‚Äù and then, with a half-hearted grin. ‚ÄúNot without me yeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúSure James,‚Äù Remus says softly. James isn‚Äôt at all sure that this is the right decision, but he does know that he‚Äôll never be able to concentrate now. Not until he speaks to Regulus. Not until he‚Äôs able to touch him. To make sure he‚Äôs real. To make sure he‚Äôs okay.

He nods at Peter before squeezing Remus‚Äôs shoulder and heading out of the Great Hall on shaking legs.

He isn‚Äôt sure if Regulus even sees him leave, but the truth is, if he stays in that room for another second he‚Äôs probably gonna do something stupid. Like kiss Regulus. Like cry. So he escapes to the Come and Go Room, heart aching the moment he steps inside and feels its warmth. It‚Äôs been a little over a month since he was last here.

He pauses at the door, letting it all hit him, the memories and feelings that this room is saturated in. Then he takes a shaky breath in and sits on the end of the bed, resting his elbows on his knees and dropping his head into his hands.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs okay,‚Äù he tries to tell himself, tries to get himself to believe. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs okay, he‚Äôs okay, he‚Äôs okay.‚Äù He takes in a deep breath and lets it out slowly. He‚Äôs been so fucking scared, spending every minute since he‚Äôd last seen Regulus worrying. Knowing that Reg wasn‚Äôt safe and that there was nothing he could do about it‚Äîeven before he went missing. He squeezes his eyes shut. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs okay, he‚Äôs okay, he‚Äôs okay.‚Äù It comes out like a prayer, though James doesn‚Äôt know who wizards pray to. After all, they don‚Äôt need faith. They have magic.

The door opens and James‚Äôs head shoots up, nearly tripping as he gets to his feet. Regulus is there, standing in front of the door, so fucking close James can‚Äôt breathe. For a minute they just stay like that, staring at one another, the air filling up with something that buzzes and sparks and begs to be touched. But James doesn‚Äôt know what to do, he‚Äôs held in place by Regulus‚Äôs eyes, by his stare, by all the things he feels for him.

It‚Äôs Reg who steps forward eventually, breaking the moment apart as he walks right up to James, throwing his arms around his torso and pressing his face into his chest. James doesn‚Äôt hesitate, instantly hugging him back.

‚ÄúI have you,‚Äù he whispers as he presses desperate kisses to the top of Regulus‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre safe, you‚Äôre safe, I have you.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt answer, just squeezes tighter, trembling in James‚Äôs arms and James has to fight back the burning in his eyes because he knows Reg needs him to be strong and he can do that. He can. For this boy he can push all the rest of it aside.

‚ÄúI love you, you‚Äôre safe, I promise,‚Äù James‚Äôs mouth is running away with itself, he isn‚Äôt even entirely sure what he‚Äôs saying only that he wants Regulus to know that he‚Äôs there.

‚ÄúAre you real?‚Äù Regulus asks after a few minutes, voice small and muffled by James‚Äôs shirt.

James almost laughs, because honestly he could ask Regulus the same question. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says instead. ‚ÄúYeah I‚Äôm real.‚Äù

‚ÄúPromise?‚Äù

James plants another kiss on the top of his head. ‚ÄúPromise.‚Äù

Eventually James shuffles them towards the bed, wrapping them up in the warm blankets and holding Regulus to his chest. His hands rub soothing circles into his back as he continues his running monologue of comfort. After a few minutes Regulus tilts his head back, looking up at him.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James says softly. ‚ÄúHey, hi, how are you?‚Äù his hands cup Regulus‚Äôs face, thumbs brushing against his cheeks.

Regulus‚Äôs eyes flutter closed at the touch. ‚ÄúYou know,‚Äù he croaks, sounding a bit more like himself, ‚Äúthere was a second there, where I thought I‚Äôd never see you again.‚Äù

James swallows around the lump in his throat. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he whispers, ‚Äúme too.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes open again, as beautiful and intense as always. ‚ÄúI wanted to come back.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù James says, because it‚Äôs true.

‚ÄúI thought you might‚Ä¶‚Äù James watches him fight with the words in his mouth. ‚ÄúI know I‚Äôve disappeared on you before. But I told you I wouldn‚Äôt do that again. And I don‚Äôt want to break my promises anymore. Especially not to you.‚Äù

James kisses his forehead, his cheek, his nose, his chin. ‚ÄúThis okay?‚Äù he asks. Regulus nods, eyes closed again, face still in James‚Äôs hands.

‚ÄúI imagined you were with me,‚Äù he says breathlessly. ‚ÄúIt helped.‚Äù

James‚Äôs heart aches. ‚ÄúWhat did you imagine?‚Äù he asks quietly.

‚ÄúUs, our home,‚Äù Regulus says, nuzzling against James‚Äôs palm, before turning to press a kiss there.

‚ÄúOur home?‚Äù

‚ÄúMm, what it would look like‚Äîbe like‚Äîif we had one. A flat in London.‚Äù

James wrinkles his nose. ‚ÄúIn London? Why?‚Äù

‚ÄúClose to Quidditch.‚Äù

James almost laughs. ‚ÄúAh of course. You do realize we‚Äôre Wizards right? So really anywhere is close to Quidditch if we want it to be.‚Äù

Regulus cracks one eye open to glare at him and James has to bite the inside of his cheek to keep from smiling.

‚ÄúAre you really going to nitpick my fantasy?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, sorry. Tell me about our flat in London.‚Äù

Regulus closes his eyes again, humming contently. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs small and cozy. Lots of carpets and blankets and pillows. Lots of fireplaces‚Äîthough only one of them is connected to the Floo and we keep it off most of the time.‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure what to do with the information that Regulus‚Äôs fantasy involves cutting himself off from the Wizarding world as much as possible.

‚ÄúYou make a mess, obviously.‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúObviously.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut you make up for it by cooking me hamburgers the Muggle way.‚Äù

That feels like a punch to the gut. That Regulus remembers what he wrote in his letter. That he liked it. Wanted that too. Wanted everything James saw for them. He knows they‚Äôre young. He does. But he can‚Äôt help it, imagining his future with Reg.

‚ÄúI‚Äôd learn to cook other things for you,‚Äù he says finally, thumb stroking Regulus‚Äôs cheek. ‚ÄúIf you wanted.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt cook too much though,‚Äù Regulus says seriously. ‚ÄúKreacher will get upset.‚Äù

That makes James pause. ‚ÄúKreacher?‚Äù

‚ÄúMy house elf.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight, but wouldn‚Äôt he, you know, stay with your mum? At Grimmauld?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes open, voice surprisingly serious considering nothing they‚Äôre discussing is real. ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt leave him there. Not with her. I couldn‚Äôt leave him behind.‚Äù

There‚Äôs something heartbreaking about those words, though James can‚Äôt decide if it‚Äôs the love Regulus has for his elf, or if its the pain he clearly feels about being left behind.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù James leans forward, kissing him softly. ‚ÄúI won‚Äôt cook too much.‚Äù

They lie there in silence for a moment, the outside world disappearing, becoming something fuzzy and far away. Something that can‚Äôt touch them. And James luxuriates in the warmth of Regulus‚Äôs body in his arms. The weight of him. The same monologue on loop in his head.

He‚Äôs okay.

He‚Äôs okay.

He‚Äôs okay.

There‚Äôs a shift in Regulus before he speaks again. James can feel it. Can feel him trying to put up his walls, to protect himself from James‚Äôs reaction. He wants to tell him not to, that he doesn‚Äôt need to. Not with James. Not after all this time. But he knows it would only make it worse. So instead he waits.

‚ÄúI was in Azkaban,‚Äù Regulus says finally, and even though James already knew that he still feels his breath hitch.

He nods, chin brushing Regulus‚Äôs curls. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

Regulus instantly pulls away, looking up at him with wide eyes. ‚ÄúYou know? What do you mean you know?‚Äù

James tries to pull him back down but it‚Äôs no use, Regulus is already sitting fully upright, blankets pooling around his waist. James sighs, pulling himself up too.

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt think I was just going to sit around and do nothing did you?‚Äù he gives Regulus a self-deprecating smile.

‚ÄúWhat did you do James?‚Äù he sounds worried, which, James supposes isn‚Äôt entirely unwarranted.

‚ÄúDeveloped my own tracking spell,‚Äù like it‚Äôs no big deal.

Regulus blinks back at him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äîwhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe used the Quaffle you made me to track your magical signature. The minute you used magic we were able to find you.‚Äù

Regulus still looks confused. ‚ÄúBut I wasn‚Äôt using magic, I didn‚Äôt have my wand.‚Äù

James shrugs. ‚ÄúWell you must have at some point because‚Äî‚Äú he cuts himself off as Regulus‚Äôs face goes abruptly pale, the change so quick James is certain he‚Äôs going to pass out.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù the next second Regulus is scrambling out of the bed, practically falling onto his hands and knees as he vomits on the floor.

James moves without thinking, sitting beside him and holding his hair away from his face. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre okay, it‚Äôs okay,‚Äù he says softly, even though he has absolutely no idea what is going on.

Even after the vomiting stops Regulus remains on his hands and knees just breathing. James reaches for his wand and vanishes the mess.

‚ÄúOkay?‚Äù he asks, hand on Regulus‚Äôs back, he still looks frightfully pale as he leans back against the bed, bending his knees and dropping his head between them.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he says weakly.

‚ÄúFor what? You don‚Äôt need to‚Äîyou don‚Äôt need to apologize to me Reg.‚Äù Just tell me what I said, he almost asks, just tell me what happened to you. Though, to be honest, he‚Äôs not sure he could bear hearing it, not sure he could bare knowing that more damage had been done to this boy that he loves so much. More damage he couldn‚Äôt protect him from.

Eventually Regulus lifts his head. ‚ÄúThat means you didn‚Äôt find me until last night?‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúYeah.‚Äù

Regulus smiles dryly, loosening some of the tension in James‚Äôs chest even though when he speaks his voice still sounds strained. ‚ÄúAnd what exactly were you planning to do with that information? Break into Azkaban?‚Äù

‚ÄúI was thinking about it,‚Äù James shrugs, because he had been.

Regulus laughs weakly. ‚ÄúOf course you were,‚Äù a few moments of silence pass before he lets out a deep breath, shoulders slouching forward. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you didn‚Äôt. I‚Äôm glad you weren‚Äôt there. I don‚Äôt want you to ever‚Äî‚Äú but he cuts himself off, shaking his head.

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù James says softly, hand going to the back of his neck, he feels Regulus sag into his touch. ‚ÄúWhat happened?‚Äù he can‚Äôt help it.

Regulus‚Äôs mouth turns down as he shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo‚ÄîI‚Äîcan‚Äôt‚ÄîI‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúShh,‚Äù James squeezes his neck lightly. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine, I‚Äôm sorry, I shouldn‚Äôt have asked. You don‚Äôt have to tell me, okay?‚Äù

Regulus nods, breathing in and out slowly. ‚ÄúThank you.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù

They sit side by side on the floor, James in no hurry to move, happy just to be near him. Eventually Regulus leans into James body, resting his head on his shoulder, James‚Äôs hand sliding down around his back, pulling him close.

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù he sighs eventually, chin resting on the top of his head. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something I have to tell you.‚Äù

Regulus laughs without humour. ‚ÄúOf course there is.‚Äù

James swallows, throat tight. He‚Äôs not sure how Regulus is going to react to this but he‚Äôd rather he hear it from him first, so he has time to prepare himself before it all inevitably blows up.

‚ÄúSirius knows.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence.

‚ÄúSirius knows what?‚Äù

James sighs.

‚ÄúHe knows about us.‚Äù

¬†

PART III REMUS

Remus stands in front of the whomping willow, watching Peter scurry through the grass towards the knot in the trunk. He‚Äôs embarrassed that he didn‚Äôt think of it earlier. Or at all, for that matter. It was Peter who suggested it, after they had once again fruitlessly searched the map for Sirius‚Äôs name.

It‚Äôs so obvious. Remus doesn‚Äôt know how he missed it. Except maybe that he tries not to think about the Shack. Tries to forget it exists. Forget why this big hulking tree has been planted here in the first place. It‚Äôs never occurred to him that the Shack could act as actual shelter and not just a glorified cage.

The tree branches slow to a stop and a minute later Peter is back, transforming into himself again.

‚ÄúSure you don‚Äôt want me to go with you?‚Äù he asks, straightening up, breath heavy after the run.

‚ÄúNo, thanks. If he‚Äôs in there I think‚Ä¶I think it‚Äôs probably best if it‚Äôs just me.‚Äù

Peter nods, not looking the least bit put out at the idea of missing the altercation.

‚ÄúWell alright then,‚Äù he claps Remus good naturedly on the back. ‚ÄúGood luck.‚Äù

Remus shoots him a weak smile. ‚ÄúThanks.‚Äù

He hates every step he takes towards the Willow. Every step along the dark, damp passage underneath it, every step into the dusty, creaking house. He‚Äôs trembling by the time he reaches the top of the stairs.

‚ÄúSirius?‚Äù he calls out, resisting the urge to pull out his wand. He strains his ears but he can‚Äôt hear anything‚Äîwell, besides the wind. It‚Äôs freezing in here, his teeth already chattering as he walks along the hallway towards the bedroom. In the light of day he can make out more of the faded wallpaper. Of the desperate scratches on the walls. He shivers. Most of them are old. From his first and second year, before he had the others. Though some are undoubtedly also from last year.

He tenses when he reaches the bedroom but it‚Äôs empty, just like the rest of the house. Remus sighs, sagging against the doorframe. It‚Äôd been a good idea, better than any Remus had been able to come up with, but still wrong.

He‚Äôs stepping back into the hallway when he hears it‚Äîa door, steps on the floor, heading for the stairs. Something isn‚Äôt right though, the steps clatter, like heels on hardwood, and there are too many of them, coming too fast. It isn‚Äôt until he sees the dark head cresting the top of the stairs that he realizes, of course, what the reason must be.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù Remus says stupidly, as a large black dog comes to an abrupt halt at the other end of the hallway. ‚ÄúHi.‚Äù

There‚Äôs another moment of silence before Padfoot growls, baring his teeth and flattening his ears.

Remus arches his brow. ‚ÄúAre you going to bite me Sirius?‚Äù he asks, with more bravado than he feels. ‚ÄúYou think I‚Äôm afraid of teeth? Of claws? Me?‚Äù he almost laughs, opening his arms wide. ‚ÄúGo on then, what‚Äôs a few more scars right?‚Äù

The growling promptly turns into a whine that‚Äôs so pitiful Remus almost takes it back. But before he can speak again Padfoot is moving, he brushes past Remus and goes into the bedroom behind him without so much as a sniff in his direction. Remus takes a deep breath before following after him.

Padfoot is curled up in the corner, back to the door and therefore also to Remus. Remus watches him for a few moments before sighing.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

Padfoot huffs.

‚ÄúI know. Believe me I know. I just‚ÄîI mean at first I was in shock, and everything between us was so back and forth last year that I hardly wanted to add to that‚Äî‚Äú

Padfoot growls and Remus doesn‚Äôt need words to know why. Whatever else they were, they were friends first. Family. Remus should have told him. Should have made James tell him. No excuse can make up for that failure of loyalty.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù he repeats desperately. ‚ÄúLook, I told him it was fucked up okay? I told him not to do it but you know James,‚Äù he stares at the dark mass in front of him, head still buried. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want to hurt you. But I didn‚Äôt want to hurt him either.‚Äù

Nothing. No more grumbling, no barking, not even the twitch of his tail or ears. The house is silent.

‚ÄúSirius,‚Äù Remus whispers finally. ‚ÄúPlease.‚Äù

If anything, Sirius seems to curl more into himself. Like he‚Äôs trying to disappear. Remus feels the desperate desire to reach out to him, to burry his face in his fur, but he refrains. Maybe he should leave, give Sirius the time that he clearly needs. The problem is, Remus can‚Äôt quite make himself walk out the door. It‚Äôs as though everything in him is pulling him towards the black dog in the corner.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre not just fooling around,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure you don‚Äôt want to hear that but I‚Äôm also sure that you know it already since James is your best mate and you and I are both well aware that he‚Äôs never had a casual emotion in his life,‚Äù and since Remus continues to get the silent treatment he decides to keep going, feeling an uncomfortable mix of emotions pressing against the inside of his skin.

‚ÄúI thought that Regulus was just using him to get at you, but he isn‚Äôt. Fuck Sirius, they love each other. I mean properly love each other. So I don‚Äôt know what I was supposed to do? It was wrong to lie, I know it was, but I couldn‚Äôt break James‚Äôs heart like that, not when I knew that it was something real.‚Äù

It happens so fast that Remus barely has time to process it. One second Sirius is a dog and the next he‚Äôs breathing heavily on the floor, clumsily pushing himself to his feet. That he‚Äôs still angry is clear but Remus feels his heart skip at the sight of him anyway. At the sight of his Sirius.

‚ÄúRegulus doesn‚Äôt love him,‚Äù Sirius says, voice all twisted, though whether that‚Äôs from anger or the transformation Remus doesn‚Äôt know.

‚ÄúI know you don‚Äôt want‚Äî‚Äú

But Sirius cuts him off. ‚ÄúWhat I want is irrelevant, clearly,‚Äù he sneers at the last word. ‚ÄúRegulus doesn‚Äôt love him, Regulus doesn‚Äôt love anything but himself. That‚Äôs why he will always choose them. The family.‚Äù

Remus knows that Sirius feels betrayed, feels abandoned by Regulus, who handed him over to their mother time and time again. Who turned his back when Sirius cried out for help. He also knows that Sirius doesn‚Äôt hate his brother. No matter what he says. Because none of that would hurt so much if he did.

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHe has the Mark.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs whole body goes cold. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe has the Mark,‚Äù Sirius practically spits on the floor. ‚ÄúI told you. He chooses them. Every time he chooses them.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow do you know?‚Äù Remus asks desperately. He isn‚Äôt concerned for Regulus, but James‚ÄîJames won‚Äôt recover from this. Not if it‚Äôs true.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen it.‚Äù

Remus closes his eyes briefly. ‚ÄúFuck‚Äù he hisses under his breath, taking a few seconds to appreciate what an absolute clusterfuck of a situation this is before he speaks again. ‚ÄúRegulus does love him,‚Äù he says wearily and without really knowing why.

Sirius scoffs.

‚ÄúHis Patronus,‚Äù Remus goes on, opening his eyes so he can see the confusion flicker across Sirius‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúRegulus‚Äôs Patronus is a Stag.‚Äù

For a moment neither of them speak, and then Sirius starts shaking his head.

‚ÄúNo‚Äîit can‚Äôt‚Äîand even if it is, so what? That‚Äôs just‚Äîthat‚Äôs just a stupid myth‚Äîit isn‚Äôt real, it doesn‚Äôt mean anything.‚Äù There‚Äôs a sort of desperation in Sirius‚Äôs voice that Remus doesn‚Äôt understand. Why, he wants to ask, why is it so important that Regulus doesn‚Äôt care?

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs real,‚Äù Remus says, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs in our textbooks.‚Äù But Sirius is still shaking his head.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the kind of bullshit story you tell kids, Patronuses and soulmates, it‚Äôs a fairytale, it doesn‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú Sirius goes silent as Remus raises his wand.

‚ÄúExpecto Patronum.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a bright flash and then that flash grows legs and feet and a tail, running circles around Remus before it bounds across the room and sits at Sirius‚Äôs feet. Sirius stares down at the dog and then back up at Remus, eyes wide.

‚ÄúI‚Äôd been afraid,‚Äù Remus has to stop and clear his throat, his voice too tight, ‚Äúin class,‚Äù he clarifies, ‚Äúto really try. Afraid it would be a werewolf. But after I found out about Regulus I thought‚Ä¶‚Äù he trails off, shrugging and then after a minute he smiles, even if it is a bit fragile. ‚ÄúAs soon as I saw him I thought ‚Äúof course‚Äù you know? Of course it‚Äôs y‚Äîyou.‚Äù He stutters on the last word, Sirius still staring at him like he can‚Äôt believe what he‚Äôs seeing.

‚ÄúSo I know it‚Äôs real,‚Äù Remus presses on, fidgeting under Sirius‚Äôs gaze. ‚ÄúBecause I know how I feel about you and it‚Äôs‚Äî‚Äú he exhales, trying to get his words in order. ‚ÄúI think it was inevitable, me loving you. Does that make sense? Like I was always going to love you no matter what. Even if we never met, never sat in that compartment together, never got sorted into the same house or the same dorm. Even if I never knew you existed you would still be the person I loved and I would spend my whole life wondering where you were,‚Äù he swallows. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt just love you because you‚Äôre here. I don‚Äôt just love you by accident. I love you because I was always going to love you. In this life and the next life and the one after that. The universe could have placed us on different planets and it would still be you.‚Äù

The phantom dog gives a little bark, his tail wagging enthusiastically as he paws at Sirius‚Äôs feet. Remus watches the anger bleed out of Sirius as he sags back against the wall behind him, closing his eyes.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the same. I feel the same,‚Äù he says, sounding incredibly tired. Despite it all, those words make Remus‚Äôs heart skip.

‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù

Sirius opens his eyes, looking right at him. ‚ÄúYou really think you‚Äôre in this alone?‚Äù

Sometimes,

Remus thinks before he can stop himself.

Sometimes you feel so far away.

But instead all he manages is; ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know.‚Äù

Sirius huffs, like he‚Äôs still a dog. ‚ÄúI love you Remus, I love you too fucking much.‚Äù Something about his tone doesn‚Äôt sit right with Remus.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt make that sound like a good thing?‚Äù

Sirius sighs, running a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to do this forever.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs chest squeezes. ‚ÄúDo what?‚Äù he whispers.

‚ÄúHurt each other.‚Äù

The dog at Sirius‚Äôs feet flickers and then goes out, dissolving into a faint mist. Remus honestly doesn‚Äôt know what to say, but for the first time all day Sirius seems willing to talk.

‚ÄúI hurt you with Snape, you hurt me with Regulus. I mean, is this what it‚Äôs going to be like? Just letting each other down for the rest of our lives? Because I don‚Äôt think I can handle it Moons. It‚Äôs too fucking painful.‚Äù

Something desperate is clawing at Remus‚Äôs chest. Because he can‚Äôt lose him. He doesn‚Äôt have anything else. Doesn‚Äôt have a mum, doesn‚Äôt have a home, or a future, shit, he barely has a dad. Loving Sirius is the only thing that feels like his anymore. And he knows that he‚Äôll always have to share him with James, but he‚Äôs made peace with that, because James will never get to kiss the freckle just below Sirius‚Äôs left ear, or feel the way Sirius‚Äôs hands tremble for the first few seconds after they find skin, like it‚Äôs a thrill every time. He‚Äôll never know how Sirius tastes. Those things will always be Remus‚Äôs and they‚Äôre enough. More than enough.

‚ÄúAre you‚Ä¶ending things?‚Äù Remus finally forces himself to ask.

Sirius gives him a humourless smile. ‚ÄúNo, I can‚Äôt. I think maybe I should, but I‚Äî‚Äú he breaks off, shaking his head, gathering his thoughts. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like you said. Loving you is inevitable. No matter where I am or who I‚Äôm with. It‚Äôll always be you, I think.‚Äù

Somehow those words hurt and heal in equal measure. ‚ÄúBut you want to? You wish you could?‚Äù he pushes, because he needs to.

Sirius sighs. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt understand how we ended up here,‚Äù he says honestly. ‚ÄúAnd I don‚Äôt know how we‚Äôre ever going to get out. Because you don‚Äôt trust me‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI do,‚Äù Remus takes a step forward, desperate. To convince Sirius. To convince himself.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Sirius says softly. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt, and that‚Äôs okay, really, I get it. But now‚Ä¶now I don‚Äôt know if I trust you either.‚Äù

A wounded noise comes out of Remus before he can get himself under control and Sirius looks up at him with sad eyes.

‚ÄúSo where do we go from here?‚Äù

It takes a minute before Remus realizes that the question isn‚Äôt rhetorical, that Sirius is genuinely hoping for an answer. And God does Remus wish he had one. He wracks his brain, trying to find something, anything, but his parents weren‚Äôt exactly the paragon of a healthy relationship and he finds that he actually has no idea how this is supposed to work. How you‚Äôre supposed to love someone.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù he says eventually, feeling helpless.

Sirius nods. ‚ÄúMe neither.‚Äù

A tense moment of silence passes, the winter wind whistling through the rotting house.

‚ÄúDo you‚Äî‚Äú Remus has to stop to clear his throat. ‚ÄúDo you want me to go?‚Äù

Sirius looks up at him and after a long minute shakes his head. ‚ÄúStay? I can‚Äôt‚ÄîI can‚Äôt go back yet. I can‚Äôt face him, I‚Äôm not‚Äî‚Äú he squeezes his eyes shut, hands in fists. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll lose it, I know I will. I just, I need more time to figure out how to‚Ä¶.‚Äù he lets out a breathy laugh that lacks any semblance of joy. ‚ÄúHow to live with this.‚Äù

Remus nods as Sirius‚Äôs eyes open again.

‚ÄúBut I‚Äôd like it if you stayed.‚Äù

Remus doesn‚Äôt need to be asked twice, he walks over to Sirius‚Äôs side of the room, sliding down the wall to sit next to him on the floor, Sirius following after. For a moment they stay like that, next to one another but not touching, not speaking, until eventually Sirius sighs, his body sagging against Remus‚Äôs, his head resting on his shoulder.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still mad at you,‚Äù he says quietly.

Remus‚Äôs heart squeezes as his arm reaches around Sirius‚Äôs back and pulls him closer.

‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

Remus almost laughs at that. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay. As long as you still want me here.‚Äù

Sirius sighs, turning his head and burying his face in the crook of Remus‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúI want you here,‚Äù he says into his skin. Remus squeezing him a little tighter.

‚ÄúPart of me,‚Äù Sirius goes on after brief a pause, words so quiet that Remus can barely hear them even with Sirius‚Äôs mouth so close to his ear. ‚ÄúHates it because it‚Äôs like Reg is rubbing it in my face that I wasn‚Äôt enough.‚Äù

Remus blinks, surprised by this sudden turn in the conversation. ‚ÄúWhat do you mean?‚Äù

Sirius lets out a hot breath against his neck. ‚ÄúThose last few years, when we were in that house together‚Ä¶there were moments when it felt like I could have died and he wouldn‚Äôt have cared. And if he‚Äôs just a heartless bastard then it‚Äôs not personal you know? But if he isn‚Äôt‚Ä¶if he‚Äôs capable of loving someone‚Ä¶‚Äù

And suddenly Remus understands. ‚ÄúThen why couldn‚Äôt he love you?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a moment of silence before Sirius speaks again. ‚ÄúI know that James is better than me.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú

But Sirius cuts him off, clearly not in the mood to be placated.

‚ÄúBut then there‚Äôs this other‚Äîthis other part of it. Because if he‚Äîif he loves James, I mean actually, properly loves him, then that means he can‚Äôt really be one of them can he? Not completely. There has to be at least some part of him that wants something else. Something different.‚Äù

‚ÄúMaybe, yeah,‚Äù Remus says, not entirely sure.

‚ÄúBut I didn‚Äôt know‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt think that part of him still existed. Because if it does then‚Äî‚Äú Sirius‚Äôs voice cracks and Remus can physically feel him getting frustrated with himself. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the difference.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs brow furrows even though Sirius can‚Äôt see it. ‚ÄúThe difference?‚Äù

Sirius sighs. ‚ÄúBetween him choosing to stay,‚Äù he says weakly, pain thrumming through his words. ‚ÄúAnd me leaving him behind.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

I think this chapter was a little shorter but hey, Regulus is back! So, that's fun. Also I feel like Peter was a real MVP in this chapter which, honestly, is a surprise to us all and unlikely to happen again. But I guess even rats have good days.

Thank you for all your kudos and comments and I've seen some like tiktoks and fan videos too which honestly is just so cool to me so like wow love you guys :) :)

Chapter 36

Chapter Summary

Is anyone okay? No. Will they be eventually? Also no.

Chapter Notes

Tw: deals with trauma surrounding death and murder

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I JAMES

Regulus is just staring at him, eyes wide, something complicated twisting up his face that James can‚Äôt quite interpret.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he asks cautiously.

But Regulus doesn‚Äôt respond, at least not right away, his body rigid at James‚Äôs side. Eventually he manages to force his expression into something vaguely blank, which James knows is a bad sign.

‚ÄúSirius knows about us,‚Äù he repeats robotically. ‚ÄúDoes he know because you told him?‚Äù there is something brittle about his voice.

James wants to say no, that he would never betray Regulus‚Äôs trust like that, but he‚Äôs not about to throw Remus under the bus.

‚ÄúYou were missing,‚Äù is what he says instead. Which Regulus seems to take as an admission of guilt.

‚ÄúFuck James,‚Äù he hisses, before he grips his knees, head dropping down between them. ‚ÄúFuck. Fuck. Fuck.‚Äù

‚ÄúHey, it‚Äôs okay,‚Äù James says, even though he has absolutely no idea if that‚Äôs true.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt deal with this right now, I don‚Äôt even‚ÄîFuck‚ÄîI can‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHe‚Äôll never forgive me for this,‚Äù and then he laughs, head still between his knees, breaths coming in and out in wheezing gasps. ‚ÄúNo, that‚Äôs stupid. He was never going to forgive me anyway. But now he‚Äôll hate me. Properly hate me‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù James says again, trying and failing to stop his spiralling.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to fight with him. I don‚Äôt want to hurt him. I‚Äôm so tired of hurting people.‚Äù

Who have you hurt? James almost asks before he stops himself. ‚ÄúRegulus you have to breathe okay?‚Äù James‚Äôs hand goes to the back of Regulus‚Äôs neck, squeezing just enough that he can feel it. ‚ÄúNo one is fighting anyone,‚Äù though he isn‚Äôt sure he can promise that, not knowing Sirius as well as he does.

‚ÄúWhat if he never speaks to you again?‚Äù Regulus sounds out of breath. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll resent me. You‚Äôll hate me too‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt your fault Reg, I knew what the consequences were,‚Äù though he can‚Äôt help the panic that rises up in him at the thought of Sirius cutting him out of his life. ‚ÄúI won‚Äôt hate you.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou will. You fucking will,‚Äù another choked laugh bubbles out of him. ‚ÄúBut I guess that doesn‚Äôt matter either,‚Äù he‚Äôs talking to himself, James realizes. ‚ÄúI already made sure you would.‚Äù

James feels those words like they‚Äôre hands twisting his gut. ‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù he says more sternly, squeezing his neck again, not tight enough to hurt, just enough to anchor him, to keep him grounded in his body instead of his unraveling nightmares. ‚ÄúBreathe. Now. Breathe with me. In and out.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo, no more talking. Just breathe, okay? Open your mouth and inhale.‚Äù

After a few seconds James hears the sound of breath being slowly taken in.

‚ÄúGood, that‚Äôs good. Again, do it with me.‚Äù And so they breathe together. In, two, three, out, two, three. In, two, three, out two three. Again. And again. And again. Until James feels certain that Regulus isn‚Äôt about to pass out. He leans forward, pressing his forehead to Regulus‚Äôs temple.

‚ÄúYou need to trust me.‚Äù

He feels Regulus sag against him. ‚ÄúThat isn‚Äôt the problem.‚Äù

‚ÄúThen what is?‚Äù

Reg doesn‚Äôt speak, and after several minutes James gives up waiting, letting out a heavy sigh. ‚ÄúReg,‚Äù he says softly, ‚Äúkeeping things from me? Things you think I can‚Äôt handle? That‚Äôs not trust.‚Äù

Regulus presses back against him. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want you to know everything I know,‚Äù he says quietly. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt even want to know everything I know. Some things you can‚Äôt take back. Can‚Äôt forget. I don‚Äôt want to do that to you,‚Äù another pause and then; ‚ÄúPlease don‚Äôt make me do that to you.‚Äù

James squeezes his eyes shut and resists the urge to break something. To tear the world apart for everything it‚Äôs done to Reg. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry,‚Äù he finally manages.

‚ÄúNo don‚Äôt‚ÄîI don‚Äôt deserve it.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù his voice aches but Regulus quickly pulls back, sitting up and rubbing his face.

‚ÄúWe should go,‚Äù his voice has turned cold. A defence mechanism. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs too early to be disappearing and I‚Äôve already missed enough lessons as it is.‚Äù He gets to his feet without looking at James.

James wants to tell him to stop. That they can stay here all day. All week. Forever. Tucked away in their little corner of the universe where James can keep him safe. But he knows a brush off when he sees one. Knows what Regulus looks like when he‚Äôs locked himself away. The boy in front of him doesn‚Äôt want to be coddled or comforted or touched. This isn‚Äôt Reg anymore. It‚Äôs the heir to the noble and most ancient house of Black. James has learned to spot the difference between them.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he says eventually, getting awkwardly to his feet as Regulus goes about righting his robes, returning his appearance to its normal immaculately quaffed state. You‚Äôd never guess he‚Äôd been vomiting his fear up only a few minutes ago.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll deal with Sirius okay?‚Äù James says, earning him a tight nod.

‚ÄúIf you think you can.‚Äù His tone is dismissive but James knows that Regulus is terrified of what his brother will do next.

‚ÄúI can,‚Äù James tries to put as much confidence into those words as he can, even if it‚Äôs confidence that he doesn‚Äôt feel. But it‚Äôs hard when Reg won‚Äôt meet his eye.

They‚Äôre nearly at the door when something else starts nagging at the back of James‚Äôs mind. ‚ÄúHey Reg?‚Äù he stops him with his hand on the doorknob. The younger boy looks at him over his shoulder.

‚ÄúMary said‚ÄîMary Macdonald‚Äî-she said something to me, over break.‚Äù

Regulus goes unnaturally still. ‚ÄúOh?‚Äù he says mildly, tone not at all matching his posture, the effect is unnerving.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîyeah. I was just‚Äîjust wondering,‚Äù there‚Äôs no good way to ask this but James struggles to find one anyway. ‚ÄúWhat happened,‚Äù he lands on eventually, ‚Äúthe night she was attacked?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs expression remains blank. ‚ÄúYou know what happened.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo I?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a tense moment of silence during which James tries and fails to crack Regulus‚Äôs mask. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what to tell you James,‚Äù he says eventually. ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt there.‚Äù

It hits James square in the chest. The feeling of wrongness. For one blissful second he doesn‚Äôt understand it‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt understand why his skin suddenly feels like crawling off his bones as he stares into Regulus‚Äôs empty eyes. But then he realizes;

Regulus is lying.

He‚Äôs lying to me.

Which means‚Äî

‚ÄúIs that all?‚Äù Regulus asks, breaking into James‚Äôs thoughts. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather not get detention on my first day back.‚Äù

James blinks at him, mouth dry ‚ÄúUm‚Äîyeah. Okay. Sorry. That‚Äôs all.‚Äù

Regulus nods, opening the door and pausing halfway through. When he looks back for the second time there‚Äôs something a little more human in his stare. More like the boy who‚Äôd just been sitting with James on the floor.

‚ÄúTonight?‚Äù is all Regulus asks.

James offers him a shaky smile. ‚ÄúTonight,‚Äù he agrees, watching Regulus nod before slipping out of the room. He finds he can‚Äôt move, a trembling breath scratching its way out of his lungs.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he presses the heels of his hands into his eyes. ‚ÄúOh fuck Reg. What did you do?‚Äù

¬†

PART II REGULUS

He‚Äôs barely in class for thirty minutes when a silvery translucent phoenix flies through the doors and up to Professor Flitwick‚Äôs desk. Regulus grits his teeth and looks back down at his parchment. It‚Äôs probably nothing. He‚Äôs sure Dumbledore sends messages to his teachers all the time. Granted, he‚Äôs never seen it happen before but that doesn‚Äôt mean‚Äî

‚ÄúMr. Black?‚Äù

Every muscles in his body tenses as he looks up to find Professor Flitwick‚Äôs eyes on him.

‚ÄúProfessor Dumbledore would like to see you. He said to bring your books. You won‚Äôt be back before the end of class.‚Äù

Fuck.

Regulus nods at Flitwick before he starts inelegantly shoving his books back into his bag. He knows that it‚Äôs the least of his problems right now, but he really wishes that Dumbledore could have waited until lunch or something. He hates that he‚Äôs already missed the first few weeks of the winter term. He‚Äôs behind. And Regulus is never behind. He likes school, he‚Äôs not embarrassed about that, even if Evan mocks him mercilessly for it. He‚Äôs good at school, and, not to be too much of a Ravenclaw, but he really misses learning things.

‚ÄúShit Reg,‚Äù Evan whispers beside him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve only been here a few hours, what the fuck did you do to get summoned to the Headmaster‚Äôs office?‚Äù

Regulus only shakes his head as he slides his bag over his shoulder. ‚ÄúNo idea,‚Äù he mutters. ‚ÄúSee you at lunch?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, yeah, of course. Hey, tell Dumbledore to eat a dick for me will you?‚Äù he shoots Regulus a grin that actually manages to calm his nerves a little bit.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a moron Evan,‚Äù he says fondly, heading out of the class and into the largely deserted corridor.

Regulus assumes the password to Dumbledore‚Äôs office is the same as it was before Christmas and he‚Äôs proven right when the ugly stone gargoyle guarding it shifts to reveal the stairs. With every step he takes he can feel his pulse speeding up, his palms and underarms growing sweaty. It‚Äôs stupid, to be afraid of this after having just spent two weeks in Azkaban, but at least there he‚Äôd known what to expect. Well, sort of. Here though? Here he doesn‚Äôt know what Dumbledore is capable of. What he can do to Regulus. He just knows that Dumbledore‚Äôs the only one whose power is equal to Voldemort‚Äôs‚Äîmagically and politically. And he also knows that Dumbledore doesn‚Äôt like him.

‚ÄúCome in,‚Äù the Headmasters‚Äôs voice calls out after Regulus knocks tentatively on the large doors at the top of the stairs.

The cluttered nature of Dumbledore‚Äôs office automatically puts Regulus on edge every time he steps into it. Not only because he likes things ordered, but because it makes it difficult to get his bearings. He doesn‚Äôt know if there is another door, he thinks there must be, connecting to the Headmasters‚Äôs private rooms, but he can‚Äôt see it. Doesn‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs the only one or if there are more. He‚Äôs not even certain that they‚Äôre alone. Someone could easily be hiding amongst the trinkets and oddities that Dumbledore has piled around himself like he‚Äôs a dragon collecting treasure.

‚ÄúSit,‚Äù the old man says, gesturing to the single chair in front of him, he smiles at Regulus but the expression doesn‚Äôt reach his eyes. In Regulus‚Äôs experience it never does. Dumbledore is already sitting behind his desk, half-moon spectacles at the tip of his nose, hands laced in front of him.

Regulus does not relax when he sits down, back straight, barely touching the wood. ‚ÄúYou wanted to see me?‚Äù he asks, when Dumbledore allows the silence to drag on.

Dumbledore tilts his head forward, still smiling. ‚ÄúI did.‚Äù Another painful silence stretches between them and it takes every ounce of self control Regulus has not to fidget, not to let his gaze drop.

Regulus isn‚Äôt at his best. That‚Äôs the truth. Two weeks in Azkaban, a week at Grimmauld before that, his nerves are too close to the skin. His body and mind and heart too sensitive. He was barely able to keep it together with James this morning. Well, if you consider vomiting keeping it together. He hopes none of that shows on his face but he has a sneaking suspicion that Dumbledore already knows. That that‚Äôs why he wanted to speak with him so soon.

‚ÄúYou took an extended vacation I‚Äôm told,‚Äù Dumbledore says, and Regulus nearly sighs with the relief of having the silence broken.

‚ÄúFamily emergency,‚Äù he says calmly.

Dumbledore arches his brow. ‚ÄúOh?‚Äù

‚ÄúYup.‚Äù

Dumbledore tilts his head to the side, assessing Regulus. ‚ÄúYour teachers tell me you‚Äôre quite bright,‚Äù he says, the sudden shift in the conversation startling Regulus.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîdo they?‚Äù he hates the uncertainty that he‚Äôs allowed to slip into his voice.

‚ÄúThey do. And I‚Äôve been struggling to understand why someone so intelligent would willingly waste his talents on the bigoted crusades of a mad man.‚Äù

Regulus blinks, opening and closing his mouth, not sure how to respond. No one ever speaks to him about this‚Äîabout Voldemort‚Äîso bluntly and Regulus isn‚Äôt sure what he should deny and what he should own up to. Is he meant to feign ignorance in this situation? Does Dumbledore actually know anything or is he just making guesses?

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry Professor,‚Äù Regulus says when he finally manages to find his voice again. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm not quite sure what you mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúAh, of course, I‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôve been told I can be rather obtuse sometimes,‚Äù he laughs, the noise causing the hair to stand up on the back of Regulus‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúLet me be more clear.‚Äù

He slides something across his desk and it takes Regulus a minute to focus on it, to cut through the buzzing anxiety fogging up his brain and properly read the words in front of him. It‚Äôs today‚Äôs edition of the Daily Profit, he realizes. The front page of the Daily Prophet to be precise. When he finally reads the headline he feels his whole body recoil before he can get control of himself. He tries to clamp down on the fear that swells inside him, that he knows is playing across his face right now, but he doesn‚Äôt quite manage it.

‚ÄúPrisoner Murdered in His Cell,‚Äù Dumbledore reads the headline out loud. ‚ÄúMinistry in Uproar.‚Äù

All Regulus can do is stare back at him with wide eyes. Dumbledore apparently takes that as permission to continue.

‚ÄúJonathan Van Wheeler was murdered late last night in his cell in Azkaban. The twenty-two year old was being held on suspicions of Death Eater activity. Aurors refuse to comment on whether or not his death confirms or refutes his connection to the terrorist group.‚Äù

A little bit of doubt, Regulus thinks numbly. It‚Äôs what Voldemort had wanted and it‚Äôs exactly what he got.

‚ÄúVan Wheeler‚Äôs family vehemently denies that the young man had any such associations, his father saying, in a statement made early this morning; ‚ÄúWhat has happened to my son is a great injustice. The Aurors had no right taking him. They just wanted somebody. Wanted to feel like they were doing something. So they took my boy. My beautiful boy. I blame the Ministry more than anyone else for his death. He never should have been in Azkaban.‚Äù

‚ÄúStop,‚Äù Regulus says, voice raw. This couldn‚Äôt have worked out better for Voldemort. Not only are the Aurors still unclear about whether or not they‚Äôve been following a false lead, but now public opinion is turning against them.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù Dumbledore says mildly, looking up from the paper. ‚ÄúWhat was that family emergency again? I‚Äôm afraid I forgot to ask?‚Äù

Regulus is pretty sure if he tried to speak right now he would choke. All he can mange is holding Dumbledore‚Äôs stare and not throwing up. He hadn‚Äôt known the man‚Äôs name before. Jonathan. He can conjure up his face so easily‚Äî pale and desperate and begging for mercy.

‚ÄúIt isn‚Äôt mentioned in this article, because the Ministry doesn‚Äôt want anyone to know, but along with a murder, it appears there was also an escape last night. A relative of yours I believe, Rabastan Lestrange. Perhaps that is the emergency to which you were referring?‚Äù

Still Regulus doesn‚Äôt speak. Can‚Äôt. His brain is a mess of half-formed thoughts and memories he is desperately trying to force back down into the corner of himself where he keeps everything else he can‚Äôt think about.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll not pretend that I don‚Äôt find your actions reprehensible,‚Äù Dumbledore goes on, apparently bored with waiting for a response. ‚ÄúBut it would be of great value to me to have a set of eyes in Tom‚Äôs inner circle. Especially one in a family like yours. So I will ask you again, work with me, and maybe you‚Äôll be able to wash some of this blood from your hands.‚Äù He gives Regulus a look that is more like disgust than pity. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt strike me as someone who has the stomach for murder.‚Äù

Regulus almost laughs. Considering the amount of throwing up he‚Äôs been doing that might literally be true. Then something else occurs to him. Something equally hard to stomach.

‚ÄúIs that why you left us there‚Äîleft Sirius?‚Äù he‚Äôs proud that his voice comes out at least relatively even.

Dumbledore doesn‚Äôt flinch. ‚ÄúLeft you where?‚Äù

It‚Äôs an irritating question, but Regulus answers anyway. ‚ÄúAt Grimmauld. I bet the second James Potter brought Sirius home his parents were begging you to let them take him. But you never did. Never did anything even though you must have known‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúKnown what?‚Äù Dumbledore interrupts, voice betraying nothing but casual interest.

Everything in Regulus begs him to shut his mouth. These are all the things they don‚Äôt say. All the things they never say. Hide the bruises. Smile and stand up straight. Dress smart. No one will notice. No one will know. We are the Noble and most Ancient House of Black. We do not cry. We do not whine. We certainly don‚Äôt ask for help.

‚ÄúWhat they were like,‚Äù he half-whispers, not sure he can mange more honesty than that. ‚ÄúWhat was happening to us in that house. You never lifted a finger until the day Sirius left himself. Was that because of this,‚Äù Regulus gestures to him. ‚ÄúBecause you wanted‚Äîwhat did you say again? Eyes?‚Äù

Considering how blunt he‚Äôs been throughout this encounter, Regulus really shouldn‚Äôt be surprised by the words that come out of his mouth next. But somehow he still is.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Dumbledore says, without shame. Regulus finds himself well and truly speechless. ‚ÄúIt was necessary. Ideally Sirius would have remained there until he graduated but oh well. Best laid plans and so forth. Luckily,‚Äù he runs Regulus over with his eyes, ‚Äúthere‚Äôs still you.‚Äù

And oh.

Oh isn‚Äôt that just.

Just exactly what his fucking mother thought.

Regulus takes a deep breath and tries to asses the situation in front of him, tries not to lose control, to hold himself together long enough to get out of this fucking office.

‚ÄúThe last time we spoke you wanted my wand,‚Äù he says slowly, ensuring his words come out strong. Stable. Freed of the fear and anger strangling him under the surface. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm assuming you weren‚Äôt able to get a warrant from the Ministry to do so?‚Äù he needs to make sure he knows where he stands. Knows what cards Dumbledore is playing with.

Dumbledore pauses, blue ice like ice staring into him. ‚ÄúI was not.‚Äù

Regulus nods. So he tried and he failed. That‚Äôs good, it means their hold on the Ministry is strong, it means that legally Dumbledore has no power here.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why you brought this then,‚Äù Regulus points at the paper. ‚ÄúYou needed new blackmail material?‚Äù

Dumbledore arches his brow. ‚ÄúAnd what on Earth would Jonathan Van Wheeler‚Äôs death have to do with you?‚Äù

‚ÄúNothing‚Ä¶of course,‚Äù Regulus says sharply, holding Dumbledore‚Äôs stare. ‚ÄúIt has nothing to do with me. So we‚Äôre done here?‚Äù

He really wishes he could look away but he doesn‚Äôt want to seem weak‚Äîat least, not weaker than he already does.

‚ÄúThis is the last time I will be making you this offer Regulus,‚Äù he says in that deep all-consuming voice of his. ‚ÄúI will never again offer you an olive branch. There will be no changing your mind from this moment on.‚Äù

Regulus nods, the motion jerky because he‚Äôs shaking so badly. ‚ÄúI understand.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you?‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt dignify that with an answer. He wants out, of course he wants out, but he doesn‚Äôt trust Dumbledore. And at least his mother needs to keep him alive.

Eventually Dumbledore sighs. ‚ÄúThen yes. We‚Äôre done.‚Äù

Regulus gets up from his chair but doesn‚Äôt quite make it out of the room. He knows that Dumbledore doesn‚Äôt care, that Regulus is nothing but a piece on the board to him, which seems to be all he is to everyone these days. But for some reason he still says it.

‚ÄúI could have used you when I was eleven,‚Äù he looks back over his shoulder. ‚ÄúYou could have made a difference then.‚Äù

Dumbledore holds his gaze, stare unblinking. ‚ÄúThe world doesn‚Äôt owe you anything Regulus,‚Äù his voice hits Regulus somewhere low in his stomach. ‚ÄúAnd I certainly don‚Äôt.‚Äù Despite his best efforts Regulus feels the burning sensation of shame wash over him.

Without wasting anymore time he pushes through the door and sprints down the stairs.

¬†

He doesn‚Äôt know where he‚Äôs going. It‚Äôs not quite lunch yet but he can‚Äôt stomach the thought of walking back into class. He can‚Äôt stomach the idea of being anywhere if he‚Äôs honest. He just wants to disappear. To scrub the skin off his bones. He hates the way his body feels, hates the things it‚Äôs done, hates the sound of his own thoughts in his head.

Breathe, he tells himself as he walks belligerently through the corridors. No purpose, no direction, just the desire to move and not think. The word is said in James‚Äôs voice. The ghost of his touch burning into the back of Regulus‚Äôs neck.

Breathe, breathe, breath‚Äî

‚ÄúWell look who‚Äôs back.‚Äù

Regulus whips around, wand drawn as he comes face to face with a smirking Mary Macdonald. She doesn‚Äôt even flinch, just arches her brow as Regulus feels his heart start to beat again.

‚ÄúJumpy much?‚Äù she asks.

Regulus doesn‚Äôt lower his wand right away, which is stupid. They‚Äôre in the middle of the corridor, and the last thing he wants is to give Dumbledore anymore excuses to call him into his office.

‚ÄúYou gonna hex me Black?‚Äù she steps forward until tip of his wand is pressing into the base of her throat. ‚ÄúOr, sorry, I mean again. Gonna hex me again?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs hands are shaking and he can‚Äôt help thinking of the last time he had his wand pointed at someone.

I‚Äôm a good man, Jonathan had begged.

I swear.

I‚Äôm going to get married.

Please.

He drops his arm but doesn‚Äôt put away his wand, keeping it firmly clutched in the palm of his hand. ‚ÄúNot now,‚Äù he bites out. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt‚ÄîI can‚Äôt do this right now.‚Äù

‚ÄúUnfortunately I really don‚Äôt care,‚Äù she says, sounding like she means every word. ‚ÄúWe had a deal you and I.‚Äù

Regulus wants to scream.

‚ÄúI gave you two weeks.‚Äù

‚ÄúI was unavoidably detained,‚Äù he says flatly.

‚ÄúWell, you‚Äôre here now, and you‚Äôre meant to be selling out your friends to me.‚Äù

Regulus had actually forgotten about that. So much has happened since their meeting on the Quidditch pitch. This mess with Mary had felt so big and important then, but now? Regulus can barely bring himself to care. Too busy trying to navigate his way around the two titans currently vying for his loyalty.

‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt even been back a day,‚Äù he finally says, sounding nearly as exhausted as he feels.

‚ÄúYes, well, I‚Äôve been here for weeks, so you‚Äôll excuse me if I‚Äôm not feeling particularly patient.‚Äù

Regulus grits his teeth. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll give you your information‚Äîthough, I‚Äôm not entirely sure you‚Äôve been holding up your end of the bargain.‚Äù

She arches her brow, looking amused more than anything else, which Regulus finds infuriating but he pushes his anger down. It won‚Äôt do him any favours to act out right now.

‚ÄúIs that so?‚Äù she asks mildly.

‚ÄúJames has been asking questions, said you told him stuff over the break. You know anything about that?‚Äù

Regulus had been certain his heart was going to drown in the pit of his stomach this morning when James asked him about Mary‚Äôs attack.

The Gryffindor smirks. ‚ÄúJames isn‚Äôt exactly known for minding his own business is he?‚Äù

‚ÄúSo you‚Äôre saying he, what? Figured it out on his own?‚Äù

Mary shrugs. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm saying I gave you two weeks. But I still haven‚Äôt breathed a word to Dumbledore. It was his office you just came from yeah? I could always go have a chat with him.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs hand squeezes his wand. ‚ÄúI told you I would keep you informed and I will.‚Äù

Mary smiles with all her teeth. ‚ÄúGood. Then we shouldn‚Äôt have any problems should we?‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt bother responding to that. Doesn‚Äôt see the point. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to lunch now, that alright with you?‚Äù

She laughs, leaning back against the wall and crossing her arms over her chest. ‚ÄúSure babe.‚Äù

Regulus has barely taken two steps before she speaks again. Words crawling down his spine.

‚ÄúHe still doesn‚Äôt know about the Mark,‚Äù she says recklessly, though Regulus supposes it isn‚Äôt her life she‚Äôs gambling with. ‚ÄúI left that one for you. But you have to tell him.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt sop. Doesn‚Äôt turn around.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he mutters under his breath, ignoring the ache in his chest. ‚ÄúYeah, I know.‚Äù

¬†

PART III JAMES

Remus doesn‚Äôt show up until dinner. James would have had no idea where he was if it weren‚Äôt for Peter. Even still, it makes him nervous. This mess isn‚Äôt Remus‚Äôs fault and he doesn‚Äôt want him to have to bear the brunt of Sirius‚Äôs anger. Or any of it for that matter.

‚ÄúThere,‚Äù Peter nudges James‚Äôs foot under the table and he immediately stops nervously tapping his cutlery and turns to watch Remus walk towards them. He looks tired but okay.

Tired and alone.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù he says softly, as he drops down into the seat beside James.

‚ÄúHe was there then?‚Äù Peter asks, leaning across the table.

Remus nods. ‚ÄúYeah, he was there. It was a good guess Pete.‚Äù

Peter preens.

James watches as Remus rubs at his eyes, hair mussed and clothes covered in dirt, all very unlike the pristine front he normally presents. There are so many things he wants to ask him that he doesn‚Äôt know where to start.

‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù he decides on eventually.

Remus gives him a weak smile. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been better, but I‚Äôve been worse,‚Äù he pauses, taking in a deep breath. ‚ÄúI think we‚Äôll be‚Ä¶okay,‚Äù he says, though his words are shaky, like they aren‚Äôt quite sure of their footing.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs good,‚Äù James says, swallowing around the lump in his throat. ‚ÄúHow‚Äîah‚Äîhow is he?‚Äù

Remus doesn‚Äôt manage to hide his grimace. ‚ÄúHe needs‚Ä¶time, I think.‚Äù

‚ÄúCan I talk to him?‚Äù

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he says wearily.

‚ÄúPlease I just‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he repeats more sternly, eyes locking with his. ‚ÄúDid you hear what I just said?‚Äù

James does his best to bite back the frustration that flares inside him. ‚ÄúHe needs time,‚Äù he repeats stiffly.

Remus nods his head. ‚ÄúYeah. He just needs to be alone for a bit.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlone with you?‚Äù James isn‚Äôt able to keep the bitterness out of his voice. And yeah, he knows he‚Äôs out of order, but there was a time when he was the person that Sirius wanted at his side when he couldn‚Äôt stand the sight of anyone else. When he was the one to comfort him. Put him back together. Save him from himself. And he‚Äôs jealous. Because this‚Äîthis new development between Sirius and Remus, it feels like being replaced. It feels like losing something.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Remus replies, not unkindly, because it‚Äôs Remus and he is the bigger person in nearly every situation. ‚ÄúAlone with me.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt know what he‚Äôs supposed to say to that, but thankfully McGonagall saves him from having to figure it out.

‚ÄúMr. Lupin, I am told by your professors that you and Mr. Black were absent from class today. Care to explain yourself?‚Äù

Minnie knows how to be intimidating when she wants to be, towering over them with a stone cold stare and unsmiling mouth. Remus doesn‚Äôt even flinch.

‚ÄúSorry Professor, I have a note from Madam Pomfrey,‚Äù he reaches into his bag and does, in fact, pull out a note. It is work for James to keep his face neutral. ‚ÄúSirius got sick this morning, I took him to the infirmary and stayed with him.‚Äù

McGonagall takes the note from him and inspects it thoroughly. ‚ÄúI see. And you needed to remain with him because‚Ä¶?‚Äù she looks back up in time to get the full force of a Remus Lupin sheepish smile. It‚Äôs truly a thing of beauty. All soft and self deprecating. The guy could get away with murder using that thing.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôve noticed, but Sirius is a bit of a handful on a good day, let alone when he‚Äôs ill.‚Äù

James actually thinks he sees McGongall trying to bite back her own smile. Everyone thinks Remus is the goody-goody, but he‚Äôs a duplicitous little bastard when he wants to be.

‚ÄúVery well, give Mr. Black my regards, and Poppy as well, she‚Äôll need them after a day with you two.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will professor, of course,‚Äù he flashes her another one of those smiles as she walks away, note in hand.

When Remus turns back to the table he slumps, like that performance took it out of him.

‚ÄúHoly shit,‚Äù Peter gasps, echoing James‚Äôs thoughts exactly. ‚ÄúRemus did you just forge a sick note? You?‚Äù

Remus looks up at him, frowning. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not forged,‚Äù and when the pair of them continue to stare at him unconvinced he sighs, rubbing his forehead. ‚ÄúWell, not completely. She gave me a few, in case I needed to‚Ä¶take time off, around the full moon. I just‚Ä¶adjusted it a bit.‚Äù

‚ÄúTo include Sirius?‚Äù James asks.

Remus nods wearily. ‚ÄúTo include Sirius.‚Äù

James laughs, shaking his head. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs brilliant that is.‚Äù But Remus continues to look unhappy about it.

‚ÄúShe gave them to me because she trusts me, this isn‚Äôt something to be congratulating me on.‚Äù

‚ÄúI dunno,‚Äù Peter says thoughtfully. ‚ÄúPretty impressive if you ask me.‚Äù

‚ÄúVery quick witted,‚Äù James agrees.

Remus only rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúYou two are a terrible influence.‚Äù

‚ÄúHey!‚Äù James holds his hands up in a show of innocence. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the one forging legal documents here.‚Äù

‚ÄúA sick note is not a legal document,‚Äù Remus hisses as he starts piling food onto his plate. ‚ÄúAnd would you keep your voice down?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe just didn‚Äôt know you were such a delinquent,‚Äù James teases.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the Prefect thing,‚Äù Peter adds. ‚ÄúReally threw us off.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm ignoring you both now,‚Äù Remus says, causing Peter and James to snicker.

It takes a few minutes before James realizes that Remus isn‚Äôt just putting food on his plate, but on the napkin next to him as well. James looks blatantly at it, brow raised. At first he thinks Remus doesn‚Äôt see, but eventually he sighs.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs for Sirius.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù James tries to ignore the pulling in his gut. ‚ÄúNot coming in then.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd you‚Äôre going back?‚Äù

Remus doesn‚Äôt meet his eye. ‚ÄúStaying the night.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù James says for the second time, not sure he can manage much else.

‚ÄúBlimey that‚Äôs going to be bloody uncomfortable,‚Äù Peter shivers across the table and Remus gives him a small smile.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve done it before.‚Äù

‚ÄúSuppose so,‚Äù though Peter doesn‚Äôt sound convinced.

James can feel Remus shooting him glances as they keep eating, the silence between them now a little awkward. But he does his best to ignore it, to focus on the food on his plate. His mashed potatoes are absolutely fascinating tonight.

‚ÄúListen, James,‚Äù Remus says eventually, voice dropped low ‚ÄúWe should‚Äîwe need to talk.‚Äù

James looks over at him. If they‚Äôd been dating this would be the moment when James would start worrying Remus was about to break up with him, but since they‚Äôre not, he isn‚Äôt exactly sure what ‚Äúwe need to talk‚Äù means.

‚ÄúOkay?‚Äù he says eventually, instead of the obvious: we‚Äôre talking right now?

‚ÄúI have something to tell you‚Äîthat you should know. Maybe before I‚Äî‚Äú But Remus quickly cuts himself off as Marlene and Dorcas get too close.

‚ÄúHey boys,‚Äù Marlene says cheerily, dropping into the seat next to Peter, Dorcas on her other side. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs shaking?‚Äù

It‚Äôs a weird moment, remembering suddenly how normal this day has been for everyone else, like being woken up from a dream. Reminded that the rest of the world still exists.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîguys?‚Äù Marlene starts to look concerned when none of them reply, apparently all experiencing the same strange feeling as James. It‚Äôs like he can‚Äôt remember how to hold a regular conversation because his entire life at the moment is a disaster.

‚ÄúNothing much,‚Äù Peter quickly jumps in. ‚ÄúExcept‚Äîoi, did you hear about Zabini and Richardson?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh my God yeah, what the hell?‚Äù Dorcas laughs. ‚ÄúWeirdest couple ever.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre they a couple though?‚Äù Marlene says frowning. ‚ÄúI thought they just hooked up?‚Äù
