James had been wonderful of course, always there when she needed him, always willing to talk. But none of it seemed to‚Ä¶help. She wasn‚Äôt ready yet, to let go of her mum. So she started coming to visit her here. She‚Äôd stay for a few hours just siting here, thinking, talking, maybe obsessing a little. About what she should have done. About all she failed to do.

Then one morning Mary showed up. Lily isn‚Äôt sure how she knew where to find her, if it was James or just Mary‚Äôs insane intuition, but she‚Äôd brought coffee and she sat with Lily. Then the next time Marlene was there too, doughnuts in hand. And so it started‚Äîbreakfast with mum.

They come every two weeks when they can manage it. Every month when they can‚Äôt. And slowly it‚Äôs‚Ä¶helped. Helped her feel like her mother hasn‚Äôt just disappeared from her life. Helped her feel like she still has a family.

Staring at her friends, picnicking in a graveyard, she knows it‚Äôs odd. Maybe it isn‚Äôt the right way to do this‚Äîto grieve‚ÄîLily doesn‚Äôt know. But it gets her through. These days that‚Äôs all any of them can really ask for.

¬†

PART III REGULUS

He stumbles a bit as he Apparates onto the stoop of his parents‚Äô house. The inside is empty, though the windows are all thrown open, letting in the sweet summer air and causing the long white curtains to flutter in the breeze like wings. It‚Äôs been almost a year since his parents first moved to Scotland permanently and yet somehow the place still feels deserted.

The action is in London, at Grimmauld, with its never ending stream of people always coming in and out. Regulus never would have thought that his mother would willingly step away from all that‚Äîwillingly remove herself from the centre of power and politics. But then, he‚Äôd forgotten that there‚Äôs always been one thing she‚Äôs loved more than the family name or the Pureblood cause.

Her husband.

Orion is too weak and too sick for the mess that is Grimmauld Place. So he moved out here. And three weeks later, unable to be so far away from him, Walburga followed. Sometimes Regulus will catch them together, more now than ever before, maybe because his father is nearer to dying, and his mother‚Äôs face will be almost soft, her hand in his, her voice a whisper, and it will render Regulus speechless. Frozen in awe. He doesn‚Äôt know who that woman is who tends so diligently to his dying father. He just knows he‚Äôs never met her. Knows she‚Äôs never deemed him worthy of her care.

Of course, today, his father is alone.

‚ÄúPapa?‚Äù he calls out softly as he enters his father‚Äôs bedroom. Brighter and fresher than the one he‚Äôd had in London, with a view of his garden, which Regulus knows he likes.

Orion is thin‚Äîthe thinnest he‚Äôs ever been‚Äîhis pallor so far past pale he now looks vaguely blue, veins lighting up his arms and face. He has no hair left and his hands shake so badly that he can‚Äôt hold anything‚Äîcan‚Äôt write letters or bring food to his mouth.

His father‚Äôs eyes blink open, face lighting up when he turns to find Regulus at his side. ‚ÄúMon rayon de soleil,‚Äù his voice rough like sandpaper. He reaches out a shaking hand to cup Regulus‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know you were coming today.‚Äù

Regulus smiles back. ‚ÄúI know, sorry, bit unexpected.‚Äù

His father kisses his teeth. ‚ÄúNe dit pas d√©sol√©, every day I get to see you is a good day, you know this.‚Äù

He does. It eats him up sometimes, when he isn‚Äôt able to get away from the city for a few days. Terrified every second that he‚Äôs going to get the message that his father has died and he hasn‚Äôt been able to say goodbye. To hold his hand. To tell him that he loves him.

‚ÄúHave you seen your maman? She was meant to be back by now,‚Äù his father lets his hand drop, too weak to hold it up for long. It‚Äôs years of practice that allows Regulus to keep his expression blank.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here, she got held up so she‚Äôs going to be back later. I can‚Äôt stay but I wanted to check in, let you know, make sure you‚Äôre okay,‚Äù there‚Äôs no way in hell that Regulus is going to tell his dying father that his wife is currently being held for questioning at the Ministry. He severely doubts anything serious is happening to her, and Lucius and Rodolphus are currently working on getting her released as soon as possible, but still‚Ä¶it‚Äôs the type of thing likely to worry his father unnecessarily.

Orion‚Äôs eyes grow wide with concern. ‚ÄúShe is alright, your maman?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, of course,‚Äù Regulus smiles, taking his father‚Äôs hand and squeezing. ‚ÄúYou know her, she can‚Äôt leave anything half done, has to see everything through to the end, make sure it‚Äôs all done right.‚Äù

His father smiles back. ‚ÄúThat is certainly true.‚Äù

Regulus nods, desperate to change the subject. ‚ÄúSo,‚Äù he says, giving his father‚Äôs hand another squeeze. ‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù

His father scoffs at the question. ‚ÄúOf course. I am dying, but I am okay.‚Äù From anyone else that answer would have been sarcastic, but not his father, who faces death with so much brevity that Regulus sometimes wonders if he wants it.

Sometimes wonders the same thing about himself.

It is a strange dichotomy he has found. To fear dying so profoundly and yet at the same time wish he was dead on a near daily basis. Regulus shakes his head, clearing it of its morbid thoughts.

‚ÄúRight, well, besides dying‚Äîare you hungry? Thirsty? Cold? Can I get you a book or play some music? A blanket?‚Äù

His father lets out a breath that might have, years earlier, been a laugh. ‚ÄúNon, mon chou, j'ai seulement besoin de toi. Talk to me for a while?‚Äù

And Regulus makes sure not to show the tiny ways his father‚Äôs request makes his heart ache. ‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù he summons a chair from across the room and takes a seat. ‚ÄúWhere should I start? Ah, I know, Evan is seeing someone, and that is going about as well as you would expect.‚Äù

His father manages a proper laugh now. ‚ÄúOh young love, it never ceases to entertain. Tell me more.‚Äù

And so he does.

¬†

Regulus stays far longer than he means to. Than he should have. Eating dinner with his father and then waiting until he falls asleep before leaving. Hopefully Walburga will be back in Scotland before he wakes up and he‚Äôll be none the wiser to the minor crisis that occurred today.

A man nearly runs into Regulus on his way through the front door of Grimmauld Place‚Äîhe doesn‚Äôt recognize him but that isn‚Äôt uncommon. Regulus has come to learn that his family is rather terrifying. Which means people tend to steer clear of him if they can manage it. Makes it hard to get to know anyone. Not that Regulus minds.

‚ÄúExcuse me,‚Äù the man mutters‚Äîor maybe not a man‚Äînow that he speaks he sounds young, closer to Regulus‚Äôs age, though it‚Äôs hard to know for sure since he has a scarf wrapped around his face and the hood of his cloak pulled up. A small tuff of blond hair sticks out the side. He keeps his head down and gives Regulus as wide a berth as the front hall will allow before scurrying outside promptly disappearing.

He doesn‚Äôt even stop long enough to close the door behind him. Regulus rolls his eyes.

‚ÄúRude,‚Äù he mutters under his breath as he closes and locks it for good measure.

The sitting room is full of chatter, someone‚Äôs put the wireless on, and Regulus can smell the alcohol from the hall. He presses on. One or two figures loiter at the bottom of the stairs, all of them looking down when Regulus approaches. He ignores them, taking the stairs two at a time until he reaches his room. The top floor is blissfully quiet. For the first time in his life he is glad that his parents stashed him so far away.

He closes the door behind him, shucking his jacket onto the bed and pulling out his wand.

‚ÄúExpecto Patronum,‚Äù he mutters, barely even thinking about it. It‚Äôs just habit by now. There‚Äôs a burst of light and then out of his wand gallops a stag.

‚ÄúHello boy,‚Äù he says as the phantom beast rubs his head affectionately against Reg‚Äôs shoulder‚Äîboth there and not there at the same time. The animal stamps his hooves happily before he starts puttering around the room, never able to stay still. Regulus gives him a fond smile.

He‚Äôs not sure how it started exactly, just that one day he tried, just to see if he could still do it. He dragged up the memories he kept so carefully tucked away, placed them at the forefront of his mind for the first time in ages and watched the beautiful thing they created fill up his room. The feeling that the spell causes in his chest‚Äîthe warmth, and comfort and‚Ä¶completeness‚Äîhe‚Äôs become a little addicted to it. Addicted to the manifestation of his happiest memories.

With his Patronus now happily milling about his room Regulus starts pulling newspapers from his bag. He‚Äôs collected three today‚Äîone is even Muggle. He flips through the pages, snipping out the relevant articles with his wand.

It wasn‚Äôt long into his career as a member of the Dark Lord‚Äôs inner circle that Regulus realized how little any of them were told about what was going on. Their Master gives them all bits and pieces but no one, not even his mother, seems to have any idea of what the full picture is. So Regulus started looking for clues. It‚Äôs a distraction more than anything else, a puzzle to focus on as apposed to what‚Äôs really going on around him. What he‚Äôs really doing. He looks at it like coursework‚Äîa school project. He‚Äôs always been good at those.

The newspapers help him piece together what the rest of the Wizarding world knows, what the Muggles know, and also, occasionally, the locations of certain Death Eaters that he hadn‚Äôt been made aware of. Between what the papers know from the outside and Regulus knows from the inside, he‚Äôs been able to figure out a few of the jobs the Dark Lord has assigned his followers more discretely.

He isn‚Äôt sure what he‚Äôll do with this information. Likely nothing. But he keeps looking for it anyway. He sticks the new articles up on his wall with the old ones, standing back to admire his handiwork, eyes scanning the headlines and names he‚Äôs highlighted overtime. Connections he‚Äôs made. He‚Äôs about to grab his journal and make some notes when he hears a knock on the door of his bedroom.

Instantly his stag is standing in front of him, a fierce look in his eyes as he tilts his head down, showing his antlers to the door. Regulus can‚Äôt help but smirk a little. It‚Äôs nice, having someone to protect him. He leans back against his bedpost, arms crossing over his chest.

‚ÄúYes?‚Äù

The door opens and immediately there‚Äôs shrieking. ‚ÄúOh for fuck‚Äôs sake Regulus,‚Äù Narcissa snaps, hand going to her chest. ‚ÄúDo you have to have that thing around all the time?‚Äù

His stag paws at the ground, looking ready to charge.

Regulus doesn‚Äôt bother answering Narcissa‚Äôs question: ‚ÄúDown boy,‚Äù he says instead. Instantly the stag lifts his head, looking at Regulus questioningly. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs harmless, it‚Äôs okay.‚Äù

Narcissa scoffs as she inches further into the room, making a wide circle around the Patronus. ‚ÄúIt can‚Äôt hear you, you know? It‚Äôs just an‚Ä¶incantation, not an actual animal.‚Äù

Regulus ignores her, reaching out to scratch behind the stag‚Äôs ears‚Äîmore solid than a ghost, less solid than a person. The stag closes his eyes and tilts his head up appreciatively and Regulus has to fight back a smile. When he finally turns to Narcissa she‚Äôs standing on the other side of the room looking on with great disapproval.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think this is healthy.You spend more time with that thing than you do with actual people.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not a ‚Äòthing‚Äô he‚Äôs a ‚Äòhim‚Äô and don‚Äôt start with me. As though anyone in this fucking family is healthy.‚Äù

Narcissa looks like she wants to argue but decides against it.

‚ÄúSo?‚Äù he asks after a silence that stretches on too long, his Patronus returning to exploring the corners of his room. Narcissa watches him warily. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm assuming there‚Äôs something you want?‚Äù

She shifts, and Regulus has a feeling it‚Äôs more than the stag that‚Äôs making her uncomfortable. After several more seconds of fighting with her words Narcissa eventually speaks. ‚ÄúI need‚Ä¶I need a favour.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm shocked.‚Äù

She shoots him a sharp look. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be a brat Regulus.‚Äù

‚ÄúStop wasting my time Narcissa.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh like you‚Äôre so busy,‚Äù she sneers.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, do you want my help or not?‚Äù

That shuts her up. She sighs, rubbing a hand over her face, making sure not to disturb her perfectly coiffed hair.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù she says eventually. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt mean to snap I‚ÄîI haven‚Äôt been sleeping.‚Äù

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúStill?‚Äù he just gave her a months worth of Dreamless Sleep a few days ago.

Narcissa looks away. ‚ÄúYes, still. Anyway, that‚Äôs not‚Ä¶the favour.‚Äù

He waits for her to continue but she once again seems to be struggling. ‚ÄúI‚Äîwe‚Äî‚Äú she grimaces in frustration. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still not pregnant.‚Äù

Regulus continues to stare at her. ‚ÄúOkay?‚Äù

She finally looks back at him, her expression a mixture of determination and embarrassment. ‚ÄúI was wondering‚ÄîI was hoping‚Äîyou would make me a fertility potion.‚Äù

The request shouldn‚Äôt surprise him and yet for some reason it does. There are about a dozen different questions floating through his mind, perhaps the loudest being ‚Äúhow the fuck could you ask me that?‚Äù but luckily what ends up making it out of his mouth is far more reasonable.

‚ÄúI thought you were already seeing a Healer?‚Äù

He watches her jaw clench. ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

‚ÄúI would assume they‚Äôve prescribed you fertility potions then?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo why‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúI was hoping‚Ä¶you could make them‚Ä¶stronger.‚Äù

And now Regulus wants to laugh. ‚ÄúAre you out of your mind? Do you have any idea how dangerous that is?‚Äù

She gives him a hard look. ‚ÄúYes, I do actually. I‚Äôve thought about this a lot, but what we‚Äôre doing right now isn‚Äôt working and I need this baby.‚Äù The desperation in her voice strips it bare of its usual confidence.

‚ÄúMaybe you don‚Äôt,‚Äù Regulus says before he can stop himself.

She looks like he‚Äôs just slapped her. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre being cruel.‚Äù

Regulus sighs, dropping his arms. He can feel his stag raise its head, so attuned to his moods, to any sign that he might need a shield. ‚ÄúNo I‚Äôm not I‚Äôm just‚Äîyou know how I feel about him.‚Äù

She takes a step towards Regulus. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt about him,‚Äù she says fiercely.

Now Regulus does laugh, though there‚Äôs no humour in it. ‚ÄúOh come on Narcissa, he‚Äôll be the goddamn father.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will be the one taking care of this child, I‚Äôll raise him, he‚Äôll be so loved Regulus, I promise. It won‚Äôt be like it was‚Ä¶‚Äù she lets that sentence die.
Like it was for us.

Like it was for you.

Regulus shakes his head, looking away. It‚Äôs one thing for the two of them to make this fucked up family on their own, but to ask him to participate? To actively allow it to happen?

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want any part in this,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúYou wanna risk your health with an overly potent potion make it yourself.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you think I‚Äôve tried?‚Äù she says, sounding close to tears. Regulus hasn‚Äôt seen her cry since they were kids. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not good enough, I don‚Äôt know anyone who is other than you. Please. Please Regulus this is the only thing I have ever wanted. The only thing I‚Äôm allowed to have.‚Äù Her words are raw, and as much as he wishes they didn‚Äôt affect him they do. She steps forward again, reaching out to him‚Äîclose enough to touch‚Äîand then his Patronus is there. Eyes sharp, head held high, forcing Narcissa to stumble back in surprise.

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù he says to the animal, not taking his eyes off his cousin as he places a hand on the back of the stag‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, we‚Äôre okay.‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin, I fucking hate that thing,‚Äù Narcissa snaps as she rubs quickly at her eyes, getting rid of any evidence of moisture there. As though Regulus hasn‚Äôt already seen. As though she hasn‚Äôt already laid herself bare for him.

For a long while neither of them say anything.

When Narcissa eventually lifts her eyes he‚Äôs shocked by the naked pain they hold. ‚ÄúPlease Reg,‚Äù she begs in a weak voice. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what will happen to me if I fail at this.‚Äù

And oh, isn‚Äôt that a fear Regulus knows too well.

His stag crowds closer to him, maybe sensing his distress, the warmth and comfort that always wafts off of him calming Regulus.

‚ÄúHave they threatened you?‚Äù he asks.

She lets out a dry laugh. ‚ÄúLucius needs an heir, and I am worthless to everyone if I cannot produce one‚Äîincluding to my parents. This is not a good time to be without allies. Not when people so easily go missing.‚Äù She tilts her head back, closing her eyes and letting her shoulders roll forward. Regulus has never seen her look so defeated. ‚ÄúBesides, I want to be a mother. I want to be one so badly.‚Äù

It is moments like this, when Regulus knows he‚Äôs weak.

Weak and pathetic and probably lonely.

Because despite it all, he‚Äôs always liked Narcissa best. Always thought of her as a sister. A replacement, after Sirius left. There‚Äôs a part of her, maybe smaller than Regulus, but still there, that doesn‚Äôt fit the way he doesn‚Äôt fit. That is miserable the way he is miserable. Not that that‚Äôs ever meant anything. She‚Äôs never been there when he needed her. And he knows that if their places were reversed she would have already thrown him out of the room.

It‚Äôs hard for him to tell, what is normal and what isn‚Äôt. What is right and what is wrong. He has no barometer for any of it, that was broken in him a long time ago. He thinks this is probably wrong. But then, Narcissa needs help. Her life may depend on it. And Regulus knows that he can help her. More than that. Worse than that. He wants to.

Maybe she‚Äôll love you then.

Like a real family.

He knows that isn‚Äôt what will happen. Yet the childish hope persists.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he says finally, even though it feels like swallowing broken glass. Like a betrayal of every part of himself. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll do it.‚Äù

She‚Äôs moving before he even blinks, he thinks she‚Äôs going to hug him but she stops just shy of touching him‚Äîmaybe because of the angry stag at his side.

‚ÄúThank you Regulus, thank you, thank you, thank you.‚Äù

He looks away. He doesn‚Äôt feel good about this.

‚ÄúWhen can you have it ready?‚Äù she asks, voice strained.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôll take a week to brew. But I was serious about it being dangerous, there are so many potential side effects to taking a potion with an increased concentration.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs worth it,‚Äù Narcissa says without pause. Regulus can‚Äôt help but think of the conversation they‚Äôd had years earlier, about the half-blood she could have fallen in love with, but who she gave up, to do what was expected of her. Was that worth it? He wants to ask.

‚ÄúCome find me in a week then,‚Äù he says eventually, when he can‚Äôt think of anything else. Out of the corner of his eye he sees Narcissa nod, straightening out her robes before heading towards the door.

‚ÄúDo you know why?‚Äù her voice causes him to jump‚Äîhe hadn‚Äôt been expecting her to speak again. Turning his head he finds she‚Äôs stopped at the door, eyes on his Patronus. He waits for her to explain herself but she doesn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúDo I know why, what?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy a stag.‚Äù

Regulus blinks before turning to the animal at his side. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, is there supposed to be a reason?‚Äù

Narcissa rolls her eyes like that‚Äôs the dumbest question she‚Äôs ever heard and Regulus would be annoyed if he weren‚Äôt kind of relieved to see her return to her normal snotty self.

‚ÄúOf course it means something‚Äîit‚Äôs meant to represent some part of you. But a stag? Big, brutish animal that goes crashing into things head first? It‚Äôs not clever or devious‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúIs that how you see me?‚Äù Regulus asks, mildly amused despite himself. ‚ÄúClever and devious?‚Äù

Narcissa arches her brow. ‚ÄúIs that not how you see yourself?‚Äù

Maybe, Regulus doesn‚Äôt really know. He does his best, most days, not to see himself at all. To disassociate. Pretend that he isn‚Äôt real. That none of it is real.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs strong though,‚Äù Regulus doesn‚Äôt know why he feels the need to defend his Patronus but he does. ‚ÄúAnd brave.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat are you a bloody Gryffindor?‚Äù

Regulus pulls a face that makes Narcissa laugh. ‚ÄúBoy after my own heart,‚Äù she says, laughter dying down and leaving them in silence once more.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù she says eventually, and far too earnestly for Regulus‚Äôs comfort. ‚ÄúReally.‚Äù

He nods. ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you next week?‚Äù

‚ÄúNext week.‚Äù

This time he watches her leave, the door closing poignantly behind her. He turns to his stag, finding its big, kind eyes already on him. His hand hovers on the top of his head‚Äînot resting but still touching.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why I have you,‚Äù he whispers, even though no one is around to hear. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm glad I do.‚Äù

It might be a trick of the light. But he swears he sees the stag smile.

Chapter End Notes

**Translations in order** : "Mon rayon de soleil" = My ray of sunshine
"Ne dit pas d√©sol√©" = Don't say sorry
"Non, mon chou, j'ai seulement besoin de toi" = No, my darling, I only need you

¬†

Oh, wow, hi, hey, hello there!

So I have no patience for writing things that I don't immediately find interesting and thus we have time travel. The future = more drama and more fun.

This chapter is a lot of setting up where they're at two years in the future so I promise there will be more action in the ones coming up. And yes, Regulus and James will meet again!

Thank you all as always, hope this wasn't too much of a shock (or disappointment) !

Chapter 43

Chapter Summary

I've missed you.

Chapter Notes

TW: Referenced child abuse
TW: Drinking
Tw: Violence

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I SIRIUS

Remus isn‚Äôt home when Sirius gets back from the Ministry. Selfishly, Sirius is angry about that. Not really at Remus, mostly just at the universe. It‚Äôs late afternoon and Sirius has an itch under his skin that won‚Äôt go away. He paces around their flat‚Äîactually starts doing chores if you can believe it‚Äîanything to keep his hands busy. His mind. He doesn‚Äôt finish any of them though‚Äîcan‚Äôt stick with one task for too long before the thoughts start crowding in.

When Sirius was a kid, before Hogwarts, before he had a wand, his mother used to lock him in his room sometimes. When he misbehaved. When she had guests over. When she was tired of him. Now, really, all things considered, that wasn‚Äôt so bad. His room was, like every room in Grimmauld Place, fairly large and decadent, in a creepy gothic kinda way. The problem was, sometimes she would leave him there for hours. He would try calling out for her. For his father. For Regulus‚Äîthough he would have been too young to be of any help anyways. But no one would ever answer.

Not knowing when he would be let out again. Thinking he‚Äôd been left, abandoned, forgotten. That‚Äôs what made the walls start to close in. What made his ribs strangle his lungs. Made his eyes sting. It‚Äôs not that Sirius can‚Äôt be alone. Of course he can. It‚Äôs just that on his bad days the silence and the emptiness start to eat at him. And some childish voice screams inside his head;

They‚Äôre never coming back.

They‚Äôre never coming back.

They‚Äôre never coming back for me.

He wants to go out but he knows that if he does he‚Äôll end up doing something stupid. End up drunk or arrested or both. It‚Äôs not that he minds really but then Remus will be angry with him and Sirius doesn‚Äôt want that right now. Doesn‚Äôt want to get his attention that way. He just wants him to be here. So he stands at the door, with his jacket and boots on, for a good ten minutes before growling and turning back into the flat.

The dishes are half-washed, the floor half-hoovered, the laundry half-dried. All his partial cleaning has left the place in a right state and none of it has bloody helped. Sirius feels like crawling up the goddamn walls‚Äîan army of ants living under his skin, driving him mad. Well, madder. He throws on some music, blasts it as loud as it will go. His fingers drum on every surface they can reach, feet tapping and legs bouncing.

It‚Äôs ten o‚Äôclock at night before he starts getting really worried. Before he stops being able to rationalize this. Because Remus is an eighty-year-old man in a twenty-year-old‚Äôs body and he never stays out this late. Hell, he barely stays awake this late, always falling asleep on Sirius‚Äôs shoulder or in his lap.

Sirius has been putting off calling James and Lily because he didn‚Äôt want to seem needy, or desperate or fucking controlling. As though he needs his boyfriend to be around all the time incase he has an emotional crisis. He was afraid that they would see in his eyes how much he‚Äôs struggling today, how much Walburga got to him even though he didn‚Äôt even fucking see her. Afraid they would take one look at him and go ‚Äúyup, yeah, Moody was right, he can‚Äôt handle this.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt give a fuck anymore though. They can see whatever they like. His moony is missing. And he‚Äôs scared.

‚ÄúPads?‚Äù James answers. He looks tired.

‚ÄúHey, uh‚Äîis Rem there? With Lily or you or something?‚Äù

James blinks, waking up a little. ‚ÄúNo, I haven‚Äôt seen him since this morning.‚Äù

Something icy drips down Sirius‚Äôs spine. ‚ÄúCan you ask Lily if she‚Äôs heard from him?‚Äù

James nods, turning his head over his shoulder; ‚ÄúLily, can you c‚Äômere?‚Äù James shouts before turning back to Sirius. ‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt come back?‚Äù

‚ÄúBack?‚Äù he‚Äôs currently doing his best to keep his breathing at a regular pace.

‚ÄúHe was meeting with Dumbledore.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù Sirius knew that, because Remus always tells him where he‚Äôs going and what he‚Äôs doing and Sirius never remembers and never returns the favour because he‚Äôs a selfish asshole.

James looks like he‚Äôs about to say something else but at that moment Lily‚Äôs voice cuts in; ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs up‚Äîoh, hey,‚Äù and then she‚Äôs kneeling down, the smile slipping from her face when she takes in Sirius‚Äôs expression.

‚ÄúHave you heard from Remus today?‚Äù James asks her, not wasting time. To her credit Lily looks only mildly surprised by the question.

‚ÄúNo, not all day, why?‚Äù

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù Sirius curses before he can stop himself.

Her eyes are back on him, flooded with concern. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs going on?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo ones seen him since he Flooed this morning,‚Äù James explains. ‚ÄúHey Pads, did you call Peter?‚Äù

Sirius swallows around the rock in his throat. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay, you do that and we‚Äôll call Marlene and Dorcas, see if they‚Äôve heard anything. Then we‚Äôll come over, alright?‚Äù

He nods numbly, hating the new feeling of foreboding building in his stomach. People go missing almost every day now, what if‚Äî

‚ÄúSirius,‚Äù James‚Äôs voice brings him back, his gaze intense even through the fire. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to find him. He‚Äôs going to be okay.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Sirius says, because he‚Äôs not about to argue.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see you soon.‚Äù

Sirius takes a deep breath, shaking on the exhale. He needs to get it together, they don‚Äôt even know that anything is wrong yet. He‚Äôs freaking out for no reason. It‚Äôs because of his mother, she put him on edge‚Äîset him off‚Äîeverything is too much right now.

He breathes in and out a few more times before calling Peter.

Nobody answers.

He tries again.

Nobody answers.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck Peter!‚Äù he shouts at the empty fireplace. ‚ÄúWhere the fuck are you?‚Äù

He hears a knock on the door and jumps even though he knows it‚Äôs James and Lily. They have anti-Apparation charms on the apartment because, well, safety. It had been Remus‚Äôs idea, of course.

‚ÄúPeter isn‚Äôt answering his bloody Floo,‚Äù Sirius says as he throws open the door.

James frowns, walking in with Lily right behind him, she squeezes Sirius‚Äôs arm as she passes.

‚ÄúMarlene and Dorcas were there but they haven‚Äôt seen Remus since last night,‚Äù James says flatly.

Part of Sirius isn‚Äôt even sure this is real. Maybe he‚Äôs having some kind of psychotic break and this is all a delusion. Because the thought that something terrible has happened to Remus, and he‚Äôs just been here, fidgeting in their flat, being useless, it makes him want to tear himself in half.

‚ÄúFuck it, I‚Äôm going to Hogwarts,‚Äù he grabs his jacket, half-expecting one of them to protest. To tell him it‚Äôs too late, to wait until morning. He doesn‚Äôt find it comforting when neither of them do. It means they don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs overreacting.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll stay here,‚Äù Lily says as Sirius shoves on his boots. ‚ÄúIn case he Floos or comes back.‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúKeep trying Peter yeah? He‚Äôll want to know,‚Äù she nods as he kisses her on the cheek, meeting Sirius at the front door.

‚ÄúYou can stay too you know,‚Äù Sirius says, doesn‚Äôt even know why because he doesn‚Äôt mean it. If people close to him are going missing he doesn‚Äôt want to let James out of his sight.

Luckily the other boy just rolls his eyes, shoving Sirius into the stairwell outside. ‚ÄúCome on, we‚Äôll Apparate to Hogsmeade and walk from there.‚Äù

¬†

He can‚Äôt remember the last thing he said to Remus. That‚Äôs what he keeps thinking as they half-sprint up to the castle. It‚Äôs nearly pitch black and neither James nor Sirius seem to feel much like talking. So he thinks. Wracks his brain for the answer. He‚Äôd been upset after reading Moody‚Äôs owl‚Äîupset maybe isn‚Äôt the right word‚Äîhe‚Äôd lost it. Honestly he‚Äôd probably still been drunk.

Remus had watched him, standing there in the middle of the living room, still in his boxers, no shirt, a pair of socks that were too big for him‚Äîprobably Sirius‚Äôs. Watched as Sirius ranted, and paced, and threw things around, haphazardly getting dressed. He can‚Äôt remember what he‚Äôd been saying, but he knows that Remus was there, looking tired and rumpled and worried.

I love you.

Remus had definitely said that, just as Sirius had stepped out the door.

I love you.

But Sirius isn‚Äôt sure if he said it back‚Äîhe must have? Right? Just habit if nothing else. There‚Äôs no way he wouldn‚Äôt have. Something painful twists his stomach and Sirius has to bite his tongue to keep a pitiful whine from leaving his mouth. But even if he didn‚Äôt‚Äîif in his stupid, half-drunk, frantic state, he didn‚Äôt say it back, Remus knows, doesn‚Äôt he? Remus has to know.

‚ÄúWhat the hell is this?‚Äù Filch‚Äîof course it‚Äôs Filch‚Äîgreets them at the front doors, only opening them a crack.

‚ÄúMove,‚Äù Sirius snaps. Dumbledore has given them clearance, has made sure that the wards protecting the school will let them in‚Äîfor Order business and so forth. Filch knows this, of course, he‚Äôs just being a fucking dickhead about it.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt just come marching in here!‚Äù the old caretaker says indignantly.

‚ÄúWatch me,‚Äù Sirius wedges his foot between the door and the wall and uses his shoulder to throw it open, sending the old man sprawling onto his back.

‚ÄúHow dare you! Dumbledore will hear of this‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI sure fucking hope so, since he‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre here,‚Äù he hears James behind him as he takes off in the direction of the headmaster‚Äôs office.

Sirius has been back to Hogwarts a few times since graduating but it never feels less jarring. This place that used to belong to him, that held so much of his life, is now foreign‚Äîfilled with faces he doesn‚Äôt recognize and rooms that feel slightly off. A desk that wasn‚Äôt there before, a new portrait on the walls, a suit of armour moved. Part of him is jealous, in a lot of ways Hogwarts was the first home he ever had and he doesn‚Äôt want some other sticky fingered brat getting his hands all over it‚Äîcarving his name into the walls. But he can‚Äôt stop it. Time goes on. It replaces us.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù Sirius says when he gets to the ugly gargoyle at the entrance to Dumbledore‚Äôs rooms. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the password, I can‚Äôt remember?‚Äù

‚ÄúLiquorice toffee.‚Äù

Immediately the stone groans, turning over to allow them access to the stairway behind. Without a word they start up, Sirius taking the stairs two at a time. He doesn't bother knocking on the doors to the headmaster‚Äôs office, throwing them open with such force that they slam into the walls on the other side.

Part of him, the naive, desperate part, is hoping that he‚Äôll walk in on Remus and Dumbledore having tea or something. Remus‚Äôs soft eyes will lift up, brow wrinkling in confusion under his blonde fringe which really is getting too long. ‚ÄòOh,‚Äô he‚Äôll say, ‚Äòis that the time? Sorry, we got carried away.‚Äô

And Sirius will be so angry with him. He‚Äôll be fucking furious. But mostly he‚Äôll walk over and get him in his arms and promise to put a fucking tracking spell on him and Remus will laugh and kiss the top of Sirius‚Äôs head and tell him he‚Äôs sorry and Sirius will forgive him. Because of course he will.

That isn‚Äôt what happens.

Instead Sirius storms into a dimly lit office‚Äîonly a few candles, the fireplace burning low‚Äîto find Albus Dumbledore in a midnight blue bathrobe with scattered stars sparkling across it. For a moment the sight of him just standing there, waiting for them, causing Sirius to lose his footing a little.

‚ÄúThe wards?‚Äù James speaks first, framing the words as a question though Sirius doesn‚Äôt quite understand what he‚Äôs asking until Dumbledore answers.

‚ÄúThey let me know you were on your way, yes,‚Äù the old man smiles. ‚ÄúI do believe that I told you two you were free to visit whenever you wanted, but this does seem a bit extreme.‚Äù

Sirius feels himself wake up. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs Remus?‚Äù he demands, without any preamble. He has no interest in social niceties right now.

Dumbledore arches his brow. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure I understand the question.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe fuck you don‚Äôt,‚Äù Sirius snarls. ‚ÄúYou met with him this morning and no ones seen him since, so where the hell is he?‚Äù

Dumbledore‚Äôs expression remains impassive. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid this isn‚Äôt a conversation I can have.‚Äù

The fear is a physical presence in Sirius‚Äôs chest, pressing against his ribs, begging to eat him alive. ‚ÄúWhat does that mean? What do you mean you can‚Äôt have this conversation?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou look tired Sirius,‚Äù Dumbledore says instead of answering. ‚ÄúYou should go home. Perhaps return in the morning?‚Äù

Dumbledore starts towards the door at the back of his office, the one that Sirius assumes leads to his private rooms.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you dare, don‚Äôt you fucking dare,‚Äù he steps forward but James instantly grabs his arm, pulling him back.

‚ÄúProfessor,‚Äù James says, ever the boy scout. ‚ÄúPlease. We just need to know something. Anything. Are you‚Äîyou did send him somewhere didn‚Äôt you? Can you at least tell us that? That he hasn‚Äôt just gone missing?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a long pause, Dumbledore turning back to face them, gaze drifting from James to Sirius. Sirius doesn‚Äôt like the way the old man scrutinizes him, it feels like the way new Order members look at him when they find out he‚Äôs a Black. Like he‚Äôs something dirty.

‚ÄúMr. Lupin is not missing.‚Äù

Sirius feels James exhale a sigh of relief behind him but it‚Äôs not enough for Sirius. Not nearly enough.

‚ÄúWhen will he be back?‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat is he doing?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs doing me a favour.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhere?‚Äù

Dumbledore sighs, though he doesn‚Äôt sound annoyed, more patronizing. ‚ÄúGo home Sirius.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a child!‚Äù he shouts at the old man‚Äôs retreating back, sounding, regrettably, very much like a child.

Dumbledore ignores him. ‚ÄúThe Floo is open,‚Äù he gestures to his dwindling fire. ‚ÄúFeel free to use it.‚Äù The door closes behind Dumbledore with some finality.

James‚Äôs hand is still on Sirius‚Äôs arm, holding him back, always keeping him from starting the fights he can‚Äôt finish. Normally Sirius is grateful, but right now he reckons it would feel good to be beaten. To be battered and broken. To have fought for this.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù James says eventually, nudging him towards the fireplace. ‚ÄúLets go.‚Äù

Sirius is reluctant to leave, like he thinks that Remus will suddenly appear‚Äîpop out from behind the furniture. It‚Äôs stupid, so eventually he lets James shove him into the embers, muttering his address as the flames swallow him whole.

‚ÄúDid you get to Dumbledore? What did he say?‚Äù Lily asks as James stumbles out of the fireplace moments after Sirius. Sirius walks passed her, placing his palms flat on the back wall and hanging his head, trying to breathe. To keep himself in check.

‚ÄúRemus is on Order business,‚Äù James says.

‚ÄúOrder business? And he didn‚Äôt bother to tell any of us?‚Äù

That question makes everything inside of Sirius shrink and wither and want to die. Remus hadn‚Äôt bothered to leave a note. To send an owl or a Patronus or fucking anything. He must have known what this would do to Sirius‚Äîwhat it would be like for him to come home to an empty flat.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to imagine he had to leave immediately,‚Äù James says reasonably, and Sirius appreciates the unimpressed scoff that earns from Lily.

‚ÄúAnd Dumbledore? What the hell is his excuse?‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù James admits, ‚ÄúHe was being cagey, didn‚Äôt want to say anything in front of us, like he thought we were being listened to or something. It was‚Ä¶weird.‚Äù

‚ÄúListened to?‚Äù

Sirius's nails dig into the plaster. ‚ÄúHe doesn‚Äôt trust me,‚Äù he says, voice wavering.

‚ÄúOf course he trusts you,‚Äù Lily sounds confident and indignant in equal measure. But she must see something on James‚Äôs face because the next thing she says is; ‚ÄúWhat reason could he possibly have for not trusting Sirius?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou saw it too then?‚Äù Sirius asks, still staring at the floor, eyes trained on his feet.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James repeats after a short pause. ‚ÄúYeah, I saw it too.‚Äù

Sirius grits his teeth. He‚Äôs going to lose it. Any second he‚Äôs going to lose it.

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú Lily starts, sounding like she‚Äôs stepping towards him, which is a bad fucking idea right now.

‚ÄúHey, babe, uh‚ÄîI‚Äôll meet you at home okay?‚Äù James cuts her off.

There‚Äôs an extended silence during which Sirius can only imagine that they‚Äôre communicating with their eyes. It‚Äôs one of the few very coupley things they do‚Äîbecoming all telepathic. He‚Äôd be mocking them right now if he didn‚Äôt feel like his chest was about to explode.

‚ÄúYeah okay,‚Äù Lily says finally. ‚ÄúGoodnight Sirius I‚Äîcome over tomorrow.‚Äù

He nods and after a few seconds hears the hissing of the fire as she steps through.

James doesn‚Äôt try to say anything.

Doesn‚Äôt try to come any closer.

He knows better.

‚ÄúDo you think he told Remus he couldn‚Äôt trust me?‚Äù

‚ÄúPads‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúDo you think that‚Äôs why he disappeared without a fucking word?‚Äù his voice cracks and suddenly he can‚Äôt hold it in anymore.

He grabs the picture hanging by his head, ripping it off the wall and sending it smashing to the floor across the room. He goes after the bookshelf next, sending it careening towards the ground, several of Remus‚Äôs books flying out. The coffee table loses all its contents‚Äîa forgotten glass smashing on the floor, several magazines scattering around, a few more picture frames torn from the walls before Sirius finally stops, standing in the middle of the room, breathing heavy, his vision blurred.

For a moment he thinks James has left, leaving Sirius to throw his little temper tantrum in private, but then the floorboards creek and James is stepping forward. He wraps Sirius in his arms and Sirius wants to snap at him for it, wants to push him away and insist that he doesn‚Äôt need this‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt need anyone. But if that‚Äôs ever been true‚Äîand he isn‚Äôt sure that it has‚Äîit certainly isn‚Äôt now. He deflates in his best friend‚Äôs arms, tears coming unwanted to his eyes.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs supposed to be mine,‚Äù Sirius whispers. Pathetic and childish. Both not what he means and exactly what he wants to say all at once. He thinks James will call him on it‚Äîon being possessive or insecure, both of which would be true‚Äîbut he doesn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúHe is,‚Äù James says. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll come back Sirius, he‚Äôll be okay and he‚Äôll come back, but here or not, he‚Äôs still yours.‚Äù He pauses, and then: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen the way he looks at you.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh fuck off,‚Äù Sirius says thickly.

‚ÄúNo way, if I have to stomach seeing it you have to hear it, you have to know. Whatever the hell is going on with Dumbledore, there‚Äôs nothing he could say that would take Remus away from you.‚Äù

Neither of them point out that that is, actually, exactly what he did.

‚ÄúAlright,‚Äù James sighs as the pair of them pull apart, taking in the chaos surrounding them. ‚ÄúLets clean this up so we can go to bed, I‚Äôm fucking exhausted.‚Äù

Sirius looks over at him, startled. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre staying?‚Äù

‚ÄúObviously,‚Äù he says, like it‚Äôs nothing. A given. That James would never let Sirius be alone. And the truth is that he hasn‚Äôt been alone, not since he took a train at eleven years old and sat beside some specky kid with a smile about ten times too big for his face and a laugh that made Sirius want to be near him.

It‚Äôs been a long time since Sirius was a little boy trapped alone in his room, wondering if he‚Äôd been forgotten. If anyone was going to come back for him.

Because James always comes.

Always.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù Sirius finds himself blurting out, startling James if his expression is anything to go by. There‚Äôs a moment of silence before James reaches over and squeezes his shoulder.

‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù and then; ‚ÄúNow, help me with this bookshelf yeah?‚Äù James shoots him a small grin as he nods his head at the furniture in question.

Sirius swallows around the lump in his throat. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he manages. ‚ÄúYeah okay.‚Äù

¬†

PART II REGULUS

‚ÄúHey buddy!‚Äù

Regulus looks up at the sound of Evan‚Äôs voice only to find he isn‚Äôt talking to him, but to his Patronus. Regulus snorts as he watches his friend awkwardly try to pet the phantom stag. Evan is the only one who doesn‚Äôt seem to mind Regulus‚Äôs new obsession.

‚ÄúDo you think he would fetch my wand if I threw it?‚Äù Evan asks.

They‚Äôre in what was once the cellar of Grimmauld Place and is now a fully operational potions lab. Somehow, Regulus has found himself acting as the Dark Lord‚Äôs pharmacist. Blood replenishers? Truth serums? Poisons? Polyjuice? Regulus brews all of it. It started as an accident really, he just‚Ä¶knew how to‚Ä¶and now it‚Äôs somehow turned into a near full-time occupation.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a stag not a dog,‚Äù Regulus says, peering into one of the three cauldrons currently boiling in front of him.

It‚Äôs not a particularly important position, not high ranking, not sought after. Bellatrix has taken to calling him ‚Äúthe cook‚Äù. But the truth is, Regulus likes it. He likes using his brain. Likes being left alone. Likes not seeing the faces of the people he helps kill.

‚ÄúHe needs a name,‚Äù Evan goes on, unperturbed.

Regulus rolls his eyes, moving on to the next potion, he stirs it a few times before deciding it needs more mint. ‚ÄúCerci‚Äôs already named him,‚Äù he grumbles, because quite frankly, he thinks naming his Patronus is going just a step too far. Evan, on the other hand, seems absolutely tickled by the idea.

‚ÄúNo way? Greengrass? Go on then, what‚Äôd she name him?‚Äù

Regulus sighs, resigned. ‚ÄúBoo.‚Äù

‚ÄúAhhh!‚Äù

Regulus snorts. ‚ÄúNo, she named him Boo.‚Äù

Evan‚Äôs brow furrows. ‚ÄúBoo?‚Äù

‚ÄúBoo.‚Äù

‚ÄúLike B-O-O?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe very same.‚Äù

‚ÄúHuh,‚Äù Evan turns back to the stag, scratching behind his ear with a little too much force, sending his hand right through his head. ‚ÄúWhoops‚Äîsorry there Boo,‚Äù he laughs. ‚ÄúYou know what? She might be on to something. It kinda works. Hey Boo!‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre ridiculous,‚Äù Regulus says, though he doesn‚Äôt quite manage to keep the fondness out of his voice.

‚ÄúSo I‚Äôve been told. Hey, why Boo though? Did she say?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Regulus drops the crushed herbs into his potion and watches it sizzle and turn a beautiful shade of amber, just like he wanted. ‚ÄúShe said it‚Äôs because he‚Äôs a ghost.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù Evan says wisely. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a smart one that Greengrass.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe is.‚Äù

Regulus continues to stir his cauldron as Evan walks over and plops himself down on the only available stool. Regulus doesn‚Äôt tend to sit much when he‚Äôs brewing, especially since he‚Äôs always working on more than one thing at a time these days.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs your mum doing then?‚Äù Evan asks.

Regulus shrugs without turning around to face him. ‚ÄúFine, I‚Äôd imagine. Back in Scotland, no charges, though they are placing her under surveillance.‚Äù

‚ÄúDid they tell her that?‚Äù Evan asks.

‚ÄúNo, I think that would rather defeat the point. Though they‚Äôre not very subtle about it so they might as well have. Monitoring this house too‚Äîor they would be if they could find it.‚Äù

‚ÄúMmm, mmm,‚Äù Evan says happily. ‚ÄúGotta love that old house magic‚Äîno bloody Ministry cronies are ever gonna find this place.‚Äù

Before Regulus can respond the door to the cellar bangs open and there is the unmistakable sound of Barty stomping down the stairs. Regulus looks at Evan, brow arched.

‚ÄúSpeak of the Devil and he shall appear.‚Äù

Evan stifles a laugh as Barty walks in in his Ministry robes, hurling his suitcase across the room and collapsing onto the floor, back pressed to the wall. ‚ÄúI swear to Slytherin if my father makes me file one more goddamn report I will lose it. Fuck being a double agent, I will Avada the entire Ministry.‚Äù

‚ÄúSeems a bit extreme that,‚Äù Evan says nonchalantly. In fairness, Barty goes on almost this exact rant at least once a week. The Dark Lord decided that he would be most useful if his connection to the cause remained unknown, especially to his father. Which is how he‚Äôs ended up working a desk job.

‚ÄúWell it‚Äôs the plan anyway isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù Barty grumbles. ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt we just get on with it already?‚Äù

‚ÄúI reckon we‚Äôre hoping we won‚Äôt have to kill ALL of them. At least some ought to convert over, don‚Äôt you think Reg?‚Äù

Regulus offers a noncommittal grunt in response, back to fiddling with his potions‚Äîone of which being the fertility potion he promised Narcissa. It‚Äôs nearly ready.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know why,‚Äù Barty goes on. ‚ÄúBunch of pansy blood traitors, what the hell do we need them for?‚Äù

‚ÄúDunno,‚Äù Evan muses. ‚ÄúChores probably.‚Äù

That actually gets a laugh out of Barty. ‚ÄúYeah alright, fair enough‚Äîagh.‚Äù Regulus looks over his shoulder to see his Patronus pawing at Barty‚Äôs feet. ‚ÄúFuck Reg, is that thing really necessary?‚Äù he inches away from it, eyeing it with distrust.

‚ÄúExcuse you Barty, he has a name,‚Äù Evan says with mock outrage.

Oh here we go.

Barty looks thoroughly unimpressed by this. ‚ÄúA name?‚Äù

‚ÄúYup. It‚Äôs Boo.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou named it Boo?‚Äù he turns an outraged face on Regulus, as though he can‚Äôt believe he‚Äôd ever have such poor taste. But Regulus only holds up his hands in a show of innocence.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt look at me. I didn‚Äôt name him anything.‚Äù

Barty swings his gaze back to Evan.

‚ÄúNah, wish it was me. It was Greengrass.‚Äù

‚ÄúCerci Greengrass?‚Äù Regulus does not trust the new interest in Barty‚Äôs voice.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt start,‚Äù he warns as he goes back to chopping.

‚ÄúStart what? I‚Äôm not starting anything. I just wanna know if you‚Äôre finally willing to admit you‚Äôre fucking her?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve told you a hundred times,‚Äù Regulus says as he scrapes his minced newt eyes into a small bowl. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre just friends.‚Äù

‚ÄúMate, she named your bloody Patronus.‚Äù

‚ÄúWithout my permission!‚Äù

‚ÄúListen, it‚Äôs nothing to be ashamed of. She‚Äôs not bad looking really, I mean, a bit odd, but as along as her mouth works‚Äî‚Äú

Regulus‚Äôs hand freezes, still wrapped around a knife. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna need you to shut-up now.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat? I‚Äôm just‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúBarty, I think what our gentlemanly comrade here is trying to say, is that he‚Äôs not one to screw and tell,‚Äù Evan butts in before Barty can dig himself a deeper hole.

Barty rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúWhatever. Don‚Äôt see why he has to be such a fucking dweeb about it.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm right here,‚Äù Regulus says flatly.

Barty fixes him with a look before clearing his throat. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand why YOU have to be such a fucking dweeb about it. Better?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know what I think your problem is Bartholomew?‚Äù

Barty glares at Evan. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not my name.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot sure Bartemius is better,‚Äù Regulus says under his breath.

‚ÄúYour problem,‚Äù Evan goes on, loud enough that neither of the other boys can talk over him, ‚Äúis that you need to get laid.‚Äù

Barty‚Äôs expression only sours further. ‚ÄúFuck you.‚Äù

‚ÄúStill not my type.‚Äù

‚ÄúJesus Christ Evan!‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying,‚Äù Evan goes on, undeterred. ‚ÄúWe should go out,‚Äù he looks between Regulus and Barty, neither of whom seem overly excited by this idea. ‚ÄúLads night, c‚Äômon, we‚Äôre young, and hot, and horny.‚Äù

‚ÄúJesus CHRIST Evan,‚Äù Barty repeats, and Regulus finds himself agreeing.

‚ÄúThink about it okay?‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI know this great place, it‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù A voice calls down from above, causing all three of them to swivel towards the staircase. Light beams in from the open door. ‚ÄúMeeting‚Äôs starting, move your asses.‚Äù Whoever it is‚ÄîRegulus never has any idea who the hell is in this house‚Äîthey don‚Äôt wait for an answer, the sound of the cellar door slamming shut echoing down the stairs before any of them say a word.

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Evan claps his hands together as he gets to his feet. ‚ÄúDuty calls I suppose.‚Äù While he helps Barty up Regulus takes care of his potions‚Äîcasting a Stasis charm over one of them and setting the other two to simmer.

When they emerge on the main floor they are immediately carried off by the stream of people heading for the dining room. Salmon swimming upstream. There‚Äôs no telling exactly how many will turn up when the Dark Lord calls. Most are busy‚Äîthose like Barty who are still pretending to be on the other side can‚Äôt be disappearing all the time, and several people have been sent off to other countries on recruiting missions. Still, there are certainly constants: Bella, Rodolphus, Rabastan, Lucius‚Äîwhen she was still in the city Walburga never missed a meeting, but now she‚Äôs rarely in attendance. Regulus is always present. Partially because it‚Äôs his house and partially because he rarely goes out anymore, except to visit his parents. Evan and Barty are usually there too, along with Snape, Mulciber, and Avery‚Äîall too new not to do everything in their power to show their devotion to the Dark Lord.

They file into the large, uninviting room. Regulus recognizes most faces but not all of them. He isn‚Äôt sure if that‚Äôs the result of polyjuice or if they are genuinely new people. He also doesn‚Äôt care.

‚ÄúHey-o Sevy,‚Äù Evan says as he sits next to Snape for some godforsaken reason.

‚ÄúRosier,‚Äù Snape says. He‚Äôs looking a little rough around the edges, not that he ever looked anything else, but it‚Äôs clear that servicing his Lord is weighing on him‚Äîhair grown out nearly passed his shoulders, bags underneath his eyes, skin pale.

‚ÄúHaven‚Äôt seen you around recently, where you been?‚Äù Evan still sounds chipper even though his eyes are sharp. That‚Äôs the thing about Evan. He wants you to underestimate him.

Snape‚Äôs beady eyes stare back at him. ‚ÄúAbove your pay grade I expect.‚Äù

Evan laughs, big and boisterous. ‚ÄúDo you get a salary Sevy? Is the Dark Lord paying your rent? How very working class of you.‚Äù

Regulus thinks he can see the muscles twitching in Snape‚Äôs jaw. His eyes sweep Evan up and down, disgust clear on his face. ‚ÄúBe careful Rosier. I have made myself indispensable. You and your friends,‚Äù at this his eyes flick to Regulus, ‚Äúhave not.‚Äù

If Regulus was the type to care about rank he might be offended. But as it is, he simply meets Snape‚Äôs gaze, staring blankly back at him.

‚ÄúAw cute,‚Äù Evan says as he tilts his head to the side. ‚ÄúYou see Severus, some of us don‚Äôt need to prove our worth,‚Äù he leans slightly closer to the greasy black haired prick. ‚ÄúSome of us have it running through our veins,‚Äù Evan smiles then. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a half-blood right?‚Äù

Several emotions flicker across Snape‚Äôs face and Regulus is almost positive that Evan is about to get punched but before the situation can escalate any further the doors to the dining room are once again thrown open and all talking ceases.

The room feels colder, but Regulus isn‚Äôt sure if that‚Äôs real or just in his head, as he watches the figure of the Dark Lord take his seat at the end of the table. Now that he can see his face Regulus finds himself surprised by the Dark Lord‚Äôs appearance. His skin is sallow, hair thin, and something about the rest of him‚Äîblurry is the only way Regulus can think to describe it.

‚ÄúDoes he look off to you?‚Äù he whispers under his breath.

Evan gives him an amused look. ‚ÄúYou calling the Dark Lord ugly?‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes, letting the subject drop, though he can‚Äôt quiet the feeling of unease in his stomach. Because the Dark Lord doesn‚Äôt look sick, that isn‚Äôt right, it‚Äôs something else. Something Regulus can‚Äôt quite put his finger on.

Voldemort smiles at his followers, opening his arms. ‚ÄúWelcome my comrades, what a joy to see so many faces here, your loyalty and commitment are valued. Now, shall we begin?‚Äù

Largely, meetings like this are rather dull. A lot of the everyday minutia of staging a coup‚Äîscheduling, finances, inventory. What do they have? What do they need? What have they accomplished since the last meeting? Because Regulus spends all of his time in the cellar brewing potions most of it doesn‚Äôt apply to him. So instead he takes stock of who‚Äôs in attendance, of how frequently they come, who they sit with, talk to, who the Dark Lord pays more attention to. Then afterwards he scribbles it all down in his journal. Collecting information like this makes him feel like he still has some sort of control. That he isn‚Äôt just blindly following along. Even though it‚Äôs not like he has any plans to do anything. He‚Äôs not really that kind of person. The kind who acts.

It‚Äôs the mention of his mother‚Äôs name that snaps Regulus back to attention.

‚ÄúAfter what happened to Walburga we have to be more strategic about how we get our supplies,‚Äù Lucius is saying. ‚ÄúNo one at this table is able to just walk into Knockturn unnoticed. Thanks to Moody the Aurors are watching us like hawks and arresting us on any charge.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat does it matter?‚Äù asks some man Regulus doesn‚Äôt recognize, he has a monocle and a goatee that‚Äôs so long it disappears below the table. ‚ÄúWe have control of Azkaban, even if they‚Äôre able to charge us, which is doubtful, they can‚Äôt hold us.‚Äù

A grumbling of agreement circulates around the room causing Lucius‚Äôs gaze to narrow. He clearly does not appreciate being questioned.

‚ÄúEvery time they arrest us our goods are confiscated. Free or not, we are running low on important supplies.‚Äù

There are more grumblings, a few people spit out curses‚Äîmost about the Aurors generally, some about Alastor Moody specifically. The Dark Lord merely nods his head. ‚ÄúAnd what is your solution Lucius?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe raid the stores at night. Take what we need in one go and without being seen.‚Äù

A few people slam their hands on the tabletop to show their support, but most watch the Dark Lord, waiting for his reaction before they express themselves either way.

‚ÄúMy source tells me that they‚Äôre expecting us to make a move just like that,‚Äù he says finally.

Evan, Regulus and Barty all make eye contact, smirking at one another. It‚Äôs become something of an inside joke, the Dark Lord‚Äôs ‚Äúsource‚Äù. If something unexplained happens‚Äîif the floorboards creak or the wind slams the doors, they all look at one another and say ‚Äúthe source‚Äù ‚Äúit was the source‚Äù. The Dark Lord has been mentioning the illusive ‚Äúsource‚Äù for weeks now, but as far as Regulus knows no one has any idea who it is, just that they‚Äôre in the Order of the Phoenix.

‚ÄúThe Aurors are expecting this?‚Äù Lucius asks eventually, looking surprised. ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt heard‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThe Order is expecting this,‚Äù the Dark Lord cuts him off. ‚ÄúThey know that the Aurors are making it more difficult for us to purchase our supplies so they‚Äôve set up guard posts in Knockturn Alley,‚Äù the Dark Lord smiles then, at the look of dejection on Lucius‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúNo need to look so morose Lucius. You‚Äôre right, we cannot continue to operate as individuals, we must behave as a team. An army. The Order may be guarding supplies but they aren‚Äôt expecting a fight, they think they‚Äôll be faced with one of us, maybe two, and they‚Äôre spread thin, trying to cover all their bases. So we‚Äôll send in a team, wipe out their pathetic guard with ease, and take what we need.‚Äù

Now the banging is deafening as nearly every member starts slamming their hands on the table in support. In excitement.

‚ÄúDolohov," The Dark Lord turns to the brutish man on his right. "I want you to lead it, with Yaxley, Crabbe, Lee, Snyde,‚Äù there‚Äôs a brief pause, ‚Äúand Black.‚Äù

Regulus feels his whole body go stiff, almost certain he‚Äôs misheard, he can feel every head turn in his direction. He‚Äôs never been sent out on a mission before. Thankfully, he has enough presence of mind to hold back the ‚ÄúMe?‚Äù that‚Äôs dancing on his tongue. But the Dark Lord goes on like he knows exactly what‚Äôs happening inside Regulus‚Äôs head.

‚ÄúI want someone there who knows what we need, who can identify ingredients.‚Äù

Regulus knows everyone is waiting for him to speak but his throat feels impossibly tight all of a sudden. Barty kicks him under the table and Regulus finally manages to swallow.

‚ÄúYes my lord,‚Äù he croaks. ‚ÄúIt will be my honour.‚Äù

The Dark Lord smiles. ‚ÄúExcellent, that‚Äôs what I wanted to hear.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs head is spinning as the meeting moves on to other topics. Words fly about the room but he doesn‚Äôt register them until Evan leans over and whispers in his ear.

‚ÄúWe are so getting wasted tonight.‚Äù

¬†

Regulus is still in a daze when the meeting ends. That‚Äôs the only way he can explain the fact that he doesn‚Äôt put up a fight when Evan drags him and Barty from the house and Apparates them to some grimy club in the middle of London.

It‚Äôs magic, the club, covered in spells to repel Muggles and draw in Wizards. It‚Äôs only as Evan is shoving him into a black leather booth that Regulus realizes he‚Äôs never been to a club before. He hates it about as much as he always imagined he would. There are too many people, they push up against him, sweat on him, touch and grab without permission.

He sees a pair of girls with charmed wings on their backs, belligerently flapping people in the face, and a man who‚Äôs clearly taken a growth potion to make himself taller but overshot and now towers above the crowd at what must be nearly eight feet. It might not be a potion of course, he might be part giant, but Regulus doesn‚Äôt think his bone structure looks right.

He blinks as Evan drops into the seat across from him, noticing, for the first time, that Barty isn‚Äôt with them anymore. Evan slides a condensation covered glass towards him and as if reading his mind says; ‚ÄúOver there, caught her on the way in.‚Äù

Regulus follows his gaze and finds Barty entangled with a blue haired girl on the dance floor. That was fast.

‚ÄúMaybe he actually will get laid,‚Äù Regulus says flatly, earning him a laugh from Evan as he raises his own glass.

‚ÄúCome on, cheers me.‚Äù

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

Evan makes a big show of rolling his eyes. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre celebrating, obviously, you‚Äôre going on your first mission!‚Äù he puts on a voice; ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been so proud.‚Äù

Something squirms in Regulus‚Äôs stomach. ‚ÄúOh,‚Äù he says tightly, clinking his glass against Evan‚Äôs and taking a swallow of the painfully sweet liquid inside.

Evan smiles. ‚ÄúNot a cocktail man eh?‚Äù

Regulus makes a face. ‚ÄúWhat the fuck is in this?‚Äù

‚ÄúBeats me, it‚Äôll get you blitzed though.‚Äù

Regulus only shakes his head, looking back out at the crowd. He doesn‚Äôt recognize the music‚Äîisn‚Äôt even sure if it is music‚Äîit‚Äôs so loud it sounds like the speakers have blown out, it‚Äôs just noise now, with a vague beat underneath.

‚ÄúYou come here a lot?‚Äù Regulus finally asks.

Evan shrugs. ‚ÄúEvery once and a while, when I need to blow off steam.‚Äù

Regulus can‚Äôt really understand how coming to this place could feel cathartic to anyone, but then, Evan is a special sort.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs the girlfriend?‚Äù Regulus pushes, mostly because he needs to focus on something other than the pulsing headache he can feel building behind his eyes.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs fine,‚Äù Evan says.

‚ÄúShe okay with you coming here?‚Äù If nothing else, his father will appreciate hearing about Evan‚Äôs relationship drama when he goes to visit him tomorrow.

‚ÄúNever said we were exclusive,‚Äù Evan sends him a smirk but Regulus only stares skeptically back at him.

‚ÄúDoes SHE know you‚Äôre not exclusive?‚Äù

Anyone else would get angry but Evan only laughs. ‚ÄúOh come on Reg, give a man a break yeah? What are you, the relationship expert?‚Äù

There are small flashes‚Äîa hidden room, warm hands and mouths and too many promises‚ÄîRegulus looks away. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

They sit in silence for a while, watching the club move around them. If nothing else, this place is certainly excellent for people watching. Of course, eventually Regulus finds his eyes lingering a little too long on a good looking man by the bar. He‚Äôs probably got an inch or two on Regulus, floppy brown hair, big smile. Regulus isn‚Äôt really thinking about why he‚Äôs lingered on this particular person until their eyes meet and something sparks low in his stomach.

It‚Äôs been a long time since anyone‚Äôs looked at him like that.

‚ÄúYou could go over and talk to him you know?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs head snaps towards Evan so fast he feels a sharp pain lancing through his neck. The panic is immediate. Years in the making.

‚ÄúAw come on Reg, don‚Äôt look at me like that,‚Äù Evan says. Regulus has no idea how he‚Äôs looking at Evan or if it properly conveys the icy fear currently crawling up his spine. He‚Äôs been so careful, his whole life he‚Äôs been so careful. Not that there‚Äôs been much to be careful about‚Äînot for a long time. He doesn‚Äôt understand what he did to give himself away.

Evan sighs, leaning slightly closer so that he can lower his voice, not that anyone could hear him over the noise in this place anyway. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been friends since we were‚Äîwhat? Seven? Eight?‚Äù When Regulus doesn‚Äôt react he pushes on. ‚ÄúI know when you‚Äôre looking at someone Regulus.‚Äù

He thinks this is supposed to be comforting but it‚Äôs actually a terrifying thing for Evan to say. A million questions and fears flood Regulus‚Äôs mind but somehow he eventually manages to find his voice.

‚ÄúAnd that‚Äôs‚Ä¶you‚Äôre okay with‚Ä¶it?‚Äù Me. Is what he means. You‚Äôre okay with me. Not that it matters. Not that he cares. It would just be inconvenient‚Äîhe‚Äôd rather not give people things to hold over his head. He‚Äôs been in that position too many times before. That‚Äôs the only reason he‚Äôs asking. Obviously.

Evan smiles almost‚Ä¶softly? Which is weird and actually makes Regulus feel mildly uncomfortable, like they‚Äôre having some kind of moment or something. ‚ÄúYeah man, of course it is. But I get why you, y‚Äôknow, why you don‚Äôt want people to know. Like Barty. Your cousins,‚Äù he looks at Regulus seriously then. ‚ÄúI won‚Äôt tell anyone.‚Äù

And damn it.

Damn it Evan.

Because they totally are having a moment.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù he‚Äôs not even sure if Evan can hear him because the words come out so softly. But he must be able to read Regulus‚Äôs lips because his smile grows.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt mention it,‚Äù he leans back, arm thrown over the booth, taking a sip from his drink before he speaks again.

‚ÄúMerlin, it must have been torture for you.‚Äù

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúWhat must have?‚Äù

Evan‚Äôs smile has taken on a rather impish quality. ‚ÄúHaving to stare at all this every day,‚Äù he gestures to himself and Regulus actually laughs.

‚ÄúYou wish.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh come on Reg, you were totally pining after me. Not that I blame you. I‚Äôd want to fuck me too.‚Äù

Regulus shakes his head still laughing. ‚ÄúI pity your girlfriend.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be jealous Reg, our love was never meant to be,‚Äù he gives him a wink and then, before Regulus can respond; ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs still looking y‚Äôknow,‚Äù he nods his head in the direction of the bar.

Regulus looks down briefly, stomach squirming. ‚ÄúToo dangerous‚ÄîBarty might see.‚Äù Not to mention the hundreds of other people packed inside this place.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôve noticed, but Barty‚Äôs pretty distracted,‚Äù and when that doesn‚Äôt work; ‚ÄúGo on Reg. We‚Äôre young and hot and you deserve better than a fucking cellar and a Patronus.‚Äù

Well. When he puts it like that. It does sound rather pathetic doesn‚Äôt it? The truth is, he‚Äôs not sure he could do it. Pick someone up, that is. I mean, sure, he could probably convince someone to go to bed with him but‚Ä¶he‚Äôs almost certain he would start to panic once they were there.

You could ignore it,

offers the voice in the back of his mind.

You‚Äôve done it before. You know how to shut it off. How to stop feeling.

But why? Why bother? If I don‚Äôt have to?
For a moment it seems the little voice has no reply. And then,

So you can be normal.

Regulus‚Äôs hand clenches around his drink before he lifts it to his mouth and chugs the rest of it down. Evan lets out a low whistle.

‚ÄúDamn, okay.‚Äù

Regulus gets up. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm getting another drink.‚Äù

‚ÄúMhm, I bet you are,‚Äù Evan sounds far too smug, swatting at Regulus‚Äôs ass as he walks away from the table, surprised to find himself a little unsteady on his feet. He didn‚Äôt think the drink was that strong but he hasn‚Äôt had alcohol in a while and he also can‚Äôt remember the last time he ate‚Ä¶

He maneuvers through the crowd doing his best not to flinch as people bump into him. He‚Äôs flying a bit blind, trying to spot the boy from before through the sea of moving figures around him. He thinks he has a pretty good idea of which direction to head in. He‚Äôs not exactly sure what his plan is here. He‚Äôll have to drink more if he wants to be able to take his clothes off, and obviously he can‚Äôt bring someone back to Grimmauld so hopefully this bloke has somewhere they can go. Regulus wonders if he‚Äôll have to dance with him? The thought makes him shudder. Too many bodies and people and hands. Hands on him. He grits his teeth.

He can do this.

He can be normal.

A mess of wild dark hair suddenly comes into view, stopping Regulus dead in his tracks. He thinks he sees the flash of a pair of glasses but then the head is turned and he can‚Äôt be sure. But it looks like‚Äîfuck, it looks just like‚Äî

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù the name comes out of his mouth weak and whiny, for the first time he‚Äôs glad the music is so obnoxiously loud in this place because he‚Äôs fairly certain no one heard him.

His whole body starts to tremble as he takes a step forward. It‚Äôs been two years. It‚Äôs been so fucking long. If it is James‚Äîand Merlin he knows it makes no sense, that it can‚Äôt be, I mean, right?‚Äîbut if it is James, he‚Äôs not even sure he‚Äôd want to speak to him. What would they even say to one another?

Hi. Hey. Hello.

I‚Äôve missed you.

Oh God I‚Äôve missed you.

I‚Äôve kept us safe James, all those moments, all those words, all those touches. I see them everyday. I sit with them. They sit with me. Have you ever seen a stag? I don‚Äôt know why that‚Äôs the shape we take but it is. And he‚Äôs so beautiful. Just like you.

Oh God I‚Äôve missed you.

He‚Äôs nearly reached him now, if he stretches his arm out he might even be able to‚Äî

The man turns around, nearly bumping right into Regulus.

‚ÄúWhoops,‚Äù he laughs, two pints in hand. He is wearing glasses, though they‚Äôre ugly thick rimmed things. ‚ÄúSorry mate,‚Äù he smiles apologetically as he squeezes past Regulus.

Not James.

Regulus tries to get himself under control, tries to settle his racing pulse.

Of course it wasn‚Äôt James.

You knew it wouldn‚Äôt be.

You knew.

He‚Äôs not sure why he feels so sick, adrenaline suddenly draining out of him, leaving something hollow in its place.

‚ÄúHey!‚Äù

Regulus takes in a deep breath and exhales. He should probably get some water or something. Fuck he really wishes he hadn‚Äôt chugged the rest of that drink it isn‚Äôt helping.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîhi?‚Äù

Regulus blinks, suddenly realizing the voice in his periphery is speaking to him. He turns around, and because the universe is a cruel and relentless bitch, he finds the boy from earlier, smiling sheepishly at him.

He looks nice.

Handsome.

‚ÄúHi,‚Äù he says again, and then; ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Michael.‚Äù

If Regulus was actually normal, he‚Äôd probably like Michael. Probably dance with him. Go home with him. And he wouldn‚Äôt have to get drunk to do it. Wouldn‚Äôt have to retreat inside himself to ignore the way being touched makes him want to crawl out of his skin.

But he isn‚Äôt normal.

He‚Äôs not sure if he would have been, if life had been different. Maybe he always would have been this way.

‚ÄúI have to go,‚Äù he mutters, turning away quickly as he sees the disappointment flicker across Michael‚Äôs face. He shoves people out of his way on his desperate dash towards the exit, stumbling out into the street.

Evan will figure out he‚Äôs gone home eventually, or he‚Äôll think he went home with that boy, either way Regulus doesn‚Äôt care, he just needs out. He just needs to go home. He just needs the fucking weight in his chest to let up. He doesn‚Äôt know why his heart feels like it‚Äôs breaking. Nothing even happened.

Hi. Hey. Hello.

I‚Äôve missed you.

Oh God I‚Äôve missed you.

Regulus squeezes his eyes shut. Fuck it. Fuck the Statute of Secrecy, fuck the fact that he shouldn‚Äôt Apparate drunk. He can‚Äôt be here. He can‚Äôt.

And so.

By the next breath.

He isn‚Äôt.

¬†

PART III JAMES

The Order is meeting at Cardoc Dearborn‚Äôs house today. Dumbledore likes to keep the locations of the meetings new, only ever giving them out the day of, for security purposes. James has never been to Dearborn‚Äôs house. He‚Äôs one of the older members of the Order and his home is in the suburbs outside of London and covered in portraits of his ancestors. The Dearborn‚Äôs are a rather old and well known family and so they‚Äôre all very lofty and chatty and don‚Äôt seem to at all appreciate the large crowd now attempting to fit itself into the sitting room.

James is leaning against the window‚Äîthe only part of the house that doesn‚Äôt appear to have a face stuck to it‚ÄîLily is perched on the arm of the sofa next to him, Sirius standing with his arms crossed over his chest on his other side. It‚Äôs been a week now, with no word from Remus, no idea where he‚Äôs gone or what‚Äôs happened except that Dumbledore, presumably, had something he needed him to do. James has spent most nights at Remus and Sirius‚Äôs flat. He knows his best mate. Knows how he gets when he‚Äôs alone. Especially with Walburga being allowed to walk free.

It‚Äôs been a pretty shit week all things considered.

‚ÄúJames!‚Äù

He looks up to see his parents making their way through the crowd‚Äîof course they get stopped about a dozen times by people wanting to say hello. When they finally reach him James can see the irritation in his mother‚Äôs eyes and he has to bite back a smile.

‚ÄúOh it‚Äôs so good to see you,‚Äù she immediately throws her arms round Sirius who only freezes for a second before he starts hugging her back.

‚ÄúHi Mrs. Potter,‚Äù Sirius says thickly.

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt start,‚Äù she pulls back bringing her hands up to cup his face and James finds himself startled to realize that Sirius is taller than her. I mean, obviously he knew that, logically, but he‚Äôs never really noticed it before. She always just feels so‚Ä¶big.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Effie or mum, you know that.‚Äù

James sees Sirius struggle to keep his expression neutral. ‚ÄúYeah, of course,‚Äù his mum has always been the only person who can make Sirius go quiet.

She brushes his cheeks with her thumbs, eyes soft. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôre you holding up sweetheart?‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure what his mum knows about Sirius and Remus‚Äôs relationship. No one‚Äôs said anything to her, as far as James knows, but she‚Äôs not an idiot. She‚Äôs seen them together. Knows they share a flat. He‚Äôs not sure why they haven‚Äôt told her directly, it‚Äôs not as though she‚Äôd react badly, but James figures that‚Äôs really up to Sirius, and Sirius would never do anything he thought might cost him Effie.

Sirius clears his throat. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm alright,‚Äù he says, with a casualness that feels forced. ‚ÄúY‚Äôknow, getting through.‚Äù

Euphemia nods, holding still for one more second before she pulls him forward and kisses the top of his head, finally letting him go. ‚ÄúYou should come visit, you know you‚Äôre welcome anytime, you don‚Äôt need to wait for this lump to invite you,‚Äù she smacks James‚Äôs arm playfully.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù he says indignantly, noticing Lily trying to hide her giggles behind her hand.

‚ÄúWell she‚Äôs right,‚Äù his father says. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt Floo, you don‚Äôt write, sometimes I forget what you look like.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúYeah, yeah.‚Äù

‚ÄúDinner,‚Äù his mother says sternly, finger pointing directly at James.

‚ÄúLunch.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames.‚Äù

"Breakfast."

"Really?"

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù he says innocently, noticing his father trying to hide his grin. ‚ÄúI thought we were just naming meals.‚Äù His mother doesn‚Äôt dignify this with a response, just stares him down until he eventually caves.

‚ÄúAlright, alright, I‚Äôll come fore dinner, jeez.‚Äù

‚ÄúA real hardship,‚Äù his father says wryly, reaching over to muss James‚Äôs hair like he‚Äôs still ten years old. James bats his hand away, cheeks going red. Merlin he hopes no one is watching, his parents are so bloody embarrassing.

‚ÄúSunday evening, yes?‚Äù Euphemia continues.

‚ÄúAlright, alright, Sunday, dinner, got it.‚Äù

She nods, satisfied. ‚ÄúI expect to see all of you there,‚Äù she looks at the three of them. ‚ÄúYou included Lily dear.‚Äù

Lily smiles. ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt miss it.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe can finish our tour of James‚Äôs baby photos,‚Äù his father mock whispers to her, causing James to glare.

‚ÄúAnd ask Peter when you see him, he‚Äôs invited too of course,‚Äù Euphemia goes on, James is just grateful she doesn‚Äôt mention Remus, Sirius is actually looking somewhat happy for the first time in days.

‚ÄúCourse, I‚Äôll tell him.‚Äù

‚ÄúFleamont!‚Äù someone calls from across the room, causing James‚Äôs father to turn.

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù he says, resigned, ‚Äúbusiness calls,‚Äù he gives James‚Äôs arm a distracted squeeze before pulling away, heading off towards someone James doesn‚Äôt recognize‚Äîprobably from the Ministry.

His mother gives them all one more hug, squeezing James extra tight. ‚ÄúI love you,‚Äù she whispers, kissing his temple, before moving on to Lily and then disappearing after his father.

‚ÄúMerlin, they‚Äôre a lot,‚Äù James mutters as he tries fruitless to get his hair back in order.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre brilliant,‚Äù Lily says from beside him.

James looks down at her and then across the room at where his parents are clearly having some very serious, important conversation. Not that they ever have any other kind these days.

‚ÄúI mean, yeah, obviously. Still a lot though.‚Äù

She snorts, reaching over and squeezing his hand.

A flustered string of mumbled apologies drags James‚Äôs attention away from Lily and towards the slightly frazzled, sweaty figure of Peter, awkwardly maneuvering his way towards them.

‚ÄúThink he ran here?‚Äù Sirius asks, watching their friend struggle to get around an oblivious Hagrid.

‚ÄúSure bloody looks like it.‚Äù

‚ÄúShould we let him know he‚Äôs a wizard?‚Äù

‚ÄúDunno, might be a bit of a shock for him.‚Äù

Sirius chuckles as Peter finally manages to make it over to them.

‚ÄúHey Petey, aren‚Äôt you looking wonderfully sweaty today.‚Äù

Peter glares at Sirius. ‚ÄúSorry, got stuck late at work.‚Äù

Peter‚Äôs mother insisted he get a job with his father in the Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes. ‚ÄòHe should fit right in‚Äô Sirius had said when he heard, ‚Äòseeing as he is one.‚Äô James actually felt bad about laughing that time.

‚ÄúOi, Sunday night, dinner at my parents place,‚Äù James says before he forgets. Peter looks like he‚Äôs about to refuse but James cuts him off. ‚ÄúNope, no, no getting out of this one. If you don‚Äôt show my mum will never shut up about it so you‚Äôre coming. Just deal with it. Besides, I feel like we haven‚Äôt seen you in ages anyway.‚Äù

Peter sighs, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs work, there‚Äôs just‚Ä¶a lot to do,‚Äù he leans back against the wall behind him, earning him an indignant squawk from the portrait he smothers.

‚ÄúI beg your pardon!‚Äù the old woman in the frame demands, causing Peter to jump.

‚ÄúOh shit, er, sorry ma‚Äôam,‚Äù his face is on fire, James and Sirius cackling on either side of him.

‚ÄúOh shut it,‚Äù Peter mutters, crossing his arms over his chest but making sure to stay a safe distance away from the wall.

‚ÄúGood evening everyone,‚Äù the slightly magnified voice of Albus Dumbledore cuts through the room, instantly silencing all chatter and causing everyone to turn towards the entrance where the old man is standing in magenta robes. He smiles out at them.

‚ÄúI think it is time we begin, I know you are all busy people and I don‚Äôt wish to drag you away from your lives for longer than is necessary.‚Äù

James hears Sirius scoff next to him, ‚ÄúWhat lives?‚Äù

James elbows him even though he secretly agrees. Between the meetings and missions and patrols there isn‚Äôt really much outside of the Order. Of course, you can‚Äôt really blame Dumbledore for that. He‚Äôs not the one attacking people. Killing people.

James lets his eyes wander around the room as he listens to Dumbledore talk. No news on the kidnap victims, Moody suggests they presume them dead, James is sure most of them already have. Azkaban is essentially useless at keeping its prisoners locked up at this point so there‚Äôs some talk of the Order opening its own prison. Not on the same scale, of course, but some place they can reliably detained potential Death Eaters and sources.

All the members aren‚Äôt here for this particularly depressing meeting. Alice and Frank are notably absent, so are Marlene and Dorcas‚Äîall on guard duty. Moody has made it nearly impossible for anyone suspected of colluding with Voldemort to buy anything magical. It‚Äôs one of the few roadblocks they‚Äôve actually been able to put in the Death Eaters‚Äô way. All major sellers of magical ingredients and objects have been detailed with security‚Äîa mixture of Aurors and Order members. So far there‚Äôs been nothing to report, but it‚Äôs spreading their man power pretty bloody thin.

Speaking of‚Ä¶

‚ÄúMcKinnon is going to need back up on her shift tonight,‚Äù Moody announces gruffly.

‚ÄúWhat happened to Gideon?‚Äù Lily demands.
