Moody growls, rolling his eyes. ‚ÄúIdiot went and touched some bloody cursed tea kettle or some shite on his last shift and now he‚Äôs in Mungo‚Äôs vomiting up butterflies.‚Äù

‚ÄúButterflies?‚Äù James and Sirius say at the same time, barely containing their glee.

‚ÄúYeah, yeah, you‚Äôll have an excellent time taking the piss out of him when he gets back, but spare the rest of us, okay? Now, any volunteers?‚Äù

A deathly silence falls over the room, no one willing to give up their evening to babysit a bunch of potion ingredients. Eventually, James sighs.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll do it,‚Äù he says, it‚Äôs not like he‚Äôs going to let Marlene do a shift on her own.

‚ÄúThank you Potter,‚Äù though somehow Moody manages to make even his gratitude sound disapproving.

He feels Lily tug on his sleeve as Moody moves on to other topics.

‚ÄúYou sure?‚Äù she asks quietly.

‚ÄúCourse,‚Äù he gives her a reassuring smile. It‚Äôs really not the most dangerous task they‚Äôre given as members of the Order but James knows it doesn‚Äôt matter. Every time Lily walks out the door he feels anxiety roll through him. Safe just isn‚Äôt something they feel these days.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be good to see Mar, catch up on the gossip,‚Äù he leans over and kisses Lily quickly.

‚ÄúMake sure you tell her to give me back the jumper she stole the last time she was over,‚Äù Lily says playfully, though the tension in her eyes hasn‚Äôt quite disappeared.

James snorts. ‚ÄúWill do.‚Äù He turns his attention back to Moody but he can‚Äôt shake the feeling that someone‚Äôs watching him and when he turns his head he finds it‚Äôs Peter.

‚ÄúAll good Pete?‚Äù he asks, his friend‚Äôs eyes instantly dropping to the floor.

‚ÄúYup,‚Äù he says, though his voice sounds tense and he‚Äôs started to fidget; bouncing on the balls of his feet, pulling at his sleeve.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James knocks their shoulders together. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just a guard shift, no need to look so bloody worried. It‚Äôs going to be boring as fuck.‚Äù

Peter looks up at him and then away again. ‚ÄúYeah‚Ä¶yeah I know. Just‚Ä¶yeah. In a weird mood I suppose. Sorry.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be,‚Äù James says, and he means it. ‚ÄúWe all get like that these days.‚Äù

Peter nods. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says again, but he doesn‚Äôt sound like he quite believes it. Normally James would push him a little more, find out what‚Äôs really wrong, but this isn‚Äôt the place.

Sunday, he thinks, at dinner. I‚Äôll talk to him then.

¬†

He‚Äôs never been to the shop they‚Äôre guarding, not that he‚Äôs exactly a regular in Knockturn. James has always thought it was weird that this area wasn‚Äôt better policed before the war but according to Alice there are a lot of Ministry officials who have side hustles going on down here they‚Äôd rather not come to light. The smuggling and selling of illegal artifacts, under the table gambling rings etc., Turns out there‚Äôs a lot of money to be made on the black market. At this point though, Moody is far beyond caring about the feelings of a few greedy politicians, and with Dumbledore backing him no one is saying shit.

There are still people out on the street even though it‚Äôs close to midnight, there are lamps here and there but they‚Äôre pretty spread out, it‚Äôs clear the intention was to keep this area dark. Still, the figure of Marlene leaning against the front of a crumbling building is hard to miss.

‚ÄúWow Potter,‚Äù she says teasingly the moment she sees him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre late, the day shift left half an hour ago.‚Äù

‚ÄúNice try,‚Äù James says, opening his arms and giving her a hug. ‚ÄúI passed them on my way in you little weasel.‚Äù

She smiles as she pulls away. ‚ÄúSure you did,‚Äù and then, more sincerely. ‚ÄúMerlin I‚Äôm so glad it‚Äôs you, I was worried I was going to get stuck with Fletcher,‚Äù she makes a face that has James laughing.

‚ÄúFletch is alright,‚Äù he says as he watches Marlene unlock the front door and then follows her inside.

‚ÄúMaybe to you, but I‚Äôd rather not spend the whole bloody night with him staring at my ass.‚Äù

‚ÄúFair enough.‚Äù

The shop is, predictably, dark. The owners of these establishments aren‚Äôt pleased by the new police presence being forced on them and interact with them as little as humanly possible, despite countless reassurances that they aren‚Äôt there looking for illegal items, just protecting them. To be fair, James isn‚Äôt sure he‚Äôd buy that either.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù he says, hopping up on the counter as Marlene lights one of the lanterns, ‚ÄúGideon got cursed huh?‚Äù

Marlene rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúHe was such a baby about it too, whinging and complaining and‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúVomiting butterflies?‚Äù

She smiles. ‚ÄúMoody told you that bit huh?‚Äù she twirls her wand between her fingers. ‚ÄúHe begged me to make up something ‚Äúcooler,‚Äù like there‚Äôs a cool thing to vomit.‚Äù

‚ÄúI mean, you do have to admit, as far as cursed objects go, butterflies isn‚Äôt particularly hardcore.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhich he should be grateful for!‚Äù she says with exasperation. ‚ÄúBesides‚Ä¶the butterflies were really rather beautiful.‚Äù

‚ÄúReckon they‚Äôll let him keep one of them as a pet?‚Äù

She snorts. ‚ÄúMerlin, I hope not, poor butterfly. Can you imagine being stuck with Gideon? Just doing these shifts with him a few times a week has been insufferable.‚Äù

‚ÄúSpeaking of, you been watching this place long?‚Äù James asks.

She shrugs. ‚ÄúThe last week or so.‚Äù

James slides off the counter. ‚ÄúWell then, care to give me a tour?‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course, here we have our dusty showroom,‚Äù Marlene gestures widely at the small space. There isn‚Äôt much; a few shelves, the till, some plants growing in the window that James vaguely remembers from Herbology.

‚ÄúThis is basically all the above board stuff, your run of the mill potions ingredients,‚Äù she waves her wand as she walks through the door behind the counter, causing the lantern to trail beside them. ‚ÄúBack here is where things get interesting.‚Äù

‚ÄúHoly shit,‚Äù James stumbles against the wall as he‚Äôs met with the sight of about a dozen or so skeletons.

Marlene stands in front of him unfazed. ‚ÄúCharming isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

He looks from her to the skeletons and back again. ‚ÄúAre those‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúReal?‚Äù she asks. ‚ÄúOh yeah. Hundred percent.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow‚Ä¶‚Äù it seems that James has gone momentarily dumb, only able to manage two words at most.

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt worry, the shopkeeper isn‚Äôt a murderer or anything, just a grave robber,‚Äù she says flatly. ‚ÄúHe was very quick to make sure I knew that.‚Äù

James swallows. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve met him?‚Äù

‚ÄúOnly once, the first day, when he gave me these,‚Äù she holds up a dangly set of keys. ‚ÄúHe also made sure I knew, in case I was still feeling squeamish about the whole thing, that they aren‚Äôt Wizard skeletons.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt quite understand what she means and then; ‚ÄúMuggles?‚Äù

Marlene nods.

‚ÄúJesus Christ.‚Äù

‚ÄúYup,‚Äù Marlene is eying them with relative distaste.

James forces himself to step away from the wall, standing straight again and working on swallowing the bile at the back of his throat. ‚ÄúWhy does he have them at all?‚Äù

‚ÄúTurns out human bone is a very powerful potion ingredient,‚Äù she looks over at him. ‚ÄúSlughorn must have forgotten to mention that one.‚Äù

James lets out a startled laugh, still feeling shaky. ‚ÄúYeah, no kidding.‚Äù

Marlene walks past the hanging skeletons towards another door on the other side of the room that James had failed to notice. He‚Äôs not exactly sure he wants her to open it but he isn‚Äôt about to tell her not to, so he grits his teeth as he watches her turn the knob. Thankfully, all it reveals is a set of stairs.

James grimaces, walking over. ‚ÄúDo I even wanna know what‚Äôs down there?‚Äù

‚ÄúBit of a let down after this room honestly,‚Äù she says with a wane smile. ‚ÄúBunch of illegal plants, things that don‚Äôt grow here, that you can‚Äôt import. Big deal for potions nerds I guess but compared to those,‚Äù she nods her head over her shoulder. ‚ÄúHard to feel particularly shocked by it.‚Äù

‚ÄúHmm,‚Äù is all James says, avoiding looking at the skeletons as he follows Marlene back into the main room.

‚ÄúThis is the only entrance though,‚Äù she goes on, pointing at the front door. ‚ÄúNo other outside doors, and no other windows. No fireplace so there‚Äôs no Floo connection and we put up anti-Apparation charms on all these places months ago.‚Äù

James nods, shaking off his jitters and trying to focus. ‚ÄúSo if someone is coming in here, it‚Äôs gonna be through there,‚Äù he says, earning him a nod from Marlene. ‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs simple.‚Äù

‚ÄúHas been so far. Like everywhere else we‚Äôve been watching, there‚Äôs been no activity here. So get ready to be bored out of your mind.‚Äù

‚ÄúI dunno, there are a bunch of skeletons in that room, that‚Äôs pretty exciting.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey get old fast, believe me.‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure he does, but he isn‚Äôt about to argue.

‚ÄúOn the bright side,‚Äù Marlene says, reaching into her back pocket and pulling out a pack of cards. ‚ÄúI brought Exploding Snap.‚Äù

James laughs, running a hand through his hair and trying to get himself to relax as Marlene starts shuffling. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a genius you are.‚Äù

She grins up at him. ‚ÄúSo I‚Äôve been told.‚Äù

¬†

After about a dozen games and just as many loses James is pretty much at his wits end.

‚ÄúOh fuck me‚Äîthese cards are rigged.‚Äù

Marlene is giggling so hard she actually has to place her hands on her stomach like she‚Äôs getting a cramp. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt realize you were so bad at this, I thought James Potter was good at everything.‚Äù

‚ÄúI AM good at everything!‚Äù James defends himself indignantly. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre cheating.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am not.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre too!‚Äù

‚ÄúAm not!‚Äù

‚ÄúAre too!‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin,‚Äù she‚Äôs wiping tears of mirth from her eyes. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre more of a baby than Gideon.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want a rematch,‚Äù James demands.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure your ego can take it.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy ego is just fine thank you very‚Äî‚Äú

It happens fast and simultaneous in slow motion. The windows break‚Äîactually, more accurately, are blown in‚Äîshards of glass shooting at them, both James and Marlene thrown back against the wall by the force of the explosion. Sharp pain shoots through James‚Äôs spine and up the back of his head, the world around him shaking.

Somehow he manages to get his wand out, still trying to catch his breath when the first figure comes into sight.

‚ÄúExpelliarmus!‚Äù James shouts, because it‚Äôs the first thing that comes to mind. By some miracle it works, the man‚Äôs wand flying off into the chaos. He growls, stepping forward, James only just getting to his feet. He‚Äôs barely taken a step, mind frantically trying to come up with another spell, when he feels the Death Eater‚Äôs fist collide with his face, sending him stumbling back into the wall.

His whole head feels like it‚Äôs on fire at this point, but somehow he manages to dodge the second hit, scrambling out of the way as he whips his wand up.

‚ÄúIncarcerous!‚Äù

Thick black ropes hit the man with such force that he‚Äôs knocked to the ground, squirming and cursing as his legs and arms are bound tightly to his body. James doesn‚Äôt even have time to breathe before the next dark robed figure steps into view.

‚ÄúCrucio!‚Äù

James hurls himself out of the way, stumbling through the door into the back room. He runs right into something solid and warm, jumping back when he sees it‚Äôs another fucking Death Eater.

Shit, he thinks, the man turning around with a leer. He has no idea where Marlene is, he can only imagine she‚Äôs tied up with her own bad guy. Meaning they‚Äôre outnumbered at least four to two if not more.

‚ÄúLooking a little rough there pretty boy,‚Äù the man says, and before James can react he reaches out and takes him by the throat. He‚Äôs massive‚Äîmaybe 6‚Äô3 or 6‚Äô5‚Äîand when he lifts James up his feet dangle off the ground. ‚ÄúDo you reckon your bones will be better?‚Äù he nods at the skeletons behind him. ‚ÄúFresher and all that.‚Äù He grins, pulling James away from the wall like he‚Äôs getting ready to smash his head in.

Rictusempra.

James thinks desperately, hand gripping his wand. He can‚Äôt speak. Doesn‚Äôt have the air, the man‚Äôs grip unbearably tight.

Rictusempra.

It‚Äôs a stupid spell but it‚Äôs the one his frazzled brain comes up with. Him and Sirius practiced casting it silently for ages in fourth year. They thought it was hilarious, making Peter spontaneously burst into giggles.

Rictusempra. Rictusempra. Rictusempra.

The man‚Äôs body suddenly freezes, his hand on James‚Äôs neck twitching as a choked noise comes out of his mouth, his eyes growing wide. James watches the man try to fight the spell, his limbs making strange abortive movements as choked giggles escape his mouth.

James starts wiggling, trying to get himself free, which results in the pair of them stumbling around the room both jerking awkwardly. Of course the more the man tries to fight the spell the more violent the waves of giggles get. James is swung around like a doll, knocking over furniture and slamming into walls. Eventually the man roars in frustration, though the noise descends into laughter half-way through and James feels himself being thrown across the room.

He isn‚Äôt sure if it‚Äôs done on purpose‚Äîhe doesn‚Äôt think so. But it‚Äôs only as he tries to land, throwing his arms out for something to catch himself on, that James realizes the basement door is open. It‚Äôs a moment later that he‚Äôs falling down the stairs. The unbelievable pain of the hard wood steps overwhelming him, and for a moment he feels like he blacks out, crumpling into a heap when he finally hits the floor.

He knows he needs to get up. He does. Knows he doesn‚Äôt have the luxury of staying on his knees like this. But he just‚Äîhe needs a minute. Everything fucking hurts. He thinks he might have broken something. But he knows he has to get up. He‚Äôs going to. Any minute now. He‚Äôs going to get up. He‚Äôs going to keep fighting. He has to keep fighting.

That‚Äôs when he feels the hard tip of a wand press against the top of his head.

‚ÄúI‚Äôd get up slowly if I were you.‚Äù

His brain is all fucked. That‚Äôs why he‚Äôs so slow to react. Why it takes him a second. It‚Äôs not that he doesn‚Äôt hear that voice all the time, it‚Äôs just that he‚Äôs so used to it coming from inside his head.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he croaks, lifting his head to meet a pair of startled grey eyes.

It is.

It‚Äôs him.

Right there.

Right. There.

Regulus stumbles backwards, looking at James like he‚Äôs just seen a ghost‚ÄîJames can only imagine his own face is doing something similar. Regulus opens and closes his mouth but no sound comes out.

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

He isn‚Äôt sure exactly what he means to say. Something, presumably. But before the words make it out of his mouth the ceiling over their heads gives a mighty groan and then suddenly dust and concrete are crumbling down on them. James instantly throws himself backwards, stones grazing his shoulders, but he misses the worst of it, coughing as clouds of dust plume around the rubble. A sudden panic shoots through him as he stares at the wreckage in front of him.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù he calls out, voice rough, fear skyrocketing when he doesn‚Äôt hear an answer‚Äînot that he can hear much right now, his ears ringing.

‚ÄúRegulus?‚Äù he starts desperately scrambling forward, throwing chunks of concrete out of the way as he picks through the room. ‚ÄúRegulus? Reg! Please, please, please,‚Äù he cuts his hands on the stones as he throws them aside. ‚ÄúRegulus!‚Äù panic shakes his voice. ‚ÄúRegulus!‚Äù

‚ÄúJames!‚Äù

He looks up, heart hammering in his chest as he see Regulus crawling out from underneath a table a few feet in front of him. He almost cries, scrambling over the debris as Regulus moves towards him, the pair colliding in the centre of the room. He pulls Regulus into him without thinking, wrapping his arms around him.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he whispers. ‚ÄúFuck you scared me.‚Äù

He thinks Regulus says something but his words are mumbled and suddenly James realizes what he‚Äôs done, instantly pulling back.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he says, this whole thing feeling a bit surreal. Regulus just stares back at him, uncomprehending. ‚ÄúI should have asked,‚Äù James tries to explain with his barely functioning brain. ‚ÄúI should have asked before I touched you.‚Äù

Something indecipherable flickers across Regulus‚Äôs face before he‚Äôs pulling James back to him, burying his head in James‚Äôs chest.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James says softly, hands skimming over Regulus‚Äôs whole body, making sure he‚Äôs okay, making sure he‚Äôs real. ‚ÄúHey.‚Äù He drops his face into the other boy‚Äôs hair, breathing in the smell of him and feeling something profound settle inside of him.

Hello again, his bones sing.

Where have you been?

Why did you leave?

Please don‚Äôt go.

He isn‚Äôt sure how long they stay like that. Seconds. Minutes. Hours. Too long though. They should have known better.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck?‚Äù

James has barely turned around before he feels a spell hitting him square in the chest and sending him catapulting across the room. He isn‚Äôt sure if it‚Äôs the spell or the landing that hurts. He‚Äôs thinks it was only a repelling spell‚Äîstill, knocked the fucking breath out of him. And he‚Äôs lost his bloody wand.

Gasping for breath, the room spinning around him, he pushes himself up onto his hands and knees. He can hear fighting, see two blurry figures in front of him, but he feels like his head‚Äôs been submerged underwater. He needs to get it together, he needs to find his wand, he needs to help Regulus.

Regulus.

His mind gets caught on his name for a moment. Holding it carefully. In awe.

Regulus. Regulus. Regulus.

He shakes his head to clear it‚Äîa mistake, because it hurts like a motherfucker‚Äîhands scrambling along the floor for his wand. It takes him far too long to realize that the reason he can‚Äôt see isn‚Äôt because he hit his head but because he‚Äôs also lost his glasses.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he hisses under his breath. ‚ÄúFuck, fuck, fuck.‚Äù He tries to focus on the floor, grabbing at any vague looking lumps, but with the amount of debris covering this place that‚Äôs not the most effective searching method.

He‚Äôs really starting to panic now. Because he can‚Äôt see, and he can‚Äôt fight and he‚Äôs not even sure he can really breathe and this is not a good time for any of those things to be happening. And where is Reg? Or Marlene? What if they need him? How is he supposed to do anything when he can‚Äôt even fucking find his‚Äî

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù

He looks up as a blurry Regulus drops to his knees in front of him, there‚Äôs something wrong with his voice but James doesn‚Äôt know what it is or what it means.

‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù Regulus asks.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt find my glasses,‚Äù is the first thing that comes out of his mouth, words clunky. He thinks Regulus nods but he can‚Äôt be sure, and then he hears;

‚ÄúAccio glasses,‚Äù there‚Äôs the noise of something whizzing through the air and then Regulus is delicately sliding a pair of scratched glasses onto his face. He doesn‚Äôt pull away after, his hands sliding down to cradle James‚Äôs cheeks, the world finally in focus.

‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù he asks again.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James croaks. ‚ÄúYou?‚Äù

Regulus gives him a tight smile. ‚ÄúAll things considered, I could certainly be worse.‚Äù

James laughs, coughing a little at the end. ‚ÄúFuck I‚Äôve missed you.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs expression twists, caught between happiness and pain. For a moment they just freeze again, caught up in one another, and James has the mad thought that Regulus is going to kiss him. And he‚Äôs going to let him. But then Regulus pulls away.

James clears his throat. ‚ÄúWhat happened to‚Ä¶‚Äù but now that Regulus isn‚Äôt so close he can see the rest of the room. Can see the body on the ground. ‚ÄúOh shit.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù Regulus says seriously, bringing his attention back to him. ‚ÄúI need you to do something for me okay? I need you to tell your people that you killed Snyde. I need you to tell them that it was you.‚Äù

James blinks, trying to make sense of all that, when something else catches his attention. ‚ÄúMy wand‚ÄîReg, you have my wand.‚Äù

He reaches out, and Regulus gives it up easily.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he says again, this time sounding a little desperate. ‚ÄúI killed him with your wand okay? I had to, they‚Äôll check mine and I‚ÄîYou have to tell your side it was you.‚Äù

That bit still isn‚Äôt making sense to him. ‚ÄúBut why would it matter what my side thinks? Shit Reg they should know‚Äîyou fucking saved me.‚Äù

But Regulus only shakes his head. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a spy,‚Äù he says quickly, eyes darting around like he‚Äôs worried just saying those words out loud will bring them out of the shadows. ‚ÄúSomeone on your side has been turned and if they hear it was me it‚Äôll get back to the Dark Lord. They‚Äôll kill me James. On site. So you have to tell them it was you.‚Äù

‚ÄúSomeone on our side has turned?‚Äù he demands, not believing it, not wanting to believe it. ‚ÄúWho?‚Äù

Regulus only shakes his head again. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúReally I don‚Äôt, I‚Äôd tell you if I did,‚Äù he laughs at himself. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd tell you anything, you know that.‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure he does, but he reaches out anyway, hand wrapping around Regulus‚Äôs wrist, thumb brushing his pulse. ‚ÄúCome back with me,‚Äù he whispers.

Two years.

And here they are again.

‚ÄúThe Dark Mark is still on my arm James,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúYou saved my life.‚Äù

He smiles sadly at him. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt mean anything.‚Äù

James squeezes his wrist. ‚ÄúCome back with me.‚Äù

Where have you been?

Why did you leave?

Please don‚Äôt go.

Regulus opens his mouth to speak but before he can‚Äî

‚ÄúBlack!‚Äù someone shouts down, whether it‚Äôs from the top of the stairs or the hole in the ceiling James doesn‚Äôt know. ‚ÄúYou good?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Regulus yells back, staring at James the whole time. ‚ÄúAll clear down here. Lets go.‚Äù

Regulus frees his hand from James‚Äôs grip, sliding it up to the back of his neck and pulling him forward so he can kiss the top of his head. ‚ÄúBe safe,‚Äù he mumbles into James‚Äôs hair. ‚ÄúFor me. Keep yourself safe.‚Äù

And then he‚Äôs gone. Back on his feet and running up the stairs before James can think to react.

James feels all kinds of not good. All kinds of lost and confused and hurt. His wand is still warm from where Regulus was holding it. Because Regulus was here. Right here, right in front of him. His eyes trail over to the body on the floor a few feet away. Regulus saved his life.

He hears footsteps upstairs, pulling himself further into the shadows as he watches figures pass overhead through the hole in the ceiling, the sound of the front door‚Äîor whatever‚Äôs left of it‚Äîbanging open. He holds still and focuses on his breathing, not moving even when the noise stops and the shop goes still. He counts to a hundred three times, fighting the urge to run up the stairs. He needs to be sure they‚Äôre gone.

Eventually he gets to his feet, wand in his hand and raised as he steps over the dead body and the rubble. When he gets to the top floor he feels a new fear start to grow inside him‚Äîthat any minute he‚Äôll round the corner and find Marlene lying there, dead.

‚ÄúLumos,‚Äù he hisses, because the place is basically pitch black and the last thing he wants is to go falling through the floor back into the basement.

‚ÄúMarlene?‚Äù he hisses, walking through the ruins. ‚ÄúMar‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOh thank Merlin!‚Äù James starts as Marlene bursts out of the shadows, throwing her arms around him and sending him a little off balance. ‚ÄúI thought you were dead,‚Äù she mumbles into his shoulder. ‚ÄúThey said you were dead and I‚Äîgod, I‚Äôm so glad you‚Äôre okay.‚Äù

He wraps his arms around her, holding her tight.

‚ÄúSame here,‚Äù he says, surveying the damage over the top of her head. He sighs. ‚ÄúMoody‚Äôs going to kill us.‚Äù

Marlene lets out a wet scoff. ‚ÄúIt was six on two, what the fuck were we supposed to do? Alice has been telling him for weeks we're spread too thin, that we need to prioritize instead of trying to cover every possible option.‚Äù

James squeezes her again and then winces as a sharp pain shoots up the right side of his body. ‚ÄúHey Mar?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm gonna have to go to St. Mungos.‚Äù

She nods, pulling back, looking at him for the first time. ‚ÄúJesus, yeah, your face looks like it was hit with a beater‚Äôs club.‚Äù

He laughs. ‚ÄúThanks Mar.‚Äù

She starts tugging him towards the street. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon, will Apparate outside, contact the others from the hospital.‚Äù

James nods, happy to be led, without any immediate danger he‚Äôs really starting to feel the effects of being tossed around like a rag doll. He‚Äôs unsteady on his feet and vaguely woozy, fairly certain he‚Äôs only barely hanging onto his consciousness.

‚ÄúWait Mar,‚Äù he slurs when they get out outside. ‚ÄúBefore‚ÄîI don‚Äôt want to forget‚Äîthere‚Äôs a spy.‚Äù

She looks at him, face wrinkled. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù she asks, swimming in front of him. James tries to hold onto to his train of thought.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a spy, someone on our side has been turned. We need to tell Dum‚Äî‚Äú and suddenly, in his half-conscious state, something clicks. ‚ÄúHe knows,‚Äù James hisses nonsensically, black dots starting to take up a good portion of his vision.

‚ÄúWhat? Who knows? What are you talking about?‚Äù

But he can see it so clearly, the way Dumbledore had looked that night in his office, the way he had treated them. He already knows there‚Äôs a spy. And he thinks it‚Äôs Sirius.

That‚Äôs the last thought James has before the world goes dark.

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

I have lost track of days so I don't know how late this chapter is but I feel like it is pretty late so I apologize!

Also, unrelated, but you know that part in "my tears ricochet" where T. Swift is all "And I can go anywhere I want, anywhere I want just not home" ? That's what I hear in my head every time I read the bit where James and Regulus run together and hug. Cause they're each others homes (sobs for eternity) and also I am a giant sap.

ANYWAY! Thank you for being here and being your wonderful selves, hope you have a great day!

Chapter 44

Chapter Summary

This one's going to hurt.

Chapter Notes

TW: Referenced Sexual Assault / Threatened Sexual Assault (There's a moment in this chapter where it feels like things are going to escalate, I want to reassure you that they don't but also warn you that it feels that way because I know that even that is a little intense and triggering so be careful, it's in Part III)

TW: Death (This one hurts, it's at the end, so again, y'know, take care of yourselves)

ALSO I just want to throw this out there before you yell at the screen / me (hi!) this fic is canon compliant but it's also an interpretation of canon so sometimes I mess around with things, specifically in the coming chapters I play around with the order in which things happen a little bit

**FRENCH TRANSLATIONS IN THE END NOTES**

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I SIRIUS

He's on his way out. James is on duty with Marlene and his flat is empty and terrible and he doesn‚Äôt even care if he does something stupid because, quite frankly, Remus can go fuck himself. He has his coat on, keys and money jingling in his pockets, wand slipped up his sleeve, ready to go, when he hears the sound of footsteps on the stairs. Sirius freezes, staring at the door. He listens to the sound of the lock clicking, watches as the door handle turns. He tells himself he has no idea who‚Äôs on the other side, that he should get his wand out, get ready for a fight. Because it could be anyone. But he doesn‚Äôt.

Remus stops halfway across the threshold looking, Sirius thinks, unreasonably shocked to see him considering he lives here. If anyone should be looking shocked it‚Äôs Sirius.

‚ÄúYou gonna close the door?‚Äù he asks eventually, voice flat.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù Remus sounds rough, like he‚Äôs been shouting. Actually, he looks pretty rough all round‚Äîbruised and scraped and dirty. He closes the door but doesn‚Äôt move any closer. Sirius doesn‚Äôt think he‚Äôs ever heard their home sound so quiet.

‚ÄúSirius?‚Äù Remus says finally, his voice wavering. Sirius has to close his eyes for a minute because he‚Äôs so fucking angry, beyond angry, there isn‚Äôt even a word for what he is. But it‚Äôs obvious that Remus is in no shape to hash this out right now, so he has to just‚Ä¶find a place to put it.

‚ÄúTake your clothes off,‚Äù he says as he chucks his own jacket onto the sofa. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll start the shower.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú

But Sirius is already walking down the hall. He‚Äôs worried if he has to talk about this right now he won‚Äôt be able to keep it together. Won‚Äôt be able to hold back.

He‚Äôs testing the water temperature when he hears Remus shuffle in behind him. Sirius probably focuses a little harder on the water than is strictly necessary, listening to the sound of Remus carefully folding his clothes and placing them on top of the toilet. Eventually Sirius forces himself to turn around.

It‚Äôs work for him not to react to the state that Remus is in. He‚Äôs seen him in rough shape before but this‚Äîhis body is covered in bruises and welts, like someone‚Äôs been beating him. Without even thinking Sirius feels himself reaching out but Remus shies away, looking down like he‚Äôs ashamed. Sirius‚Äôs hand freezes mid-air and then drops.

‚ÄúYou hungry?‚Äù he asks eventually, swallowing around the lump in his throat. ‚ÄúShower, I‚Äôll make something.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to,‚Äù Remus says, eyes still on the tile floor.

‚ÄúOkay. That mean you don‚Äôt want any?‚Äù

He watches Remus scrunch up his swollen face and he wonders what the hell he‚Äôs thinking. And where the hell he‚Äôs been and how the hell he could walk away so fucking easily‚Äîbut no. No. That train of thought isn‚Äôt helpful right now.

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre making something anyway then‚Äîyeah, yeah I‚Äôd like some. Please,‚Äù his speech is stilted. Stiff.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù Sirius says again. ‚ÄúWater‚Äôs warm.‚Äù

‚ÄúThank you.‚Äù

‚ÄúSure.‚Äù Sirius steps around him, heading for the door.

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNot now,‚Äù is all he says, not bothering to stop on his way to the kitchen. He grabs hold of the counter when he gets there, pressing his palms to the cold surface and dropping his head. His breath shakes as he inhales. He has no idea what he‚Äôs doing. Isn‚Äôt sure who he‚Äôs more angry with; Remus or Dumbledore. And those injuries‚Ä¶if he ever finds out who put those fucking marks on Remus he‚Äôs going to‚Äî

A loud thud comes from the bathroom and Sirius is running before he even has time to think, throwing the door open to find Remus on his hands and knees in the shower. He looks up at the sound of Sirius entering, face twisted in pain.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he half sobs. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I don‚Äôt‚ÄîI slipped,‚Äù he grimaces as he tries to get back on his feet but doesn‚Äôt quite manage it. He‚Äôs too weak‚Äîthat thought makes something in Sirius‚Äôs chest ache, like his heart is a bruise.

Quickly he pulls off his boots and socks. ‚ÄúStop‚Äîjust‚Äîwait,‚Äù he snaps at Remus when he starts trying to get up again. He doesn‚Äôt bother with the rest of his clothes, jumping into the tub before Remus can hurt himself.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôre you trying to crack your fucking skull open?‚Äù Sirius mutters, arms under Remus‚Äôs as he lifts him carefully to his feet.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù Remus says again.

‚ÄúStop it,‚Äù because he knows Remus isn‚Äôt apologizing about falling, or if he is, it‚Äôs not all he‚Äôs apologizing for, and Sirius needs him to cut it out.

Remus leans into him, giving Sirius most of his weight, forehead resting against his shoulder. Water runs down his back, turning red as it washes off dried blood and Sirius has to look away before he starts screaming or crying or doing something else embarrassing and unhinged.

‚ÄúYou should have told me it was this bad, I would have just come in with you in the first place,‚Äù he mutters, running his hands softly up and down Remus‚Äôs sides.

‚ÄúI thought it would be okay,‚Äù Remus mumbles, not lifting his head. Sirius sighs, neither of them has ever been very good at asking for help.

‚ÄúPut your arms around my neck,‚Äù he says eventually, there‚Äôs a second of hesitation before Remus does as he‚Äôs asked. ‚ÄúHold on, tell me if you need to sit down okay?‚Äù

Remus nods, hair tickling Sirius‚Äôs face. He moves them slightly further under the streaming water, reaching for the soap and being as careful as possible when he cleans the filth off of Remus‚Äôs body. Remus hisses a few times but insists he doesn‚Äôt want to stop.

‚ÄúTilt your head back,‚Äù Sirius says softly, watching Remus‚Äôs eyelids flutter closed as he works shampoo into his mop of blonde hair. After it‚Äôs all rinsed out Sirius can‚Äôt stop himself from kissing Remus‚Äôs temple, which drags something like a sob from Remus who still has his eyes closed.

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù Sirius says softly. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre okay.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a bit awkward getting out. Sirius dries Remus off, tying the towel around his waist before he quickly strips out of his sopping wet clothes, throwing them over the tub and grabbing his own towel.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù Sirius says, snaking his arm around Remus‚Äôs waist.

‚ÄúI can walk,‚Äù the other boy mutters.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt even stand mate.‚Äù

Remus frowns but doesn‚Äôt fight him, letting Sirius guide him to the bedroom and sit him on the edge of the bed. He gets himself dressed first‚Äîjoggers, an old t-shirt‚Äîbefore he pulls out the pair of flannel pyjamas he knows Remus likes best. He starts to try and tug the shirt over Remus‚Äôs head but his boyfriend has apparently reached his limit.

‚ÄúOh Merlin‚ÄîI can dress myself,‚Äù he says, exasperated as he yanks the shirt out of Sirius‚Äôs hands.

‚ÄúSuit yourself,‚Äù Sirius says flatly. ‚ÄúLie down, I‚Äôll make soup,‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt wait for Remus‚Äôs reply before he heads to the kitchen for the second time. He pulls a can of chicken noodle from the cupboard and turns the stove on. It‚Äôs already started steaming by the time Remus wanders into the kitchen.

Sirius arches his brow. ‚ÄúThe fuck do you think you‚Äôre doing?‚Äù he points the wooden spoon he‚Äôs been using to stir accusingly in Remus‚Äôs direction.

The other boy rolls his eyes before sitting down on the couch.

‚ÄúRemus‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI just want to be able to see you okay? I just need to‚Äî‚Äú his voice breaks and he shakes his head, clearly irritated with himself. Sirius presses down on his sternum, trying to cut off whatever the hell that feeling is that Remus has just dragged out of him. He turns back to the soup.

‚ÄúFine.‚Äù

They don‚Äôt speak again until Sirius walks over to the couch with two full bowls. Remus cradles his in his hands for a few seconds, not moving.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù he says eventually.

Sirius only grunts.

They eat in silence, Remus clearly struggling to go slowly and Sirius doing his best not to think about the fact that his boyfriend has returned beaten and starved. Tries his best not to plot Dumbledore‚Äôs death. Not to start breaking things.

Eventually Remus places his bowl down on the table and Sirius takes it over to the sink, which is really a sign of the end times because he‚Äôs rubbish at remembering to wash the dishes. He turns on the tap, makes sure the water‚Äôs as hot as it can possibly go and starts scrubbing. He hears Remus coming up behind him. Tries to ignore him. Fails.

‚ÄúYou should sit down,‚Äù he says finally, still scrubbing. These are gonna be the cleanest fucking bowls in the whole flat.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm feeling better.‚Äù

‚ÄúWon‚Äôt last if you don‚Äôt sit your ass back down.‚Äù

‚ÄúSirius.‚Äù

He grits his teeth, pointedly not responding to that. To the way his name comes out of Remus‚Äôs mouth like a plea for mercy. When the silence stretches on he hears Remus sigh.

‚ÄúWill you look at me? Please?‚Äù

Sirius slams off the tap, placing his hands on the counter, trying to prepare himself for what‚Äôs coming. Trying to make promises to himself‚Äîthat he won‚Äôt lose control. That he‚Äôll just talk. He can do this. He can be reasonable. He can feel things‚Ä¶normally. He swallows before turning around, leaning against the counter and crossing his arms, staring flatly at Remus. He wants desperately to reach out to him. He doesn‚Äôt.

Remus‚Äôs eyes search him, looking for something, Sirius doesn‚Äôt know what, doesn‚Äôt know if he finds it. ‚ÄúDumbledore told me I couldn‚Äôt tell anyone.‚Äù

‚ÄúSince when does Dumbledore get to decide what happens here,‚Äù Sirius asks, gesturing between them.

‚ÄúBut we don‚Äôt just exist here do we?‚Äù Remus sounds tired. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in the Order. We have to follow orders.‚Äù

Sirius scoffs, looking away as he shakes his head. ‚ÄúYou disappeared for a week. A fucking week. I didn‚Äôt know what happened, I didn‚Äôt even know you‚Äôd gone on a mission, I thought‚Äî‚Äú his voice cracks, refusing to go on.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Remus sounds so small. ‚ÄúI know. I‚Äôm sorry. I swear I tried to‚Äîbut he made me promise Sirius and I‚Äîwe have to trust him. What are we doing if we don‚Äôt trust him?‚Äù

Sirius doesn‚Äôt answer. Doesn‚Äôt have one. Just keeps staring at the wall, fingers picking themselves apart. ‚ÄúWhere were you then?‚Äù he asks finally.

The pause afterwards goes on long enough that Sirius looks back at Remus.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt tell you,‚Äù he says eventually.

For a moment Sirius does nothing. And then, he laughs. ‚ÄúAre you fucking kidding me?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he holds his hands out but doesn‚Äôt try to close the space between them. He knows better than that. ‚ÄúI swear Sirius, I don‚Äôt like this anymore than you do. I hate it. I hated leaving. I hated knowing that you would‚Äîthat it would hurt you,‚Äù his voice breaks. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what you want me to do.‚Äù

‚ÄúTell me where you were!‚Äù Sirius shouts. ‚ÄúTell me where the fuck you were Remus? Tell me what happened, what did this to you?‚Äù

But he only stares back at him helplessly and Sirius feels old wounds opening up inside him.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt trust me.‚Äù

‚ÄúI DO, of course I do.‚Äù

It‚Äôs his own fault. He knows it is. He fucking knows. But he still hates it. ‚ÄúNot more than Dumbledore though,‚Äù he says eventually, watching Remus flinch. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

The other boy sighs, running a hand through his hair. He looks pale, too pale, scars and cuts standing out starkly against his sickly complexion, the skin beneath his eyes a deep purple.

‚ÄúWe have to trust him,‚Äù Remus says finally, repeating himself. ‚ÄúIf we don‚Äôt we‚Äôll fall apart,‚Äù he sounds like he‚Äôs trying to reason with himself as much as Sirius.

Sirius wants to rage and scream and break things. But Remus is teetering. ‚ÄúYou need to lie down,‚Äù he snaps eventually. ‚ÄúGo to bed Remus.‚Äù

But Remus‚Äôs mouth has formed a stubborn line and he shakes his head. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need to lie down.‚Äù

‚ÄúRemus‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI need YOU,‚Äù he says forcibly, cutting Sirius off at the knees. ‚ÄúSo we‚Äôre just going to‚Äîto do this now. ‚ÄúWhat if I can‚Äôt,‚Äù he says finally.

Remus blinks. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt what?‚Äù

‚ÄúForgive you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù the word shakes. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Remus repeats. ‚ÄúYou‚Äîno, you‚ÄîSirius please, this isn‚Äôt‚Äîplease,‚Äù he‚Äôs breathing too fast, trembling all over, making himself sick.

Sirius went too far. He always goes too far.

‚ÄúYou have to forgive me,‚Äù Remus rambles on, eyes so wide they take up half his face.

‚ÄúMoons‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI know it was awful, I do Sirius, I swear it was a-awful for me too. I didn‚Äôt want to leave you, I‚Äôm just trying to do the right thing here. I‚Äôm trying to help. To prove that I can.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh Remus,‚Äù he says softly.

Where were you?

Sirius swallows the question.

What did they do to you?

Where can I find them?

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre alright Rem,‚Äù he says instead. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all good.‚Äù He rubs his hand up and down Remus‚Äôs back.

Sirius closes his eyes, feeling a little closer to tears than he would like. He presses their cheeks together, Remus‚Äôs skin burning hot the way it always does.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù he says after a few seconds. ‚ÄúBed, lets go.‚Äù

This time Remus doesn‚Äôt fight him, though he doesn‚Äôt pull away much either, still attempting to curl himself into Sirius as they walk down the hall. When they slide under the covers they end up on their sides, facing one another. The room is dark, but Sirius can still make out Remus‚Äôs eyes in the moonlight. He reaches out, thumb brushing against Remus‚Äôs jaw. He watches the other boy‚Äôs eyelids grow heavy, drooping low, though he fights them. Like he doesn‚Äôt want to stop looking at Sirius.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he says in between. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

‚ÄúSh,‚Äù Sirius soothes, his voice shaking. ‚ÄúOkay, it‚Äôs okay Remus,‚Äù and he really wishes it was. ‚ÄúGo to sleep now.‚Äù

Remus nods, shuffling closer so that they slide together, fitting into one another like puzzle pieces. Sirius rests his chin on the top of Remus‚Äôs head, hands stroking up and down his back, well aware that he‚Äôs still tense as all hell.

When Sirius starts singing he‚Äôs barely even thinking about it; ‚Äú√Ä la claire fontaine m'en allant promener, J‚Äôai trouv√© l'eau si belle que je m'y suis baign√©e. Il y a longtemps que je t'aime, jamais je ne t‚Äôoublierai.‚Äù

¬†

It‚Äôs the light Sirius notices first‚Äîvaguely blue, invading his sleep. He groans, rolling over, burying his face in his pillow. That‚Äôs when he hears the voice.

He rolls out of bed, scrambling around on the floor for a pair of jeans. He‚Äôs only just pulling them on when he sees Remus slowly standing up, swaying the minute he‚Äôs on his feet.

Remus bends down to pick something up and winces, hand going to his lower back. Sirius is at his side in seconds.

‚ÄúWill. You. Stop. Hurting. Yourself.‚Äù He growls as he helps Remus lower himself onto the mattress. Remus instantly looks away, down at the floor.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not that bad,‚Äù he mutters under his breath.

God Sirius wants to scream at him.

Wants to kiss him.

‚ÄúNot bad for you is practically dead for the rest of us,‚Äù Sirius says, and when Remus continues to scowl at the floor; ‚ÄúHumour me, please?‚Äù

He runs his hand through Remus‚Äôs hair and the other boy‚Äôs eyes flutter closed.

‚ÄúAbsolutely,‚Äù Sirius says, giving Remus‚Äôs hair a light tug before he moves towards the door. He doesn‚Äôt quite make it out of the room though, something scraping at the inside of his skin. He looks back at Remus, not fully knowing what he wants to say.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Remus‚Äôs brow creases with concern. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be here when you get back, you know that right?‚Äù

It takes a great deal of effort for Sirius not to wince. Because of course, that‚Äôs it. That‚Äôs the problem. The last time he walked out the door and left Remus behind Remus wasn‚Äôt there when he got back.

‚ÄúSirius?‚Äù Remus says, looking like he‚Äôs about to get out of bed again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to be here,‚Äù he enunciates each word.

Sirius swallows, forcing himself to react. ‚ÄúYeah, I know,‚Äù he says, but he‚Äôs not sure that‚Äôs true anymore. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you soon I‚Äî‚Äú he stumbles over his words. ‚ÄúI love you.‚Äù

The concern on Remus‚Äôs face doesn‚Äôt lessen. ‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú

But he doesn‚Äôt stick around, already bolting out of the flat.

¬†

Sirius hates hospitals. He doesn‚Äôt have a reason for it. It‚Äôs not because he came and sat at the bed of someone he loved and watched them get sick. Or die. Hospitals are just too‚Ä¶bright. Too clean. Filled with people in various uniforms who want to know who he thinks he is and where he thinks he‚Äôs going. There are too many doors in hospitals and not enough windows. And they always smell like disinfectant. He hates it. Hates it even more now that he‚Äôs here for his best mate.

‚ÄúJames Potter,‚Äù he says breathlessly to the witch behind the desk, she looks up at him over the top of her paperwork.

‚ÄúExcuse me?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here for James Potter, where is he?‚Äù

She glares at him but she‚Äôs no Walburga so he doesn‚Äôt even blink. He‚Äôs feeling antsy, feeling all kinds of twisted up and angry and scared. Remus being away was hard. Remus being back is almost harder. And now this. He just needs to see James, to touch him, to hear him laugh. To know that he‚Äôs whole and there and okay.

‚ÄúAre you family?‚Äù the woman asks.

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

Her eyes run him up and down. ‚ÄúID?‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt have any. Promise you, he‚Äôs my family. Now tell me where I can find him.‚Äù

The woman‚Äôs expression hardens. ‚ÄúNo. Only family is allowed‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúSirius!‚Äù

He looks past the desk to see a frazzled redhead in purple pyjama bottoms and a Gryffindor sweatshirt walking towards him. Sirius start moving without sparing another glance for the woman behind the desk who he can hear calling after him. Lily practically launches herself into his arms and he gathers her up, squeezing tight.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so glad you‚Äôre here,‚Äù she says into his shoulder.

‚ÄúMe too. Have you seen him?‚Äù he asks as he places her back on her feet.

She nods, ‚ÄúYeah, yeah, him and Mar‚Äîthey‚Äôre okay. I can‚Äôt even imagine if we didn‚Äôt have magic‚Ä¶‚Äù she trails off. Sirius is only partially able to follow her train of thought but he doesn‚Äôt make her explain. He just wants to see James. ‚ÄúHey look Potter,‚Äù Marlene says when they walk into a small room with black and white tiles on the floor and yellowing paint on the walls. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs your husband.‚Äù

Marlene is bruised, with a nasty gash under her left eye, but she doesn‚Äôt seem to have anything more serious than that, sitting comfortably on the chair across from James‚Äôs bed. James looks much worse, Sirius‚Äôs breath catching in his chest when he sees him.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he hisses, staring at his friend‚Äôs swollen face.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry,‚Äù James says lightly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be beautiful again soon enough and you can go back to being the ugly marauder.‚Äù

From her he gets a real smile. ‚ÄúFucking peachy.‚Äù That actually makes him laugh.

‚ÄúOkay that‚Äôs it, Lily, I‚Äôm too weak to smack any sense into him, will you come over here and do it for me?‚Äù James whines.

‚ÄúKinky Evans.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou let Peter know?‚Äù He asks Lily eventually.

She nods. ‚ÄúSent him a Patronus, just like you.‚Äù

James turns to him, and Sirius notices for the first time that his glasses are cracked. ‚ÄúWhat do you wanna bet he slept through it?‚Äù

Sirius rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúWhat do you wanna bet he called it mum and told it to give him five more minutes?‚Äù

James snickers and then winces, eyes squeezing shut. Sirius feels all the mirth drain out of him.

‚ÄúAre you okay? Prongs? Someone get the Healer‚Äî‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine Padfoot,‚Äù James mumbles, eyes still closed, a wane smile pulling up the side of his mouth. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the concussion, they gave me a potion for it but it hasn‚Äôt‚Ä¶completely‚Ä¶fixed it yet,‚Äù he exhales like it‚Äôs difficult to talk. ‚ÄúComes and goes.‚Äù

Sirius sees Lily reach out and take James‚Äôs hand and he has the absurd desire to push her away. To never let anyone touch him ever again. He knows that James doesn‚Äôt belong to him. He does. It‚Äôs just that sometimes something in his chest forgets.

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù James says, face still tense. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be better in a minute.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat the fuck are you apologizing for?‚Äù Sirius demands, pulling another weak smile out of James.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm being a terrible host.‚Äù

Lily laughs at that, quiet and choked, and when Sirius looks over he can see his own worry and fear reflected in her eyes. They‚Äôd all fall apart without James, Sirius is almost certain. He‚Äôs the one who keeps them together, the one who holds them up. Without him the rest of them are dust.

Lily looks like she‚Äôs about to say something when the door to the room flies open and Dorcas comes charging through.

‚ÄúMar,‚Äù she says weakly, barely giving Marlene enough time to stand before she‚Äôs throwing her arms around her.‚ÄùOh thank Merlin.‚Äù

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Marlene says softly, hugging her girlfriend back. ‚ÄúI told you I was okay.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou told me you‚Äôd been attacked!‚Äù

‚ÄúAND that I was okay,‚Äù Marlene says, words partially smothered as Dorcas somehow manages to squeeze them closer.

‚ÄúAnd that you were in the hospital!‚Äù Dorcas insists.

‚ÄúOh, well, that‚Äôs mostly for James. He‚Äôs more delicate than me.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù James protests weakly from the bed.

Dorcas pulls back, hands going to cradle Marlene‚Äôs face, a small whimper leaving her mouth. ‚ÄúThey hurt you,‚Äù she nearly whispers, thumb brushing softly over the bruises on Marlene‚Äôs face.

Marlene looks back at her with soft eyes. ‚ÄúI really am okay.‚Äù

Something pinches in Sirius‚Äôs chest and he has to look away. There‚Äôs some part of him that feels like this is what it should have been like when Remus came home. Sirius should have rushed forward, should have taken him in his arms and told him how fucking worried he‚Äôd been. How happy he was that Remus was back. That he was alive. But then, Marlene hadn‚Äôt disappeared for a week without a word. Hadn‚Äôt turned back up and refused to say where she‚Äôd been or what she‚Äôd been doing.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to head home,‚Äù Marlene‚Äôs voice pulls Sirius out of his thoughts. She‚Äôs looking at James even though he still has his eyes closed. ‚ÄúYou going to be okay with these two?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James says. ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôll manage. It was fun working with you Mar, lets do it again soon yeah?‚Äù

Marlene laughs, walking forward and pressing a kiss to his forehead. ‚ÄúFeel better prick,‚Äù she whispers, before returning to Dorcas‚Äôs side. They wave to Lily and Sirius on their way out, Marlene leaning heavily into Dorcas.

Lily slumps against the wall as the door closes, still holding James‚Äôs hand. If he feels smothered by the two of them James doesn‚Äôt say anything. Maybe understanding their need to be close to him right now, to feel the proof that he‚Äôs okay beneath their hands.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù James says into the new silence, exaggerated cheerfulness in his voice. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôve you two been? Get up to anything exciting tonight?‚Äù

Lily snorts, but Sirius can‚Äôt quite manage to shake the question off. Rubbing his face with his free hand; ‚ÄúRemus came home.‚Äù

Lily instantly stands up straight again, James‚Äôs eyes snapping open causing him to wince.

‚ÄúOw‚ÄîWhat?‚Äù he demands.

‚ÄúIs he alright?‚Äù Lily asks at the same time. ‚ÄúWhere was he?‚Äù

Sirius lets out a bitter laugh. ‚ÄúWon‚Äôt tell me.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence and then James repeats; ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

Sirius shrugs, finding, suddenly, that he doesn‚Äôt want to talk about this. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs beat up pretty bad, looks like he was‚Ä¶‚Äù he trails off, trying to keep control of the feeling lashing out in his chest. ‚ÄúLike he was hit with a belt or‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt know,‚Äù he shakes his head, looking away.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù James says under his breath. ‚ÄúMerlin, where the hell was he?‚Äù

Sirius offers up another shrug because, isn‚Äôt that the million galleon question. He wonders, bitterly, if Remus would tell James. He might. ‚ÄúHe wanted to come,‚Äù he says before his thoughts can spiral too far down. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt let him, didn‚Äôt want him hurting himself. But, you should know that he wanted to be here.‚Äù

He isn‚Äôt sure what about that statement causes the silence that follows. If it‚Äôs his voice or his face, he still isn‚Äôt looking at either of them. Eventually James breaks the tension.

‚ÄúPsst, Evans,‚Äù he mock whispers. ‚ÄúCan you give Sirius a hug for me? I‚Äôm a little restrained at the moment.‚Äù

‚ÄúGod you‚Äôre such a dork.‚Äù

Sirius rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need a hug Prongs.‚Äù

‚ÄúMm, I beg to differ. Plus, Lily gives excellent hugs.‚Äù

‚ÄúObviously I know that,‚Äù he says, smiling despite himself as Lily steps around the bed. ‚ÄúMe and your girlfriend have embraced on several occasions.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay well you didn‚Äôt have to put it like that‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúAw babe, don‚Äôt be jealous,‚Äù Lily says teasingly.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not jealous,‚Äù James overemphasizes the last word. ‚ÄúI know you‚Äôd never leave me for him.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh no, I totally would.‚Äù

Sirius lets out a bark of laughter.

‚ÄúAlas,‚Äù she sighs dramatically, ignoring James‚Äôs outraged face. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs taken. But a girl can dream.‚Äù She bats her big green eyes at him.

‚ÄúC‚Äômere here Evans,‚Äù Sirius opens his arms and Lily goes to him quickly, her hold warm and strong and comforting. He actually does feel a little better.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre still here,‚Äù she whispers into his shoulder, up on her tiptoes to reach. ‚ÄúAfter everything we‚Äôre still here, still muddling through, that has to mean something doesn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

Sirius squeezes her back. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he croaks, though he isn‚Äôt entirely sure he believes it.

¬†

By the time Sirius gets back to the flat it‚Äôs nearly nine in the morning. He doesn‚Äôt hear anyone in the kitchen or find Remus lounging on the couch with a book as is his habit, and for one sharp, painful moment he‚Äôs afraid he made it all up. That he‚Äôd dreamed it and that Remus actually didn‚Äôt come back at all.

Of course the evidence of their dinner still sits in the drying rack and Sirius‚Äôs wet clothes are still hanging in the bathroom. But it isn‚Äôt until he‚Äôs standing in the doorway of their bedroom, until he sees Remus lying in their bed, wrapped in blankets, hair splayed out over the pillow, that he really starts breathing again. The knot in his stomach slowly undoing itself. Replaced by something else. A wave of emotion so intense he can hardly stand it.

Sirius escapes to the bathroom, shutting the door behind him and sitting down on the edge of the tub, head dropping between his knees as he tries to breathe. It‚Äôs too much. Losing Remus. Having him. Knowing he could lose him again. Knowing he almost lost James. It‚Äôs like they‚Äôre all standing in the middle of a frozen lake, wondering who the ice will crack under next. Sirius‚Äôs fingers dig into his skull. He just loves them so much. It‚Äôs awful. It hurts.

There‚Äôs a soft knock on the door but Sirius doesn‚Äôt bother answering, probably couldn‚Äôt even if he wanted to. He hears the sound of it opening, hears the hitch in Remus‚Äôs breath when he finds him.

‚ÄúOh Sirius,‚Äù he says softly, and in the next moment Remus is kneeling on the floor in front of him, hands on either side of Sirius‚Äôs face, lifting it up. ‚ÄúJames?‚Äù he asks, looking into Sirius‚Äôs red eyes.

‚ÄúFine,‚Äù he chokes out. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be fine.‚Äù

Remus nods, looking at Sirius for a moment longer before he starts pulling him down into his lap. It‚Äôs awkward and clumsy but Sirius goes willingly.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre hurt.‚Äù

Remus only scoffs. ‚ÄúYou hold me during my break down, I hold you during your‚Äôs, that‚Äôs how we get through this.‚Äù

Sirius laughs wetly into his shoulder, as Remus leans back against the wall.

‚ÄúIs that what we‚Äôre doing? Getting through it? Because I just feel like I‚Äôm standing still Remus. Standing still and watching everyone I love bleed.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt,‚Äù Remus holds him more tightly. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just as much a part of this as the rest of us.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a Black,‚Äù he sniffles bitterly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll always be on the outside. People will always wonder about me.‚Äù

‚ÄúThose people are idiots,‚Äù Remus says vehemently. ‚ÄúYou aren‚Äôt your name Sirius, you aren‚Äôt your family. You‚Äôve been proving that since you were eleven years old. Probably before, just none of us were there to see it.‚Äù

And he knows he should leave it. It‚Äôs been a long enough night. Long enough day. But he can‚Äôt help it.

‚ÄúThen why won‚Äôt you tell me where you were?‚Äù he whispers.

He feels Remus tense around him. ‚ÄúSirius‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúWhere did you go Remus? What did you do? Who fucking hurt you?‚Äù

‚ÄúI want to tell you,‚Äù Remus whispers back. ‚ÄúI swear I do.‚Äù

‚ÄúThen why don‚Äôt you?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a long pause, Remus buries his face in Sirius‚Äôs hair, squeezing him so tightly it feels like he‚Äôs trying to force Sirius between his ribs. Like he would share his skin with him if he could.

‚ÄúDumbledore‚Äî‚Äú Remus finally starts in a choked voice. ‚ÄúHe‚ÄîI promised Sirius, I gave him my word.‚Äù

Sirius takes another minute to enjoy the warmth of Remus‚Äôs arms before he pulls away, getting to his feet.

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú Remus says desperately, still on the bathroom floor. Sirius‚Äôs eyes flick down to him and then away.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to bed,‚Äù he says finally, voice rusted through. Maybe sleeping will help. Maybe he‚Äôll hate this less in the morning. Hate Remus less for this. For choosing the Order over him. He knows it‚Äôs a childish thing to want‚Äîto be the most important thing‚Äîno doubt a leftover from his childhood. But knowing what‚Äôs fucked him up never seems to fix the way he feels.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he hears Remus say uncertainly. ‚ÄúDo you want me to‚Äîdo you want me to come with you or‚Ä¶‚Äù he never would have asked before and Sirius feels himself wince, knowing this is his fault, if he could just let it go‚Ä¶ but he can feel old walls building up inside him.

‚ÄúDo what you want Remus,‚Äù he says flatly, not about to ask for someone who might walk away at any moment. Not about to ask for someone who isn‚Äôt always there. Sirius has been left before. He knows there‚Äôs no point in begging people to stay.

¬†

PART II JAMES

It‚Äôs a few days after the incident that James finds himself in Moody‚Äôs office with Marlene, Alice, Frank and Dumbledore. They‚Äôre discussing what happened‚Äîa debrief, Moody called it. Trying to figure out what Marlene and James could have done differently, which he thinks they both bristle at. He‚Äôs not sure there was anyway they were going to successfully defend themselves against six opponents, but Moody disagrees.

He wants to start putting Order members through training, wants them to learn defensive tactics, which is all well and good, Alice says, but they also need to conserve their forces. They‚Äôre spread too thin, working themselves ragged. They need to be more strategic. Alice is about the only person willing to talk to Moody like that, I mean, Dumbledore might but he doesn‚Äôt, at least not in front of the rest of them. Mostly he just sits back and observes.

In any case, eventually they decide to drop three locations from the guard rotations. Less than Alice wants and more than Moody wants. Frank‚Äôs idea. And then there‚Äôs the issue of the spy.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe you didn‚Äôt tell us,‚Äù Alice says indignantly, staring down Moody and Dumbledore like they aren‚Äôt two of the most powerful Wizards alive. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve known for weeks and you didn‚Äôt think to mention it?!‚Äù

‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt know,‚Äù Dumbledore responds calmly before Moody can bark back.‚ÄúWe suspected. Now, with this new information,‚Äù he nods his head in James‚Äôs direction. ‚ÄúOur suspicions are confirmed.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow‚Äôd you find this out again?‚Äù Frank asks, turning to James who fidgets in his chair.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîheard two of them talking about it.‚Äù

Thankfully, no one questions his story much.

‚ÄúSo what‚Äôre we going to do?‚Äù Marlene asks, leaning forward in her seat. ‚ÄúHow are we gonna catch him?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou lot,‚Äù Moody grumbles, ‚Äúaren‚Äôt going to do anything. Me and Albus will handle this.‚Äù

Alice arches an impressive eyebrow. ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

‚ÄúNone of your business.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow can you say that?! Of course it‚Äôs our business! We‚Äôre as much a part of this as‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúAlice,‚Äù Dumbledore doesn‚Äôt yell, doesn‚Äôt even sound angry, but there‚Äôs something about him that is undeniable. A single word and they all snap their attention right to him. Alice silenced.

‚ÄúI understand your frustration,‚Äù he goes on steadily. ‚ÄúBut this is a delicate situation, and the longer that the other side remains ignorant of our knowledge on this matter the more likely it is that we will be able to catch the individual in question. So, for the time being, you need to trust that me and Alastor have this in hand.‚Äù

Alice looks distinctly unhappy about this, chewing on her lower lip as she holds Dumbledore‚Äôs gaze. James reckons there‚Äôs a fifty percent chance she starts cursing them out again. Alice is fearless like that. After a few more seconds Frank steps forward, squeezing her arm. It‚Äôs clear that gesture communicates something the rest of them can‚Äôt hear because Alice seems to deflate slightly.

‚ÄúFine,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúBut we‚Äôre telling the people we trust.‚Äù

‚ÄúPeople you trust?‚Äù Moody barks. ‚ÄúHave I taught you nothing? You can trust no one.‚Äù

‚ÄúThen what do you call this,‚Äù she throws her arms out, gesturing to the room. ‚ÄúClearly you can trust some people. And if there is a threat this close to us I want the people I care about to know, to be able to protect themselves.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve already told Lily,‚Äù James interjects, before the argument can continue. ‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôm telling Sirius,‚Äù he looks specifically at Dumbledore when he says that, ‚Äúand Remus and Peter.‚Äù

‚ÄúPotter‚Äî‚Äú Moody starts, but James doesn‚Äôt want to hear it.

‚ÄúI won‚Äôt lie to them,‚Äù he says flatly. ‚ÄúAlice is right. They need to know, to keep themselves safe.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm telling Dorcas,‚Äù Marlene pipes up. ‚ÄúAnd Mary.‚Äù

They all stare back at the two old men defiantly. Moody looks like he‚Äôs about to have an aneurism but Dumbledore only seems mildly amused.

‚ÄúThis is ridiculous‚Äîno, worse‚Äîthis is reckless. Do you lot understand what is at stake here?‚Äù Moody demands.

‚ÄúI think they are well aware of the stakes Alastor,‚Äù Dumbledore interrupts before Alice can get going again. The older man‚Äôs eyes sweep over them thoughtfully. ‚ÄúI trust you all to use your judgement. Tell who you must, but understand that you are taking a risk.‚Äù

‚ÄúEverything‚Äôs a risk these days,‚Äù Alice says firmly. Dumbledore tilts his head to her in silent concession, after all, it‚Äôs not as though he can argue.

‚ÄúThis is a mistake,‚Äù Moody growls.

‚ÄúYour opinion is noted Alastor,‚Äù Dumbledore says calmly.

The other man only shakes his head, arms crossed over his chest in disapproval. When it is clear that Dumbledore will be saying no more on the matter Moody turns his attention back to James and Marlene. ‚ÄúYou good to go back on duty McKinnon or do you need more time to recover?‚Äù

Marlene grins, all scrapes and bruises magicked away. ‚ÄúDefinitely ready.‚Äù

Moody nods his approval. ‚ÄúGood girl,‚Äù his eyes move on to James next.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm good too,‚Äù he says before the old man can ask, however, this is met with less enthusiasm.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna need you to see a Mind Healer first Potter.‚Äù

James blinks. ‚ÄúI‚Äîwhat? Why?‚Äù

The room is uncomfortably silent as they all stare back at him. Eventually Alice steps forward.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù she says gently, like he‚Äôs some wounded animal. ‚ÄúYou killed someone. That‚Äôs‚Äîthat takes time to process. You need to give yourself that now so it doesn‚Äôt grow into something harder to handle later.‚Äù

Oh.

Right.

For a second, just a second, he considers telling them the truth. There‚Äôs no way anyone in this room is the snitch. There just isn‚Äôt. He wants them to know what Regulus did, wants to broach the topic of trying to get him out of Grimmauld to Dumbledore. But he promised. And if something were to happen to Regulus because of him‚Ä¶James would never forgive himself.

‚ÄúI‚Äîer‚Äîright. I think I‚Äôm okay though. I don‚Äôt really, I mean, I‚Äôm processing on my own. I don‚Äôt really need a mind healer.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs protocol,‚Äù Moody says, like that settles it.

‚ÄúYeah, but, I‚Äôm not exactly an Auror am I? So it‚Äôs not like protocol really applies to me.‚Äù

Moody seems to consider this, hand running absentmindedly along the scar on the under-side of his chin. ‚ÄúFair enough,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúUp to you I suppose.‚Äù

James smiles and then‚Äîrealizing immediately that that is absolutely an inappropriate response‚Äîquickly morphs his expression into something more solemn. ‚ÄúGreat. Put me back on the rotation.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú Alice starts, but Moody cuts her off.

‚ÄúLeave it Prewett, the boy‚Äôs made his decision.‚Äù

Alice gives him a flat look. ‚ÄúLongbottom.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere are two Longbottoms in this room, it‚Äôs too confusing,‚Äù he waves her off causing Alice to roll her eyes while Marlene tries to stifle her laughter.

‚ÄúGo on then you lot, get out of here,‚Äù Moody moves back behind his desk, groaning as he sits down. ‚ÄúLeave the grown-ups to our business.‚Äù James gets to his feet quickly, more than happy to be dismissed, though he sees Frank struggling to herd Alice out of the room.

Dumbledore offers James a small smile on his way towards the door. ‚ÄúGlad to see you recovering so quickly,‚Äù he says, though there feels like there‚Äôs something else behind those words. Like maybe he doesn‚Äôt quite buy James‚Äôs story about what happened in the shop.

Which is ridiculous.

There‚Äôs no reason for Dumbledore to be suspicious, he never knew about James and Regulus, Regulus made sure of that. James is just being paranoid. Still, he doesn‚Äôt want to risk saying the wrong thing so he just gives the old man a tight smile before following the others out of the room.

‚ÄúCome on,‚Äù Alice throws an arm around Marlene‚Äôs shoulders as they walk through the chaos outside Moody‚Äôs office. ‚ÄúLets get lunch, our treat,‚Äù she nods at Frank.

‚ÄúGee thanks mum and dad,‚Äù James puts on a voice that makes Alice laugh.

‚ÄúIs Lily free?‚Äù Marlene asks as they get into the elevator and head for the atrium. ‚ÄúYou should tell her to come with.‚Äù

‚ÄúNah she‚Äôs out with Fenwick, looking into the new missing persons case.‚Äù They all nod silently. These days, when people go missing, they usually don‚Äôt come back.

After what happened at the shop, after seeing Regulus again, James had worried that things with Lily would be‚Ä¶different. But they aren‚Äôt. He still feels the same rush of warmth when he sees her. Still loves the feel of her pressed to his chest when they fall asleep. Still loves going grocery shopping with her and listening to her rattle on about all the Muggle gadgets she misses, laughing with her about nothing‚Äîjust because they‚Äôre tired.

Seeing Regulus hasn‚Äôt dulled what he feels for Lily. What it has done, is make clear to him that being with Lily hasn‚Äôt dulled what he feels for Regulus. And that is a truth he doesn‚Äôt know what to do with. Surely you‚Äôre meant to love one person and then another, not two people at the same time? What he feels for Lily is so strong, so warm and comforting, that he‚Äôd just assumed it meant he no longer felt anything for Regulus. At least not in that way. But one look at him, one touch, and James is right back where he‚Äôd been two years ago. Hungry and desperate and hopelessly in love.

Maybe he does need to go to a Mind Healer‚Ä¶

‚ÄúOi,‚Äù Alice snaps her fingers in front of his face and James startles. ‚ÄúEarth to Potter, we‚Äôre trying to decide what to eat.‚Äù

‚ÄúUh,‚Äù James stutters as he tries to collect his thoughts. ‚ÄúAnything is fine with me. As long as it‚Äôs edible.‚Äù

Alice rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúUseless.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs that fish and chips place that‚Äôs close,‚Äù Frank volunteers.

‚ÄúIs there somewhere to sit though?‚Äù Marlene asks. ‚ÄúBecause I need a table.‚Äù

Alice smirks. ‚ÄúNot a park bench kind of girl, huh?‚Äù

Marlene sighs, sounding genuinely upset about it; ‚ÄúI‚Äôm way too clumsy for that kind of thing. I‚Äôll get ketchup everywhere.‚Äù

James is about to suggest that they just go outside and see what they can find, they‚Äôre in downtown London after all, they‚Äôre bound to run into something sooner or later, but then‚Äî

‚ÄúMalfoy!‚Äù someone shouts across the atrium and James feels his whole body jolt to a stop, something cold dripping down his spine.

James has heard Lucius Malfoy‚Äôs name countless times but he‚Äôs never actually been in the same room as him. He turns to see a tall, slender, blonde haired man standing near the fountain. He‚Äôs in an expensive looking set of black robes, surrounded by a group of other men who also appear to be wearing their wealth.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù

He barely hears Alice this time, his entire being focused on the man a few feet away. He‚Äôs always wondered what he‚Äôd feel if he ever saw him in the flesh. The person who hurt Regulus so deeply. I mean, he knew he would be angry, but the magnitude of it‚Äîhe just wasn‚Äôt sure what it would feel like.

It turns out it feels like ice. Cold and sharp and clear. There is no doubt in his mind about what he is going to do next. No wondering whether or not it‚Äôs the right thing. There‚Äôs only one option, one path his anger will let him take.

‚ÄúJames are you‚ÄîJames?‚Äù

He starts walking, making a B-line right for Lucius Malfoy.

He doesn‚Äôt pull out his wand.

He isn‚Äôt going to need it.

‚ÄúMalfoy!‚Äù he shouts when he‚Äôs within arms reach. The man has barely turned around before James throws his fist in his face, hearing the satisfying sound of something cracking. Malfoy stumbles back but James doesn‚Äôt let him get far, grabbing the front of his robes and half-tackling half-pushing him to the ground. He hits the stone floor hard, James on top of him.

He lands another hit. And another. Malfoy has worked through his shock enough to start fighting back but he‚Äôs at a disadvantage‚Äîalready on the ground, already bleeding. James doesn‚Äôt know why none of the men surrounding them try to pull him off, maybe they‚Äôre too surprised. Or too frightened. James imagines he must be at least a little intimidating, what with their friend‚Äôs blood dripping down his knuckles.

Finally he feels arms wrapping around him from behind, trying to pull him off. He‚Äôs vaguely aware that there‚Äôs shouting, he thinks he hears his name. He fights to get in one more hit, Lucius‚Äôs eyes wide and right on him.

‚ÄúEnough James!‚Äù

That‚Äôs Frank. Frank rarely yells, at least off the Quidditch Pitch, and for some reason that‚Äôs enough to make James pause‚Äîgiving Frank the chance to pull him the rest of the way off.

‚ÄúWhere are the Aurors?‚Äù one of the men in the fancy robes is shouting. ‚ÄúI want the bloody Aurors! I want him arrested! This is assault! And in the Ministry of Magic of all places!‚Äù

‚ÄúWe are the Aurors,‚Äù Alice snaps at him. ‚ÄúNow someone take Malfoy to St Mungos before he gets blood all over the floor,‚Äù she gestures to Lucius who is currently being supported by two of his friends, clutching his face but never taking his eyes off of James.

‚ÄúI know what you did to him, motherfucker!‚Äù James shouts, feeling somehow completely out of control and completely in control all at the same time. ‚ÄúI know what you fucking did!‚Äù

‚ÄúEnough,‚Äù Frank starts dragging him away‚ÄîJames isn‚Äôt even sure where they‚Äôre going‚ÄîAlice still arguing with the men behind them.

‚ÄúWhat the hell was that James?‚Äù Marlene demands as she helps Frank shove him down the hallway. James doesn‚Äôt answer, doesn‚Äôt know how to. Instead he flexes his hands, feeling them burn.

He hadn‚Äôt known how he would react to seeing Lucius Malfoy. Hadn‚Äôt known how it would feel. But now he does. And he also knows, that if he sees him again, he‚Äôll fucking kill him.

¬†

PART III REGULUS

‚ÄúYour turn,‚Äù Regulus says, surveying the various cards in his hand. He sighs as his Queen of Hearts starts picking a fight with his Queen of Spades and he‚Äôs forced to shuffle them.

His father kisses his teeth, propped up in bed gesturing to the cards lying on the mattress between them. ‚ÄúLook at this,‚Äù he says teasingly. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre destroying me. Me. Your father, a dying man, have you no mercy?‚Äù

Regulus smiles, rolling his eyes. ‚ÄúJust play your card papa.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlways so serious,‚Äù his father shakes his head, though he doesn‚Äôt quite manage to hide his smile. ‚ÄúJust like your mother. Your brother on the other hand, he certainly knew how to have a good time.‚Äù His father lets out a wheezy laugh and Regulus does his best to remain impassive. He talks about Sirius a lot these days, like he thinks he can summon him with his old anecdotes.

Regulus watches his father‚Äôs play, recalculating before he makes his next move.

‚ÄúA pair!‚Äù his father squawks. ‚ÄúMon dieu.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf this is your attempt to lull me into a false sense of security it‚Äôs not working. I know you have a strong hand,‚Äù Regulus says flatly.

Orion grins at him, watery eyes sparkling with mischief. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs because you count the cards.‚Äù

Regulus can‚Äôt help but grin back. ‚ÄúI wonder who taught me that?‚Äù

His father laughs a little more heartily. ‚ÄúFair enough mon chou,‚Äù there‚Äôs a loud crack just as he‚Äôs playing his next card.

‚ÄúMasters,‚Äù Kreacher says, stepping forward.

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù Orion smiles. ‚ÄúIs it time for tea yet?‚Äù Today is a good day, he‚Äôs lucid and energetic and hungry. Regulus is trying to savour it. There aren‚Äôt many good days.

‚ÄúNo Sir, my Mistress has asked that Master Regulus please come speak with her in the drawing room.‚Äù

Regulus does his best to suppress a shiver. This, he imagines, will not be fun.

‚ÄúThank you Kreacher,‚Äù Regulus says as he places his cards face down on the bedside table. ‚ÄúYou can tell her I‚Äôll be right down.‚Äù

Kreacher nods and with another crack disappears from the room. Regulus leans over and gives his father a kiss on the cheek. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be right back,‚Äù he says as he pulls away, and then points an accusing finger at him. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt cheat.‚Äù

His father gasps dramatically. ‚ÄúMe? Cheat? How dare you!‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúYeah, yeah,‚Äù he says, smiling on his way into the hall.

He doesn‚Äôt spend much time in the drawing room, that has more or less become his mother‚Äôs domain. It‚Äôs where the fireplace is, so she spends most days in and out, taking calls. Regulus isn‚Äôt really sure who she‚Äôs talking to or what she has to tell them but he mostly doesn‚Äôt want to know.

‚ÄúCome in,‚Äù his mother says when he knocks.

The walls are covered in floral paper, his mother standing at the fireplace, hand resting on the mantle. Regulus closes the door and then stops a few feet in, hands clasped behind his back, waiting. The silence between them lasts far longer than he would like but he doesn‚Äôt fidget, not even when her eyes run him up and down, no doubt looking for imperfections. There‚Äôs something slightly off in her expression but Regulus isn‚Äôt sure what it is.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve done your family proud these last few years,‚Äù she says finally, startling Regulus.

‚ÄúOh‚ÄîI‚Äîthank you?‚Äù he still doesn‚Äôt move, doesn‚Äôt relax his posture, watching his mother warily.

She nods her head, as if deciding something. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs time you married.‚Äù

Regulus chokes on his next inhale, hands going to his throat as he coughs and splutters. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù he manages to get out, looking up to see his mother still standing at the fireplace, her brow arched.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a young man, the head of the household, it is time you had a wife. Someone from a suitable family. It will send the right message.‚Äù

Regulus is struggling to keep up. ‚ÄúThe right message?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat the House of Black is strong, that it is alive and well and continuing on.‚Äù

Continuing on.

Oh Jesus.

‚ÄúI‚Äîmaman I‚Äôm not‚Äîthere isn‚Äôt even anyone I‚Äôm‚Ä¶courting,‚Äù he struggles through his shock, trying to get his brain to start working again, to figure out what to say to convince her that this is a terrible idea.

His mother waves a dismissive hand. ‚ÄúThat makes no difference, there are several families with daughters your age. I will make the arrangements.‚Äù

Fuck.

Panic is slowly starting to build in his chest. ‚ÄúI really don‚Äôt think this is‚Ä¶the time. Not with everything‚Ä¶‚Äù he swallows around the rock in his throat. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather not‚Ä¶I think we should wait.‚Äù

His mother‚Äôs face is as cold and hard as stone, no feeling in her eyes. ‚ÄúYou must Regulus. You must have a son. You know this. These things must happen.‚Äù

He supposes he did know that, but he‚Äôs never really thought about it, about what it would actually mean. He has no plan for this. It just seems so‚Ä¶twisted. He can‚Äôt be with‚Ä¶a woman. Merlin, how is he going to make a child? He wonders absentmindedly if there‚Äôs a potion for this sort of thing.

‚ÄúYou have done so well Regulus,‚Äù his mother finally says, breaking the silence. Regulus looks up at her. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let me down now.‚Äù There‚Äôs something about her voice, about the intensity‚Äîthe emphasis she places on her words‚Äîthat makes Regulus wonder if maybe his father told her. Told her about Regulus. Told her that he‚Äôs‚Ä¶something squirms low in his gut.

‚ÄúOkay maman,‚Äù he says eventually, partially because he‚Äôs scared and partially because there‚Äôs nothing else he can say. There never is. ‚ÄúIf that‚Äôs what you feel is best.‚Äù

Walburga nods approvingly. ‚ÄúGood boy.‚Äù

¬†

It‚Äôs early evening by the time Regulus gets back to Grimmauld but he‚Äôs fucking exhausted. He climbs the stairs to his bedroom, shutting the door and immediately crawling under the covers without even getting undressed. He just doesn‚Äôt want to think for a moment, doesn‚Äôt want to deal with the anxiety boiling inside of him, clawing at his skin. He just wants the darkness of sleep to swallow him up. He‚Äôll figure out how to put this off tomorrow, how to convince his mother there‚Äôs another way. Or maybe convince himself that he can do it. He‚Äôs never tried being with a girl before. In fact, he‚Äôs never really tried being with anyone except James.

He squeezes his eyes more firmly shut, curling onto his side and ignoring the memories that come to mind. The warmth of being in James‚Äôs arms again, the overwhelming sense of

Here.

Here is where I‚Äôm meant to be.
I‚Äôve been away too long.

I‚Äôm so happy to be home again.

It isn‚Äôt useful to think like that. To feel like that. It was a fluke that James and him ended up in that shop together that night. It won‚Äôt happen again and that‚Äôs probably a good thing if either of them wants to stay alive.

Regulus slowly drifts. The world grows fuzzy and distant and dark. He hasn‚Äôt been sleeping well since the raid on the shop. It isn‚Äôt that he‚Äôs all that bothered about killing Snyde. It had to be done and he‚Äôd do it again. But. But for some reason it‚Äôs gone and rattled something in him. He keeps dreaming of being in the back garden in Scotland, with Bellatrix and Lucius and his mother all trying to get him to kill the rabbit. Except then the rabbit isn‚Äôt a rabbit. It‚Äôs Johnathan.

No, please, please, please.

I‚Äôm a good man.

I swear.

I‚Äôm going to get married.

Sometimes he‚Äôs tied up‚Äîin a pen like the rabbits‚Äîbut other times he‚Äôs free and he crawls right up to Regulus‚Äôs feet. His face so clear Regulus swears he‚Äôs really there.

Please, please, please.

I love her.

I promised I‚Äôd come back.

We‚Äôre going to start a family.

Have mercy.

He kills him. Every time. In every dream. No matter how badly he tries not to. How loudly he screams at himself to put his wand down. He does it. Usually he wakes up crying. On his more shameful nights he wets the bed. He‚Äôs started thinking maybe Narcissa isn‚Äôt the only one who needs some dreamless sleep.

He drifts away as early evening turns to late evening. And everything is okay, thoughts perhaps too tied up with trying to overcome the threat of marriage to conjure any other nightmares. It‚Äôs looking like he might actually get a full nights sleep.

Until.
