‚ÄúChildren,‚Äù Liam calls out, smiling from the doorway. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt make me put you in time out.‚Äù

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt realize the whole daddy thing was a kink of yours Liam,‚Äù Gabe says, finally letting a very frazzled Ava go.

Liam‚Äôs face goes beet red, mouth falling open in an expression that has Remus struggling not to laugh.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry Liam,‚Äù Gabe pats his arm as he scoots past him into the kitchen. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt judge.‚Äù

Remus shoots Liam an apologetic look as he follows Gabe into the house.

‚ÄúI hate him,‚Äù he hears Ava say behind them.

‚ÄúYou keep telling yourself that,‚Äù Liam replies.

Dinner is nice. A bit less energetic than normal perhaps but there‚Äôs something so‚Ä¶warm about it. So comforting. No one fusses over him, no one sends him nervous looks. There‚Äôs no need for him to feel self-conscious about the few scrapes on his face, no need to come up with excuses. People discuss the full moon like it‚Äôs‚Ä¶normal. No big deal‚Äîsmall talk. This thing he‚Äôs spent his whole life hiding with his every breath is here laid bare. It‚Äôs‚Ä¶he‚Äôs not sure he even has the words to describe it. What it means. How that feels, after all this time.

‚ÄúExcuse me.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs looks up to see Jack leaving the table early, heading out the front door. He‚Äôs been quiet all day. Quiet since Remus got here honestly. Head down, eyes on the floor.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll be back in a minute,‚Äù Remus says, to no one in particular, Gabe and Ava once again engaged in an argument so intensely he probably could have grown wings and they wouldn‚Äôt have noticed.

He walks outside, worried he waited too long, that he won‚Äôt be able to find Jack. But thankfully, the kid is just sitting on the porch steps, staring out at the long driveway in front of him. Remus takes in a deep breath before stepping forward and sitting down next to him.

Jack instantly stiffens.

‚ÄúWhen I was fifteen my friend‚Äî‚Äú his throat closes for a moment, hands shaking already. He holds onto his knees, neither him nor Jack looking at each other, but he knows the other boy is listening.

‚ÄúWhen I was fifteen,‚Äù he starts again, ‚Äúmy‚Ä¶friend, he told someone at school how to get to me on the full moon.‚Äù

Jack hisses, like he‚Äôs been burned. ‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù the word so soft Remus can barely hear him.

There is something strangely affirming about having him understand instantly, what that would mean. How much that would mean. Sirius will never know how vulnerable it is to transform. To be stripped down to your barest instincts and thoughts and desires. All he sees are claws and teeth. All he sees is brute strength. But that isn‚Äôt how it feels. It feels‚Ä¶exposing.

‚ÄúAnd this, this kid he told, he found me. Saw me. It‚Äî‚Äú he closes his eyes briefly. He does his best not to go back here too often. Especially to those first moments, to the fear of seeing Snape in that doorway, the primal panic.

‚ÄúDid you bite him?‚Äù Jack asks, staring at his hands.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Remus holds back a wince. ‚ÄúNo I‚Äîmy other‚Äîmy‚ÄîJames, he showed up and he, he stopped it from going too far but I still attacked them. Attacked both of them. And I hurt them,‚Äù he silently curses the way his voice wobbles.

‚ÄúWhich is my way of telling you,‚Äù Remus pushes on. ‚ÄúThat I get it, what you‚Äôre feeling, and that I don‚Äôt blame you, for what happened.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a long pause, but Jack doesn‚Äôt immediately get up and walk away so Remus assumes he hasn‚Äôt completely screwed this up. The teen boy picks at the fabric covering his knee, still not looking at Remus.

‚ÄúIt isn‚Äôt the same though,‚Äù he says finally, like explaining this is difficult.

‚ÄúIt isn‚Äôt?‚Äù

Jack frowns. ‚ÄúNo one really has control of themselves on the full moon, but I‚ÄîI should have been able to‚Äî‚Äú he sighs, frustrated, shaking his head. ‚ÄúIt shouldn‚Äôt have been like that for me. I should have been in control.‚Äù

God Remus really wants to give this kid a hug. ‚ÄúIt was your first time, give yourself a break okay? It was a freak accident. It doesn‚Äôt make you‚Ä¶it doesn‚Äôt define you,‚Äù he struggles with his words. ‚ÄúThat one moment isn‚Äôt who you are,‚Äù something he has told himself over and over again and never really been able to believe. He can only hope Jack has better luck.

‚ÄúI just‚Ä¶‚Äù Jack sighs, scrubbing at his face. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want that to be me, you know? I didn‚Äôt want to believe that it could be. I‚Äôve never hurt anyone before.‚Äù

Remus smiles wanly. ‚ÄúI know, really I know. But it isn‚Äôt you. I promise.‚Äù

Jack sniffles. ‚ÄúBut how can you say that? Because‚Äîbecause it was. Because I did that. I‚Äî‚Äú his voice breaks and he turns his face away. Remus doesn‚Äôt know what to say. Doesn‚Äôt know how to comfort this kid when he can‚Äôt even comfort himself.

‚ÄúI try so hard, you know? To be okay with it,‚Äù Jack goes on eventually, voice thick. ‚ÄúNot okay with what I did to you but just okay with‚Ä¶with what I am. The way the others are. But sometimes I just‚Ä¶‚Äù Remus can practically feel the pain pouring out of him. ‚ÄúI just really hate myself.‚Äù

If he was Mia or Gabe Remus thinks he would probably have something encouraging to say now. Something uplifting. And maybe he should have let them handle this instead because all that comes out of his mouth is: ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù rough and scratched. ‚ÄúYeah me too.‚Äù They stay like that for a long time. Neither of them talking.

¬†

It‚Äôs two days later that Remus wakes to screaming.

It‚Äôs barely dawn, the sun only just coming up, Remus‚Äôs room still cold and dark. He thinks he might be dreaming. That the screaming is his mother. It lingers sometimes, when he has nightmares about the attack. But he‚Äôs barely pulled himself upright in bed before the door to his room is thrown open and two men come storming in.

Fear shoots through him and he tries to lunge for his wand on the bedside table but they get to him first. Grabbing hold of his t-shirt and throwing him into the wall, pulling his hands behind his back.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck,‚Äù he shouts, bucking and twisting, trying to pull himself free. Fighting‚Äôs never really been his strong suit, not like this. That‚Äôs really more James‚Äôs area of expertise. Or Sirius‚Äôs. Fucking Quidditch players.

‚ÄúWho the fuck are you?‚Äù he‚Äôs still tired and can‚Äôt quite keep his voice from shaking. He thinks they might be with Greyback. Must be. And the idea of having to face that man with his hands bound behind his back and no wand makes Remus panic.

He struggles, noises drifting in from downstairs, from outside. He wonders where the kids are, if someone‚Äôs with them. If they‚Äôre safe. Wonders where Gabe is. Ava. Liam. He kicks and shakes and thrashes around but nothing works.

‚ÄúOh Merlins‚Äôs‚Äîstay still you fucking mutt,‚Äù the man holding him rips him away from the wall as his friend shoves a wand in Remus‚Äôs face. Which‚Ä¶which doesn‚Äôt seem right. Werewolves don‚Äôt usually use wands. ‚ÄúStay still or I‚Äôll curse your furry little balls off understood?‚Äù

For the first time Remus gets a good look at the man in front of him. He‚Äôs in black like Greyback had been, but these are robes not street clothes, and they‚Äôre fresh and crisp. Identical uniforms.

‚ÄúAre you Death Eaters?‚Äù he asks, confused enough that he‚Äôs stopped fighting. He doesn‚Äôt recognize them and neither of them are wearing masks or baring their forearms so he can‚Äôt tell. The man in front of him doesn‚Äôt answer, instead he brings his elbow up and cracks it into Remus‚Äôs face. Pain shoots through his jaw and he spits blood out onto the floor‚Äîhe bit his tongue.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt fucking speak to me,‚Äù the man says. And then, presumably to his colleague who still has Remus bound. ‚ÄúLets go, put him with the others.‚Äù

Remus doesn‚Äôt bother resisting as they drag him from the barn, his head still aching from that hit. He sees others, some look like they‚Äôve been stunned, some being hauled across the lawn like him. He checks the sky but there‚Äôs no sign of a Dark Mark and still there‚Äôs not a mask in sight, though all the men and women are in identical black robes.

‚ÄúWho are you?‚Äù Remus asks again.

The man holding his arms and shoving him forward delivers a jab to his lower back that causes Remus to stumble.

‚ÄúHe told you not to fucking speak.‚Äù

God Remus really wishes he hadn‚Äôt gotten into the habit of sleeping without his wand. Back at the flat they always have them on their person now. Moody made it protocol and honestly, it‚Äôs one of the few rules that even Sirius didn‚Äôt bitch about. A bit uncomfortable but it makes you feel safer. He‚Äôd gotten too complacent here. He closes his eyes briefly, cursing himself.

The noise gets louder the closer they get to the main house. Remus thinks they‚Äôre going to go inside but instead he starts being dragged towards the front lawn. He sees the cages first. Black bars, holding three or four people in each. People he knows. People he‚Äôs been having dinner with every night for the past week.

He sees his father second.

Remus‚Äôs feet stop working, causing the man behind him to almost trip over him. ‚ÄúWhat the fuck,‚Äù he mutters, shoving Remus forward, forcing him to move.

An icy cold sensation has descended on Remus.

‚ÄúDad?‚Äù he croaks. And then, louder. ‚ÄúDad?‚Äù

Lyall Lupin‚Äôs head turns and for the first time in years he looks at his son. And his eyes go wide, his apathetic mask cracking, replaced by something akin to horror, making Remus flinch.

‚ÄúDad?‚Äù the man holding him repeats. ‚ÄúWhat the fuck are you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúLet him go,‚Äù his father‚Äôs voice comes out full of authority as he starts walking towards them, people turning to stare.

‚ÄúSir?‚Äù

‚ÄúI said let him go,‚Äù there‚Äôs no emotion in the command.

After a second Remus‚Äôs arms are released, and he brings them around to his front, massaging his wrists.

‚ÄúGo help the others,‚Äù Lyall says gruffly, the man nodding his head, eyes darting between father and son before heading off in the direction of the cages.

For a moment Lyall and Remus stand in silence, staring at one another, the only stillness in the chaos surrounding them.

And then; ‚ÄúWhatever you‚Äôre doing you have to stop,‚Äù Remus manages to force his voice to work again, ‚Äúthey aren‚Äôt‚Äîthis isn‚Äôt what you think. They aren‚Äôt how you think.‚Äù

But he isn‚Äôt sure his father even hears him, staring down at Remus like he doesn‚Äôt recognize him. It makes him feel small. Like a child. Somewhere in the distance someone screams again, Remus thinks it‚Äôs one of the little kids. He swallows with difficulty and presses on.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre good people, they‚Äôre‚ÄîI know how you feel about‚Äîbut don‚Äôt do this. I‚Äôve never asked you for anything but I‚Äôm asking now. Don‚Äôt do this to them.‚Äù It‚Äôs a struggle to get the words out, his voice jumpy and cracking all over the place.

Still Lyall is a wall of silence and disapproval.

‚ÄúSir!‚Äù someone calls from the front. ‚ÄúSir we have a bit of a situation.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm coming,‚Äù Lyall yells back over his shoulder, eyes never leaving Remus.

‚ÄúPlease,‚Äù he practically whispers. But it‚Äôs no use. His father never did seem to care when he begged.

‚ÄúGet out of here,‚Äù Lyall says finally. ‚ÄúApparate back to London, I‚Äôll make sure there‚Äôs no record of your presence here.‚Äù

Remus feels his heart sink. He could tell his father, of course, that the only reason he‚Äôs here is because Moody told him to be. That he‚Äôs working for the Ministry. The Order. But he doesn‚Äôt want to. It would feel like a betrayal of everyone here who has shown him so much kindness. Besides, he isn‚Äôt even sure if it‚Äôs true anymore.

‚ÄúDad‚Äî‚Äú he follows as Lyall walks away towards the front of the house. ‚ÄúDad, please,‚Äù he sounds desperate and whinny. He wishes he could speak with some authority, wishes he didn‚Äôt turn into a spineless little kid ever time his father was around. Afraid of being locked up in the basement, with the doors that burned to touch. ‚ÄúDad‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúWhat the hell do you think you‚Äôre doing Lyall?‚Äù Mia‚Äôs voice thunders across the lawn as she‚Äôs dragged from the house.

‚ÄúREMUS!‚Äù

He whips his head around to see Gabe being shuffled towards the cages behind him, Ava and Liam already inside, looking like they‚Äôve taken a beating and also like they‚Äôre trying to shrink away from the bars. Wolf‚Äôs Bane, he realizes, they‚Äôve covered the bars in Wolf‚Äôs Bane.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure how many times this has to be explained to you,‚Äù Lyall says, sounding haggard. ‚ÄúBut the new laws state that there cannot be a gathering of more than two werewolves in a single location at any given time. Since you are all in clear violation of this law, the Ministry has seen fit to take action.‚Äù

Remus feels his stomach drop. The law, his father‚Äôs law, it passed.

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt you start with your legal bullshit,‚Äù they‚Äôre yelling at one another across the lawn, several feet apart, the men holding Mia clearly uncertain about whether or not they should keep dragging her towards the cages.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt just put laws into immediate effect that‚Äôs absurd, it‚Äôs goddamn tyrannical. It hasn‚Äôt even been passed a whole twenty-four hours. You have absolutely no right to do this!‚Äù

‚ÄúOn the contrary,‚Äù Lyall goes on, unruffled. ‚ÄúI have the complete support of the Wizenmagot. Your pack is seen as an immediate threat to the safety of the Wizarding world and therefore dismantling it is top priority.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis is a violation of our rights! It‚Äôs completely unconstitutional.‚Äù

But once again, Lyall is unfazed. ‚ÄúYou seem to be mistaken. Werewolves have no civil rights, they are not seen as citizens under British Wizarding law. I am violating nothing.‚Äù He turns his attention to the men behind her. ‚ÄúGet her in a cage.‚Äù

Remus feels like he might be sick.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt do this,‚Äù he tries again, stepping in front of his dad. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm begging you, I‚Äôm begging as your son don‚Äôt do this.‚Äù

When Lyall turns his gaze on Remus it‚Äôs so cold he almost shivers. ‚ÄúI told you to leave.‚Äù

Remus opens his mouth when the screaming starts again, and that‚Äôs when he sees Charlotte. She looks terrified, grabbing for the Ministry Wizards, clinging to them as they try to push her away, try to tell her to go sit on the steps.

‚ÄúYou have to hold her,‚Äù Mia shouts as she struggles against the men attempting to stuff her in a cage. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs afraid, she‚Äôs just been attacked, she‚Äôs scared of being left on the ground.‚Äù

Charlotte is hysterical, it hurts to watch, to hear, and yet somehow the Ministry wizards look on without feeling. Because, of course, they don‚Äôt see a little girl. They see a werewolf.

Remus turns to his dad, but his face is expressionless.

‚ÄúAre you really just going to stand there and do nothing?‚Äù he growls. ‚ÄúReally gonna let that little girl suffer?‚Äù Lyall doesn‚Äôt respond, watching the scene unfold with disinterest.

Remus laughs without humour. ‚ÄúMerlin, it‚Äôs a good thing I had mum there to look out for me, if this is how you treat us.‚Äù

His father‚Äôs head snaps towards him, eyes bright with furry. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you dare bring up your mother,‚Äù he says in a voice that is quiet and dangerous and far more frightening than yelling could possibly be. ‚ÄúShe would be ashamed if she could see you now. Here. Throwing away everything we fought so hard to give you.‚Äù

It shouldn‚Äôt matter what he says. What he thinks. It‚Äôs not as though Remus respects him. And yet‚Ä¶

She would be ashamed if she could see you now.

Those words land like a punch to his gut, and Remus actually stumbles back from the force of them. He‚Äôs reeling so hard that he doesn‚Äôt hear what‚Äôs going on in the background. Mind going momentarily numb until one of the Ministry goons starts shouting.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck! What the fuck is she doing?‚Äù

Remus turns his head just in time to see Mia transforming, her jaw extending, her pupils blowing wide, her legs and arms growing long as claws sprout from her fingers. Throwing off the men trying to hold her back. The she-wolf who couldn‚Äôt ignore the crying of children.

Remus barely has time to step forward, to raise his arm, to think the words ‚Äúno‚Äù and ‚Äúdon‚Äôt‚Äù before a man in black robes is pointing his wand right at her.

‚ÄúAvada Kedavra.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs eyes instantly snap shut. A stupid little kid thing to do. But maybe if he doesn‚Äôt see it then it never happened.

Silence seems to fall over them. Time stopping. And then. And then Gabe starts to scream.

‚ÄúNO! NO! NO!‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs eyes fly open again and he turns around to see his friend, not yet caged like the others, thrashing around, tears coming furiously to his eyes.

‚ÄúNO,‚Äù he just keeps saying, sobbing, voice shattered as he stares helplessly at the woman who raised him. Who cared for him. Who gave him a life when no one else believed he deserved one.

‚ÄúGet off of me! Get off of me!‚Äù he‚Äôs growling, and Remus can already see it happening, already see where this is going. ‚ÄúGet the fuck off of me I swear I‚Äôm going to fucking kill you. All of you!‚Äù

Remus starts running, legs numb as he sees Gabe begin to transform himself.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt,‚Äù he chokes out. ‚ÄúGabe stop!‚Äù he practically runs into him, Gabe‚Äôs eyes big and glassy when they find Remus.

‚ÄúHelp me, Remus you have to help me, we have to save her. You have to help me.‚Äù

Remus feels himself struggling not to choke. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry Gabe, I‚Äôm so sorry‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo, no, don‚Äôt‚Äîdon‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú Gabe stutters, thrashing around again, growling. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna kill them. I‚Äôm gonna fucking kill them.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt Gabe, you can‚Äôt,‚Äù he grabs hold of the other boy‚Äôs face, forcing him to be still, forcing Gabe to look at him, wiping the angry tears away with his thumbs. ‚ÄúThey have magic‚Äîthey have wands‚Äîyou can‚Äôt fight them.‚Äù

Gabe shakes under his hands, it feels so twisted and wrong to see his happy face such a mess. ‚ÄúWhat difference does it make‚Äù he asks weakly. ‚ÄúWithout her what difference does it make?‚Äù

Remus fights the urge to scream, to crumble and curl in on himself. How could this have happened? How could this have happened?

‚ÄúThe others‚Äîthey need you,‚Äù he manages to say, still cradling Gabe‚Äôs face, trying to be gentle, trying to be strong, trying to be any use at all. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt leave them now Gabe, you can‚Äôt.‚Äù

A whimper escapes the other boy‚Äôs mouth as he begins to sob in earnest, like the anger has left him and all that remains is the unbearable sadness of losing the one person you never wanted to live without.

‚ÄúWhat are you waiting for?‚Äù Remus flinches at the sound of his father‚Äôs voice. ‚ÄúLock him up. We‚Äôre done here.‚Äù

The men start dragging Gabe towards the cages again.

‚ÄúRemus‚Äî‚Äú he says weakly, sounding afraid for the first time since Remus has known him.

‚ÄúNo, wait, wait where are you taking them?‚Äù he goes to use his wand, to get the men off of Gabe, but of course he doesn‚Äôt have it. Instead he grabs their arms, tries to pull them away but he‚Äôs easily thrown to the ground. ‚ÄúNo, please, stop,‚Äù he reaches for the closing cage door but the minute his hands touch the metal bars he‚Äôs burned, yanking them back with an agonized growl as the cage is locked.

He looks at the terrified faces of his friends, hand cradled against his stomach before he turns back to his dad. He doesn‚Äôt know where Charlotte has gone, he thinks he can hear crying still in the distance but he isn‚Äôt sure. In the periphery of his vision is Mia‚Äôs body but he doesn‚Äôt let himself look there.

‚ÄúDad,‚Äù he stumbles forward, feeling so completely at a loss for what to do. ‚ÄúListen, I‚Äôm begging you to listen.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou aren‚Äôt being arrested as a favour to me,‚Äù Lyall says, looking out at the cages in front of him. ‚ÄúIt is the last favour I will be doing you.‚Äù Finally his eyes find Remus‚Äôs again. ‚ÄúYou aren‚Äôt my son. You haven‚Äôt been for a very long time.‚Äù

Since you were five, is what he doesn‚Äôt say. Since before Greyback got his teeth in you.

‚ÄúAnd whose fucking fault is that?‚Äù he finds himself spitting back.

Lyall gives him one last look over before whistling to his team. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Apparating in three‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúApparating?‚Äù

‚ÄúTwo‚Äù

‚ÄúWait, Apparating where?‚Äù Remus looks frantically at the cages. ‚ÄúWhere are you taking them?‚Äù

‚ÄúThree.‚Äù

¬†

Of all the things that magic has accomplished. Perhaps nothing is quite so devastating, as how easy it makes it for people to disappear.

¬†

He‚Äôs does find them, eventually.

They‚Äôre taken back to the Ministry. He‚Äôd been worried at first that his father would bring them to Azkaban, but apparently they aren‚Äôt actually planning on holding them. Instead the adults are interrogated. For hours. Moody says he can‚Äôt stop it, that Lyall Lupin has been granted special permission and a task force to carry out this exact mission. The Auror‚Äôs are not involved, and therefore it is out of Moody‚Äôs hands. Not that he seems overly disapproving of Lyall‚Äôs actions.

No one is allowed to return to the farm.

No one is allowed to see each other.

Tracking spells are fixed on all the werewolves.

It takes him a while, but eventually Remus finds the room they‚Äôre questioning Gabe in and despite numerous people telling him repeatedly that he isn‚Äôt allowed to be there, he sits down on the floor outside the door and he waits.

And waits.

And waits.

His head grows heavy and he ends up resting his forehead on his knees, the adrenaline completely gone from his system, leaving him worn out and exhausted and wanting to go home more badly than he has in a long time. Wanting to be in his bed. With his Padfoot. Wanting to hear Sirius laugh and tell him he loves him.

He knows he doesn‚Äôt necessarily deserve any of that. But fuck does he need it.

‚ÄúWaiting for me?‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs head pops up as Gabe collapses onto the floor next to him. He looks about as awful as Remus feels.

‚ÄúYou okay?‚Äù he asks, before cursing himself. Stupid question.

Gabe laughs without humour, running a hand over his face. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he croaks, staring at the wall across from them. ‚ÄúNot even a little bit.‚Äù

Remus feels his heartbreak. ‚ÄúGabe‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúYou know they just left her body there?‚Äù he says, voice shaking with barely contained rage. ‚ÄúI asked them and they didn‚Äôt even seem ashamed, fucking happy to tell me. Left her there like she was nothing. Roadkill. You think there‚Äôs anyway they would leave a wizard like that? I mean even if they‚Äôd committed the most heinous crime I bet you they would still have the respect to collect their fucking body. Still recognize their humanity enough to do that much.‚Äù

Remus reaches out, squeezing Gabe‚Äôs arm.

‚ÄúShe tried so hard,‚Äù he presses on, voice cracking, ‚Äúto play by their rules, to do everything the right way, everything they asked. And what did it matter? In the end? What did it get her?‚Äù He drops his head like he‚Äôs trying to catch his breath, trying to hold onto himself.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Remus finally says into the quiet of the hallway. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry. Fuck Gabe, I‚Äôm so sorry.‚Äù

After a minute Gabe nods, a new determination flickering across his face. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm taking Greyback up on his offer.‚Äù

Remus‚Äôs hand pulls back like he‚Äôs just been burned. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm done trying to show them I‚Äôm not a threat,‚Äù he looks at Remus now, dead in the eye. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs time to start showing them that I am.‚Äù

A chill runs down Remus‚Äôs spine. ‚ÄúGabe, that‚Äôs not‚Äînot Greyback, c‚Äômon, he‚Äôs a monster.‚Äù

But Gabe only shakes his head. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre thinking like them.‚Äù

‚ÄúThem?‚Äù Remus repeats. ‚ÄúWho the hell is them?‚Äù Gabe looks at him like that‚Äôs a stupid question and Remus guesses that under the current circumstances it might be. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not that simple Gabe. There are Wizards who aren‚Äôt like this, who don‚Äôt think like‚Äî‚Äú my father, he can‚Äôt quite bring himself to say. ‚ÄúThere are Wizards out there who support us.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre there?‚Äù Gabe asks disbelievingly. ‚ÄúThen where the fuck are they Remus? Why are they never around when we need them? What the hell are they doing?‚Äù

And Remus doesn‚Äôt know how to answer those questions. Doesn‚Äôt know if he has any answers. Eventually Gabe gets to his feet, looking down at him with sad eyes.

‚Äú88 Clements Avenue,‚Äù Gabe says, unprompted.

Remus blinks up at him. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs where I‚Äôll be, if you change your mind.‚Äù

‚ÄúChange my mind?‚Äù he repeats slowly.

Gabe sighs. ‚ÄúAbout whose side you really want to be on,‚Äù he laughs weakly. ‚ÄúOr about who‚Äôs on your side, I guess.‚Äù

He starts walking away, leaving Remus feeling lost. Out at sea. Drifting. Everyone drifting. ‚ÄúGabe‚Äîfuck, Gabe wait‚Äîwhat about the kids?‚Äù

But Gabe doesn‚Äôt stop. ‚ÄúOrphanages, they‚Äôre splitting them up,‚Äù he says coldly. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt have more than two werewolves in one place. Goes for kids too, turns out.‚Äù

Remus should stop him but he doesn‚Äôt know how. He should fix this but he doesn‚Äôt know how. He feels small and useless as he watches Gabe walk away.

¬†

As desperately as Remus wants to go home and sleep for days, weeks, months. He doesn‚Äôt. Instead he finds himself in Moody‚Äôs office, Dumbledore and Moody sitting across from him as he recounts everything that has happened over the last week.

He‚Äôs grown to hate these meetings.

‚ÄúCan‚Äôt we stop this?‚Äù he asks at the end, looking desperately at the two men in front of him and feeling infuriatingly like a kid back in school, called to the Headmasters office. ‚ÄúI mean how the hell did this fucking law even get passed?‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôve noticed boy,‚Äù Moody says gruffly, ‚Äúbut we‚Äôre in the middle of a war here. We don‚Äôt exactly have time for petty politics.‚Äù

Remus stares at him. People have died. Children have been traumatized. He‚Äôs not sure he would call this petty.

‚ÄúSo we can‚Äôt do anything then? That‚Äôs what you‚Äôre saying? This is completely out of your hands?‚Äù he looks very pointedly at Dumbledore then.

‚ÄúAt the moment, yes, but I share your indignation Remus.When we aren‚Äôt spread so thin, I‚Äôll speak to my allies on the Wizengamot, we‚Äôll have a second vote. I think there‚Äôs a good chance of getting the law repealed.‚Äù

Remus tries to process that, a headache pulsing behind his eyes. He can‚Äôt remember the last time he ate or drank anything. Honestly he isn‚Äôt even sure what time it is.

‚ÄúWhen we aren‚Äôt spread so thin,‚Äù he repeats finally. ‚ÄúYou mean when the war is over?‚Äù if the war is ever over, which these days he‚Äôs no longer confident it will be.

Dumbledore bows his head in confirmation and Remus grits his teeth, doing his best not to lose his temper.

‚ÄúThe kids,‚Äù he manages finally. ‚ÄúGabe said they‚Äôll be put in orphanages?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs right.‚Äù

‚ÄúSeparate Orphanages?‚Äù

Another nod.

‚ÄúIs there no way to keep them together? Not even the kids?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Moody replies gruffly. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs nowhere with enough space first of all. Secondly, we can‚Äôt be saddling Muggles with an entire pack of werwolf cubs. One is already more than enough.‚Äù

His headache seems to grow stronger, he swears he can feel the veins pulsing in his temple. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre being put in Muggle orphanages?‚Äù he asks numbly.

‚ÄúThe only kind there are.‚Äù

Remus supposes he should have known that but, truth be told, he‚Äôs never thought much about orphanages. ‚ÄúWhat will happen, on the full moon?‚Äù

‚ÄúThey‚Äôll be brought to the Ministry.‚Äù

Remus is too tired to hide his flinch. They‚Äôll be put in cells. Alone and scared. They‚Äôll tear themselves apart. He thinks of Ava and Gabe and Liam, about how whole they seemed. How smooth their skin was. These kids will be covered in scars. He looks down at his own hands, at the white lines on his knuckles.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to tell Sirius,‚Äù he says suddenly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to tell him what happened.‚Äù

I need to tell him, he doesn‚Äôt say.

This was too much.

I can‚Äôt keep it all in.

I‚Äôll break.

I‚Äôm already breaking. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt do that Remus.‚Äù

Still staring at his hands, he curls them into fists, watching the scars pull tight. ‚ÄúI trust him.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you?‚Äù

He looks up, meeting blue eyes behind half-moon spectacles. He doesn‚Äôt speak though, the words on the tip of his tongue. Sitting in his mouth.

Yes. I do.

Of course I do.

He doesn‚Äôt know why he doesn‚Äôt say them.

‚ÄúI was there that night,‚Äù Dumbledore goes on slowly, ‚Äúwhen James carried Severus‚Äôs unconscious body into the infirmary. He had claw marks on his back, James that is. According to Poppy they were quite deep.‚Äù

Remus recoils, pressing back into his chair. James. God James.

‚ÄúI was there too, in the office, when James said that Sirius smiled, when he told him what he‚Äôd done.‚Äù

For the second time that day Remus feels like he‚Äôs going to be sick.

‚ÄúSo I‚Äôll ask you again,‚Äù Dumbledore is relentless. ‚ÄúDo you trust him? Are you sure?‚Äù

Once again Remus doesn‚Äôt answer. He doesn‚Äôt want to. Can‚Äôt bear to. Unwanted memories pulling and poking at his chest.

‚ÄúWell, now that that‚Äôs settled,‚Äù Moody goes on briskly. ‚ÄúYou said the boy gave you an address?‚Äù

It takes Remus a minute to get his thoughts in order enough to understand what Moody is talking about. ‚ÄúGabe?‚Äù he finally realizes.

Moody nods. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre gonna go to him, tell him you changed your mind, that you want to join Greyback as well.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe hell I am!‚Äù

‚ÄúRemus,‚Äù Dumbledore says firmly, like a disappointed parent. ‚ÄúThis is important. It has never been about your personal feelings but about attempting to keep as many werewolves as possible from turning to Voldemort.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut Greyback has already chosen Voldemort,‚Äù Remus says desperately. He can‚Äôt imagine being forced to spend time with him. To listen and look and smell him. He can‚Äôt imagine having to see him fully transformed. The thought alone makes Remus start to feel panicky.

‚ÄúThen convince his followers to do otherwise,‚Äù Moody snaps. ‚ÄúOr if you can‚Äôt do that at least keep us informed on their plans. Their whereabouts.‚Äù

Remus folds forward, dropping his head into his hands. He hates this. Hates this with every fibre of his being. He‚Äôs tired of it. The secrets and the disappearing and the double life. It‚Äôs too hard. He‚Äôs too exhausted.

‚ÄúOkay, fine, whatever,‚Äù he sighs, sitting back. ‚ÄúCan I go now?‚Äù

Moody looks like he‚Äôs going to say something but Dumbledore cuts him off. ‚ÄúYes, of course. We‚Äôll be in touch.‚Äù

‚ÄúGreat,‚Äù he gets out of his seat, heading for the door, but he stops before leaving. ‚ÄúThe law says no more than two werewolves together in one place correct?‚Äù

Dumbledore nods, though Remus can see the question in his eyes. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs correct.‚Äù

Remus holds his gaze with intent. ‚ÄúThere are two boys, Oliver and William, I want them to be kept together. I want you to do that for me.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo that for you?‚Äù Moody says indignantly. ‚ÄúWhat in the seven hells makes you think we have‚Äî‚Äú

But Dumbledore holds up his hand, never taking his eyes off of Remus. ‚ÄúVery well,‚Äù he says after a brief pause. ‚ÄúThe boys will be kept together. You have my word.‚Äù

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù Remus says curtly, not bothering with anything else before he pushes into the hallway outside.

¬†

It‚Äôs one in the morning by the time he gets back to the flat. Sirius is on the couch, reading, his shoulders tense when Remus shuts the door but he doesn‚Äôt turn around. Doesn‚Äôt look up. Remus doesn‚Äôt blame him. He drops his bag on the floor, hesitantly walking forward. He feels so fucking hollow. Like he‚Äôs barely processed anything that‚Äôs happen. Can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs only been a day.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs leftover takeaway in the fridge,‚Äù Sirius says when Remus just keeps standing there, unsure of what to say. Unsure of how to ask for what he needs. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs from the curry place you don‚Äôt like, but, well, I didn‚Äôt know when you were coming back so‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúSirius.‚Äù

Sirius‚Äôs eyes flick up immediately at the sound of his name. At the pathetic whimpering thing that Remus‚Äôs voice has become. One look and he‚Äôs dropping his book, getting to his feet.

‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù Sirius asks as his hands come up to Remus‚Äôs face, holding it carefully. ‚ÄúRemus what happened?‚Äù

The tears start falling from his eyes and he knows they aren‚Äôt going to stop. He shakes his head. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt, I can‚Äôt fight right now, can we not fight right now? Because I just‚Äîfuck I just need‚Äî‚Äú

Sirius pulls him close, hand going to the back of Remus‚Äôs head, letting him burying his face in Sirius‚Äôs neck. Breathing him in, feeling his warmth. He shakes as the tears keep coming.

‚ÄúRem,‚Äù Sirius says softly.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so tired,‚Äù he hiccups. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so tired of letting everyone down. I can‚Äôt do this Sirius. I don‚Äôt know how to do this anymore.‚Äù

‚ÄúSh, sh,‚Äù Sirius maneuvers them onto the couch, pulling Remus into him and wrapping them up in the blanket thrown over the back. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay. You‚Äôre okay.‚Äù

But he isn‚Äôt.

He really isn‚Äôt.

He buries himself further into Sirius. He shuts his eyes and he tries to pretend that everything is different. That he never got bit by a werewolf. That Sirius never told Snape how to find him. That neither of them ever lied. Or cheated. Or left. He pretends that this is their life, together like this, in their flat. Holding one another.

He isn‚Äôt okay.

Really he isn‚Äôt.

¬†

A few days later, for reasons he‚Äôll never quite understand, Remus feels compelled to look up the story Mia told him. Romulus and Remus. Founders of Rome.

It turns out she forgot a rather important detail in her retelling.

That Remus was betrayed. Murdered by his brother.

Fate works in mysterious ways, that‚Äôs what Mia had said.

Remus can‚Äôt help but find that foreboding.

Chapter End Notes

Hey, hi, hello!

1) Chapter 50 is all James and Reg and Chapter 51 is Jegulus so I promise I am not leaving you guys hanging much longer!

2) Okay my reverse slow burn comment seems to have sparked a heck of a lot more debate than I was anticipating. The ending is still canon, just so we're clear, still canon, so I am gently suggesting we manage our expectations

3) I promise I will not take this long to update again, this was a lil extreme

THANK YOU ALL!!!

Chapter 50

Chapter Summary

HAPPY JEGULUS WEEK

Chapter Notes

Given recent events I just wanted to say that this story is currently taking place during a war and that might be particularly difficult for some people to read about at this point in time so please take care of yourselves!

tw: Drug use / addiction (via potions)
tw: Violence
tw: Panic attack
tw: Referenced sexual assault (there's also a moment where Lucius and Reg are alone together in this chapter and nothing happens but it definitely feels uneasy, if that makes sense? It takes place in the kitchen at Malfoy Manner just so you're prepared)
tw: Death (I don't think this counts as a major character death...but...it might...)

Just a heads up because some people do get angry about this, I've mentioned it before, but I am messing with the canon timeline, just because, in this story, it's more interesting if stuff happens while Regulus is still alive. Y'know? So yeah, that happens :)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I JAMES

James, Peter and Sirius sit squashed together on a floral patterned sofa with lace pillows‚Äîone of which, is currently being cuddled by Peter. The living room they‚Äôre in is overcrowded, with people, yes, but also with stuff. And James really does mean stuff. Boxes and newspapers and old takeaway menus.

Oh.

And cats.

How could he forget the cats.

There are at least three that he‚Äôs seen walking around, all of whom seem to be in love with Sirius for reasons he can‚Äôt fathom. The rest are staring out at them from their portraits which are hung up throughout the house. On top of all that, the whole place smells a bit like boiled cabbage.

‚ÄúThe following information has been kept from most of you for the past few months in the interest of your safety.‚Äù
Dumbledore‚Äôs words instantly ignite a wave of murmuring across the room. None of the three boys on the sofa react, all well aware of what is coming. Though Peter does fidget ever so slightly, clutching his pillow a little closer to his chest.

‚ÄúIt has come to light that there is someone amongst us who has been passing information to Lord Voldemort.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù says a panicked voice at the back of the room, the murmurs escalating to more of a frantic buzz.

‚ÄúI know this will be a shock to many of you. We were hoping to use this information to our advantage, to allow the individual in question to believe nothing was suspected, leading them to act more carelessly. However, as time has passed and no one has been found out, it has become more and more pertinent for all of you to be on your guard. To take seriously our requests that all knowledge of missions and tasks performed for the Order remain only between those actively involved in them.‚Äù

James doesn‚Äôt miss the guilty looks bouncing around the room. None of them have done a particularly good job of keeping information from each other. Except maybe Moony. James shoots a cautious look at Sirius but he seems to be focusing the entirety of his attention on the black cat purring next to him.

‚ÄúAlastor will brief you on what behaviour to watch out for in the people around you. If you notice anything, I implore you to bring it to the attention of myself or the Head Auror.‚Äù

Moody groans, rising out of his seat to address the Order members able to attend the meeting today. Remus isn‚Äôt there, off doing god knows what. Sirius is positive he‚Äôs trying to get the werewolves to join their side but James isn‚Äôt entirely convinced. Alice and Frank are both back at the Ministry‚Äîthe security measures there have been increased astronomically. And Lily and Marlene are on a mission, though, of course, they weren‚Äôt able to tell anyone where they were going or why.

Before she left James had suggested that Lily should perhaps stop taking Order missions now that she‚Äôs literally growing a baby. That suggestion did not go over well, though he still feels like he sort of has a point.

‚Äú‚Ä¶someone who is frequently unreachable,‚Äù Moody is babbling on, James barely paying attention. ‚ÄúWhose behaviour in the past few months has altered, who‚Äôs started disappearing without explanation, or anyone to corroborate where they were or what they were doing. Often times this sort of double life starts to take a toll physically‚Äîif someone seems more ill than normal, weaker, less social. Like they‚Äôre trying to distance themselves. If they start expressing guilt for unknown reasons. These are all warning signs, things to look out for, and if you notice more than one of them in a single individual please come to see me in my office, do not,‚Äù Moody narrows his eyes, ‚ÄúI repeat, DO NOT send an owl, the post is unreliable and too easily intercepted.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, thank you Alastor,‚Äù Dumbledore says, the faintest hint of amusement in the corner of his eyes.

The room around them has gone dead silent, perhaps the quietest James has ever heard an Order meeting before. Everyone, no doubt, running through a list of all their closest friends, trying to figure out if any of them match the description Moody has just given.

‚ÄúAny questions?‚Äù Dumbledore asks after a short pause. No one raises their hand. ‚ÄúExcellent. Well, I imagine you are all eager to return to your homes, and I‚Äôm sure Arabella would love it if we would depart from her‚Äôs. Thank you for all your hard work, I‚Äôll see you all again soon.‚Äù He smiles. James doesn‚Äôt know if anyone smiles back.

These meetings are strange nowadays. He finds himself waiting sometimes, for his parents to walk through the door. For his mother to pull them all into a hug and get lipstick on James‚Äôs cheek. For his father to watch on fondly, quieter and calmer but no less warm. He waits for that feeling of certainty that always filled him whenever they were around, the weight lifting from his shoulders. Because the adults were there. And surely they would take care of things.

The weight never lifts these days. But maybe that‚Äôs just what it feels like to grow up.

The room is slowly emptying. People going outside to Apparate since Mrs. Figg doesn‚Äôt have a Floo connection. Some people still linger, small groups huddled along the walls, catching up since the last time they saw one another, taking stock of the damage‚Äîwho‚Äôs been injured, killed, taken. James, Peter and Sirius, however, say nothing. The three of them too tired to speak. Too tired to move. This winter is feeling long and it hasn‚Äôt even started yet.

‚ÄúDid it‚Äî‚Äú Peter starts and then stops, looking at the pillow in his lap and fiddling with the lace.

James waits for a moment, but when Peter doesn‚Äôt continue on his own he decides to give him a push. ‚ÄúDid it what?‚Äù

Peter chews on the inside of his cheek. ‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶it‚Äôs just that‚ÄîI‚Äôm not saying it is or anything‚ÄîI‚Äôm just saying, it sounded a bit like‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúJust spit it out Peter,‚Äù Sirius says, now petting two cats. You‚Äôd think him being a dog would make them automatically dislike him but apparently his charm works on animals as well as people.

‚ÄúWhen Moody was describing everything to look out for‚Ä¶did it sound a bit like he was describing Remus to either of you?‚Äù

Sirius freezes. He doesn‚Äôt look up, doesn‚Äôt speak, just goes deadly still.

James has somewhat of the opposite reaction. ‚ÄúTell me you‚Äôre joking right now?‚Äù he asks, anger edging into his voice as he watches Peter‚Äôs cheeks flush.

‚ÄúI told you, I‚Äôm not saying he is I‚Äôm just saying‚Ä¶well, the similarities were a bit hard to miss weren‚Äôt they?‚Äù he now looks over at Sirius who still hasn‚Äôt moved. James isn‚Äôt even sure if he‚Äôs breathing.

‚ÄúPete can you give us a minute?‚Äù James says finally, voice held tight.

Peter looks at him. ‚ÄúGive you‚Ä¶‚Äù then back at Sirius. ‚ÄúOh‚Äîoh right, yeah,‚Äù he awkwardly stands, taking a step forward before realizing he‚Äôs still holding a pillow and placing it, somewhat delicately, back on the sofa.

Something is off. Sirius should be fuming‚ÄîJames should be holding him back, barely restraining him. Why is he just sitting there? Why is he‚Äî

‚ÄúPete‚Äôs right you know,‚Äù Sirius croaks.

James has to run those words through his head a few times before he‚Äôs finally able to accept that Sirius said them.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck is wrong with you?‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat.

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo really, what the fuck is wrong with you? How could you even‚Äî‚Äú he has to stop because his anger is getting to be too much, making his words shake as they cut their way out of his mouth.

To be fair, Sirius does look ashamed, staring at the floor, curled in on himself. Usually so big and bright, now wilting. James isn‚Äôt sure he‚Äôs seen him this defeated since fifth year.

‚ÄúTell me I‚Äôm wrong James,‚Äù his voice cracks. ‚ÄúPlease. Because I hate it. I hate it too but‚Ä¶rationally‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúRationally?‚Äù James cuts in. ‚ÄúSince when are you rational?‚Äù

Somehow Sirius manages to make himself even smaller.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Remus,‚Äù James says, not understanding why he needs to explain this. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Remus. Fuck reason, fuck every fucking similarity‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs. Remus.‚Äù

Sirius sighs, dropping his head into his hands. A long moment of silence passes between them.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Sirius says eventually, voice weak. ‚ÄúBut I can‚Äôt stop‚Ä¶seeing it. Every time he lies. Every time he won‚Äôt tell me what he‚Äôs doing or where he‚Äôs going,‚Äù he takes in a rattling breath. ‚ÄúWhen he came back, this last time, he said‚Ä¶said he was tired of letting everyone down.What if‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre kidding? That‚Äôs like the most Remus thing to say it doesn‚Äôt‚Äîyou‚Äôre really fucking reaching with that one.‚Äù

But Sirius doesn‚Äôt let it go. ‚ÄúMoody just said, randomly admitting to feelings of guilt‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHe always feels guilty!‚Äù James shouts, loud enough that the remaining Order members have started looking their way. Frustrated, he gets off the couch, turning towards the window, hands running through his hair. It‚Äôs a while before he‚Äôs able to face Sirius again.

‚ÄúWhy are you acting like this? Why are you acting like you don‚Äôt know who he is?‚Äù

Sirius has gone back to staring at the floor, jaw tense. ‚ÄúMaybe I don‚Äôt.‚Äù

For a moment James actually thinks about hitting him. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you dare say this shit to Moony, don‚Äôt you dare fucking drag him down with this. Jesus Christ Sirius.‚Äù

Sirius doesn‚Äôt say anything, the same expression on his face he used to wear when McGonagall was dressing him down‚Äîpetulant, defiant, stubborn.

‚ÄúYou need to figure your shit out,‚Äù James says finally. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never met two people more incompetent at loving each other.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt mean it to sound the way it does. It‚Äôs supposed to be snarky not cruel. But he can physically see the words burn Sirius, his mouth flicking down before he gets to his feet.

‚ÄúCheers mate.‚Äù

He‚Äôs heading for the door before James even has the chance to blink.

‚ÄúFuck‚ÄîSirius!‚Äù James calls after him. But he doesn‚Äôt turn around and James doesn‚Äôt have the heart to follow. Doesn‚Äôt know if it would do any good. ‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he hisses again, kicking the sofa before collapsing back onto it. He brings his hands up, covering his face.

‚ÄúI feel like that was my fault.‚Äù

James peers through his fingers at a repentant looking Peter and sighs. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt beat yourself up about it, but yeah, it kinda was.‚Äù

Peter sits down next to him and James drops his hands into his lap, both boys lapsing into silence for a while.

‚ÄúDo you ever think about before?‚Äù Peter finally says.

James looks at him wearily. ‚ÄúBefore?‚Äù

‚ÄúBefore Hogwarts‚Ä¶before Sirius and Remus. When it was just us?‚Äù

Not really, is the answer. For starters, James‚Äôs memories prior to the age of eleven are a little hazy, as he imagines most people‚Äôs are. But also‚Ä¶everything before the Marauders feels flat somehow. James wasn‚Äôt really himself before he had his boys.

‚ÄúIt was nice,‚Äù Peter goes on when James doesn‚Äôt answer. ‚ÄúRight?‚Äù His friend looks at him now, something a little‚ÄîJames doesn‚Äôt even know‚Äîdesperate? In his eyes. And James feels like he‚Äôs missed something. Doesn‚Äôt understand how they got from suspecting Remus to this.

‚ÄúSure Pete. Yeah. It was‚Ä¶nice.‚Äù He claps him on the back and watches something in Peter‚Äôs eyes flicker. That was the wrong thing to say. Or the wrong way to say it. Peter can see right through him.

‚ÄúPete‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI should get going,‚Äù Peter says abruptly, pulling away from James and getting to his feet. He shoots him a self-deprecating smile. ‚ÄúSee you, yeah?‚Äù

And before James can respond Peter is moving quickly out of the room. James watching him go.

Good job Potter, he thinks coldly. That‚Äôs two people you‚Äôve let down and it‚Äôs not even noon yet. Must be a personal best.

¬†

It‚Äôs only twenty minutes later that he‚Äôs walking into his own house. The lights out. The rooms dark.

‚ÄúLily?‚Äù he tries, even though he already knows she isn‚Äôt home. Silence answers him back and he doesn‚Äôt know why it makes him angry. He has half a mind to firecall Sirius. Half a mind to just show up at his flat and hash this all out. Partially because he hates fighting with him and partially because he doesn‚Äôt know what to do with the insidious energy thrumming under his skin.

It makes him antsy. He can‚Äôt sit. Can‚Äôt read. He needs to move. He should go flying, that usually helps, but his hands are shaking too much, in this state he‚Äôd crash into the side of the house.

He makes it up to the second floor, to his empty bedroom, sheets still messed up, and he starts pacing. Is this really how they‚Äôre supposed to live from now on? Never knowing where anyone is or what they‚Äôre doing or when they‚Äôre coming back? He always felt Remus was in the wrong for keeping secrets, even if it was on Dumbledore‚Äôs orders. It drives cracks into everything. Remus and Sirius never really fought at school, not after they got together properly. There were moments sure, but, for the most part‚Ä¶this fucking war. This fucking war is killing all of them. It‚Äôs driving them all out of their heads. There‚Äôs no way that Sirius can really believe, I mean really believe that Remus would betray them. Right? Right?? Because if they‚Äôve gone that far‚Äîif they‚Äôve lost each other that much‚Ä¶how will they ever come back from it? What the hell is going to happen to them?

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù James snaps, knocking something off his dresser and feeling mildly satisfied when it slams into the wall. Not satisfied enough of course. He throws a real proper temper tantrum then, Sirius would be proud‚Äîknocking things over, kicking and punching and cursing like a little kid who hasn‚Äôt got his way. Like someone trapped in a life they have no control over, watching other people make decisions for them.

By the time he‚Äôs done his skin is hot and sweaty, his chest heaving, the tremor in his hands gone. His room is also a fucking disaster. There are spells for this, but he‚Äôd rather clean it up by hand. He took it all apart quickly but he puts it back together almost painfully slow. Delicate with his movements. Like an apology. Glasses and books returned to bedside tables, picture frames set upright again. When he heaves the dresser onto its feet some of the drawers slide out, contents spilling onto the floor.

They‚Äôre clothes mostly. Socks and jumpers that he hasn‚Äôt got the patience to re-fold so he just starts shoving them all back into roughly the same drawers and slamming them shut. Until his hand brushes against something hard. There, beneath one of his t-shirts, is a small wooden box. For a minute James just stares at it. It‚Äôs been a long time since he‚Äôs looked at it‚Äîshoved all the way at the back of his dresser. He‚Äôs not sure why he kept it, except that the idea of throwing it away makes him want to be sick.

Eventually he gives in, reaching for it as he collapses down onto the floor. He runs his fingers over it, brushing off the dust, before he flicks open the lid, revealing the little miniature ball inside, initials catching the light.

J&R

Sometimes, he can‚Äôt even believe any of it really happened. It doesn‚Äôt sound real. Doesn‚Äôt sound like him‚Äîgetting with his best mates brother. A Slytherin. A Death Eater.

He stares the Quaffle down like it‚Äôll give him the answers. Like it‚Äôll tell him what happened and why all this time later it still feels‚Ä¶like this. He‚Äôd told his mother he didn‚Äôt want Regulus to become a bruise and he‚Äôd gotten his wish. Regulus isn‚Äôt a bruise. He‚Äôs a tsunami. And every time James lets himself think of him, lets himself remember, he‚Äôs overwhelmed. He loses sight of the shore. Forgets it even exists at all. He isn‚Äôt even here, hasn‚Äôt been, in a very long time, and yet somehow, Regulus still has the ability to wrap himself around James. To be all he can hear and feel and think. All he can breathe and smell and taste.

Which is exactly why he needs to stay at the back of James‚Äôs dresser.

He snaps the box shut, eyes falling on what had been lying next to it. Black velvet, a jewellery case his mother had very politely not asked him about when she saw him buying it. This he really doesn‚Äôt know why he kept. He sets the Quaffle down next to it, a matching set. He‚Äôd agonized about what to get Regulus, what could possibly match his gift. It couldn‚Äôt just be something he bought, it had to be something he made. The problem was, James‚Äôs magic has always been big and loud and strong, well suited to duelling not meticulous charm work. Still, he‚Äôd been determined.

He can‚Äôt help wondering what Regulus would have thought, if he‚Äôd had the time to give it to him. If everything hadn‚Äôt gone to hell after Christmas. If things had been different. It shouldn‚Äôt matter now. He wishes it didn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù the front door closes and James jolts, like he‚Äôs been caught.

He throws the two boxes back in his dresser, slamming the drawer shut and trying to ignore the sinking feeling of guilt currently eating its way through his stomach.

‚ÄúUp here!‚Äù James calls down to Lily as he heads for the bedroom door. Looking over his shoulder like he‚Äôs expecting to see Regulus standing there. Like Lily could walk in on them. Catch him with the memory of the boy he used to love.

Still loves. When he lets himself. When he forgets about the shore.

¬†

PART II REGULUS

Personally, Regulus thinks Malfoy Manor is a little tacky. But maybe he‚Äôs biased. It‚Äôs all marble floors and pillars, all thirty-foot ceilings and chandeliers, and gilded mirrors. Where Grimmauld is gothic and cluttered, Malfoy Manor is open and Grecian. There are peacocks in the front yard.

Like he said. Tacky.

They all sit in the drawing room at a long wooden table (Regulus is frankly surprised it isn‚Äôt made out of marble too) listening to Snape and Lucius bicker. The Dark Lord isn‚Äôt there of course, or things would likely be proceeding with more decorum. As it is, they are forced to watch two little men haggling over the scraps of power that have been left for them.

Regulus is sunk low in his chair, arms crossed over his chest, fighting the heaviness in his eyes. He expects all of this would be rather more annoying if he weren‚Äôt blitzed out of his mind. The potions leave him sated. Content. Here or at Grimmauld place it doesn‚Äôt matter. He feels the same.

Well, until Snape chucks an inkwell at his head. Luckily Evan swats it away because there is no chance Regulus‚Äôs reflexes are fast enough to dodge anything right now.

‚ÄúFuck off Severus,‚Äù Evan snaps, as the glass bottle clatters to the ground.

‚ÄúYou know,‚Äù Regulus sits up straight, ‚Äúif you needed something you could have just asked,‚Äù he notices a few uncomfortable looks being passed around the table and instantly understands his mistake. Snape had asked, Regulus was just too high to notice.

‚ÄúHe speaks,‚Äù Snape sneers. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a fucking miracle.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell maybe if you and Lucius said anything worth listening to I wouldn‚Äôt be falling asleep.‚Äù A few people chuckle.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù Snape says, dark eyes narrowing, ‚Äúare we boring you? I know you may not be aware of this little prince, but taking over a government is actually quite a bit of work.‚Äù

He‚Äôs always hated that. Little Prince. Not just because it‚Äôs patronizing, but because it‚Äôs what they used to call Sirius. Except back then it sounded like they meant it.

‚ÄúAnd how much of that work have you accomplished exactly?‚Äù Regulus snaps back. ‚ÄúBecause from where I‚Äôm sitting all you‚Äôve been discussing for the past hour is whose dick is bigger.‚Äù

There‚Äôs laughter again, Evan actually sounds like he‚Äôs choking, ‚ÄúFuck Reg,‚Äù he mutters under his breath, the heat rising in Severus‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúI expect,‚Äù Snape‚Äôs tinny voice cuts through the noise, ‚Äúif we were talking about dicks we‚Äôd have more of your attention.‚Äù

The mood in the room shifts instantly. There‚Äôs no laughter. This is not a crowd that takes kindly to such accusations. Regulus wonders if Snape even fully understands that, having not grown up in this world, with these families and their mansions and their precious baby boys. If he ever understood what he was threatening Regulus with, even back in school.

‚ÄúThe fuck did you just say?‚Äù Evan demands, but Regulus holds up his hand. He doesn‚Äôt need anyone to fight his battles for him, especially not against Snape. Not anymore.

‚ÄúTell me Severus, how is Lily Evans doing these days?‚Äù If his last remark filled Snape‚Äôs face with colour, this one drains it of it.

‚ÄúAlright, okay, enough boys,‚Äù Lucius finally steps back in. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all friends here yes?‚Äù

Evan snorts but neither Regulus nor Snape contradict him, instead they settle for glaring viciously at one another across the table.

‚ÄúExcellent,‚Äù Lucius goes on, clearly enjoying himself. ‚ÄúNow Regulus, we were wondering if you thought it was possible to make a version of a sleeping potion that was gaseous.‚Äù

Regulus blinks, momentarily distracted from his staring contest with Snape. ‚ÄúGaseous?‚Äù he repeats. He‚Äôs never changed the state of a potion before and the challenge peeks his interest.

‚ÄúYes, so that people will be able to feel the effects through inhalation rather than ingestion. Severus wasn‚Äôt sure if it could be done.‚Äù

And oh.

Oh isn‚Äôt that just delightful.

He turns his gaze back on Snape who is practically vibrating with anger, a smirk curving the corner of Regulus‚Äôs mouth. ‚ÄúSeverus wasn‚Äôt sure?‚Äù he repeats, gloating.

I mean, he isn‚Äôt sure either. He‚Äôs never done it. Never even thought about it. But nobody here knows that. Without taking his eyes off Snape he answers.

‚ÄúYeah, I expect it can be done.‚Äù

There is the faint murmur of skepticism along the table but Regulus doesn‚Äôt pay it much mind, enjoying Snape‚Äôs scowling face far too much.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll need it to be ready within the next few days, so we have time to test it out before we make our move on the Ministry. Do you think you can manage that?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù another lie. Or, well, half-lie, at least. He has no idea how long it‚Äôll take.

‚ÄúWell then, look at that,‚Äù Lucius claps a hand on Snape‚Äôs shoulder that only exaggerates the other boy‚Äôs awkwardness. ‚ÄúI told you he would know what to do.‚Äù

Snape‚Äôs eyes are mutinous, Regulus is surprised he isn‚Äôt barring his teeth. ‚ÄúA shame he couldn‚Äôt stay conscious long enough to tell us earlier. Save us all this back and forth.‚Äù

‚ÄúBeing a sore loser isn‚Äôt very becoming Severus,‚Äù Regulus says dryly, not that any part of Snape is becoming. Next to him Evan snorts.

‚ÄúNo one is perfect,‚Äù Lucius says, dismissing them both with the wave of his hand before looking down at the notes in front of him. ‚ÄúSo you two will have that done by Sunday, yes?‚Äù

Regulus very nearly bangs his head on the table in front of him.

‚ÄúThe two of us?‚Äù Snape hisses, lanky black hair falling in his face.

‚ÄúWell you are our best potioneers and we need this done quickly. So yes. The two of you.‚Äù

No really, Regulus thinks it would help, just slamming his forehead into something hard. Maybe if he gets a concussion they‚Äôll take pity on him and won‚Äôt make him work with Snape.

‚ÄúThe Dark Lord values cooperation,‚Äù Lucius‚Äôs eyes flick up off the page in front of him and pass between Regulus and Snape. ‚ÄúYou wouldn‚Äôt want me to tell him you two are being uncooperative now would you?‚Äù

Regulus struggles not to roll his eyes. He hates it when Lucius tries to play father. He‚Äôs been doing it more and more since they found out Narcissa is pregnant.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Regulus says finally, when the silence stretches on too long. ‚ÄúThat won‚Äôt be necessary, we can work together.‚Äù

Snape looks like he‚Äôs just swallowed something rotten but when Lucius turns to him he forces himself to speak. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll work together.‚Äù

‚ÄúCome to Grimmauld tomorrow, we can start then,‚Äù Regulus says.

‚ÄúWhy do we have to work at your house?‚Äù

This time Regulus really does roll his eyes. ‚ÄúDo you have a fully functioning potions lab in your flat?‚Äù he demands, the silence he is met with is all the answer he needs. ‚ÄúYeah, that‚Äôs what I thought. So we‚Äôll meet at mine.‚Äù

Snape looks like he‚Äôs about to say something bratty back but Lucius quickly cuts him off. ‚ÄúBrilliant plan, I knew they didn‚Äôt call you a genius for no reason Regulus,‚Äù he gives him a wink that Regulus absolutely does not appreciate. ‚ÄúNow, on to other business‚Ä¶‚Äù

Whatever that other business is Regulus hardly pays attention, although he knows he should. Instead, he spends the remainder of the meeting trying to figure out if there is any plausible way he could poison Snape and make it look like an accident.

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúAre you feeling alright?‚Äù

Regulus starts. He‚Äôs been staring at the sink in the Malfoy‚Äôs kitchen for a long time. Too long. He isn‚Äôt even sure what he got distracted by. He came in here for a glass of water and somehow ended up‚Ä¶drifting.

The voice behind him is enough to wake him up though. Enough to make his hackles rise.

‚ÄúYou suddenly care how I‚Äôm feeling Lucius?‚Äù his back is to him, hands pressed to the counter.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve always cared about you,‚Äù he answers smoothly, making every inch of Regulus feel grimy and gross and unbearable.

‚ÄúHave you,‚Äù he asks bitingly. ‚ÄúAnd how exactly were you caring for me when you started trying to convince the Dark Lord of my wavering loyalty?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh that.‚Äù

Regulus laughs humourlessly. ‚ÄúYeah that.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell I felt perhaps your head was getting a bit too big, that you could do with being knocked down a few pegs. I knew the Dark Lord would be merciful,‚Äù Lucius walks forward, his hand wrapping around the back of Regulus‚Äôs neck, making every muscle in his body stiffen. ‚ÄúAfter all, you‚Äôre his little prince.‚Äù

Regulus looks up at the window across from them, looks at their reflections in the glass, Lucius a few inches taller, looming over him. Regulus looks young. He looks thirteen. Nothing has changed. Nothing ever changes.

‚ÄúTell me,‚Äù Lucius‚Äôs voice is low, intimate, making Regulus want to dismantle himself. Break down his body into parts and rebuild himself somewhere else. Rebuild himself without this skin that has been so thoroughly misused. ‚ÄúTell me what‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù

He‚Äôs so afraid. Even all this time later the fear is a live wire in his chest that makes moving and fighting hard.

‚ÄúLet go of me,‚Äù he manages through gritted teeth.

‚ÄúOh Regulus,‚Äù Lucius sounds amused. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt push away everyone who loves you.‚Äù

He wants to say that no one ever has loved him, but that‚Äôs not quite true. He wants to say that if someone ever did he would never let them go. That he would leave claw marks in their skin. But then that‚Äôs not quite true either.

He knows this twisted thing with Lucius isn‚Äôt love. He knows that after James in a way he never could have before him. In a way he didn‚Äôt when he was thirteen.

Someone clears their throat and Lucius‚Äôs hand instantly falls away, though he‚Äôs slow to step back, unhurried.

‚ÄúSeverus,‚Äù he greets calmly, and Regulus squeezes his eyes shut, still frozen in front of the sink.

‚ÄúI just came to get some water,‚Äù Snape says stiffly. ‚ÄúAm I interrupting?‚Äù

Regulus wants to curl in on himself. Wants to run from the room. Wants to scream.

He doesn‚Äôt do any of that of course. Just keeps standing there, back to the room.

‚ÄúBy all means,‚Äù he hears Lucius say, hears his footsteps on the fucking marble floor as he starts to walk away. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll chat later Regulus,‚Äù he throws casually over his shoulder.

Joy.

Regulus still can‚Äôt really move, luckily the kitchen sink, like every other damned part of this house, is grande and excessive, so there‚Äôs more than enough room for Snape to get to the tap. Regulus forces his eyes open again but stares intently straight ahead and not at the boy next to him.

‚ÄúWell doesn‚Äôt this feel familiar,‚Äù Snape says as he fills his glass.

Regulus grits his teeth and ignores him, attempting to pull himself back together, wishing he wasn‚Äôt so easily shaken. He feels Snape pause beside him, and when the pause drags on too long he forces himself to look up. It‚Äôs surprising, when he finds something like concern in Snape‚Äôs expression. Concern and confusion.

‚ÄúBlack are you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine,‚Äù the shock of Snape considering his well being for even a second is enough to jolt Regulus into action again. He pulls away from the counter, hands in fists as he does his best to walk normally. The meeting is over and he just wants to leave, to go back to the quiet safety of his house. To take something that‚Äôll make his memories stop shaking.

‚ÄúOi, there you are,‚Äù Evan smiles, him and Barty pulling away from the wall just outside of the drawing room and coming towards him.

‚ÄúI thought you two had left,‚Äù Regulus says wearily. He hasn‚Äôt got the emotional energy to socialize right now. And he hates being in this fucking house.

‚ÄúNah, just listening to Barty bitch about how he‚Äôs being benched again.‚Äù

The boy in question crosses his arms over his chest and, there‚Äôs no other word for it, pouts. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt fucking believe it.‚Äù

‚ÄúI mean, it is the place where you work. If you lose your mask there during the fighting then poof,‚Äù Evan makes a sort of farting noise to emphasize his point. ‚ÄúCover blown.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut what does it matter if we‚Äôre gonna take over the Ministry anyway!‚Äù

Evan shrugs. ‚ÄúSuppose they wanna be careful, incase we don‚Äôt manage it.‚Äù

Regulus feels barely present, like there‚Äôs a wall between him and everything around him. He needs to leave.

‚Äú‚Äîif Macdonald‚Äôs there you better make sure no one gets her,‚Äù Barty is rambling on. ‚ÄúThat bitch is mine.‚Äù

‚ÄúHonestly Barty, I think this little crush of your‚Äôs is getting a bit out of hand.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be disgusting Evan.‚Äù

‚ÄúI mean, I would get it if you were like, dying to shag her or whatever, but it‚Äôs not as though you haven‚Äôt already had a go on‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúShut up.‚Äù

The word is sharp and loud when it comes out of Regulus‚Äôs mouth, instantly silencing Evan. For a moment his friends just stare back at him and Regulus struggles to hold onto reality. A million thoughts and feelings colliding in his head, making everything unclear.

‚ÄúShut up,‚Äù he repeats, even though no one is talking.

‚ÄúReg are you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThat never happened.‚Äù

He remembers it and he doesn‚Äôt all at the same time. The room. The people. Closed bed curtains. Blood. He remembers it and he doesn‚Äôt. Because sometimes when he thinks about it the room looks different. Sometimes the people change. Sometimes Lucius is there. And sometimes he isn‚Äôt.

Regulus is too sensitive and too numb. Too high and too sober. All kinds of wrong bubbling inside his skin.

‚ÄúI stopped it,‚Äù he feels shaky. ‚ÄúI got there and I stopped it. Nothing happened in that room.‚Äù

Nothing happened in any room.

In any bed.

Nothing happened.

Or if it did‚Ä¶it didn‚Äôt matter.

Evan is looking at him perhaps with the most genuine concern Regulus has ever seen on his face, but Barty just snorts.

‚ÄúYeah, because before you got there we were all sitting around having tea‚Äîoof.‚Äù

Evan has thrown his arm into Barty‚Äôs stomach like he‚Äôs trying to stop him from running off a cliff. He does it with enough force that the other boy actually doubles over.

‚ÄúFuck you!‚Äù he wheezes, but Evan hasn‚Äôt taken his eyes off of Regulus. Studying him, like he‚Äôs looking for answers. Everything around Regulus blurs in and out of focus. Panic attack, his mind supplies. It isn‚Äôt a very helpful observation.

‚ÄúNothing happened in that room,‚Äù Evan says slowly, like he‚Äôs talking to a scared little kid. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs‚Äîyeah. That‚Äôs right. Isn‚Äôt it Barty?‚Äù

Barty, who is still gripping his knees, glares up at both of them. ‚ÄúWhat the hell are you‚Äî‚Äú this time he cuts himself off, clearly seeing something threatening in Evan‚Äôs expression. Rolling his eyes he straightens up. ‚ÄúFine, fuck, nothing happened,‚Äù and then, looking directly at Regulus, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre fucking mental sometimes, I swear to god.‚Äù

‚ÄúChrist Barty.‚Äù

But Regulus doesn‚Äôt care, he‚Äôs already walking away. He can‚Äôt be here anymore. He can‚Äôt think anymore. Memories and feelings scraping the walls of his skull. Lies and realities all blending together.

‚ÄúRegulus!‚Äù

He Floos into his living room, stumbling a little bit as the portraits of his ancestors stare down with disapproval at the quivering mess their line has become. Sirius would never be this pathetic. A blood traitor maybe, but at least he wasn‚Äôt weak.

‚ÄúMaster Regulus?‚Äù Kreacher calls out. Regulus thinks he‚Äôs in the kitchen, but he doesn‚Äôt stop long enough to find out, taking the stairs two at a time and barely making it to the bathroom before throwing up. He grips the toilet and tries to breathe.

Inhale.

Exhale.

Funny how it never gets better, no matter how many times it happens.

Inhale.

Exhale

Funny how the fear never dulls. Always insisting this will be the time he won‚Äôt be able to catch his breath. This will be the time he lets his thoughts drown him.

Inhale.

Exhale.

He can still feel Lucius‚Äôs hand on the back of his neck.

Still feel Mary Macdonald‚Äôs blood.

Inhale.

Exhale.

He has to hold onto the sink in order to stand up, hands shaking as they reach for the bottles lined up neatly behind the mirror. He pulls the stopper out of the first one with his teeth, downing the contents in a single go before reaching for the next. He gets through about two and a half before things really start to get woozy, but he is feeling better. His heart rate slowing, his thoughts going from a sprint, to a walk, to a crawl. Everything becomes softer. Hazier. Easier to manage.

He kind of forgets about himself after that.

¬†

‚ÄúMaster Regulus? Master Regulus you is be needing to be up now sir. You is having company now sir!‚Äù

Regulus groans, throwing a pillow over his head and trying to drown out the croaky voice nagging at him. It sounds like a frog, though he doesn‚Äôt know why a frog would be bugging him to get out of bed.

He‚Äôs still pondering this thought when his pillow is mercilessly ripped away from him and used to smack him in the face.

‚ÄúMaster. Regulus. Must. Get. Up. Now,‚Äù each word punctuated with a hit. ‚ÄúMr. Snape is waiting and he is getting very impatient. Kreacher is certain he will soon be coming up here to demand an audience and Kreacher does not think Master Regulus will like him to be seeing him like this.‚Äù

‚ÄúArgh,‚Äù Regulus manages eloquently, grabbing hold of the pillow and wrestling it out of the house elf‚Äôs hands. However, to Kreacher‚Äôs credit, Regulus is now awake.

He glares at the elf who is standing on the edge of the mattress huffing and puffing and looking thoroughly unimpressed. Regulus hugs the pillow to his chest with one arm and scrubs at his face with the other.

‚ÄúWhat are you blabbering on about,‚Äù realizing with disgust that he fell asleep in yesterday‚Äôs clothes. And without brushing his teeth. He makes a revolted face at the stale, dry taste in his mouth.

‚ÄúMr. Snape has been waiting downstairs for Master Regulus for almost thirty whole minutes and he is being very angry sir.‚Äù

Regulus blinks at him. ‚ÄúSnape? Severus Snape? Is here?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes Sir.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat time is it?‚Äù

‚ÄúNoon sir.‚Äù

A cold sense of dread washes over him. ‚ÄúNo. Oh fuck. I‚Äôm supposed to start working on this fucking potion with Snape this morning,‚Äù he mutters as he scrambles out of bed. Looking down at himself and grimacing. He can‚Äôt meet Snape wearing yesterday‚Äôs clothes.

‚ÄúYes I is knowing this sir.‚Äù

‚ÄúThen why the hell didn‚Äôt you wake me earlier!‚Äù Regulus snaps.

It‚Äôs now Kreacher‚Äôs turn to glare. ‚ÄúI have been trying sir,‚Äù he gestures emphatically at the bed and Regulus groans, covering his face with his hands. He has a pounding headache and despite having slept like the dead he feels fucking exhausted.

‚ÄúSorry Kreacher,‚Äù he says finally ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just‚ÄîI‚Äôm not used to oversleeping.‚Äù

And now Kreacher looks worried instead of annoyed, which is definitely worse. ‚ÄúI is knowing this too sir.‚Äù

‚ÄúWill you just‚Äîtell Snape I‚Äôll be down in ten minutes alright?‚Äù

Kreacher grimaces. ‚ÄúI will try,‚Äù and with a crack he disappears, leaving Regulus alone with his self-hatred.

This truly is a new low. Regulus is always prepared, always on time, being caught like this‚Äîit makes him feel weak. He taps his fingers anxiously on his thigh, closing his eyes for a minute and breathing in deeply. He doesn‚Äôt have time to be upset with himself right now. He has to get it together.

He counts to ten before opening his eyes again. And then he forces himself to move.

He showers and dresses in record time, and when he finally makes it down the stairs to the sitting room it‚Äôs only been five minutes longer than he promised. Though he can hear Snape bitching from the hallway.

‚Äú‚Äîand if he thinks that I‚Äôll just wait around here all day while he‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúStop harassing my house elf Severus,‚Äù he says lazily from the doorway, hands in his trouser pockets, shoulders pulled back. Both of the individuals in the room turn towards him, Kreacher looking significantly more happy to see him than Snape.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre late,‚Äù Snape snaps, eyes already narrowed.

‚ÄúYup,‚Äù is all Regulus says before he turns his attention to Kreacher. ‚ÄúCan you get lunch ready for us? I‚Äôm starving.‚Äù Which isn‚Äôt exactly true but he knows it will make Kreacher happy to hear. Honestly, Regulus‚Äôs stomach feels like a bit of a toxic wasteland at the moment.

‚ÄúYes sir, of course,‚Äù Kreacher bows his head. ‚ÄúI will be making it at once.‚Äù With another crack he very happily gets himself out of Snape‚Äôs sight.

Regulus feels the other boy run him over. ‚ÄúYou look like shit Black.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight back at you sweetheart,‚Äù though he does look like shit. Half because he‚Äôs hungover and half because he hasn‚Äôt taken anything this morning. There‚Äôs an insistent itch under his skin begging for potions but he pushes it aside. He needs his thoughts clear for this. And he doesn‚Äôt like the idea of being alone around Snape without his senses.

‚ÄúWell c‚Äômon then, lets get this over with,‚Äù Regulus turns around and heads towards the basement stairs. Snape‚Äôs grumpy footsteps following after him.

When they enter the lab he summons a sleep potion to the work table in the middle of the room, along with all the individual ingredients, laying them out in neat piles. And then. Without thinking. He flicks his wand again.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù Snape stumbles into the table as a ghostly stag comes galloping into the room.

It‚Äôs been weeks since Regulus has been able to conjure Boo, but he‚Äôs spent so long doing it that it‚Äôs become second nature. Even when he‚Äôs high he still tries to cast his Patronus, still watches as nothing but white vapours come out of his wand. Now he stands face to face with the stag and he feels his heart tremble ever so slightly.

Hi, he almost says. Hey. Hello.

I‚Äôve missed you.

‚ÄúYour Patronus is a stag?‚Äù Snape demands, sounding unnecessarily upset as he rights himself.

Regulus blinks, pulling his eyes away from the animal in front of him to meet Snape‚Äôs angry glare.

‚ÄúObviously,‚Äù he says, even though it hadn‚Äôt been remotely obvious to him the first time.

Snape just keeps scrutinizing him, but to be quite frank, Regulus can‚Äôt be bothered figuring out why. He turns to Boo, who steps forward, gently knocking his forehead against Regulus‚Äôs shoulder before he saunters off, walking the perimeter of the room as he is want to do. It feels good, having him here. Calms some of the jittering in Regulus‚Äôs skin.

‚ÄúYou expecting dementors?‚Äù Snape asks, still eyeing Regulus with suspicion.

Regulus shrugs. ‚ÄúNever know these days.‚Äù

And surprisingly, Snape seems to accept this.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù Regulus faces the table. ‚ÄúI suppose the real question, is do you think we‚Äôll have to brew the ingredients differently, to make them react to oxygen and become gaseous, or do we have to find a way to transfigure the finished solution?‚Äù

He expects some kind of snappy remark but instead Snape seems to be seriously considering the question, stepping up beside him in front of the table. After several long minutes of gazing intently at the ingredients, Snape speaks;

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll have to change how it‚Äôs brewed,‚Äù there is something definite about his tone. ‚ÄúTransfiguration will alter the appearance but it won‚Äôt change the actual properties of the mixture. It would still have to be drunk.‚Äù

Regulus nods. ‚ÄúI agree. We should specifically focus on how we brew‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThe Lavender and Valerian Sprigs.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, exactly. If we smoke the Valerian‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúAnd boil the Lavender‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThat might do the trick.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat makes sense. Altering those two ingredients should alter the state of the potion itself. I can take the Lavender if you want to‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúSmoke the Valerian, sure. I‚Äôm also thinking we should increase the length of time it simmers for."

Snape nods. ‚ÄúYes, that‚Äôs a good idea.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood.‚Äù

They both look at each other, suddenly realizing that, not only have they just had a whole conversation without insulting or threatening one another, but they have, in fact, been finishing one another‚Äôs sentences.

Eventually Snape coughs, clearing his throat. ‚ÄúWe should‚Ä¶get started.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah. Yes. Definitely.‚Äù

It‚Äôs awkward sure, though not as awkward as it should be. Both of them far too engrossed in their work to really think about how much they dislike the person next to them. When all is said and done the stakes are too high for personal grudges. This is a very complicated bastardization of potion law that they‚Äôve promised they‚Äôll be able to achieve in a very short amount of time. And if there is one person you keep your promises to, it‚Äôs the Dark Lord.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it then,‚Äù Regulus says as he wipes the sweat from his forehead, stepping back and watching the cauldron in front of him boil.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it,‚Äù Snape agrees.

‚ÄúNow we wait.‚Äù

‚ÄúNow we wait.‚Äù

Regulus lets the awkward silence linger for a moment longer before he starts tidying up the mess they‚Äôve made. They‚Äôre starting with a single batch, and if that turns out as planned they‚Äôll figure out how to mass produce the stuff. It‚Äôs a delicate science, potions, making large quantities of something requires more thought than simply doubling the recipe.

‚ÄúHow do you know Lucius?‚Äù

The question comes so out of nowhere that Regulus actually drops the mortar and pestle he‚Äôs holding. The tools banging onto the tabletop.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs married to my cousin,‚Äù Regulus chokes out, heart stuttering as he quickly cleans up his mess. He has his back to Snape so he can‚Äôt see his face.

‚ÄúDid you know him before that?‚Äù

‚ÄúSure,‚Äù Regulus sweeps up the left over ingredients, placing them in their individual jars. He could do it with his wand but he‚Äôs grateful to have something to keep his hands occupied. There‚Äôs another long moment of silence and Regulus is hopeful that this weird line of questioning has reached it‚Äôs conclusion but then Snape speaks again:

‚ÄúIs there something going on between you two?‚Äù

Regulus has to pause before he grabs the next jar, hands shaking too badly. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry, I should have phrased that differently. Clearly something is going on between you two.‚Äù

Regulus gives up on the ingredients and resorts to simply gripping the wooden table. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúJust like there was nothing going on between you and Roger Flint?‚Äù

‚ÄúFuck you.‚Äù

‚ÄúOr James Potter?‚Äù

The comparison rocks Regulus, vomit crawling up the back of his throat. He‚Äôs been throwing up far too much lately for someone who‚Äôs barely eating.
