He runs a hand over his slicked back hair for the third time in the past fifteen minutes. The Portkey has brought him somewhere on the continent, he isn‚Äôt sure where. It‚Äôs warm here, the sun beating down outside so fiercely that even standing in the shaded entryway he‚Äôs still sweating profusely.

Or maybe that‚Äôs the nerves.

He always gets anxious before these meetings, it‚Äôs only natural. But this time is worse. Because this time he‚Äôs messed up. The very thought makes his stomach squirm. He‚Äôd been doing so well. For once in his life he‚Äôd been excelling at something, not just barely scraping by. And now‚Ä¶

He passes his weight between his feet, wringing his hands out in front of his stomach. The last time he‚Äôd felt this terrified was probably the first time he‚Äôd met with Voldemort. It‚Äôs a scary thing, switching sides. Brave, is what Voldemort had called it. It had felt quite good to hear that, from a man like him. Someone so smart and so talented. Someone who was, himself, willing to take on the government and the accepted order of society for what he believed in.

It isn‚Äôt that Peter has much of a problem with Mudbloods really. That isn‚Äôt why he did it. I mean, he likes Lily. And he likes Mary. But he‚Äôs not willing to die for them. And he thinks that‚Äôs fair, because he doubts very much that they‚Äôd die for him.

‚ÄúMr. Pettigrew?‚Äù

Peter jumps as a man with an intimidatingly deep voice steps out of the shadows.

‚ÄúEr‚Äîyeah?‚Äù

‚ÄúOur lord will receive you now.‚Äù

He turns on his heel and Peter assumes he‚Äôs probably meant to follow so he does, tripping a little as he goes, thankful the man is facing forward and doesn‚Äôt see. Everything about this building is narrow, the hallway not wide enough for two people to walk side by side, the ceiling domed, with ornate copper chandeliers hanging down every few steps. And the heat. It really is bloody hot. Peter can feel his clothes growing damp.

They walk straight for a long time. There are doors on either side of them but no corners or twists and Peter thinks it must be a spell because he doesn‚Äôt remember the building being this long from the outside.

Eventually the man in front of him slows to a stop, gesturing to the nondescript door beside him that looks like every other one they‚Äôve passed.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs waiting for you,‚Äù his voice fills up the tiny space and makes Peter want to cower away. That‚Äôs all the instruction he gets before the man continues down the hall. Peter tries to squint through the shadows, to see the end, but he can‚Äôt. Eventually, he‚Äôs forced to face the door.

‚ÄúCome in,‚Äù says a high voice after he hesitantly knocks, like he‚Äôs hoping whoever‚Äôs inside won‚Äôt hear and he‚Äôll just be able to walk away.

The room smells heavily of something that makes Peter‚Äôs head swim‚Äîlavender? Sandalwood? The walls are plaster, cracked, old, faded green paint covering them. The floors dressed in luxurious carpets, a heavy oak desk at one end of the room and heavy oak bookshelves on the other, the same copper chandelier as the ones in the hallway hanging above their heads.

Voldemort is standing in front of a painting, his back to Peter, hands held behind him. For a moment neither of them speak. A long moment, as far as Peter is concerned. He fidgets at the door, trying to decide whether or not he‚Äôs expected to say something. Constantly second guessing himself every time he goes to announce his presence until eventually the Dark Lord puts him out of his misery.

‚ÄúI expect you know why you‚Äôre here?‚Äù

Peter swallows.

He does.

The Aurors were warned about the attack.

About the gas.

All of it. It was a massacre. It‚Äôd all been outlined for him in the letter that he‚Äôd found in his flat, along with the Portkey that had brought him here. Peter isn‚Äôt exactly sure how to answer the question though. Does Voldemort think there‚Äôs a chance he didn‚Äôt read the letter? Is it a rhetorical question?

‚ÄúThis is usually when you start babbling on about how there‚Äôs no way you could have known we were walking into a trap,‚Äù Voldemort once again speaks for him. ‚ÄúBegging for mercy, etcetera, etcetera.‚Äù

Fuck.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know,‚Äù because he hadn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúAnd how exactly is that possible?‚Äù the tone of his voice is calm, steady, his eyes still on the painting in front of him, like they‚Äôre just making small talk‚Äîdiscussing what they plan on having for supper.

Peter fidgets. ‚ÄúWe had a meeting recently, the Order, Dumbledore and Moody announced to everyone that there‚Äôs‚Ä¶a spy.‚Äù

‚ÄúI see. And did anyone question you?‚Äù

Peter almost snorts. They‚Äôd have to remember I existed first, he nearly says, but doesn‚Äôt. He doesn‚Äôt want Voldemort to think he isn‚Äôt important enough to be able to get him the information he needs.

‚ÄúNo, and I pointed the finger at someone else before they could start.‚Äù

Voldemort nods. ‚ÄúThen why didn‚Äôt someone tell you about this?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Peter swallows with some difficulty, his throat feeling tight. He pulls at his collar. ‚ÄúI think maybe Moody suspects that the spy is in the Order and not the Auror department,‚Äù he‚Äôd been intending to keep that particular suspicion to himself but‚Ä¶well, he has to say something. ‚ÄúSo he kept the Order out of it. Kept it within his department.‚Äù

Another long pause.

‚ÄúHis suspicions will have been confirmed then. He‚Äôll know whoever is passing me information is not an Auror. If you‚Äôre telling the truth that is, and you really didn‚Äôt know. That you haven‚Äôt just‚Ä¶lost your nerve. Decided to switch sides again.‚Äù

Peter feels as though his whole stomach has just jumped into his chest. ‚ÄúI would never‚Äîmy lord I would never. I am committed to you I swear.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure you swear the same to Dumbledore,‚Äù he says casually. ‚ÄúBackstabbers really are such finicky little things.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will not betray you,‚Äù Peter can feel everything he‚Äôs accomplished over the last few months slipping through his fingers. He had gained Voldemort‚Äôs trust, his respect, completing every task given to him seamlessly. And now‚Äînow it‚Äôs crumbling before his very eyes.

He licks his lips. ‚ÄúI swear on my life my lord, on the life of my mother and father, it is you I am faithful to and no one else. And‚Äîand I can still be useful. Even if Moody suspects an Order member there are dozens of other people it could be, he‚Äôll never think it‚Äôs me.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt will make it more difficult for you to collect information though.‚Äù

Peter grimaces. ‚ÄúI can do it. I promise this will never happen again.‚Äù

Somehow Peter has managed to stumble into the middle of the room, arms held out, beseeching. Begging. He certainly isn‚Äôt above begging. He‚Äôs honestly pretty good at it.

‚ÄúThis painting,‚Äù Voldemort says when he speaks next, taking Peter completely by surprise, ‚Äúis called the Flaying of Marsyas, have you seen it?‚Äù

‚ÄúEr‚Ä¶‚Äù Peter feels lost. ‚ÄúNo?‚Äù

Voldemort steps to the side, looking at Peter for the first time, dark eyes cutting right through him. ‚ÄúCome,‚Äù he gestures him forward, ‚Äúlook.‚Äù

Cautiously, Peter approaches. It‚Äôs a Muggle painting, that much is obvious right away because, well, no one is moving. Peter squints at it, not quite sure what he‚Äôs looking at. He‚Äôs always rather preferred landscapes when it comes to paintings‚Äîsimple, straight forward, pretty. This painting is none of those things.

‚ÄúThe Flaying of Marsyas? So they‚Äôre‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúCutting his skin off,‚Äù Voldemort says. ‚ÄúYes. You see, Marsyas challenged the god Appollo to a music competition. He lost, of course, but then Apollo had him strung up and skinned alive for even daring to think he could best a god.‚Äù

Something grows tight in Peter‚Äôs chest, eyes bouncing from Voldemort to the gruesome painting. ‚ÄúMy lord‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúIt's a lesson you see,‚Äù Voldemort interrupts him smoothly, ‚Äúthat tragedy will inevitably befall anyone foolish enough to think they can best their betters.‚Äù

Peter‚Äôs heart is really beginning to flutter now‚Äîa bird unwillingly caged. ‚ÄúMy lord I promise, I promise I would never go back to them.‚Äù

He smiles and then, in a movement so quick Peter doesn‚Äôt even see it, he reaches out and grabs him by the face. Peter squeaks at the tightness of Voldemort‚Äôs grip, the sharp puncturing of his nails. He leans in close and Peter begins to squirm but he gets nowhere.

The Dark Lord speaks. ‚ÄúI believe you Peter Pettigrew. But I want you to understand that if you betray me, if you dare to think you can out maneuver me, I will not hesitate to hang you from a tree and carve the skin from your bones.‚Äù

He throws Peter‚Äôs face out of his hand like he can‚Äôt bare to touch it anymore, Peter stumbling back a few paces, rubbing petulantly at his injured cheek.

‚ÄúI really do like the idea of flaying,‚Äù Voldemort‚Äôs voice is light again, as though nothing has happened. ‚ÄúLike a snake shedding its skin,‚Äù a shiver runs through Peter‚Äôs whole body when their eyes meet. When he sees the hunger in the man in front of him.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre dismissed.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Hi! Hey! Hello!

Am I freaking out about this chapter? Maybe. Do I just freak out about every chapter now? Apparently. Turns out. Oh well. Here we are.

Sorry this took so long again, but the chapters are just getting more complicated and heavy so it takes more time.

I hope this wasn't too much...I feel like Regulus chapters are always kinda a lot. But hey, next chapter is the Jegulus chapter so we can all look forward to that :)

Thank you all as always for sticking with me through this and being so kind even though it's the internet, I really appreciate all of you!

ALSO PSA: If you have made translations of Choices, can you get back in contact with me either via the comments or on tumblr (https://little-shit-soph.tumblr.com/) and give me a link and then I'll make a big post with links to all the translated versions so people can find them easier!!

Ok that's it thanks!

Chapter 51

Chapter Summary

The boys are back in town

Chapter Notes

tw referenced sexual assault

tw blood

tw referenced drug addiction (via potions)

tw suicidal ideation

See the end of the chapter for more notes

‚ÄúYou is not to be touching any of Master Regulus‚Äôs things.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight, well, I need to‚Äîow!‚Äù

‚ÄúI said you are not to be touching!‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, I heard you‚Äîfuck you slap hard‚Äîif you want me to help him then I‚Äôm going to need to touch things. I also need to know where he keeps his potions.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo one can go into Master Regulus‚Äôs lab without his permission.‚Äù

‚ÄúI think maybe you can make an exception this time.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre very unpleasant, has anyone ever told you that?‚Äù

The voices swim around in Regulus‚Äôs head as he struggles through the dark. They don‚Äôt mean anything to him. He hears them but he can‚Äôt think. Can‚Äôt understand. Noise, noise, noise. That‚Äôs all it is. They come in and out of focus, sometimes louder and sometimes quieter. But when he pushes, edges closer to the thinning of the dark, where the black becomes grey, and then almost a faint red, he starts to feel the pain again, and instantly falls back into the hole behind him. Letting it consume him.

‚ÄúWe have to take him to St Mungo‚Äôs.‚Äù

‚ÄúNO! Master Regulus is being very clear that we cannot do that.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe needs a healer.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

‚ÄúWell he‚Äôs fucking bleeding out and I don‚Äôt know what to do, I‚Äôm not‚ÄîI can‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú

Something in those words pokes at Regulus‚Äôs flickering consciousness. Not the meaning, which is still lost on him, but the‚Ä¶sound. Breaking. Cracking. Splintering off. And he wants to fix it. Wants to pull it back together. Wants to hold all the pieces in his hands.

‚ÄúOk, alright, new plan. You‚Äôre going to go get me whatever fucking healing potions he has‚Äîpain potions, blood replenishers, Skele-gro‚Äîwhatever he has. And you‚Äôre gonna get me towels and, I don‚Äôt know, if there‚Äôs a book of healing spells in this goddamn house that‚Äôd be really useful too. And I won‚Äôt touch any of it except when I use it on Regulus okay? Deal?‚Äù

‚ÄúIs a bad deal.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah well, we don‚Äôt have a lot of options right now so it‚Äôs bad deal or no deal.‚Äù

‚ÄúFine.‚Äù

‚ÄúFine.‚Äù

It hurts. His whole body hurts. It started off soft but it keeps getting brighter and brighter and soon he thinks he‚Äôs going to be on fire with it.

‚ÄúGod Reg,‚Äù those words are quieter than the others. Soft. Followed by something gentle brushing against the back of his hand. And he understands them. He understands. But oh how it hurts.

He whimpers, unable to hold it in anymore, his body involuntarily contracting.

‚ÄúReg? Regulus?‚Äù

He tries to speak but it just comes out as a high pathetic whine. His eyes open and close, fighting with themselves. It hurts. It hurts. It hurts.

‚ÄúPlease,‚Äù he can‚Äôt remember what he did. ‚ÄúPlease, I‚Äôm sorry, please.‚Äù He tries to be good. So good and so quiet and so small. ‚ÄúPlease stop. Please stop.‚Äù To give them no reason to punish him.

Not that they need a reason.

‚ÄúHey no, I‚ÄîI‚Äôm going to make it stop, I promise. I promise I‚Äôll make it stop okay?‚Äù the voice breaks again and Regulus squeezes his eyes shut, tears streaming down his face as he twitches and jerks and tries not to scream. Screaming always makes it worse. So does crying but he can‚Äôt stop that at this point. Never could. He tried to tell Sirius but he didn‚Äôt understand.

Sirius never cried.

Except that last time.

‚ÄúKreacher! Goddamnit Kreacher! I need a fucking pain potion or something!‚Äù

The yelling hurts and he makes another injured noise as he tries to curl further in on himself. Every time he moves pain ripples across his skin.

‚ÄúSorry, fuck, I‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù the voice is soft again, and suddenly close. ‚ÄúRegulus, can you hear me?‚Äù

He thinks about nodding but that‚Äôll hurt too much so he forces himself to speak. ‚ÄúYes,‚Äù it‚Äôs more a rattle than a word but he can‚Äôt manage anything else.

‚ÄúOkay good, that‚Äôs good,‚Äù the voice whispers. ‚ÄúEverything is going to be okay, alright? I‚Äôm going‚ÄîI‚Äôm going to figure out what to do and I‚Äôm going to make it stop hurting okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù Regulus swallows with difficulty. He can feel the sticky hot weight of blood on his skin. He doesn‚Äôt know where it‚Äôs coming from. He tries to ignore it. Ignore the way it makes his stomach lurch.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry I cried.‚Äù

The voice doesn‚Äôt speak for a long time and when it does it‚Äôs rough.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay. It‚Äôs okay, you can cry.‚Äù

Which Regulus knows isn‚Äôt true. Has never been true, but he doesn‚Äôt say so. Because it hurts to speak. To think. Even breathing sends spasms of pain along his spine.

‚ÄúWhat did I do?‚Äù he manages after a few more seconds, grimacing with the effort. ‚ÄúSirius what did I do to make them so angry?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù the voice hitches, like all the oxygen has suddenly been punched out of it. ‚ÄúReg I‚Äôm not‚Äî‚Äú

There‚Äôs a crack that has Regulus flinching, wishing desperately that he could shut his ears the same way he shuts his eyes. His head feels nauseous‚Äîthat‚Äôs the only way to describe it. Dizzy and achy and sick.

‚ÄúCan you not do that in here,‚Äù the voice hisses, ‚Äúloud noises hurt his head.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe is waking?‚Äù another voice whispers back.

‚ÄúYeah, sort of, he won‚Äôt really open his eyes and he‚Äôs‚Ä¶he‚Äôs confused.‚Äù

‚ÄúHis head‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere is much blood on his head.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah. I know.‚Äù

‚ÄúWill he‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be fine. He‚Äôs going to be fine. What did you find?‚Äù

‚ÄúHere is many towels sir and blood returning potions, and the purple cleaning one, and Pepperup.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat is all for healing sir.‚Äù

‚ÄúFucking‚Äîgoddamn Reg‚Äîhe has a whole goddamn potions lab in his house and this is all he has? No pain potion? Or, I don‚Äôt know, dreamlessly sleep?‚Äù

‚ÄúYour voice is getting loud sir.‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry, just‚ÄîI thought he would have more. It‚Äôll take ages to brew them from scratch and‚Ä¶‚Äù

Something wiggles in Regulus‚Äôs head. Some‚Ä¶some thought he can‚Äôt quite hold. Some memory. Of potions. Of glass bottles. Of fear.

‚ÄúWhat about Dittany? Did you see any of that?‚Äù

‚ÄúDittany?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah it‚Äôs like‚Ä¶it‚Äôs a plant. It has little round green leaves and a green stem.‚Äù

‚ÄúA plant. And it will be helping?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou can chew it, for small wounds. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôll do much for the rest but it can‚Äôt hurt.‚Äù

‚ÄúI is going back and checking sir.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah‚Äîokay, yeah. Thanks. I‚Äôll‚Ä¶fuck, I‚Äôll try to figure out what else to do.‚Äù

There‚Äôs another crack.

‚ÄúGoddamnit Kreacher.‚Äù

Potions. Bottles. Fear.

Potions. Bottles. Fear.

Potions. Bottles.

Potions.

He can see a floor covered in empty bottles.

He can see his hand uncorking one in his bathroom.

He can see Snape.

Snape.

And potions.

And empty bottles.

In his bathroom.

On the floor of the Atrium.

The Atrium.

The Ministry.

Evan.

Evan.

Evan.

He forces his eyes open. The nausea in his head explodes, dozens of tiny black dots speckling his vision as he slips and flails, trying to push himself up. He‚Äôs lying on the dining room table he realizes. His blood dripping over the sides.

‚ÄúWoah, woah, hold on, Jesus, slow down,‚Äù the voice.

And suddenly James Potter is in front of him, hands hovering over his sides, ready to catch him but not touching.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù James says softly, ‚Äúyour eyes are open.‚Äù

Regulus stares at him, trying to blink the black dots away. Waiting for the moment that the world tilts again and he finds himself on his own. James nothing but a shadow. Some trick of the light his fucked up brain turned into a ghost. But he keeps staring. And staring. And staring. And that doesn‚Äôt happen. The dots disappear and James remains.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck is going on,‚Äù Regulus forces the words out. It feels like nails are being hammered through his skull.

James huffs out a laugh. ‚ÄúI was kind of hoping you could tell me that.‚Äù

Regulus has to drop his head, it‚Äôs too heavy to hold up. He exhales slowly, trying to grab onto something solid but everything keeps slipping away. Thoughts. Words. What does he know? What does he know for certain right now?

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in Grimmauld?‚Äù he says suddenly.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James confirms. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about as creepy as I was expecting.‚Äù

Panic grips Regulus‚Äôs chest. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt be here,‚Äù he forces himself to look up even though it makes the pain ten times worse. ‚ÄúJames what the fuck are you doing here? It‚Äôs not safe. You have‚Äîyou have to go. You have to go now.‚Äù He doesn‚Äôt understand. Doesn‚Äôt understand how he ended up bleeding on the dining room table with James Potter as his nursemaid. It doesn‚Äôt make sense and his head hurts too much to figure it out.

‚ÄúHey, breathe okay? Kreacher helped me adjust the wards, shut down the Floo, no one‚Äôs allowed in.‚Äù

The wards.

Regulus shakes his head, regretting it instantly and gritting his teeth against the pain. ‚ÄúThat won‚Äôt stop them.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, but it‚Äôll give me enough of a warning to get the fuck out.‚Äù

Maybe.

Merlin, maybe but still‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúJames,‚Äù he can feel himself slipping again, the black dots coming back. ‚ÄúWhat the fuck are you doing here?‚Äù he repeats.

He can‚Äôt really look at his face. Can‚Äôt really look at anything, has to keep dropping his head or closing his eyes.

‚ÄúKreacher came and got me. Said you needed help. Wish he‚Äôd been a bit more specific about the kind of help but‚Ä¶here we are.‚Äù

‚ÄúKreacher?‚Äù

Oh.

Oh of course.

You is needing saving sir.

And what had he said in reply? Over and over again?

James.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù his hands grip his knees. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry. I didn‚Äôt mean for‚ÄîI‚Äôm so sorry.‚Äù

‚ÄúWoah, it‚Äôs okay. Reg, it‚Äôs okay.‚Äù

He barely stops himself from shaking his head again. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really not. This is so fucking dangerous James. You can‚Äôt be here. Wards or no wards. You. Can‚Äôt. Be. Here.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence.

‚ÄúCan I touch you?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúCan I‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Regulus says before he can finish, always pathetically easy when it comes to James Potter. ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

James‚Äôs hands are cold against his hot skin, carefully, so carefully, taking Regulus‚Äôs face between them and lifting his head up. Their eyes meet.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad I‚Äôm here, okay?‚Äù James says, still whispering.

And Regulus doesn‚Äôt know what to say to that. Can‚Äôt organize his thoughts enough to even attempt to form a response. So he just lets his eyes close.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre ridiculous,‚Äù he manages eventually.

James laughs softly. And maybe a little sadly too.

For a while they just stay like that. Regulus trying to focus only on James‚Äôs touch, trying to forget the burning across his back and arms. The insufferable pounding in his head.

Inhale.

Exhale.

Inhale.

Exhale.

‚ÄúDo you know what‚Äôs hurting?‚Äù James asks eventually.

Regulus takes a moment. Nothing in his head seems to be where it‚Äôs supposed to be. Like someone has come along and messed up his memories. Dumped them out of their folders and scattered them on the floor.

‚ÄúHead,‚Äù he manages eventually, forcing his brain to focus. ‚ÄúSomething hit my head and then‚Äî‚Äú

Lupin.

‚ÄúA spell?‚Äù James asks.

Lupin.

Lupin.

Lupin.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry. Um‚Äîno. Just, part of the fountain. And then I splinched myself. Trying to get back. Here. Home.‚Äù

After Remus fucking Lupin saved my ass. He can‚Äôt help it, he laughs, even though it hurts, turning into some kind of choked cough halfway through.

‚ÄúHey, take it easy okay?‚Äù

He wants to tell James. Because maybe he‚Äôd actually get the joke. But he doesn‚Äôt have the energy to explain it all. Doesn‚Äôt think he could get enough air in his lungs.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù is all he says, voice barely there.

‚ÄúSo splinching and a head injury? That‚Äôs not too bad.‚Äù

‚ÄúSays you.‚Äù

His eyes are still closed so he can‚Äôt see James‚Äôs face, but he feels his thumb brushing over his cheek. And it‚Äôs ridiculous to think that it helps. That it takes away even a tiny part of his pain. And yet‚Ä¶

And yet.

‚ÄúI meant we can handle it.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I can handle much of anything right now.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can handle it then.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs good.‚Äù

Another huff of laughter.

There are pins and needles running through Regulus‚Äôs arms and legs, he flexes his fingers and knows they‚Äôre starting to go numb.

‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm gonna need to lie down again.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúJust splinching and a head injury,‚Äù his words sound a little slurred as James helps maneuver him back onto his side so he doesn‚Äôt have to open his eyes. He hisses as he puts weight on his bottom arm.

‚ÄúCareful,‚Äù James says quietly, and Regulus can tell by the nearness of his voice that he‚Äôs crouched down, a second later he feels James‚Äôs hand in his hair, pushing the curls off his face. Every part of his body feels like it‚Äôs pulsing.

And then there‚Äôs a loud crack.

And his fucking head explodes.

‚ÄúKreacher, Jesus, I told you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI is sorry! I forget! Master Regulus I is sorry!‚Äù

Merlin poor Kreacher.

Is what Regulus thinks.

‚ÄúReg, hey, Reg‚Äîpain potions, we can‚Äôt find them, where‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúMy bathroom,‚Äù it comes out a sob. Merlin he‚Äôs so fucking tired of being in pain. ‚ÄúBehind the mirror.‚Äù

‚ÄúGot it, got it, Kreacher can you get one‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThree.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

He can‚Äôt answer right away, because he‚Äôs pretty sure if he tries he‚Äôs going to start throwing up and that‚Äôll hurt like a bitch. So he waits. Waits for the pain to dim just enough that he can‚Äî

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù

‚ÄúI. Need. Three.‚Äù

Silence. He wishes he could open his eyes without wanting to tear his brain from his skull.

‚ÄúThree,‚Äù James repeats. ‚ÄúRegulus that‚Äôs too much. I know you‚Äôre in pain but‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúIt won‚Äôt‚Äîless won‚Äôt work. Just. Fuck. Please. Listen. Please. Please.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù James says finally, sounding anything but sure. ‚ÄúOkay, Kreacher? Three potions, from behind the mirror in the bathroom‚Äîand please, Apparate from a different room.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes sir. Yes, right away sir.‚Äù

A few seconds later there‚Äôs a gentle hand on Regulus‚Äôs forehead and he whines. Something he would feel embarrassed about if he wasn‚Äôt already so fucking gone.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù James says softly. ‚ÄúI know. We‚Äôre going to get the pain potion and then I‚Äôm going to fix you up okay?‚Äù

Regulus can‚Äôt really respond but James doesn‚Äôt seem to expect him to.

He focuses on his hand again, the weight of it on his skin. The familiarity of its touch even after all this time.

Inhale.

Exhale.

In the end, he doesn‚Äôt stay conscious long enough for the potion.

¬†

¬†

The next time he opens his eyes he almost cries with relief. The stabbing pain in his brain has gone, leaving behind a faint ache. He blinks up at the ceiling for a few minutes, letting the world reform around him. He‚Äôs in a bed this time, not on a table. His bed to be exact. His body sore and tired, but at least he doesn‚Äôt feel like he‚Äôs being torn apart. He prods at the bandages on his arms and when he brings his hand up to his nose he smells Dittany.

Smart.

Most people wouldn‚Äôt think to apply it directly to the wounds, but the prolonged exposure will likely give it a chance to work on the deeper cuts in a way it wouldn‚Äôt have if just ingested.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre awake.‚Äù

He starts, head snapping towards the voice and instantly regretting it. Not quite healed enough for fast movements. He grimaces, closing his eyes for a minute as his brain settles. When he opens them again he's met with the sight of James Potter, sitting in a chair across from his bed, elbows on his knees, something in his hands.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre here,‚Äù Regulus says stupidly, because it‚Äôs no less shocking now than it was the first time. He had been more than willing to write it off as some sort of delusion. That would honestly make more sense to him than James Potter actually being in his house.

Kreacher went and got him.

Told him you needed help.

And he came.

After everything he‚Äî

‚ÄúThree potions,‚Äù James‚Äôs voices cuts off Regulus‚Äôs thoughts.

Something is‚Ä¶wrong.

Regulus pushes himself up to sit against the headboard, pillows supporting his lower back. It‚Äôs a clumsy process that takes far too long but he‚Äôs not about to have this conversation lying down.

James isn‚Äôt looking at him, eyes trained instead on the thing in his hands, which Regulus can now see is a potion bottle.

‚ÄúThree potions is way too much, and I couldn‚Äôt figure out why you thought you needed it,‚Äù James says, voice carefully blank. ‚ÄúYou of all people know how these potions work. How potent they are. How powerful.‚Äù He passes the little vial back and forth between his palms, tension hanging heavy in the room. Regulus can practically see it curving around James‚Äôs shoulders, down his rigid spine, into the tight way he‚Äôs holding his mouth. There‚Äôs something dangerous about it. Regulus feels like he‚Äôs standing on the edge of a cliff just waiting to be pushed off.

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt a pain potion,‚Äù he holds up the vial, looking at Regulus for the first time. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt realize it when Kreacher first brought them down. I was too busy freaking out. But once I had you stable I realized‚Ä¶this isn‚Äôt a pain potion.‚Äù

Regulus just watches him, not sure where this is going. I mean, okay, maybe he knows a little bit where this is going, but he‚Äôs not sure why James seems so‚Ä¶angry. He isn‚Äôt yelling, but everything about the way he‚Äôs holding himself feels like rage.

‚ÄúThere are a ton of these behind that mirror, at least two dozen. Unlabelled. And way more of them empty under the sink.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to pretend I know what‚Äôs in this,‚Äù James presses on, voice starting to shake ever so slightly. ‚ÄúBut I‚Äôm going to take a wild guess that it has nothing to do with pain management.‚Äù

Shows what you know,

is the first thing Regulus thinks, though it doesn‚Äôt quite make it past his lips. A long moment of silence stretches between them before either of them speaks again.

‚ÄúSo what.‚Äù

James blinks. ‚ÄúSo what?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, so what. What the fuck does any of this have to do with you?‚Äù

James just stares at him, everything in his eyes so‚Ä¶so big. That‚Äôs the only way Regulus can think to describe it. Holding his stare feels impossible. There‚Äôs too much of it. Regulus isn‚Äôt enough to take it all.

Eventually James laughs. It‚Äôs a cold sound, sending chills down Regulus‚Äôs spine. He gets out of his chair and for a second Regulus thinks he might just walk out. After everything. All this time. He might just leave. Again.

But he doesn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúEverything you did‚Äî‚Äú James starts and then stops, taking a deep breath. ‚ÄúEverything you let THEM do. To Sirius, to Mary, to you. You justified by saying you didn‚Äôt want to die. And I fucking fell for it.‚Äù

Regulus feels his brows draw together. ‚ÄúWhat are you talking about?‚Äù But James is barely listening to him.

‚ÄúI thought‚ÄîI thought,‚Äù his voice breaks and Regulus thinks there might be tears in his eyes. ‚ÄúI thought, he‚Äôs so scared. He‚Äôs so scared. He really thinks they‚Äôre going to kill him. And he doesn‚Äôt have anyone‚Äîanywhere safe. And I wanted to be that somewhere safe for you Reg. I wanted to be it so bad because I thought‚ÄîI thought if I could, then you‚Äîyou would see that you didn‚Äôt have to do this. That there was another way,‚Äù he runs a hand over his face, maybe he‚Äôs wiping away tears Regulus doesn‚Äôt know. ‚ÄúI felt fucking bad for you. I felt so fucking bad for you and it was all bullshit.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe hell it was!‚Äù Regulus snaps before he can stop himself.

‚ÄúI thought you were scared, I thought you did it all because you were scared.‚Äù

‚ÄúI WAS scared!‚Äù

‚ÄúThen what the hell is this Regulus?‚Äù He holds up the glass vial, and now he is yelling. His voice shaking Regulus‚Äôs chest, making his eyes prickle. It isn‚Äôt just because he‚Äôs being yelled at. It‚Äôs James. It‚Äôs the look in his eyes, his voice cracking on the way out of his mouth. He‚Äôs hurt. Somehow Regulus has managed to hurt him again and he doesn‚Äôt even know how.

‚ÄúWhat the hell is this?‚Äù James goes on. ‚ÄúYou justified every horrible fucking thing you did by saying you were afraid of dying‚Äîit‚Äôs Voldemort or death that‚Äôs what you said. So you had to get the Mark. Had to stay here in this goddamn house. Had to leave me‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúYOU left me!‚Äù

‚ÄúBULLSHIT!‚Äù James‚Äôs face is red, his chest heaving. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs bullshit Reg and you know it! You left, the minute you got that fucking snake on your arm. You gave up everything because you wanted to live and I thought you were wrong, I thought you were wrong but I still understood. Because dying is a scary thing. But after all of that, all of the pain you caused so that you could survive, here you are KILLING YOUR FUCKING SELF.‚Äù

He throws the potion bottle across the room, the glass smashing against the wall making Regulus flinch. There‚Äôs buzzing in his ears, James‚Äôs voice still hanging in the air. Ugly and mean and maybe honest. And maybe true. But there‚Äôs a cruelty in telling the truth, something James has never understood.

‚ÄúSo was it worth it?‚Äù James asks, voice ragged. ‚ÄúHuh? Letting them torture Sirius? Attack Mary‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI saved Macdonald!‚Äù Regulus snaps, because he‚Äôs had just about a goddamn enough of James‚Äôs sermonizing.

James looks at him oddly. ‚ÄúIs that what you think?‚Äù

Regulus fists the comforter, glaring at him. ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a moment of hesitation, like he doesn‚Äôt know whether or not he should keep going, but in the end, James Potter has never excelled at self-restraint. ‚ÄúOne of these days you‚Äôre going to have to come to terms with the fact, that what you did to her is exactly what your family did to you when they pretended they couldn‚Äôt see what Lucius was up to.‚Äù

And oh.

Oh.

Oh.

Regulus has to resist the urge to wrap his arms around himself. To protect himself from those words. A profound silence settling over the room. His mind twitches, threatening to let it all go. To open every box in every corner and let it all come spilling out. Every horrible feeling. Every moment he screamed and no one came.

‚ÄúIs exactly what your father did,‚Äù James goes on, because apparently he still has more to say. Apparently that wasn‚Äôt enough. ‚ÄúWhen he left you and Sirius at the mercy of your mother.‚Äù

Regulus is shaking so badly he‚Äôs not sure he‚Äôll be able to speak. He‚Äôs so fucking angry. And something else. Something he can‚Äôt name. Something that sits heavy behind his ribs and threatens to break him.

‚ÄúYeah well,‚Äù he manages eventually, impressed by how empty his voice is, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs what people do.‚Äù

He gets some satisfaction out of the way James reels back at that. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI've told you before, we can‚Äôt all be heroes, some of us just have to be people. And people do whatever the fuck they need to to get through the day. Good or bad, wrong or right, none of it matters in the end,‚Äù it‚Äôs work to keep his teeth from chattering, to make his words come out clearly. ‚ÄúAll the pain I‚Äôve been through? It never made me strong or brave, it just made me so goddamn sure that I didn‚Äôt want to feel it again. So yeah, I shoved everyone I could in front of me, used them to protect myself. And I would do it again. Maybe that makes me a coward. Maybe that makes me a villain. I honestly don‚Äôt care at this point. I just don‚Äôt want to fucking hurt anymore.‚Äù

He holds onto his anger with trembling hands, holds it up as a shield and hides behind it. Ignoring everything else that James‚Äôs words have done. Every way they‚Äôve twisted him up. Ignores the weight in his chest. Ignores the boxes threatening to unlock themselves.

He will not feel this.

He won‚Äôt.

He‚Äôs not strong enough,

He never was.

James is different though. The rage that had been wafting off him a few minutes ago has transformed into something else, something more complicated. And that pisses Regulus off. Because he started this, he doesn‚Äôt get to look like that now. Doesn‚Äôt get to look heartbroken.

‚ÄúI want my wand,‚Äù Regulus finally says, when the silence becomes just a little too much.

James arches his brow. ‚ÄúYou going to curse me?‚Äù

‚ÄúThinking about it,‚Äù Regulus says flatly. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs my fucking wand Potter?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh so it‚Äôs Potter now?‚Äù

‚ÄúDamn right it‚Äôs Potter, you think you can just say‚Äî‚Äú but his voice cuts out, hands shaking as he runs them through his hair. ‚ÄúI want my wand. Krea‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt need to call him,‚Äù James walks over to Regulus‚Äôs desk, picking up his wand and waving it at him. ‚ÄúI brought it up.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt say anything just holds out his hand. He feels naked without it. Disadvantaged. Well, more disadvantaged than he already is‚Äîbeing injured and barely able to sit up on his own. James hands the wand over, handle first, and then pauses, the tip pressed to his stomach. Regulus‚Äôs eyes find the point of contact and then flick up to James‚Äôs face, seeing the challenge in his gaze.

He doesn‚Äôt need to say ‚ÄúI dare you‚Äù Regulus can hear it loud and clear.

He rips his wand away from James‚Äôs stomach and James takes a step back but doesn‚Äôt go far. Regulus really isn‚Äôt planning on using it. He just wants to have it, wants to show James he isn‚Äôt some weak quivering mess, wants the comforting weight in his hand.

He really isn‚Äôt planning to use it.

But.

Well.

He flicks it without thinking. Barely even noticing. Mind focused on whether or not he wants to kick James Potter out of his fucking house (the answer is no, but he‚Äôs loathed to admit it). He‚Äôs so used to Boo randomly appearing that he doesn‚Äôt even bother acknowledging him when he slips out.

But James goes stiff.

‚ÄúRelax, it‚Äôs just a Patronus, it‚Äôs not going to do anything to you,‚Äù he mutters irritably, wondering if James really thinks he would curse him. But the other boy still doesn‚Äôt move, eyes wide as he watches the ghostly figure walk towards him.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù Regulus says, not understanding why he‚Äôs acting like he‚Äôs never seen a Patronus before. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not going to hurt you,‚Äù and when he still doesn‚Äôt get a response; ‚ÄúLook I‚Äôll get rid of him okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo don‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú James‚Äôs voice is strained as he holds up his hand, stopping Regulus half-way through the incantation. He‚Äôs still watching Boo like he can‚Äôt tear his eyes away. And then, without warning, he pulls his own wand out of his back pocket.

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúExpecto-Patronum,‚Äù the spell comes out of his mouth a little shakily and there‚Äôs a burst of bright light. A second later a stag appears. He gallops across Regulus‚Äôs bed before running up to Boo, the pair turning to look at one another. They aren‚Äôt identical. Boo is a little bit shorter, his antlers different, his neck thicker. But‚Äîbut‚Äî

‚ÄúThey match,‚Äù Regulus says breathlessly, watching Boo move forward, watching him duck his head down, pressing into the other stag‚Äôs chest, who curves around him like‚Äîlike they‚Äôre holding one another.

James sits down on the end of the bed, seemingly in a similar state of awe. Eventually Boo pulls away and the pair starts chasing one another, two bright blurs of motion circling the room. Playing.

It‚Äôs beautiful.

After a few moments Regulus finally manages to make himself speak. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt mean anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt mean anything,‚Äù James repeats numbly, neither of them looking away from the bright lights in front of them. Regulus doesn‚Äôt know if stags can actually smile, but he‚Äôs pretty sure Boo is.

‚ÄúIf that‚Äôs‚Äîif you‚Äôre freaking out because your Patronus matches a‚Ä¶Death Eater‚Äôs,‚Äù he says the words derisively, ‚Äúif you think that says something about you, it doesn‚Äôt. Okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause it doesn‚Äôt mean anything,‚Äù James says again, in that same flat voice. And then he laughs, dropping his face into hands. ‚ÄúYou really believe that Reg?‚Äù

And Regulus tries to answer but his throat has grown too tight, watching as Boo playfully butts his antlers against the other stag‚Äôs. Yes, he wants to say.

It doesn‚Äôt matter.

It doesn‚Äôt mean anything.

Lets both move on.

Like we should have done years ago.

Should have done after the first kiss.

Yes. I believe that. Believe all of it.

But he can‚Äôt quite make the words come out of his mouth.

‚ÄúYou really think I would be here if you didn‚Äôt mean‚Äî‚Äú James‚Äôs voice breaks and he takes a deep breath, letting his hands fall away from his face as he sits back up. ‚ÄúIf you didn‚Äôt mean anything to me?‚Äù

The two stags are slowly moving around one another. In awe. In reverence. Sometimes they brush up against each other‚Äîtheir noses, their foreheads. Regulus is always telling Cerci that Boo isn‚Äôt real, just an incantation. But that‚Äôs never been harder to believe than it is right now. Watching him with James‚Äôs stag. The way his eyes follow him, the way he fits himself so perfectly at his side.

Regulus has to close his eyes because it‚Äôs too much. James has always been able to make him lose control. He feels the weight in his chest starting to crack his ribs, everything inside of him pushing and pushing with nowhere to go.

He‚Äôd thought they were some freak accident. That a mistake had been made. James Potter and Regulus Black were never meant to speak. Never meant to grow close. Never meant to fall in love. That is not how the story goes. It was inevitable that fate would course correct. That they would be forced back onto the paths they were always supposed to travel, completely separate from one another.

And yet.

And yet they match.

In the most intimate way two wizards possibly can.

And how can that be? How can that be if they were doomed from the start?

He grabs hold of James‚Äôs wrist as the house shakes again. He doesn‚Äôt know how long the wards will last under pressure but he‚Äôs not taking any chances.

‚ÄúWoah hey, careful, you‚Äôre hurt,‚Äù James says as Regulus scrambles off the bed, dragging James with him. His back and arms twinge, head a little light, but he doesn‚Äôt care. He pulls James out of the room and down the stairs.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll open the Floo,‚Äù he explains without stopping, without taking a minute to breathe, ‚Äújust long enough for you to go through,‚Äù they stumble onto the main floor. ‚ÄúThen close it again. It shouldn‚Äôt be enough time for anyone else to get in.‚Äù

‚ÄúShouldn‚Äôt?‚Äù

Regulus grimaces but doesn‚Äôt comment. He‚Äôs been selfish, he knows that. He should have made James leave before now. Should have made him leave the moment he was conscious again.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he pants as they reach the fireplace, his hand gripping the mantle, ignoring the curious faces of the little painted boys above. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll open it now and you can‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúWait‚ÄîJesus Regulus, breathe okay? It‚Äôll take them a minute to get through the wards.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know that!‚Äù he snaps, voice cracking. Because if it‚Äôs Lucius, or Bellatrix, or god, fucking Voldemort himself, and they get their hands on James‚Äîthe thought alone makes Regulus feel sick.

‚ÄúPlease,‚Äù he says as James steps into his space, hands cupping his face. ‚ÄúPlease, I just want you to be safe.‚Äù

But James is apparently in no hurry, not caring at all for Regulus‚Äôs nerves. The fucking bastard. Instead he just stands there, staring, like he hasn‚Äôt had his fill yet.

‚ÄúCome with me.‚Äù

Regulus blinks. Feeling like he‚Äôs been thrown back in time.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúCome with me.‚Äù

This just feels mean. ‚ÄúGo. James.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

But he pulls away, out of James‚Äôs reach, taking a few steps in the opposite direction before turning back. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre with Lily Evans.‚Äù

James‚Äôs face is serious. ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre having a baby with her.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

Regulus laughs humourlessly as the house trembles again. The painting above the mantle threatening to fall.

‚ÄúSo‚Äîso what? Are you trying to tell me you‚Äôre going to leave her?‚Äù

James pauses for a moment before slowly shaking his head. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause of the baby?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause I love her.‚Äù

That shouldn‚Äôt be so hard to hear. Regulus already knew it was true, but he still finds himself reacting as if physically struck.

‚ÄúFuck off Potter.‚Äù

‚ÄúRegulus‚Äî‚Äú he steps forward, arms outstretched, but Regulus stops him with a look.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not your fucking charity project. I don‚Äôt need your goddamn pity.‚Äù

James growls, clearly frustrated. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not why I‚Äôm asking.‚Äù

‚ÄúSure it is,‚Äù Regulus sneers. ‚ÄúYou want me to come with you because leaving me behind would be the wrong thing to do, and James Potter never does the wrong thing. You‚Äôre obsessed with playing the hero. That‚Äôs all this is.‚Äù Maybe it‚Äôs all it ever was. That‚Äôs a thought Regulus doesn‚Äôt particularly want to linger on.

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúThen why? Why do you want me to come with you?‚Äù

James is looking at him desperately. ‚ÄúBecause I love you too.‚Äù

Regulus feels himself stagger again. Fucking James Potter and his goddamn mouth. Always saying the last thing Regulus wants to hear. The last thing he needs. Making his life more complicated.

For a moment they just stare across the room at one another before Regulus brings his hands up to his face, shoulders sagging in defeat. "I don't understand what you want from me?‚Äù he mutters into his palms.

‚ÄúI want you to come with me,‚Äù James sounds closer and when Regulus drops his hands he sees it‚Äôs because he is. Not quite an arms length between them. They could touch if they wanted to.

‚ÄúAnd be what? Your mistress?‚Äù Honestly he would do it. That‚Äôs the pathetic bit. He would do just about anything if it meant that he didn‚Äôt have to live without this again. But he isn‚Äôt going to say that out loud.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James says firmly. ‚ÄúNo more lying, no more secrets. Not this time. I don‚Äôt want to hide.‚Äù

Regulus lets out an exasperated laugh. ‚ÄúThen what James? You‚Äôre just going to be with both of us?‚Äù

His brows draw together. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, I-I don‚Äôt know, I just‚Ä¶‚Äù he shoves his hands into his hair, flustered. ‚ÄúI love you both so much. It‚Äôs like I can‚Äôt‚ÄîI can‚Äôt be myself without you. I can‚Äôt be‚Ä¶whole,‚Äù he shakes his head, trying to clear it. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt figured it out yet, but there has to be‚Ä¶there has to be a way to make this work.‚Äù

Regulus snorts. ‚ÄúDoes there? I think you‚Äôre too used to getting everything you want.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot everything,‚Äù James reaches out his hand, slow enough that Regulus could pull away if he wanted to. He doesn‚Äôt. ‚ÄúNot yet,‚Äù he holds Regulus‚Äôs face, thumb brushing his cheek. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon Reg,‚Äù he says, in a voice low enough that it makes Regulus‚Äôs eyes flutter closed, ‚Äúspoil me.‚Äù

‚ÄúChrist James,‚Äù that isn‚Äôt supposed to sound reverent.

‚ÄúCome with me.‚Äù

Regulus chews on his bottom lip, shamelessly pressing into James‚Äôs touch. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll fuck your life up.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy life‚Äôs already fucked.‚Äù

After a few more seconds Regulus forces his eyes open, looking seriously at the boy across from him. ‚ÄúSo just like that huh, everything‚Äôs forgiven? You expect me to believe all that anger from before is just gone?‚Äù

Sadness flickers across James‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says, equally as serious. ‚ÄúForgiveness takes time. Takes work. I‚Äôm asking for that time. Just this once Regulus, don‚Äôt give up.‚Äù

Regulus wants to argue, but that‚Äôs the truth isn‚Äôt it? He had given up. Given up on them before they even started. Given up on himself before Sirius ever left him behind. Regulus has lived a life where he never tried, too afraid to be caught caring. Too afraid to hope for more only to have it ripped away.

This is a mental idea, he knows that. Only James potter would think he could love two people without it ending in heartbreak. In devastation. But then again, maybe for him the universe will be generous. He‚Äôs the hero of the story after all. Maybe he gets to write his own ending.

It doesn‚Äôt matter, Regulus knows, either way it doesn‚Äôt matter.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he says finally, watching James‚Äôs eyes go wide.

‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù

Anything for you.

‚ÄúYes. I‚Äôll come with you. I‚Äôll come.‚Äù

It‚Äôs not until that moment, when he hears the weight of the shaking breath that James lets go, when he sees the pain and relief twisting his face, that Regulus realizes how much he‚Äôs hurt James. That he realizes how much James has meant it. All of it.

James pulls Regulus into him, bending over to burry his face in Regulus‚Äôs hair and Regulus wraps his arms around him as James cries. Does his best not to cry himself‚Äîhe‚Äôs done enough of that today.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he mumbles into James‚Äôs chest. And he means for everything, even though he knows there are some things too big for sorry. Some things that cannot be apologized for. The words feel inadequate and awkward as they come out of his mouth, because he knows that he‚Äôll never be sorry enough.

James sniffles, kissing the top of his head as he pulls away, linking their hands together. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù he says, offering Regulus a weak smile as he nods towards the fireplace. ‚Äúlets go home, huh?‚Äù

I am home,

he thinks stupidly.

It's always been you.

Regulus squeezes James‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt come yet,‚Äù he says, already wincing at the way it makes the light in James‚Äôs eyes flicker.

‚ÄúReg‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI have to do something,‚Äù he tries to explain as the walls around them shake threateningly, the wards protecting them cracking. Some priceless antique shatters somewhere in the house. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important.‚Äù

James interrogates his face, looking for something, Regulus doesn‚Äôt know what. But he tries to give it to him, tries not to pull his mask on, tries not to hide anything. Not now. Not here.

Finally James nods. ‚ÄúBut then you‚Äôll come?‚Äù

‚ÄúI promise.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause, and then the ghost of a smile drifts across James‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúI believe you.‚Äù

And before he can stop himself Regulus is stepping forward, going up on his toes so that he can reach James‚Äôs mouth, trying to pour everything he feels into that kiss. It‚Äôs not possible, but he tries.

Dust falls from the ceiling with the next strike against his wards and Regulus pulls away.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll talk to Lily,‚Äù James says breathlessly. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know‚ÄîI don‚Äôt know how this works Reg but‚ÄîI‚Äôll talk to her. And I‚Äôll make sure our wards will let you in so when you can‚Äîthe moment you can‚Äîjust come. I‚Äôm at my parents house do you‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI remember the address.‚Äù

The one he‚Äôd shakily written out in a Muggle post office all those years ago.

Seared in his brain.

James nods, squeezing Regulus‚Äôs hand one more time before he steps into the fire, Regulus waving his wand and re-opening the connection.

Their eyes meet.

‚ÄúI love you Regulus.‚Äù

Years disappear and suddenly they‚Äôre just two boys facing each other in an empty room.

A do over.

‚ÄúI love you too.‚Äù

James Potter is smiling when the flames pull him away.

After he‚Äôs gone it feels like the oxygen has been sucked out of Regulus‚Äôs life. Everything dark again.

He waves his wand, closing the Floo connection and leaning against the wall behind him for support. His body is sore, his head aching, and suddenly he feels exhausted. It takes a few moments for him to notice the small glowing light coming from the doorway, and it‚Äôs not until Boo is standing right next to him that he realizes what‚Äôs causing it.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù he says wearily, because he‚Äôs almost positive Boo is pouting. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see them again. I promise.‚Äù

He thinks he‚Äôs telling the truth.

He hopes he is.

It‚Äôs then that the house gives another tremendous shuddered, something else crashing to the ground.

‚ÄúSir,‚Äù Kreacher appears, the shattered pieces of an ugly vase in his hands. ‚ÄúThey is be breaking the house! Breaking your mother‚Äôs things!‚Äù

Regulus isn‚Äôt sure that that‚Äôs necessarily a bad thing.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù he says instead. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll let them in.‚Äù

The elf‚Äôs eyes grow wide. ‚ÄúIs you sure?‚Äù

He nods, pushing himself off the wall with a groan. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôll only keep trying until they get through anyway.‚Äù

He closes his eyes briefly, muttering incantations under his breath and feeling the wards around the house pulse. He‚Äôs praying it isn‚Äôt Lucius, even though he has a feeling it probably is. He hasn‚Äôt got the energy for him right now. Besides, somehow he‚Äôll know, he‚Äôll figure out James was there. He‚Äôs always been uncannily good at reading Regulus‚Äôs mind.

He feels something give in his chest when the wards drop. There‚Äôs a moment of peace, of stillness. And then the front door slams open.

‚ÄúRegulus!‚Äù

He blinks.

‚ÄúCerci?‚Äù

‚ÄúRegulus! Regulus are you okay? Reg‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here, I‚Äôm in here.‚Äù

He can hear her feet slamming into the floor as she runs towards his voice, sprinting into the room. ‚ÄúOh thank god,‚Äù she says as she launches herself into his arms, causing them both to stumble backwards.

Regulus winces, ‚ÄúCareful, I‚Äôm‚Äîa bit fucked up.‚Äù

‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù she mutters into his shoulder, not letting him go.

Kreacher clears his throat. ‚ÄúI will be‚Äîer‚Äîputting this away sir,‚Äù he gestures to the broken vase in his hands, bowing out of the room with a knowing look that has Regulus rolling his eyes. Honestly, he‚Äôs worse than Cerci‚Äôs mum.

‚ÄúI was so scared,‚Äù she murmurs, his had rubbing her back. He‚Äôs a bit awkward, comforting people having never been his forte. ‚ÄúI heard‚Äîheard there was some kind of fight at the Ministry. Heard people died. And then your Floo was closed and your wards wouldn‚Äôt let me in and I thought‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThat you‚Äôd just blast your way through them?‚Äù he asks amused.

‚ÄúWell I wasn‚Äôt about to leave you alone! What if you were dying?!‚Äù

Regulus swallows around the lump in his throat. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not dying.‚Äù

He tries not to think about lying on the dining room table, bleeding out, screaming. Tries not to think about gentle fingers brushing the backs of his hands. Or holding his face.

‚ÄúWell I can see that NOW.‚Äù But she‚Äôs still hugging him, like if she lets go he might disappear.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù Regulus says after a few seconds, ‚Äúfor coming.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course!‚Äù

Something else sits in his mouth, bouncing on its toes, begging to be said. To be asked. It‚Äôs dangerous, but the truth is, despite his best efforts, he trusts Cerci. Trusts her completely.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to‚ÄîI need to do something,‚Äù he says finally, voice quiet as he watches the doorway over her shoulder for Kreacher. He trusts that elf with a lot but not this. ‚ÄúAnd I think I‚Äôm going to need your help.‚Äù

She pulls back for the first time, keeping her hands on his arms, eyes staring up into his face. ‚ÄúOf course, anything. What is it?‚Äù

He takes a deep breath, feeling jittery, something between manic excitement and absolute terror.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to kill Voldemort.‚Äù

He watches her eyes grow wide, the silence in the room deafening. Maybe he made a mistake. Maybe he‚Äôs going to have to pull out his wand. But then she speaks.

Hell, she might even be smiling.

‚ÄúWhat do you need me to do?‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

For those of you who feel like Evan really got shafted in this chapter I promise he will not be forgotten and Regulus will be dealing with his death in the next chapter!

I hope this felt kind of satisfying to read, I wanted to give them the chance to talk about, like, everything. I don't know if I accomplished that but that was the dream!

As always, I know I am garbage at replying to comments but I do read them and they do mean a lot, I really appreciate all the love and support, we're getting really close to the end now which is honestly wild and making me feel a lil bit sad, but thanks for being here! Hope you're having a good day / night/ morning etc. ect.

Chapter 52

Chapter Summary

There's some cute shit here

Chapter Notes

tw Drug use / addiction (via potions)

tw Alcohol

tw Panic attack

tw ED (idk if this needs to be here because it's a side effect of the potions more than a conscious eating disorder but I just feel like it's being mentioned enough that I wanna throw this out there)

Canon continues to be a loose concept, like she's still around but sometimes we pretend we can't see her, y'know?

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I REGULUS

War is a strange thing. It bends the rules of normal life. Of normal morality. Warps everything to revolve around it. It had never occurred to Regulus that a body could be used as a weapon. He had somewhat assumed that, as a society, they were all agreed that certain things were sacred.

He was wrong.

The Ministry refuses to return the bodies of the dead Death Eaters to their families without a comprehensive list of names detailing everyone who was part of the attempted coup. No one, of course, agrees to supply such a list and so dozens of bodies go unclaimed. Unburied. Unmourned.

And Evan Rosier is one of them.

His mother waits a week before she decides to have a funeral anyway. Dozens of people dressing in black and attending the Rosier home where a large portrait of Evan is suspended in the middle of the living room, winking and smirking at everyone who walks by. Regulus finds it hard to breathe every time he sees it. Doing his best to avoid it all together.

Somehow he ends up on the stairs with Barty, passing a flask of firewhisky back and forth. They don‚Äôt talk. There isn‚Äôt anything to say. There have been speeches all day, from family members, friends. Neither Regulus nor Barty get up. Regulus has no desire to showcase his grief. Besides, he barely recognizes the Evan everyone else is talking about‚Äîthe perfect son, perfect student, perfect friend‚ÄîRegulus loved Evan. He really did. But ‚Äúperfect‚Äù is not the word he would use to describe him.

Mrs. Rosier had pleaded with Regulus to tell her about her son‚Äôs last moments. And so he had, hands shaking in his lap the whole time. He had told her about how well Evan had fought, how he‚Äôd saved Regulus, how brave (not idiotic, or delusional, or selfish) he had been to take on Alastor Moody. How he‚Äôd almost won. How he‚Äôd died quickly and peacefully‚Äîthough he isn‚Äôt entirely sure that last one is true. Nothing about that moment had felt peaceful to Regulus.

He did not tell her that he held Evan in his arms. That he let him go. Left him behind.

The thing that hurts most. Well, besides all of it. Is that he doesn‚Äôt think that Evan would have done it. Left him behind, that is. He never had before.

He‚Äôs passing the flask silently back to Barty when Cerci appears. He‚Äôd lost her sometime after they made it through the line of people offering condolences. He‚Äôs said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry for your loss‚Äù so many times today he‚Äôs not sure he knows what the words mean anymore.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôre you two holding up?‚Äù she asks, her eyes soft, running them over. He isn‚Äôt sure what they look like. Probably pathetic. He feels pathetic.

Barty holds up his hand, palm down, and wiggles it. Cerci gives him a small smile.

‚ÄúFair enough. Why don‚Äôt we get out of here huh? Go get some food? My treat.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs food here,‚Äù Barty says, though he doesn‚Äôt even sound like he‚Äôs making an argument, more just stating a fact.

‚ÄúYeah, but I feel like you two could benefit from maybe not being here anymore.‚Äù

Barty makes a noise that might be a laugh or a scoff, Regulus can‚Äôt tell. Cerci‚Äôs eyes finding him, asking a question.

‚ÄúReg?‚Äù

He holds her gaze for a moment before looking over at the doorway to the living room, just the edge of Evan‚Äôs portrait visible.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says finally, voice rough. ‚ÄúYeah lets go.‚Äù

He isn‚Äôt paying attention to where Cerci is taking them, doesn‚Äôt think Barty is either, the pair of them asleep on their feet. Death is one of those things‚Äîyou have nothing to compare it to‚Äîwhich makes it very difficult to hold. Evan is dead.

He‚Äôs dead.

He‚Äôs dead.

He‚Äôs dead.

Regulus knows that. Knew it the moment it happened. Saw the empty look in his friend‚Äôs eyes. But he still‚Ä¶can‚Äôt quite‚Ä¶grasp what it means.

It‚Äôs not until Cerci is shoving him into a leather booth after Barty that Regulus realizes they‚Äôve ended up at the Leaky Cauldron. It‚Äôs empty mostly, people don‚Äôt go out much these days, it‚Äôs not safe.

Because of you, hisses the voice in his head.

He smothers it the best he can. He can only handle so much guilt at once.

‚ÄúWhat can I get you folks?‚Äù

Regulus blinks up at the overly chipper witch who has just arrived at their table. She smiles at them, pad of paper and QuickQuotes Quill floating beside her head.

‚ÄúWhisky,‚Äù Barty says, voice flat. He‚Äôs leaning back against the booth, expression as blank as his tone, ‚Äúlots of it.‚Äù

The waitress‚Äôs smile slips, replaced by confusion‚Äîshe looks like she‚Äôs trying to figure out whether or not to take him seriously.

‚ÄúJust bring us the bottle,‚Äù Regulus says, satisfied when he sees the quill finally move.

‚ÄúAlso a pitcher of water please,‚Äù Cerci cuts in. ‚ÄúAnd three burgers with chips.‚Äù

When the waitress turns towards her, her face lights up. ‚ÄúOh my god, Cerci! I didn‚Äôt even see you there, how are you?‚Äù

Cerci‚Äôs face goes red instantly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm‚ÄîI‚Äôm good‚Äîgreat‚Äîwell,‚Äù she looks quickly at Barty and Regulus and then back at the waitress. ‚ÄúNot great, obviously‚Äîjust came from a funeral, so, bit sad actually, but also, also‚Ä¶great right now, well, here, cause chips and‚Ä¶you or‚Ä¶stuff,‚Äù all of that comes out more or less on the strength of a single breath, leaving Cerci looking rather deflated at the end of it, and panting ever so slightly.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù the waitress clearly does not know what to do with any of that. ‚ÄúWell I‚Äôm sorry to hear about the funeral‚Ä¶‚Äù there is a very awkward pause. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll just go get your order shall I? Bottle of whisky, water and three burgers, coming right up,‚Äù she offers them a slightly less confident smile than the one she was originally wearing, quickly turning away, clearly glad to escape their table.

‚ÄúCome here often?‚Äù Barty asks flatly.

Cerci rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the Leaky, everyone comes here often.‚Äù

Which Regulus doesn‚Äôt think is exactly true‚Äînone of the waitresses know his name‚Äîbut he‚Äôs not about to bring that up.

Cerci is staring into the restaurant with an almost longing look on her face, teeth worrying her bottom lip. ‚ÄúI hope she doesn‚Äôt forget the chips. Do you think she will? She didn‚Äôt mention them at the end but maybe she was just shortening ‚Äúburgers and chips‚Äù to ‚Äúburgers‚Äù, y‚Äôknow? To save time?‚Äù she looks across the table at Regulus. ‚ÄúWhat do you think?‚Äù

Regulus blinks back at her. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs probably fine.‚Äù

Cerci nods but doesn‚Äôt look at all convinced, nails tapping on the tabletop. ‚ÄúYou know what?‚Äù she declares after a few seconds. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just going to go check‚Äîcan‚Äôt have a burger without chips.‚Äù

‚ÄúApparently,‚Äù Regulus watches her get up and head towards the bar. In her absence a more obvious silence settles around him and Barty. It‚Äôs thick and stagnant and uncomfortable.

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt work without him does it?‚Äù Barty asks, not looking at Regulus when he speaks but staring vaguely off into the distance.

‚ÄúWhat doesn‚Äôt work?‚Äù Regulus asks, even though, of course, he knows.

Barty replies by lifting his hand and swirling it between them.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Regulus agrees after a brief pause, ‚ÄúNo it doesn‚Äôt.‚Äù

Barty just nods. ‚ÄúHe was an annoying prick,‚Äù which makes Regulus snort. ‚ÄúBut I think he was also kind of my favourite person, you know?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Regulus says too quickly. If it‚Äôs possible to mourn someone too quickly. Too needfully. It is undeniable that Evan has left a hole in Regulus‚Äôs life. One he carries around with him maybe more than he thought he would.

‚ÄúWas it really quick?‚Äù

Regulus blinks. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou told his mum it was quick. Was it really?‚Äù

Right to the chest.

Regulus can see it like it‚Äôs still happening in front of him. It took a while for all his memories to come back after his head injury, but he has them now.

Evan standing there, grinning, so fucking cocky. So fucking self-assured. Until his back hit the ground.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Regulus clears his throat. ‚ÄúYeah it was quick.‚Äù

‚ÄúAvada?‚Äù

He nods. ‚ÄúI think so.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood.‚Äù

He can‚Äôt help but think of Evan‚Äôs lifeless eyes. Someone so full of‚Ä¶everything honestly, suddenly just a shell.

Good is not the word Regulus would use.

‚ÄúWooph okay,‚Äù Cerci says as she walks back towards them, cheeks slightly flushed and a smile on her face that she is clearly trying to hide. ‚ÄúShe didn‚Äôt forget the chips, and also, I have our drinks!‚Äù she‚Äôs carrying a bottle in one hand and three glasses in the other.

‚ÄúThank fuck,‚Äù Barty mutters under his breath, and honestly, Regulus can‚Äôt say he disagrees.

¬†

‚ÄúCareful‚Äîcareful there‚Äôs one more step, lift your foot up and‚Ä¶perfect, okay,‚Äù Cerci is slightly out of breath as they make it up the stairs, Regulus leaning on her almost completely.

He‚Äôs drunk.

Absolutely, out of his head, drunk.

‚ÄúWheresbarty?‚Äù he slurs, not bothering to leave space between his words.

‚ÄúWe dropped him off at his flat remember?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh yeah,‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt, not at all, but he can‚Äôt think of any reason Cerci would lie about such a thing.

They stumble into his bedroom, all the lights out, Cerci clumsily spilling Regulus onto the mattress. Not a second later there‚Äôs a crack.

‚ÄúIs Master Regulus injured?‚Äù comes a scratchy voice that makes Regulus groan and hold his head. He thinks his hangover is already starting.

‚ÄúNo Kreacher, he‚Äôs fine, he‚Äôs just‚Ä¶tired‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúHe is looking ill!‚Äù

‚ÄúMhm, do you think you could be a darling and fetch him a glass of water and a hangover potion if he has any?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou is sure he is not being hurt or sick?‚Äù

‚ÄúPositive,‚Äù Regulus can‚Äôt see Cerci from his position on his back in the middle of his bed, but he‚Äôs pretty sure she‚Äôs smiling. ‚ÄúBut he will be tomorrow morning without that potion.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause.

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù Kreacher says finally. ‚ÄúI will be getting it then.‚Äù

There‚Äôs another crack and Regulus groans‚Äîmaybe it‚Äôs more of a whine but he doesn‚Äôt want to admit that to himself. And suddenly he‚Äôs hit with the memory of lying on the dining room table, clutching his head as Kreacher popped in and out of the room.

And James.

And James.

And James.

‚ÄúHe was here,‚Äù he says before he can stop himself. Too drunk.

‚ÄúWho was here?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe was here in my bed,‚Äù Merlin what would eleven year old Regulus have thought about that? ‚ÄúAnd he was so pretty.‚Äù

Cerci sits down beside him, legs crossing under her skirt. ‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù she says slowly, he looks over at her. She seems very big like this‚Äîwith him on his back. ‚ÄúDo you have a beau?‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt know how to answer that question. Doesn‚Äôt want to say no even if it‚Äôs true. Mostly true. He doesn‚Äôt know what him and James are‚Äîother than a mess. His eyes flutter closed and he says the only thing that feels real in that moment.

‚ÄúI love him.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat the heck!‚Äù Cerci punches him playfully in the arm and Regulus pouts even though he barely feels it. ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you tell me! I have to meet him! I have to give him The Talk!‚Äù

‚ÄúThe Talk?‚Äù Regulus asks, eyebrows raised.

‚ÄúYou know, make sure he‚Äôs aware that if he hurts you he‚Äôll be dealing with me.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, very scary,‚Äù Regulus says flatly, prompting Cerci to punch him again. ‚ÄúOw!‚Äîokay, point taken.‚Äù

She smiles.

‚ÄúAnyway, you can‚Äôt talk to him, he left.‚Äù It‚Äôs an effort to make the words come out fully formed.

‚ÄúLeft, like, forever?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe just left.‚Äù

Regulus sighs, staring up at the ceiling.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so tired of being left behind,‚Äù he says eventually, voice small, ‚Äúeven if it‚Äôs my fault.‚Äù

‚ÄúAw, Reg no. You‚Äôre not being left behind. I‚Äôm here, right?‚Äù

He looks at her again, trying to return her smile. ‚ÄúYeah, yeah you are,‚Äù he manages eventually.

A few moments pass and Regulus has started to drift a bit when Cerci says: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not‚Äîer‚Äîtalking about Evan right? That‚Äôs not who you‚Äôre in love with?‚Äù

That makes Regulus laugh, it‚Äôs a giggly-snorty sound, juvenile and unbecoming. ‚ÄúMerlin no. He‚Äôll love that though, the idea of me being secretly in love him.‚Äù And then Regulus feels something in his chest catch. ‚ÄúHe would have loved it,‚Äù he corrects himself, the sudden hot pressure of tears behind his eyes. Merlin he hates being drunk. He brings his hands up to his face, hiding it.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù he hisses, voice shaking. ‚ÄúI miss him so much.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Cerci says softly.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to miss him forever.‚Äù

‚ÄúProbably. But that‚Äôs a good thing.‚Äù

Regulus lets out a wet laugh before dropping his hands. ‚ÄúHow could that possibly be a good thing?‚Äù

Cerci shrugs, tucking her hair behind her ear. Regulus can‚Äôt really see her face in the dark so he‚Äôs not exactly sure what her expression is. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs kind of the most meaningful way to remember someone‚Äîmissing them. It means they mattered. It means you loved them. Those are good things.‚Äù

Regulus is feeling a little blurry so it takes a moment for that to really sink in, but when it does, something in his chest eases a little. ‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù he says finally, voice rough. ‚ÄúThat‚Äîthat helps.‚Äù

And he thinks maybe he really means it.

¬†

Regulus does not remember Kreacher coming back. Or falling asleep for that matter. Regardless, he wakes up the next morning tucked into bed with a glass of water and a hangover potion sitting beside him on the table. With some effort he‚Äôs able to sit, mouth stale and dry, head pounding. He swings his legs over the side of the bed and then pauses, waiting for the spins to cease and his stomach to stop threatening to purge itself. And then he reaches for the potion.

It‚Äôs barely down his throat and he already starts to feel relief, a cool sensation wafting over him, like a damp cloth has been placed on his forehead. He chugs the water and stands, walking into the bathroom. He feels more human after a shower and brushing his teeth, fixing his hair in the mirror before his hand reaches out‚Äîinstinct, habit‚Äîhe freezes when he realizes what he‚Äôs doing, suddenly caught staring at his own reflection.

after all of that,

James‚Äôs voice rings loud in his head.

All of the pain you caused so that you could survive, here you are KILLING YOUR FUCKING SELF.

He keeps staring at his reflection, hand beginning to shake. Surely, after seeing James again, after being given a purpose, a way to redeem himself, he can let it go. Let the ghosts go. Surely he can focus his attention entirely on his new plan. And do it sober.

Really?

Regulus winces at the voice.

Just gonna forget about me huh?

It feels like Evan is standing right behind him, head tilted, smirk hanging from his mouth.

Oh c‚Äômon Reg, you can‚Äôt really be surprised to see me, right? I mean, if it weren‚Äôt for you I‚Äôd still be alive.

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù he croaks, eyes suddenly squeezed shut. The thing is, it doesn‚Äôt really sound like Evan. The voice maybe, but the words, the cruel lilt‚ÄîEvan might have spoken to other people that way but never Regulus.

You reckon my mum will ever get my body back?

Regulus‚Äôs hand tightens around the mirror‚Äôs edge.

Or will I just rot in the Ministry forever? Where you left me?

‚ÄúGod, stop.‚Äù

The voice laughs. Nothing like him. Exactly like him.

No.

You don‚Äôt get to make demands. Not now. Not after what you did to me.

And that‚Äôs it. That‚Äôs all he has in him, swinging the mirror open and reaching for one of the bottles.

Evan laughs again.

Damn Reg. I knew you were weak, but I didn‚Äôt know you were quite this pathetic.

Regulus doesn‚Äôt argue. He‚Äôs not sure he could ever sink low enough to surprise himself.

¬†

His thoughts are duller when he heads down the stairs a few minutes later. The voices silenced. Nothing but indistinct murmurs in the corners of his mind. He knows he won‚Äôt be able to keep this going, especially with James. But for now at least‚Ä¶it helps.

He‚Äôll stop when he has to.

When he absolutely has to.

‚ÄúYou is being awake sir!‚Äù Kreacher says as Regulus walks into the kitchen, the smells of breakfast wrapping around him like a warm hug‚Äîcoffee and sausage and eggs. Regulus has barely made it to the table before Kreacher is sliding a full plate towards him. Regulus doesn‚Äôt sit, looking down and then back up.

‚ÄúCerci?‚Äù

‚ÄúMiss Greengrass is in the library,‚Äù the house elf points emphatically at the plate. ‚ÄúEat.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot hungry.‚Äù

He isn‚Äôt fast enough to duck out of the way when Kreacher hurls a dish towel at his face.

‚ÄúNo! No, no, no!‚Äù Kreacher chants, throwing his arms up in the air as Regulus pulls the towel off his head. ‚ÄúYou will be eating this!‚Äù There is something like violence in his eyes.

‚ÄúOkay, okay, jeez,‚Äù Regulus puts his hands up in surrender, doing his best not to laugh because Kreacher really does seem very serious. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll eat it, I promise, I just want to see what Cerci is up to first.‚Äù

‚ÄúTake it with you then!‚Äù

Regulus arches his brow. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to let me eat in the library?‚Äù

‚ÄúI is being desperate!‚Äù and Regulus gets the feeling that he is one more question away from getting another dishtowel thrown at him.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll eat it, I promise!‚Äù he takes a bite out of one of the pieces of toast to prove his point.

Kreacher crosses his arms over his chest, still glaring. ‚ÄúThe whole thing Master Regulus.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes, picking up the plate as he swallows. ‚ÄúFine. But I‚Äôm doing it in the library,‚Äù and then, for good measure; ‚Äúand I‚Äôm going to get crumbs everywhere.‚Äù

Kreacher winces. ‚ÄúYou is being very like your brother right now sir.‚Äù

That makes Regulus stumble, but when he turns back Kreacher is facing away, washing the dishes. He knows that Kreacher only meant that he‚Äôs being a brat. But that comparison has never been easy for Regulus to swallow and he just wasn‚Äôt‚Ä¶expecting it.

Eventually he gets his feet to start moving again.

Cerci is sitting at the back of the library in one of the old velvet chesterfields, her legs pulled up and feet tucked under her, a book open in her lap. Regulus drops his plate of food on the coffee table between them before collapsing into the other chair.

‚ÄúBrought you food.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlready ate,‚Äù she says cheerfully. ‚ÄúKreacher‚Äôs eggs benedict may be the most amazing thing I‚Äôve ever put in my mouth.‚Äù

Regulus gives her a weak smile even though she can‚Äôt see it, leaning over to pick at his plate now that there‚Äôs no chance of pawning it off on Cerci. He manages to get down a few more bites before he gives up, sitting back in his chair.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry about‚Ä¶last night.‚Äù

Cerci looks up, her eyes soft. ‚ÄúOne of your best friends just died Reg, you‚Äôre allowed to get a little‚Ä¶messy.‚Äù

He isn‚Äôt sure why that makes his chest grow so tight but he just nods stiffly. ‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù and then, desperate to change the subject. ‚ÄúWhich room did you sleep in then?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe purple one,‚Äù looking back down at her book.

Regulus can practically hear his mother shrieking in Scotland at the insinuation that there is a purple room in her house. ‚ÄúWhich one?‚Äù he asks, mildly amused.

She waves her hand in the air dismissively. ‚ÄúYou know, second floor with the floral wallpaper and the little purple flowers.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh, Aunt Mildred‚Äôs room.‚Äù

She looks up at him again. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs somebody‚Äôs bedroom? I thought it was a guest room?‚Äù

Regulus shrugs. ‚ÄúI mean, it is now.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat happened to Mildred?‚Äù

‚ÄúShe died.‚Äù

Cerci‚Äôs eyes grow wide. ‚ÄúPlease tell me she didn‚Äôt die in that room?‚Äù

Regulus can‚Äôt keep the grin off his face. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, Kreacher changed the sheets. Well, at least I think he did.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh my god! You are the worst!‚Äù Cerci tries to kick his legs, but Regulus pulls them up onto the seat of his chair, laughing.

Cursing his name under her breath Cerci turns back to her book. It‚Äôs a big leather bound thing, with long pages of cursive writing Regulus can‚Äôt quite make out from where he‚Äôs sitting.

‚ÄúWhat are you looking at then?‚Äù he asks.

‚ÄúHogwarts‚Äôs registry.‚Äù

He arches his brow. ‚ÄúLooking for Voldemort?‚Äù she makes an affirming sound. ‚ÄúAnd how exactly are you going to find a name you don‚Äôt know?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, I figure he‚Äôs got to be from one of the Sacred Twenty-Eight right?‚Äù

‚ÄúSeems likely.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut we know all those families, so I wonder if he‚Äôs the last of his line, I‚Äôm looking for names that have disappeared‚ÄîGaunt, Peverell, Shafiq‚Äîseeing if anything pops up.‚Äù

Regulus nods thoughtfully. ‚ÄúAny luck?‚Äù

She lets out a breath, blowing the hair off her forehead. ‚ÄúNot really. It doesn‚Äôt help that I‚Äôm not exactly sure how old he is so I‚Äôm only guessing about what years I should be looking at. What about you?‚Äù

Regulus blinks. ‚ÄúMe?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou said you would look into Voldemort,‚Äù and when he continues to stare blankly at her. ‚ÄúThe name? Its origins? see where he got it from?‚Äù she doesn‚Äôt say ‚Äúduh‚Äù but it feels like it‚Äôs implied.

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù the potions are making his thoughts too sluggish for this and he can already see the concern creeping into Cerci‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúEr‚Äîno mention of a Voldemort in any kind of mythology or history I can find. My best guess is it‚Äôs French in origin. Seems to be three words put together: vol‚Äîde‚Äîmort.‚Äù

Now it‚Äôs Cerci‚Äôs turn to look blank. ‚ÄúSorry, is that supposed to mean something to me? Because I‚Äôm pretty sure you just made a bunch of noises.‚Äù

Regulus rolls his eyes, though it‚Äôs work to hold back his smile. ‚ÄúYou could interpret it a couple different ways. It could mean flight from death or flight of death or stolen from death. My money‚Äôs on the first one though.‚Äù

Cerci‚Äôs biting her lower lip, rubbing her chin. ‚ÄúSo maybe he‚Äôs French then? And his name, his real one, might be french too?‚Äù

Regulus shrugs. ‚ÄúI mean, could be. But I‚Äôm french, and my name is Regulus Black so‚Ä¶‚Äù

She grimaces. ‚ÄúGood point.‚Äù She‚Äôs looking a little dejected, which Regulus just can‚Äôt have, so he reaches his foot out and nudges her‚Äôs.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúyou got another one of those registries for me to look through?‚Äù

She smiles, reaching beside her where Regulus can now see a stack of near identical books piled on the floor by her chair. ‚ÄúDo I ever.‚Äù

¬†

The Hogwarts school registry is about as interesting as you would imagine. Lists of names, dates, signatures. Regulus tries to keep his eyes focused, tries not to let his mind drift. This is important. He needs to figure out what Voldemort is using as a Horcrux and where he‚Äôs keeping it. And in order to do that he needs to know who the fuck Voldemort actually is.

‚ÄúWhat if this is all pointless,‚Äù he says after about an hour of running through lists of names. ‚ÄúWhat if he‚Äôs choosing his object and his location based on strategy not‚Ä¶sentimentality?‚Äù

Cerci makes a dismissive noise. ‚ÄúPlease, an egomaniac like Voldemort? Everything he does revolves around himself, I can‚Äôt believe this would be any different.‚Äù

Regulus actually feels his mouth fall open and when he doesn‚Äôt manage to form a reply Cerci looks up.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI just,‚Äù he struggles to get his voice back, half laughing. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe you just said that.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy not? It‚Äôs true.‚Äù

Now he really does laugh, short and disbelieving. ‚ÄúWell for one, because he‚Äôs‚Äîhe‚Äôs who he is. And two, because I think lots of people would disagree with you.‚Äù

She looks at him quizzically. ‚ÄúAbout what?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat he does everything for himself. He‚Äôs the leader of the revolution, he wants Wizards to be recognized as above all other beings, to protect their magic. That‚Äôs‚Äîlots of people believe in that.‚Äù

But Cerci rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúLots of people are idiots. Voldemort doesn‚Äôt care about Wizard-kind. He cares about Voldemort.‚Äù

Regulus finds his eyes bouncing around the room, suddenly paranoid that somehow they‚Äôre being listened to because this‚Äîeven if you think like this, most people know better than to say so out loud. At least in Grimmauld Place.

‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶‚Äù Regulus says eventually. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never heard anyone put it quite like that.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat's because I‚Äôm smarter than everyone else, obviously," she shoots him a wink, turning to the next page in her registry. Regulus watches her for a moment.

‚ÄúHave your parents‚Äô views changed? The last you said they didn‚Äôt care much either way, they just didn‚Äôt want to get involved?‚Äù

Cerci rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about the only thing my mother has ever not wanted to get involved in. But no, that‚Äôs still how they feel. Wait it out, commit to no one, and cozy up to whoever wins.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt sounds like you don‚Äôt agree with that?‚Äù
