She does not tell him when it gets worse.

Which it does.

She lies in bed and begs herself to go to sleep, hoping that after a few hours of unconsciousness it‚Äôll pass, but it‚Äôs impossible to get comfortable when it feels like a rusty fish hook is being dragged through her lower intestines. Eventually, when she‚Äôs sure James is asleep, she gets out of bed and starts pacing, hand on her lower back, breaths slow and controlled. In a way she goes into a bit of a trance, riding the waves of pain as they come. Breathing through them.

She doesn‚Äôt let herself think about what this might be.

What it almost certainly is.

She just keeps telling herself that eventually it will stop.

It will pass.

Because she isn‚Äôt ready.

I mean, yes, sure, she‚Äôs ready to not be carrying a whole other life around with her everywhere she goes. But she isn‚Äôt ready to be a mum. To have a baby. She just‚Äîshe needs more time. Just a little more. She needs to be more in control. So it has to wait. The baby has to wait.

‚ÄúLily?‚Äù James murmurs, squinting up at her, barely awake.

‚ÄúSorry, just feeling a little restless,‚Äù she smiles tightly, though she doubts he can see her in the dark. ‚ÄúGo back to sleep, I‚Äôll lie down in a minute.‚Äù

Thankfully he does, his heavy eyes drifting closed again. A second later he‚Äôs snoring. James doesn‚Äôt believe that he snores, Lily‚Äôs thought about recording him, playing it back for him, but she never has.

She isn‚Äôt sure how much time passes between one moment and the next. She can‚Äôt look at the clock. Can‚Äôt think about anything except breathing and not screaming. Or crying. Or doing anything else.

This will go away.

It always does.

‚ÄúLily?‚Äù this time James sits up, rubbing at his eyes, hair a mess. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù

‚ÄúNothing,‚Äù she whispers, as casually as she can. ‚ÄúGo back to sleep.‚Äù

Much to her irritation James does not go back to sleep, but instead continues to sit there, knees bent under the blankets, watching her pace. If she thought she could, she would get back in bed just to put him at ease. But right now moving is the only thing keeping her sane.

‚ÄúIs this the same pain from dinner?‚Äù James croaks.

Lily grimaces but doesn‚Äôt answer. Doesn‚Äôt want to. Breathing in and out, she demands that her body stop. Stop this. We‚Äôre not doing it. Not yet. Not yet. Please not yet. She isn‚Äôt ready. She doesn‚Äôt know when she will be but she certainly isn‚Äôt right now.

Along with the aching in her lower half something has started to claw desperately at her chest.

Panic.

She‚Äôs panicking.

Somehow knowing that doesn‚Äôt help.

‚ÄúLily, I think we need to go to the hospital,‚Äù James says finally, yawning.

She shakes her head. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nothing.‚Äù

‚ÄúLily.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to the hospital!‚Äù she snaps, stopping her pacing so she can glare at him. Unfortunately, her body chooses that moment to let loose a particularly brutal pain, the shocks of which rumble through her like thunder.

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù she gasps, grabbing the wall for support.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it," James gets out of bed, pulling open his dresser and searching for trousers. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going.‚Äù

‚ÄúI said no!‚Äù Lily hisses, teeth clenched.

‚ÄúSomething is clearly wrong‚Äîthat or you‚Äôre having the ba‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúShut up,‚Äù she‚Äôs frustratingly breathless, panting like she's just run a mile, sweat dampening her hair. Her skin.

James looks at her, concern wafting off of him, trousers clutched in his hand. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happening right now?‚Äù

She doesn‚Äôt have an answer for him. Doesn‚Äôt know how to tell him that she feels like she‚Äôs doing this on her own. That she‚Äôs felt alone since the day she watched him fall apart over someone else and suddenly realized that they weren‚Äôt on the same page about anything. The months of work they‚Äôve done don‚Äôt feel like enough. Not now. Not in this moment.

But more than anything, she doesn‚Äôt know how to tell him that she‚Äôs scared.

Scared of being a mum.

Scared that they‚Äôve made the wrong decision.

Scared of how much she loves him and how much that hurts sometimes.

So she doesn‚Äôt tell him any of that. Instead she waddles past him out of the room. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to the hospital,‚Äù she snaps on her way.

‚ÄúLily‚Äî‚Äú

But she slams the bathroom door on him, locking it for good measure before kneeling down on the bathmat, hands clutching at the side of the tub as she tries to breathe. Tries to bargain with her body.

I‚Äôll be so good if you just stop.

Stop please.

I‚Äôll drink so much water.

I‚Äôll get eight hours of sleep.

Just please, please, don‚Äôt do this.

I thought I could handle it but I can‚Äôt.

I can‚Äôt.

As the next sharp pain shoots through her she can‚Äôt hold back a shocked sob, heart hammering faster than she‚Äôs ever felt it go before. ‚ÄúI want my mum,‚Äù it‚Äôs not the first time she‚Äôs thought that. Not the first time she's made that plea. Voice coming out small and weak. ‚ÄúI want my mum.‚Äù She was never meant to do this without her. She isn‚Äôt sure how she‚Äôs supposed to now.

There‚Äôs gentle knocking on the door. ‚ÄúLily?‚Äù James asks softly.

Lily squeezes her eyes shut, tears slipping down her cheeks. ‚ÄúPlease,‚Äù her voice is raw. ‚ÄúPlease just go away.‚Äù

He could open the door, of course, a simple Alohomora would do the trick. But he doesn‚Äôt. She can feel him standing there on the other side. Feel the warmth of him even through the walls.

Eventually he sighs. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what to do here Lils.‚Äù

She half-laughs, half-sobs. ‚ÄúMe either.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt say anything else, the pair of them lapsing into silence and eventually Lily drifts, consciousness fraying around the edges as her forehead presses to the cold porcelain tub.

She doesn‚Äôt know how long that period of time stretches on for. Of silence. Of stillness. Her grasp on time at the moment is, admittedly, fuzzy. But at some point there‚Äôs knocking on the door again. This time decidedly less gently.

‚ÄúAlright babe, we‚Äôre gonna need you to open up.‚Äù

Lily lifts her head, blinking the blurriness out of her eyes. ‚ÄúMary?‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd Marlene!‚Äù Pipes up another voice.

‚ÄúDorcas is also here.‚Äù

Lily just stares at the door, fairly certain she‚Äôs hallucinating.

‚ÄúOi, Evans,‚Äù comes Mary‚Äôs voice again. ‚ÄúYou alive?‚Äù she‚Äôs joking but there‚Äôs definitely an edge to her voice of genuine concern.

Lily coughs, clearing her throat. ‚ÄúEr‚Äîyeah‚ÄîI‚Äîyeah.‚Äù She thinks about getting up to answer the door but can‚Äôt quite bring herself to move. ‚ÄúYou can come in I just can‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú but she doesn‚Äôt even manage to finish her sentence before the door is springing open, Mary and Marlene coming in, Marlene wearing a pair of purple pyjama bottoms with tiny snitches all over them. Mary in sweats and a jumper and wearing her glasses‚Äîa rare sight. Dorcas is a little behind them, she gives Lily a soft smile that Lily returns shakily.

‚ÄúHere,‚Äù Mary plops down on the floor beside her, handing Lily a water bottle. It‚Äôs not until she sees it that she realizes how thirsty she is.

‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù her hands shake as she gulps down the water while Mary reaches over to push some of the sweaty hair off her forehead. When she‚Äôs done she places the bottle down on the ground, wiping her mouth on the back of her hand and looking up at her friends.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôre you doing here?‚Äù

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Marlene is standing just over Mary. ‚ÄúJames is kinda freaking out a bit.‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause you started having a baby and then locked yourself in the bathroom and refused to go to the hospital,‚Äù Mary says bluntly, somehow managing to startle a laugh out of Lily.

‚ÄúOh.‚Äù

"To be fair,‚Äù Dorcas says, leaning against the closed door. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd probably do the same.‚Äù

Marlene turns to her, bewildered expression on her face. ‚ÄúWhat? Why?‚Äù and then quickly; ‚ÄúNo offence Lily.‚Äù

‚ÄúNone taken.‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause babies are scary,‚Äù Dorcas goes on. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd want to hide from it too.‚Äù

That makes Lily laugh again, though this time she winces, pain flaring up through her stomach. She grabs hold of Mary who doesn‚Äôt even flinch.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt hide from it,‚Äù Marlene goes on. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs literally inside you.‚Äù

‚ÄúI can try,‚Äù Lily heaves, breathing through the pain.

Dorcas nods as though that makes perfect sense. ‚ÄúExactly."

‚ÄúMar,‚Äù Mary interrupts them as Lily‚Äôs fingernails dig into her arm. ‚ÄúYou wanna wet one of those washcloths with cold water?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, of course.‚Äù

Lily hears the tap running, which is when she realizes that she‚Äôs closed her eyes. She opens them, finding Mary‚Äôs gaze intent on her. ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù Lily whispers, voice hoarse, but Mary only shakes her head.

‚ÄúYou have nothing to apologize for.‚Äù

Before Lily can speak Marlene is back with the washcloth. ‚ÄúHere,‚Äù Mary gently tilts Lily‚Äôs head forward, placing the cold cloth on the back of her neck. Lily lets out a heavy breath. ‚ÄúFeel good?‚Äù

She nods the best she can. ‚ÄúYeah.‚Äù

Marlene comes up behind her, kneeling down and rubbing soothing circles into her lower back. Lily doesn‚Äôt know if she wants to laugh or cry. They stay like that for a while, no one talking, Lily breathing through the pain, until a loud bang irrupts from downstairs.

Lily‚Äôs head pops up, the washcloth falling to the tile floor. ‚ÄúWhat the fuck‚Äî‚Äú

Mary rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúDorcas, can you go tell those fucking idiots to please not blow the house up right now?‚Äù

Dorcas gives her a two fingered salut. ‚ÄúOn it.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat the hell are they doing?‚Äù Marlene asks, collapsing against the wall across from the tub.

‚ÄúWho knows.‚Äù

Lily‚Äôs eyes travel back and forth between the pair of them. ‚ÄúI'm sorry, who are we talking about?"

‚ÄúThe boys are here as well, though we figured it was best if they stayed downstairs,‚Äù Mary explains.

‚ÄúThe boys?‚Äù

‚ÄúRemus, Sirius, Peter,‚Äù Marlene ticks them off on her fingers.

Lily stares at her. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre all here? Why?‚Äù

‚ÄúCalled everyone.‚Äù

‚ÄúJesus,‚Äù Lily runs a hand over her face.

Lily laughs a little, dropping her forehead onto the tub and breathing out. ‚ÄúMerlin this is such a mess.‚Äù

‚ÄúNah, it‚Äôs not so bad,‚Äù Marlene says. ‚ÄúThough you are kind of stealing Alice‚Äôs thunder.‚Äù

Lily snorts and then grimaces, hand going to her stomach. ‚ÄúStop making me laugh, it hurts."

Mary‚Äôs hand finds the back of her neck and gives it a comforting squeeze just as the door opens again.

‚ÄúThe idiots have been wrangled,‚Äù Dorcas announces, a little breathlessly.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a star,‚Äù Lily hears Marlene say before the unmistakable sound of a well aimed kiss.

‚ÄúSo I‚Äôve been told,‚Äù Dorcas murmurs.

There‚Äôs another few moments of stillness, where they let Lily breathe, Mary‚Äôs hand never leaving her neck.

‚ÄúHere,‚Äù Mary says eventually, placing the water bottle back in her hands, ‚Äúdrink. ‚Äù Lily does, taking small sips, evening out her breathing, settling her stomach. ‚ÄúSomeone want to go smash up some ice cubes for her to suck on?‚Äù Mary asks, hand gently rubbing up and down Lily‚Äôs back.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre on it!‚Äù Marlene says, and Lily once again hears the sound of the door opening and closing. She slumps forward a little more, putting all her weight on the tub. Eventually she‚Äôs able to lift her head enough to look at Mary.

‚ÄúHow do you know what to do?‚Äù she asks weakly, ignoring the sparks of pain running through her stomach.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a wealth of knowledge,‚Äù Mary says dryly, causing Lily to give her a faint smile. ‚ÄúBut in all honesty, I‚Äôm just doing what I used to do when my sister had the flu growing up.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh, of course,‚Äù Lily‚Äôs too tired to laugh. ‚ÄúChildbirth and the flu, practically the same.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I figured,‚Äù before her expression grows more sincere. ‚ÄúBut my expertise is gonna run out when we get to the actual birthing portion of the night,‚Äù she pauses when Lily looks away. ‚ÄúWe really need to get you to the hospital Lily.‚Äù

Lily winces even though she knows Mary‚Äôs right. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm scared.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf going to the hospital?‚Äù

Among other things.

‚ÄúOf making it real,‚Äù she whispers.¬†

Lily feels like every organ in her body is being squeezed‚Äîwhich, admittedly, is what is happening, so fair enough. But still. Bloody unbearable.

‚ÄúWe need to get you to the hospital for that.‚Äù

Before Lily can force herself to speak again Marlene and Dorcas come bounding through the door‚Äîwell, Marlene is bounding, Dorcas is walking at a very reasonable pace.

‚ÄúIce chips achieved!‚Äù Marlene holds out the small bowl proudly.

Mary doesn‚Äôt take her eyes off Lily, brow raised in question. Lily doesn‚Äôt need words to know what she‚Äôs asking.¬†

‚ÄúEr‚Äîguys?‚Äù Marlene shakes the bowl of ice looking between the pair in confusion.

After a long pause Lily finally sighs, nodding her head.

‚ÄúForget the ice,‚Äù Mary says, slipping her arm around Lily‚Äôs waist as they both struggle to get her on her feet. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to the hospital.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am thoroughly in favour of that plan,‚Äù Dorcas says from the doorway.

‚ÄúOkay, right,‚Äù Marlene tosses the ice chips in the sink. ‚ÄúOperation get Lily to Mungo‚Äôs,‚Äù her eyes then flick down to Lily‚Äôs sleep pants and something crosses her face. ‚ÄúMight wanna get you a new pair of trousers though Lils, looks like you might have‚Äîer‚Äîhad an accident.‚Äù

Lily blinks. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù she looks down only to find that she‚Äôs wet herself. ‚ÄúOh fuck me, really?‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry about it,‚Äù Dorcas says casually. ‚ÄúMar peed herself after drinking too much at the pub like two weeks ago.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Marlene turns around and punches her in the arm. ‚ÄúYou were supposed to take that to the grave!‚Äù

Dorcas rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúPlease, you‚Äôve done way more embarrassing stuff.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think you peed yourself,‚Äù Mary cuts through the chatter, arm still wrapped around Lily, holding her up because standing is feeling extremely difficult at the moment. ‚ÄúI think your water broke.‚Äù

Lily blinks. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, I was crouched over and I‚Äôm already sweaty and I didn‚Äôt even notice honestly. I‚Äî‚Äú

Lily drops her head onto her chest. ‚ÄúFuck, fuck, fuck.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou mean she‚Äôs having the baby here?‚Äù Marlene demands. ‚ÄúIn the loo?‚Äù

Everything feels blurry from the pain‚Äîtoo loud and too bright‚Äîlike Lily‚Äôs going to pass out, and all she can really focus on is breathing.

In.

Out.

In.

Out.

Her brain short circuits every time the contractions hit. Slashing through her stomach like a dull blade.

Mary takes a deep breath. ‚ÄúOkay, tell the boys to get us a Mediwizard‚ÄîFloocall Mungo‚Äôs or go to the hospital and kidnap one for all I care.‚Äù

Marlene nods. ‚ÄúYup. Got it!‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay, Lils, lets get you out of these wet trousers alright?‚Äù Lily whimpers and Mary runs a soothing hand through her hair. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be okay, I promise. We can absolutely do this.‚Äù

And somehow, when Mary says it, Lily almost believes her.

‚ÄúDorcas, can you help me get her up? Get these off?‚Äù

A second later Dorcas is at Lily‚Äôs side, her two friends helping her stand, Dorcas holding her steady while Mary pulls down her trousers.

‚ÄúHere, maybe it‚Äôd be best if we got in the tub? More support and less‚Ä¶mess?‚Äù Lily steps into the tub without complaint, letting Dorcas lower her down as the pain dulls for just a moment.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù she sighs for the hundredth time. ‚ÄúFuck this is mental.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine, right Dorcas?‚Äù

Dorcas smiles a little. ‚ÄúTotally fine.‚Äù

Lily shakes her head at the pair of them, eyes a little misty. ‚ÄúYou lot are mental then.‚Äù

‚ÄúSays the girl who started having a baby and decided to lock herself in the bathroom. Honestly Lily, and I thought I was the drama queen,‚Äù Mary gives her a wink.¬†

‚ÄúOh fuck off,‚Äù she groans just as Marlene comes back into the room.

‚ÄúOkay, okay, okay,‚Äù she doubles over, gripping her knees, out of breath from running up and down the stairs so much. ‚ÄúSo they‚Äôre gonna go to the hospital and see if they can bring someone back with them but,‚Äù Marlene looks at Lily who feels like she‚Äôs barely keeping up. ‚ÄúJames really wants to see you first.‚Äù

They all turn to her, making Lily squirm. She knows this should be an easy answer. An obvious one. But after a second she shakes her head. She‚Äôs worried they‚Äôll ask her to explain but Marlene doesn‚Äôt miss a beat.

‚ÄúGot it, I‚Äôll tell them to get fucking going.‚Äù And the next second she‚Äôs gone again.

‚ÄúI just,‚Äù Lily says between breaths as Mary kneels next to the tub. ‚ÄúI just can‚Äôt. Not right now, he‚Äî‚Äú she squeezes her eyes shut. ‚ÄúI love him. I love him. I want him here. But it‚Äôs too hard right now. I can‚Äôt.‚Äù

Lily lets out something between a laugh and a hiccup. ‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù she takes some ice, before dropping her head back against the cold tiles and closing her eyes.

The pounding of feet up the stairs signals Marlene‚Äôs return, speeding into the bathroom.

‚ÄúGuess who I‚Äôve found?‚Äù she says gleefully.

‚ÄúPlease say someone with a medical degree,‚Äù Mary replies.

‚ÄúI second that,‚Äù Dorcas chimes in.

Marlene‚Äôs smile doesn‚Äôt shrink. ‚ÄúNah better.‚Äù Lily is vaguely aware of the noise of someone approaching behind Marlene, the pain building inside her again, making it difficult to focus. Marlene steps aside with a flourish revealing‚Äî¬†

Alice is dressed in a baggy t-shirt that must be Frank‚Äôs and flannel pyjama bottoms. She looks tired but otherwise good. Eyes bright as they stare down at Lily.¬†

‚ÄúWhat am I doing here? What are you doing giving birth in a bathtub?‚Äù

Lily groans and then the contraction really hits her and it turns into more of a grunt, forcing her to curl forward over her stomach.

‚ÄúAlright, okay, you‚Äôre okay sweetheart, we‚Äôve got you,‚Äù Alice maneuvers her way through the bathroom until she‚Äôs crawling into the tub by Lily‚Äôs feet. ‚ÄúHow far apart are the contractions?‚Äù she asks Mary.

‚ÄúNot very.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot very? I‚Äôm gonna need something a little more precise than that Macdonald.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell I don‚Äôt have anything more precise than that Longbottom.‚Äù

Alice rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúCan someone please start timing these contractions?‚Äù

‚ÄúOn it!‚Äù Dorcas calls, pulling out her wand and transfiguring Lily‚Äôs toothbrush into a stopwatch.

Lily makes a small whimpering noise. ‚ÄúFuck, fuck, what‚Äôre we going to do? What if something goes wrong?‚Äù

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Alice says softly, squeezing Lily‚Äôs knees. ‚ÄúThe boys have gone to get a Mediwizard okay? I promise you we have plenty of time before this baby comes, so you just need to stay calm and breathe. Nothing is going to go wrong. We‚Äôre all right here for whatever you need, okay?‚Äù

Lily closes her eyes, squeezing Mary‚Äôs hand and exhaling. ‚ÄúOkay.‚Äù And then she grimaces.

‚ÄúIs that another contraction?‚Äù Alice asks.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Lily forces out through clenched teeth, opening her eyes to see Alice looking over her head at Dorcas.

‚ÄúHow long was that?‚Äù

Dorcas looks up from the watch. ‚ÄúTwo minutes.‚Äù

‚ÄúHuh,‚Äù Alice says, turning back to Lily.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù she asks, voice strained as she tries to talk through the pain, surprised Mary hasn‚Äôt said a word since she‚Äôs definitely squeezing the shit out of her hand. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù

Alice shakes her head quickly. ‚ÄúNothing! Nothing‚Äôs wrong, just‚Äîuh‚Äî‚Äú she gives Lily a bemused smile. ‚ÄúThat baby might be coming a little sooner than I thought.‚Äù

PART V JAMES

¬†

James and Sirius have been asked to leave the hospital.

Well, that might not be entirely true.

James and Sirius have been escorted by security out of the building and are now anxiously pacing outside. At least, James is pacing, Sirius is more‚Ä¶leaning.

‚Äú‚Äîit‚Äôs not like we punched anyone!‚Äù James rails, indignantly throwing his arms around. ‚ÄúWe were just telling them, calmly,‚Äù Sirius snorts but James ignores him, ‚Äúto get their heads out of their asses and help out my pregnant wife‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúGirlfriend.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúGirlfriend,‚Äù Sirius corrects, bringing James up short. ‚ÄúYou said‚Äîer‚Äîwife.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù James blinks a few times. ‚ÄúOh well‚Ä¶‚Äù there‚Äôs a small awkward silence as James tries to figure out where the hell that mental slip came from. ‚ÄúYou know what I meant.‚Äù

Sirius nods. ‚ÄúYeah mate, I know.‚Äù

‚ÄúAnd they bloody kicked us out!‚Äù

‚ÄúOut of order.‚Äù

‚ÄúCompletely out of order!‚Äù James‚Äôs voice echoes a bit, bouncing off the courtyard they‚Äôre currently standing in.

‚ÄúMoony will sort them out,‚Äù Sirius says, with an unshakeable level of confidence. ‚ÄúAnd, I‚Äôm gonna be honest, I was definitely about to punch at least one of them.‚Äù

James snorts, rubbing at his face. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he murmurs. ‚ÄúYeah me too.‚Äù He lets out a heavy sigh, walking over to Sirius by the wall and sinking down to the ground. ‚ÄúI just want to be useful.‚Äù

Sirius nudges him with his foot. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

Another pause and then. ‚ÄúShe didn‚Äôt want to see me.‚Äù

Sirius sighs, ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

James shakes his head before dropping it back against the brick wall behind him. ‚ÄúSometimes,‚Äù he starts, ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs getting better, you know? That we‚Äôre‚Ä¶healing‚Ä¶and then other times‚Ä¶‚Äù I remember that I‚Äôm never going to see him again. Other times Lily walks into the room and won‚Äôt even look at me.

‚ÄúIt hasn‚Äôt really been that long, all things considered,‚Äù Sirius says eventually. ‚ÄúMaybe it‚Äôll get easier?‚Äù

James scrubs at his face, ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he croaks. He doesn‚Äôt know what time it is. He knows it‚Äôs light out‚Äîthe sun hanging offensively bright in the sky above his head‚Äîbut that could mean anything. Late morning? Early afternoon? All he knows is he‚Äôs been up for hours and it‚Äôs making his whole body feel heavy.

‚ÄúThere are good moments,‚Äù he finds himself saying, ‚Äúlike really good moments.‚Äù He thinks about last night, about dancing with Lily in the middle of their kitchen. ‚ÄúI just can‚Äôt figure out if that‚Äôs normal, you know? That those are just‚Ä¶moments. That there is so much in between.‚Äù

Sirius sighs, finally sinking down beside him. There‚Äôs silence before he speaks. ‚ÄúYou reckon it‚Äôs just us?‚Äù he asks finally, both of them looking at each other. ‚ÄúAre we the problem? Or is this just‚Ä¶what it‚Äôs like?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat it‚Äôs like?‚Äù James asks.

Sirius waves his hand in the air. ‚ÄúBeing a grown-up.‚Äù¬†

James thinks of his parents. Of Remus‚Äôs parents. Of Sirius‚Äôs. Finally he shakes his head. ‚ÄúI have no fucking clue.‚Äù

Sirius lets out a huff. ‚ÄúMe either.‚Äù

At that moment the front doors fly open and both of them jump to their feet, Remus and Peter walking towards them.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt see a Mediwizard,‚Äù James says warningly.

Remus shoots him an unimpressed look. ‚ÄúYou know, as a general rule, if you want people to do something for you it‚Äôs really best not to try and fight them.‚Äù

‚ÄúUnless they‚Äôre being absolute bellends,‚Äù Sirius says, which earns him an equally unimpressed look.

‚ÄúWe should have left you both behind.‚Äù

‚ÄúRemus, the Mediwizard?‚Äù James asks impatiently.

The other boy rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre backed up, they‚Äôll be able to send someone in a few hours.‚Äù

‚ÄúA few hours!‚Äù James demands.

‚ÄúTwo or three,‚Äù Remus elaborates reluctantly.

‚ÄúOh absolutely not!‚Äù he starts towards the doors but Peter impedes his path, a rather apologetic look on his face as Remus grabs hold of Sirius who was following behind him.

‚ÄúNo, no, no,‚Äù Remus says firmly. ‚ÄúYou two go in there and it‚Äôll be ten hours before they bother to send anyone.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe needs someone now not in three hours! Jesus Christ.‚Äù James tries to move forward again, and again Peter blocks his path. He glares at him. ‚ÄúPete, I love you, but if you don‚Äôt get out of my way I will use force.‚Äù

Peter grimaces but stays staunchly where he is. ‚ÄúSorry Prongs, but Moony scares me more so‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù Remus says wearily. ‚ÄúPlease, I get it, you‚Äôre stressed, but fighting everyone in that hospital is not going to fix anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know that.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames.‚Äù

He sighs, running a hand through his hair. ‚ÄúFuck‚Äîfine. FINE,‚Äù he turns to Remus who‚Äôs standing a few paces behind him, still holding onto Sirius‚Äôs arm. ‚ÄúSo what do we do now?‚Äù

There‚Äôs something like pity in Remus‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúWe go back and wait.‚Äù

James shakes his head, throwing his hands up in the air. ‚ÄúGreat. That‚Äôs just fucking‚Äîfat lot of use I am.‚Äù

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

But it‚Äôs too late. He‚Äôs already Apparating away, not interested in whatever placating statement Remus is about to make. He stalks up to his front door, listening to the distinct ‚Äúpops‚Äù of his friend‚Äôs appearing behind him. The minute he steps inside he hears screaming. It stops him dead in his tracks. He‚Äôs never heard Lily‚Äôs voice sound like that before.

He feels Sirius come up beside him, and then Remus, Peter. They lean against him, letting him feel their weight, their presence, as he stands uselessly at the bottom of the stairs and listens to one of the people he loves most in the world in pain. Unable to do anything about it.

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt bad,‚Äù Remus says finally, voice quiet. ‚ÄúI know it sounds‚Ä¶but this isn‚Äôt bad.‚Äù

James nods numbly. He knows that, he supposes, but at the moment it‚Äôs hard to believe.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù Sirius nudges him into the sitting room, practically pushing him onto the sofa. ‚ÄúYou want some tea?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll make it,‚Äù Remus says, going quickly to the kitchen.

Sirius sits down next to James, the noises from upstairs still drifting through the floors. James rests his elbows on his knees, head in his hands. ‚ÄúI hate this,‚Äù he murmurs. He‚Äôs never been good at waiting. At being still. At doing nothing. He wants to fix things.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Sirius says beside him. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

So they sit.

And they listen.

Hoping that any minute the wards will charm and the Mediwizard will appear.

Remus and Peter start playing a game of chess at some point, while Sirius stays glued to James‚Äôs side, even when Peter asks if he wants to play the winner. He presses into James, just like he‚Äôd done at the door. Not talking, just a constant steady presence.

I‚Äôm here.

I‚Äôm here.

I‚Äôm here.

And then they hear running. James‚Äôs head pops up just as Marlene skids into the room. Her hair has been thrown into a sloppy bun, strands escaping in all directions making her look a bit mad. And there‚Äôs blood. Blood on her shirt.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù she says, and his heart lurches in his chest even after he registers the smile on her face. ‚ÄúCome, come, come.‚Äù

‚ÄúIs she alright?‚Äù James stumbles to his feet, Marlene already bounding out of the room like some kind of over energized rabbit.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs totally fine. They‚Äôre both totally fine.‚Äù

He‚Äôs halfway up the stairs before he registers that. ‚ÄúBoth?‚Äù his mouth feels dry. ‚ÄúYou‚Äîthe‚Äîthe baby?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe baby,‚Äù Marlene confirms, beaming at him over her shoulder. ‚ÄúJust wait until you‚Äîgod James he‚Äôs so‚Äî‚Äú but they‚Äôve made it to the bathroom door now, it‚Äôs wide open, the room inside an absolute mess. There are clothes and water and blood‚Äîfuck why is there so much blood?

Dorcas is sitting on the toilet lid, she smiles wearily at him as he walks in, Mary at the sink washing her hands, Alice kneeling down beside the tub and then‚Äî

James‚Äôs brain freezes for a minute, pulling him up short in the middle of the room. The sudden movement‚Äîor lack thereof‚Äîseems to catch Alice‚Äôs attention, because she looks up.

‚ÄúWell look who it is,‚Äù she smiles, sweaty and tired. ‚ÄúSorry, I‚Äôm in your spot.‚Äù

She moves out of the way, squeezing James‚Äôs shoulder as she passes him. ‚ÄúI think maybe we all have something very urgent that we need to do downstairs right now at this second.‚Äù

Mary snorts.

‚ÄúOh‚Äîyeah‚Äîthat thing,‚Äù Marlene grabs Dorcas‚Äôs arm and starts hauling her towards the door.

‚ÄúJesus Mar,‚Äù James can hear them distantly in the corridor, ‚Äúdislocate my arm why don‚Äôt you.‚Äù

And suddenly it‚Äôs just them.

James.

And Lily.

And‚Äî

‚ÄúLook Harry,‚Äù Lily says, voice rough, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs your dad.‚Äù

James swallows as the baby‚Äîpink and blue and painfully beautiful‚Äîlooks up at him. Giant green eyes and small slicked tuffs of dark hair. For a moment he can‚Äôt breathe. Overwhelmed by it all.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù Lily asks, the smallest hint of concern creeping in to her voice, which is when James realizes that he hasn‚Äôt said anything since he stepped into the room.

‚ÄúHi,‚Äù James sounds wrecked and Lily laughs a little.

‚ÄúHi.‚Äù

And suddenly he‚Äôs at her side, dropping down to his knees, kissing her temple.

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt, I‚Äôm so gross,‚Äù her squirming makes the baby squirm, scrunching his little chubby face, and puckering his little chubby mouth.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre so beautiful,‚Äù James says in a hushed voice, something prickling behind his eyes. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre both so beautiful. I‚Äî‚Äú

And he can‚Äôt.

He really can‚Äôt speak.

He just wants to gather them in his arms.

He just wants to hold them for the rest of his life.

‚ÄúWe did alright huh?‚Äù Lily asks.

James half-snorts half-sniffles. ‚ÄúUs? Please, this was all you,‚Äù his voice cracks as he greedily takes in the sight of their baby. Their son. He reaches out his hand, gently running his fingers along Harry‚Äôs little arms.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs so perfect.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know,‚Äù Lily whispers back. ‚ÄúI just want to squish him.‚Äù

That startles a laugh out of James. And then he‚Äôs leaning forward and pressing a kiss to the top of the baby‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúHello Harry,‚Äù he says in the same gentle voice. ‚ÄúHello, hi, hey, it‚Äôs so good to see you. I love you so much. I‚Äôm gonna love you so much.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you reckon it‚Äôs possible to love someone too much?‚Äù Lily asks, sniffling herself. ‚ÄúBecause I think I might.‚Äù

James looks over at her. Cheeks flushed and eyes bright, hair plastered to her face with sweat. Before he can help himself he kisses her again‚Äîher cheek, her forehead, her nose.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù she laughs.

When he pulls back their eyes fall into one another, catching each other, and holding, holding, holding.

‚ÄúMarry me.‚Äù

The words are out of his mouth before he has time to think about them. And while he is, admittedly, a little startled by his own brashness, he doesn‚Äôt regret it. Not a bit.

Lily‚Äôs eyes go wide. ‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI know we aren‚Äôt perfect,‚Äù he goes on. ‚ÄúI know we have so much still to work through. But can you honestly look at me and say that this isn‚Äôt forever? Because even in the worst moments, the hardest moments‚Äîthe ones that burn and ache and sting‚ÄîI feel forever when I look at you.‚Äù¬†

They‚Äôre close enough that he can feel her breath hitch, so can the baby, who makes a slightly disgruntled gurgling noise.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù she says again, like his name is the only thing her mind can wrap itself around.

‚ÄúI love you,‚Äù he knows he‚Äôs crying. A complete and utter mess. He reaches forward, cradling her face in his hands. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all I really want to do honestly. Love you. Love both of you.‚Äù

Lily lets out a wet laugh, as she turns her face to kiss his palm. ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah‚Äîyes, okay, it‚Äôs absolutely mental but yes,‚Äù she shakes her head, leaning forward to kiss his mouth. ‚ÄúI feel forever with you too,‚Äù she says against his lips. James wraps around her and Harry‚Äîwho squirms again but miraculously does not start crying‚Äîburying his face in Lily‚Äôs neck.

‚ÄúAlright?‚Äù Lily asks, turning her head to nuzzle his hair.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù James exhales, letting go of all the anxiety and fear he‚Äôs been holding since he woke up last night to find Lily out of bed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just really fucking happy you‚Äôre both okay.‚Äù

Lily hums, kissing the top of his head. ‚ÄúMe too.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúKnock, knock,‚Äù Alice sings as she taps on the bedroom door sometime later, Sirius standing just behind her.

Lily and James are both on the bed, Lily under the covers, James on top of them, baby Harry asleep in his arms.

‚ÄúOh‚Äîwhoops, sorry,‚Äù Alice‚Äôs voice instantly drops to a whisper as they come into the room. She goes to Lily‚Äôs side, stroking her hair. ‚ÄúYou're looking better.‚Äù

‚ÄúProbably the shower,‚Äù Lily‚Äôs voice is heavy with exhaustion but she has a dopey smile on her face. ‚ÄúWell, that and the lack of blood.‚Äù

Alice snorts. ‚ÄúPersonally, I thought you looked quite dashing covered in afterbirth.‚Äù

Lily makes a face. ‚ÄúGross.‚Äù

Sirius hasn‚Äôt made it past the middle of the room, eyes on the baby in James‚Äôs arms, he looks like he‚Äôs been hit with a stunning spell.

‚ÄúWell?‚Äù James asks softly. ‚ÄúYou gonna come over and meet him or are you just going to stand there gawking?‚Äù

Sirius blinks, like he‚Äôs waking from a trance. ‚ÄúRight‚Äîyeah‚Äî‚Äòcourse.‚Äù

He walks over to James‚Äôs side, unable to look anywhere but at the baby.

‚ÄúThis is Harry,‚Äù James says, smiling. He‚Äôs already obsessed with the feel of the warm body in his arms‚Äîhis little breaths and snorts turning James‚Äôs heart to goo.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs so‚Ä¶‚Äù there‚Äôs aw in Sirius‚Äôs voice. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs so small.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi! Give him a minute, he‚Äôs only just got here. He‚Äôll grow. Least that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve been told.‚Äù

Alice lets out a huff of laughter but Sirius‚Äôs face remains uncharacteristically sober. After a few more seconds of silence James starts to get a little worried.

‚ÄúSirius?‚Äù

Sirius swallows before looking up and James sees his eyes are wet. ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù he clears his throat, quickly blinking the moisture away. ‚ÄúI just‚Äîthat‚Äôs your son, you know?‚Äù

James gives his friend a soft smile. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna buy him so much shit.‚Äù

James almost forgets to be quiet then, biting his lip at the last second to hold back a full laugh, Harry fussing a little in his arms at the movement.

‚ÄúOh God,‚Äù Lily says, sounding more fond than horrified.

Sirius‚Äôs eyes go to her. ‚ÄúYou did real good Evans.‚Äù

She smiles at him. ‚ÄúI did, didn‚Äôt I?‚Äù And for a moment they all just bask in it. The warmth and softness and love that seems to be bleeding out of every corner of the room.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù Alice says eventually, ‚Äúnot that I don‚Äôt want to spend every waking moment with you and your lovely bundle of joy. But is there a reason you summoned us?‚Äù she waggles a finger between herself and Sirius. ‚ÄúBecause I have to admit, I do feel a bit like I‚Äôve been called to the Head Master‚Äôs office.‚Äù

Lily snorts. ‚ÄúAs if you were ever called to the Head Master‚Äôs office.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs right, this is nothing like that,‚Äù Sirius adds. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre inner swot is showing Longbottom.‚Äù

Alice rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúOh well, pardon me for not purposefully pissing off every Professor in the whole school.‚Äù

‚ÄúCome now, it was hardly EVERY professor.‚Äù

James makes a skeptical noise.

‚ÄúPretty sure Slughorn was obsessed with us.‚Äù

‚ÄúLikely a bit hacked-off we never went to his parties though.‚Äù

‚ÄúPfft, those weren‚Äôt parties. More like‚Ä¶meetings.‚Äù

‚ÄúWork-dos.‚Äù

‚ÄúFamily obligations.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlright,‚Äù Alice interrupts, turning to Lily. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm assuming there‚Äôs something you wanted to tell us?‚Äù

Lily smiles, biting her lip as she reaches out and takes Alice‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù she says, before looking at Sirius. ‚ÄúWe were wondering if you two would be willing to‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúBe Harry‚Äôs God parents,‚Äù James finishes for her.

There‚Äôs a beat of silence.

And then Alice squeals, which has Lily laughing and sh-ing her at the same time.

‚ÄúSorry, sorry,‚Äù Alice says, hands clasped over her mouth as she does a little happy dance.

‚ÄúIs that a yes?‚Äù Lily asks.

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt be silly, of course it‚Äôs a yes!‚Äù throwing her arms around Lily and squeezing her unreasonably tight.

Sirius‚Äôs reaction is somewhat more subdued. His eyes going wide‚Äîthreatening to fall out. ‚ÄúMe?‚Äù he asks James quietly.

‚ÄúYeah, of course you. Who else would it be?‚Äù

Sirius looks uncertain, it‚Äôs an odd expression on him. ‚ÄúI dunno, Frank or Remus, they‚Äôre‚Ä¶‚Äù but he doesn‚Äôt seem to know how to finish that sentence.¬†

James wants to reach out to him, but he settles for looking. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says, as sincerely as he can manage. ‚ÄúYou. I want it to be you. If, y‚Äôknow, if you‚Äôre willing?‚Äù

Sirius holds his gaze. ‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù and then, after a moment. ‚ÄúI just met the little bugger but I‚Äôd die for him in a heartbeat.‚Äù

James smiles. ‚ÄúI know you would.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

The Mediwizard does come eventually, performing a few diagnostic spells and determining that everything is all right. He gives Lily some potions and salves to help with her recovery, though largely he just recommends she gets as much rest as she can. A bit difficult when everyone is crowding around them trying to get a better look at Harry.

‚ÄúHe looks a bit like a naked mole-rat doesn‚Äôt he?‚Äù

‚ÄúMerlin Peter.‚Äù

Eventually James is convinced to put him down in his crib. The house slowly emptying out until it‚Äôs just the three of them.

‚ÄúJames, come to bed,‚Äù Lily half-laughs.¬†

But he can‚Äôt stop looking at Harry. Can‚Äôt stand not being next to him. Touching him. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs such a good baby,‚Äù James coos. ‚ÄúHe barely cried at all.‚Äù

Lily snorts. ‚ÄúYeah well, I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôll change in a few hours when he decides he‚Äôs hungry.‚Äù

James can‚Äôt be mad at that, he wants to cry when he‚Äôs hungry too. And there‚Äôs nothing wrong with a little midnight snack.

‚ÄúJames,‚Äù Lily hisses, though she can‚Äôt keep the warmth out of her voice. ‚ÄúC‚Äômere. You haven‚Äôt slept in like twenty-four hours.‚Äù

After a few more seconds James sighs, tearing himself away from the crib and crawling into bed with Lily. He slips his arm underneath her and she rests her head on his chest. He can already feel sleep pulling at him, even though five seconds ago he was more than willing to stay up all night watching Harry. But before he can completely drift away he finds himself speaking:

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt want to see me.‚Äù

‚ÄúHm?‚Äù Lily mumbles.

‚ÄúWhen you were‚Äîwhen you were having the baby. You didn‚Äôt want to see me.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause and James thinks maybe Lily has fallen asleep.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still‚Ä¶work, to trust you sometimes,‚Äù she whispers into the dark room, James can feel the vibrations of her voice in his chest. ‚ÄúAnd I just‚Ä¶I couldn‚Äôt do that work then, I didn‚Äôt have it in me. Does that make sense?‚Äù

James closes his eyes briefly, trying to swallow the way that stings. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúYeah that makes sense.‚Äù

He feels Lily lift her head, so he opens his eyes, looking down at her. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs getting easier though,‚Äù she says, before leaning up and kissing his cheek. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still glad it‚Äôs you.‚Äù

James‚Äôs breath stutters in his chest. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad it‚Äôs you too.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

Lily is still in bed when the knock on the door comes the next morning. James doesn‚Äôt think much of it. Pretty well everyone promised to come back and visit so he‚Äôs not exactly surprised. He doesn‚Äôt even bring his wand, walking to the front door in a t-shirt and his pants.

Dumbledore‚Äôs eyes sparkle when he opens the door.

‚ÄúOh,‚Äù James comes up short. ‚ÄúEr‚Äîhello?‚Äù

The older man gives him a tight smile. ‚ÄúGood morning James. I do hope you‚Äôll pardon the intrusion, but I heard you had a son yesterday?‚Äù

James can feel the confusion pinching his face. ‚ÄúI‚Äîyeah I‚Äîare you here to see the baby?‚Äù

The way Dumbledore‚Äôs smile flickers makes something heavy fall into the pit of James‚Äôs stomach.

‚ÄúNot quite,‚Äù the old man says eventually. ‚ÄúMay I come in?‚Äù

¬†

¬†

The wedding is small. They have it in their back garden. Fireflies charmed to light up the sky above their heads like a blanket of stars. It‚Äôs the beginning of fall but it‚Äôs still warm.

Frank finds James before the ceremony, fidgeting with the collar of his robes in the bathroom mirror.

‚ÄúHere, let me,‚Äù¬† he says, batting James‚Äôs hands away. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre only making it worse.‚Äù

James sighs but doesn‚Äôt fight it, tilting his head back slightly to give Frank better access.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôre you holding up?‚Äù he asks.

‚ÄúFine.‚Äù

"Show off.‚Äù

That makes James laugh. ‚ÄúSorry. I‚Äôll try to be more panicky.‚Äù

Frank only rolls his eyes, stepping back and admiring his work. ‚ÄúWell, at least now it doesn‚Äôt look like you‚Äôre trying to strangle yourself.‚Äù

James‚Äôs hand comes up, gently brushing over the fabric as he looks at himself in the mirror, a vague sense of longing pulling at his gut. In another life, he thinks, it would be his father here helping him get ready.

‚ÄúThey would have been so happy today,‚Äù Frank says, like he can read James‚Äôs mind.

He tries to smile. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù his voice cracks.

‚ÄúWho do you reckon would start crying first?‚Äù

James snorts. ‚ÄúFleamont, easy.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, ‚Äòcourse.‚Äù

James exhales, leaning forward and gripping the sink in front of him. Today is a good day. It is. But it‚Äôs also‚Ä¶hard.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt expect to be missing so many people on my wedding day.‚Äù

Frank gives him a sympathetic look. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre here, I promise you. The people that matter are always here,‚Äù he gives James‚Äôs chest a gentle nudge, before his eyes trail around the room, up the walls, like he can see Effie and Fleamont in the wooden beams.

‚ÄúI know that the wedding had to be here for other, less sentimental reasons, but it feels right. Feels like they‚Äôre still a part of it, you know?‚Äù Frank looks at James whose heart swells just a little too big for his chest.

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he manages to choke out. ‚ÄúYeah it does.‚Äù

It had been a fight to get Dumbledore to let them have any kind of celebrations at all. Especially considering that, as of tomorrow, James and Lily will officially be in hiding. Luckily they had just about every Order member on their side and eventually Dumbledore caved. It would probably be safe, Dumbledore allowed, to have a small gathering at their home. So here they are, getting married. Saying goodbye.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Sirius‚Äôs voice comes hollering up the stairs. ‚ÄúYou lot done making yourselves look pretty? We‚Äôve got a wedding to get started!‚Äù

James and Frank share a look of joint exasperation.

‚ÄúI hope Remus never proposes,‚Äù Frank says as they walk out of the bathroom. ‚ÄúCause Black‚Äôs gonna be a nightmare of a bride.‚Äù

James laughs, getting to the top of the stairs before he feels his sleeves. ‚ÄúShit‚Äîforgot my cufflinks.‚Äù

Frank looks up at him, a few steps below.

‚ÄúGo ahead,‚Äù James waves him off already turning back for the bedroom. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be right there.‚Äù

‚ÄúBetter hurry or you‚Äôll ruin Sirius‚Äôs special day!‚Äù

James shakes his head as he walks into the bedroom, hands going for the cufflinks sitting on top of his dresser. That should be the end of it. Over. Done. But for some reason James lingers. Before he can really think about what he‚Äôs doing his hand opens the top drawer, reaching inside, wrapping around the small wooden box at the back.

He opens it carefully, pulling out the Quaffle and sitting down on his bed. He feels the familiar ache he always does when it sits lifelessly in his palm. He rolls it around, watching the golden initials glinting in the light coming from the corridor.

‚ÄúDo you feel betrayed?‚Äù he whispers to the ball. ‚ÄúOr do you understand?‚Äù

That it‚Äôs still love.

Always love.

He squeezes the ball tight before bringing it to his lips.

‚ÄúI wish you were here,‚Äù which is an absurd thing to say, but he feels it all the same.

Because he wants to marry Lily. He just wishes Regulus was with him too. At his side. Smirking. Making sharp remarks about the guests as they arrive. Sneaking James soft smiles when he thinks no one is looking. Bickering with Sirius about the music. James closes his eyes for a moment and exhales. He knows that‚Äôs not how it would have been, even if Regulus was alive, even if he had come to Godric‚Äôs Hollow, it was never going to be like that.

But oh how James wants.

‚ÄúPRONGS! Stop playing with your hair and get down here!‚Äù

James sighs. ‚ÄúI‚ÄôM COMING YOU LUNATIC!‚Äù

He gets up, moving to put the Quaffle back in its box, but at the last minute his hand seems to take a detour. The ball ending up in the pocket of James‚Äôs robes instead.

¬†

¬†

It‚Äôs a few hours later‚Äîafter the ceremony, during which James cried more than Harry ever has, and dinner, during which several glasses of wine were consumed‚Äîthat Sirius pulls James clumsily into the quiet of the house. None of the lights are on so they can only see one another by the warm glow that spills in from the back garden.

‚ÄúI have something for you,‚Äù Sirius says, hand warm on the back of James‚Äôs neck. He‚Äôs surprisingly serious for someone who, only a moment ago, was doing the worm in the middle of the dance floor.

‚ÄúPadfoot, I love you, but I‚Äôm taken,‚Äù James holds up his hand. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm maaarrriiieeeddd.‚Äù

He should probably stop drinking.

‚ÄúI had you first and Evans knows it,‚Äù Sirius says, causing James to snort as the pair of them stumble around. ‚ÄúBut listen LISTEN this is important.‚Äù

James does his best to school his expression into something that says ‚ÄúI am listening‚Äù but judging by the look Sirius gives him he doesn‚Äôt do a very good job. Sirius squeezes the back of James‚Äôs neck before bringing their foreheads together.¬†

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know that.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, really James. I‚Äôm here. I know that it‚Äôll be‚Ä¶‚Äú he swallows with some difficulty, ‚Äúharder now, what with‚Ä¶‚Äù¬† the alcohol seems to have robbed Sirius of his ability to finish his sentences.

‚ÄúThe hiding,‚Äù James decides to help him out, feeling Sirius nod against him. In the dark the light catches Sirius‚Äôs eyes, making them look like water.

‚ÄúBut I will always be here, always, always. Okay? For you. For Lily. For Harry.‚Äù

James‚Äôs chest is starting to feel uncomfortably tight. ‚ÄúI wish you and Moons would just move in.‚Äù

Sirius laughs quietly, though there‚Äôs something heavy about it. ‚ÄúIt never feels right, does it? All of us not being together.‚Äù

James shakes his head. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he whispers, like it‚Äôs a secret. ‚ÄúNever.‚Äù

A new certainty seems to take hold of Sirius and he pulls back from James, who sways unintentionally into the empty space he‚Äôs left.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why I want you to have this.‚Äù

At first, because of the light, and also because of the alcohol, James can‚Äôt tell what it is. It looks‚Ä¶wet‚Ä¶maybe? And then he realizes‚Äî

‚ÄúA mirror?‚Äù James takes the ornate handle he‚Äôs offered and holds the mirror up.

‚ÄúThey talk to one another,‚Äù Sirius explains as he shows James its twin. James squints at his best mate.

‚ÄúTalk to one another?‚Äù

Sirius nods at the the item in question. ‚ÄúLook at the reflection.‚Äù

So James does, expecting to see the blurry image of his own face. What he ends up seeing is the blurry image of Sirius‚Äôs face. His eyes snap up, and then back down, multiple times.

‚ÄúWe can use these,‚Äù Sirius says when he decides that James has been confused long enough. ‚ÄúNo Floo, no letters. I‚Äôll always have this with me okay?‚Äù James looks at Sirius again, his swimming eyes holding him. ‚ÄúWherever I am, whatever I‚Äôm doing, you‚Äôll be able to contact me. Okay?‚Äù He grabs hold of James‚Äôs neck again with his free hand. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here.‚Äù

Fuck, James is too drunk for this many emotions.

‚ÄúThat goes both ways,‚Äù he finally manages. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll carry it, always.‚Äù

James isn‚Äôt sure who moves first, but the next thing he knows they have their arms wrapped around one another, the embrace almost violent, almost knocking them off their feet.

‚ÄúI really love you, you know,‚Äù Sirius says into his shoulder.

James squeezes him tighter, as though worried he‚Äôs going to suddenly disappear. ‚ÄúI love you too.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

James didn‚Äôt want to make Sirius the Secret Keeper.

I mean, he did.

But.

He didn‚Äôt want to give Remus and Sirius something else to fight about.

Another ocean in their relationship that neither of them could cross.

Another thing they couldn‚Äôt say.

So James had wanted to pick someone else.

Except.

Except he couldn‚Äôt.

It was Sirius.

It was always going to be Sirius.

¬†

¬†

Harry provides a good distraction at first. Babies, it turns out, take up quite a bit of time. Convenient, since now Lily and James have so much of it. It isn‚Äôt terribly noticeable at first, that they‚Äôre prisoners. It doesn‚Äôt really sink in until the day James tries to go flying and finds that the wards Dumbledore set up won‚Äôt even let him in the back garden.

It is a shock to no one that James is terrible at staying put. Being still. Quiet. Patient. He talks to Sirius every day. Sometimes Remus is there. Sometimes Peter. They tell him what‚Äôs going on‚Äîat least to the extent that they‚Äôre allowed, which, thanks to Moody, is not much. James becomes increasingly bitter about this since obviously he isn‚Äôt the fucking spy is he? And It‚Äôs not like he can see anyone to spread information. But apparently Moody doesn‚Äôt believe in exceptions.

‚ÄúI probably won‚Äôt be able to talk tomorrow.‚Äù

Sirius looks nearly as miserable as James feels, sitting slouched on his sofa, hair in a messy bun, heavy bags under his eyes. Remus is sitting next to him, cup of tea clutched between both hands.

Merlin, James can‚Äôt help thinking, when did we all start looking so old?

‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù he cringes at how petulant he sounds, but if Sirius notices he doesn‚Äôt comment, only blowing out a breath that disturbs some of the fly away hairs framing his forehead.

‚ÄúI‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúSirius,‚Äù Remus warns, earning him a glare from both of them.

‚ÄúWho is he gonna tell Remus? Honestly.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know who‚Äôs listening,‚Äù Remus insists.

‚ÄúI promise Harry won‚Äôt snitch,‚Äù James intends for it to be a joke but the bitterness in his voice is undeniable.

Remus gives him an apologetic look. ‚ÄúListen, I know how mental this sounds‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúDo you?‚Äù Sirius demands, and now they‚Äôre all glaring.

‚ÄúYes. I do. But we have no idea how these mirrors even work‚Äîhow easy they are to hack into. Not to mention our flat.‚Äù

‚ÄúOur flat?‚Äù Sirius repeats. ‚ÄúWhat the hell is wrong with our flat?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt could be bugged! It‚Äôs not exactly a secret that we live here, in this very busy, well known location.‚Äù

Sirius lets out a heavy sigh and, James assumes, throws his arms in the air, because for a minute he gets a very good look at the ceiling.

‚ÄúJesus Christ Remus.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just saying!‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just fucking paranoid.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo shit I‚Äôm paranoid! Haven‚Äôt you been paying attention?‚Äú

‚ÄúOh don‚Äôt start‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúOI!‚Äù James shouts, free hand massaging his temple. ‚ÄúEnough, enough. Merlin, you‚Äôd think you two were the ones locked up in a house together.‚Äù

Both of them look a little embarrassed, which isn‚Äôt really what James wants either.

‚ÄúSorry James, I just‚Äî‚Äú

But James stops Remus with his hand. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine, really, you‚Äôre right‚Äî‚Äú

Sirius scoffs.

‚ÄúHe IS right,‚Äù James sends Sirius a pointed look. ‚ÄúSo lets just‚Ä¶talk about something else. Okay?‚Äù

There's a tense moment of silence before Remus eventually clears his throat. ‚ÄúHow are things, you know, with you and Lily?‚Äù

How are things with Lily?

That is an interesting question.

They‚Äôre around one another all the time, inescapably so, with a new born baby who‚Äîdespite being extraordinarily well behaved, James still maintains‚Äîloves to get them up several times a night. Lily only knows how to take care of a baby the Muggle way and James the magical way, and while most of the time those two systems cohabit nicely, every once and a while they do clash. Like when James charmed the teddybears to watch Harry for an hour while he chatted with Sirius the other night.

Still, despite it all, James thinks that oddly, miraculously, they might actually be‚Äî

‚ÄúGood,‚Äù he says finally, eyes refocusing on his two mates who are now watching him rather intently. ‚ÄúMaybe it sounds weird but I feel like we‚Äôve been‚Ä¶missing Harry, y‚Äôknow? He‚Ä¶everything just makes more sense with him.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt mention the way he sometimes fantasizes about what it would‚Äôve been like, to introduce Harry to Regulus. To see him holding him. How that‚Ä¶makes sense too. Fills in some gap for James.¬† ¬†

Sirius looks completely lost but Remus offers James a soft smile. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy for you.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

Regardless of how well he and Lily are coping James still feels about ten seconds away from pulling his hair out most of the time. He‚Äôs already read pretty well every book in the cottage‚ÄîRemus has agreed to have Sirius bring him more‚Äîand he‚Äôs grown so bored that he‚Äôs actually dragged some of his father‚Äôs old potions stuff out of the basement and started experimenting.

‚ÄúIf you accidentally curse us I‚Äôm going to be so unimpressed Potter,‚Äù Lily says one day, bouncing Harry up and down on her knee as she watches James hover over a bubbling potion.

‚ÄúO ye of little faith,‚Äù James says, chopping up a frog‚Äôs foot.

‚ÄúI have seven years of potions‚Äôs classes that tell me not to trust you with a cauldron.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù James says mildly offended. ‚ÄúI was good at potions.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs more your evil mind that frightens me, not so much your lack of ability.‚Äù

He shoots her a cheeky grin. ‚ÄúYou think I have an evil mind? Gosh golly gee Lily Potter, are you trying to seduce me? Cause it‚Äôs working,‚Äù he winks.

Lily tries and fails to keep a straight face, eventually laughing, which causes Harry to make some happy gurgling noises James assumes are him joining in.

Sometimes he loves them so much it hurts.¬†

¬†

¬†

He starts staying up later, because it‚Äôs one of the few ways he can be alone. Get some space. Lily and Harry asleep upstairs while he fiddles with his potions. One night, for some reason, he finds himself casting his Patronus. And then he does it again the night after. And after. And After. He doesn‚Äôt know why.¬†

Well, okay.

Maybe he does know why.

It sits with him, a calm, soothing presence. Filling James‚Äôs nights with a safe blueish glow. And whispered conversations.

‚ÄúWhat do you reckon Reg?‚Äù he says softly. ‚ÄúDo we crush the the pomegranate seeds or put them in whole?‚Äù

Funny. But he swears the stag is listening.

¬†

¬†

It‚Äôs only shortly after James discovers that the invisibility cloak allows him to walk through Dumbledore‚Äôs wards that the old man comes round asking for it. He doesn‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a coincidence, nor does he appreciate being treated like a child‚Äîhaving his toys taken away. But the problem with Dumbledore is, as much as you might want to, you can‚Äôt ever say no to him.

Well, unless you‚Äôre Mary Macdonald.

But almost no one is.

Dumbledore says he‚Äôll give it back. That he just needs it for some research he‚Äôs been doing. James doesn‚Äôt say much to him. Teeth clenched, hands in fists. Every fibre of his being revolting against the idea of handing it over. But in the end he does.

Of course he does.

His last bit of freedom.

He‚Äôs not sure Dumbledore knows what he‚Äôs taking. Or maybe he doesn‚Äôt care.

¬†

¬†

All of their communications have to go through Sirius, who, to his credit, takes on the task of letter carrier graciously. James knows Lily is lonely. She does not have a magical mirror instantly connecting her to her friends. Hell, she doesn‚Äôt even have an owl anymore. And while Sirius does his best to make regular visits, it‚Äôs difficult.¬†

Lily writes a lot of letters. There‚Äôs not much else to do to be fair. They sit on her desk and wait for Sirius to come pick them up and James fights the urge to ask her what‚Äôs in them.

It‚Äôs none of his business.

But he can‚Äôt help but wonder.

¬†

¬†

Harry is in the sink‚Äîtoo small for the bathtub‚Äîwet and rosy cheeked and smiling as he plays with the little rubber Snitch James conjured for him. Harry isn‚Äôt talking yet but he is smiling. He smiles a lot. And the gurgling has definitely started to sound more like laughter.

‚ÄúI think we might have a Seeker on our hands,‚Äù James says as he works the baby shampoo into Harry‚Äôs impressively thick hair.

‚ÄúOh yeah?‚Äù Lily is only half-listening, sitting in the empty bathtub behind him, reading through the letters Sirius brought over earlier that day.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs obsessed with this thing,‚Äù and then, to prove his point, he picks up the Snitch in question and tickles Harry‚Äôs little belly with it. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt that right, huh? Isn‚Äôt that right?‚Äù

Harry makes that gurgly-giggly noise and James can‚Äôt help but beam back at him.

‚ÄúTo be fair,‚Äù Lily says, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre also obsessed with it and you‚Äôre a Chaser.‚Äù

James considers that for a moment. ‚ÄúTrue enough I suppose.‚Äù

He‚Äôs just towelling Harry off‚Äîwho is beginning to get a little grumpy‚Äîwhen Lily gasps. He turns around to find her scrambling to her feet, eyes wide and on the letter in her hands. He feels his heart stutter.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù he asks, trying to keep the panic out of his voice as he holds Harry a little closer. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happened? What is it?‚Äù

But then Lily is laughing. ‚ÄúMarlene and Dorcas,‚Äù she looks up, eyes bright. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre engaged!‚Äù

‚ÄúHoly shit,‚Äù James says, before looking guiltily down at Harry and whispering; ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt tell anyone I said that.‚Äù

Harry just blinks up at him, making an unhappy noise. Clearly someone needs a nap.

‚ÄúGod I can‚Äôt believe this,‚Äù Lily is practically vibrating, standing in the middle of the tub and bouncing up and down on the balls of her feet. James can‚Äôt help but smile. ‚ÄúApparently Marlene is the one who did it, bought a ring, got down on one knee, the whole thing.‚Äù

‚ÄúMakes sense,‚Äù James says, kissing the top of Harry‚Äôs head just because it‚Äôs there.

‚ÄúMan I just‚Äî‚Äú some of the bubbling excitement drains out of her. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe I can‚Äôt see her,‚Äù and then, looking up at James fiercely, as though expecting a fight. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no way I‚Äôm not going to this wedding.‚Äù

James nods even though he knows it isn‚Äôt up to them, not really. Lily knows that too so there‚Äôs no reason to point it out. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt imagine they would have it without you.‚Äù

Lily looks back down at the letter, and James can practically feel the longing wafting off of her. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt want to‚Ä¶miss everything, you know? I just want to be there. Does that sound awful‚Ä¶selfish.‚Äù She suddenly looks at Harry, guilt clear in her eyes, like she‚Äôs done something wrong.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù James steps forward, kissing her head too. ‚ÄúNo it doesn‚Äôt.‚Äù

It‚Äôs only been a few months, but James feels it too.

Like the world is moving on without them.

It‚Äôs fucking terrifying.

¬†

¬†

His Patronus trails around the border of the room. And for a moment all James can do is stare and ache.

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúBones is missing,‚Äù Sirius‚Äôs haggard voice comes through the mirror.

‚ÄúBones?‚Äù

‚ÄúFrederick Bones.‚Äù

‚ÄúShit.‚Äù

Sirius nods in agreement. ‚ÄúConnor, Mark, Kathy, a few others I don‚Äôt know, all dead‚Äî Order meetings are a rather intimate affair these days.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúOh my God James! James!‚Äù

James comes running into the living room from the kitchen to find Lily and Harry on the ground. She looks over at him, smiling widely.

‚ÄúHarry‚Äôs crawling! Look, look, look,‚Äù she scoots back a little and then holds out her hands to Harry who is currently on his belly. ‚ÄúCome here darling, come on, come here!‚Äù

Harry makes a bit of a face‚ÄîJames secretly thinks of it as his poop face‚Äîbefore all the sudden getting his hands under him and dragging himself forward towards Lily.

‚ÄúWow look at him go,‚Äù James says as Lily gathers the baby in her arms and nuzzles at his head.

‚ÄúYou hear that Harry? You did such a good job. Now I just need you to say momma.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúHis first word is gonna to be dada and we all know it.‚Äù

Lily looks up and sticks her tongue out at him and James laughs.

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, I think he might be a Beater,‚Äù Sirius holds one of Harry‚Äôs little arms up. ‚ÄúLook at these things, rippling mate.‚Äù

James snorts from where he‚Äôs sitting in the armchair across the room. ‚ÄúIf rippling muscles were a requirement for a good Beater you wouldn‚Äôt have even been allowed on the Pitch.‚Äù

‚ÄúWow, rude,‚Äù he dips his head low, whispering to Harry conspiratorially. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt listen to your dad, he doesn‚Äôt know what he‚Äôs talking about. I‚Äôm well fit. ‚Äù

Harry giggles, likely because Sirius‚Äôs breath is tickling his cheek, but Sirius still looks up at James triumphantly. ‚ÄúHe thinks I‚Äôm funny.‚Äù

James rolls his eyes. ‚ÄúHe thinks his toes are funny.‚Äù

Sirius makes a thoughtful expression before looking down at Harry‚Äôs socked feet. He reaches out and gives one a light squeeze. ‚ÄúTo be fair, they are kinda.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat! I‚Äôm just saying‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúBoys,‚Äù Lily chides playfully as she walks into the room, putting a bowl of crisps on the table before sitting down on the floor, leaning back against James‚Äôs legs. ‚ÄúAm I going to have to separate you two?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs insulting our son‚Äôs toes!‚Äù

Sirius scoffs. ‚ÄúPlease, if anything I was complimenting his well developed sense of humour.‚Äù

Lily snorts. ‚ÄúWell, at least you‚Äôre not arguing over something silly.‚Äù

‚ÄúSilly?‚Äù

‚ÄúUs?‚Äù

‚ÄúNever.‚Äù

‚ÄúCan‚Äôt even picture it really.‚Äù

‚ÄúNor can I Prongs, nor can I.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right,‚Äù Lily half-laughs, reaching for the crisps. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know what I was thinking.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a small pause, Sirius playing with Harry while James watches, feeling more at ease than he has in days. Maybe weeks. The impatient buzzing that‚Äôs recently been growing louder beneath his skin has turned down to a quiet hum.

‚ÄúSo,‚Äù Lily asks. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôre things? How‚Äôs Remus?‚Äù

Sirius shrugs, still playing with Harry who is making a series of nonsense noises. It‚Äôs his new favourite thing. Like he‚Äôs talking back to you even though he doesn‚Äôt know any words. Sometimes James babbles with him.

‚ÄúMoony‚Äôs fine, or, you know, was the last time I saw him."

Ah.

Gone again then.

It‚Äôs been years of this now. You'd think they'd all be used to it but somehow it never feels mundane, Remus‚Äôs disappearances. Never feels routine. It‚Äôs isn‚Äôt that they all haven‚Äôt vanished from time to time, but Remus‚Äôs disappearances are certainly the longest and the most consistent. And he is, as Sirius always very bitterly points out, the most secretive.

James and Lily exchange a quick glance and James opens his mouth to say something comforting when Harry beats him to it.

‚ÄúMoomy, moomy, moomy,‚Äù he mutters, pulling on Sirius‚Äôs collar. Lily pops up onto her knees.

‚ÄúDid he just say mommy?‚Äù she asks excitedly.

‚ÄúNo way,‚Äù James will not be losing this battle.

‚ÄúI told you I was gonna be his first word!‚Äù

‚ÄúHe did NOT say mommy, you‚Äôre hearing things Evans."

‚ÄúYou wish Potter.‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù Sirius interrupts, still looking down at Harry. ‚ÄúWould you two shut it, the kid is trying to talk.‚Äù

They quiet down, though James does nudge Lily with his foot, causing her to retaliate by elbowing him in the shins.

Harry has largely gone back to his regular string of indistinguishable noises and James can practically feel Lily getting ready to go get the Pensieve so they can all replay the memory and listen to Harry say it again, when‚Äî

‚ÄúMoomy,‚Äù pulling his fingers out of his mouth and looking up at Sirius. ‚ÄúMoony.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a beat of silence.

‚ÄúDid he just‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúMoony?‚Äù

‚ÄúMoony!‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat the hell!‚Äù James exclaims, throwing his hands up. ‚ÄúHow does Remus get to be MY son‚Äôs first word when the bastard isn‚Äôt even here!‚Äù

Sirius says nothing, staring down at the Harry with something complicated in his eyes, causing Lily and James to once again share a glance. A few more seconds pass before James prods:

‚ÄúPadfoot? You doing alright over there?‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Sirius croaks. ‚ÄúYeah just‚Ä¶‚Äù he lets the sentence hang so long that James is certain he isn‚Äôt going to finish it but then: ‚ÄúI think Remus feels a little on the outside these days‚Ä¶it‚Äôll mean something to him, that Harry knows his name.‚Äù

"Well,‚Äù there‚Äôs a small tremor in Lily‚Äôs voice. ‚ÄúI guess I can get over losing then.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause before she looks pointedly at James. ‚ÄúPfft,‚Äù he scoffs. ‚ÄúNot me, I‚Äôm still fucking livid.‚Äù

That makes Sirius snort, Lily punching James‚Äôs thigh.

‚ÄúMoony!‚Äù Harry exclaims excitedly, making Sirius laugh more.

‚ÄúYeah buddy,‚Äù he says softly. ‚ÄúMoony, Moony, Moony.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

The day that James tries to use the mirror and Sirius doesn‚Äôt pick up he knows something is wrong.

He doesn‚Äôt know how wrong, of course. Not yet. But it‚Äôs enough to start him worrying.¬†

He sits on the end of the bed with the mirror gripped between his hands for close to an hour trying to get a response. But none comes.

That‚Äôs when the panic really sets in.

He paces around the room, not wanting to go downstairs and frightened Lily before he has some actual information‚Äîsomething more than his gut intuition and the certainty that Sirius would never willingly not pick up when he called.

He watches time tick by and does his best not to chew through his own cheek. Every few minutes he tries Sirius again but there‚Äôs only silence, only James‚Äôs reflection staring back at him. One hour turns to two. Then three. And then, finally, he hears a voice.

‚ÄúJames?‚Äù

He lifts the mirror up to eye level, the relief at seeing that Sirius is okay short lived when he takes in his pale face and the blank look in his eyes. When things get bad, truly bad, Sirius shuts off. Regulus was the same. A family trait‚Äîa way to protect themselves from the horrible things they had no choice but to live through.

‚ÄúWhat is it? What‚Äôs happened?‚Äù

James has an eery memory of sitting on the floor of his father‚Äôs study, asking Sirius similar questions before having his world torn apart. He tries to push that away. Dragging up old pain won‚Äôt help him now.

‚ÄúIs Lily there?‚Äù

‚ÄúNot in the room with me.‚Äù

Sirius nods. ‚ÄúYou should go get her.‚Äù His voice is even. Empty. Some people might mistake it for calm. James is not some people. He sees it for what it is‚Äîdevastation.

‚ÄúSirius‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúShe needs to hear this too. And it‚Äôs better‚Ä¶not being alone.‚Äù

James swallows with difficulty. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre scaring me Sirius.‚Äù

The other boy only nods. ‚ÄúGo get Lily.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt bother fighting it, happy when he goes downstairs and finds Harry already down for his afternoon nap, that‚Äôll make things easier. Lily looks up from the book in her lap, giving James a small smile until she sees the expression on his face.

‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù she asks.

James only shakes his head. ‚ÄúSirius wants to talk to both of us.‚Äù

He sees Lily‚Äôs eyes drop to the mirror in his hands and then slide over to Harry. ‚ÄúThe kitchen?‚Äù she says after a moment, and James nods, the pair of them quickly moving into the other room.

‚ÄúHey Lily,‚Äù Sirius says wearily when they‚Äôre seated at the table, both visible in the mirror‚Äôs reflection.

‚ÄúSirius, what‚Äôs going on?‚Äù

For a moment he just looks back at them, mouth half open, struggling around the words, like they‚Äôre trying desperately to scramble back down his throat.

For the first time there‚Äôs a crack in his mask, pain flashing in his eyes. He closes them briefly, taking a deep breath. ‚ÄúThe McKinnion‚Äôs were attacked,‚Äù James feels the sensation of cold dread dripping down his spine, Lily rigid beside him. ‚ÄúThey‚Äîthey‚Äôre all dead.‚Äù His words quiver even while his expression remains unchanged. ‚ÄúMarlene‚Äôs dead.‚Äù

Lily shakes her head. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt looks like it was fast. Not much‚ÄîI don‚Äôt think she‚Äî‚Äú Sirius‚Äôs voice cuts out and he closes his eyes again.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Lily repeats, before standing up and walking out of the room.

‚ÄúLily‚Äî‚Äú James is half out of his seat already. ‚ÄúSirius I‚Äôll call you back okay?‚Äù¬†

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something else,‚Äú the crack in Sirius‚Äôs voice brings James to a halt. He inspects his friend‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

Sirius sighs. ‚ÄúDorcas is missing.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

He hears a loud bang in the other room and looks nervously down the hall. A second later Harry starts to cry.

‚ÄúShe wasn‚Äôt with Mar. She was working and when she heard she fucking took off,‚Äù Sirius wipes a hand over his face. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre looking for her but, god, I don‚Äôt know. I feel like she‚Äôs gone and‚Äî‚Äú his voice breaks again.

Dorcas and Sirius have been working together a lot James knows.

And Marlene‚Äî

There‚Äôs another bang, Harry screaming his little lungs out now.

‚ÄúFuck‚Äîokay I have to go. Are you‚Äîis Remus?‚Äù

Sirius shakes his head. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine. Go. I‚Äôll call back when I can yeah?‚Äù

James nods. ‚ÄúBe careful.‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt know who he‚Äôs supposed to go to first; Lily or Harry. He‚Äôs shaking and a little cold and he knows he isn‚Äôt processing anything, that this will hit him like a brick wall later but he‚Äôs grateful for the numbness now.

He finds Lily in the study, door flung open, her wand in her hand as she fires spells at the fireplace.

‚ÄúLily‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúI need to get out of this house,‚Äù she waves her wand, casting god knows what. James is fairly certain Dumbledore fully took them off the grid and he‚Äôs pretty sure there‚Äôs no way for them to reconnect on this end. ‚ÄúI need to see her.‚Äù

‚ÄúSee who?‚Äù James asks, taking a tentative step forward, both arms raised.

‚ÄúMarlene. I have to see her.‚Äù

‚ÄúLily‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúShe isn‚Äôt,‚Äù Lily snaps, firing another spell that bounces off the mantle causing James to duck. He can hear Harry screaming and it‚Äôs twisting up his stomach. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs hurt maybe, or something, but she isn‚Äôt‚Äîshe isn‚Äôt‚Äî‚Äú Lily just shakes her head, tears filling her eyes. ‚ÄúNot Marlene, you know? She‚Äôs so‚Äîshe has so much life and she‚Äôs so smart and so strong, so she just can‚Äôt be‚Äîshe can‚Äôt be. It isn‚Äôt possible.‚Äù

She raises her wand again but this time James moves, stepping in front of her. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve gotta stop, you‚Äôre gonna do something to the house, it might hurt Harry. You have to stop.‚Äù

Lily blinks, looking at him for the first time. For a moment he‚Äôs worried that she‚Äôs going to fire anyway but she doesn‚Äôt, instead she pushes him out of the way and starts for the front door.

‚ÄúFine, I‚Äôll just break the fucking wards then.‚Äù

‚ÄúLily!‚Äù he follows after her, walking by the living room where Harry wails for their attention. ‚ÄúIf you break the wards you‚Äôre putting us at risk.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care,‚Äù her hand on the doorknob. ‚ÄúSomething has happened to Marlene and I need to find her, I need to be with her, I need to‚Äîto‚Äî‚Äú

He wraps his arms around her from the behind, pulling her back into the house.

‚ÄúLet me fucking go James!‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôm so sorry but I can‚Äôt. We have to think about Harry, we have to‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúLet me go! Let me go! Let me go!‚Äù she‚Äôs sobbing now, kicking and punching as James drags her back into the living room.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù his voice wobbles. ‚ÄúBut we can‚Äôt do anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúLily‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúThis can‚Äôt keep happening!‚Äù she shouts desperately, voice scraping itself raw on her teeth. ‚ÄúHow can this keep happening? How can we‚Äîno, I won‚Äôt. I won‚Äôt lose her. I can‚Äôt lose her. Please let me go. Please, please I just need to see her. I just need to hear her voice. Please. I can‚Äôt do this again. I can‚Äôt lose someone again. Please.‚Äù

They‚Äôve somehow ended up on the floor, James curling himself around Lily as she stops fighting him and starts just crying. Shaking so badly James can barely keep his grip.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù he whispers, kissing her temple. It‚Äôs all he can say. It‚Äôs all he has. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù He hears the scratchiness of his own voice. Harry howling in the background. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù He thinks he‚Äôs crying now too and he hopes Harry can‚Äôt see. He hopes he has no idea what‚Äôs going on. He hopes he never remembers this moment.

Hopes his life isn‚Äôt a series of moments just like it.

¬†

¬†

It takes Voldemort himself to kill Dorcas. Though she manages to take quite a few of his followers down with her.

They can‚Äôt go to the funerals, of course.

Lily shuts herself away in their bedroom.

¬†

¬†

Harry‚Äôs first birthday comes and goes. They bake a cake, they sing songs, Harry makes an absolute mess.

Sirius sends him a toy broom which James honestly falls in love with as much as Harry does. The kid taking to it like it‚Äôs the most natural thing in the world‚Äîspeeding around, giggling. James is jealous honestly. It‚Äôs been ages since he‚Äôs flown.

That night he stays up late, his Patronus glowing brightly beside him as he sits with his head in his hands.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want his whole life to be like this,‚Äù he says.

He doesn‚Äôt know who he‚Äôs talking to.

Well.

Okay.

Maybe he does.

‚ÄúTrapped in this house. He should be outside, he should be surrounded by family and other kids and not just our fucking misery.‚Äù Because nothing has been the same since Marlene and Dorcas. How could it be?

‚ÄúThis house is full of grief,‚Äù James sighs, scrubbing at his eyes. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want his life to be full of grief,‚Äù and then: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want my life to be full of grief.‚Äù ¬† ¬†

¬†

¬†

It‚Äôs a month or so later that Sirius shows up unannounced.

He looks nervous, like he hasn‚Äôt been sleeping, pacing up and down their living room as they watch from the sofa, ringing his hands, pulling at his hair. It feels like they wait a long time, his anxiety too loud to interrupt, to cut through, filling the whole room and making all of them squirm.

Until eventually he stops, eyes wide, begging them to understand. ‚ÄúI think you need to pick a new Secret Keeper.‚Äù

Which is not at all what James was expecting.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm too obvious,‚Äù Sirius goes on, with the air of someone who has had this thought again and again and again. ‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôm worried‚ÄîI‚Äôm worried that they‚Äôll be able to kill me. And if they do then you won‚Äôt be safe anymore.‚Äù James can‚Äôt quite understand why he looks so guilty. ‚ÄúI would die for you, for all of you, in a heartbeat. You know that,‚Äù he looks pleadingly at James who nods quickly.

‚ÄúOf course I do.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut I don‚Äôt want to be the reason you‚Äôre not safe. I don‚Äôt want to be the reason‚Äî‚Äú he swallows. ‚ÄúYou need a new Secret Keeper.‚Äù

James wants to argue with him, but he isn‚Äôt sure that Sirius is entirely wrong. It‚Äôs not exactly a secret how close they are, and while Sirius might not mind dying for them, James certainly doesn‚Äôt want him to.

‚ÄúWho are you thinking?‚Äù Lily asks eventually. ‚ÄúRemus?"

There‚Äôs that guilt again. Sirius looks away, shaking his head. ‚ÄúNo, still too obvious,‚Äù James thinks there‚Äôs more than that but Sirius doesn‚Äôt give him the chance to push. ‚ÄúPeter.‚Äù

‚ÄúPeter?‚Äù James asks, surprised.

Sirius looks up again, more certainty in his gaze. ‚ÄúNo one will suspect it. Not him. Not Pete. No one ever thinks it‚Äôs Pete, not even back in school.‚Äù

James chews on his bottom lip, thinking, before he looks to Lily.

‚ÄúIt makes sense,‚Äù she says finally.¬†

He isn‚Äôt sure why it doesn‚Äôt feel right, why the idea makes something itch inside of his chest. Eventually he turns back to Sirius. ‚ÄúYou think this is our best option?‚Äù

Sirius nods. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôll come for me, it‚Äôs only a matter of time. At least this way, if they manage to‚Ä¶at least this way you‚Äôll be okay.‚Äù

Which couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth.

If Sirius dies James dies. But he doesn‚Äôt bother pointing that out. Doesn‚Äôt think he needs to. Clearly this has been weighing on Sirius, so, eventually, he nods.

‚ÄúSomeone should go get Pete.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúWait, wait, wait!‚Äù Lily dashes up the stairs, leaving Harry and James to stare at one another, James holding a camera.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt look at me,‚Äù he says to the one year old. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what she‚Äôs doing.‚Äù

Harry gives him a wide eyed blink. ‚ÄúMoomy.‚Äù

It isn‚Äôt that Harry hasn‚Äôt learned any other words, he has. Like broom, and hungry, and no. But the only name he seems to have picked up is Moony. For whatever reason.

‚ÄúNot quite buddy,‚Äù James says as he hears the sound of Lily running back down the stairs, skidding into the living room.

‚ÄúHe needs his hat!‚Äù she says breathlessly. ‚ÄúIt makes the whole thing.‚Äù

‚ÄúUh-huh.‚Äù

She shoots him a glare as she pulls the round cap with the pointed stem over Harry‚Äôs head. Stepping back and smiling. ‚ÄúThere, perfect.‚Äù

In fairness, the hat really does pull it all together. Little Harry sitting in the middle of the sofa dressed like a very convincing pumpkin. ‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù James says, lifting the camera up to his face, ‚Äúsay cheese.‚Äù

Harry smiles most of the time so it isn‚Äôt hard to get a good picture. Honestly James thinks he could stare at him for hours‚Äîhis big green eyes, his dark peach fuzz hair, his chubby cheeks.

Perfect.

Everything about him is perfect.

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù James laughs as Lily rushes into the frame, jumping on the sofa and peppering Harry with kisses. ‚ÄúM‚Äôam, please, you‚Äôre harassing my model.‚Äù Though he snaps a few more photos while he says it.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt help it, he's so cute,‚Äù she pulls Harry into her lap, his hat lost as she bounces him up and down on her knee. ‚ÄúAren‚Äôt you?‚Äù she says in a baby voice, leaning forward to brush their noses together. ‚ÄúAren‚Äôt you just the cutest?‚Äù Harry giggles and James puts down the camera, coming over to join them.

‚ÄúWe should have bought sweets,‚Äù he says, arm draped over Lily‚Äôs shoulders, pulling her into his side. ‚ÄúBit of a sad Halloween without them.‚Äù

Lily laughs. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a baby, he can‚Äôt eat sweets.‚Äù

‚ÄúWho says they would be for him?‚Äù

Harry is playing with Lily‚Äôs necklace and occasionally interspersing his baby babble with actual words. Something about the moment‚Äîthe three of them sitting together on the sofa‚Äîmakes James feel settled. Almost calm. A rare thing these days.¬†

‚ÄúTake him for a minute?‚Äù Lily says as she shifts Harry to James‚Äôs lap, ‚ÄúI'm just going to run upstairs and put on some music.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs not Monster Mash I don‚Äôt wanna hear it!‚Äù James shouts after her.

‚ÄúYou know, sometimes I can‚Äôt tell who the baby is, you or Harry!‚Äù

‚ÄúOi!‚Äù and then, leaning down and whispering to Harry; ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs me, but don‚Äôt tell her I said that.‚Äù

Harry just blinks at him, and then giggles, causing¬† a smile to spread across James‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúYou really are unfairly cute,‚Äù he goes on in the same quiet tone. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not saying you should be grateful, but we honestly outdid ourselves with this,‚Äù he waves his hand vaguely at Harry‚Äôs face, which, of course, has the toddler reaching out and trying to stuff James‚Äôs fingers in his mouth.

‚ÄúHopefully you get your mum‚Äôs eyesight along with her eyes though,‚Äù he goes on as Harry attempts to eat him. ‚ÄúThe glasses are a real pain especially on the Pitch,‚Äù another smile creeps up on him. ‚ÄúMerlin, I can‚Äôt wait to watch you play.
