You‚Äôre gonna be brilliant, I can already tell.‚Äù¬†

Sometimes, when he looks at Harry, when he thinks about everything he wants to show him and tell him and watch him do, he feels like his chest is too small. Like it can‚Äôt hold the impossible amount of love he has for this one little being.

‚ÄúThis doesn‚Äôt sound like Monster Mash!‚Äù he says, as Lily starts coming back down the stairs.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs because I have taste,‚Äù he watches her face warm as she comes through the doorway. ‚ÄúAw, you two look so cozy.‚Äù

‚ÄúExcuse you, we‚Äôre very fearsome, isn‚Äôt that right pumpkin?‚Äù he leans down and presses a kiss to Harry‚Äôs forehead causing him to squirm.¬†

‚ÄúUh-huh,‚Äù Lily climbs back onto the sofa, curling into James‚Äôs side. She hums along to the song which Harry seems to enjoy quite a bit, clapping and reaching for her. In general he‚Äôs an excellent source of entertainment. Sure, his abilities to articulate thoughts and move are limited, but Harry‚Äôs always doing something. And everything he does is fascinating to James.¬†

That‚Äôs when he feels it.

A slight tremor.

But it isn‚Äôt coming from the ground, like an earthquake, instead it‚Äôs the space around them. The air rippling.

Lily instantly sits up. ‚ÄúThat was weird.‚Äù

Quiet falls over the house. A moment ago there was the noise of children out on the street, banging on doors, demanding sweets. The popping of Apparation as people jumped from one neighbourhood to the next. Talking. Laughing.

Now.

Now there‚Äôs nothing.

Not even the wind.

It‚Äôs unnerving.

Wordlessly James slides Harry off of his lap and into Lily‚Äôs arms. ‚ÄúJames?‚Äù she asks, whispering, because it suddenly feels as though they need to be just as quiet as their surroundings.

Which is when James realizes; ‚ÄúThe music‚Äôs stopped.‚Äù

Lily‚Äôs face scrunches up as she looks towards the ceiling, like she can see the record player. ‚ÄúStrange,‚Äù she murmurs. ‚ÄúI wonder if the needle got stuck?‚Äù

Sound is a wave. Physical even if we can‚Äôt see it. And all James can think about is that tremor. Powerful enough to knock the music out of the air.

‚ÄúThe wards,‚Äù he says finally. Moving faster now, towards the window. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the wards. They‚Äôre broken.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù he hears the panic in Lily‚Äôs voice a moment before he‚Äôs able to see outside. Able to see the man walking leisurely up their front steps.

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúLily it‚Äôs him,‚Äù he feels his body go numb, preventing him from being able to process those words. ‚ÄúYou have to run.‚Äù There‚Äôs scuffling on the front stoop. The door‚Äôs locked of course. A laughable precaution.

‚ÄúRun?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll try to hold him off,‚Äù James is already heading for the front door. ‚ÄúFind a way out. Get Harry somewhere safe.‚Äù

The doorknob turns

‚ÄúJames‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúLily. Please.‚Äù

He‚Äôs shaking as he listens to the sound of her running up the stairs, reaching for his wand and laughing when he finds it isn‚Äôt there. He has no idea where he left it. In the kitchen after fixing a quick snack? The living room floor after playing with Harry? He barely needs it at all these days, he‚Äôs gotten lazy with it.

Of course, he‚Äôs been wand-less in moments like this before. Like when he was fifteen. Standing in the Shrieking Shack between Snape and Remus. Things worked out alright then. Maybe he‚Äôll pull it off now too?

The sick feeling in his stomach suggests he doesn‚Äôt quite believe that.

Funny, how everything speeds up and slows down all at once. Seconds stretching into hours, the door opening for lifetimes. His lifetime. And the many lifetimes he didn‚Äôt live. James feels himself splintering even before he sees Voldemort‚Äôs face. The strings attached to all his possible endings being snipped one by one. All the choices he could have made falling away.

This is the last one.

There will be no more.

Where once there were multitudes now there is but a single boy. Naked. And alone. Standing at the front door of his family home. Meeting an unexpected guest. In a way, this is just how it all started.

He considers charging, maybe he can knock the wand out of the other man‚Äôs hand. Maybe, in the end, Voldemort will be taken down not by some great feat of magic but by desperate fists. It‚Äôs only a fleeting thought however, not even lasting a second.

The minute that James meets the older man‚Äôs eyes it‚Äôs already too late.¬† ¬† ¬†

The spell cast.

As all his lives play out before his eyes in the pitiful moments before he dies, only one thought really rises above the other‚Äôs. So that, the last thing that James Potter thinks about, with his beating heart and fluttering pulse, is Sirius Black.

A moment in a train carriage, their eyes crashing into one another for the first time, like two suns colliding. He was bright without Sirius, but he was brighter with him. His universe set fundamentally to rights the moment they shook hands.

If Sirius dies James dies. And if James dies‚Äî

Sirius.

He barely feels it when the green bolt slides between his ribs. It‚Äôs just a shiver really. A chill. Not so bad at all. Maybe it didn‚Äôt work. Maybe something went wrong. Maybe he‚Äôs still breathing.

Except that he‚Äôs falling.

Crashing to the floor as the world becomes a mash of indistinguishable sounds and colours.

Oh Sirius, I‚Äôm so sor‚Äî

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

Inhale.

¬†

Exhale.

¬†

Exhale.

¬†

Exha‚Äî

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

PART IV SIRIUS

¬†

He feels it all.

¬†

All at once.

¬†

Inescapable.

¬†

He feels it all.

¬†

And it hurts,

¬†

hurts

¬†

hurts.

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

PART V REMUS

¬†

When Remus comes home the flat is dark.

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

PART VI MARY

¬†

It‚Äôs been years since Mary Macdonald last stepped foot in Hogwarts. Probably just as long since she last stared across a desk at Albus Dumbledore. The quality of the experience has not improved.

‚ÄúPetunia Evans.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Dursley, actually,‚Äù Dumbledore corrects her mildly.

There is something like rage humming beneath her skin, so close to the surface it‚Äôs practically reaching across the desk. He should really be more careful.

‚ÄúLily would never have wanted that.‚Äù

Dumbledore inclines his head in agreement. ‚ÄúAlas, the guardians she did want are currently indisposed.‚Äù

Imprisoned.

Insane.

Mary‚Äôs nails dig into the arms of her chair as his blue eyes stare calmly back at her. Twinkling. Like he‚Äôs enjoying this.

‚ÄúThen let me take him.‚Äù

The older man arches his brow. ‚ÄúYou want to raise their baby?‚Äù he tugs lightly on his beard. ‚ÄúI must admit Ms. Macdonald, I am rather surprised. You always seemed so reluctant to get involved.‚Äù

It‚Äôs an obvious attack. Boring and uninspired. ‚ÄúYes, well, I‚Äôm full of surprises.‚Äù

He smiles. It isn‚Äôt reassuring. ‚ÄúYou certainly are. Unfortunately, the child has to stay where he is. Though I‚Äôm sure James and Lily would have appreciated your willingness to help.‚Äù

Mary barely holds in the urge to rip their names out of his mouth. ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù she says, voice blank. ‚ÄúI misspoke earlier. What I meant to say was; I will be taking Harry. Seeing as he is not yours to give away I actually don‚Äôt require your permission. I just needed to know where he was.‚Äù

She moves to get up but Dumbledore‚Äôs words stop her. ‚ÄúI do actually have authority in this matter, as it happens. Since Remus Lupin was Black‚Äôs legal common law partner, and the two named guardians have been deemed unfit to make decisions, the power of Harry‚Äôs guardianship falls to him,‚Äù still smiling. ‚ÄúAnd he has chosen to defer to me.‚Äù

‚ÄúBullshit,‚Äù she snaps. ‚ÄúRemus is catatonic, he can barely speak let alone legally consent to anything.‚Äù

Dumbledore opens his palms to her. ‚ÄúThe Ministry disagrees with you.‚Äù

‚ÄúFuck the Ministry.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôd like to check this with the Minister I can certainly organize a meeting‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúFuck the Ministry and fuck you,‚Äù her vision blurs around the edges, seconds away from exploding. From burning the school down. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm taking Harry.‚Äù

She doesn‚Äôt wait for a reply, turning on her heel and heading towards the door. The only thing stopping her from reaching for her wand is the knowledge that Harry already has one person who was meant to care for him in jail. He certainly doesn‚Äôt need another.

‚ÄúMs. Macdonald.‚Äù

She doesn‚Äôt stop.

Has no interest in what he has to say.

Never has really.

‚ÄúMs. Macdonald‚ÄîMary.‚Äù

Hand on the doorknob.

‚Äú29 Hendford Hill.‚Äù

She freezes, her whole body going stiff.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs your brother‚Äôs address is it not? Damian?‚Äù

She turns to face him, the rage transforming into something else. Something like acid. Something like fear. Dumbledore is standing now, illuminated by the tall windows behind him. He almost glows.

‚ÄúYou will leave Harry Potter where he is,‚Äù all warmth gone from his voice. The curtain pulled back. The Wizard of Oz revealed. ‚ÄúYou will not speak to him, you will not write to him, you will have no contact with him at all.‚Äù

She wonders how they all missed it. How they couldn‚Äôt see. She doesn‚Äôt know if it would have made a difference. Maybe they‚Äôd all still be gone even without Dumbledore‚Äôs help.

‚ÄúAnd I promise,‚Äù the old man goes on, ‚Äúto show your brother the same curtesy.‚Äù

To let him live.¬†

For the first time in years, Mary Macdonald feels herself crack.¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

PART VII PETER

¬†

Peter has never given much thought to what kind of person he is.

Those larger questions, the ones that try to tear life open and understand it, never appeal to him. Those are Remus‚Äôs specialty.

Peter simply is a person. That is enough for him.

When he feels desire he moves towards it.

When he feels fear he moves away.

He does not think life is meant to be more complicated than that. We‚Äôre animals after all. Things only mean more because we decide they do.

Death, is one of those things.

Peter has lost himself to grief. To the pain of it. The ache. But that was before he realized he had a choice.

Death hurts because humans decide to make it hurt.

They decide you should cry.

Tear your hair out.

Scream.

So you do. But death, like life, has no inherent meaning. It simply is. A fact. A state of being. There‚Äôs no need for all the theatrics. No need to tear yourself up about it. If you simply ignore everything you‚Äôre taught, death can be something quite mundane.

Well.

Other people‚Äôs deaths, in any case.

Peter first learned this as he stood over Marlene McKinnon‚Äôs body.

Initially, there was that swelling of feeling. That ache. That pain. But then he‚Äôd made himself stop.

Stop.

Stop it.

It doesn‚Äôt mean anything. Doesn‚Äôt actually hurt. You just think it does. You‚Äôve just been taught that it does. But that isn‚Äôt actually how you feel.

In the end her death had seemed almost dull. Like there really ought to have been more to it. He‚Äôd stood over her, eyes staring up at him unseeing, and thought; ‚Äúthat wasn‚Äôt so bad.‚Äù He could do it again. If it was necessary. If he needed to. If it kept him alive. Because that did matter, that always mattered.

Peter mattered.

That‚Äôs what the Dark Lord said.

It was one of the many reasons he was growing tired of his school friends. Especially Remus and Sirius. Listening to them suspect one another. Giving each other credit for his work. At first he had taken it as a compliment, that they didn‚Äôt think he would ever turn on them, but he quickly realized that wasn‚Äôt what it was. They had simply forgotten to consider him all together. He was a non-factor. Too lowly even to be suspected.

Voldemort, on the other hand, never forgot about Peter. He corresponded with him frequently, smiling whenever Peter came to see him. There had been no more fuck-ups since the travesty at the Ministry two years ago, and that had placed Peter firmly back in the Dark Lord‚Äôs good graces. The Dark Lord had even revealed his identity to his more high-ranking followers. Forcing Lucius Malfoy and Rodolphus Lestrange to thank him for his great service. When there were meetings he sat at the head of the table.

It was impossible not to notice him.

Not to see him.

Not to consider him.

Still, it wasn‚Äôt actually his intent to give James up to Voldemort. At least not at first. It meant a great deal to him that James had decided to change his mind. To make Peter the Secret Keeper‚Äîas he should have been all along honestly. Sirius was far too brash for something like that. Too careless. Peter had always felt he was the obvious choice.

For a while he had become quite devoted to James again, visiting often, delivering whatever it was that he and Lily needed, playing with little baby Harry. He‚Äôd honestly started to reconsider things. Clearly James was coming around, seeing him the way he had when they were kids, before Hogwarts‚Äîas someone worthy of his time.

He mattered.

Peter mattered.

But more and more he noticed that all James ever wanted to talk about was the others; Sirius, Remus, Mary, Alice, Frank. It was never questions about Peter. He had come up with dozens of excuses he could use to explain his frequent absences but he never needed them. No one asked where he‚Äôd been or what he was up to. No one cared much how he spent his time.

There had been years when he had been James Potter‚Äôs closest friend. His only friend, really. They had spent nearly every day together. How could James just forget that? Toss it all aside for Sirius? It wasn‚Äôt that Peter didn‚Äôt like Sirius. Or Remus. Of course he did. But he didn‚Äôt like them more than he liked himself.¬†

James had seen something in him once. Something that had made him leave a room full of people to follow Peter upstairs. Somehow he‚Äôd lost sight of that. But Peter was tired of being forgotten. And tired of being afraid. They all thought they knew better than him, but they were on the wrong side. The losing side. And while all of them sunk Peter floated.

Regulus Black left a hole in Voldemort‚Äôs ranks. His family name would have made him the obvious choice to be Voldemort‚Äôs prot√©g√©. He wouldn‚Äôt even have needed to work for it,¬† to prove his worth‚Äîit all would have been handed to him. But he bumbled it. He hadn‚Äôt figured out what Peter had‚Äîthat you get to choose what matters. What means something. You get to choose what is right and what is wrong.

Peter thinks again of the memory of Marlene‚Äôs dead body.

It had been right, in the end, that she die.

Right for him anyway.

And now he can take Regulus‚Äôs place the same way Sirius has taken his‚Äîthere‚Äôs a neat sort of symmetry in that.

So though it took him a few months to decide, he did eventually turn James over to Voldemort. And he expected the same nothing as he‚Äôd felt with Marlene. Really this ought to be even easier, since he wouldn‚Äôt be there.

And in a way, it was. There was no fretting‚Äîwell, not much fretting‚Äîno tearing out of hair, no crying. Peter simply went about his day like anyone else. And yet. At exactly 8:32 pm on October 31st 1981, Peter‚Äôs world dimmed.

He would argue with himself about this for years to come.

Because that was absurd.

The loss of one person could not possibly alter the universe so greatly.

But somehow all colours felt suddenly less vibrant. The food he ate less tasteful. Every piece of music, every summer‚Äôs day, every touch‚Äîduller.

He was certain he was making it up.

Certain.

But what he could not deny, what he eventually accepted the day his own hand wrapped around his neck, was that no matter how high he rose, how far out of the muck and dust of the war he was able to elevate himself, how close to the top Peter Pettigrew got.

He never did feel the sun again.¬†

¬†

Chapter End Notes

I don't really have the words to describe what writing this story has meant
There is so much of it that is so deeply personal for me and the fact that it has resonated with so many of you is more than I ever could have asked for when I started writing it

So thank you all for sticking around, for your patience and your kindness and for all collectively agreeing that James is so fucking dumb for thinking Remus had a crush on Mary in chapter 2, like bro please get it together

THERE IS STILL AN EPILOGUE it should be posted in the next few days and it'll end us on a bit of a happier note but, yeah, wow, okay, bye I guess????? Yeesh

Hope y'all are having a good day :)

Epilogue

Chapter Notes

**French translations at the end**

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Past the ocean-stream they went, past the white rock, past the portals of the sun and land of dreams, and soon they reached the field of asphodel, where spirits dwell, spectres of worn-out men. Here they came upon the spirit of Achilles, son of Peleus, and of Patroclus too.

¬†

¬†

This is the place where everything and nothing touch and all that we are is set free, spilling over our lines, bleeding out. Memories, thoughts, feelings, no longer contained by the borders of our bodies. Here is where life and death are old friends who meet for tea, and ask after one another‚Äôs health. Here is where a boy with dark curls and stormy eyes stands in a garden somewhere in Scotland, tall grass tickling his kneecaps as he watches the clouds on the horizon.

His eyes close and he tilts his head up, basking in the light. The sun, usually distant and faded‚Äîa memory and nothing more‚Äîtoday, is bright and warm, placing gentle kisses on his cheeks, his hair, his shoulders.

‚ÄúOkay I give up, what are you doing?‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes snap open as he spins around. James Potter is leaning against one of the trees behind him, arms crossed over his chest, a smile hanging from the corner of his mouth, the sun glinting off his glasses. The messy haired boy squints up at the sky.

‚ÄúNo stars, so you‚Äôre not talking to anyone. Sun tanning maybe? You‚Äôll have to take off a few more layers for that,‚Äù he gives Regulus a wink.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI said‚Äî‚Äú

‚ÄúNo‚Äîshut up‚ÄîI heard you.‚Äù

James holds his hands up in surrender. ‚ÄúHey, you asked.‚Äù

‚ÄúI meant‚Äî‚Äú Regulus cuts himself off, scrubbing at his eyes. ‚ÄúWhat are you doing here?‚Äù his voice shakes.

‚ÄúShamelessly ogling you.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo‚Äîstop it‚Äîstop,‚Äù he‚Äôs shaking. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt be here.‚Äú

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù James‚Äôs voice goes soft and it makes every part of Regulus‚Äîevery thought and feeling and memory that makes him up‚Äîcrumble to dust.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he shakes his head. ‚ÄúTell me this isn‚Äôt‚Äîthis isn‚Äôt real. You can‚Äôt be here.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù he sounds closer but Regulus can‚Äôt open his eyes.

‚ÄúI did the right thing,‚Äù his voice wobbles.

‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou were supposed to be okay. I did the right thing, dangerous and stupid, but I did it so that you would be okay. You were supposed to be okay.‚Äù

Regulus doesn‚Äôt know how he can be struggling to breathe when he doesn‚Äôt even have a pulse.

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù in that same soft voice. ‚ÄúLook at me?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúPlease?‚Äù

‚ÄúGo away. Please go away. Please don‚Äôt be here. Don‚Äôt be here. James you shouldn‚Äôt be here. You were having a baby.‚Äù

‚ÄúHad him‚Äîwell, Lily had him if we‚Äôre being technical about it.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt funny.‚Äù

‚ÄúReg,‚Äù he sighs. ‚ÄúPlease look at me?‚Äù

He doesn‚Äôt want to. He really doesn‚Äôt. So he has no idea why he does, but then, he‚Äôs never been able to control himself with James. The garden comes back into focus, James‚Äôs eyes colliding with his.

And his heart,

the one that doesn‚Äôt beat anymore,

doesn‚Äôt even exist really,

hiccup,

hiccup,

hiccups.

James offers him a gentle smile. ‚ÄúThere you are.‚Äù

Regulus is still shaking his head. ‚ÄúJust this once,‚Äù his voice breaks, ‚ÄúI wanted to be the one to catch you.‚Äù

If James is confused he doesn‚Äôt show it, instead he opens his arms‚Äîan invitation. Regulus launches himself forward, surprised to find James so solid. So sturdy. So real. His fingers tangle in James‚Äôs shirt. He‚Äôs desperate not to let him go. Heartbroken he has him at all.¬†

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so proud of you,‚Äù James whispers, kissing the top of Regulus‚Äôs head. ‚ÄúYou were so brave.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt didn‚Äôt matter.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt mattered. Reg, of course it mattered.‚Äù

A pained noise comes from Regulus‚Äôs throat as he pulls James closer, like he wants to slip inside his skin. Maybe he can. He hasn‚Äôt quite figured out the rules of this yet.

‚ÄúIf it had mattered you wouldn‚Äôt be here.‚Äù

There‚Äôs a pause, James‚Äôs hands running up and down his back. ‚ÄúIt mattered,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt mattered to me.‚Äù

Regulus is sobbing. He doesn‚Äôt care. He doesn‚Äôt care anymore. He isn‚Äôt even real. He isn‚Äôt even him. He can cry.

‚ÄúRegulus,‚Äù James says softly.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want you to be dead,‚Äù his words thick, spoken into James‚Äôs chest. He isn‚Äôt sure why it still hurts so much. ‚ÄúFuck I don‚Äôt want you to be dead.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah well, I‚Äôm not particularly thrilled about you being here either,‚Äù and then; ‚ÄúYou promised Reg.‚Äù

That feels like a sucker punch, and Regulus actually has to pull back. Recovering from the hit. Finding James‚Äôs eyes.

James Potter. Looking at him.

Looking.

Looking.

Looking.

It never stops feeling monumental.

‚ÄúI meant it,‚Äù Regulus finally manages. ‚ÄúI meant to come back. I swear I did.‚Äù

Those words drift between them for a moment, setting down roots, growing vines that sneak up their legs, that slip between their ribs. James‚Äôs hand slides up Regulus‚Äôs neck, cupping his face.

‚ÄúI love you.‚Äù

I love you.

I love you.

Regulus‚Äôs whole body reacts, quivering under the impact. Eyes fluttering closed.

‚ÄúJe t‚Äôaime.‚Äù

Since I was eleven.

James‚Äôs lips press against his.

And he isn‚Äôt even real.

Isn‚Äôt even here.

Isn‚Äôt even him.

But oh how he feels. Warmth filling him up, breaking him open, pulling him apart. It‚Äôs too much. Too much. And not nearly enough. Everything that‚Äôs been keeping him in falls away. Regulus is boundless, intertwining with James, the pair of them nothing but ash. Nothing but dust. Nothing but love.

Love.

Love.

The garden disappears.

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúHello?‚Äù

Lily steps into her childhood home, all the windows thrown wide open, curtains fluttering in the warm breeze. It‚Äôs too bright to be able to see anything outside but white light. She pushes cautiously further into the house, vaguely aware of the distant sound of music.

‚ÄúHello?‚Äù

Two little girls run down the stairs and nearly bowl her over, laughing and giggling, their hair whipping behind them like capes. Lily tries to keep up with them but loses them down the corridor. The music growing louder.

Haven't felt like this, my dear

Since can't remember when

It's been a long, long time

Light slips through the cracks in the floors and the walls, leaking in like water. It makes everything sparkle and glow, Lily cutting through the beams as she makes her way into the kitchen and startles to a stop.

Her mum has her head tilted back, laughing as her dad twirls them around the room. The sun makes them look almost golden. She watches, letting the music swell, filling her up. They look young, her parents. Or maybe they just look happy.

Every few seconds, out of the corner of her eye, she swears she sees the two girls again. Giggling. Chasing one another. But as soon as she turns her head they‚Äôre gone.

‚ÄúHello bug.‚Äù

Lily‚Äôs attention snaps back to her parents, they‚Äôve stopped dancing, their gazes finally finding her.

She tries to speak, but when she opens her mouth nothing manages to come out. All her words failing her. There might be tears on her cheeks, she can‚Äôt tell.¬†

‚ÄúOh, darling.‚Äù¬†

The next second they‚Äôre on either side of her, holding, hugging, kissing her temple, the top of her head.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve missed you so much,‚Äù her voice a wreck.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve missed you too.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs alright. It‚Äôs alright.‚Äù

They fall into one another.

Swallowed by the light.

¬†

¬†

Regulus grips the broom tightly in his hands‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt know where it came from, where he came from, doesn‚Äôt know where he is, but it hardly matters. He speeds through the air a little recklessly.

He‚Äôs always loved going fast.

The wind whips the hair out of his face as he drops towards the ground, falling, falling, falling. And then, at the last second, pulling up.

A laugh tumbles out of his mouth before he can help it, his whole body singing. Which is why it takes a moment for him to realize that someone else is laughing too. And clapping. He looks down and finds his father beaming up at him. Orion‚Äôs dark hair tied in a ponytail at the back of his head, his eyes twinkling as they follow Regulus‚Äôs descent to the ground.

‚ÄúPapa,‚Äù he stumbles off his broom and towards a man he hasn‚Äôt seen in years‚Äîstrong and tall, his cheeks full, towering above Regulus.

‚ÄúThat was spectacular, mon chou. You are an artiste huh? An artist in the sky.‚Äù

Regulus only shakes his head. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre here.‚Äù

‚ÄúOui, pour toi. Je veux te voir voler. Rien ne m'apporte plus de joie que de te voir dans le ciel, mon ch√©ri.‚Äù

His father reaches out for him, large hands gently holding either side of Regulus‚Äôs face, his eyes wet. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry I didn‚Äôt visit,‚Äù Regulus says in a small voice. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know how.‚Äù

Orion only smiles, leaning down and kissing his forehead. ‚ÄúPlus de regrets, d‚Äôaccord? Pas ici.‚Äù

Regulus nods, swallowing. ‚ÄúNot here,‚Äù he whispers in agreement, closing his eyes.

¬†

¬†

Lily laughs as James tickles her sides, the pair rolling around in the fourposter bed, curtains drawn, the only light coming from their lit wands that they‚Äôve already lost somewhere in the sheets.

‚ÄúStop it! Stop!‚Äù Lily giggles, shoving and pushing at him. James must have thrown his glasses off at some point because he isn‚Äôt wearing them now, hair a mess as he grins down at her.

‚ÄúOr what?‚Äù he asks, voice husky. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôre you gonna do Evans?‚Äù

Lily smirks, their heavy breathing loud in the small space. ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt you like to know.‚Äù

James‚Äôs eyes dip down to her mouth a second before he takes it. And Lily opens for him, lets him in, swallows the groan that punches out of him when she arches her back.

‚ÄúYou remembered the silencing charm right?‚Äù James breathes against her lips.

‚ÄúI thought you were casting it?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo I‚Äî‚Äú James‚Äôs eyes go wide, darting to the curtains. ‚ÄúShit.‚Äù

Lily only laughs, and in one swift motion flips them over.

‚ÄúOof,‚Äù James lets out as he lands on his back, Lily straddling his hips, running her hands along his arms and pinning them above his head.

‚ÄúWell then,‚Äù she whispers, dropping her face down so that their noses nearly touch. ‚ÄúGuess you‚Äôll just have to be quiet.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

‚ÄúHow did I not know you snogged Gilderoy?‚Äù Marlene asks through a mouthful of crips. She‚Äôs lying on her back on the floor of the girl‚Äôs dormitory, Dorcas leaning against the bed beside her, Lily on top of it. Everything is a little fuzzy. A little soft. Like they‚Äôre watching an old movie.

‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt really a snog,‚Äù Dorcas rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúMore like‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúA peck?‚Äù Lily offers helpfully.

Dorcas scrunches up her face. ‚ÄúMore than a peck.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou snogged him! Just admit it!‚Äù

Dorcas kicks Marlene who throws her crisps at her in retaliation, Lily laughing at them from above.

‚ÄúIt was just a kiss that‚Äôs all,‚Äù Dorcas says in a huff.

Marlene rolls her eyes. ‚ÄúUh-huh.‚Äù

‚ÄúShut-it McKinnon.‚Äù

Marlene looks up at her, watches the way she bites her lip, trying to hold back a smile. Jutting her chin out defiantly Marlene replies; ‚ÄúMake me Meadowes.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

They lie tangled up together, the Come and Go Room glowing around them. There‚Äôs no mirror on the wall, the carvings on full display;

¬†

G & S

¬†

J & R

¬†

More than once James finds Regulus‚Äôs eyes trailing over to them. Finds his own eyes trailing over to them. James lifts Regulus‚Äôs hand to his mouth, kissing each of his fingertips, his knuckles, enjoying watching Regulus fight back a smile.

‚ÄúYou reckon anyone will ever find them?‚Äù he nods towards the initials.

Regulus looks at them thoughtfully, letting James turn over his hand, kissing his wrist, the spot where his pulse would be.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù he says finally. ‚ÄúWe did, after all.‚Äù

James hums against his skin. ‚ÄúBig gap between us and them,‚Äù he still can‚Äôt quite believe it was really Salazar and Godric who had this room before them.

‚ÄúIn another hundred years then,‚Äù Regulus says. ‚ÄúThere will be another pair of idiots.‚Äù

‚ÄúSpeak for yourself, I‚Äôm well clever.‚Äù

Regulus snorts despite his best efforts not to, putting his hand in James‚Äôs face and shoving him away. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre insufferable is what you are.‚Äù

James grabs hold of Regulus‚Äôs wrist yanking him on top of him. Chest to chest, nose to nose. Regulus holds himself up on his elbows, James staring at him. ‚ÄúYou suffer me just fine,‚Äù the older boy says finally. Quietly.

And Regulus can‚Äôt help it, he kisses him. The corner of his mouth, the hinge of his jaw, the side of his neck. James holding still and letting him.

Regulus isn‚Äôt surprised it took so long for this room to be found again.

It takes centuries to grow this kind of love.

¬†

¬†

The dining table in the Potter‚Äôs cottage is covered in food and surrounded by people, music playing in the background. Lily Evans, Dorcas Meadowes and Marlene McKinnion all crowd around one corner, laughing and shouting. James sits beside Lily, his father across from him, Gideon and Fabian Prewett at the other end arguing over the bread rolls. There‚Äôs an older couple too, a man and a woman, the woman baring a striking resemblance to Evans, almost certainly her mother.

Regulus stands at the back door, on the threshold, watching. Unable to make himself move. To shake the feeling that he doesn‚Äôt belong here. James looks so at ease, so happy, sitting with the people he loves‚ÄîRegulus doesn‚Äôt want to ruin it. The truth is, the pair of them were always better in the dark. Meant for secret rooms and cupboards and hideaways. They could never stand-up to the scrutiny of the light of day.

‚ÄúAre you waiting for an invitation?‚Äù

Regulus starts, turning to find a smirking Euphemia Potter leaning against the wall by the door. He opens his mouth but doesn‚Äôt quite know what to say, something painful rocking through him.

‚ÄúBecause you can have one,‚Äù she gestures towards the table when he doesn‚Äôt speak. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been waiting for you.‚Äù

Regulus‚Äôs eyes go automatically to James who has just snatched something off of Lily Evan‚Äôs plate, earning him a smack to the arm. Regulus stares, likely for too long, before looking back at Euphemia.

‚ÄúDo you know?‚Äù he whispers, throat tight.

She tilts her head, eyes going soft. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid there are many answers to that question.‚Äù

Regulus nods, because she‚Äôs right, and because it gives him a little more time before he has to speak again. ‚ÄúWhat I did,‚Äù which probably isn‚Äôt more helpful. He forces himself to look at her, somehow hold her gaze. ‚ÄúWhat I did to you?‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù she says knowingly. For a second neither of them speak and then: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre quite talented, you know. It takes great skill to brew a potion that can get past Fleamont Potter.‚Äù

Regulus hisses like he‚Äôs just been burned, taking a step back. ‚ÄúI shouldn‚Äôt be here.‚Äù

Euphemia looks at him, eyes far too much like her son‚Äôs for Regulus‚Äôs comfort. ‚ÄúDo you want to be here?‚Äù she asks finally.

Another gut punch. ‚ÄúYes,‚Äù it‚Äôs his dirty secret‚Äîwanting‚Äîhe‚Äôs supposed to know better than that.

‚ÄúWell then,‚Äù she offers her hand to Regulus who‚Äôs so startled by the gesture that he actually takes it. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon,‚Äù she gives him a light tug but Regulus doesn‚Äôt move.

‚ÄúHow can you‚Äî‚Äú that‚Äôs all he manages to work into his mouth. Euphemia giving his hand a squeeze. Maybe she‚Äôs a mindreader because she seems to know exactly what he means.¬†

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not in the habit of blaming children for the actions of adults.‚Äù

But Regulus doesn‚Äôt accept that, shaking his head. ‚ÄúI was eighteen.‚Äù

Euphemia smiles sadly at him. "I know, you‚Äôd barely started,‚Äù she looks over at the table. ‚ÄúNone of you got much of a chance at all.‚Äù For a moment the sadness on her face truly breaks his heart, but then she shakes it off, expression lighter when she turns back to him.

‚ÄúYou have a choice, to come in or to stay out. To face it or to runaway. You said you wanted to be here?‚Äù

‚ÄúI do,‚Äù Regulus says before he can stop himself.

Smiling slightly she leans forward, still holding his hand. ‚ÄúThen be brave Regulus Black. And come inside.‚Äù

Which is how Regulus finds himself being lead through the Potter‚Äôs dining room, finds himself sitting on James‚Äôs other side, at a table full of people he knows he‚Äôs wronged. He wants to run away. To hide. To pluck those memories out of him one by one. But he doesn‚Äôt, and when James smiles at him it‚Äôs almost worth it.

‚ÄúHi.‚Äù

‚ÄúHi.‚Äù

James‚Äôs leg knocks against his under the table.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so happy you‚Äôre finally here.‚Äù

Regulus swallows. ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù he manages. ‚ÄúYeah me too.‚Äù

¬†

¬†

Memories, and feelings, and thoughts, bumping into one another, struggling to find the light. To stay there. They crumble and rebuild, blurring the lines between one another. The past, the present, the hundreds of futures never touched, never given life, all thrumming through them. Alive. At once. And separately. And all of the time.

The sun and the stars and the storm.

Orbiting around one another.

Above. Below. Watching.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs sad,‚Äù a voice in the void, ‚Äúthat we will never grow old together.‚Äù

In and out of one another, leaving traces behind.

‚ÄúBut can‚Äôt you see it? Don‚Äôt you know?‚Äù

Warmth that bleeds into every corner of the universe.

‚ÄúThat oh from us, so much will grow.‚Äù¬† ¬†

Chapter End Notes

** Yes, for you. I want to see you fly. Nothing brings me more joy than to see you in the sky, my darling
** No more regrets, okay? Not here.

Thank you <3
